1. I 我 ## 848

[aɪ]pron.我

  • Excuse me! 劳驾!
  • I am a new student. 我是个新学生。
  • Yes, I am. 我是。

SEE> you 你, re·al·ly 真的, know 知道

ODE> The imaginary quantity equal to the square root of minus one. – ego, I, oneself, persona, person, identity, character, personality, psyche, soul, spirit, mind, intellect, inner man, inner person, inner woman, inner self, one’s innermost feelings, one’s heart of hearts.

2. a·ban·don 放弃 ## 4

[ə’bændən]v.放弃；抛弃；放纵n.放纵

  • The order to abandon ship was given and hundreds of people plunged into the icy water. 在发出弃船的命令，几百人跳进冰冷的水里。
  • And if you think you’ll abandon meat and become a vegetarian, you have the choice of very expensive organically-grown vegetables or a steady diet of pesticides every time you think you’re eating fresh salads and vegetables, or just having an innocent glass of water! 如果你想放弃肉类而变成一位素食者，那么你很昂贵的有机种植的蔬菜每一个你认为你吃新鲜的沙拉和蔬菜，或者只是有一个无辜的玻璃时间的选择或农药的稳定的饮食水！
  • This rabbit had no natural enemies in the Antipodes, so that it multiplied with that promiscuous abandon characteristic of rabbits. 这种兔子在拓地没有天敌，所以它乘以该混杂放弃兔子的特征。

SEE> a·ban·doned 弃, per·suade 说服, con·vinced

ODE> Cease to support or look after (someone); desert. – desert, leave, leave high and dry, turn one’s back on, cast aside, break with, break up with.

3. a·bil·i·ty 能力 ## 7

[ə’bɪləti]n.能力；才能

  • A cat’s ability to survive falls is based on fact. 猫的生存瀑布能力是基于事实。
  • A truly dedicated bargain hunter must have patience, and above all, the ability to recognize the worth of something when he sees it. 一个到处找便宜的人必须具有耐心，而且最重要的，当他看到它的能力，认识事物的价值。
  • This ability was first noticed by her father. 这种能力首先是由她的父亲发现。

SEE> a·ble 能够, en·a·ble 使能够, dem·on·strate 演示

ODE> Possession of the means or skill to do something. – capacity, capability, potential, potentiality, power, faculty, aptness, facility, propensity, wherewithal, means, preparedness.

4. a·ble 能够 ## 50

[’eɪbl]adj.能够的；有能力的；能干的

  • Because of this, he has not been able to get his own car into his garage even once. 正因为如此，他一直没能得到自己的车开进他的车库，甚至一次。
  • Nearly a week passed before the girl was able to explain what had happened to her. 近一周的女孩前通过能够讲述自己的遭遇。
  • How was the plane able to clear the mountains? 如何为飞机能够清除山上？

SEE> un·a·ble 不能, could 可以, e·nough 足够的

ODE> Having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something. – allowed to, free to, in a position to.

5. a·bout 关于 ## 111

[ə’baʊt]prep.关于；大约；在 … 周围adv.大约；附近；到处；在周围adj.即将的；正要的；在流行中的

  • What about the dog? 什么狗？
  • What about some steak? 来点牛排？
  • He can get up for about two hours each day, but you must keep the room warm. 他可以起床，每天约两个小时，但您必须保持房间温暖。

SEE> some 一些, a·round 周围, what 什么

ODE> On the subject of; concerning. – regarding, concerning, with reference to, referring to, with regard to, with respect to, respecting, relating to, on, touching on, dealing with, relevant to, with relevance to, connected with, in connection with, on the subject of, in the matter of, apropos, re.

6. a·bove 在上方 ## 10

[ə’bʌv]prep.超过；在 … 上面；高于adj.上面的；以上的adv.在上面；超过；更重要地；上文地n.上面的东西

  • Of course, the Hubble is above the earth’s atmosphere, so it will soon be sending us the clearest pictures of the stars and distant galaxies that we have ever seen. 当然，哈勃位于地球的大气层之外，因此，它很快就会给我们发送的行星和远距离星系的最清晰的照片，我们已经见过。
  • The tunnel would be well-ventilated if tall chimneys were built above sea level. 这条隧道的通风良好，如果高大的烟囱被海拔建。
  • Above the surface of the water, the towers rise to a height of nearly 700 feet. 水的表面上，塔上升到将近700英尺的高度。

SEE> be·low 在下面, lev·el 水平, same 相同

ODE> In extended space over and not touching. – over, higher than, higher up than, overlooking.

7. a·broad 在国外 ## 11

[ə’brɔːd]adv.到国外；广为流传adj.在国外；海外(一般作表语)

  • We may go abroad. 我们可能出国。
  • My brother has never been abroad before, so he is finding this trip very exciting. 我弟弟以前从未出过国，因此，他觉得这次旅行非常激动人心。
  • ‘Will you be spending your holidays abroad this year?’ “您在国外今年度假吗？”

SEE> o·ver·seas , else·where 别处, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> In or to a foreign country or countries. – overseas, out of the country, in foreign parts, to foreign parts, in a foreign country, in a foreign land, to a foreign country, to a foreign land, over the sea, beyond the seas.

8. ab·sence 缺席 ## 2

[’æbsəns]n.缺席；缺乏

  • Three factors have caused these fish to grow so large: the warm water round the hot oil pipes under the sea; the plentiful supply of food thrown overboard by the crews on the rigs; the total absence of fishing boats around the oil rigs. 3个因素造成这些鱼能长得这么大：温水轮海下热油管道;由钻井平台工作人员抛到海里食品的供应充足;完全没有钻井平台周围的渔船。
  • It was as clear as daylight then that burglars had forced an entry during her absence. 那么窃贼曾闯进她缺席期间的条目这是昭然若揭。

SEE> ab·sent 缺席, de·spite 尽管, fact 事实

ODE> The state of being away from a place or person. – non-attendance, non-appearance, absenteeism.

9. ab·sent 缺席 ## 3

[’æbsənt]adj.缺席的；不在的；缺乏的vt.使缺席

  • Was he absent from school last week? 在他缺席上周的学校吗？
  • He was absent on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. 他缺席周一，周二，周三和周四。
  • After being absent from The Gables for a week, my aunt unexpectedly returned one afternoon with a party of guests and instructed Bessie to prepare dinner. 正在从山墙缺席了一周后，我的她出其不意地回来一个下午的客人，吩咐贝西准备晚饭。

SEE> ab·sence 缺席, like·wise , cu·ri·ous·ly 好奇地

ODE> Not present in a place, at an occasion, or as part of something. – away, off, out, not present, non-attending, truant.

10. ab·sorb 吸收 ## 3

[əb’sɔːrb]vt.吸收；吸引 … 的注意；吞并；承受

  • In the new country he became absorbed in making a new life for the two of us, so that he gradually ceased to grieve. 在新的国家里，父亲专心致志做我们两个人的新生活，让他渐渐不再悲伤。
  • It is then left completely undisturbed with plenty of food and water so that it can absorb the atmosphere of its new home and see that nothing particularly alarming is happening to its companions. 然后将其用充足的食物和水的离开完全不受干扰，以便它可以吸收其新家的气氛，并且看到什么特别令人担忧的是发生在它的同伴。
  • Each day is a holiday, and ordinary holidays, when they come, are grudged as enforced interruptions in an absorbing vocation. 每天都是假日，而通常的假期，当他们来，都抱怨自己有趣的吸收假期强制打断。

SEE> a·ble 能够, more·o·ver 此外, ex·cess

ODE> Take in or soak up (energy or a liquid or other substance) by chemical or physical action. – soak up, suck up, draw in, draw up, take in, take up, blot up, mop up, sponge up, sop up.

11. a·buse 滥用 ## 2

[ə’bjuːs]n.滥用；恶习vt.滥用；辱骂；虐待

  • No creature has received more praise and abuse than the common garden snail. 没有一种生物所受到如此多的赞扬和批评花园里常见的蜗牛。
  • However, this freedom can easily be abused. 然而，这种自由很容易被滥用。

SEE> child 儿童, sex·u·al 有性, al·leged

ODE> Use (something) to bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse. – misuse, misapply, misemploy, mishandle.

12. ac·cept 接受 ## 11

[ək’sept]vt.接受；同意；承担(责任等)vi.接受

  • The villagers have told him that they will not accept the pub even if he gives it away. 村民们告诉他，即使他把它拿走，他们不会接受酒馆。
  • When my old friend Brian urged me to accept a cigarette, it was more than I could bear. 当我的老朋友布赖恩怂恿我接受一支香烟时，它比我能承受的。
  • On the other hand, your stomach would turn at the idea of frying potatoes in animal fat – the normally accepted practice in many northern countries. 在另一方面，你的胃会变成在动物脂肪油炸土豆的想法 - 在北方许多国家常接受的做法。

SEE> ac·cept·ed , re·ject 拒绝, a·gree 同意

ODE> Consent to receive or undertake (something offered) – receive, agree to receive, welcome, take, take receipt of, get, gain, obtain, acquire, come by.

13. ac·ci·dent 事故 ## 6

[’æksɪdənt]n.事故；意外；偶然；造化

  • Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents. 喜剧演员在横死和严重事故这类悲剧家们的笑话。
  • What incident began the series of traffic accidents? 什么事件开始了一系列的交通事故？
  • When my mother had died after a tragic accident, he did not quickly recover from the shock and loneliness. 当我的母亲在一次事故中惨死，他并没有很快从悲痛与孤独中恢复过来。

SEE> crash 撞车, in·ci·dent 事件, mis·hap

ODE> An unfortunate incident that happens unexpectedly and unintentionally, typically resulting in damage or injury. – mishap, misfortune, misadventure, mischance, unfortunate incident, injury, disaster, tragedy, catastrophe, contretemps, calamity, blow, trouble, problem, difficulty.

14. ac·ci·den·tal·ly 偶然 ## 2

[ˌæksɪ’dentəli]adv.偶然地；意外地；附带地

  • This morning, however, a firemen accidentally discovered the cause. 然而今天上午，一个消防队员偶然发现了原因。
  • Then in 1989, twenty-six years after the crash, the plane was accidentally rediscovered in an aerial survey of the island. 然后，在1989年，崩溃26年后，飞机却意外地在海岛的航测重新发现。

SEE> ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, pre·sum·a·bly 想必, in·ci·den·tal·ly

ODE> By chance; inadvertently. – fortuitously, by accident, by chance, by a mere chance, by a twist of fate, adventitiously, as luck would have it, by a fluke, flukily, coincidentally, by coincidence, serendipitously.

15. ac·com·pa·ny 陪伴 ## 5

[ə’kʌmpəni]vt.陪伴；伴随…发生；补充；给 … 伴奏vi.伴奏

  • Dressed up as Father Christmas and accompanied by a ‘guard of honour’ of six pretty girls, he set off down the main street of the city riding a baby elephant called Jumbo. 他打扮成圣诞老人，在由6个漂亮姑娘组成的“仪仗队”，他掀起，沿着城里骑着名叫Jumbo的小象的主要街道。
  • It is possible that there is a definite relation between these paintings and the markings that sometimes accompany them. 这可能是有这些画作和有时陪他们的标记之间的一定的联系。
  • Permission was granted and a policeman accompanied him to a pay phone. 获得了许可后，一名警察陪他来到一个公用电话。

SEE> like·wise , pre·sum·a·bly 想必, in·var·i·a·bly

ODE> Go somewhere with (someone) as a companion or escort. – go with, go along with, travel with, keep someone company, tag along with, partner, escort, chaperone, attend, follow, conduct, lead, take, show, see, guide, steer, usher, pilot, convoy, help, assist, show someone the way.

16. ac·count 帐户 ## 7

[ə’kaʊnt]n.账户；帐目；赊账；老主顾；报告；描述；解释；说明；估计；理由；利益；好处；根据v.解释；导致；报账；把 … 视为；归咎(于)

  • No one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy. 没有人可以解释这个事实，即一个箱子特别重。
  • The bridge is so long that the shape of the earth had to be taken into account by its designer. 这座桥很长，所以地球的形状有它的设计师必须考虑到。
  • When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money, repayment of which he may demand at any time, either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person. 任何人在银行开一个活期账户，他在借钱给银行，还款，而他可以在任何时间要求，以现金或通过绘制有利于他人的支票。

SEE> in·stance 例子, fact 事实, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A report or description of an event or experience. – description, report, version, story, narration, narrative, statement, news, explanation, exposition, interpretation, communiqué, recital, rendition, sketch, delineation, portrayal, tale.

17. ac·cu·rate 准确 ## 4

[’ækjərət]adj.准确的；精确的

  • It is not only of immense size, but is extremely accurate as well. 它不仅规模巨大，而且是非常准确。
  • Accurate, don’t you think? 准确的，你不觉得？
  • Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature, pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want. 假定每个传感器都给出了温度，压力，湿度，和气象学家需要的任何其他量完全准确的读数。

SEE> pre·cise 精确, re·li·a·ble , ac·cu·ra·cy

ODE> (especially of information, measurements, or predictions) correct in all details; exact. – correct, precise, exact, right, errorless, error-free, without error, faultless, perfect, valid, specific, detailed, minute, explicit, clear-cut, word for word, unambiguous, meticulous, authoritative, reliable, canonical.

18. ac·cuse 指责 ## 3

[ə’kjuːz]v.谴责；控告；指责

  • Dimitri immediately went to Aleko’s house and angrily accused him of stealing the lamb. 迪米特里立刻去了阿列科家，气呼呼地指责他偷了羔羊。
  • Ashamed of having acted so rashly, Dimitri apologized to Aleko for having accused him. 感到羞愧的鲁莽的，迪米特里道歉阿列科为被指责他。
  • They may even accuse them of disloyalty, or make some spiteful remark about the friends’ parents. 他们甚至责备孩子不忠，或者讲朋友家长的坏话。

SEE> al·lege , crit·i·cize 批评, in·sist 坚持

ODE> Charge (someone) with an offence or crime. – charge with, indict for, arraign for, take to court for, put on trial for, bring to trial for, prosecute for.

19. a·chieve 实现 ## 6

[ə’tʃiːv]v.完成；达到；实现

  • But in an old man who has known human joys and sorrows, and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do, the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble. 但是，在一个老人谁知道人的悲欢离合，并都经历过了，自己做的，死亡的恐惧是有些可怜且可耻。
  • What do oilmen want to achieve as soon as they strike oil? 什么石油商想只要他们打出油来实现？
  • ‘Rest’, in terms of muscle relaxation and so on, can be achieved by a brief period lying, or even sitting down. “休息”，使肌肉得到放松的条件等，可以通过稍微躺一躺，甚至坐一坐来实现的。

SEE> at·tain , aim 瞄准, ac·com·plish

ODE> Successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective or result) by effort, skill, or courage. – attain, reach, arrive at.

20. ac·quire 获得 ## 9

[ə’kwaɪər]vt.获得；学到；取得

  • After having been instructed to drive out of town, I began to acquire confidence. 被告知将带动镇出来后，我开始有了信心。
  • After telling several of his friends about the theft, Dimitri found out that his neighbour, Aleko, had suddenly acquired a new lamb. 告诉他的几个朋友把失窃后，迪米特里发现他的邻居阿列科家突然多了一只小羔羊。
  • The story of a poor family that acquired fame and fortune overnight, dramatically illustrates the power of the press. 一个贫穷的家庭是获得名利一夜的故事戏剧性地说明了新闻报道的威力。

SEE> pur·chase 购买, buy 买, sell 卖

ODE> Buy or obtain (an asset or object) for oneself. – obtain, come by, come to have, get, receive, gain, earn, win, come into, come in for, take possession of, take receipt of, be given.

21. a·cross 横过 ## 27

[ə’krɔːs]adv.横过；穿过；朝向特定的方向；在对面；横写地prep.横过；穿过；在对面；在(身体某部位)上；在…各处

  • It’s running across the grass. 它的运行穿过草地。
  • He is swimming across the river. 他游泳渡河。
  • It has sailed across the Atlantic many times. 它横跨大西洋很多次航行。

SEE> a·long 沿着, through·out 始终, a·round 周围

ODE> From one side to the other of (a place, area, etc.) – to the other side of, from one side of … to the other, over, throughout the expanse of, throughout the width of, covering, everywhere on, on all parts of.

22. act 行动 ## 19

[ækt]n.行为；行动；法案；(戏剧、歌剧等的)一幕；假装v.行动；举止；假装；表演；扮演；充当；有效果

  • Roy acted quickly and drove the bus straight at the thieves. 罗伊行动迅速，开车直冲窃贼。
  • He acted as if he had never lived in England before. 他的举动就好像他在英格兰从未住过。
  • Ashamed of having acted so rashly, Dimitri apologized to Aleko for having accused him. 感到羞愧的鲁莽的，迪米特里道歉阿列科为被指责他。

SEE> pro·vi·sion , in·deed 确实, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> Take action; do something. – take action, take steps, take measures, take the initiative, move, make a move, react, do something, proceed, go ahead.

23. ac·tion 行动 ## 10

[’ækʃn]n.行为；活动；措施；效用；交战；情节；事件；姿态；起诉；机能

  • His father told everybody that Eric had been killed in action. 他的父亲告诉大家，埃里克在战争中被杀害。
  • Franz poured scorn on the idea, pointing out that his brother had been killed in action during the war. 弗朗兹对此不屑一顾，指出他兄弟已经在战争中被杀害。
  • They will be able, as it were, to see and hear us in action. 他们将能够，因为它是，看到和听到我们在行动。

SEE> take 拿取, re·sult 结果, in·stead 代替

ODE> The fact or process of doing something, typically to achieve an aim. – steps, measures, activity, movement, work, working, effort, exertion, operation.

24. ac·tive 活跃的 ## 3

[’æktɪv]adj.活跃的；积极的；起作用的；灵活的

  • Haroun Tazieff, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and deep caves in all parts of the world. 哈龙塔捷耶夫，波兰科学家，已经花了毕生的研究在世界各地的活火山和探洞。
  • He has been able to tell us more about active volcanoes than any man alive. 他已经能告诉我们更多关于比任何人活着活火山。
  • The body’s tissues are self-repairing and self-restoring to a degree, and function best when more or less continuously active. 人体的组织是自我修复和自我恢复到一定程度，和功能最好的时候，或多或少地连续活动。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, in·volved 参与, en·gaged 订婚

ODE> Engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits. – mobile, energetic, agile, sporty, nimble, vigorous, vital, dynamic, sprightly, spry, lively, animated, bouncy, bubbly, perky, frisky, zestful, spirited.

25. ac·tiv·i·ty 活动 ## 6

[æk’tɪvəti]n.活动；活跃vt.表演adj.厉害

  • My particular experience is largely in oil, and the search for oil has done more to improve deep drilling than any other mining activity. 我是专门搞石油的，并且对石油的搜索已经做得更多，以提高深钻比其他任何采矿业。
  • First the electroencephalograph (which is simply a device for recording the electrical activity of the brain by attaching electrodes to the scalp) shows that while there is a change in the pattern of activity during sleep, there is no evidence that the total amount of activity is any less. 第一点，脑电图（这是简单地对电极接到头皮记录大脑电活动的装置）显示，虽然有在睡眠期间活动的图案的变化，没有证据表明活性的总量是任何减少。
  • A burst of activity associated with the laying of submarine cables soon confirmed the Challenger’s observation that many parts of the ocean were two to three miles deep, and the existence of underwater features of considerable magnitude. 海底电缆的铺设相关活动的热潮很快证实了挑战者的观察结果：海洋中很多地方两到三英里深，和幅度相当水下的存在特征。

SEE> fur·ther·more , sug·gest 建议, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The condition in which things are happening or being done. – bustle, hustle and bustle, busyness, action, liveliness, movement, life, stir, animation, commotion, flurry, tumult, hubbub, excitement, agitation, fuss, whirl.

26. ac·tor 演员 ## 8

[’æktər]n.演员；行动者

  • Conrad Reeves, the actor? 康拉德，演员？
  • I could not hear the actors. 我听不清演员。
  • An ancient bus stopped by a dry river bed and a party of famous actors and actresses got off. 一个古老的车停了一个干涸的河床和著名演员和女演员的聚会下车。

SEE> co·me·di·an , mov·ie 电影, per·form·er 演员

ODE> A person whose profession is acting on the stage, in films, or on television. – performer, player, trouper, theatrical, dramatic artist, thespian, member of the cast, artist, artiste.

27. ac·tress 女演员 ## 4

[’æktrəs]n.女演员

  • It must be Karen Marsh, the actress. 它必须是卡伦马什，女演员。
  • She was a famous actress when I was still at school. 她是一个著名的演员，当我还在学校。
  • My aunt Jennifer is an actress. 我的姑姑詹妮弗是个女演员。

ODE> A woman whose profession is acting on stage, in films, or on television. – actor, performer, player, trouper, theatrical, dramatic artist, thespian, member of the cast, artist, artiste.

28. ac·tu·al·ly 其实 ## 11

[’æktʃuəli]adv.实际上；事实上；竟然（表示惊讶）

  • At the moment, they cover every inch of floor space and I actually have to walk on them to get in or out of the room. 目前，它们覆盖的地面每一寸空间，我实际上是踩着这些书进出房间的获得。
  • Forty-two years later a tunnel was actually begun. 四十二年后，隧道实际已经开始。
  • you can hear the clock when it is actually striking because microphones are connected to the clock tower. 你可以听到时钟时，它实际上是惊人的，因为麦克风连接到钟楼。

SEE> in·deed 确实, fact 事实, though 虽然

ODE> As the truth or facts of a situation; really. – indeed, you could say, possibly, more precisely, veritably, in truth, actually, or rather, nay.

29. add 加 ## 9

[æd]v.加；增加；补充

  • She gazed at it for some time then added, ’You don’t need bookcases at all. 她盯着它一段时间，然后又说：“你并不需要在所有的书柜。
  • Then I added with a smile, ‘It’s a strange mixture I make myself.’ 然后，我带微笑补充说，“这是一个奇怪的混合物，我让我自己。”
  • This invariably wins them the love and respect of others, for they add colour to the dull routine of everyday life. 这往往使他们赢得了爱和他人的尊重，因为他们增添色彩日常生活的平淡单一。

SEE> com·bine 结合, bring 带来, ad·di·tion·al 额外

ODE> Join (something) to something else so as to increase the size, number, or amount. – attach, build on, add on, put on, put in, append, adjoin, join, affix, connect, annex.

30. ad·di·tion 加 ## 3

[ə’dɪʃn]n.增加；加法；附加物

  • In addition to all her other qualifications, Bessie was an expert cook. 除了她所有的其他资格，贝茜还是一个烹饪大师。
  • Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books, china, glass, antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals, there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books. 无论它的组成邮票，唱片，书籍，瓷器，玻璃，古董家具，绘画，模型汽车，鸟类标本，玩具动物初版，总有一些东西与它连接的事，找到可以在正确的地方最新加入，以核对参考书中的事实。
  • But, in addition to that basically simple concept, the bank and its customer owe a large number of obligations to one another. 但是，除了这一基本的简单概念外，银行和储户的大量义务彼此。

SEE> be·sides , ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子

ODE> The action or process of adding something to something else. – inclusion, adding, adding in, incorporation, introduction, insertion.

31. ad·dress 地址 ## 3

[ə’dres]n.住址；网址；电子邮箱地址；称呼；致词；讲话；演讲；谈吐v.称呼；发表演说；提出；写地址；处理

  • There’s a label on the handle with my name and address on it. 界面上有我的名字和地址手柄上的标签。
  • What’s your name and address? 你叫什么名字和地址？
  • Last year, we were travelling across the Channel and Jane put a piece of paper with her name and address on it into a bottle. 去年，当我们横渡英吉利海峡时，简把一张纸，她的名字和地址装进了一只瓶子。

SEE> speech 讲话, mes·sage 消息, an·swer 回答

ODE> The particulars of the place where someone lives or an organization is situated. – inscription, label, mark, superscription.

32. ad·e·quate 充足 ## 2

[’ædɪkwət]adj.足够的；适当的；能胜任的

  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。
  • Disillusionment with the parents, however good and adequate they may be both as parents and as individuals, is to some degree inevitable. 幻灭与父母，但是好和充足的，他们可能是双方父母和个人，在某种程度上是不可避免的。

SEE> suf·fi·cient 足够的, in·suf·fi·cient , in·ad·e·quate

ODE> Satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity. – sufficient, enough, ample, requisite, apposite, appropriate, suitable.

33. ad·mire 钦佩 ## 3

[əd’maɪər]vt.钦佩；赞美；羡慕；欣赏

  • Everybody admires him for his great sense of humour – everybody, that is, except his six-year-old daughter, Jenny. 人人都钦佩他那绝妙的幽默感 - 人人，就是说，除他6岁的女儿珍妮。
  • Mr. Taylor, the owner of a jewellery shop was admiring a new window display. 泰勒先生，珠宝店的老板正在欣赏新布置的橱窗。
  • The Scandinavian countries are much admired all over the world for their enlightened social policies. 斯堪的纳维亚国家都非常敬佩全世界为他们开明的社会政策。

34. ad·mit 承认 ## 8

[əd’mɪt]vt.承认；允许进入；给…进入的权利；容纳vi.承认；允许进入；允许

  • After he was arrested, the man admitted hiding in the box before the plane left London. 他被逮捕后，男子承认躲在盒子在飞机离开伦敦前。
  • When we use a phrase like ‘it serves him right’, we are, in part, admitting that a certain set of circumstances has enabled justice to act of its own accord. 当我们用一个短语，如“他罪有应得”，我们是，部分承认了某种特定的环境使得正义自动地起了自己的协议。
  • The sorry-looking, blackened figure that emerged, admitted at once that he had tried to break into the shop during the night but had got stuck in the chimney. 惋惜的前瞻性，熏黑的数字一出来，一旦他曾试图在夜间闯入店铺，但已经陷入了烟囱录取。

SEE> ac·knowl·edge 确认, fact 事实, in·sist 坚持

ODE> Confess to be true or to be the case. – acknowledge, confess, reveal, make known, disclose, divulge, make public, avow, declare, profess, own up to, make a clean breast of, bring into the open, bring to light, give away, blurt out, leak.

35. a·dopt 采用 ## 3

[ə’dɑːpt]v.采用；收养；接受

  • The system has worked so well, that it has been adopted in other countries too. 该系统已经运作得非常好，它已经被其他国家采纳。
  • For this reason there is no risk to the customer in the practice, adopted by banks, of printing the customer’s name on his cheques. 由于这个原因，是在实践中的客户没有任何风险，银行通过对他的检查打印客户的名字。
  • That sounds a silly suggestion, but that was precisely the idea adopted in some of the early instruments (seismometers) for recording earthquake waves. 这听起来愚蠢的想法，但正是在一些早期的仪器（地震）记录地震波所采用的想法。

SEE> a·dopt·ed , in·tro·duce 介绍, pro·pose 提议

ODE> Legally take (another’s child) and bring it up as one’s own. – embrace, take on, acquire, affect, espouse, assume, appropriate, arrogate.

36. ad·vance 预先 ## 6

[əd’væns]n.前进；进展；预付金v.前进；预付；增长；推进adj.预先的；提前的

  • Both the police and the workmen were grateful to the student for this piece of advance information. 无论是警察与工人都感谢那个学生事先通报。
  • So, faced with the Danish advance, Alfred did not risk open battle but harried the enemy. 因此，面对丹麦人的进攻，阿尔弗雷德没有冒险作战，而是不断地袭扰敌人。
  • With the invention of writing, a great advance was made, for knowledge could then be not only communicated but also stored. 随着书写的发明，一大进步作出，知识然后可以不仅能交流，而且能储存了。

SEE> push 推, like·wise , move 移动

ODE> Move forwards in a purposeful way. – move forward, proceed, move along, press on, push on, push forward, make progress, make headway, forge on, forge ahead, gain ground, approach, come closer, move closer, move nearer, draw nearer, near.

37. ad·vanced 高级的 ## 3

[əd’vænst]adj.先进的；高级的

  • First of all, they may have come to this planet of ours thousands or millions of years ago, and found our then prevailing primitive state completely uninteresting to their own advanced knowledge. 首先，他们可能前来到这个星球上的我们的数千或数百万年，并且发现我们当时的原始状态无趣自己的先进的知识。
  • Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer, argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system, may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization. 罗纳德·布雷斯韦尔教授，领先美国射电天文学家，自然认为，如此优越的文明，对我们自己的太阳能系统进行访问，可能已经离开了自动信使以等待一个先进文明的觉醒。
  • Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society, one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying sufficient details to enable the thing to be constructed. 想象一下，在一个相当先进的技术社会，人们仍然不具备弹，使其认识的可能性，提供足够的细节，以使事情要构造的效果。

SEE> ad·vance 预先, de·vel·oped , tech·nol·o·gy 技术

ODE> Modern and recently developed. – state-of-the-art, new, modern, up to date, up to the minute, the newest, the latest, recently developed, newly discovered, newfangled, ultra-modern, futuristic.

  • I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service. 我反映，必须有自己之外了许多人谁希望借此优良的服务优势。
  • Collecting as a serious hobby is quite different and has many advantages. 收集作为一个严肃的业余爱好是一回事，它具有许多优点。
  • Some of the bigger firms are engaged in researches which are of such general and fundamental nature that it is a positive advantage to them not to keep them secret. 某些大公司所从事的研究属于一般和基础性的，这是一个积极的优势，他们不会让他们的秘密。

39. ad·ver·tise·ment 广告 ## 3

[ˌædvər’taɪzmənt]n.广告

  • No one can avoid being influenced by advertisements. 没有人能避免受广告的影响。
  • An advertisement which begins with the magic word FREE can rarely go wrong. 与魔语FREE很少会失败开头的广告。
  • There is something comforting about the warm glow shed by advertisements on cold wet winter nights. 有某种安慰寒冷潮湿的冬夜里，广告的暖光棚。

40. ad·vice 忠告 ## 4

  • Well, next time you’d better take my advice! 好了，下次你最好还是听从我的劝告！
  • One wants to meet like-minded collectors, to get advice, to compare notes, to exchange articles, to show off the latest find. 收藏者要会见志同道合的收藏家，以获取教益，比较笔记，交换收藏品，炫耀自己的最新发现。

ODE> Guidance or recommendations offered with regard to prudent future action. – guidance, advising, counselling, counsel, help, direction, instruction, information, enlightenment.

41. ad·vise 劝告 ## 3

  • I gave him fifty pence yesterday and advised him to save it. 昨天，我给了他50便士，并建议他保存。
  • The inspector then asked the old lady to try to check what was missing by the next day and advised her not to stay alone in the flat for a few nights. 巡官请老妇人试图检查什么是由次日失踪，劝她不要独自留在平了几晚。

  • Of course a writer doing this is misunderstood: he might as well try to explain a crime or a love affair. 作家如此行事当然这是误解：他还不如给人讲一个犯罪案件或一个恋爱故事。

43. af·fect 影响 ## 4

[ə’fekt]vt.影响；感动；作用

  • However, there is an even more insidious kind of pollution that particularly affects urban areas and invades our daily lives, and that is noise. 然而，还有一个更加隐蔽有害的污染，它专门影响城镇地区，侵袭我们的日常生活，那就是噪音。
  • We are lucky in that only the lower fields, which make up a very small proportion of our farm, are affected by flooding, but other farms are less favourably sited, and flooding can sometimes spell disaster for their owners. 我们是只有较低的领域，从而弥补了我们农场比例很小幸运，是由洪水的影响，但其他农场地势欠佳，和洪水有时会给农场主带来灾难。
  • Many people in industry and the Services, who have practical experience of noise, regard any investigation of this question as a waste of time; they are not prepared even to admit the possibility that noise affects people. 许多人在工业和服务，谁都有噪音的实践经验，认为对这个问题是浪费时间的任何调查;他们不准备甚至承认噪音可能对人有影响。

  • We can’t afford all that money. 我们负担不起那么多钱。
  • You always want the best, but we can’t afford it. 你总是要买最好的，但我们不能负担得起。
  • He told me that the firm could not afford to pay such large salaries. 他告诉我，公司无法支付如此巨额的工资。

50. a·gainst 反对 ## 27

[ə’ɡenst]prep.反对；逆；违背；倚靠；映衬；防御；相比；相对

  • I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep, so I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window. 我试着按响了门铃，试图唤醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟，所以我在花园里接到了棚里拿来一架梯子，把它靠在墙边，开始攀爬向卧室的窗口。
  • The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool. 孩子们相互竞争，谁先到达游泳池的另一端。
  • Lined up against the wall, there were long thin wires attached to metal spheres. 一字排开靠墙，有附着于金属球长细线。

51. age 年龄 ## 22

[eɪdʒ]n.年龄；时代；时期；长时间v.（使）变老；（使）陈化

  • My daughter, Jane, never dreamed of receiving a letter from a girl of her own age in Holland. 我的女儿简从未想过自己的年龄在荷兰的一个女孩收到信的。
  • The Hubble will tell us a great deal about the age and size of the universe. 哈勃将告诉我们有关宇宙的年龄和大小的许多事情。
  • Experiments have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age. 实验证明，孩子们可以在游泳在很小的时候就被指示。

52. a·go 前 ## 42

[ə’ɡoʊ]adv.以前

  • No, she bought them in the U.S. We had some shoes like those a month ago, but we don’t have any now. 不，她买了他们在美国我们有这样的鞋在一个月前，但我们没有任何现在。
  • I brought it here three days ago. 我把它3天前。

53. a·gree 同意 ## 6

[ə’ɡriː]v.同意；赞成；承认；符合；一致

  • Though Jimmy agreed to go at once, Jumbo refused to move. 虽然吉米同意马上就走，但江伯却拒绝移动。
  • ‘It couldn’t be better, Gloria,’ Brinksley Meers agreed. “这是再好不过，凯莱，”米尔斯布林克斯利同意。
  • The old lady thought he was a fussy creature, but since the porter agreed with him, she rang up her daughter and asked for her help in what she described as a little spot of bother. 老太太以为他是个挑剔的动物，但既然同意他的门房，她又响了起来她的女儿和她描述为麻烦的一个小点问她的帮助。

SEE> in·sist 坚持, ac·cept 接受, will·ing 愿意

54. a·gree·ment 协议 ## 3

[ə’ɡriːmənt]n.同意；一致；协议

  • The busmen have stated that the strike will continue until general agreement is reached about pay and working conditions. 司机们声称罢工将持续到就工资和工作条件达成全面协议。
  • One difficulty is to construct the agreements. 困难之一是这些协议。
  • The EU – following fine continental traditions – wants agreement on general principles, which could be applied to many types of products and perhaps extended to other countries. 欧盟 - 以下优良的大陆传统 - 希望就普遍的原则，这些原则可以适用于许多不同产品，同时可能延伸到其它国家。

SEE> ac·cord , deal 交易, pact

ODE> Harmony or accordance in opinion or feeling. – accord, concurrence, consensus, harmony, accordance, unity, unison, concord, like-mindedness, rapport, sympathy.

55. a·head 在前面 ## 3

[ə’hed]adv.领先；预先；在前；向前；提前

  • Early next morning, she saw a light ahead. 第二天凌晨，她看到前方有灯光。
  • After crossing the Equator, the captain called in at a port to have a new rudder fitted, but by now the Thermopylae was over five hundred miles ahead. 跨越赤道，在口叫有装新舵队长后，但现在的温泉是早已在500多英里。
  • Just ahead of us there was a huge fissure. 离我们不远处有一个巨大的地裂。

SEE> next 下一个, put 放, be·hind 在后面

ODE> Further forward in space; in the line of one’s forward motion. – forwards, towards the front, frontwards.

56. aim 瞄准 ## 7

[eɪm]n.目标；对准；枪法vt.瞄准；针对vi.瞄准；旨在；致力

  • I went down immediately, of course, and that fool, Horst, aimed a fire extinguisher at me. 我马上下去，当然，和那个傻瓜霍斯特，我把灭火器对准了。
  • They had a single aim, a solitary goal – the top! 他们只有一个目的，唯一的目标 - 顶峰！
  • Their aim is understandable. 他们的目标是可以理解的。

SEE> ob·jec·tive 目标, en·a·ble 使能够, pur·pose 目的

ODE> Point or direct (a weapon or camera) at a target. – point, direct, train, sight, focus, level, line up, position.

57. air 空气 ## 25

[er]n.空气；天空；空中；感觉；神态；曲调；装腔作势v.晾干；使通风；广播

  • Open the window and air the room. 打开窗户，给房间通通风。
  • Will you travel by sea or by air? 您将通过海运或空运旅行？
  • This would solve the problem of ventilation, for if a train entered this tunnel, it would draw in fresh air behind it. 这样就解决了通风问题，因为如果有列火车开进这条隧道，它会在它背后新鲜空气借鉴。

SEE> force 力, air·craft 飞机, je·t

ODE> The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen. – sky, heavens, ether.

58. air·craft 飞机 ## 5

[’erkræft]n.飞机

  • The aircraft was able to fly over the endless white plains without difficulty. 飞机可以飞越茫茫无际的白色平原毫无困难。
  • The officer in the control tower was very angry when he heard the news, because balloons can be a great danger to aircraft. 在控制塔上的官员非常生气，当他听到这个消息，因为气球有可能有很大的危险飞机。
  • Some time ago the United States Navy, for instance, examined a very large number of men working on aircraft carriers: the study was known as Project Anehin. 前段时间美国海军，比如，检查了非常多的人在航空母舰上工作：研究被称为安内欣计划。

SEE> air·plane , plane 飞机, je·t

ODE> An aeroplane, helicopter, or other machine capable of flight. –

59. air·port 飞机场 ## 6

[’erpɔːrt]n.机场；航空站

  • Karen Marsh arrived at London Airport today. 卡伦马什今天到达伦敦机场。
  • The plane was late and detectives were waiting at the airport all morning. 飞机晚点了，侦探们在机场等了一个上午。
  • I live near an airport and passing planes can be heard night and day. 我住在一个机场附近，过往飞机日夜不绝于耳。

SEE> ar·ri·val 到达, flight 飞行, ter·mi·nal

ODE> A complex of runways and buildings for the take-off, landing, and maintenance of civil aircraft, with facilities for passengers. – airfield, airstrip, landing strip, runway.

60. a·larm 报警 ## 4

[ə’lɑːrm]n.警报；警报器；惊恐vt.警告；使惊恐；向 … 报警

  • After the alarm had been given, the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision. 警报响过不久，巨轮急转弯，以避免直接碰撞。
  • Burglar alarms going off at any time of the day or night serve only to annoy passers-by and actually assist burglars to burgle. 防盗警报器在白天和黑夜的任何时候都会响起只是骚扰路人而实际上却帮助窃贼入室行窃。
  • Car alarms constantly scream at us in the street and are a source of profound irritation. 汽车警报不断对我们在街上吼叫，这是人们极度烦燥的一个来源。

SEE> warn 警告, warn·ing 警告, con·cern 与有关

ODE> An anxious awareness of danger. – fear, anxiety, apprehension, trepidation, nervousness, unease, distress, agitation, consternation, disquiet, perturbation, fright, panic, dread, horror, shock, terror.

61. al·co·hol 酒精 ## 3

[’ælkəhɔːl]n.酒精；酒；乙醇

  • Alcohol may be a medical disinfectant, but should not be relied upon to sterilize water. 酒精可能是医学上的消毒剂，但决不可用来消毒饮用水。
  • Spirits labelled 95 proof contain only about 47 per cent alcohol. 精神标为95的含有47％的酒精。
  • Beware of methylated alcohol, which is very poisonous, and should never be added to drinking water. 提防甲基化酒精，那是剧毒的，不应该被添加到饮用水中。

SEE> drink 喝, al·co·hol·ic 酒精的, ad·dic·tion

ODE> A colourless volatile flammable liquid which is produced by the natural fermentation of sugars and is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, spirits, and other drinks, and is also used as an industrial solvent and as fuel. – liquor, intoxicating liquor, alcoholic drink, strong drink, drink, spirits, intoxicants.

62. a·live 活着的 ## 10

[ə’laɪv]adj.活着的；有活力的；注意到的；热闹的

  • He has been able to tell us more about active volcanoes than any man alive. 他已经能告诉我们更多关于比任何人活着活火山。
  • Such creatures have rarely been seen alive by man as they live at a depth of six hundred feet. 这样的动物，因为它们生活在600英尺深的水下很少能看到活着的人。
  • He may hunt, beg, or steal occasionally to keep himself alive; he may even, in times of real need, do a little work; but he will never sacrifice his freedom. 他可能会去打猎，乞讨，偶尔偷来保持自己活着;他甚至可能在确实需要的时候，做了一点工作;但他决不会牺牲自由。

SEE> dead 死的, still 仍然, in·deed 确实

ODE> (of a person, animal, or plant) living, not dead. – living, live, having life, not dead.

63. all 所有 ## 204

[ɔːl]adj.所有的；全部的adv.完全；都；非常pron.一切；全部n.全部

  • Are you all right now? 你现在还好吗？
  • Are you all right now? 你现在还好吗？
  • Is that all? 这就是全部？

SEE> those 那些, well 好, on·ly 只有

ODE> Used to refer to the whole quantity or extent of a particular group or thing. – each of, each one of the, every one of the, every single one of the.

64. al·low 允许 ## 7

[ə’laʊ]vt.允许；让某人得到；留出；同意（法律）vi.(for)考虑到；允许

  • Now we are not allowed to touch it. 现在，我们是不允许去碰它。
  • He then asked when Mr. Gilbert would be allowed to go home and the doctor told him that he would have to stay in hospital for another two weeks. 然后他又问吉尔伯特先生将被允许回家，医生告诉他，他必须留在医院再过两个星期。
  • He should have known that the police would never allow this sort of thing. 他应该知道，警察绝不会允许这样的事情。

SEE> en·a·ble 使能够, per·mit 允许, would 将

ODE> Let (someone) have or do something. – permit, let, authorize, give someone permission to, give authorization to, give leave to, sanction, grant, grant someone the right, license, empower, enable, entitle, qualify.

65. al·most 几乎 ## 26

[’ɔːlmoʊst]adv.几乎；差不多adj.相近的

  • Almost immediately he began to complain about the weather, for even though it was still summer, it rained continually and it was often bitterly cold. 但紧接着他就开始抱怨那里的天气了。因为即使那时仍为夏季，它不断地下雨，而且常常冷得厉害。
  • I regretted saying it almost at once. 我后悔几乎立刻说了。
  • Dreams of finding lost treasure almost came true recently. 寻找失落的宝藏的梦想差一点儿最近真。

SEE> near·ly 几乎, though 虽然, but 但是

ODE> Not quite; very nearly. – nearly, just about, about, more or less, practically, virtually, all but, as good as, next to, close to, near, nigh on, not far from, not far off, to all intents and purposes, approaching, bordering on, verging on, nearing.

66. a·lone 单独地 ## 9

[ə’loʊn]adj.单独的；独自一人的；孤单的adv.独自地；仅仅

  • When he was alone, he telephoned the hospital exchange and asked for Doctor Millington. 当他独自一人，他打电话给医院的交换台，要求与米灵顿医生。
  • These alone took sixteen months to build. 仅这花了16个月才建成。
  • The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell. 该大幕拉开上的最后一幕戏，并透露了贵族独自坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房。

SEE> ac·tu·al·ly 其实, else 其他, same 相同

ODE> Having no one else present. – by oneself, on one’s own, all alone, solo, lone, solitary, single, singly.

67. a·long 沿着 ## 15

[ə’lɔːŋ]prep.沿着；顺着adv.向前；一起

  • My wife and I are walking along the banks of the river. 我和妻子沿河岸上散步。
  • When he was driving along Catford Street recently, he saw two thieves rush out of a shop and run towards a waiting car. 当他凯特福德街上行驶最近，他看到有两个小偷急于一家商店出来，向一辆等候着的小汽车跑去。
  • A policeman approached Jimmy and told him he ought to have gone along a side street as Jumbo was holding up the traffic. 一个警察走过来告诉吉米，他应该走一条小街走了，因为江泊阻碍了交通。

SEE> and 和, well 好, a·long·side 在旁边

ODE> Moving in a constant direction on (a more or less horizontal surface) – down, throughout the length of, from one end of … to the other, through, across.

68. a·long·side 在旁边 ## 2

[əˌlɔːŋ’saɪd]adv.在旁边prep.在 … 旁边

  • Seeing a cake flying through the air, a lorry driver who was drawing up alongside the car, pulled up all of a sudden. 看见一块蛋糕在空中飞行，一名卡车司机谁正在起草旁边的车，突然拉升所有的。
  • If you recognize yourself in this description, you might include a couple of heady growth stocks in your portfolio, alongside your more pedestrian investments. 如果你认识到自己在该说明中，可能包括在你的投资组合了几个令人兴奋的成长股，你旁边的行人多的投资。

SEE> a·long 沿着, no·ta·bly , both 两者

ODE> Close to the side of; next to. – beside, by the side of, on the edge of, alongside, next to, adjacent to, close by, in a line by, one after the other by.

69. al·read·y 已经 ## 21

[ɔːl’redi]adv.已经

  • I’ve already had lunch. 我已经吃过饭了。
  • I’ve already had my holiday this year. 我已经有我今年休假。
  • Oh, I’ve already seen it. 噢，我已看过了。

SEE> have 有, so 所以, though 虽然

ODE> Before or by now or the time in question. – by that time, by this time, by now, by then, thus far, so far, hitherto, before, before now, before then, previously, earlier, earlier on, until now, until then, up to now, up to then.

70. al·so 也 ## 27

[’ɔːlsoʊ]adv.也；而且；同样地

  • They will also be building new roads and a special railway line. 他们还将兴建新的公路和一条铁路专用线。
  • He also said that he had found five empty whisky bottles which the ghost must have drunk the night before. 他还表示，他发现了鬼魂肯定昨天晚上喝的5个空的威士忌酒瓶。
  • They were also quite sure that a cigarette end did not start the fire. 他们还相当肯定，一个烟头没有启动火。

SEE> both 两者, al·though 虽然, well 好

ODE> In addition; too. – too, as well, besides, in addition, additionally, furthermore, further, moreover, into the bargain, on top, on top of that, over and above that, what’s more, to boot, else, then, equally.

71. al·ter·na·tive 替代 ## 3

[ɔːl’tɜːrnətɪv]adj.两者择一的；供选择的；非主流的n.二者择一；供替代的选择

  • Bagrit foresaw a time when computers would be small enough to hold in the hand, when they would be capable of providing information about traffic jams and suggesting alternative routes, when they would be used in hospitals to help doctors to diagnose illnesses, when they would relieve office workers and accountants of dull, repetitive clerical work. 巴格瑞特预示有一天计算机可以小到拿在手上，当他们将能够提供有关交通阻塞的信息，并建议替代路线，当他们将在医院使用，以帮助医生诊断疾病，当他们将减轻上班族的平淡会计师，重复的文职工作。
  • The growth of alternative mental interests is a long process. 精神上多种情趣的培养是一个长期的过程。
  • Yet to both classes, the need of an alternative outlook, of a change of atmosphere, of a diversion of effort, is essential. 然而，这两个班，需要气氛的变化的另一种面貌，尝试做点不同的，是必不可少的。

SEE> pref·er·a·ble , in·stead 代替, means 手段

ODE> (of one or more things) available as another possibility or choice. – different, other, another, second, possible, substitute, replacement.

72. al·though 虽然 ## 12

[ɔːl’ðoʊ]conj.虽然；尽管；然而；可是

  • Although the bed was smashed to pieces, the man was miraculously unhurt. 尽管床摔成了碎片，但年轻人却奇迹般地没有受伤。
  • Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run. 尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，他在控制汽车，因为轮胎在第一次运行时突发很大的困难。
  • Although being early may mean wasting a little time, this will be less than if you miss the train and have to wait an hour or more for the next one; and you avoid the frustration of arriving at the very moment when the train is drawing out of the station and being unable to get on it. 虽然早到可能意味着浪费一点时间，这将是小于，如果你错过了火车，要等一个小时以上的下一个;你避免在非常时刻，当火车在站引出，并暂时无法得到它到达的无奈。

SEE> though 虽然, how·ev·er 然而, but 但是

ODE> In spite of the fact that; even though. – in spite of the fact that, despite the fact that, notwithstanding the fact that, notwithstanding that, even though, even if, for all that, while, whilst.

73. al·ways 总是 ## 83

[’ɔːlweɪz]adv.总是；一直；始终；永远；随时；无论如何

  • It’s always warm in April and May, but it rains sometimes. 它总是温暖的四月和五月，但有时下雨。
  • It’s always hot in June, July and August. 它总是热的六月，七月和八月。
  • It’s always warm in September and October. 它总是温暖在九月和十月。

SEE> so 所以, sure 当然, eve·ry·one 大家

ODE> At all times; on all occasions. – every time, each time, at all times, all the time, on every occasion, on all occasions, consistently, invariably, without fail, without exception, regularly, repeatedly, habitually, unfailingly, infallibly, inevitably.

74. a·maze 惊奇 ## 2

[ə’meɪz]vt.使吃惊；使惊异vi.惊讶n.吃惊；好奇

  • When the archaeologists reconstructed the fragments, they were amazed to find that the goddess turned out to be a very modern-looking woman. 考古工作者把这些碎片重新，他们惊奇地发现那位女神原来是一个非常现代的女人。
  • I am always amazed when I hear people saying that sport creates goodwill between the nations, and that if only the common peoples of the world could meet one another at football or cricket, they would have no inclination to meet on the battlefield. 当我听人们说体育运动可创造国家之间的友谊，我总是惊讶，如果只有世界的普通人能够满足在足球场或板球场上，他们就没有兴趣在战场上。

ODE> Surprise (someone) greatly; fill with astonishment. – astonish, astound, surprise, bewilder, stun, stagger, flabbergast, nonplus, shock, startle, shake, stop someone in their tracks, stupefy, leave open-mouthed, leave aghast, take someone’s breath away, dumbfound, daze, benumb, perplex, confound, dismay, disconcert, shatter, take aback, jolt, shake up.

75. am·bi·tion 雄心 ## 2

[æm’bɪʃn]n.雄心；抱负；野心；精力vt.追求；有 … 野心

  • I limited myself to two modest ambitions: to do physical exercises every morning and to read more of an evening. 只给自己定下两项适中的任务：每天早上锻炼身体，多读一个晚上。
  • They have an air of freedom, and they have not a dreary commitment to mean ambitions or love of comfort. 他们有自由的气息，他们不会的野心和舒适爱一个沉闷的承诺。

SEE> de·sire 渴望, ob·ses·sion , pas·sion

ODE> A strong desire to do or achieve something. – aspiration, intention, goal, aim, objective, object, purpose, intent, plan, scheme, mission, calling, vocation, desire, wish, design, target, end, dream, hope.

76. a·mong 其中 ## 13

[ə’mʌŋ]prep.在 … 之中；…之一

  • Among the rubbish, I found a sign which said, ‘Anyone who leaves litter in these woods will be prosecuted!’ 在垃圾堆中我发现了一块牌子，上面写着：“凡谁在此树林里垃圾会被起诉！”
  • Among them will be Debbie’s mother, who swam the Channel herself when she was a girl. 他们当中还会有黛比的母亲，谁横渡过英吉利海峡她自己，当她是个女孩。
  • Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air. 同时，他们鼓励我们中的那些他们正在大口喘气前谁也游不了5码。

SEE> man·y 许多, oth·er 其他, both 两者

ODE> Situated more or less centrally in relation to (several other things) – surrounded by, in the company of, amid, in the middle of, between, in the thick of.

77. a·mount 数量 ## 6

[ə’maʊnt]n.数量；总额vi.总计；等于

  • Considering the amount she paid, he was dear in more ways than one! 考虑到她所支付的金额，他在不止一个方面亲爱的！
  • Films, videos, CDs and CD-ROMs are just some of the bewildering amount of information they will have. 电影，录像，光盘和CD-ROM都只是一些他们将有信息的扑朔迷离量。
  • In fact a basic amount of movement occurs during sleep which is specifically concerned with preventing muscle inactivity. 实际上移动的基本的量，其具体涉及防止肌肉活动停止睡眠期间发生。

SEE> sub·stan·tial 大量的, quan·ti·ty 数量, much 许多

ODE> A quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent. – quantity, number, total, aggregate, sum, quota, group, size, mass, weight, volume, bulk, load, consignment.

78. a·muse 逗乐 ## 3

[ə’mjuːz]v.娱乐；消遣；使 … 发笑

  • Sally was amused, but I was very embarrassed! 萨莉感到很有趣，但我很尴尬！
  • He was amused too, because he never expected the bicycle to be found. 但又感到非常好笑，因为他从未指望那辆自行车还能找到。
  • The police had a difficult time, but they were most amused. 警察有困难的时候，但他们还是感到很有趣。

SEE> en·ter·tain 招待, a·mused 逗乐的, an·noy 烦扰

ODE> Cause (someone) to find something funny. – entertain, make laugh, delight, divert, gladden, cheer, cheer up, please, charm, tickle, convulse, beguile, enliven, regale.

79. a·mus·ing 有趣的 ## 5

[ə’mjuːzɪŋ]adj.有趣的；引人发笑的

  • I had an amusing experience last year. 去年我有过一次有趣的经历。
  • In the same way, a Russian might fail to see anything amusing in a joke which would make an Englishman laugh to tears. 以同样的方式，一个俄国人可能看不到任何东西的笑话这将使英国人笑出泪来会哄。
  • Students often create amusing situations which are funny to everyone except the victims. 学生往往是制造一种搞笑的，除了受害者大家有趣的情况。

SEE> hi·lar·i·ous , hu·mor·ous 幽默, en·ter·tain·ing 娱乐

ODE> Causing laughter and providing entertainment. – entertaining, funny, comical, humorous, light-hearted, jocular, witty, mirthful, hilarious, chucklesome, ludicrous, laughable, rollicking, facetious, droll, whimsical, novel, interesting, diverting, engaging, beguiling.

80. an·cient 古代的 ## 6

[’eɪnʃənt]adj.古老的；古代的n.古人

  • Jasper White is one of those rare people who believes in ancient myths. 怀特是少有的在谁相信古代神话之一。
  • An ancient bus stopped by a dry river bed and a party of famous actors and actresses got off. 一个古老的车停了一个干涸的河床和著名演员和女演员的聚会下车。
  • An American team explored a temple which stands in an ancient city on the promontory of Ayia Irini. 一个美国考古队矗立在古城的阿依Irini酒店的海角寺庙。

SEE> me·di·e·val , civ·i·li·za·tion , tra·di·tion 传统

ODE> Belonging to the very distant past and no longer in existence. – of long ago, earliest, first, early, past, former, bygone.

81. and 和 ## 1330

[ənd]conj.和；加；接着；那么

  • My coat and my umbrella please. 我的大衣和伞拿给我。
  • Here’s your umbrella and your coat. 这是你的伞和大衣。
  • And this is Naoko. 这位是直子。

SEE> both 两者, well 好, al·so 也

ODE> Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences, that are to be taken jointly. – together with, along with, with, as well as, in addition to, including, also, too.

82. an·gri·ly 愤怒地 ## 7

[’æŋɡrəli]adv.气愤地

  • I looked at the man and the woman angrily. 我看着这个男人和女人生气地说。
  • I said angrily. 我气愤地说。
  • The woman walked out of the shop angrily and decided to punish the assistant next day. 该女子走出了商店的一气之下，决定教训一下那个售货员第二天。

SEE> re·peat·ed·ly 重复地, fu·ri·ous·ly , sug·ges·tion 建议

ODE> In a manner resulting from or betraying anger. –

83. an·gry 生气 ## 5

[’æŋɡri]adj.生气的；愤怒的；（伤口等）肿痛的，发炎的；（天空或海洋）天昏地暗的，狂风暴雨的

  • I got very angry. 我非常生气。
  • Mrs. Sterling got so angry that she ran after them. 斯特林夫人非常气愤，他们追了过去。
  • He looked very angry. 他看上去非常气愤。

SEE> fu·ri·ous , frus·trat·ed , annoyed 恼怒的

ODE> Feeling or showing strong annoyance, displeasure, or hostility; full of anger. – irate, annoyed, cross, vexed, irritated, exasperated, indignant, aggrieved, irked, piqued, displeased, provoked, galled, resentful.

84. an·i·mal 动物 ## 27

[’ænɪml]n.动物；牲畜adj.动物的；野兽的

  • Pumas are large, cat-like animals which are found in America. 美洲狮是大的，像猫，产于美洲发现的动物。
  • Wherever it went, it left behind it a trail of dead deer and small animals like rabbits. 无论它去，它留下一串死鹿和小动物如兔子的踪迹。
  • The experts were now fully convinced that the animal was a puma, but where had it come from? 现在专家们充分肯定那只动物就是美洲狮，但如果有它从何而来？

SEE> hu·man 人的, in·stance 例子, dog 狗

ODE> A living organism that feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and nervous system and able to respond rapidly to stimuli. – animal, beast, brute.

85. an·nounce 宣布 ## 2

[ə’naʊns]vt.宣布；宣告；预示；播报vi.作播音员；宣布竞选

  • A yellow light on the dashboard flashed angrily and Bruce cheerfully announced that there was no oil in the engine! 仪表盘上一盏黄灯闪着刺眼的光芒，布鲁斯兴致勃勃地宣布有发动机是没油了！
  • We also make the fundamental error of announcing our resolutions to everybody so that we look even more foolish when we slip back into our bad old ways. 我们也做宣布我们决心向大家一个根本性的错误，使我们，当我们重新陷入我们的那些老习惯看起来更加愚蠢。

SEE> an·nounce·ment , expected 预期, pro·pose 提议

ODE> Make a formal public statement about a fact, occurrence, or intention. – make public, make known, report, issue a statement about, declare, state, set forth, give out, put out, post, notify, give notice of, publicize, broadcast, publish, advertise, circulate, proclaim, promulgate, trumpet, noise abroad.

86. annoyed 恼怒的 ## 3

[ə’nɔɪd]adj.恼怒的；气恼的动词annoy的过去式和过去分词.

  • Yesterday my husband removed the gate and Rex got so annoyed we have not seen him since. 昨天，我丈夫把门卸和Rex有这么生气，此后我们再也没有见过他。
  • When Harry put on his act of being mildly annoyed, the assistant promised to order some for him. 当哈利把他的被婉转出不高兴的样子时，女售货员答应订购一些他。
  • Parents are often upset when their children praise the homes of their friends and regard it as a slur on their own cooking, or cleaning, or furniture, and often are foolish enough to let the adolescents see that they are annoyed. 父母常常心烦意乱时，他们的孩子赞扬自己朋友的家，并把它作为自己做饭一个污点，卫生，或家具，而且是愚蠢的，足以让孩子看出自己的烦恼。

SEE> ir·ri·tat·ed 恼怒的, embarrassed 尴尬, frus·trat·ed

ODE> Slightly angry; irritated. –

87. an·nu·al 年度 ## 2

[’ænjuəl]adj.每年的；年度的；一年生的n.年刊；一年生植物

  • It had been purchased by a local authority so that an enormous pie could be baked for an annual fair. 它是由一个地方当局买下，这样一个巨大的馅饼可以烘焙的年度展览会。
  • This modern faith in medicines is proved by the fact that the annual drug bill of the Health Services is mounting to astronomical figures and shows no signs at present of ceasing to rise. 这现代人对药物是由卫生部门的年度药费在停止上涨的目前安装到天文数字，且没有迹象事实证明。

SEE> an·nu·al·ly 每年, month·ly , year 年

ODE> Occurring once every year. – yearly, once-a-year, every twelve months.

88. an·oth·er 另一个 ## 54

[ə’nʌðər]adj.另一的；再一个的pron.另一个；类似的一个；别的

  • Here is another photograph of the village. 这是我们村庄的另一张照片。
  • Here is another photograph. 这是另一张照片。
  • You must stay in bed for another two days. 你必须卧床两天。

SEE> one 一, a , on·ly 只有

ODE> Used to refer to an additional person or thing of the same type as one already mentioned or known about; one more; a further. – one more, a further, an additional, a second.

89. an·swer 回答 ## 43

[’ænsər]v.回答；答复；接电话n.答案；回答；答复

  • How did Pauline answer the telephone at nine o’clock? 波林是如何接听电话九点钟？
  • My boss answered the telephone. 我的老板接的电话。
  • But I didn’t answer the phone! 但我没接电话！

SEE> ques·tion 问题, why 为什么, ask 问

ODE> A thing that is said, written, or done as a reaction to a question, statement, or situation. – reply, response, rejoinder, return, reaction.

90. anx·i·e·ty 焦虑 ## 3

[æŋ’zaɪəti]n.焦虑；担心；渴望

  • He may never be sure where the next meal is coming from, but he is free from the thousands of anxieties which afflict other people. 他可能从不知道下顿饭有无着落，但他是从成千上万的折磨着其他人的焦虑的自由。
  • What particular anxiety spoils the country dweller’s visit to the theatre? 什么特别的焦虑败坏了农村居民的剧院访问？
  • The city dweller never experiences anxieties of this sort. 城里人是从未经历过这种担忧。

SEE> nerv·ous·ness , fear 恐惧, an·ger 愤怒

ODE> A feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. – worry, concern, apprehension, apprehensiveness, consternation, uneasiness, unease, fearfulness, fear, disquiet, disquietude, perturbation, fretfulness, agitation, angst, nervousness, nerves, edginess, tension, tenseness, stress, misgiving, trepidation, foreboding, suspense.

91. anx·ious 着急的 ## 2

[’æŋkʃəs]adj.渴望的；忧虑的

  • The gaoler looked on eagerly, anxious to see if his fellow actor had at last learnt his lines. 热切地看着狱卒，急于想了解他的同事是否男主角终于了解到他的台词。
  • They are not anxious social climbers, and they have no devotion to material things. 他们不是焦虑的向上爬的人，他们没有奉献给物质性的东西。

SEE> ea·ger , wor·ried 担心的, un·der·stand·a·bly

ODE> Feeling or showing worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. – worried, concerned, apprehensive, fearful, uneasy, ill at ease, perturbed, troubled, disquieted, bothered, disturbed, distressed, fretful, fretting, agitated, in a state of agitation, nervous, in a state of nerves, edgy, on edge, tense, overwrought, worked up, keyed up, strung out, jumpy, afraid, worried sick, with one’s stomach in knots, with one’s heart in one’s mouth, on pins and needles, stressed, under stress, in suspense, flurried.

92. anx·ious·ly 焦急地 ## 2

[’æŋkʃəsli]adv.焦急地；忧虑地；担心地

  • Tomorrow he will be watching her anxiously as she swims the long distance to England. 明天他将焦急地注视着女儿游到英国的长途。
  • Everybody will be watching anxiously as the new buildings go up. 大家都将急切地注视着新建筑的建成。

SEE> nerv·ous·ly 紧张, ea·ger·ly , im·pa·tient·ly

ODE> In a manner resulting from or revealing anxiety. –

93. an·y 任何 ## 86

[’eni]adj.任何的adv.稍微；丝毫pron.任何

  • Is there any water in this kettle? 有没有在这水壶里有水？
  • Do you want any sugar? 你要糖吗？
  • Do you want any milk? 你想要的任何牛奶吗？

SEE> no 不, not 不, an·y·thing 任何东西

ODE> Used to refer to one or some of a thing or number of things, no matter how much or how many. – some, a piece of, a part of, a bit of.

94. an·y·one 任何人 ## 20

[’eniwʌn]pron.任何人

  • Isn’t there anyone at home? 是不是有没有人在家吗？
  • He turned on the light, but he couldn’t see anyone. 他开了灯，但他什么都没看到。
  • Among the rubbish, I found a sign which said, ‘Anyone who leaves litter in these woods will be prosecuted!’ 在垃圾堆中我发现了一块牌子，上面写着：“凡谁在此树林里垃圾会被起诉！”

SEE> an·y·bod·y 任何人, else 其他, an·y·thing 任何东西

ODE> Any person or people. – anyone, anybody.

95. an·y·thing 任何东西 ## 29

[’eniθɪŋ]pron.任何事；任何东西；重要事物adv.在任何程度上

  • Can you see anything? 你能看见什么？
  • You always say that, but we never win anything! 你总是这么说，但是我们从来没赢过！
  • I often fish for hours without catching anything. 我经常一钓数小时却一无所获。

SEE> noth·ing 没有, some·thing 某物, else 其他

ODE> Used to refer to a thing, no matter what. –

96. an·y·where 任何地方 ## 6

[’eniwer]adv.任何地方n.任何(一个)地方

  • We might not go anywhere. 我们可能不会去任何地方。
  • The most surprising thing about it, however, is that it can land anywhere: on snow, water, or even on a ploughed field. 它最令人惊奇的事情，但问题在于，它可以在任何地方降落：雪地上，水面上，甚至耕过的田里。
  • He could not find his fifty pence piece anywhere, and what is more, he could not get his arm out. 他无法找到他的50便士硬币，而且更重要的是，他无法得到他的手臂出来。

SEE> else 其他, some·where 某处, an·y·one 任何人

ODE> In or to any place. –

97. a·part 分开 ## 7

[ə’pɑːrt]adv.相距；分开地；分别地adj.分开的；分离的

  • Apart from a few words, I do not know any French at all. 除了少数的话，我不知道任何法语。
  • Apart from an interesting-looking carved dagger, the box was full of crockery, much of it broken. 除了一个有趣的前瞻性雕匕首外，箱子里面装满了陶器，很多都碎了。
  • What does the computer industry thrive on apart from anarchy? 什么是计算机行业从混乱兴旺分开？

SEE> rest 休息, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, though 虽然

ODE> (of two or more people or things) separated by a specified distance in time or space. – away from each other, distant from each other.

98. a·part·ment 公寓 ## 2

[ə’pɑːrtmənt]n.一套公寓房间

  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。
  • The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground, and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them. 形状和摩天大楼的尺寸完全取决于获得每平方英尺的地面最高收入的必要性，并提供使他满意的租户办公室和住房。

SEE> bed·room 卧室, base·ment , build·ing 建筑

ODE> A flat, typically one that is well appointed or used for holidays. – flat.

99. a·pol·o·gize 道歉 ## 2

[ə’pɑːlədʒaɪz]vi.道歉；赔罪

  • Was Dimitri right to apologize to his neighbour? 当时迪米特里道歉对他的邻居吗？
  • Ashamed of having acted so rashly, Dimitri apologized to Aleko for having accused him. 感到羞愧的鲁莽的，迪米特里道歉阿列科为被指责他。

SEE> a·pol·o·gy , sor·ry 抱歉, re·gret 后悔

ODE> Express regret for something that one has done wrong. – say sorry, express regret, be apologetic, make an apology, ask forgiveness, beg forgiveness, beg someone’s forgiveness, ask for pardon, beg pardon, beg someone’s pardon.

100. ap·par·ent·ly 显然地 ## 6

[ə’pærəntli]adv.表面上；似乎；显然

  • Apparently sensitive to criticism, the bull forgot all about the matador and charged at the drunk. 批评显然非常敏感的公牛完全斗牛士和醉汉。
  • Apparently, there is a good deal of truth in this idea. 显然，有真理的这个想法很划算。
  • So their entry into this flat was apparently not the burglars’ first job that day and they must have been disturbed. 所以他们进入这个单位是显然不是窃贼第一份工作的那一天，他们必须感到不安。

SEE> pre·sum·a·bly 想必, ev·i·dent·ly , sup·pos·ed·ly

ODE> As far as one knows or can see. – seemingly, evidently, it seems, it seems that, it would seem, it would seem that, it appears, it appears that, it would appear, it would appear that, as far as one knows, by all accounts, so it seems.

101. ap·peal 有吸引力 ## 3

[ə’piːl]n.恳求；呼吁；上诉；吸引力n.(体育比赛中)诉请裁决v.呼吁；有吸引力；求助；诉请

  • The idea never appealed to me very much, but one day, after a heavy shower, I happened to be walking in my garden when I noticed a huge number of snails taking a stroll on some of my prize plants. 该想法没有引起我多大兴趣，但有一天，一个大雨后，我正好走在我的花园时，我注意到在服用一些心爱的花木上慢悠悠蜗牛的一个巨大的数字。
  • In spite of national differences, certain funny situations have a universal appeal. 尽管民族不同，有些滑稽的情节却能产生普遍的效果。
  • The quiet life of the country has never appealed to me. 在宁静的乡村生活从来没有吸引过我。

SEE> re·quest 请求, court 法庭, de·ci·sion 决定

ODE> Make a serious, urgent, or heartfelt request. – ask earnestly, ask urgently, request earnestly, request urgently, make an earnest request, make an urgent request, call, make a plea, plead, beg.

102. ap·pear 出现 ## 14

[ə’pɪr]vi.出现；出版；显得；好像；登场

  • In spite of this, she often appears on the stage as a young girl. 尽管如此，她经常出现在舞台上作为一个年轻的女孩。
  • In the play, she must appear in a bright red dress and long black stockings. 在剧中，她必须出现在鲜红色的裙子和黑色的长筒袜。
  • In place of the great trees which had been growing there for centuries, patches of green had begun to appear in the blackened soil. 上，代替了多少世纪以来一直生长在那里的参天大树，片的绿草开始出现在这片烧焦的土壤。

SEE> al·though 虽然, in·deed 确实, though 虽然

ODE> Come into sight; become visible or noticeable, especially without apparent cause. – become visible, come into view, come into sight, materialize, take shape.

103. ap·ply 应用 ## 6

[ə’plaɪ]vt.应用；涂；使专心从事vi.申请；有关联

  • An all-night party on New Year’s Eve provided me with a good excuse for not carrying out either of these new resolutions on the first day of the year, but on the second, I applied myself assiduously to the task. 在除夕通宵晚会为我提供了一个很好的借口，在今年的第一天也不这些新决议的执行，但在第二天，我自己刻苦钻研的任务。
  • The EU – following fine continental traditions – wants agreement on general principles, which could be applied to many types of products and perhaps extended to other countries. 欧盟 - 以下优良的大陆传统 - 希望就普遍的原则，这些原则可以适用于许多不同产品，同时可能延伸到其它国家。
  • This applies particularly to chemical industries, where chance discoveries play a much larger part than they do in physical and mechanical industries. 这尤其适用于化工等行业，其中偶然发现的机会比他们在物理和机械工业做一个更大的部分。

SEE> al·low 允许, must 必须, per·mit 允许

ODE> Make a formal application or request. – put in an application, put in, try, bid, appeal, petition, make an entreaty, sue, register, audition.

104. ap·point·ment 约定 ## 2

[ə’pɔɪntmənt]n.约会；任命；设备；职位

  • Do you have an appointment? 你有预约吗？
  • It is hard for energetic, quick-minded people to waste time, so they are often tempted to finish a job before setting out to keep an appointment. 这是精力充沛，思维敏捷的人浪费时间，因此他们常想做完一件事后再去赴约之前。

SEE> res·ig·na·tion , rec·om·men·da·tion , de·par·ture 离开

ODE> An arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place. – meeting, engagement, interview, arrangement, consultation, session.

105. ap·pre·ci·ate 欣赏 ## 5

[ə’priːʃieɪt]vt.欣赏；赏识；感激；领会；意识到vi.增值

  • I think that young children often appreciate modern pictures better than anyone else. 我觉得小孩子们往往欣赏现代绘画比别人更好。
  • Children always appreciate small gifts of money. 孩子们总是喜欢得到一些零花钱。
  • It has always been a mystery to me why city dwellers, who appreciate all these things, obstinately pretend that they would prefer to live in the country. 这一直是个谜我为什么城市居民，谁对这一切，硬是假装他们宁愿住在乡下。

SEE> ad·mire 钦佩, un·der·stand 懂, im·por·tant·ly 重要的

ODE> Recognize the full worth of. – value, respect, prize, cherish, treasure, admire, hold in high regard, hold in esteem, rate highly, think highly of, think much of, have a high opinion of, set store by, set great store by.

106. ap·proach 靠近 ## 5

[ə’proʊtʃ]v.靠近；接近；接洽；要求；达到；动手处理n.途径；方法；接近；接洽；要求；路径；进场着陆；相似的事物

  • A policeman approached Jimmy and told him he ought to have gone along a side street as Jumbo was holding up the traffic. 一个警察走过来告诉吉米，他应该走一条小街走了，因为江泊阻碍了交通。
  • The next man to approach me was selling expensive pens and watches. 接下来的男子接近我是卖名贵钢笔和手表。
  • The captive elephant, still roped to a tree, plunges and screams every time a man approaches, and for several days will probably refuse all food through anger and fear. 圈养的大象，还是拉拢在树上，猛冲并发出尖叫每一个男人接近的时间，几天很可能会拒绝所有食物愤怒和恐惧。

SEE> way 方式, ra·ther 相当, kind 种类

ODE> Come near or nearer to (someone or something) in distance or time. – proceed towards, come towards, go towards, advance towards, go near, go nearer, come near, come nearer, draw near, draw nearer, come close, come closer, go close, go closer, draw close, draw closer, move near, move nearer, edge near, edge nearer, near, draw near.

107. ar·e·a 区域 ## 8

[’eriə]n.面积；地区，地段；区域；领域

  • This is a “No Parking” area. 这是一个“禁止停车”的区域。
  • The Games will be held just outside the capital and the whole area will be called ‘Olympic City’. 该游戏将在城外举行的首都，整个地区将被称作“奥林匹克城”。
  • Macaroni has been grown in this area for over six hundred years. 通心粉在这个地区已经种植了600年。

SEE> vi·cin·i·ty , near·by 附近, ad·ja·cent

ODE> A region or part of a town, a country, or the world. – district, region, zone, sector, quarter.

108. ar·gue 争论 ## 6

[’ɑːrɡjuː]v.说服；争论；辩论

  • During the rush hour one evening two cars collided and both drivers began to argue. 在上下班高峰期一天晚上，两台车相撞，两个司机争吵起来。
  • I argued that if I spent less time exhausting myself at exercises in the morning, I would keep my mind fresh for reading when I got home from work. 我认为，如果我花更少的时间在晨练用尽我自己，我会保持我的头脑更清醒读书，当我下班回家。
  • I accept that we are equals, and I will argue with him, as an equal, if I think he is wrong. 我承认，我们是平等的，我会和他辩论，作为一个平等的，如果我认为他是错的。

SEE> in·sist 坚持, more·o·ver 此外, be·lieve 相信

ODE> Give reasons or cite evidence in support of an idea, action, or theory, typically with the aim of persuading others to share one’s view. – contend, assert, declare, maintain, state, proclaim, advance, insist, hold, claim, aver, avow, reason, attest, expostulate, testify, swear, certify.

109. ar·gu·ment 争论 ## 3

[’ɑːrɡjumənt]n.辩论；论点；论据；争论；理由；(函数)自变量

  • The two men quarrelled bitterly and it was clear that the argument could only be settled by a fight. 这两人争吵不休，它很清楚，论据只能通过战斗来解决。
  • This led to yet another angry argument. 这又引起了一场唇枪舌剑的争吵。
  • What is the author’s main argument about the modern city? 笔者对现代城市的主要论点是什么？

SEE> ar·gue 争论, in·deed 确实, rea·son 理由

ODE> An exchange of diverging or opposite views, typically a heated or angry one. – quarrel, disagreement, squabble, fight, difference of opinion, dispute, wrangle, clash, altercation, feud, dissension, war of words, contretemps, exchange of views.

110. arm 手臂 ## 8

[ɑːrm]n.臂；扶手；袖子n.武器；军种vt.武装；装备（复）arms: 军事行动；纹章；兵役.

  • Armed with the new machine, a search party went into the cave hoping to find buried treasure. 随着新机的武装，搜索队进入了这个岩洞，希望找到埋藏的宝藏。
  • Armed with a torch, the vicar went up into the clock tower to see what was going on. 用一支电筒，牧师一同上到钟楼，看看发生了什么事情。
  • George took off his jacket, rolled up his sleeves and pushed his right arm through the drain cover. 乔治脱掉外套，挽起袖子，并通过排盖推开他的右臂。

SEE> hand 手, head 头, shoul·der 肩膀

ODE> Each of the two upper limbs of the human body from the shoulder to the hand. – upper limb, forelimb, appendage.

111. ar·my 军队 ## 7

[’ɑːrmi]n.军队；陆军；一大批

  • He had been obliged to join the army during the Second World War. 他曾被迫在二战期间参军。
  • As he hated army life, he decided to desert his regiment. 他讨厌军旅生活，决定逃离所在部队。
  • Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished. 哈丽特姑妈统率着他们不停地擦拭，清扫，刷洗一支看不见的佣人大军。

SEE> mil·i·tar·y 军事, troops , force 力

ODE> An organized military force equipped for fighting on land. – armed force, fighting force, defence force, military force, the military, land force, soldiery, infantry, militia, horde.

112. a·round 周围 ## 14

[ə’raʊnd]prep.到处；在 … 附近；围绕；大约；符合adv.到处；在周围；现有；闲散地；转弯；掉头adj.存在的；在风行的

  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。
  • A short time before, great trees had covered the countryside for miles around. 就在不久之前，参天大树还覆盖着方圆数英里的土地。
  • I had to think of a way of preventing him from following me around all morning. 我得想办法不让他整个上午都在跟着我周围的一种方式。

SEE> just 刚刚, up 上, some 一些

ODE> Located or situated on every side. – on every side, on all sides, in all directions, throughout, all over, all over the place, everywhere, about, here and there.

113. ar·rest 逮捕 ## 8

[ə’rest]vt.逮捕；拘留n.逮捕；拘留

  • When she was arrested, the detective found out that the shop assistant was her daughter. 她被逮捕后，侦探发现原来那售货员是她的女儿。
  • Shortly afterwards, the police stopped the car and both men were arrested. 不久，警察就截住了那辆车，两个小偷被逮捕。
  • After he was arrested, the man admitted hiding in the box before the plane left London. 他被逮捕后，男子承认躲在盒子在飞机离开伦敦前。

SEE> sus·pect 怀疑, cus·to·dy , jail

ODE> Seize (someone) by legal authority and take them into custody. – apprehend, take into custody, seize, take in, take prisoner, detain, put in jail, throw in jail.

114. ar·ri·val 到达 ## 4

[ə’raɪvl]n.到达；达到；到达者；新生儿

  • The porter went to fetch one and arrived back with the station master, who produced it with a flourish and pointed out a microscopic ‘o’ beside the time of the arrival of the train at his station; this little ‘o’ indicated that the train only stopped for mail. 搬运工跑回去取和到达同站主，谁一挥手，并指出了微观的“o”火车在他站的到达时间旁;这个小“O”表示，火车只停了邮件。
  • When several elephants are being trained at one time, it is customary for the new arrival to be placed between the stalls of two captives whose training is already well advanced. 当几个大象在同一时间接受培训，按照惯例，放置两头训练得很好的摊位之间新的到来。
  • The first records the arrival of longitudinal vibrations. 第一记录纵向振动的到来。

SEE> ar·rive 到达, de·par·ture 离开, short·ly 不久

ODE> The action or process of arriving. – coming, advent, appearance, entrance, entry, materialization, approach.

115. ar·rive 到达 ## 47

[ə’raɪv]vi.到达；到来；成功

  • They arrive home early. 他们到家很早。
  • He arrives home late. 他后期到家。
  • Then I arrived home at six o’clock yesterday evening. 然后，我回到家里昨晚6点钟。

SEE> de·part , ar·ri·val 到达, leave 离开

ODE> Reach a place at the end of a journey or a stage in a journey. – come, get here, get there, reach one’s destination, make it, appear, put in an appearance, make an appearance, come on the scene, come up, approach, enter, present oneself, turn up, be along, come along, materialize.

116. art 艺术 ## 11

[ɑːrt]n.艺术；美术；技巧；艺术品；人文学科；阴谋adj.艺术(品)的；美术(品)的

  • I am an art student and I paint a lot of pictures. 我是学艺术的学生，画了很多画。
  • Many people pretend that they understand modern art. 很多人装成很懂现代艺术。
  • The idea that modern art can only be seen in museums is mistaken. 那种认为现代艺术只能在博物馆里才能看到的观点是错误的。

SEE> mu·se·um 博物馆, con·tem·po·rar·y 当代, gal·ler·y

ODE> The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power. – fine art, artwork, creative activity.

117. ar·ti·cle 文章 ## 8

[’ɑːrtɪkl]n.文章；物品；条款；[语]冠词vt.订契约

  • The woman first bought a few small articles. 这位妇女先是买了几样小商品。
  • After reading an article entitled ‘Cigarette Smoking and Your Health’ I lit a cigarette to calm my nerves. 阅读一篇文章，题为“吸烟与健康”后，我点了一支烟，镇静一下紧张情绪。
  • Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president’s palace in a new African republic. 去年，一位记者受一家知名杂志写在总统府的一篇文章中一个新的中非共和国。

SEE> page 页, pub·li·ca·tion 出版物, in·stance 例子

ODE> A particular item or object. – object, thing, item, unit, artefact, piece of merchandise, commodity, product.

118. art·ist 艺术家 ## 2

[’ɑːrtɪst]n.艺术家；美术家；艺人

  • This exhibition received a great deal of attention in the press, for though the pictures were supposed to be the work of famous artists, they had in fact been painted by Dickie. 这次展览的极大关注，在新闻，因为这些画被认为是著名艺术家的作品，他们在事实上是迪基自己画。
  • For this reason also the writer, like any other artist, has no resting place, no crowd or movement in which he may take comfort, no judgment from outside which can replace the judgment from within. 也是由于这个原因，作家同任何艺术家一样，一直没有休息的地方，没有人群或运动中，他可能需要的舒适性，无论从局外人的判断也从内心的正确判断。

SEE> paint·er 画家, mu·si·cian 音乐家, sing·er 歌手

ODE> A person who creates paintings or drawings as a profession or hobby. – creator, originator, designer, producer, fine artist.

119. as 作为 ## 393

[əz]adv.同样地；例如；被认为prep.作为；如同conj.因为；像；当 … 之时；像 … 一样；结果；尽管n.阿斯（古罗马重量单位，约373克；古罗马铜币名）

  • I’m afraid this green dress is too small for me as well. 恐怕这件绿色的衣服对我来说太小了为好。
  • But, of course, it’s not as good as the expensive one. 但是，当然，这还不如昂贵的一个。
  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

SEE> al·so 也, well 好, once 一次

ODE> Used in comparisons to refer to the extent or degree of something. – while, just as, even as, at the time that, at the same time that, at the moment that, during the time that, just when.

120. ask 问 ## 89

[æsk]v.询问；请求；邀请；要求；开价；期待

  • Ask her please. 请问她。
  • ‘I can ask him the way,’ she said to herself. “我可以向他问路，”她对自己说。
  • I’ll ask some of the passengers. 我会问一些乘客。

SEE> tell 告诉, why 为什么, want 想要

121. a·sleep 睡着 ## 2

[ə’sliːp]adj.睡着的；已死的；不活跃的；麻木的adv.睡着；进入静止状态

  • I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep, so I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window. 我试着按响了门铃，试图唤醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟，所以我在花园里接到了棚里拿来一架梯子，把它靠在墙边，开始攀爬向卧室的窗口。
  • In it there was a boatman fast asleep. 在这里面有一船夫在呼呼大睡。

SEE> a·wake 醒着, sleep 睡觉, bed 床

ODE> In a state of sleep. – sleeping, fast asleep, sound asleep, in a deep sleep, slumbering, napping, catnapping, dozing, resting, reposing, drowsing, dormant, comatose.

122. as·sis·tance 帮助 ## 2

[ə’sɪstəns]n.援助；帮助

  • Then, her composure regained, she was ready to set off with the porter’s assistance to search for any intruders who might still be lurking in her flat. 然后，她镇定了，她准备衬托着看门人的协助下搜寻谁可能仍潜伏在她房里的窃贼。
  • In fact, it would be an assistance to all carnivores though it would be a two-edged weapon when they fought each other. 事实上，这将是一个帮助所有的食肉动物虽然这将是一柄武器，当他们相互交战。

123. as·sis·tant 助理 ## 22

[ə’sɪstənt]n.助手，助理，助教；【化】（用于染色的）助剂adj.副的；辅助的

  • He’s our office assistant. 他是我们的办公室助理。
  • After a little time, she chose one of the most expensive dresses in the shop and handed it to an assistant who wrapped it up for her as quickly as possible. 过了一会儿，她又选了商场里最昂贵的一件衣服，把它递给了助手谁尽快包好了她越好。
  • When she was arrested, the detective found out that the shop assistant was her daughter. 她被逮捕后，侦探发现原来那售货员是她的女儿。

124. as·so·ci·ate 联系 ## 4

[ə’soʊʃieɪt]vt.联想；联合n.伙伴；同事；同伴adj.副的；共事的；有联系的n.准学士学位获得者vi.交往

  • There are countless people who, ever since their early years, have learned to associate snails with food. 还有谁，因为他们早年曾经，已经学会了与食物关联蜗牛无数人。
  • The word justice is usually associated with courts of law. 字义通常与法庭连在一起的。
  • This is a pity, because noise abatement really is a good cause, and it is likely to be discredited if it gets to be associated with bad science. 这是一个遗憾，因为减少噪音实在是一个很好的原因，很可能使人生疑，如果它得到与坏科学有关。
