125. as·so·ci·a·tion 协会 ## 2

[əˌsoʊʃi’eɪʃn]n.协会；社团；交往；联想；联合；结合

  • The Youth Hostels Association. 青年招待所协会。
  • Things owned for a long time are full of associations with the past, perhaps with relatives who are dead, and so they gradually acquire a value beyond their true worth. 很长一段时间所有的东西都充满着与过去岁月的联系，或许与亲戚谁已经死了，所以他们逐渐获得了一种超出自己的真正价值的值。

SEE> fed·er·a·tion , or·gan·i·za·tion 组织, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> (often in names) a group of people organized for a joint purpose. – alliance, consortium, coalition, union, league, guild, syndicate, corporation, federation, confederation, confederacy, conglomerate, cooperative, partnership, amalgamation, merger.

126. as·sume 假设 ## 11

[ə’suːm]vt.假定；设想；承担；(想当然的)认为；假装

  • Assuming that his family had been killed during an air raid, Hans settled down in a village fifty miles away where he had remained ever since. 假设他的全家人都在空袭中被打死，汉斯在一个村子里定居下来五十英里的地方，他保持至今。
  • Up to now, historians have assumed that calendars came into being with the advent of agriculture, for then man was faced with a real need to understand something about the seasons. 截至目前，历史学家们认为日历是随农业的问世而出现的，因为当时人们面临着一个真正需要了解一些有关的季节。
  • You can stretch your legs on the spacious decks, play games, meet interesting people and enjoy good food – always assuming, of course, that the sea is calm. 您可以舒展上宽敞的甲板，玩游戏，满足有趣的人你的双腿，享受美味佳肴 - 总是假设，当然，海上风平浪静。

SEE> in·deed 确实, more·o·ver 此外, there·fore 因此

ODE> Suppose to be the case, without proof. – presume, suppose, take it, take for granted, take as read, take it as given, presuppose, conjecture, surmise, conclude, come to the conclusion, deduce, infer, draw the inference, reckon, reason, guess, imagine, think, fancy, suspect, expect, accept, believe, be of the opinion, understand, be given to understand, gather, glean.

127. at 在 ## 410

[ət]prep.在；向；达n.基普(老挝货币基本单位)(=att)；[化]砹(极不稳定放射性元素)abbr.密封的(=airtight)abbr.气温(=air temperature)

  • Mr. Jones and his wife are looking at them. 琼斯先生和他的妻子正在寻找他们。
  • Sally is looking at a big ship. 莎莉正在观看一艘大船。
  • Tim is looking at an aeroplane. 蒂姆正望着一架飞机。

SEE> where 哪里, time 时间, while 当的时候

ODE> Expressing location or arrival in a particular place or position. – no later than, in good time for, at, before.

128. at·mos·phere 大气层 ## 11

[’ætməsfɪr]n.大气；空气；气氛；气压

  • Of course, the Hubble is above the earth’s atmosphere, so it will soon be sending us the clearest pictures of the stars and distant galaxies that we have ever seen. 当然，哈勃位于地球的大气层之外，因此，它很快就会给我们发送的行星和远距离星系的最清晰的照片，我们已经见过。
  • He is forever talking about the friendly people, the clean atmosphere, the closeness to nature and the gentle pace of living. 他滔滔不绝地大谈友好的农民，洁净的空气，贴近大自然的环境和悠闲的生活节奏。
  • Our own warm atmosphere and the heat generated by the telescope would make it impossible to detect objects as small as planets. 我们自己温暖的大气层和望远镜所产生的热量，就不可能检测到物体小的行星。

SEE> kind 种类, sort 种类, in·deed 确实

ODE> The envelope of gases surrounding the earth or another planet. – air, aerosphere, airspace, sky.

129. at·ta·ch 贴上 ## 5

[ə’tætʃ]v.附上；系上；贴上；使依附；使附属；使附着

  • Lined up against the wall, there were long thin wires attached to metal spheres. 一字排开靠墙，有附着于金属球长细线。
  • The sides of the dish were so smooth that it was almost impossible to attach hawsers and chains to the rim without damaging it. 培养皿的四边十分光滑，这是几乎不可能拴上绳索或链条到轮辋而不损坏它。
  • She was sentimentally attached to this house, for even though it was far too big for her needs, she persisted in living there long after her husband’s death. 她眷恋这个房子，因为即使是如此庞大的她的需要，她在丈夫去世后，生活在那里长期坚持。

SEE> at·tached 附, like·wise , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Join or fasten (something) to something else. – fasten, fix, affix, join, connect, couple, link, secure, make fast, tie, tie up, bind, fetter, strap, rope, tether, truss, lash, hitch, moor, anchor, yoke, chain.

130. at·tack 攻击 ## 3

[ə’tæk]n.攻击；抨击v.攻击；抨击；发动攻击；（疾病）侵袭

  • Why did the prisoner attack the driver? 没有犯人为何要攻击的驱动程序？
  • It immediately ran away when she saw it, and experts confirmed that a puma will not attack a human being unless it is cornered. 它就立刻逃走了，当她看见了，专家证实，除非被逼得走投无路，美洲狮不会攻击人类。
  • Hart’s good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited, and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way, his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive, especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians. 哈特的好，坏男人总是一个局外人，总是剥夺继承权的一个，如果他认为有必要枪击一个司法官或抢劫一个银行，他的早期观众很容易理解和原谅，特别是当它是哈特谁，最终战胜了前来进攻的印第安人。

SEE> bombing , ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, an·oth·er 另一个

ODE> Take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces) with weapons or armed force. – begin an assault, charge, pounce, strike, begin hostilities, ambush.

131. at·tempt 尝试 ## 14

[ə’tempt]v.企图；尝试n.企图；试图

  • After his attempt, Campbell was disappointed to learn that his average speed had been 299 miles per hour. 比赛结束后，坎贝尔非常失望地得知他的平均时速已经每小时299英里。
  • Despite the new tunnel, there are still a few people who rashly attempt to cross the Pass on foot. 尽管新的隧道，但仍有一些人谁莽撞地企图跨越山口徒步。
  • The temperature drops to -30˚, and very few people attempt to cross the Pass. 气温下降到-30˚，只有极少数人试图跨越山口。

SEE> ef·fort 努力, try 尝试, to 至

ODE> Make an effort to achieve or complete (something difficult) – try, strive, aim, venture, endeavour, seek, set out, do one’s best, do all one can, do one’s utmost, make an effort, make every effort, spare no effort, give one’s all, take it on oneself.

132. at·tend 出席 ## 4

[ə’tend]v.出席；参加；照料；注意；专心于

  • A great many former pupils will be attending a farewell dinner in his honour next Thursday. 很多老学生将参加在他的荣誉下周四的告别宴会。
  • You hang up hurriedly and attend to baby, crockery, etc. 你慌忙挂上电话，去照料孩子，陶器等。
  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。

SEE> par·tic·i·pate , meet·ing 会议, in·vite 邀请

ODE> Be present at (an event, meeting, or function) – be present at, be at, be there at, sit in on, take part in.

133. at·ten·tion 注意 ## 12

[ə’tenʃn]n.注意；注意力；照料；留心；关怀；(口令)立正

  • They did not pay any attention. 他们没有支付任何注意。
  • You will enjoy your stay here if you pay attention to our street signs. 如果你注意我们街上的标牌你在这里过得愉快。
  • Even the bull seemed to feel sorry for him, for it looked on sympathetically until the drunk was out of the way before once more turning its attention to the matador. 好像连牛觉得对不起他，因为它一直同情地望着醉汉，直到醉汉才重新将注意力转向斗牛士是的出路。

SEE> fo·cus 焦点, par·tic·u·lar 特定的, much 许多

ODE> Notice taken of someone or something; the regarding of someone or something as interesting or important. – awareness, notice, observation, consciousness, heed, recognition, regard, scrutiny, surveillance, attentiveness.

134. at·ti·tude 态度 ## 3

[’ætɪtuːd]n.态度；看法；姿势

  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。
  • Victorian parents believed that they kept their dignity by retreating behind an unreasoning authoritarian attitude; in fact they did nothing of the kind, but children were then too cowed to let them know how they really felt. 维多利亚时代的父母认为，他们可以靠无理的权威气派自己的尊严;其实他们什么也没做的那种，但孩子们则太吓倒，让他们知道他们是如何真正感受到。
  • Today we tend to go to the other extreme, but on the whole this is a healthier attitude both for the child and the parent. 今天，我们倾向于走向另一个极端，但整体上这是既为孩子和家长双方态度都比较端正。

SEE> re·gard 看待, stance , ap·proach 靠近

ODE> A settled way of thinking or feeling about something. – point of view, view, viewpoint, vantage point, frame of mind, way of thinking, way of looking at things, school of thought, outlook, angle, slant, perspective, reaction, stance, standpoint, position, inclination, orientation, approach.

135. at·tract 吸引 ## 6

[ə’trækt]v.吸引；引来

  • The spheres had been magnetized and attracted or repelled each other all the time. 球经过磁化，吸引或排斥的时间彼此。
  • This attracted the attention of Richard Humphries who was then the most eminent boxer in England. 这吸引了理查德·汉弗莱斯的注意谁是当时英国最杰出的拳击手。
  • Stories about people often attract far more public attention than political events. 常人轶事往往比政治事件更能引起公众注意。

SEE> lure , ea·ger , en·cour·age 鼓励

ODE> Cause to come to a place or participate in a venture by offering something of interest or advantage. – entice, allure, lure, tempt, charm, win over, woo, engage, enchant, entrance, mesmerize, hypnotize, spellbind, captivate, beguile, bewitch, seduce, dazzle, tantalize, inveigle, lead on.

136. au·di·ence 听众 ## 3

[’ɔːdiəns]n.听众；观众；读者；倾听；拥护者；正式会见

  • Over the years, one may well become an authority on one’s hobby and will very probably be asked to give informal talks to little gatherings and then, if successful, to larger audiences. 多年来，一个可能成为自己这种爱好的权威，很可能被要求在小型集会上作非正式的会谈，然后，如果成功，为更多受众群体。
  • Hart’s good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited, and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way, his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive, especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians. 哈特的好，坏男人总是一个局外人，总是剥夺继承权的一个，如果他认为有必要枪击一个司法官或抢劫一个银行，他的早期观众很容易理解和原谅，特别是当它是哈特谁，最终战胜了前来进攻的印第安人。
  • Audiences in the second decade of the twentieth century found it pleasant to escape to a time when life, though hard, was relatively simple. 在二十世纪的第二个十年的观众发现它令人愉快逃脱的时候，生活，虽然辛苦，相对简单。

SEE> crowd 人群, eve·ry·one 大家, in·deed 确实

ODE> The assembled spectators or listeners at a public event such as a play, film, concert, or meeting. – spectators, listeners, viewers, onlookers, concertgoers, theatregoers, patrons.

137. aunt 姑妈 ## 18

[ænt]n.伯母；姑；婶；姨

  • Why was the writer’s aunt surprised? 为什么作家的阿姨感到惊讶吗？
  • It was my aunt Lucy. 这是我的阿姨露西。
  • Why doesn’t Aunt Jennifer tell anyone how old she is? 为什么不珍大妈告诉任何人，她有多大？

SEE> grand·moth·er 祖母, niece 侄女, moth·er 母亲

ODE> The sister of one’s father or mother or the wife of one’s uncle. – relative, relation, blood relation, blood relative, family member, one’s own flesh and blood, next of kin.

138. au·thor 作者 ## 6

[’ɔːθər]n.作家；作者vt.编写；创作Author.n.上帝

  • What was the mistake the author made? 什么是作者所犯的错误？
  • What, according to the author, is the best way to overcome the fear of death as you get older? 什么，根据作者，是克服对死亡的恐惧，你变老的最佳方式？
  • What is the author’s main argument about the modern city? 笔者对现代城市的主要论点是什么？

SEE> nov·el·ist , book 书, writ·er 作家

ODE> A writer of a book, article, or document. – writer, man of letters, woman of letters, wordsmith.

139. au·thor·i·ty 当局 ## 10

[ə’θɔːrəti]n.权力；官方；当局；职权；权威

  • When the fire had at last been put out, the forest authorities ordered several tons of a special type of grass-seed which would grow quickly. 最后，当有火被扑灭后，森林管理当局订购了好几吨一种特殊类型的草籽生长迅速的。
  • The French authorities had the plane packaged and moved in parts back to France. 法国当局有包装和部分转移的飞机回法国。
  • There he was picked up by a policeman and sent back to England by the local authorities. 他在那儿被一个警察抓住了，之后被当局送回了英国。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, ad·min·is·tra·tion , like·wise

ODE> The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience. – power, jurisdiction, command, control, mastery, charge, dominance, dominion, rule, sovereignty, ascendancy, supremacy, domination.

140. au·to·mat·ic 自动 ## 2

[ˌɔːtə’mætɪk]adj.自动的；无意识的；必然的n.自动装置；半自动武器

  • Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer, argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system, may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization. 罗纳德·布雷斯韦尔教授，领先美国射电天文学家，自然认为，如此优越的文明，对我们自己的太阳能系统进行访问，可能已经离开了自动信使以等待一个先进文明的觉醒。
  • Radio waves also travel at the speed of light, and assuming such an automatic messenger picked up our first broadcasts of the 1920’s, the message to its home planet is barely halfway there. 无线电波也是以光的速度，并假设这种自动化信息装置接收了我们第一个节目的20世纪20年代，该消息到原来的行星几乎一半。

SEE> au·to·mat·i·cal·ly 自动, ma·chine 机器, in·stead 代替

ODE> (of a device or process) working by itself with little or no direct human control. – mechanized, mechanical, automated, push-button, preprogrammed, computerized, electronic, robotic, unmanned.

141. au·tumn 秋季 ## 3

[’ɔːtəm]n.秋季；秋天

  • Is it cold or warm in autumn? 它是在秋季冷还是暖？
  • I don’t like autumn and winter. 我不喜欢秋季和冬季。
  • We welcome the seasons by the riverside, crowning the youngest girl with flowers in the spring, holding a summer festival on Midsummer Eve, giving thanks for the harvest in the autumn, and throwing a holly wreath into the current in the winter. 我们在河边迎接一年四季加冕最年轻的女孩在春天的花朵，抱着仲夏前夜夏季节，在秋季收获感恩，并抛出一个冬青花环到冬天的电流。

ODE> The season after summer and before winter, in the northern hemisphere from September to November and in the southern hemisphere from March to May. – decline, waning, downturn, ebb.

142. a·vail·a·ble 可得到 ## 6

[ə’veɪləbl]adj.可利用的；可得到的；有空的；有效的；【政】有资格的，适合的

  • He has to deduce what he can from the few scanty clues available. 他从现有的一些微薄的线索推断出什么，他可以。
  • They invariably live nearby and are always available for an informal chat or an evening’s entertainment. 他们都住在附近，并随时可以聊天或在晚上一起娱乐。
  • But even when such refinements are not available, there is plenty to keep you occupied. 但即使这样的改进不到位，有很多让你目不暇给。

SEE> on·ly 只有, ad·di·tion 加, al·though 虽然

ODE> Able to be used or obtained; at someone’s disposal. – obtainable, accessible, to be had, ready for use, at hand, to hand, at one’s disposal, at one’s fingertips, within easy reach, handy, convenient.

143. av·er·age 平均 ## 7

[’ævərɪdʒ]n.平均数；平均水平adj.平均的；一般的；通常的v.取平均值；达到平均水平

  • After his attempt, Campbell was disappointed to learn that his average speed had been 299 miles per hour. 比赛结束后，坎贝尔非常失望地得知他的平均时速已经每小时299英里。
  • His average speed had been 301 miles per hour. 他的平均时速已经时速是301英里。
  • As complaints must be made in writing, the Ombudsman receives an average of 1,200 letters a year. 由于意见必须以书面形式提出，司法特派员接收平均每年1200个字母。

SEE> than 比, per 每, less 减

ODE> A number expressing the central or typical value in a set of data, in particular the mode, median, or (most commonly) the mean, which is calculated by dividing the sum of the values in the set by their number. – mean, median, mode, midpoint, centre.

144. a·void 避免 ## 9

[ə’vɔɪd]vt.避免；逃避；[律]使无效；撤销

  • I crossed the street to avoid meeting him, but he saw me and came running towards me. 我穿过马路以便避开他，但他看到我并朝我跑过来。
  • After the alarm had been given, the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision. 警报响过不久，巨轮急转弯，以避免直接碰撞。
  • No one can avoid being influenced by advertisements. 没有人能避免受广告的影响。

SEE> pre·vent 防止, ra·ther 相当, in·stead 代替

ODE> Keep away from or stop oneself from doing (something) – keep away from, stay away from, steer clear of, circumvent, give a wide berth to, give something a miss, keep at arm’s length, fight shy of.

145. a·ware 知道的 ## 4

[ə’wer]adj.知道的；意识到的

  • He has deliberately chosen to lead the life he leads and is fully aware of the consequences. 他是故意在选择过那种生活的，并完全清楚后果的生活。
  • Aware of these pitfalls, this year I attempted to keep my resolutions to myself. 鉴于这些经验教训，今年我试图让我的决议，以自己。
  • People tend to amass possessions, sometimes without being aware of doing so. 人们喜欢收藏东西，有时并没有意识到这样做的。

SEE> con·cerned 关心的, ob·vi·ous·ly 显然, fact 事实

146. a·way 离开 ## 55

[ə’weɪ]adv.离开；远离；在远处；一直；朝另一个方向；消失adj.不在的；遥远的；[棒]出局的；客场的

  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。
  • Why didn’t Caroline recognize the customer straight away? 为什么卡罗琳没有认识到客户马上？

  • I feel awful. 我感觉糟透了。

148. ba·by 宝宝 ## 10

  • Dressed up as Father Christmas and accompanied by a ‘guard of honour’ of six pretty girls, he set off down the main street of the city riding a baby elephant called Jumbo. 他打扮成圣诞老人，在由6个漂亮姑娘组成的“仪仗队”，他掀起，沿着城里骑着名叫Jumbo的小象的主要街道。
  • The only passengers, a young woman and her two baby daughters, were unhurt. 上仅有的乘客，一位年轻妇女和她的两个孩子，她们没有受伤。

149. back 背部 ## 54

  • Does the man get his umbrella back? 难道男人得到他的伞回来？

151. bad 坏 ## 22

[bæd]adj.坏的；不好的；差的；疼痛的；严重的；有害的；腐败的；低劣的；不利的；不舒服的；不健康的n.坏人；坏事adv.非常；不好地

  • He has a bad cold, Mr. Williams, so he must stay in bed for a week. 他得了重感冒，威廉斯先生，因此他必须卧床一周。

152. bad·ly 惨 ## 4

[’bædli]adv.差的；严重地；恶劣地；极度地

  • Perhaps we didn’t do too badly. 也许我们没有做得太惨。
  • The thieves’ car was badly damaged and easy to recognize. 小偷的车损坏严重，很容易辨认。
  • The plane wasn’t too badly damaged, but over the years, the crash was forgotten and the wreck remained undisturbed. 这架飞机是不是太严重损坏，但是，多年来，飞机失事已被遗忘，飞机残骸也不受干扰。

153. bag 袋 ## 20

  • After I had had lunch at a village pub, I looked for my bag. 我在一家乡村小酒店吃过午饭后，就找我的提包。

154. bake 烘烤 ## 4

[beɪk]v.烤；烘焙；烘干；灼热

  • During a radio programme, a company of biscuit manufacturers once asked listeners to bake biscuits and send them to their factory. 在一个电台节目中，一个生产饼干请听众公司烘制饼干送到他们的工厂。
  • They offered to pay $10 a pound for the biggest biscuit baked by a listener. 他们愿意以$ 10磅由听众烘制的最大的饼干。
  • It had been baked by a college student who had used over 1,000 pounds of flour, 800 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of fat, and 400 pounds of various other ingredients. 它是由一个大学生谁使用了超过1000磅面粉，800磅食糖，200磅动物脂肪及400磅其他各种原料出炉。

SEE> ov·en 烤箱, sprin·kle , cake 蛋糕

ODE> Cook (food) by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven. – cook, oven-bake, dry-roast, roast, spit-roast, pot-roast.

155. ball 球 ## 6

[bɔːl]n.球；球状物；炮弹；舞会；愉快的经历；胆量；胡说；（复）睾丸v.使成球状；呈球状；性交

  • Suddenly, one of the children kicked a ball very hard and it went towards a passing boat. 突然，一个孩子踢一个球非常艰苦，这对路过的船去了。
  • The ball struck him so hard that he nearly fell into the water. 球击中了他，使他差点儿落入水中。
  • He called out to the children and threw the ball back to the bank. 他呼吁那些孩子，把球扔回到岸上。

SEE> throw 扔, kick 踢, cor·ner 角落

ODE> A solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game. – dance, dinner dance, masked ball, masquerade, tea dance.

156. bank 银行 ## 33

[bæŋk]n.银行；岸；筹码；库；田埂；堤；积云；一系列；一组；一排；一团；用于循环再利用的废旧物品回收站v.把钱存入银行；开户；筑堤防护；堆积

  • My wife and I are walking along the banks of the river. 我和妻子沿河岸上散步。
  • Tony worked in a lawyer’s office years ago, but he is now working at a bank. 托尼在一家律师事务所年前的工作，但他现在在一家银行上班。
  • It was warm last Sunday, so I went and sat on the river bank as usual. 它上星期日天气很暖和，所以我走过去坐在河堤上如常。

SEE> bank·ing , cen·tral 中央, cred·it 信用

ODE> The land alongside or sloping down to a river or lake. – edge, side, embankment, levee, border, verge, boundary, margin, rim, fringe, fringes, flank, brink, perimeter, circumference, extremity, periphery, limit, outer limit, limits, bound, bounds.

157. ba·r 横木 ## 8

[bɑːr]n.酒吧；条；横木；栅vt.禁止；阻挠；闩上；在 … 设栅栏

  • A bar of soap. 一块肥皂。
  • A bar of chocolate. 一块巧克力。
  • There’s a bar next door to the station. 有一个酒吧隔壁的站。

ODE> A long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, typically used as an obstruction, fastening, or weapon. – rod, pole, stake, stick, batten, shaft, shank, rail, pale, paling, spar, strut, support, prop, spoke, crosspiece, girder, beam, boom.

158. bar·gain 议价 ## 2

[’bɑːrɡən]n.交易；便宜货；契约v.讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖

  • I felt especially pleased with my wonderful bargain – until I got back to the ship. 我感到特别高兴与我的绝妙的讨价还价 - 直到我回到船上。
  • A truly dedicated bargain hunter must have patience, and above all, the ability to recognize the worth of something when he sees it. 一个到处找便宜的人必须具有耐心，而且最重要的，当他看到它的能力，认识事物的价值。

SEE> plea , like·wise , in·deed 确实

ODE> An agreement between two or more people or groups as to what each will do for the other. – agreement, arrangement, understanding, deal.

159. base 基础 ## 10

[beɪs]n.底部；基地；基础；基数；基线；(棒球)垒；[化]碱vt.以 … 作基础adj.卑鄙的；不道德的

  • A cat’s ability to survive falls is based on fact. 猫的生存瀑布能力是基于事实。
  • At the base of the gold cap, the words ‘made in the U.S.A.’ had been neatly inscribed. 在金笔帽的基础上，写着“在U.S.A.制造”整齐地刻有。
  • Most funny stories are based on comic situations. 最可笑的故事是基于喜剧情景。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, where 哪里, force 力

ODE> The lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported. – foundation, bottom, foot, support, prop, stay, stand, pedestal, plinth, rest, bed, substructure.

160. ba·sic 基本 ## 4

[’beɪsɪk]adj.基本的；基础的；初级的；含硅少的n.基础；根本；[计]BASIC语言

  • In fact a basic amount of movement occurs during sleep which is specifically concerned with preventing muscle inactivity. 实际上移动的基本的量，其具体涉及防止肌肉活动停止睡眠期间发生。
  • It was Hart who created the basic formula of the Western film, and devised the protagonist he played in every film he made, the good-bad man, the accidental-noble outlaw, or the honest-but-framed cowboy, or the sheriff made suspect by vicious gossip; in short, the individual in conflict with himself and his frontier environment. 这是哈特谁创造了西部电影的基本公式，并设计了他，他拍的电影几乎扮演主角，好的坏的男人，意外贵金属逃犯，诚实的，但是，遭陷害的牛仔或司法官。因流言蜚语怀疑;总之，在与他自己和他的拓荒环境相矛盾的人物。
  • Since the sea covers the greater part of the earth’s surface, it is quite reasonable to regard the sea floor as the basic form of the crust of the earth, with, superimposed upon it, the continents, together with the islands and other features of the oceans. 既然海洋覆盖了地球表面的大部分时间里，这是很合理的与岛屿和其他功能把海床看作地壳的基本形式，叠加，那么，大陆，一起海洋。

SEE> fun·da·men·tal 基本的, es·sen·tial 必要, basics

ODE> Forming an essential foundation or starting point; fundamental. – fundamental, rudimentary, primary, principal, cardinal, chief, elementary, elemental, root.

161. ba·sis 基础 ## 3

[’beɪsɪs]n.基础；根据；基底

  • What is the basis of ‘sick’ humour? 什么是“病态”幽默的基础是什么？
  • It can take as long as eight days to rig up rope ladders and to establish supply bases before a descent can be made into a very deep cave. 它可能需要长达8天时间来搭起绳梯，建立供应基地的下降可以做成一个很深的洞穴里。
  • It spread through France, where wild rabbits are not generally regarded as a pest but as a sport and a useful food supply, and it spread to Britain where wild rabbits are regarded as a pest but where domesticated rabbits, equally susceptible to the disease, are the basis of a profitable fur industry. 它蔓延至法国，在那里的野生兔子一般不被当作有害动物，而作为体育和有用的食物来源，并蔓延到英国，野兔被当作有害的，但在那里驯化的野兔，同样易患本病，是赚钱的毛皮工业的基础。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, fur·ther·more , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The underlying support or foundation for an idea, argument, or process. – origin, cause, root, source, starting point, core, centre, heart, kernel, base, basis, foundation.

162. bath 浴缸 ## 2

[bæθ]n.洗澡；浴室；沐浴；浴盆v.洗澡Bath.n.巴斯(英国城市)

  • He’s having a bath. 他正在洗澡。
  • On entering a shop, he would ask for a new perfume called ‘Scented Shadow’ or for ‘insoluble bath cubes’. 一进商店，他会提出要一种名叫“香影”的新型香水或什么“不溶浴皂”。

SEE> show·er 淋浴, bed 床, last·ly

ODE> A large container for water, used for immersing and washing the body. – bathtub, tub, hot tub.

163. bat·tle 战斗 ## 4

[’bætl]n.战斗；争斗v.与 … 作战；与 … 竞争

  • But Alfred had deduced that the Danes were no longer fit for prolonged battle: and that their commissariat had no organization, but depended on irregular raids. 然而，阿尔弗雷德断定，丹麦人持久的战争，不再适合：他们的军需供应处于无组织状态，只是靠临时突击。
  • So, faced with the Danish advance, Alfred did not risk open battle but harried the enemy. 因此，面对丹麦人的进攻，阿尔弗雷德没有冒险作战，而是不断地袭扰敌人。
  • Young men who have reason to fear that they will be killed in battle may justifiably feel bitter in the thought that they have been cheated of the best things that life has to offer. 年轻人谁有理由担心他们会在战斗中可以名正言顺地感到痛苦。想到自己被骗走的最好的事情，生活必须提供被杀死。

SEE> fight 战斗, fight·ing 战斗, strug·gle 斗争

ODE> A sustained fight between large organized armed forces. – fight, conflict, armed conflict, clash, struggle, skirmish, engagement, dogfight, affray, fray, encounter, confrontation.

[bi]v.有；在；是；到达；拜访

  • Whose handbag is it? 是谁的手袋？
  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？
  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？

SEE> be·ing , not 不, should 应该

ODE> Exist. – exist, have being, have existence.

165. beach 海滩 ## 2

[biːtʃ]n.海滩；海滨；沙滩vt.拖(船)上岸

  • The hovercraft travelled first over the water, then mounted the beach, climbed up the dunes, and sat down on a road. 气垫船先是在水面上行驶，后又登上海岸，爬上沙丘，最后停在路上。
  • Not only are the means of arriving at the holiday paradise entirely within one’s own command and keeping, but the means of escape from holiday hell (if the beach proves too crowded, the local weather too inclement) are there, outside – or, as likely, part of – the tent. 不仅是完全在自己的命令，并保持在到达假日天堂的手段，而是逃离假日地狱（如海滩太挤，当地天气太恶劣）在那里，外面的手段 - 或者，如帐篷 - 的可能性较大，部分。

SEE> palm , shore , surf

ODE> A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the sea between high- and low-water marks. – seaside, seashore, shore, coast, coastline, coastal region, seaboard, foreshore, water’s edge, margin.

  • In the end, it was more than he could bear. 最终，它更比他再也忍不住了。
  • When my old friend Brian urged me to accept a cigarette, it was more than I could bear. 当我的老朋友布赖恩怂恿我接受一支香烟时，它比我能承受的。

  • It was not until his third match in 1790 that he finally beat Humphries and became Champion of England. 它不是直到1790年第三场比赛，他终于击败汉弗莱斯，成了全英冠军。
  • He was glad to get away with a mere twenty pounds and he beat a hasty retreat, clutching the precious bottle under his arm. 他庆幸脱身只破费了20英镑便匆忙撤退，他腋下夹着的那宝贵的瓶子。
  • They sting or bite without provocation; they fly uninvited into our rooms on summer nights, or beat against our lighted windows. 他们又叮又咬不挑衅;它们未经邀请便飞到我们的房间在夏天夜晚，或者对着露出亮光的窗户。

  • Sally was very excited because she had never travelled on a train before. 萨莉非常激动，因为她从未之前火车旅行。

  • In a few years the small workshop had become a large factory which employed seven hundred and twenty-eight people. 在几年之后，小铺子已经发展成了一个大工厂雇用728人。
  • A short while ago, however, he became a bus driver and he has not regretted it. 前一阵子，但是，他成为一名公交车司机，他不后悔。

  • I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep, so I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window. 我试着按响了门铃，试图唤醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟，所以我在花园里接到了棚里拿来一架梯子，把它靠在墙边，开始攀爬向卧室的窗口。
  • After her husband had gone to work, Mrs. Richards sent her children to school and went upstairs to her bedroom. 之后，她的丈夫上班走后，理查兹女士把孩子送去上学，然后来到楼上自己的卧室。

182. be·have 行为 ## 3

[bɪ’heɪv]v.表现；行为；举止

  • ‘Cats behave like well-trained paratroopers,’ a doctor said. “猫就像训练有素的跳伞队员，”一位医生说。
  • The administrative overheads of a business are low to the extent that everyone working in the business can be trusted to behave in a way that best promotes the interests of the firm. 一个企业的管理费用低的程度，每个人都在企业工作的可以信任的最促进公司利益的方式行事。
  • To the extent that the people can be relied upon to behave in a loyal and responsible manner, the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order. 为了我们的人民能够在以忠诚和负责任的方式行事的依据的范围内，政府就不需要警察和公务员的军队，让他们为了。

SEE> dif·fer·ent·ly 不同, re·act 反应, sim·i·lar·ly 同样

ODE> Act or conduct oneself in a specified way, especially towards others. – conduct oneself, act, acquit oneself, bear oneself, carry oneself.

183. be·hav·iour 行为 ## 7

[bɪ’heɪvjər]n.行为；举止；品行=behavior

  • What was the difference between Bruce’s behaviour and that of other people? 是什么布鲁斯的行为之间和其他人的区别？
  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。
  • Such a loss of dignity and descent into childish behaviour on the part of the adults deeply shocks the adolescents, and makes them resolve that in future they will not talk to their parents about the places or people they visit. 尊严和下降的这样的损失插入成人的一部分幼稚的行为深感震惊着少年，并让他们的决心，今后他们不会跟父母讲述去过的地方和人。

ODE> The way in which one acts or conducts oneself, especially towards others. – conduct, way of behaving, way of acting, deportment, bearing, etiquette.

184. be·hind 在后面 ## 22

[bɪ’haɪnd]prep.在…之后；迟于…；落后于；基于；追赶adv.在后面地；落后地；迟；不如n. 屁股

  • It’s over there, behind the teapot. 在那边，茶壶后面。
  • Five other cars were just behind him. 其他5辆汽车跟在他后面。
  • Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them. 突然，他们听到身后有声音。

SEE> while 当的时候, third 第三, put 放

ODE> At or to the far side of (something), typically so as to be hidden by it. – at the back of, at the rear of, beyond, on the other side of, on the far side of, on the further side of.

185. be·lief 信仰 ## 8

[bɪ’liːf]n.信念；信仰；相信

  • One of the things that fascinates us most about cats is the popular belief that they have nine lives. 其中一个最使我们感兴趣有关猫的事情就是一种通俗的信念有九条命。
  • The Swedes were the first to recognize that public officials like civil servants, police officers, health inspectors or tax-collectors can make mistakes or act over-zealously in the belief that they are serving the public. 是瑞典人首先认识到政府工作人员如文职人员，警官，卫生稽查员，税务，也会犯错误或行为过分热心的信念，他们所服务的公众。
  • They leave unwanted objects in drawers, cupboards and attics for years, in the belief that they may one day need just those very things. 他们留在抽屉，柜子和阁楼不需要的对象了多年，相信他们可能有一天需要的正好是那些东西。

SEE> con·tra·ry , faith 信仰, no·tion

ODE> An acceptance that something exists or is true, especially one without proof. – guess, speculation, surmise, fancy, notion, belief, suspicion, presumption, assumption, theory, hypothesis, postulation, supposition.

186. be·lieve 相信 ## 17

[bɪ’liːv]v.相信；认为

  • I believe that this house is for sale. 我相信，这房子是要出售。
  • Don’t believe her, Jim. 别信她，吉姆。
  • Jasper White is one of those rare people who believes in ancient myths. 怀特是少有的在谁相信古代神话之一。

SEE> say 说, cer·tain·ly 当然, in·deed 确实

ODE> Accept that (something) is true, especially without proof. – be convinced by, trust, have confidence in, consider honest, consider truthful.

187. bell 钟铃 ## 4

[bel]n.钟；铃；门铃；钟声；钟状物vt.敲钟；使象钟状地张开vi.使呈钟状；张开

  • I rang the bell and was not surprised to see that Hugh was still as fat as ever. 我按响了门铃，并不感到惊讶地看到，休仍象以前一样胖。
  • Looking at his watch, he saw that it was one o’clock, but the bell struck thirteen times before it stopped. 看他的手表，他看到才1点钟，可是那钟敲了13下才停。
  • ‘I’m trying to repair the bell,’ answered Bill. “我想把这口钟修好，”比尔回答说。

SEE> in·stance 例子, bak·er , ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A hollow metal object, typically in the shape of a deep inverted cup widening at the lip, that sounds a clear musical note when struck, especially by means of a clapper inside. – chime, gong, alarm.

188. be·long 属于 ## 5

[bɪ’lɔːŋ]vi.应归入；属于

  • This case doesn’t belong to me! 这种情况不属于我！
  • It has belonged to our family for a long time. 它已经属于我们的家庭很长一段时间。
  • They could be saved so much misery and expense if they chose to live in the city where they rightly belong. 它们可以保存这么多的痛苦和费用，如果他们愿意住在城市本来属于他们。

SEE> like·wise , more·o·ver 此外, fur·ther·more

ODE> Be the property of. – be owned by, be the property of, be the possession of, be in the ownership of, be held by, be at the disposal of, be in the hands of.

189. be·low 在下面 ## 8

[bɪ’loʊ]prep.低于；在 … 下面adv.在下面；向下

  • Though, at first, Byrd and his men were able to take a great many photographs of the mountains that lay below, they soon ran into serious trouble. 虽然开始时伯德和他的助手们拍下了飞机下面连绵群山的大量照片，但他们很快就陷入了困境。
  • A gust of wind swept the bed off the roof and sent it crashing into the courtyard below. 一阵风席卷床从屋顶上，并把它摔碎在下面的院子里。
  • I was almost there when a sarcastic voice below said, ‘I don’t think the windows need cleaning at this time of the night.’ 我几乎是在下面说，讽刺的声音，“我不认为窗户需要清洗，此时的夜晚。”

SEE> a·bove 在上方, lev·el 水平, drop 掉落

ODE> At a lower level or layer than. – lower than, under, inferior to, subordinate to, secondary to, subservient to.

190. be·neath 在下面 ## 3

[bɪ’niːθ]prep.在 … 之下；被…覆盖；低于…；不值得adv.在下方；在底下

  • If there had not been a hard layer of rock beneath the soil, they would have completed the job in a few hours. 如果不曾有过的土壤下面的岩石的坚硬层，他们已经完成了几个小时的工作。
  • The city was even equipped with a drainage system, for a great many clay pipes were found beneath the narrow streets. 在这座城市甚至还敷设了排水系统，为一个伟大的许多陶土制的管道被发现在狭窄的街道下面。
  • As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow, her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze, and the red and gold of her superstructure ablaze with colour, she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before. 当她从她的漂泊与搅动泡沫水炮烟的云下她的弓，她彩旗飘扬，锦旗挥舞，帆填充在微风中，红色和她的金上层建筑色闪亮出现，她提出了更加宏伟的场面比斯德哥尔摩人从未见过之前。

SEE> un·der·neath 下, be·side 在旁边, in·side 内

ODE> Extending or directly underneath. – under, underneath, below, at the foot of, at the bottom of.

191. ben·e·fit 益处 ## 5

[’benɪfɪt]n.利益；津贴；义演；保险金；借助vt.有益于；得益

  • Only two stray dogs benefited from all this confusion, for they greedily devoured what was left of the cake. 只有两只野狗从这一片混乱中得到好处，它们贪婪地吃掉了剩下的蛋糕。
  • There are also other benefits. 也有其他好处。
  • Carlyle was entirely ignorant of what the bottle in his pocket contained, of the nature of the illness from which his friend was suffering, and of what had previously been wrong with his wife, but a medicine that had worked so well in one form of illness would surely be of equal benefit in another, and comforted by the thought of the help he was bringing to his friend, he hastened to Henry Taylor’s house. 卡莱尔不知道什么样的瓶子在他的口袋里所含知道他的朋友得的是什么病的性质，以及什么以前一直错误与他的妻子，但已在疾病的一种形式运作得非常好药品肯定是对另利益，并通过帮助下，他把他的朋友的想法安慰，于是急急忙忙来到了亨利的房子。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, in·deed 确实, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> An advantage or profit gained from something. – good, sake, interest, welfare, well-being, satisfaction, enjoyment, advantage, comfort, ease, convenience.

192. be·side 在旁边 ## 7

[bɪ’saɪd]prep.在 … 旁边；与 … 相比；和… 无关

  • It is beside a park. 它位于公园的旁边。
  • Who’s that beside her? 谁是她旁边的那个？
  • I had left it on a chair beside the door and now it wasn’t there! 我曾把它放在门边的椅子上，现在它不存在！

SEE> a·long·side 在旁边, un·der·neath 下, near·by 附近

ODE> At the side of; next to. – alongside, by the side of, at the side of, next to, parallel to, abreast of, at someone’s elbow, with, by.

193. best 最好 ## 17

[best]adj.最好的adv.最；最好地n.最好的人(或物)v.优于；打败

  • Which seasons do you like best? 哪些季节你最喜欢？
  • You always want the best, but we can’t afford it. 你总是要买最好的，但我们不能负担得起。
  • If we win a lot of money we’ll travel round the world and we’ll stay at the best hotels. 如果我们赢了很多钱，我们周游世界，我们将留在最好的酒店。

SEE> well 好, bet·ter 更好, good 好

ODE> Of the most excellent or desirable type or quality. – finest, greatest, top, foremost, leading, pre-eminent, premier, prime, first, chief, principal, supreme, of the highest quality, superlative, unrivalled, second to none, without equal, nonpareil, unsurpassed, unsurpassable, peerless, matchless, unparalleled, unbeaten, unbeatable, unexcelled, optimum, optimal, ultimate, surpassing, incomparable, ideal, perfect.

194. bet·ter 更好 ## 12

[’betər]adj.更好的；较好的adv.更好地v.使更好；改善n.更好者；更优者；下赌注者形容词good和副词well的比较级形式

  • Better. 更好。
  • You are better now, but you mustn’t get up yet. 你现在好些了，但你不能起床。
  • We had better go back to the station now, Ken. 我们最好现在回到车站，肯。

SEE> good 好, well 好, e·ven 甚至

ODE> More desirable, satisfactory, or effective. – superior, finer, of higher quality, greater, in a different class, one step ahead.

[bɪ’twiːn]prep.在 … 之间adv.在中间

  • It is between two hills. 这是两座小山之间。
  • It obviously could not tell the difference between Indian music and jazz! 显然，它分辨不出印度音乐和爵士乐的区别！
  • I picked up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice of Helen Bates. 我用两个沾满面糊的手指拿起听筒，当我听出是海伦·贝茨的声音感到沮丧。

SEE> both 两者, which 哪一个, two 二

196. be·yond 超出 ## 11

[bɪ’jɑːnd]prep.超出；远于；除 … 之外；超出…之外adv.在更远处；另外n.远处；来世

  • We might say that justice has been done when a man’s innocence or guilt has been proved beyond doubt. 我们可以说，当一个人的无罪或有罪已被证明毫无疑问正义得到了伸张。
  • Why people are prepared to tolerate a four-hour journey each day for the dubious privilege of living in the country is beyond me. 人们为什么情愿每天忍受四个小时的旅程居住在该国的可疑特权是超越我。
  • Past experience has taught us that certain accomplishments are beyond attainment. 过去的经验告诉我们有些事是办不到的。

SEE> in·deed 确实, far 远, fact 事实

ODE> At or to the further side of. – on the far side of, on the farther side of, on the other side of, further on than, behind, past, after.

197. bi·cy·cle 自行车 ## 7

[’baɪsɪkl]n.自行车vi.骑自行车

  • It was his job to repair bicycles and at that time he used to work fourteen hours a day. 这是他的工作是修理自行车，当时他曾经每天工作14个小时。

  • How long had the police taken to find his bicycle? 多久采取了警察找到他的自行车吗？

199. bill 账单 ## 2

[bɪl]n.帐单；钞票；清单；议案；海报；节目单；锚钩；鸟喙；帽舌v.开帐单；把 … 列成表；用海报宣传；(鸟嘴)接触；爱抚Billn.比尔(男子名)

  • ‘Yes, thank you,’ I answered, ’but I can’t pay the bill. “是的，谢谢你，”我回答，“但我不能埋单。
  • This modern faith in medicines is proved by the fact that the annual drug bill of the Health Services is mounting to astronomical figures and shows no signs at present of ceasing to rise. 这现代人对药物是由卫生部门的年度药费在停止上涨的目前安装到天文数字，且没有迹象事实证明。

  • The Hubble telescope was launched into space by NASA on April 20, 1990 at a cost of over a billion dollars. 哈勃望远镜于超过十亿美元的价格于1990年4月20日发射升空的美国宇航局。
  • Only the Earth provides ideal conditions, and even here it has taken more than four billion years for plant and animal life to evolve. 只有地球提供理想的条件，而即使在这里已经超过四十亿年的植物和动物的进化。

202. birth 出生 ## 5

[bɜːrθ]n.分娩；出生；诞生；血统v.分娩；产生adj.有血亲关系的

  • The day after the birth of the five children, an aeroplane arrived in Aberdeen bringing sixty reporters and photographers. 五胞胎出生后的第二天，一架飞机飞抵香港仔，随机带来60名记者与摄影师。
  • In that first glorious hour, the mighty Vasa, which was intended to rule the Baltic, sank with all flags flying – in the harbour of her birth. 在这第一个辉煌时刻，强大的瓦萨，其目的是统治波罗的海，沉没飞行的所有标志 - 在她诞生的港口。
  • So much is certain: that we would have doctors and preachers, lawyers and defendants, marriages and births – but our spiritual outlook would be different. 所以是可以肯定的：虽然我们还会有医生和牧师，律师和被告，婚姻和生育 - 但我们的精神面貌将是不同的。

  • In a heat wave we choose a midnight birthday party and that is the most exciting of all. 天气炎热时，我们便选择在半夜生日派对，这是最令人激动的。

204. bis·cuit 饼干 ## 13

205. bit 一点点 ## 9

[bɪt]n.少量；小块；片刻；马嚼子；（烟头等的）咬嘴；钻头；钥匙齿；一角二分半钱；[计]比特v.给（马等）上嚼口；约束动词bite的过去式和过去分词

  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。
  • Shops cater for the do-it-yourself craze not only by running special advisory services for novices, but by offering consumers bits and pieces which they can assemble at home. 商店为了迎合做自己动手热潮不仅运行新手专门的咨询服务，而且为消费者提供的点点滴滴，他们可以在家里组装。
  • I was not surprised to find that the machine still refused to work after I had reassembled it, for the simple reason that I was left with several curiously shaped bits of metal which did not seem to fit anywhere. 我并不感到惊讶地发现，机器仍然拒绝工作，我已经装完后，原因很简单，我留下了金属几个形状奇特位，似乎并不适合任何地方。

ODE> A small piece, part, or quantity of something. – small portion, small piece, piece, portion, segment, section, part.

206. bite 咬 ## 3

[baɪt]v.咬；叮；蜇n.咬；一口；(被咬的)伤痕

  • They sting or bite without provocation; they fly uninvited into our rooms on summer nights, or beat against our lighted windows. 他们又叮又咬不挑衅;它们未经邀请便飞到我们的房间在夏天夜晚，或者对着露出亮光的窗户。
  • Poison to a snake is merely a luxury; it enables it to get its food with very little effort, no more effort than one bite. 毒液对蛇仅仅是一种奢侈;这使得它能够获得它的食物用很少的努力，轻咬一口没有更多的努力。
  • Cats, for instance, would be greatly helped; no running fights with large, fierce rats or tussles with grown rabbits – just a bite and no more effort needed. 猫，例如，将极大的帮助;只要咬一口，就不必再努力 - 没有与大又凶的老鼠角力与成年兔运行打架。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, for·tu·nate·ly , ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> (of a person or animal) use the teeth to cut into something. – sink one’s teeth into, chew, munch, crunch, champ, tear at, masticate, eat.

[’bɪtərli]adv.残酷地；痛苦地

  • Almost immediately he began to complain about the weather, for even though it was still summer, it rained continually and it was often bitterly cold. 但紧接着他就开始抱怨那里的天气了。因为即使那时仍为夏季，它不断地下雨，而且常常冷得厉害。
  • The two men quarrelled bitterly and it was clear that the argument could only be settled by a fight. 这两人争吵不休，它很清楚，论据只能通过战斗来解决。

ODE> In an angry, hurt, or resentful way. –

208. black 黑色 ## 16

  • I like black coffee. 我喜欢黑咖啡。
  • Black. 黑色。

209. blame 责怪 ## 2

[bleɪm]vt.责备；把 … 归咎于n.责备；过失

  • It is all too easy to blame the railway authorities when something does go wrong. 这是太容易的时候确实存在错误归咎于铁路部门。
  • But can we blame those who looked and failed to see what Galileo saw, if we remember that to use a telescope at the limit of its powers calls for long experience and intimate familiarity with one’s instrument? 但是，我们能责怪那些谁看了一下，没有看到什么伽利略所看到的，如果我们记得在长期的经验和熟悉程度的仪器其权力的呼叫限制使用望远镜？

210. blank 空白的 ## 3

  • It was simply a blank sheet of paper. 它简单地的一张白纸。
  • The noble stared at the blank sheet of paper for a few seconds. 在纸几秒钟的白纸贵族盯着。
  • He expected the assistant to look at him in blank astonishment. 他预计助手看着瞠目结舌茫然。

ODE> (of a surface or background) unrelieved by decorative or other features; bare, empty, or plain. – empty, unfilled, unmarked, unwritten on, unused, clear, free, bare, clean, plain, spotless, white.

211. block 石块 ## 5

[blɑːk]n.街区；木块；石块；大楼；一组；阻塞(物)；障碍(物)v.阻塞

  • Once he landed on the roof of a block of flats and on another occasion, he landed in a deserted car park. 一次，他降落在单位，并在另一个场合块的屋顶，降落在了一个废弃的停车场上。
  • The next morning, he found that the doors had been blocked by chairs and the furniture had been moved. 第二天早上，他发现门都被椅子堵上了，家具也被挪动过。
  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, in·stance 例子, move 移动

ODE> A large solid piece of hard material, especially rock, stone, or wood, typically with flat surfaces on each side. – chunk, hunk, brick, slab, lump, piece.

212. blood 血液 ## 5

[blʌd]n.血；血统；仇恨vt.流血

  • One poison acts on the nerves, the other on the blood. 一个毒作用于神经，另对血液。
  • Vipers (adders) and rattlesnakes manufacture the blood poison, which is known as haemolytic. 蝰蛇（蝮蛇）和响尾蛇产生血液毒素，这被称为溶血。
  • Both poisons are unpleasant, but by far the more unpleasant is the blood poison. 这两种毒素都是不愉快的，但到目前为止，更多的不愉快是血毒。

SEE> heart 心脏, ac·tu·al·ly 其实, sam·ple 样品

ODE> The red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and other vertebrate animals, carrying oxygen to and carbon dioxide from the tissues of the body. – gore, lifeblood, vital fluid.

213. blow 吹 ## 2

[bloʊ]n.打击；殴打；吹v.吹；风吹；擤(鼻子)；(保险丝)熔断；浪费(机会)

  • He slept very well for the first two nights, but on the third night, a storm blew up. 他睡得非常好。前两个晚上，但在第三天晚上，起了风暴。
  • As the man came near, the prisoner knocked him to the ground with a sharp blow. 当人走近时，战俘把他撞倒在地，猛烈的冲击。

SEE> setback , wake 唤醒, bring 带来

ODE> (of wind) move creating an air current. – gust, puff, flurry, blast, roar, bluster, rush, storm.

214. blue 蓝色 ## 15

[bluː]adj.蓝色的；忧郁的；沮丧的；色情的n.蓝色

  • My shirt’s blue. 我的衬衫是蓝色的。
  • The cooker is blue. 电磁炉是蓝色的。
  • It’s a small blue case and it’s got a zip. 这是一个蓝色的小箱子，它是有拉链。

SEE> red 红色, bright 明亮的, pur·ple 紫色

ODE> Of a colour intermediate between green and violet, as of the sky or sea on a sunny day. – sky blue, azure, cobalt, cobalt blue, sapphire, cerulean, navy, navy blue, saxe, saxe blue, Oxford blue, Cambridge blue, ultramarine, lapis lazuli, indigo, aquamarine, turquoise, teal, teal blue, cyan, of the colour of the sky, of the colour of the sea.

215. board 木板 ## 8

[bɔːrd]n.木板；布告板；董事会；船舷或机舱；伙食；舞台v.登(飞机、车、船等)；接受乘客；有偿提供食宿；搭伙；用木板覆盖

  • Everybody on board was worried and we were curious to find out what had happened. 飞机上的人都很着急，大家都急于想知道出了什么事。
  • Later we learnt that there was a very important person on board. 后来我们才得知，飞机上坐了一位非常重要的人物。
  • Mrs. Richards realized that it must be the man from the Electricity Board who had come to read the metre. 理查兹夫人这才想到一定是供电局的人谁曾来查电表。

SEE> ex·ec·u·tive 行政人员, ad·di·tion 加, al·so 也

ODE> A long, thin, flat piece of wood or other hard material, used for floors or other building purposes. – plank, beam, panel, slat, batten, timber, length of timber, piece of wood, lath.

216. boat 船 ## 27

[boʊt]n.船；船型物v.划船；放于船上；乘船

  • There are some boats on the river. 有河上的几艘船。
  • He will be in his small boat, Topsail. 他将他的小船，托波赛尔号。
  • Topsail is a famous little boat. 桅帆是有名的小艇。

SEE> ship 船, yacht , sail·ing 帆船

ODE> A small vessel for travelling over water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine. – vessel, craft, watercraft, ship.

217. bod·y 身体 ## 8

[’bɑːdi]n.身体；主体；正文；主要部分；尸体；躯体；团体v.赋…以形体

  • The body of one statue was found among remains dating from the fifteenth century B.C. 一尊雕像，她的躯体是在公元前15世纪的历史文物中发现公元前
  • Speculations about its nature have been going on for literally thousands of years, and one odd finding that makes the problem puzzling is that it looks very much as if sleeping is not simply a matter of giving the body a rest. 关于它的性质的猜测已经持续了成千上万的年，一个奇怪的发现，使得百思不得其解的问题是，它看起来非常仿佛睡也不只是为了使身体得到休息。
  • The body’s tissues are self-repairing and self-restoring to a degree, and function best when more or less continuously active. 人体的组织是自我修复和自我恢复到一定程度，和功能最好的时候，或多或少地连续活动。

SEE> head 头, found 建立, which 哪一个

ODE> The physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or an animal. – anatomy, figure, frame, form, shape, build, physique, framework, skeleton, bones, flesh and bones.

218. boil 沸腾 ## 5

[bɔɪl]v.沸腾；煮沸；激动n.煮沸；翻滚；疖

  • The kettle’s boiling! 水壶的沸腾！
  • Boiling is always a good way of treating water. 烧开一直是水处理的一种好办法。
  • Some hotels supply boiled water on request and this can be used for drinking, or for brushing teeth. 一些酒店供应的要求白开水，这可用于饮用和刷牙。

SEE> boil·ing , stir 搅拌, cook 烹饪

ODE> (with reference to a liquid) reach or cause to reach the temperature at which it bubbles and turns to vapour. – simmer, bubble, seethe, heat, cook, stew.

219. bom·b 炸弹 ## 5

[bɑːm]n.炸弹vt.轰炸；投弹于vi.投弹；失败

  • The police had been told that a bomb had been planted on the plane. 警察已被告知，一枚炸弹已被放置在飞机上。
  • The hospital had been bombed and Hans had made his way back into Western Germany on foot. 医院遭到轰炸，汉斯做了他的徒步的方式回到了西德。
  • Hans returned to his family home, but the house had been bombed and no one in the neighbourhood knew what had become of the inhabitants. 汉斯回到了自己的家，但房子已被炸毁，没有人在附近知道发生了什么成为居民。

SEE> bombing , ex·plo·sion 爆炸, ex·plo·sive

ODE> A container filled with explosive or incendiary material, designed to explode on impact or when detonated by a timing, proximity, or remote-control device. – explosive, incendiary device, incendiary, device.

220. bone 骨头 ## 4

[boʊn]n.骨骼；骨；核心vt.除去骨头；往衣服里加撑条；磨光表面vi.努力学习adv.非常地；极其地

  • What is the importance of the dots, lines, and symbols engraved on stone, bones and ivory? 什么是点，线，并刻在石头，骨头和象牙符号的重要性？
  • Historians have long been puzzled by dots, lines and symbols which have been engraved on walls, bones, and the ivory tusks of mammoths. 历史学家们长久以来已被刻在墙壁上，骨头，和猛犸象的象牙点，线和符号感到困惑不解。
  • Stone does not decay, and so the tools of long ago have remained when even the bones of the men who made them have disappeared without trace. 石头不会腐烂，所以很久以前的工具时，是谁使他们的人连骨头已经消失得无影无踪一直保持。

SEE> tis·sue , skull , bro·ken 破碎的

ODE> Any of the pieces of hard whitish tissue making up the skeleton in humans and other vertebrates. – body, figure, form, shape, physique, build, size, proportions.

222. boot 靴子 ## 3

  • I never catch anything – not even old boots. 我从来不乘任何东西 - 甚至没有旧靴子。
  • A little later, a man came along with a biscuit which occupied the whole boot of his car. 不一会儿，一个男子也把汽车的行李箱饼干走过来。

223. bor·row 借 ## 4

[’bɑːroʊ]v.借；借鉴；抄袭

  • He gets a good salary, but he always borrows money from his friends and never pays it back. 他的薪水很高，但他却总是向朋友借钱，并且从来不还。
  • He has never borrowed money from me. 他从未向我借过钱。
  • ‘I have never borrowed any money from you,’ Tony said, ‘so now you can pay for my dinner!’ “我从来没有借过钱，从你的，”托尼说道，“所以现在你可以替我付饭钱了！”

SEE> lend 借, re·pay , buy 买

ODE> Take and use (something belonging to someone else) with the intention of returning it. – take, take for oneself, help oneself to, use as one’s own, abscond with, carry off, appropriate, commandeer, abstract.

  • The old lady thought he was a fussy creature, but since the porter agreed with him, she rang up her daughter and asked for her help in what she described as a little spot of bother. 老太太以为他是个挑剔的动物，但既然同意他的门房，她又响了起来她的女儿和她描述为麻烦的一个小点问她的帮助。

231. brain 大脑 ## 5

[breɪn]n.脑；智力；智者；控制中心vt.打 … 的脑袋

  • Are you doing the football pools, Brain? 你做足球池，脑？
  • If it is not a question of resting the body, then perhaps it is the brain that needs resting? 如果不是休息身体的问题，那么也许是大脑需要休息吗？
  • First the electroencephalograph (which is simply a device for recording the electrical activity of the brain by attaching electrodes to the scalp) shows that while there is a change in the pattern of activity during sleep, there is no evidence that the total amount of activity is any less. 第一点，脑电图（这是简单地对电极接到头皮记录大脑电活动的装置）显示，虽然有在睡眠期间活动的图案的变化，没有证据表明活性的总量是任何减少。

SEE> heart 心脏, tis·sue , mind 心神

ODE> An organ of soft nervous tissue contained in the skull of vertebrates, functioning as the coordinating centre of sensation and intellectual and nervous activity. – cerebrum, cerebral matter.

  • Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine. 因为有一般都很肮脏和跳蚤深重例如旅馆;食物是当地的干酪和面包通常存放了一年的时候，都冲下来的粗酒。

233. break 打破 ## 15

[breɪk]v.打碎；折断；违背；解决；中断；透露；变弱；锐减；结束n.破裂；休息；中断；急冲；好运

  • She struck the keys too hard and two of the strings were broken. 她在击琴键时用力过猛两根琴弦被打破。
  • In the struggle, the strap broke and, with the bag in their possession, both men started running through the trees. 在斗争中，带子断了，在他们身上的袋子，两人开始跑进了树林。
  • Many of the cars broke down on the course and some drivers spent more time under their cars than in them! 许多汽车抛锚在球场上，而有些驾驶员他们的汽车下花更多的时间比他们！

ODE> Separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain. – shatter, smash, smash to smithereens, crack, snap, fracture, fragment, splinter.

  • ‘But I’m still having breakfast,’ I said. “但我还在吃早饭，”我说。
  • ‘I’m having breakfast,’ I repeated. “我正在吃早饭，”我又说了一遍。

235. breath 呼吸 ## 3

[breθ]n.呼吸；气息

  • She was soon out of breath, but she continued to run. 她很快就气喘吁吁了，但她还是继续运行。
  • At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles, children become expert at holding their breath under water even before they can walk. 在一个特别的游泳池在洛杉矶，孩子成为下他们能走甚至在水下屏住呼吸了专家。
  • Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once. 有些孩子能够跑完游泳池的全长而不用露出水面换气一次。

SEE> breathe 呼吸, when·ev·er 每当, mind 心神

ODE> The air taken into or expelled from the lungs. – wind.

  • ‘Rest’, in terms of muscle relaxation and so on, can be achieved by a brief period lying, or even sitting down. “休息”，使肌肉得到放松的条件等，可以通过稍微躺一躺，甚至坐一坐来实现的。

  • Last year in another play, she had to wear short socks and a bright, orange-coloured dress. 去年在另一出戏里，她不得不穿短袜和一件鲜艳的橘红色的衣服。
  • It had a head like a horse, big blue eyes, shining silver skin, and a bright red tail. 它有一个头似马，蓝色的大眼睛，闪闪发光的银色皮肤，还有一条鲜红色的尾巴。

241. bro·ken 破碎的 ## 5

[’broʊkən]adj.弄坏的；破碎的动词break的过去分词.

  • Forest fires are often caused by broken glass or by cigarette ends which people carelessly throw away. 森林火灾时常由破碎的玻璃或烟头人们随手扔掉造成的。
  • Yesterday the firemen examined the ground carefully, but were not able to find any broken glass. 昨天，消防队员仔细查看了地面，但未能找到任何碎玻璃。
  • One cat, Sabrina, fell 32 storeys, yet only suffered from a broken tooth. 一只猫，萨布丽娜，下跌32层高，但只有从断齿遭遇。

SEE> a·part 分开, break 打破, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> Having been broken. – smashed, shattered, burst, fragmented, splintered, shivered, crushed, snapped, rent, torn, ruptured, separated, severed, in bits, in pieces.

[’brʌðər]n.兄弟；教友；同胞；老兄

  • I have just received a letter from my brother, Tim. 我刚刚收到一封来自我的兄弟，蒂姆。
  • My brother has never been abroad before, so he is finding this trip very exciting. 我弟弟以前从未出过国，因此，他觉得这次旅行非常激动人心。
  • He then asked me how my brother was and whether I liked my new job in London. 然后，他又问我的兄弟近来如何，问我是否喜欢伦敦的新工作。

243. brown 棕色 ## 3

[braʊn]adj.棕色的；褐色的n.褐色；棕色v.（使）变褐色Brown.n.布朗(姓氏)

  • Our cases are brown. 我们的箱子是棕色的。
  • Here you can see two workers who, between them, have just finished cutting three cartloads of golden brown macaroni stalks. 在这里，你可以看到谁，他们之间，刚刚完成切割金黄色的通心粉秸了3台车两名工人。
  • Among these I would list string and brown paper, kept by thrifty people when a parcel has been opened, to save buying these two requisites. 其中我想举出线绳和包装纸为例，当包裹已经被打开节俭起来，省得日后购买这两个必要条件。

244. build 建造 ## 24

[bɪld]v.建造；开发；创建；逐渐增强n.体格；身材

  • He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool. 他提出了整洁的小路，并在池塘上架起木桥。
  • The airport was built years ago, but for some reason it could not be used then. 机场是许多年前建的，但由于某种原因不能再使用。
  • As a great many people will be visiting the country, the government will be building new hotels, an immense stadium, and a new Olympic-standard swimming pool. 作为一个伟大的很多人将访问的国家，政府准备建造一些新的饭店，一个大型体育场和一个新的奥运会标准游泳池。

SEE> con·struct 建造, de·vel·op 开发, cre·ate 创造

ODE> Construct (something) by putting parts or material together. – construct, erect, put up, assemble, set up, raise.

245. build·ing 建筑 ## 14

[’bɪldɪŋ]n.建筑物

  • This is the school building. 这是学校大楼。
  • Some children are coming out of the building. 一些孩子正从大楼出来。
  • When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield. 当飞机到达时，一些侦探在主楼内等待而其他人则守候在停机坪上。

SEE> con·struc·tion 建造, build 建造, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory. – structure, construction, edifice, erection, pile.

246. burn 烧伤 ## 5

[bɜːrn]v.燃烧；烧着；烧毁；灼伤；急于n.烧伤；燃烧

  • If the Houses of Parliament had not been burned down in 1834, the great clock would never have been erected. 如果国会大厦并没有在1834年被烧毁，这座大钟永远也不会建造。
  • It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936. 它仍然是最有名的建筑之一，在世界上，直到它在1936年被焚毁。
  • In times of peace, when business was bad, Hawkwood and his men would march into a city-state and, after burning down a few farms, would offer to go away if protection money was paid to them. 在和平时期，当生意萧条时，霍克伍德和他的手下将步入一个城邦，纵火烧毁一两个农场后，将提供走开，如果保护金，支付给他们。

SEE> burn·ing , pre·sum·a·bly 想必, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> (of a fire) flame or glow while consuming a material such as coal or wood. – be on fire, be alight, be ablaze, blaze, go up, go up in smoke, be in flames, be aflame.

247. burst 爆裂 ## 4

[bɜːrst]n.爆发；破裂；阵v.爆裂；迸发；冲；闯

  • Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run. 尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，他在控制汽车，因为轮胎在第一次运行时突发很大的困难。
  • As soon as he opened his mouth, everyone burst out laughing. 只要他一开口说话，人们便哄堂大笑起来。
  • He showed that the average individual’s sleep cycle is punctuated with peculiar bursts of eye-movements, some drifting and slow, others jerky and rapid. 他指出，平常人的睡眠周期中不时用眼睛运动，有的飘忽而缓慢，有的急剧而快速的阵阵奇特。

SEE> sud·den·ly 突然地, when 什么时候, sud·den 突然的

ODE> Break open or apart suddenly and violently, especially as a result of an impact or internal pressure. – split open, burst open, break open, tear open, rupture, crack, fracture, fragment, shatter, shiver, fly open.

248. bur·y 埋葬 ## 4

[’beri]vt.埋葬；隐匿；专心致志；抛弃

  • A new machine called ‘The Revealer’ has been invented and it has been used to detect gold which has been buried in the ground. 一种叫“探宝器”的新机器已经发明，它已被用于检测已埋在地下的黄金。
  • The pirates would often bury gold in the cave and then fail to collect it. 海盗们过去常把金子埋藏在那个洞里，可后来却没能取走。
  • Armed with the new machine, a search party went into the cave hoping to find buried treasure. 随着新机的武装，搜索队进入了这个岩洞，希望找到埋藏的宝藏。

SEE> like·wise , last·ly , pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> Put or hide underground. – subterranean, subterrestrial, below ground, buried, sunken, lower-level, basement.

249. bus 公共汽车 ## 20

[bʌs]n.公共汽车n.总线；信息通路vt.用公共汽车运输vi.乘公共汽车

  • Suddenly, she saw a man near a bus stop. 突然，她看到附近的一个公共汽车站一个人。
  • You must get off the bus. 你必须下车。
  • A short while ago, however, he became a bus driver and he has not regretted it. 前一阵子，但是，他成为一名公交车司机，他不后悔。

SEE> train 火车, tax·i 出租车, truck 卡车

ODE> A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a fare. – bus, minibus, van.

250. bush 灌木 ## 3

[bʊʃ]n.灌木丛；矮树v.丛生；(以灌木)标记、保护、支撑Bush.n.布什(姓氏)

  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。
  • Paw prints were seen in a number of places and puma fur was found clinging to bushes. 掌印被认为在许多地方和美洲狮的皮毛被发现抱住了灌木丛。
  • What a relief it was when the boulders suddenly disappeared, giving way to a stretch of plain where the only obstacles were clumps of bushes. 什么救济是突然大石块不见了，让位给平淡的舒展，唯一的障碍是灌木丛的团块。

SEE> ad·min·is·tra·tion , dole , fact 事实

ODE> A shrub or clump of shrubs with stems of moderate length. – shrub, woody plant.

251. busi·ness 商业 ## 25

[’bɪznəs]n.商业；事务；生意

  • ‘It’s none of your business,’ the young man said rudely. “这不关你的事，”那男的毫不客气地说。
  • After I had sat down, he said that business was very bad. 我坐下后，他说生意非常不景气。
  • Before he retired, Frank was the head of a very large business company, but as a boy he used to work in a small shop. 他在退休前，弗兰克是一家非常大的商业公司的负责人，但作为一个男孩，他曾经工作在一个小商店。

SEE> in·dus·try 行业, cor·po·rate , well 好

ODE> A person’s regular occupation, profession, or trade. – work, line of work, line, occupation, profession, career, employment, job, day job, position, pursuit, vocation, calling, field, sphere, walk of life, trade, craft.

252. busi·ness·man 商人 ## 4

[’bɪznəsmæn]n.商人

  • Captain Fawcett has just refused a strange request from a businessman. 弗西特机长刚刚拒绝了一位商人的奇怪要求。
  • Several people complained of ‘cat-like noises’ at night and a businessman on a fishing trip saw the puma up a tree. 几个人在晚上抱怨“猫一样的叫声”，并在一位商人去钓鱼看见那只美洲狮在树上。
  • He was a shrewd and wealthy businessman, but most people in the town hardly knew anything about this side of his life. 他是个精明能干，有钱的商人，但大多数人在镇几乎不知道关于他的生活的这一面什么。

SEE> bank·er , pol·i·ti·cian 政治家, wealth·y

ODE> A man who works in commerce, especially at executive level. –

253. bus·y 忙碌的 ## 12

[’bɪzi]adj.忙的；繁忙的；热闹的；(电话)占线的vt.使忙于

  • They aren’t very busy! 他们不是很忙吧！
  • The dentist is very busy at the moment. 牙科医生这会儿很忙。
  • Her eyes were fixed on her plate and in a short time, she was busy eating. 她的眼睛盯着自己的盘子，并在很短的时间，她就忙着吃起来。

SEE> crowd·ed 挤, be·sides , work·ing 工作

ODE> Having a great deal to do. – occupied, occupied in, engaged in, involved in, employed in, working at, labouring at, toiling at, slaving at, hard at work, hard at work on, wrapped up, wrapped up in, wrapped up with.

254. but 但是 ## 380

[bət]conj.但是prep.除 … 以外adv.仅仅；只pron.无不

  • There are some clouds in the sky, but the sun is shining. 还有在天空中飘着几朵云，但阳光灿烂。
  • I can see the teapot, but I can’t see the tea. 我可以看到茶壶，但我看不到茶。
  • I like lamb, but my husband doesn’t. 我喜欢羔羊肉，但我丈夫不喜欢。

SEE> though 虽然, al·though 虽然, how·ev·er 然而

ODE> Used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned. – yet.

255. but·ter 黄油 ## 3

[’bʌtər]n.黄油；奶油vt.涂黄油；奉承

  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。
  • In a short time I was busy mixing butter and flour and my hands were soon covered with sticky pastry. 在很短的时间，我就忙着调拌黄油和面粉，我的手很快就沾满面粉。
  • A crowd of people gathered round him and a lady rubbed his arm with soap and butter, but George was firmly stuck. 一大群人围拢过来，一位女士胳膊上抹了肥皂，黄油，但乔治是牢牢卡住。

SEE> pea·nut , choc·o·late 巧克力, cheese 奶酪

ODE> A pale yellow edible fatty substance made by churning cream and used as a spread or in cooking. – fat, oil, cooking oil, animal fat.

256. buy 买 ## 47

[baɪ]vt.购买；买；获得；收买；相信vi.买n.购买；便宜货

  • Does the lady buy any chalk? 这位女士有没有买任何粉笔？
  • But my sister bought this pair last month. 但是，我姐姐上个月买到了这样的一双。
  • Did she buy them here? 难道她在这里购买呢？

SEE> sell 卖, pur·chase 购买, ac·quire 获得

ODE> Obtain in exchange for payment. – purchase, make a purchase of, make the purchase of, acquire, obtain, get, pick up, snap up.

257. by 由 ## 277

[baɪ]prep.靠近；通过；被；经由；不迟于adv.经过；在旁边；靠近

  • The children go to school by car every day, but today, they are going to school on foot. 孩子们每天都去学校的车程，但今天，他们正步行上学。
  • What does she mean by ‘change’ in the last sentence? 什么是她在最后一句“变”是什么意思？
  • Does Susan have tea by herself? 苏珊是一个人喝茶吗？

SEE> be·ing , be 是, when 什么时候

ODE> Identifying the agent performing an action. – by means of, by use of, by virtue of, on account of, as a result of, as a consequence of, owing to, by reason of, on grounds of, on the strength of, due to, thanks to, by, via.

258. ca·ble 电缆 ## 4

[’keɪbl]n.电缆；缆；索；电报v.发电报；(通过电缆)交流；(用缆绳)固定

  • Two great towers support four huge cables. 两座巨塔支撑着四个巨大的电缆。
  • They support the cables from which the bridge has been suspended. 它们支撑着桥已经暂停的电缆。
  • Each of the four cables contains 26,108 lengths of wire. 四个电缆导线包含的26108个长度。

SEE> net·work 网络, TV 电视, tel·e·vi·sion 电视

ODE> A thick rope of wire or hemp used for construction, mooring ships, and towing vehicles. – rope, cord, line, guy, piece of cordage.

259. cake 蛋糕 ## 4

[keɪk]n.蛋糕；块状物

  • His wife was sitting beside him holding a large cake. 他的妻子正坐在他身边，手里托着块大蛋糕。
  • As she was thrown forward, the cake went right through the windscreen and landed on the road. 当她往前一冲，蛋糕去的权利，通过挡风玻璃，落在马路上。
  • Seeing a cake flying through the air, a lorry driver who was drawing up alongside the car, pulled up all of a sudden. 看见一块蛋糕在空中飞行，一名卡车司机谁正在起草旁边的车，突然拉升所有的。

SEE> choc·o·late 巧克力, des·sert , pie

ODE> An item of soft sweet food made from a mixture of flour, fat, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients, baked and sometimes iced or decorated. – gateau, kuchen.

260. cal·cu·late 计算 ## 3

[’kælkjuleɪt]v.计算；估计；考虑；推测；计划；指望

  • A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom, and by measuring the time interval between the taps and the receipt of the echoes, the depth of the sea at that point can be calculated. 通过敲击一个船体发出的声音将被反射从海底，并通过测量抽头和接收回波之间的时间间隔，海的在该点的深度可以计算出来。
  • Precisely at noon an infinitely powerful computer takes all the data and calculates what will happen at each point at 12.01, then 12.02, then 12.03… 在正午时分，一个功能巨大的计算机搜集了所有的数据，并计算在每一个点发生在12.01，然后12.02，然后12.03什么？
  • This may sound fantastic, but it is easily calculated. 这听起来令人难以置信，但却很容易计算出来。

SEE> cal·cu·la·tion 计算, pre·cise·ly 恰好地, ac·cu·rate·ly 准确

ODE> Determine (the amount or number of something) mathematically. – compute, work out, reckon, figure, enumerate, determine, evaluate, quantify, assess, cost, put a figure on.

261. call 呼叫 ## 45

[kɔːl]vt.呼叫；打电话；把 …称为n.打电话；访问；召唤；呼叫；把 … 看作vi.呼叫；(短暂的)拜访

  • He looks ill. We must call the doctor. 他觉得不舒服。我们得去请医生。
  • Who called out to the thieves in the dark? 谁大声在黑暗盗贼？
  • someone called. 有人叫。

SEE> ask 问, come 来, tell 告诉

ODE> Give (a baby or animal) a specified name. – name.

262. calm 平静 ## 3

[kɑːm]adj.平静的；冷静的v.(使)平静；(使)镇静n.镇定；平静；平稳

  • After reading an article entitled ‘Cigarette Smoking and Your Health’ I lit a cigarette to calm my nerves. 阅读一篇文章，题为“吸烟与健康”后，我点了一支烟，镇静一下紧张情绪。
  • While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to keep calm and to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. 在我们等待降落时，一位空中乘务员告诉我们要保持镇静，因为它感动了下来静静地尽快离开飞机。
  • You can stretch your legs on the spacious decks, play games, meet interesting people and enjoy good food – always assuming, of course, that the sea is calm. 您可以舒展上宽敞的甲板，玩游戏，满足有趣的人你的双腿，享受美味佳肴 - 总是假设，当然，海上风平浪静。

SEE> qui·et 安静, anx·ious 着急的, tran·quil

ODE> Not showing or feeling nervousness, anger, or other strong emotions. – serene, tranquil, relaxed, unruffled, unperturbed, unflustered, undisturbed, unagitated, unmoved, unbothered, untroubled.

263. camp 营地 ## 12

[kæmp]n.野营；帐篷；营地v.宿营；露营；扎营

  • Tazieff was able to set up his camp very close to the volcano while it was erupting violently. 塔捷耶夫能够非常接近设立他的阵营火山，同时它猛烈地喷发。
  • Now, dressed in a blue uniform and with a rifle over his shoulder, the prisoner marched boldly up and down in front of the camp. 现在，在一个蓝色的制服，并用步枪在他的肩膀穿着，囚犯大胆进军上下在营地前。
  • He could hear shouting in the camp itself. 他听得军营里面的喧闹声。

SEE> where 哪里, near·by 附近, ref·u·gee

ODE> A place with temporary accommodation of huts, tents, or other structures, typically used by soldiers, refugees, or travelling people. – bivouac, encampment, cantonment, barracks, base.

264. camping 露营 ## 9

[’kæmpɪŋ]n.野营；露营

  • It says “No Camping”–in case you can’t read!’ 上面写着“禁止野营” - 你看不懂的情况下“！
  • What is one of the features of modern camping where nationality is concerned? 什么是那里国籍有关现代露营的特点之一？
  • Economy is one powerful motive for camping, since after the initial outlay upon equipment, or through hiring it, the total expense can be far less than the cost of hotels. 经济是露营的一个主要动机。因为在设备的初始费用后，或是租借，总费用可能比经济型酒店的成本远不如。

SEE> hik·ing , camp·site , backpacking

ODE> The activity of spending a holiday living in a tent. –

265. can 可以 ## 233

[kæn]aux.可以；能n.罐头v.罐装；解雇

  • Can you make the tea, Sam? 你可以使茶，山姆？
  • Yes, of course I can, Penny. 是的，我当然会，彭妮。
  • Can you see it? 你能看见它吗？

SEE> could 可以, if 如果, can·not 不能

ODE> Be able to. – tin, canister.

266. cap 帽子 ## 3

[kæp]n.帽子；盖子；顶；上限vt.超过；加盖于；戴帽；覆盖；完成；设限vi.脱帽致意

  • The bull was busy with the matador at the time, but it suddenly caught sight of the drunk who was shouting rude remarks and waving a red cap. 公牛正忙着与当时的斗牛士，但突然它看见谁喊着粗鲁的话，挥舞顶红帽子的。
  • The Officer unscrewed the cap and put the bottle to his nostrils. 海关官员拧开瓶盖，把瓶子放到鼻子底下。
  • At the base of the gold cap, the words ‘made in the U.S.A.’ had been neatly inscribed. 在金笔帽的基础上，写着“在U.S.A.制造”整齐地刻有。

SEE> ex·cep·tion 例外, put 放, sal·a·ry 薪水

ODE> A kind of soft, flat hat without a brim and typically with a peak. – mortar board, academic cap.

267. ca·pa·ble 有能力的 ## 5

[’keɪpəbl]adj.有能力的；能干的；有…的可能性

  • Bagrit foresaw a time when computers would be small enough to hold in the hand, when they would be capable of providing information about traffic jams and suggesting alternative routes, when they would be used in hospitals to help doctors to diagnose illnesses, when they would relieve office workers and accountants of dull, repetitive clerical work. 巴格瑞特预示有一天计算机可以小到拿在手上，当他们将能够提供有关交通阻塞的信息，并建议替代路线，当他们将在医院使用，以帮助医生诊断疾病，当他们将减轻上班族的平淡会计师，重复的文职工作。
  • A planet would have to be a very long way from it to be capable of supporting life. 一颗行星必须是一个很长的路从它是能够支持生命。
  • At present, there is no telescope in existence that is capable of detecting the presence of life. 目前，有存在，其能够检测生命的存在没有望远镜。

SEE> in·ca·pa·ble , ca·pa·bil·i·ty , be·sides

ODE> Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing. – have the ability to, have the potential to, be equal to, be equal to the task of, be up to.

268. ca·pac·i·ty 容量 ## 2

[kə’pæsəti]n.容量；容积；能力；职位；资格

  • It has been estimated that if the bridge were packed with cars, it would still only be carrying a third of its total capacity. 据估计，若桥上摆满了汽车，也只不过携带三分之一的总容量。
  • We would lay less stress on ‘facts and figures’ and more on a good memory, on applied psychology, and on the capacity of a man to get along with his fellow-citizens. 我们不会重视“资料和数据”，而靠好记性，实用心理学，并在一个人的能力与他的同胞相处。

SEE> ca·pa·bil·i·ty , ad·di·tion 加, in·crease 增加

ODE> The maximum amount that something can contain. – volume, cubic measure.

269. cap·i·tal 资本 ## 3

[’kæpɪtl]n.首都；资本；大写字母；[建筑]柱顶adj.资本的；大写的；一流的；首要的；极其严重的；涉及死亡的

  • The Games will be held just outside the capital and the whole area will be called ‘Olympic City’. 该游戏将在城外举行的首都，整个地区将被称作“奥林匹克城”。
  • So preserving your capital and generating extra income are your main priorities. 因此，保护​​你的资金和引发额外的收入，你的首要任务。
  • In this case, you’d probably construct a portfolio with some shares (but not high risk ones), along with gilts, cash deposits, and perhaps convertibles or the income shares of split capital investment trusts. 在这种情况下，你可能会构建一个投资组合与某些股份（但不是风险很大），与证券，现金储蓄，可能还有可换，或分割资本投资信托的所得股一起。

SEE> out·skirts , out·side 外面, cit·y 城市

ODE> The city or town that functions as the seat of government and administrative centre of a country or region. – first city, most important city, seat of government, centre of administration.

270. cap·tain 队长 ## 19

[’kæptɪn]n.首领；队长；船长vt.指挥；率领

  • Where is Captain Alison going and how? 凡艾利森船长打算又如何呢？
  • Our neighbour, Captain Charles Alison, will sail from Portsmouth tomorrow. 我们的邻居查尔斯。艾利森船长明天就要从朴次茅斯起航。
  • Captain Alison will set out at eight o’clock, so we’ll have plenty of time. 艾利森船长将于8点钟，所以我们有充裕的时间。

SEE> squad , ab·sence 缺席, when 什么时候

ODE> The person in command of a ship. – commander, master, skipper.

271. cap·ture 俘获 ## 3

[’kæptʃər]vt.捕获；占领；夺取；吸引；(用照片等)留存n.捕获；战利品

  • Radio and television have made it possible for advertisers to capture the attention of millions of people in this way. 电台，电视使我们能够为广告主吸引千百万人的注意以这种方式。
  • A blurred image appears; he adds a brushstroke and another, and it is gone; but something was there, and he will not rest till he has captured it. 出现一个模糊图像;他增添了一笔，另外，它是走了;但事情在那里，他不会休息，直到把它捕捉。
  • The most economical age to capture an elephant for training is between fifteen and twenty years, for it is then almost ready to undertake heavy work and can begin to earn its keep straight away. 最经济的年龄捕捉大象训练是15至20岁之间，因为它是差不多已能干重活，可以很快赚其保持挺直了。

SEE> pre·sum·a·bly 想必, es·cape 逃跑, a·ble 能够

ODE> Take into one’s possession or control by force. – catch, apprehend, seize, arrest.

272. car 汽车 ## 74

[kɑːr]n.汽车；车厢；吊舱

  • The children go to school by car every day, but today, they are going to school on foot. 孩子们每天都去学校的车程，但今天，他们正步行上学。
  • Which car was the winner in 1995? 哪辆车在1995年的赢家？
  • There is a car race near our town every year. 有每年都有一场汽车比赛我们镇子附近。

SEE> ve·hi·cle 车辆, truck 卡车, driv·er 司机

ODE> A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine and able to carry a small number of people. – motor car, automobile, motor, machine.

273. card 卡片 ## 7

[kɑːrd]n.纸牌；卡片；名片；怪人；梳理机v.把 … 记入卡片；梳理

  • Does grandmother seem pleased to get a card from Jimmy? 祖母是否显得高兴获得从吉米的名片？
  • Read Jimmy’s card to me please, Penny. 阅读吉米的卡给我听听，彭妮。
  • He can’t write very much on a card, Mum. 他写不了很多卡片，妈妈上。

SEE> deb·it , cred·it 信用, check 检查

ODE> A piece of thick, stiff paper or thin pasteboard, in particular one used for writing or printing on. – cardboard, pasteboard, board, stiff paper.

274. care 关心 ## 5

[ker]v.关心；担忧；照顾；喜爱；介意；倾向于；愿望；在乎n.小心；照料；忧虑；注意；护理

  • The Officer went through the case with great care. 该官员通过非常谨慎的情况去了。
  • We often speak of tramps with contempt and put them in the same class as beggars, but how many of us can honestly say that we have not felt a little envious of their simple way of life and their freedom from care? 我们常常带有轻蔑流浪汉，并把它们放在同一类乞丐，但我们又有多少人能够坦率地说，我们还没有感受到生活的简单方法和照顾他们的自由，有点羡慕？
  • He did not marry again and I was brought up without a woman’s care; but I lacked for nothing, for he was both father and mother to me. 他没有再娶，因此，我从小就没有女人的关怀;但我什么都不缺，他既当父亲又当母亲。

SEE> health 健康, need 需要, med·i·cal 医学的

ODE> The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something. – safe keeping, supervision, custody, charge, protection, keeping, keep, control, management, ministration, guidance, superintendence, tutelage, aegis, responsibility.

275. care·ful 小心 ## 3

[’kerfl]adj.小心谨慎的；慎重的；精心的

  • Be careful! 小心！
  • I’ll certainly be more careful. 我肯定会更加小心。
  • They went through the rooms, being careful to touch nothing, as they did not want to hinder the police in their search for fingerprints. 他们通过了每一个房间，小心翼翼地不接触任何东西，因为他们不想妨碍警察寻找指纹。

SEE> sure 当然, me·tic·u·lous , re·gard 看待

ODE> Making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious. – cautious, heedful, alert, aware, attentive, watchful, vigilant, wary, on guard, chary, circumspect, prudent, mindful, guarded.

276. care·ful·ly 小心 ## 10

[’keəfəli]adv.小心地，谨慎地；仔细地，认真地

  • I not only spoke English very carefully, but very clearly as well. 我不但非常认真讲英语，但非常清楚。
  • Yesterday the firemen examined the ground carefully, but were not able to find any broken glass. 昨天，消防队员仔细查看了地面，但未能找到任何碎玻璃。
  • He prepared the speech carefully and went to the wedding with Jenny. 他认真准备了讲稿，去与珍妮的婚礼。

SEE> care·ful 小心, prop·er·ly 正确地, pre·pared 准备

ODE> In a way that deliberately avoids harm or errors; cautiously. –

277. care·less·ly 粗心地 ## 2

[’keələsli]adv.粗心大意地；疏忽地

  • Forest fires are often caused by broken glass or by cigarette ends which people carelessly throw away. 森林火灾时常由破碎的玻璃或烟头人们随手扔掉造成的。
  • The man who manoeuvres carelessly into his twenty pounds’ worth of space at one of Europe’s myriad permanent sites may find himself bumping a Bentley. 谁漫不经心地驾车驶入二十磅的价值空间在欧洲无数常年营地之一可能发现自己撞上一个宾利的人。

SEE> in·ci·den·tal·ly , sen·si·bly , cas·u·al·ly

ODE> In a casual or reckless way; inattentively. –

278. car·pet 地毯 ## 6

[’kɑːrpɪt]n.地毯；地毯状物vt.铺盖；铺以地毯

  • What is the writer’s carpet made of? 什么是作家的地毯做的？
  • ‘This is the prettiest carpet I have ever seen,’ she said. “这是我见过的最漂亮的地毯，”她说。

279. car·ry 携带 ## 32

  • Yesterday, a pigeon carried the first message from Pinhurst to Silbury. 昨天，鸽子把第一消息从树丛到梳。
  • Two men took the parcel off the plane and carried it into the Customs House. 有两个人把包裹拿下飞机，进了海关大楼。
  • This wonderful plane can carry seven passengers. 这个奇妙的飞机可以载7名乘客。

280. case 箱子 ## 31

  • Our cases are brown. 我们的箱子是棕色的。

281. cash 现金 ## 3

[kæʃ]n.现金vt.付现款；兑现adj.现金的

  • When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money, repayment of which he may demand at any time, either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person. 任何人在银行开一个活期账户，他在借钱给银行，还款，而他可以在任何时间要求，以现金或通过绘制有利于他人的支票。
  • We’ll assume that you have sorted out the basics – like mortgages, pensions, insurance and access to sufficient cash reserves. 我们假设你已经基本情况弄清楚了 - 如抵押贷款，养老金，保险和获得足够的现金储备。
  • In this case, you’d probably construct a portfolio with some shares (but not high risk ones), along with gilts, cash deposits, and perhaps convertibles or the income shares of split capital investment trusts. 在这种情况下，你可能会构建一个投资组合与某些股份（但不是风险很大），与证券，现金储蓄，可能还有可换，或分割资本投资信托的所得股一起。

SEE> mon·ey 钱, pay 支付, pay·ment 付款

ODE> Money in coins or notes, as distinct from cheques, money orders, or credit. – money, ready cash, ready money, currency, legal tender, hard cash.

282. cat 猫 ## 20

[kæt]n.猫；猫科动物；狠毒的女人；吊锚机；独桅船；九尾鞭v.起锚；寻找性伴侣abbr.目录（=catalog）

  • Is the cat climbing the tree? 是猫爬树？
  • It’s running after a cat. 这是一个猫运行后。
  • The hunt for the puma began in a small village where a woman picking blackberries saw ‘a large cat’ only five yards away from her. 美洲狮狩猎开始在一个小村庄，一位妇女在采摘黑莓时的看见“一只大猫”，离她仅5码远。

SEE> dog 狗, pet 宠物, mon·key

ODE> A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws. It is widely kept as a pet or for catching mice, and many breeds have been developed. – feline.

  • Catch! 抓住！
  • We want to catch the eight nineteen to London. 我们要乘8点19分至伦敦。
  • I often fish for hours without catching anything. 我经常一钓数小时却一无所获。

SEE> grab 抓住, slip 滑倒, chance 机会

284. cause 原因 ## 23

  • What caused the fire? 是什么原因造成的火？
  • Forest fires are often caused by broken glass or by cigarette ends which people carelessly throw away. 森林火灾时常由破碎的玻璃或烟头人们随手扔掉造成的。
  • This morning, however, a firemen accidentally discovered the cause. 然而今天上午，一个消防队员偶然发现了原因。

285. cease 停止 ## 4

[siːs]v.终止；停止n.停止

  • There are rare instances when justice almost ceases to be an abstract concept. 在极少数情况下，正义不再是一个抽象的概念。
  • In the new country he became absorbed in making a new life for the two of us, so that he gradually ceased to grieve. 在新的国家里，父亲专心致志做我们两个人的新生活，让他渐渐不再悲伤。
  • It was also found that although she could perceive things with her fingers this ability ceased the moment her hands were wet. 有人还发现，尽管她可以用她的手指感知事物这个能力停止的那一刻她的手是湿的。

SEE> re·su·me , ac·cord , a·gree·ment 协议

ODE> Come or bring to an end. – come to an end, come to a halt, come to a stop, end, halt, stop, conclude, terminate, finish, wind up, draw to a close, be over, come to a standstill.

286. ceil·ing 天花板 ## 2

[’siːlɪŋ]n.天花板；上限

  • Oddly shaped forms that are suspended from the ceiling and move in response to a gust of wind are quite familiar to everybody. 被从天花板和移动响应于一阵风悬浮异形形式是大家十分熟悉。
  • If you are lucky enough to get a sleeper, you spend half the night staring at the small blue light in the ceiling, or fumbling to find your ticket for inspection. 如果你幸运地得到一个卧铺，你花一半的晚上在天花板上蓝色的小光盯着，或摸索着找到自己的检查车票。

287. cell 细胞 ## 2

  • The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell. 该大幕拉开上的最后一幕戏，并透露了贵族独自坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房。
  • He entered the cell and presented the letter to the aristocrat. 他走进牢房，将信交给贵族。

SEE> phone 电话, in·stance 例子, fur·ther·more

ODE> A small room in which a prisoner is locked up or in which a monk or nun sleeps. – dungeon, oubliette, lock-up, prison.

288. cent 一分钱 ## 9

[sent]n.分

  • It had been wrapped up in newspaper and it contained half the money he had lost, together with a note which said: ‘A thief, yes, but only 50 per cent a thief!’ 它是用报纸包着的，一个纸条，上面写着含有一半，他已经失去了钱，一起：“一个小偷，是的，但只有50％的小偷！”
  • Two months later, some more money was sent to Sam with another note: ‘Only 25 per cent a thief now!’ 两个月后，又有一些钱送还给了萨姆并附上一张字条：“只有25％的小偷了！”
  • The last note said: ‘I am 100 per cent honest now!’ 最后的那张字条上写道：“我是100％的诚信了！”
