ODE> A monetary unit in various countries, equal to one hundredth of a dollar, euro, or other decimal currency unit. –

289. cen·tre 中央 ## 7

[’sentər]n.中心；集中点v.居中；使集中=centeradj.中心的；中央的

  • He has just bought an Australian car and has gone to Alice Springs, a small town in the centre of Australia. 他刚买了一辆澳大利亚小汽车，现在去了爱丽丝泉小镇在澳大利亚的中心。
  • He said that it would be possible to build a platform in the centre of the Channel. 他说，这将有可能在通道的中心搭建了一个平台。
  • The next car the boy stopped did not take him into the centre of Paris as he hoped it would, but to Perpignan on the French-Spanish border. 的下一辆车，孩子拦住并没有把他带到巴黎的中心，他希望可以，但到佩皮尼昂在法国和西班牙边界。

ODE> The point that is equally distant from every point on the circumference of a circle or sphere. – middle, nucleus, heart, core, hub, pivot, kernel, eye, bosom.

290. cen·tu·ry 世纪 ## 18

[’sentʃəri]n.百年；世纪adj.百年的

  • In place of the great trees which had been growing there for centuries, patches of green had begun to appear in the blackened soil. 上，代替了多少世纪以来一直生长在那里的参天大树，片的绿草开始出现在这片烧焦的土壤。
  • Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace, which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851. 也许是十九世纪最不寻常的建筑水晶宫，这是建在海德公园的1851年世界博览会。
  • One of the most famous monuments in the world, the Statue of Liberty, was presented to the United States of America in the nineteenth century by the people of France. 一个是世界上最有名的古迹，自由女神像，是由法国人民赠送给美国的美国在十九世纪。

SEE> lat·ter 后者, be·gin·ning 开始, ear·ly 早

ODE> A period of one hundred years. – age, time, period, era, epoch, century, decade, year, stage.

291. cer·tain 确定的 ## 21

[’sɜːrtn]adj.确定的；肯定的；某事；某人；某种；（与人名连用；表示不认识此人）一位叫…；特定的；轻微的；微小的pron.某些；某几个

  • When the doctor answered the phone, Mr. Gilbert said he was inquiring about a certain patient, a Mr. John Gilbert. 当这位医生接过电话时，吉尔伯特先生说他想询问一个病人的情况，约翰·吉尔伯特先生。
  • At one point, it seemed certain that their plane would crash. 在一个点上，似乎可以肯定，他们的飞机会崩溃。
  • The sad truth is that most of us have been brought up to eat certain foods and we stick to them all our lives. 可悲的事实是，我们大多数人已经长大吃某些食物，我们坚持给他们所有我们的生活。

SEE> par·tic·u·lar 特定的, such 这样, these 这些

ODE> Able to be firmly relied on to happen or be the case. – unquestionable, sure, definite, beyond question, not in question, not in doubt, beyond doubt, unequivocal, indubitable, undeniable, irrefutable, indisputable, incontrovertible, incontestable, obvious, patent, manifest, evident, plain, clear, transparent, palpable, unmistakable, conclusive, recognized, confirmed, accepted, acknowledged, undisputed, undoubted, unquestioned, unchallenged, uncontested.

292. cer·tain·ly 当然 ## 14

[’sɜːrtnli]adv.当然；一定

  • Well, it’s certainly not for me! 那么，它肯定不是我！
  • Our climate is not very good, but it’s certainly interesting. 我们的气候不是很好，但它肯定有意思。
  • Certainly, doctor. 当然可以，医生。

SEE> def·i·nite·ly 肯定, in·deed 确实, ob·vi·ous·ly 显然

293. chain 链条 ## 7

[tʃeɪn]n.束缚；链条；链；(一)连串；连锁店（常用复数）vt.束缚；用铁链锁住

  • It is as if a single unimportant event set up a chain of reactions. 这是因为如果单不重要事件成立反应的链。
  • The sides of the dish were so smooth that it was almost impossible to attach hawsers and chains to the rim without damaging it. 培养皿的四边十分光滑，这是几乎不可能拴上绳索或链条到轮辋而不损坏它。
  • Eventually chains were fixed to one end of the dish and a powerful winch was put into operation. 最终链条固定在盘子的一端，具有强大的绞盘被投入运行。

294. chair 椅子 ## 5

  • Put it on this chair. 把它放在这把椅子上。
  • I had left it on a chair beside the door and now it wasn’t there! 我曾把它放在门边的椅子上，现在它不存在！
  • I sat down on one of those modern chairs with holes in it and waited. 我坐下来的新式椅子一个有孔和等待。

SEE> head 头, sit 坐, be·side 在旁边

ODE> A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs. – seat.

295. chance 机会 ## 14

[tʃæns]n.可能性；机会；偶然性v.偶然发生；碰巧；冒 … (的险)

  • The following day, however, the doctor consoled him by telling him that his chances of being able to leave hospital in time for New Year celebrations were good. 次日，然而，医生告诉他，他能够离开医院时欢度新年的可能性还是很大的安慰他。
  • No one discovers a rarity by chance. 没有人发现的偶然罕见。
  • What was the chance in a million? 什么是一百万的机会？

SEE> op·por·tu·ni·ty 机会, give 给, hope 希望

ODE> A possibility of something happening. – possibility, prospect, probability, odds, likelihood, likeliness, expectation, anticipation, conceivability, feasibility, plausibility.

296. change 改变 ## 25

[tʃeɪndʒ]n.变化；零钱v.改变

  • I want my change. 我想我的变化。
  • Who has got some small change? 谁得到了一些小的变化？
  • I can’t change a ten-pound note. 我可以不开10英镑的钞票。

SEE> shift 转移, same 相同, come 来

ODE> Make or become different. – convert, change, transform, make.

297. chan·nel 渠道 ## 13

[’tʃænl]n.频道；海峡；方法；通道；（消息）渠道vt.引导；形成河道；集中（精力）

  • Last year, we were travelling across the Channel and Jane put a piece of paper with her name and address on it into a bottle. 去年，当我们横渡英吉利海峡时，简把一张纸，她的名字和地址装进了一只瓶子。
  • Debbie Hart is going to swim across the English Channel tomorrow. 黛比·哈特准备横渡英吉利海峡游泳的明天。
  • Among them will be Debbie’s mother, who swam the Channel herself when she was a girl. 他们当中还会有黛比的母亲，谁横渡过英吉利海峡她自己，当她是个女孩。

SEE> TV 电视, tel·e·vi·sion 电视, broad·cast 广播

ODE> A length of water wider than a strait, joining two larger areas of water, especially two seas. – strait, straits, sound, neck, arm, narrows, passage, sea passage, stretch of water, waterway.

298. char·ac·ter 性格 ## 2

[’kærəktər]n.个性；品质；字符；人物；名誉；地位adj.[剧](角色)代表某一特性的

  • Parents would be greatly surprised and deeply touched if they realized how much belief their children usually have in their character and infallibility, and how much this faith means to a child. 家长会大为吃惊，如果他们意识到有多少相信他们的孩子通常在他们的品行和绝对正确，又有多少这种信念的手段对孩子深深打动了。
  • They have a character, perhaps two; they are in that condition of eager discomfort which passes for inspiration; all admit radical changes of destination once the journey has begun; one, to my certain knowledge, spent nine months on a novel about Kashmir, then reset the whole thing in the Scottish Highlands. 他们有一个或两个角色;它们是其中通行证灵感急切不安的条件;无不承认，一旦旅程开始目的地急剧的变化。一个，据我所知，花了九个月一个有关克什米尔的小说，后来却把苏格兰高地整个事情。

SEE> pro·tag·o·nist , fic·tion·al , role 角色

ODE> The mental and moral qualities distinctive to an individual. – personality, nature, disposition, temperament, temper, mentality, turn of mind, psychology, psyche, constitution, make-up, make, stamp, mould, cast.

299. char·ac·ter·is·tic 特性 ## 4

[ˌkærəktə’rɪstɪk]n.特点；特性；特色adj.典型的；特有的

  • The sense of humour is mysteriously bound up with national characteristics. 幽默感是神秘莫测的具有民族特色。
  • This rabbit had no natural enemies in the Antipodes, so that it multiplied with that promiscuous abandon characteristic of rabbits. 这种兔子在拓地没有天敌，所以它乘以该混杂放弃兔子的特征。
  • What would you say is the main characteristic of porpoises? 你会说是江豚的主要特点？

SEE> dis·tinc·tive , pe·cu·li·ar , dis·tinct

ODE> Typical of a particular person, place, or thing. – typical, usual, normal, predictable, habitual, in character.

300. charge 要价 ## 7

[tʃɑːrdʒ]n.责任；电荷；指控；费用；照顾vi.要价；充电；向前冲，冲锋；记在账上vt.控诉；赊帐；给…充电；委以重任；归罪于；装填（炸药等）

  • I won’t charge you this time. 这次我就不罚你。
  • Apparently sensitive to criticism, the bull forgot all about the matador and charged at the drunk. 批评显然非常敏感的公牛完全斗牛士和醉汉。
  • A flight attendant would take charge of me and I never had an unpleasant experience. 一位空中乘务员照顾我，我从未有过不愉快的经历。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ad·di·tion 加, in·stead 代替

ODE> Demand (an amount) as a price for a service rendered or goods supplied. – ask in payment, ask, fix a charge, fix a price, impose, levy.

301. chat 聊天 ## 2

[tʃæt]vi.闲谈；谈天n.闲谈；聊天

  • They invariably live nearby and are always available for an informal chat or an evening’s entertainment. 他们都住在附近，并随时可以聊天或在晚上一起娱乐。
  • Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat. 在移动电话大声交谈侵入我们的思想或中断和朋友在一起轻声聊天的乐趣。

SEE> talk 谈论, con·ver·sa·tion 会话, dis·cus·sion 讨论

ODE> Talk in a friendly and informal way. – talk, gossip, chatter, chitter-chatter, speak, converse, have a conversation, engage in conversation, tittle-tattle, prattle, jabber, jibber-jabber, babble, prate, go on, run on.

302. cheap 便宜的 ## 4

[tʃiːp]adj.便宜的；廉价的

  • The need to produce ever-increasing quantities of cheap food leads to a different kind of pollution. 需要生产廉价食物导致的不断增加的数量以不同的一种污染。
  • Industrialized farming methods produce cheap meat products: beef, pork and chicken. 工业化的农作方式生产出廉价的肉类制品 - 牛肉，猪肉和鸡肉。
  • The use of pesticides and fertilizers produces cheap grain and vegetables. 使用杀虫剂和化肥生产出廉价的谷物和蔬菜。

SEE> in·ex·pen·sive , ex·pen·sive 昂贵的, eas·y 容易

ODE> Low in price, especially in relation to similar items or services. – inexpensive, low-priced, low-price, low-cost, economical, economic, competitive, affordable, reasonable, reasonably priced, moderately priced, keenly priced, budget, economy, cheap and cheerful, bargain, cut-rate, cut-price, half-price, sale-price, sale, reduced, on special offer, marked down, discounted, discount, rock-bottom, giveaway.

303. check 检查 ## 6

[tʃɛk]v.检查；阻止；核对；买单n.检查；阻碍；支票；账单；方格图案；(国际象棋)将军

  • Officials from Greenwich Observatory have the clock checked twice a day. 从格林尼治天文台的官员们时钟每天两次检查。
  • It was only possible for the Ombudsman to find this out by sending one of his representatives to check the facts. 这是唯一可能的监察员派他的代表之一检查事实发现这一点。
  • The inspector began to look for fingerprints, while the constable checked that the front door locks had not been forced, thereby proving that the burglars had either used skeleton keys or entered over the balcony. 巡官开始搜寻指纹，警察经检查发现大门锁没有被强迫，由此可以证明，窃贼或者是用万能钥匙，或者是翻越阳台进来。

SEE> sure 当然, when·ev·er 每当, in·stance 例子

ODE> Examine (something) in order to determine its accuracy, quality, or condition, or to detect the presence of something. – examine, inspect, look at, look over, scrutinize, scan, survey.

304. cheer·ful 欢快的 ## 3

[’tʃɪrfl]adj.高兴的；快乐的

  • Though they are running out of food and drink, the men are cheerful and confident that they will get out soon. 虽然他们的食物和饮料的不多了，人的心情很好，坚信他们很快就会出来的。
  • This festival is a cheerful occasion, for on this day, the dead are said to return to their homes and they are welcomed by the living. 这个节日是个欢乐的日子，因为在这一天，据说死去的人返回他们的家园，他们被生活的欢迎。
  • The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages, but produces a cheerful, good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service. 温柔法要求在最初阶段保持较大的耐心，但产生一个开朗，好脾气的大象谁给多年的忠诚服务。

SEE> eas·y·go·ing , vi·va·cious , charm·ing

ODE> Noticeably happy and optimistic. – happy, jolly, merry, bright, glad, sunny, joyful, joyous, light-hearted, in good spirits, in high spirits, sparkling, bubbly, exuberant, ebullient, cock-a-hoop, elated, gleeful, breezy, airy, cheery, sprightly, jaunty, animated, radiant, smiling, grinning, laughing, mirthful, frolicsome.

305. cheese 奶酪 ## 3

[tʃiːz]n.干酪；乳酪；奶酪vt.使停止

  • A piece of cheese. 一块奶酪。
  • Then he put a piece of cheese in his pocket and went away. 然后，他把一块乳酪装进衣袋里走了。
  • Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine. 因为有一般都很肮脏和跳蚤深重例如旅馆;食物是当地的干酪和面包通常存放了一年的时候，都冲下来的粗酒。

ODE> A food made from the pressed curds of milk, firm and elastic or soft and semi-liquid in texture. –

306. chem·i·cal 化学 ## 4

[’kemɪkl]adj.化学的n.药品；化学物

  • Why is secrecy particularly important in the chemical industries? 为什么是秘密的化工行业特别重要？
  • This applies particularly to chemical industries, where chance discoveries play a much larger part than they do in physical and mechanical industries. 这尤其适用于化工等行业，其中偶然发现的机会比他们在物理和机械工业做一个更大的部分。
  • Similarly, our own present primitive chemical rockets, though good enough to orbit men, have no chance of transporting us to the nearest other star, four light years away, let alone distances of tens or hundreds of light years. 同样，我们目前使用的原始化学火箭，虽然不够好把人送入轨道，但尚不能把我们最近的其他星球的机会，四光年远，更不用说几十或几百光年的孤独距离。

SEE> bi·o·log·i·cal , tox·ic , man·u·fac·ture 制造

ODE> Relating to chemistry, or the interactions of substances as studied in chemistry. – technological, technical.

307. cheque 支票 ## 5

[tʃek]n.支票=check(美).

  • Why is there no risk to the customer when a bank prints the customer’s name on his cheques? 为什么会出现当银行打印对他检查客户的姓名客户没有风险？
  • When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money, repayment of which he may demand at any time, either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person. 任何人在银行开一个活期账户，他在借钱给银行，还款，而他可以在任何时间要求，以现金或通过绘制有利于他人的支票。
  • When, for example, a customer first opens an account, he instructs the bank to debit his account only in respect of cheques drawn by himself. 当，例如，顾客至上开户时，他通知银行借记他的帐户只就由他签发支票。

ODE> An order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer’s account, written on a specially printed form. – payment, settlement, money, fee.

308. chest 胸部 ## 4

[tʃest]n.胸部；胸腔；箱子；金库

  • The sea bed was scoured with powerful nets and there was tremendous excitement on board when a chest was raised from the bottom. 海床用结实的网冲刷并有巨大的兴奋在船上当一只箱子从海底升起。
  • Though the crew were at first under the impression that the lost ship had been found, the contents of the chest proved them wrong. 虽然船员们开始的印象是，沉船已被发现，胸部的物品证明他们错了。
  • The chest contained the personal belongings of a seaman, Alan Fielding. 木箱内装有水手艾伦的个人物品。

ODE> The front surface of a person’s or animal’s body between the neck and the stomach. – breast, upper body, body, torso, trunk.

309. chick·en 鸡 ## 6

  • Do you want a chicken, Mrs. Bird? 你想鸡，鸟夫人？
  • My husband likes steak, but he doesn’t like chicken. 我丈夫喜欢牛排，但他不喜欢鸡。
  • To tell you the truth, Mrs. Bird, I don’t like chicken either! 说句实话，伯德夫人，我也不喜欢鸡！

ODE> A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one. – easily frightened, lacking courage, fearful, apprehensive, afraid, frightened, scared, faint-hearted.

  • The Ombudsman immediately wrote to the Chief of Police in the district asking him to send a record of the case. 司法特派员立即写信给当地的警察局长，请他寄送情况的记录。
  • There was nothing in the record to show that the foreigner’s complaint was justified and the Chief of Police strongly denied the accusation. 材料中没有任何文字记载证明外国人的情况符合事实，警察局长矢口否认这一指控。

312. chip 碎屑 ## 6

[tʃɪp]n.缺口；碎屑；油炸土豆条；薄片；筹码；芯片；（足球）高球；（高尔夫球）近穴球v.形成（缺口）；切下；凿下；凑份子；打高球；近穴击球；将（土豆等）切条

  • Fish and chips has always been a favourite dish in Britain, but as the oceans have been overfished, fish has become more and more expensive. 鱼和炸土豆片一直是英国人喜爱的一道菜，但是随着海洋里的滥捕滥捞，鱼已经变得越来越昂贵。
  • After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. 通过墙上挖了厚18英寸碎裂后，他们发现，一男子已被困在烟囱里。
  • Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh. 米德 - 集成电路的一位先驱，加州技术学院的计算机科学教授，注意到，现在的工作站，使工程师可以设计，试验和生产芯片在他们的办公桌，就像一位编辑器上创建一个简讯在Macintosh。

SEE> in·stance 例子, tech·nol·o·gy 技术, like·wise

ODE> A small piece of something removed in the course of chopping, cutting, or breaking a hard material such as wood or stone. – fragment, piece, bit.

313. choc·o·late 巧克力 ## 5

[’tʃɑːklət]n.巧克力；巧克力糖；巧克力色adj.巧克力的；巧克力色的

  • A bar of chocolate. 一块巧克力。
  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。
  • It contained five large bars of chocolate and three bags of sweets! 里面装了5个大块巧克力和3袋糖果！

ODE> A food in the form of a paste or solid block made from roasted and ground cacao seeds, typically sweetened and eaten as confectionery. – sweet, lozenge, pastille, piece of confectionery.

314. choose 选择 ## 10

[tʃuːz]v.选择；决定

  • After a little time, she chose one of the most expensive dresses in the shop and handed it to an assistant who wrapped it up for her as quickly as possible. 过了一会儿，她又选了商场里最昂贵的一件衣服，把它递给了助手谁尽快包好了她越好。
  • The site chosen was an island at the entrance of New York Harbour. 场地选在了纽约港入口处的一个岛上。
  • Much as we may pride ourselves on our good taste, we are no longer free to choose the things we want, for advertising exerts a subtle influence on us. 尽管我们可以对我们的好味道感到自豪，我们不再自由选择我们想要的东西，广告发挥对我们有潜移默化的影响。

315. church 教会 ## 5

[tʃɜːrtʃ]n.礼拜仪式；教堂；基督教徒adj.教堂的v.把 … 带到教堂接受某种宗教仪式

  • The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago, but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation. 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，但它只是在最近几年才得到了一个坏名声。
  • Our vicar is always raising money for one cause or another, but he has never managed to get enough money to have the church clock repaired. 我们的牧师总是为了钱，一个原因或其他，但他从来没有设法得到足够的钱来把教堂的钟修好。
  • We had spent several days in a small town and visited a number of old churches in the vicinity. 我们在一座小镇上逗留了几天，参观了许多古老的教堂附近。

  • A quiet day’s fishing, or eight hours in a cinema seeing the same film over and over again, is usually as far as they get. 安静的一天的捕鱼，或者一遍又一遍地看同一部电影在电影院八小时，通常只要他们得到。
  • When the news got round that a comedy show would be presented at our local cinema by the P. and U. Bird Seed Company, we all rushed to see it. 当消息传开喜剧节目将在我们皮尤鸟食公司当地影院介绍，大家都赶紧跑去观看。

318. cir·cle 圈 ## 6

[’sɜːrkl]n.圆圈；圈子；包厢v.划圈；包围；盘旋；环绕

  • Jeremy Hampden has a large circle of friends and is very popular at parties. 杰里米·汉普登有一大群朋友，是各种聚会很受欢迎。
  • Both men had just begun to swim towards the shore, when they noticed with dismay that the speedboat was moving in a circle. 两个人刚开始向岸边游去，当他们突然惊愕地发现快艇正在转着圈行驶。
  • They had just had enough time to swim out of danger when the boat again completed a circle. 他们刚刚来得及游的危险，出来的时候，船又转完了一圈。

SEE> in·deed 确实, like·wise , once 一次

ODE> A round plane figure whose boundary (the circumference) consists of points equidistant from a fixed point (the centre) – ring, round, band, hoop, circlet.

319. cir·cum·stance 环境 ## 7

[’sɜːrkəmstæns]n.环境；详情；事件；(复数)境况

  • When we use a phrase like ‘it serves him right’, we are, in part, admitting that a certain set of circumstances has enabled justice to act of its own accord. 当我们用一个短语，如“他罪有应得”，我们是，部分承认了某种特定的环境使得正义自动地起了自己的协议。
  • Yet, in real life, circumstances do sometimes conspire to bring about coincidences which anyone but a nineteenth century novelist would find incredible. 然而，在现实生活中，有时情况做凑到带来巧合，这些巧合任何人，而是19世纪小说家会觉得不可思议。
  • But even in the most favourable circumstances only a small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them. 但是，即使在最有利的情况下，只有死的生物的一小部分以这种方式被保存开始腐烂前，或，甚至更容易，食腐动物吃掉它们之前。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate 不幸的, pe·cu·li·ar , con·se·quence 后果

ODE> A fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action. – situation, conditions, set of conditions, state of affairs, things, position.

320. cit·i·zen 公民 ## 3

[’sɪtɪzn]n.公民；市民

  • Sweden has evolved an excellent system for protecting the individual citizen from high-handed or incompetent public officers. 瑞典，已逐渐一种完善的制度以保护每个公民不受专横或无能的政府官员。
  • If a citizen’s complaint is justified, the Ombudsman will act on his behalf. 如果公民的意见正确，司法特派员便为他伸张正义。
  • They are often more industrious, useful citizens than those who are never late. 他们往往是谁比那些从不迟到更勤奋有用的公民。

SEE> like·wise , res·i·dent 居民, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A legally recognized subject or national of a state or commonwealth, either native or naturalized. – subject, national, passport holder, native.

321. cit·y 城市 ## 26

[’sɪti]n.城市；都市；全体市民；特许市；特权市City.n.（伦敦最古老的金融商务中心）伦敦商业区

  • Paris is a beautiful city. 巴黎是一座美丽的城市。
  • On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods. 周日，数百人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林散步。
  • During a holiday in Sweden, I found this note on my car: ’sir, we welcome you to our city. 有一次在瑞典度假，我发现我的车上有这样一个字条：“先生，欢迎您光临我们的城市。

SEE> town 城镇, down·town , where 哪里

ODE> A large town. – town, municipality, metropolis, megalopolis.

322. civ·il 公民的 ## 2

[’sɪvl]adj.公民的；文明的；国内的；民用的；民事的；【建】土木的

  • The Swedes were the first to recognize that public officials like civil servants, police officers, health inspectors or tax-collectors can make mistakes or act over-zealously in the belief that they are serving the public. 是瑞典人首先认识到政府工作人员如文职人员，警官，卫生稽查员，税务，也会犯错误或行为过分热心的信念，他们所服务的公众。
  • To the extent that the people can be relied upon to behave in a loyal and responsible manner, the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order. 为了我们的人民能够在以忠诚和负责任的方式行事的依据的范围内，政府就不需要警察和公务员的军队，让他们为了。

SEE> con·flict 冲突, war 战争, dec·ade 十年

ODE> Relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns, as distinct from military or ecclesiastical matters. – secular, non-religious, lay.

323. claim 声称 ## 9

[kleɪm]n.要求；要求权；主张；断言；声称；要求物vt.要求；请求；主张；声称；断言

  • Many villagers believe that the tree has already claimed a number of victims. 很多村民相信此树已经害了不少人的。
  • Fishermen and sailors sometimes claim to have seen monsters in the sea. 渔夫和水手们有时声称看到过海里的妖怪。
  • However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the Zoo felt obliged to investigate, for the descriptions given by people who claimed to have seen the puma were extraordinarily similar. 然而，随着证据越来越多，动物园的专家们感到有必要调查，通过谁声称见到过美洲狮的人们所描述的情况竟是出奇地相似。

SEE> as·sert , fact 事实, ar·gue 争论

ODE> State or assert that something is the case, typically without providing evidence or proof. – assert, declare, profess, maintain, state, hold, affirm, avow, aver, protest, insist, swear, attest.

324. class 种类 ## 7

[klæs]n.等级；阶级；阶层；班级；课；[生]纲；出色的风度v.分类

  • We often speak of tramps with contempt and put them in the same class as beggars, but how many of us can honestly say that we have not felt a little envious of their simple way of life and their freedom from care? 我们常常带有轻蔑流浪汉，并把它们放在同一类乞丐，但我们又有多少人能够坦率地说，我们还没有感受到生活的简单方法和照顾他们的自由，有点羡慕？
  • No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight; the varieties are infinite; but two classes may be roughly seen. 没有两种鸟的做法不尽相同种类的飞行;该品种有无限的;但两个班可以大致看出。
  • The albatross is the king of the gliders, the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose, but must yield to its opposition. 信天翁是滑翔机之王，种类，其利用空气他们的目的传单的，但必须屈服于反对。

SEE> same 相同, ex·am·ple 例子, type 类型

ODE> A set or category of things having some property or attribute in common and differentiated from others by kind, type, or quality. – kind, sort, type, order, variety, genre, brand.

325. clean 清洁 ## 11

[kliːn]adj.干净的；纯洁的；完全的；空白的；正当的；精准的adv.完全地n.清洁v.打扫；清扫；擦，刷

  • The cup is clean. 杯子很干净。
  • How must Amy clean the floor? 艾米需要如何来清扫地面？
  • Visitors have been asked to keep the woods clean and tidy. 游客已被告知要保持树林的整洁。

SEE> sure 当然, e·nough 足够的, put 放

ODE> Free from dirt, marks, or stains. – washed, scrubbed, cleansed, cleaned, polished.

326. clear 清楚 ## 11

[klɪr]adj.清楚的；明确的；明白(某事)的；清晰的；清澈的；晴朗的；头脑清醒的v.清空；清除；澄清；放晴；使明确adv.清楚地；彻底地n.空地

  • How was the plane able to clear the mountains? 如何为飞机能够清除山上？
  • The plane was then able to rise and it cleared the mountains by 400 feet. 于是飞机可以上升了，它400英尺的高度飞越山区。
  • He was rather elderly with grey hair and clear blue eyes. 他上了年纪，灰白的头发和明亮的蓝眼睛。

SEE> yet 还, clear·ly 清楚地, but 但是

ODE> Easy to perceive, understand, or interpret. – understandable, comprehensible, intelligible, easy to understand, plain, direct, uncomplicated, explicit, lucid, perspicuous, coherent, logical, distinct, simple, straightforward, clearly expressed, unambiguous, clear-cut, crystal clear, accessible, user-friendly.

327. clear·ly 清楚地 ## 4

[’klɪrli]adv.清楚地；显然地

  • I not only spoke English very carefully, but very clearly as well. 我不但非常认真讲英语，但非常清楚。
  • he answered me, but he spoke neither slowly nor clearly. 他回答了，但他讲得既不慢也不清楚。
  • Though the sound could be heard clearly, it took me a long time to react. 虽然声音清晰可闻，我花了很长的时间作出反应。

SEE> ob·vi·ous·ly 显然, fact 事实, in·deed 确实

ODE> In a clear manner; with clarity. – intelligibly, plainly, distinctly, comprehensibly, understandably, perspicuously, with clarity.

328. cli·mate 气候 ## 5

[’klaɪmət]n.气候；风气

  • What’s the climate like in your country? 怎么样在你的国家的气候？
  • What’s the climate like in your country? 怎么样在你的国家的气候？
  • Our climate is not very good, but it’s certainly interesting. 我们的气候不是很好，但它肯定有意思。

SEE> change 改变, en·vi·ron·ment 环境, glob·al 全球的

ODE> The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period. – weather pattern, weather conditions, weather, atmospheric conditions.

329. climb 爬 ## 15

[klaɪm]v.攀登；爬；上升n.爬；攀爬处

  • Is the cat climbing the tree? 是猫爬树？
  • He’s climbing the tree. 他爬树。
  • Who’s climbing the tree? 谁在爬树？

SEE> climb·ing 攀登, steep 陡峭的, drop 掉落

ODE> Go or come up a (slope or staircase); ascend. – ascend, mount, scale, scramble up, clamber up, shin up.

330. clock 时钟 ## 16

[klɑːk]n.时钟v.计时；打卡

  • That clock’s ten minutes slow. 那时钟的慢了10分钟。
  • It was the last day of the year and a large crowd of people had gathered under the Town Hall clock. 那是一年的最后一天，人大群人在市政厅的大钟下聚集。
  • Fifteen minutes passed and then, at five to twelve, the clock stopped. 十五分钟过去了，而就在11点55分时，大钟停了下来。

SEE> time 时间, in·stance 例子, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> A mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures. – timepiece, timekeeper, timer.

331. close 关闭 ## 12

[kloʊs]v.关；合拢；不开放；停业；结束；收盘；（使）缩小；牢牢握住或抓住；（使）靠拢；同意；短兵相接adj.亲近的；近的；几乎的；闷热的；严密的；紧凑的；剪得很短的；守口如瓶的；吝啬的；势均力敌的adv.接近；靠近；紧紧地n.死胡同；完结；结论

  • Tazieff was able to set up his camp very close to the volcano while it was erupting violently. 塔捷耶夫能够非常接近设立他的阵营火山，同时它猛烈地喷发。
  • When the bull got close to him, he clumsily stepped aside to let it pass. 当公牛逼近他时，他笨拙地向一旁让了过去。
  • I felt sure I would never be able to close the case again. 我确信我将永远无法再次关闭的情况。

SEE> up 上, but 但是, while 当的时候

ODE> Only a short distance away or apart in space or time. – near, adjacent, in close proximity, close at hand, near at hand.

332. cloth 布料 ## 2

[klɔːθ]n.布；布料；一块布

  • Dickie left the shop without a word and returned carrying a large cloth bag. 一会儿，他店里一言不发地返回背着一个大布袋。
  • When Dickie was given the watch, he presented the assistant with the cloth bag. 当迪基被赋予了手表，他把布袋的助手。

SEE> fab·ric , lin·en , wool 羊毛

ODE> Woven or felted fabric made from wool, cotton, or a similar fibre. – fabric, material, textile, stuff.

333. clothes 衣服 ## 9

[kloʊðz]n.服装；衣服

  • Then put these clothes in the wardrobe. 然后把这些衣服在衣柜里。
  • Dressed in dark glasses and old clothes, they had taken special precautions so that no one should recognize them. 在墨镜，穿着旧衣裳，他们采取特别的预防措施，使任何人认出他们。
  • When it grew dark, she turned a suitcase into a bed and put the children inside it, covering them with all the clothes she could find. 天黑下来的时候，她把提箱当作小床，把两个孩子放里面，涵盖了他们所有的衣服，她能找到。

SEE> cloth·ing 服装, dress 连衣裙, wear 穿

ODE> Items worn to cover the body. – clothing, garments, articles of clothing, articles of dress, attire, garb.

334. cloth·ing 服装 ## 2

[’kloʊðɪŋ]n.(总称)衣服；覆盖物

  • When a plane from London arrived at Sydney airport, workers began to unload a number of wooden boxes which contained clothing. 当一架飞机从伦敦抵达悉尼机场时，工人们开始卸下大批装有衣服的木箱。
  • There were books, clothing and photographs, together with letters which the seaman had once received from his wife. 有书箱，衣服，照片以及水手曾经从他妻子的来信。

SEE> clothes 衣服, jew·el·ry , fur·ni·ture 家具

ODE> Clothes collectively. – clothes, garments, articles of clothing, articles of dress, attire, garb.

335. cloud 云 ## 4

[klaʊd]n.云；阴影

  • There are some clouds in the sky, but the sun is shining. 还有在天空中飘着几朵云，但阳光灿烂。
  • Travelling at a height of 30,000 feet, far above the clouds, and at over 500 miles an hour is an exhilarating experience. 旅行在30,000英尺的高度，远在云层之上，并在超过500英里的时速是一个令人振奋的体验。
  • If the landscape is hidden from view, you can enjoy the extraordinary sight of unbroken cloud plains that stretch out for miles before you, while the sun shines brilliantly in a clear sky. 如果景色被遮住了，你可以观赏一下展现在伸出你之前英里完整的云平原，而太阳在晴朗的天空灿烂。

SEE> shad·ow 阴影, mist , in·deed 确实

ODE> A visible mass of condensed watery vapour floating in the atmosphere, typically high above the general level of the ground. – mass, billow, pall, shroud, mantle, blanket, layer, sheet, curtain, canopy.

336. coast 海岸 ## 5

[koʊst]n.海岸；海滨

  • One afternoon she set out from the coast in a small boat and was caught in a storm. 一天下午，她从海岸出发的小船，遇上了风暴。
  • She is going to set out from the French coast at five o’clock in the morning. 她打算早上5点钟从法国海岸出发。
  • Most of Debbie’s school friends will be waiting for her on the English coast. 黛比的大部分的同学将在英国海岸等候她。

SEE> coast·al , coast·line , o·cean 海洋

ODE> The part of the land adjoining or near the sea. – seaboard, coastal region, coastline, seashore, shore, shoreline, seaside, beach, sand, sands, foreshore, waterside, water’s edge, waterfront.

337. coat 外套 ## 7

[koʊt]n.外套；上衣；层；表皮vt.涂上；覆盖；包上

  • My coat and my umbrella please. 我的大衣和伞拿给我。
  • Here’s your umbrella and your coat. 这是你的伞和大衣。
  • She was wearing a blue dress and a mink coat. 她穿着一身蓝色的套装和一件貂皮大衣。

SEE> jack·et 夹克, shin·y 闪亮, sweat·er 毛线衣

ODE> An outer garment with sleeves, worn outdoors and typically extending below the hips. – overcoat, tunic.

338. code 代码 ## 2

[koʊd]n.密码；法规；准则v.制成法典；把 … 编码

  • By correlating markings made in various parts of the world, historians have been able to read this difficult code. 通过在世界各地留下的痕迹放在一起研究，史学家已能读懂这种困难的代码。
  • We still do; living in a world in which undeclared aggression, war, hypocrisy, chicanery, anarchy and impending immolation are part of our daily lives, we all want a code to live by. 我们仍然做;生活在一个世界里，不宣战，侵略，虚伪，欺骗，无政府状态和一触即发的杀戮，是我们日常生活的一部分，我们都希望通过住一个代码。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子, same 相同

ODE> A system of words, letters, figures, or symbols used to represent others, especially for the purposes of secrecy. – cipher, secret language, secret writing, set of symbols, key, hieroglyphics.

339. cof·fee 咖啡 ## 13

[’kɔːfi]n.咖啡；咖啡色

  • Half a pound of coffee. 咖啡半磅。
  • How does Ann like her coffee? 安想要什么样的咖啡？
  • Do you like coffee, Ann? 你喜欢咖啡吗，安？

SEE> tea 茶, drink 喝, beer 啤酒

ODE> A hot drink made from the roasted and ground seeds (coffee beans) of a tropical shrub. – joe, java.

340. coin 硬币 ## 7

[kɔɪn]n.硬币；金钱vt.铸造（钱币）；创造（新词）adj.硬币的；投币的

  • When my husband was going into the dining room this morning, he dropped some coins on the floor. 当我的丈夫走进饭厅今天上午，他掉在地上一些硬币。
  • There were coins everywhere. 到处都是硬币。
  • While we were having breakfast, our little boy, Tommy, found two small coins on the floor. 虽然我们吃早饭时，我们的小男孩汤米在地上找到两枚小硬币。

SEE> stamp 邮票, in·stance 例子, like·wise

ODE> A flat disc or piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money. – piece, bit.

341. cold 寒冷的 ## 14

[koʊld]adj.冷的；寒冷的；冷酷的；冷淡的；冷静的n.寒冷；感冒；伤风adv.完全地；彻底地

  • Is it cold or warm in autumn? 它是在秋季冷还是暖？
  • It’s often cold in November and it rains sometimes. 它通常在寒冷的十一月，而且有时下雨。
  • Is it very cold in winter? 它是在冬天很冷吗？

SEE> warm 暖, cool 凉爽的, chil·ly

ODE> Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the human body. – chilly, cool, freezing, icy, snowy, icy-cold, glacial, wintry, crisp, frosty, frigid, bitter, bitterly cold, biting, piercing, numbing, sharp, raw, polar, arctic, Siberian.

342. col·lect 收集 ## 13

[kə’lekt]v.收集；聚集；募捐；运走；使（自己）镇定

  • He knew I collected match boxes and asked me whether my collection was growing. 他知道我收集火柴盒，于是问我收藏是否在增加。
  • The pirates would often bury gold in the cave and then fail to collect it. 海盗们过去常把金子埋藏在那个洞里，可后来却没能取走。
  • The men collected rainwater in the rubber dinghy. 男子收集在橡皮艇的雨水。

SEE> re·trieve , gath·er 聚集, a·ble 能够

ODE> Bring or gather together (a number of things) – gather, accumulate, assemble.

343. col·lec·tion 收集物 ## 4

[kə’lekʃn]n.收集；收取，托收；聚集；收藏品；募捐

  • He knew I collected match boxes and asked me whether my collection was growing. 他知道我收集火柴盒，于是问我收藏是否在增加。
  • On another occasion, he invited a number of important critics to see his private collection of modern paintings. 还有一次，他邀请一些著名评论家看到他的现代画的私人收藏。
  • The parquet floors shone like mirrors; highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets; even my uncle’s huge collection of books was kept miraculously free from dust. 洁如镜的镶木地板;高度抛光的银陈列在明亮的玻璃橱柜;连姑夫的大量藏书保持奇迹般地一尘不染。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, ex·hib·it 展览, well 好

ODE> The action or process of collecting someone or something. – donations, contributions, gifts, subscription, subscriptions, alms.

344. col·lege 学院 ## 4

[’kɑːlɪdʒ]n.学院；大学；学校；枢机主教团；社团

  • There were six million visitors in all, and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges. 有是600万人次，并从博览会的赢利用来建造博物馆和高等学校。
  • It had been baked by a college student who had used over 1,000 pounds of flour, 800 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of fat, and 400 pounds of various other ingredients. 它是由一个大学生谁使用了超过1000磅面粉，800磅食糖，200磅动物脂肪及400磅其他各种原料出炉。
  • And Chinese, Korean, Filipino and Indian engineers are graduating in droves from California’s colleges. 而中国，韩国，菲律宾和印度的工程师毕业，从加州的大学趋之若鹜。

SEE> grad·u·ate , school 学校, u·ni·ver·si·ty 大学

ODE> An educational institution or establishment, in particular one providing higher education or specialized professional or vocational training. – educational institution, training establishment, centre of learning, seat of learning.

345. colour 颜色 ## 18

[’kʌlər]n.颜色；颜料；彩色；肤色vt.给 … 着色；渲染；影响vi.染色；脸红=color（美）

  • What colour is Anna’s hat? 什么颜色是安娜的帽子吗？
  • What colour’s your new dress? 什么颜色是你的新衣服吗？
  • What colour is it? 它是什么颜色？

ODE> The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light. – hue, shade, tint, tone, tinge, cast, tincture.

346. come 来 ## 133

[kʌm]v.来；来到；来取、来拿；成为；达到；接近；摆出 … 的样子；处于（某个位置）

  • Come upstairs and see it. 到楼上去看它。

  • Come in, Amy. 进来，艾米。

ODE> Move or travel towards or into a place thought of as near or familiar to the speaker. – move nearer, move closer, approach, advance, near, draw nigh, draw close, draw closer, draw near, draw nearer.

347. com·fort 舒适 ## 8

[’kʌmfərt]n.舒适；安逸；安慰；慰藉vt.安慰；使舒适

  • In the light of this statement, teachers live by selling knowledge, philosophers by selling wisdom and priests by selling spiritual comfort. 根据这种说法的光，教师靠靠卖精神安慰卖知识，哲学家靠卖智慧和教士。
  • By comparison, ferry trips or cruises offer a great variety of civilized comforts. 相比之下，坐船旅行或环游可以得到文明世界的各种享受。
  • But nothing can match them for speed and comfort. 但没有什么能比得上他们的速度和舒适度。

SEE> in·deed 确实, im·por·tant·ly 重要的, like·wise

ODE> A state of physical ease and freedom from pain or constraint. – ease, freedom from hardship, repose, relaxation, serenity, tranquillity, contentment, content, well-being, cosiness, enjoyment.

348. com·fort·a·ble 舒服的 ## 3

[’kʌmftəbl]adj.舒适的；充裕的

  • Their sleeping bags were warm and comfortable, so they all slept soundly. 睡袋既暖和又舒服，所以，他们都睡得很香。
  • When they had all made themselves comfortable, a stranger appeared. 当他们都已安排舒适时，一个陌生人出现了。
  • She wanted to find out whether it would be comfortable to wear. 她想知道是否会穿着舒适。

SEE> com·fort·a·bly 舒服地, eas·y 容易, quite 相当

ODE> (especially of clothes or furnishings) providing physical ease and relaxation. – cosy, snug, warm, pleasant, enjoyable, agreeable, congenial, plush, well furnished.

349. com·mand 命令 ## 3

[kə’mænd]n.命令；指挥；掌握；[计算机] DOS命令 : 引用辅助命令处理器v.命令；指挥；掌握；博得

  • But this is not a business that can be undertaken in a day or swiftly improvised by a mere command of the will. 但是，这不是一个可以在一天内通过意志的纯粹命令一蹴而就业务。
  • As for the unfortunate people who can command everything they want, who can gratify every caprice and lay their hands on almost every object of desire – for them a new pleasure, a new excitement is only an additional satiation. 而对于不幸的人谁可以命令他们想要的一切，谁又能取悦每一个任性和染指的欲望几乎每一个对象 - 为他们一种新的乐趣，新的刺激只是无所谓的事情。
  • Not only are the means of arriving at the holiday paradise entirely within one’s own command and keeping, but the means of escape from holiday hell (if the beach proves too crowded, the local weather too inclement) are there, outside – or, as likely, part of – the tent. 不仅是完全在自己的命令，并保持在到达假日天堂的手段，而是逃离假日地狱（如海滩太挤，当地天气太恶劣）在那里，外面的手段 - 或者，如帐篷 - 的可能性较大，部分。

SEE> com·mand·er , force 力, ar·my 军队

ODE> Give an authoritative or peremptory order. – order, give orders to, give the order to, tell, direct, instruct, call on, enjoin, adjure, charge, require, prescribe.

350. com·mit·tee 委员会 ## 4

[kə’mɪti]n.委员会

  • The pie committee decided that the best way to transport the dish would be by canal, so they insured it for the trip. 馅饼委员会决定，运菜的最佳途径是通过运河水运，所以他们投了保的行程。
  • Shortly after it was launched, the pie committee went to a local inn to celebrate. 下水后不久，馅饼委员会成员们来到当地一家小酒店庆贺。
  • The pie committee telephoned a local garage owner who arrived in a recovery truck to salvage the pie dish. 馅饼委员会给当地汽车修理库老板谁在回收的卡车抵达打捞盘子。

SEE> pan·el 面板, mem·ber 成员, board 木板

ODE> A group of people appointed for a specific function by a larger group and typically consisting of members of that group. – group, advisory group, team, body, committee, jury, council, board, commission.

351. com·mon 共同 ## 7

[’kɑːmən]adj.常见的；共同的；普通的；平常的；平凡的；粗俗的n.公地；平民；普通；公园

  • All these cats had one experience in common: they had fallen off high buildings, yet only eight of them died from shock or injuries. 所有这些猫有一个共同的经历：他们已经脱落高层建筑，但只有其中的8名来自死于震荡或跌伤。
  • No creature has received more praise and abuse than the common garden snail. 没有一种生物所受到如此多的赞扬和批评花园里常见的蜗牛。
  • Who could have imagined, in the mid 1970s, for example, that by the end of the 20th century, computers would be as common in people’s homes as TV sets? 谁能够想到，20世纪70年代中期开始，例如，由20世纪末，计算机会在人们的家中为电视机常见？

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, com·mon·ly 通常, par·tic·u·lar 特定的

ODE> Occurring, found, or done often; prevalent. – usual, ordinary, customary, habitual, familiar, regular, frequent, repeated, recurrent, routine, everyday, daily, day-to-day, quotidian, standard, typical.

352. com·mon·ly 通常 ## 4

[’kɑːmənli]adv.一般地；通常地；普通地

  • Though these large machines still exist, many of their functions have been taken over by small powerful personal computers, commonly known as PCs. 虽然这种大计算机仍然存在，但它们的许多功能已被体积小功能强大的个人电脑，俗称电脑。
  • The official title of the person is ‘Justiteombudsman’, but the Swedes commonly refer to him as the ‘J.O.’ 此人官衔为“司法特派员”，但瑞典人一般都管他叫“J.O.”
  • Most animals we commonly observe do in fact age as we do, if given the chance to live long enough; and mechanical systems like a wound watch, or the sun, do in fact run out of energy in accordance with the second law of thermodynamics (whether the whole universe does so is a moot point at present). 大多数动物，我们通常看到的其实年龄，因为我们做，如果有机会到现场足够长;和机械系统像上了发条的手表，或者太阳，也实际上能根据热力学第二定律用完（整个宇宙是否如此，目前尚有争论）。

SEE> known , u·su·al·ly 通常, re·fer 提到

ODE> Very often; frequently. – often, frequently, regularly, repeatedly, recurrently, time and again, time and time again, over and over, all the time, routinely, habitually, customarily.

353. com·mu·ni·cate 沟通 ## 6

[kə’mjuːnɪkeɪt]v.传达；沟通；交流

  • Of course, Leon Bagrit could not possibly have foreseen the development of the Internet, the worldwide system that enables us to communicate instantly with anyone in any part of the world by using computers linked to telephone networks. 当然，巴格瑞特不可能预见到互联网的发展，世界范围内的系统，使我们能够立即与任何人在世界任何地方通过连接到电话网络上的计算机进行通信。
  • As Earth-dwellers, we always cherish the hope that we will be visited by little green men and that we will be able to communicate with them. 作为地球上的居民，我们总存有这样的希望，我们将通过小绿人来拜访我们，而我们可以和他们交流。
  • Knowledge began to increase as soon as the thoughts of one individual could be communicated to another by means of speech. 知识开始作为一个独立的思想可以通过语言同别人交流，以尽快提高。

SEE> un·der·stand 懂, a·ble 能够, in·ter·act

ODE> Share or exchange information, news, or ideas. – liaise, be in touch, be in contact, be in communication, make contact, have dealings, interface, commune, meet, meet up.

354. com·mu·ni·ca·tion 通讯 ## 2

[kəˌmjuːnɪ’keɪʃn]n.交流；通讯；传达；通信；沟通

  • The hovercraft is particularly useful in large areas with poor communications such as Africa or Australia; it can become a ‘flying fruit-bowl’, carrying bananas from the plantations to the ports; giant hovercraft liners could span the Atlantic; and the railway of the future may well be the ‘hovertrain’, riding on its air cushion over a single rail, which it never touches, at speeds up to 300 m.p.h. 气垫船与沟通不畅，如非洲，澳大利亚大地区特别有用。它能成为“飞行水果盘子”，从种植园动到港口的香蕉;大型的气垫班轮或许能跨越大西洋。和将来的火车或许能成为“气垫火车”，乘着气垫在单个轨道，而不接触，在速度高达300 M.P.H.
  • Once the existence of this wave-length had been discovered, it was not long before its use as the uniquely recognizable broadcasting frequency for interstellar communication was suggested. 一旦这波长度的存在被发现，没多久它作为唯一可辨认的广播频率进行星际通信使用建议之前。

SEE> fur·ther·more , fa·cil·i·tate , en·a·ble 使能够

ODE> The imparting or exchanging of information by speaking, writing, or using some other medium. – transmission, imparting, conveying, reporting, presenting, passing on, handing on, relay, conveyance, divulgence, divulgation, disclosure.

355. com·mu·ni·ty 社区 ## 6

[kə’mjuːnəti]n.社区；社会；公众；共同体；团体；共享；共有；[生]群落

  • Only in a sparsely-populated rural community is it possible to disregard it. 只有在人口稀少的农村，才可以忽视它。
  • The life history of the individual is first and foremost an accommodation to the patterns and standards traditionally handed down in his community. 个人的生活史首先是住宿，以传统在他的社区流传下来的模式和标准。
  • Competition between ourselves, person against person, community against community, still persists, however; and it is as fierce as it ever was. 我们之间的竞争战争，人与人，团体与团体，依然在进行着，但是，它是一样激烈，因为它曾经是。

SEE> well 好, part 部分, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common. – group, section, body, company, set, circle, clique, coterie, ring, band, faction.

356. com·pa·ny 公司 ## 11

[’kʌmpəni]n.公司；商号；陪伴；同伴；客人；[军]连；一群v.陪伴

  • You work for the Overseas Engineering Company, don’t you? 你在海外工程公司上班，是吗？
  • Before he retired, Frank was the head of a very large business company, but as a boy he used to work in a small shop. 他在退休前，弗兰克是一家非常大的商业公司的负责人，但作为一个男孩，他曾经工作在一个小商店。
  • When the news got round that a comedy show would be presented at our local cinema by the P. and U. Bird Seed Company, we all rushed to see it. 当消息传开喜剧节目将在我们皮尤鸟食公司当地影院介绍，大家都赶紧跑去观看。

SEE> firm 公司, busi·ness 商业, ven·ture 冒险

ODE> A commercial business. – firm, business, corporation, house, establishment, agency, office, bureau, institution, organization, operation, concern, enterprise, venture, undertaking, practice.

357. com·pare 比较 ## 6

[kəm’per]v.比较；对比；比喻n.比较；对照

  • Nothing can be compared, he maintains, with the first cockcrow, the twittering of birds at dawn, the sight of the rising sun glinting on the trees and pastures. 没有什么能比的，他坚持认为，凌晨雄鸡第一声啼叫，黎明时分小鸟呢喃，眼前升起的太阳闪闪发光的树木，草场的。
  • With what does the writer compare the Gouffre Berger? 关于什么的作家比较高弗？
  • One wants to meet like-minded collectors, to get advice, to compare notes, to exchange articles, to show off the latest find. 收藏者要会见志同道合的收藏家，以获取教益，比较笔记，交换收藏品，炫耀自己的最新发现。

SEE> com·par·i·son 对照, in·stance 例子, com·pa·ra·ble

ODE> Estimate, measure, or note the similarity or dissimilarity between. – contrast, set side by side, juxtapose, collate, differentiate, weigh up, balance, balance the differences between, measure the differences between, weigh the differences between.

358. com·pete 竞争 ## 4

[kəm’piːt]v.竞争；比赛；对抗

  • What kind of race do the children compete in? 种族种什么孩子竞争吗？
  • The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool. 孩子们相互竞争，谁先到达游泳池的另一端。
  • The last creature to compete with man was the mosquito. 最后的生物与竞争的是蚊子。

SEE> com·pe·ti·tion 竞争, com·pet·i·tive 竞争的, par·tic·i·pate

ODE> Strive to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others. – take part, play, be a contestant, be a competitor, participate, be involved, get involved, engage.

359. com·pe·ti·tion 竞争 ## 11

[ˌkɑːmpə’tɪʃn]n.竞争；比赛

  • Nearly everybody enters for ‘The Nicest Garden Competition’ each year, but Joe wins every time. 几乎每个人都在每年举办的“最佳花园竞赛”，但每次都是乔获胜。
  • Every year I enter for the garden competition too, and I always win a little prize for the worst garden in the town! 我每年的花园竞赛进入过了，我总是得全镇最差花园的小奖！
  • This last scene shows you what will happen at the end of the harvest: the famous Calabrian macaroni-eating competition! 这最后一个镜头向您展示将发生在收获的到底是什么：著名的卡拉布里亚通心粉吃的竞争！

SEE> com·pete 竞争, com·pet·i·tive 竞争的, com·pet·i·tor

ODE> The activity or condition of striving to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others. – rivalry, competitiveness, vying, contesting, opposition, contention, conflict, feuding, battling, fighting, struggling, strife, war.

360. com·plain 抱怨 ## 10

[kəm’pleɪn]vi.抱怨；控诉；诉说

  • Why did the writer complain to the people behind him? 为什么笔者抱怨他身后的人吗？
  • He started to complain about this wicked world but was interrupted by a knock at the door. 他开始抱怨世道不好，但却被敲门声打断了。
  • Almost immediately he began to complain about the weather, for even though it was still summer, it rained continually and it was often bitterly cold. 但紧接着他就开始抱怨那里的天气了。因为即使那时仍为夏季，它不断地下雨，而且常常冷得厉害。

SEE> in·sist 坚持, wor·ry 担心, say 说

ODE> Express dissatisfaction or annoyance about something. – protest, grumble, moan, whine, bleat, carp, cavil, lodge a complaint, make a complaint, make a fuss.

361. com·plaint 抱怨 ## 9

[kəm’pleɪnt]n.抱怨；疾病；诉苦；控告；投诉

  • I determined to lodge a complaint as soon as we arrived. 我决定一到站就去投诉。
  • He investigates complaints large and small that come to him from all levels of society. 他研究大，小抱怨，来找他从社会的各个层面。
  • As complaints must be made in writing, the Ombudsman receives an average of 1,200 letters a year. 由于意见必须以书面形式提出，司法特派员接收平均每年1200个字母。

SEE> law·suit , ac·cu·sa·tion , al·le·ga·tion

ODE> A statement that something is unsatisfactory or unacceptable. – protest, protestation, objection, remonstrance, statement of dissatisfaction, grievance, charge, accusation, criticism.

362. com·plete 完成 ## 12

[kəm’pliːt]adj.完整的；完成的；彻底的vt.完成；使完美；使圆满；填（表格等）

  • The house was completed five months ago. 这幢房子是5个月前完成。
  • Workers will have completed the new roads by the end of this year. 工人们将在今年年底前把新的道路。
  • A few cars, however, completed the race. 几辆车，不过，跑完了全程。

SEE> full 满的, yet 还, on·ly 只有

ODE> Having all the necessary or appropriate parts. – entire, whole, full, total, intact, uncut, unshortened, unabridged, comprehensive.

363. com·plete·ly 完全 ## 9

[kəm’pliːtli]adv.完全地；十分地；全然

  • It threatened to surround him completely, but Tazieff managed to escape just in time. 它威胁要完全包围了他，但塔捷耶夫设法逃离了。
  • Before long, the noise dropped completely and the boat began to drift gently across the water. 没过多久，噪音便彻底消失，快艇开始在水面上慢悠悠地漂流。
  • I realized sadly that I had been completely defeated by their ingenuity. 我悲哀地意识到我已被他们的足智多谋所彻底挫败。

ODE> Totally; utterly. – totally, entirely, wholly, thoroughly, fully, utterly, absolutely, perfectly, unreservedly, unconditionally, quite, altogether, downright.

364. com·plex 复杂的 ## 5

[kəm’pleks]adj.复杂的；合成的；复合的n.综合体；复合体；[医]综合症状；[心]情结

  • Justice is part of the complex machinery of the law. 正义是法律的复杂机制的组成部分。
  • Although negotiators are optimistic, the details are complex enough that they may be hard-pressed to get a deal at all. 虽然谈判持乐观态度，细节很复杂，以至于他们可能很难压在所有得到处理。
  • He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself; he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight; he realizes its volume, as the space that the shape displaces in the air. 他的大脑从全面本身就是一个复杂的形式;他知道当他看着一面是什么对方等;他把自己与形体的重心，它的质量，它的重量;他意识到物体的体积，其形状在空气中所占的空间。

SEE> com·pli·cat·ed 复杂的, struc·ture 结构, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> Consisting of many different and connected parts. – compound, composite, compounded, multiplex.

365. com·pli·cat·ed 复杂的 ## 2

[’kɑːmplɪkeɪtɪd]adj.复杂难懂的；结构复杂的动词complicate的过去式和过去分词.

  • These ocean waves are among the earth’s most complicated natural phenomena. 这些海浪属于地球上最复杂的自然现象。
  • The apparatus thus described, however, records only the horizontal component of the wave movement, which is, in fact, much more complicated. 该装置如此描述的，然而，只记录波运动，这是，在实际上，更复杂的水平分量。

SEE> dif·fi·cult 困难的, prob·lem·at·ic , in·volve 包含

ODE> Consisting of many interconnecting parts or elements; intricate. – complex, intricate, involved, convoluted, tangled, elaborate, impenetrable, knotty, tricky, thorny, serpentine, labyrinthine, tortuous, cumbersome, Byzantine, Daedalian, Gordian.

366. com·put·er 电脑 ## 21

[kəm’pjuːtər]n.电脑；计算机

  • Some really keen enthusiasts go so far as to build their own computers. 有些热衷于走那么远，以建立自己的计算机。
  • Who could have imagined, in the mid 1970s, for example, that by the end of the 20th century, computers would be as common in people’s homes as TV sets? 谁能够想到，20世纪70年代中期开始，例如，由20世纪末，计算机会在人们的家中为电视机常见？
  • In the 1970s, computers were common enough, but only in big business, government departments, and large organizations. 在20世纪70年代，计算机已经普遍不够，但只用在大公司，政府部门和大的组织。

SEE> soft·ware 软件, tech·nol·o·gy 技术, laptop

ODE> An electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program. –

367. con·cen·tra·tion 专心 ## 2

[ˌkɒnsen’treɪʃən]n.集中；专心；浓度

  • I smoked with concentration and pleasure as I was sure that this would be my last cigarette. 我聚精会神而又愉快地吸着，因为我相信这将是我最后一根烟。
  • Ethanol is more effective at a concentration of 50-70 per cent; below 20 per cent, its bactericidal action is negligible. 乙醇是在50-70％的浓度更有效;低于20％时，它的杀菌作用是可忽略的。

SEE> fur·ther·more , con·se·quent·ly , where·as 而

ODE> The action or power of focusing all one’s attention. – close attention, close thought, attentiveness, application, industry, assiduousness, single-mindedness, absorption, engrossment.

368. con·cept 概念 ## 4

[’kɑːnsept]n.观念；概念；想法

  • There are rare instances when justice almost ceases to be an abstract concept. 在极少数情况下，正义不再是一个抽象的概念。
  • But, in addition to that basically simple concept, the bank and its customer owe a large number of obligations to one another. 但是，除了这一基本的简单概念外，银行和储户的大量义务彼此。
  • Even in his philosophical probings he cannot go behind these stereotypes; his very concepts of the true and the false will still have reference to his particular traditional customs. 甚至在哲学领域的探索中，人们也无法超越这些定型的框框。他的真与伪的概念依然参照特定的传统风俗。

SEE> i·de·a 想法, no·tion , in·stance 例子

ODE> An abstract idea. – idea, notion, conception, abstraction, conceptualization.

369. con·cern 与有关 ## 5

[kən’sɜːrn]n.关心；关心的事；忧虑，担心vt.涉及；影响；关心；（使）担心n.公司；企业

  • A recent case concerns Jane Butlin whose fiancé, John, runs a successful furniture business. 最近的一个案例是关于简Butlin的未婚夫约翰，运行一个成功的家具企业。
  • One case concerns an eleven-year-old schoolgirl, Vera Petrova, who has normal vision but who can also perceive things with different parts of her skin, and through solid walls. 有一起案件涉及一个11岁的女学生，维拉佩特洛娃，谁拥有正常视力，但谁也能感知的东西和她皮肤的不同部位，并通过坚实的墙壁。
  • In fact a basic amount of movement occurs during sleep which is specifically concerned with preventing muscle inactivity. 实际上移动的基本的量，其具体涉及防止肌肉活动停止睡眠期间发生。

SEE> con·cerned 关心的, wor·ry 担心, doubt 怀疑

ODE> Relate to; be about. – be about, deal with, cover, treat, have to do with.

370. con·clude 得出结论 ## 3

[kən’kluːd]vt.推断出；缔结；使结束vi.结束；总结；作决定；作协议

  • I concluded that they were simply shy of strangers. 我的结论是，他们只是怕生人。
  • A young man sees a sunset and, unable to understand or to express the emotion that it rouses in him, concludes that it must be the gateway to a world that lies beyond. 一个年轻人看到日落，由于无法理解或者说，它在他唤起来表达情感，得出结论认为，它必须是通往世界深藏超越。
  • We must conclude from the work of those who have studied the origin of life, that given a planet only approximately like our own, life is almost certain to start. 我们必须从那些谁研究生命起源的工作总结，给定一个星球上大约只有像我们自己，生活几乎肯定会产生。

SEE> con·clu·sion 结论, in·deed 确实, a·gree 同意

ODE> Bring or come to an end. – finish, end, come to an end, draw to a close, wind up, be over, stop, terminate, close, cease.

371. con·clu·sion 结论 ## 5

[kən’kluːʒn]n.结尾；结论；结束

  • In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences – most of them wildly improbable. 大部分是牵强附会，不可思议 - 在十九世纪时，小说家将通过一系列的巧合他的读者带来了他的故事的一个结论。
  • She reluctantly came to the conclusion that Bessie was drunk. 她不得不认定贝西是喝醉了。
  • Without it, nothing could ever be brought to a conclusion; everything would be in a state of chaos. 没有它，没有什么能带来一个结论;一切都将是混乱的状态。

SEE> con·clude 得出结论, in·deed 确实, out·set

ODE> The end or finish of an event, process, or text. – end, ending, finish, close, closure, termination, wind-up, cessation.

372. con·crete 具体的 ## 2

[’kɑːŋkriːt]adj.具体的；实质性的；混凝土的n.水泥；混凝土；具体物v.凝结；结合

  • The towers are built on immense underwater platforms made of steel and concrete. 该塔建在由钢和混凝土的巨大的水下平台。
  • Even if one didn’t know from concrete examples (the 1936 Olympic Games, for instance) that international sporting contests lead to orgies of hatred, one could deduce it from general principles. 一个人即使不能从具体的事例（如1936年奥林匹克运动会）了解到国际运动比赛会导致疯狂的仇恨知道，人们可以从一般的原则推断出这一点。

SEE> build·ing 建筑, brick 砖块, con·struct 建造

ODE> Existing in a material or physical form; not abstract. – solid, material, real, physical, tangible, touchable, tactile, palpable, visible, existing.

373. con·di·tion 条件 ## 21

[kən’dɪʃn]n.条件；情况v.训练；决定；以 … 为条件；护理（头发）

  • By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing. 到了这个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。
  • Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey – still in perfect condition. 想象一下，他们惊讶和高兴，当他们拆开包装箱的情况下，发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 - 完好无损。
  • The busmen have stated that the strike will continue until general agreement is reached about pay and working conditions. 司机们声称罢工将持续到就工资和工作条件达成全面协议。

SEE> al·though 虽然, nei·ther 两者都不, un·clear

ODE> The state of something with regard to its appearance, quality, or working order. – state, shape, order.

374. con·fi·dence 信心 ## 4

[’kɑːnfɪdəns]n.信任；把握；信心；知心话adj.骗得信任的

  • After having been instructed to drive out of town, I began to acquire confidence. 被告知将带动镇出来后，我开始有了信心。
  • During that time she so gained my aunt’s confidence, that she was put in charge of the domestic staff. 在此期间，她赢得了姑母的赏识，甚至当上了大管家的。
  • This is a sceptical age, but although our faith in many of the things in which our forefathers fervently believed has weakened, our confidence in the curative properties of the bottle of medicine remains the same as theirs. 这是一个怀疑一切的时代，可是虽然我们中的许多，使我们的祖先笃信的事情的信心有所减弱，我们对瓶装药品疗效的信心仍与祖先一样。

SEE> op·ti·mism , doubt 怀疑, con·fi·dent 信心

ODE> The feeling or belief that one can have faith in or rely on someone or something. – trust, belief, faith, credence, conviction.

375. con·fi·dent 信心 ## 2

[’kɒnfədənt]adj.自信的；有信心的；有把握的

  • In spite of this, many people are confident that ‘The Revealer’ may reveal something of value fairly soon. 尽管如此，很多人仍然相信“探宝器”很快就会探出值钱的东西。
  • Though they are running out of food and drink, the men are cheerful and confident that they will get out soon. 虽然他们的食物和饮料的不多了，人的心情很好，坚信他们很快就会出来的。

SEE> sat·is·fied 满意, op·ti·mis·tic , pleased 高兴

ODE> Feeling or showing confidence in oneself or one’s abilities or qualities. – self-assured, assured, sure of oneself, self-confident, positive.

376. con·fine 局限 ## 3

[kən’faɪn]vt.限制；禁闭n.范围；界限；约束；限制

  • He had had a long and uncomfortable trip, for he had been confined to the wooden box for over eighteen hours. 他经历了一次漫长而又难受的旅程，因为他已经被限制在木箱了18个多小时。
  • Soon the hobby leads to travel, perhaps to a meeting in another town, possibly a trip abroad in search of a rare specimen, for collectors are not confined to any one country. 不久，有这种爱好旅行，也许是去另一个城市参加会议，可能是在寻找一件珍品的出国，因为收藏家是不局限于任何一个国家。
  • Our knowledge of the oceans a hundred years ago was confined to the two-dimensional shape of the sea surface and the hazards of navigation presented by the irregularities in depth of the shallow water close to the land. 我们的海洋一百年前的知识仅限于海面的二维形状和导航的浅水接近土地的深浅不一提出的危害。

SEE> like·wise , last·ly , in·struct

ODE> Keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits of (space, scope, or time) – enclose, incarcerate, imprison, intern, impound, hold captive, trap.

377. con·firm 确认 ## 5

[kən’fɜːrm]v.证实；批准；确定

  • My employer will confirm that I was there on time.’ 我的雇主会证明我是准时到达。”
  • It immediately ran away when she saw it, and experts confirmed that a puma will not attack a human being unless it is cornered. 它就立刻逃走了，当她看见了，专家证实，除非被逼得走投无路，美洲狮不会攻击人类。
  • This was later confirmed by a naval official at the Ministry of Defence after the Elkor had returned home. 这是后来由国防部一位海军官员证实了Elkor回家后。

SEE> nei·ther 两者都不, un·clear , nor 也不

ODE> Establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed or suspected to be the case) – find out, discover, come to know, get to know, work out, make out, fathom, fathom out, become aware of, learn, ferret out, dig out, dig up, establish, fix, determine, settle, decide, verify, make certain of, confirm, deduce, divine, intuit, diagnose, discern, perceive, see, realize, appreciate, identify, pin down, recognize, register, understand, grasp, take in, comprehend.

378. con·flict 冲突 ## 2

[’kɑːnflɪkt]n.冲突；战斗；矛盾；斗争vi.冲突；抵触；争执

  • It was Hart who created the basic formula of the Western film, and devised the protagonist he played in every film he made, the good-bad man, the accidental-noble outlaw, or the honest-but-framed cowboy, or the sheriff made suspect by vicious gossip; in short, the individual in conflict with himself and his frontier environment. 这是哈特谁创造了西部电影的基本公式，并设计了他，他拍的电影几乎扮演主角，好的坏的男人，意外贵金属逃犯，诚实的，但是，遭陷害的牛仔或司法官。因流言蜚语怀疑;总之，在与他自己和他的拓荒环境相矛盾的人物。
  • And although no period or place in American history has been more absurdly romanticized, myth and reality did join hands in at least one arena, the conflict between the individual and encroaching civilization. 虽然在美国历史上没有任何时期或地方已被荒谬地浪漫主义，神话和现实都携手至少在某一个舞台，个人与渐渐渗入的文明之间的冲突。

SEE> war 战争, con·fron·ta·tion , on·go·ing

ODE> A serious disagreement or argument, typically a protracted one. – dispute, quarrel, squabble, disagreement, difference of opinion, dissension.

379. con·front 面对 ## 2

[kən’frʌnt]vt.对抗；遭遇；面临

  • Precautions of this sort are necessary, for it is impossible to foretell the exact nature of the difficulties which will confront the pot-holer. 作出这样的准备是必要的，因为它是无法预见到将面临锅holer困难的确切性质。
  • No necessity of making a living away from home results in neglect of children, and no father is confronted with his inability to ‘buy’ an education for his child. 在儿童的忽视使生活远离家乡的结果没有必要，也没有父亲面临无力为“买入”的教育他的孩子。

SEE> con·vinced , in·deed 确实, un·doubt·ed·ly

ODE> Come face to face with (someone) with hostile or argumentative intent. – challenge, square up to, oppose, resist, defy, beard, tackle, attack, assault.

380. con·fu·sion 混乱 ## 2

[kən’fjuːʒən]n.惶惑；混淆；混乱；不确定状态

  • Only two stray dogs benefited from all this confusion, for they greedily devoured what was left of the cake. 只有两只野狗从这一片混乱中得到好处，它们贪婪地吃掉了剩下的蛋糕。
  • Looking into the drawing room, she saw a scene of confusion over by her writing desk. 展望客厅，她看到混乱的场面在她的办公桌。

SEE> mis·un·der·stand·ing , un·cer·tain·ty , cha·os

ODE> Uncertainty about what is happening, intended, or required. – uncertainty, lack of certainty, unsureness, indecision, hesitation, hesitancy, scepticism, doubt, ignorance.

381. con·nect 连接 ## 4

[kə’nekt]v.连接；接通；联系

  • It was officially opened on March 7, 1994, finally connecting Britain to the European continent. 它正式于1994年3月7日开通，将英国连接欧洲大陆。
  • you can hear the clock when it is actually striking because microphones are connected to the clock tower. 你可以听到时钟时，它实际上是惊人的，因为麦克风连接到钟楼。
  • The Great St. Bernard Pass connects Switzerland to Italy. 大圣伯纳德山口连接着瑞士与意大利。

SEE> link 链接, en·a·ble 使能够, com·mu·ni·cate 沟通

382. con·se·quence 后果 ## 3

[’kɑːnsəkwens]n.结果；后果；重要性；影响

  • What was the consequence of the editor’s insistence on facts and statistics? 什么是编辑对事实和统计数字坚持的后果是什么？
  • He has deliberately chosen to lead the life he leads and is fully aware of the consequences. 他是故意在选择过那种生活的，并完全清楚后果的生活。
  • His telescopic observations are justly immortal; they aroused great interest at the time, they had important theoretical consequences, and they provided a striking demonstration of the potentialities hidden in instruments and apparatus. 他的望远镜的观察结果当然是不朽;他们在当时引起了极大的兴趣，具有重要的理论意义，而且提供隐藏在仪表和仪器的潜在力量的示范。

SEE> con·se·quent·ly , fur·ther·more , re·sult 结果

ODE> A result or effect, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant. – result, upshot, outcome, out-turn, sequel, effect, reaction, repercussion, reverberations, ramification, end, end result, conclusion, termination, culmination, denouement, corollary, concomitant, aftermath, fruit, fruits, product, produce, by-product.

383. con·sid·er 考虑 ## 8

[kən’sɪdər]v.考虑；思考；认为；体谅；注视

  • In the early morning, the food that had been laid out for the dead is thrown into a river or into the sea as it is considered unlucky for anyone living to eat it. 清晨，人们便把为死者摆放的食品扔进河中或因为它被认为是不吉利的生活的人吃了大海。
  • Though Verrazano is by no means considered to be a great explorer, his name will probably remain immortal, for on November 21st, 1964, the longest suspension bridge in the world was named after him. 虽然维拉萨诺绝不认为是一个伟大的探险家，他的名字将流芳百世，对1964年11月21日，世界上最长的吊桥是以他的名字命名的。
  • Considering the amount she paid, he was dear in more ways than one! 考虑到她所支付的金额，他在不止一个方面亲爱的！

SEE> con·sid·er·ing , should 应该, re·gard 看待

ODE> Think carefully about (something), typically before making a decision. – think about, contemplate, give thought to, reflect on, examine, appraise, review.

384. con·sid·er·a·ble 大量的 ## 8

[kən’sɪdərəbl]adj.重要的；相当大的；可观的

  • Kidnappers are rarely interested in animals, but they recently took considerable interest in Mrs. Eleanor Ramsay’s cat. 绑架者很少对动物感兴趣，但他们最近参加了拉姆齐太太的猫相当大的兴趣。
  • For them this is a major operation which involves considerable planning. 对他们来说，这是一个涉及到大量的规划的主要操作。
  • When she came in with the last course – a huge pudding – she tripped on the carpet and the pudding went flying through the air, narrowly missed my aunt, and crashed on the dining table with considerable force. 当她端着最后一道菜 - 一大盘布丁 - 她绊倒在地毯上的布丁经历了空中飞行，差一点我的姑姑，并坠毁，机上有相当大的力量的餐桌。

SEE> sub·stan·tial 大量的, e·nor·mous 巨大的, im·mense

ODE> Notably large in size, amount, or extent. – sizeable, substantial, appreciable, significant.

385. con·sid·er·a·bly 相当大地 ## 3

[kən’sɪdərəbli]adv.非常地；相当地；颇

  • On this occasion, however, it had slowed down considerably. 在此之际，但是，它已经大大放缓。
  • If a shop assistant told him she had not heard of it, he would pretend to be considerably put out. 要是女售货员告诉他从未听说过的话，他会假装是相当扑灭。
  • The degree of secrecy naturally varies considerably. 保密程度自然差别很大。

SEE> sub·stan·tial·ly 基本上, dra·mat·i·cal·ly 显著地, noticeably

ODE> By a notably large amount or to a notably large extent; greatly. – greatly, much, very much, a great deal, a lot, lots, a fair amount.

386. con·sid·er·a·tion 考虑 ## 3

[kənˌsɪdə’reɪʃn]n.考虑；体贴；考虑因素；敬重；意见

  • It has expanded without any idea of the true nature of the human beings who run the machines, and without giving any consideration to the effects produced on the individuals and on their descendants by the artificial mode of existence imposed by the factory. 它没有谁操作机器的人的本质的任何想法有所扩大，并没有给予任何考虑对个人和他们的后裔由厂家规定存在的人工方式产生的效果。
  • Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training, for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer. 除了任何道义问题，这是一种愚蠢的训练方法，因为这种方法愤懑动物谁在后一阶段可能会变成杀手。
  • In the first place, any scientific study requires that there be no preferential weighting of one or another of the items in the series it selects for its consideration. 首先，任何科学研究都要求存在一个或另一个则选择供其审议一系列的项目没有优先权。

SEE> re·gard 看待, con·sid·er 考虑, ap·pro·pri·ate 适当

ODE> Careful thought, typically over a period of time. – thought, deliberation, reflection, contemplation, cogitation, rumination, pondering, meditation, musing, mulling, examination, inspection, scrutiny, analysis, review, discussion.

387. con·sist 组成 ## 7

[kən’sɪst]vi.由 … 组成；构成；在于；符合

  • Though the costume consisted only of a sheet, it was very effective. 尽管化装服仅由一个被单的，这是非常有效的。
  • The place consisted of a straggling unmade road which was lined on either side by small houses. 这个地方包括，将其用小房子两边排列着一个掉队作废了道路。
  • Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books, china, glass, antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals, there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books. 无论它的组成邮票，唱片，书籍，瓷器，玻璃，古董家具，绘画，模型汽车，鸟类标本，玩具动物初版，总有一些东西与它连接的事，找到可以在正确的地方最新加入，以核对参考书中的事实。

SEE> com·prise , where·as 而, fur·ther·more

ODE> Be composed or made up of. – be composed, be made up, be formed.

388. con·stant·ly 一直地 ## 4

[’kɑːnstəntli]adv.不断地；经常地

  • Car alarms constantly scream at us in the street and are a source of profound irritation. 汽车警报不断对我们在街上吼叫，这是人们极度烦燥的一个来源。
  • Against these figures, it was found that only 5% of women snore regularly, while the rest are constantly woken or kept awake by their trumpeting partners. 与这些数字相比，人们发现，只有5％的女性经常打鼾，而其余则经常被唤醒或他们像吹号清醒保持。
  • He was constantly on the move, drawing the Danes after him. 他不停地移动，牵着敌人的鼻子在他之后。

SEE> con·tin·u·al·ly , con·tin·u·ous·ly 连续不断地, fre·quent·ly 经常

ODE> Continuously over a period of time; always. – always, all the time, the entire time, continually, continuously, persistently, repeatedly, regularly.

389. con·struct 建造 ## 4

[kən’strʌkt]vt.建造；构筑；造(句)n.构想

  • The actual figure was made of copper supported by a metal framework which had been especially constructed by Eiffel. 实际数字是由通过已经由艾菲尔特制的金属框架支撑铜。
  • One difficulty is to construct the agreements. 困难之一是这些协议。
  • Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society, one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying sufficient details to enable the thing to be constructed. 想象一下，在一个相当先进的技术社会，人们仍然不具备弹，使其认识的可能性，提供足够的细节，以使事情要构造的效果。

SEE> build 建造, fur·ther·more , en·a·ble 使能够

ODE> Build or make (something, typically a building, road, or machine) – build, erect, put up, set up, raise, establish, assemble, manufacture, fabricate, form, fashion, contrive, create, make.

390. con·sult 请教 ## 2

[kən’sʌlt]v.查阅；请教；商讨；就诊

  • After consulting my railway timetable, I noted with satisfaction that there was an express train to Westhaven. 我查看了列车时刻表，满意地指出，有快车不可动摇的信念。
  • Bruce consulted the map once more and told us that the village was now only fifteen miles away. 布鲁斯地图再一次告诉我们，村里现在只有15英里远。

SEE> ad·vise 劝告, in·form 通知, in·struct

ODE> Seek information or advice from (someone, especially an expert or professional) – ask, seek advice from, seek information from, take counsel from, call in, call on, call upon, turn to, have recourse to.

391. con·tact 联系 ## 2

[’kɑːntækt]n.接触；联系；熟人v.(与)联系；(与)接触adj.接触的

  • In so far as any inquiry is a secret one, it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities, or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm. 在迄今为止的任何调查都涉及到保密，自然受到了限制所有从事从有效接触与他们的同胞科学家们无论是在其他国家或大学，甚至往往不能在同一公司的其他部门实施它。
  • But here we come up against the most difficult of all obstacles to contact with people on other planets – the astronomical distances which separate us. 但在这里我们遇到了最困难的与人在其他星球上接触的一切障碍 - 是分隔我们的天文距离。

SEE> di·rect 直接, call 呼叫, al·though 虽然

ODE> The state of physical touching. – touch, touching.

392. con·tain 包含 ## 21

[kən’teɪn]vt.容纳；包含；抑制；克制vi.自制

  • It contained ￡50. 它包含了£50。
  • It had been wrapped up in newspaper and it contained half the money he had lost, together with a note which said: ‘A thief, yes, but only 50 per cent a thief!’ 它是用报纸包着的，一个纸条，上面写着含有一半，他已经失去了钱，一起：“一个小偷，是的，但只有50％的小偷！”
  • When a plane from London arrived at Sydney airport, workers began to unload a number of wooden boxes which contained clothing. 当一架飞机从伦敦抵达悉尼机场时，工人们开始卸下大批装有衣服的木箱。

SEE> in·stance 例子, more·o·ver 此外, fur·ther·more

ODE> Have or hold (someone or something) within. – hold, have capacity for, have room for, have seating for, have space for, carry, accommodate, seat.

393. con·tem·po·rar·y 当代 ## 2

[kən’tempəreri]adj.同时代的；当代的n.同时代的人；同龄人

  • Unlike most of his contemporaries in Hollywood, Hart actually knew something of the old West. 不像大多数他在好莱坞的同时代人，他确实了解老西的东西。
  • The contemporary phenomenon of car worship is to be explained not least by the sense of independence and freedom that ownership entails. 崇拜汽车现象可以通过独立和自由与所有权相伴的意义来解释并非最不重要的。

394. con·tent 内容 ## 2

[’kɑːntent]n. 内容； 目录； 含量adj. 满足的； 满意的vt. 使 … 满足； 使 … 安心

  • It is impossible to make more than the wildest guess at how many they kill, but they are hungry creatures, not content with only three meals a day. 这是不可能做出比最大胆的猜测更在他们杀了多少，但它们是吃不饱的动物，而不是满足于一日三餐。
  • I should wish to die while still at work, knowing that others will carry on what I can no longer do, and content in the thought that what was possible has been done. 我希望在工作中，同时仍死，知道别人会继续我再也不能做的，在想到什么是可能已经完成的内容。

SEE> in·stance 例子, fur·ther·more , like·wise

ODE> In a state of peaceful happiness. – contented, satisfied, pleased.

395. con·test 竞赛 ## 2

[’kɑːntest]n.竞赛；比赛vt.驳斥；争取vi.奋斗

  • Even if one didn’t know from concrete examples (the 1936 Olympic Games, for instance) that international sporting contests lead to orgies of hatred, one could deduce it from general principles. 一个人即使不能从具体的事例（如1936年奥林匹克运动会）了解到国际运动比赛会导致疯狂的仇恨知道，人们可以从一般的原则推断出这一点。
  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。

SEE> com·pe·ti·tion 竞争, chal·lenge 挑战, in·stance 例子

ODE> An event in which people compete for supremacy in a sport or other activity, or in a quality. – competition, match, tournament, game, meet.

396. con·ti·nent 大陆 ## 8

[’kɒntɪnənt]n.大陆；洲；(the Continent)欧洲大陆

  • It was officially opened on March 7, 1994, finally connecting Britain to the European continent. 它正式于1994年3月7日开通，将英国连接欧洲大陆。
  • It overran a whole continent. 它占领了整个大陆。
  • It effectively spread the disease all over the continent and drastically reduced the rabbit population. 它有效地传播本病遍布大陆，大大降低了兔子的人口。

SEE> in·deed 确实, na·tion 国家, coun·try 国家

ODE> Any of the world’s main continuous expanses of land (Europe, Asia, Africa, North and South America, Australia, Antarctica). – mainland.

397. con·tin·ue 持续 ## 9

[kən’tɪnjuː]v.继续；连续；维持；持续

  • The snake, however, continued to ‘dance’ slowly. 蛇，然而，持续地“舞动”慢。
  • She was soon out of breath, but she continued to run. 她很快就气喘吁吁了，但她还是继续运行。
  • I continued driving and after some time, the examiner tapped loudly. 我继续往前开了一段时间后，主考人砰砰地敲。

SEE> should 应该, will 将, keep 保持

ODE> Persist in an activity or process. – carry on with, go on with, keep on with, proceed with, pursue.

398. con·tin·u·ous·ly 连续不断地 ## 5

[kən’tɪnjuəsli]adv.不断地；连续地

  • These lights flickered continuously like traffic lights which have gone mad. 这些灯闪烁不断像交通信号灯具有疯了。
  • In the eerie silence of the cavern, the only sound that could be heard was made by water which dripped continuously from the high dome above them. 洞里有一种可怕的寂静，也可以听见的声响是由从高高的圆顶上不断滴下的水制成。
  • Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished. 哈丽特姑妈统率着他们不停地擦拭，清扫，刷洗一支看不见的佣人大军。

SEE> con·tin·u·al·ly , con·stant·ly 一直地, si·mul·ta·ne·ous·ly

ODE> Without interruption or gaps. –

399. con·trast 对比 ## 4

[’kɑːntræst]n.对比；差别；对照物v.对比；成对照n.[计算机] 反差

  • It’s as if they were, in some sense, cosmic beings in violent and lovely contrast with us suburban creatures. 这是因为如果他们成功了，在某种意义上，宇宙人，同我们这些凡夫俗子暴力而鲜明的对照。
  • But, in contrast, it is only in modern times that Galileo has become a problem child for historians of science. 但是，与此相反，它只是在近代伽利略也成了问题孩子对于科学史家。
  • An old watch, by contrast, becomes so worn and unreliable that it eventually is not worth mending. 一块旧手表，相比之下，磨损太厉害，不可靠了，最终不值得修理。

SEE> sim·i·lar·ly 同样, where·as 而, un·like 不像

ODE> The state of being strikingly different from something else in juxtaposition or close association. – difference, dissimilarity, disparity, dissimilitude, distinction, contradistinction, divergence, variance, variation, differentiation.

400. con·trol 控制 ## 10

[kən’troʊl]n.掌控；控制；管制；克制；操作装置v.控制；支配；掌管；抑制；克制

  • Firemen had been fighting the forest fire for nearly three weeks before they could get it under control. 消防员已经场森林大火搏斗了将近3个星期才可以把火势控制住。
  • Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run. 尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，他在控制汽车，因为轮胎在第一次运行时突发很大的困难。
  • The officer in the control tower was very angry when he heard the news, because balloons can be a great danger to aircraft. 在控制塔上的官员非常生气，当他听到这个消息，因为气球有可能有很大的危险飞机。

SEE> take 拿取, how·ev·er 然而, turn 转动

ODE> The power to influence or direct people’s behaviour or the course of events. – jurisdiction, sway, power, authority, command, dominance, domination, government, mastery, leadership, rule, reign, sovereignty, supremacy, ascendancy, predominance, hegemony.

401. con·ven·tion 惯例 ## 2

[kən’venʃn]n.大会；协定；惯例；公约

  • They disregard social conventions without being conscious that they are doing anything extraordinary. 他们不顾社会习俗，意识不到自己所作所为有什么特殊之处。
  • Indeed, the concept of free speech only exists in our modern society because when you are inside a community, you are conditioned by the conventions of the community to such a degree that it is very difficult to conceive of anything really destructive. 事实上，因为当你是一个社区里面，你是社区到这种程度的约定条件，这是很难以想象的事情真的破坏言论自由的概念只存在于我们现代社会中存在。

SEE> gath·er·ing , con·fer·ence 会议, in·stance 例子

ODE> A way in which something is usually done. – custom, practice, habit, tradition, convention, routine, rule, rite, ritual, observance, ordinance, ceremony, ceremonial.

402. con·ver·sa·tion 会话 ## 6

[ˌkɑːnvər’seɪʃn]n.谈话；会话

  • What is the favourite subject of conversation in England? 什么是谈话的英格兰最喜欢的科目？
  • It’s our favourite subject of conversation. 这是我们最喜欢谈论的话题。
  • ‘This is a private conversation!’ “这是私人间的谈话！”

SEE> dis·cus·sion 讨论, talk 谈论, af·ter·ward

ODE> A talk, especially an informal one, between two or more people, in which news and ideas are exchanged. – discussion, talk, chat, gossip, tête-à-tête, heart-to-heart, head-to-head, exchange, dialogue, parley, consultation, conference.

403. con·vert 转换 ## 2

[kən’vɜːrt]v.(使)转变；使…改变信仰；转化；兑换；换算n.皈依者；改变信仰的人

  • The shop was an old converted house with many large, disused fireplaces and tall, narrow chimneys. 这家店的老改造的房子有许多废置不用的大壁炉和又高又窄的烟囱。
  • Over the periods their saliva, a mild, digestive juice like our own, was converted into a poison that defies analysis even today. 经过漫长的时间他们的唾液，一种温和的消化液像我们自己，被改装成毒仍无法分析即使到了今天。

SEE> con·ver·sion , like·wise , a·ble 能够

ODE> Change the form, character, or function of something. – change, turn, transform, metamorphose, transfigure, transmute, translate.

404. con·vince 使相信 ## 2

[kən’vɪns]vt.使确信；使信服；说服

  • The experts were now fully convinced that the animal was a puma, but where had it come from? 现在专家们充分肯定那只动物就是美洲狮，但如果有它从何而来？
  • He was greeted by an unpleasant smell which convinced him that I was telling the truth. 他被这让他相信我说的是真话难闻的气味招呼。

SEE> per·suade 说服, con·vinced , ea·ger

ODE> Cause (someone) to believe firmly in the truth of something. – persuade, satisfy, prove to, cause to feel certain.

405. cook 烹饪 ## 6

[kʊk]n.厨师；炊事员v.烹调；烧煮；捏造；纂改(账目)

  • As soon as this was done, they cooked a meal over an open fire. 只要这事就上烧起了饭明火。
  • Why did Jane cook John’s wallet? 没有简为什么厨师约翰的钱包？
  • When they got home, Jane cooked their dinner in the microwave oven and without realizing it, cooked her fiancé’s wallet as well. 当他们回家后，简熟烤箱微波炉和没有意识到他们的晚餐，煮她的未婚夫的钱包也。

SEE> fry 油炸, bak·er , cook·ing 烹饪

ODE> Prepare (food, a dish, or a meal) by mixing, combining, and heating the ingredients. – prepare, make, get, put together.

406. cook·er 厨灶 ## 3

[’kʊkər]n.炉具；烹饪用的水果
