  • There is an electric cooker in the kitchen. 有厨房的电饭煲。
  • The cooker is blue. 电磁炉是蓝色的。

ODE> An appliance used for cooking food, typically consisting of an oven, hob, and grill and powered by gas or electricity. –

407. cool 凉爽的 ## 4

[kuːl]adj.凉爽的；凉的；冷静的；冷漠的vt.(使)变凉；(使)冷却；(使)冷静vi.变凉；冷静下来n.凉爽；冷静；凉快adv.冷静地

  • I stopped to let the car cool off and to study the map. 我停下车，让汽车发动机冷却一下，同时查看一下地图。
  • But, if this world is not merely a bad joke, life a vulgar flare amid the cool radiance of the stars, and existence an empty laugh braying across the mysteries; if these intimations of a something behind and beyond are not evil humour born of indigestion, or whimsies sent by the devil to mock and madden us, if, in a word, beauty means something, yet we must not seek to interpret the meaning. 但是，如果这个世界不只是一个拙劣的恶作剧，生活庸俗火炬惨淡的星光里的清凉四射，并且存在一个空虚的笑声奥秘马叫;如果后面的东西的暗示和超越都没有邪念的，或者不是一种魔鬼送来嘲笑我们并使我们发狂，如果在一个字，美指什么，但我们千万不要去阐明它的意义邪念。
  • Drinks can be cooled by placing them on ice rather than adding ice to them. 饮料可以通过将它们放置在冰上，而不是把冰块加冷却。

SEE> warm 暖, hot 热, cold 寒冷的

ODE> Of or at a fairly low temperature. – chilly, cold.

408. cop·y 副本 ## 4

[’kɑːpi]n.复制品；抄本；副本；一册；一份v.复制；抄写；抄袭

  • But the copy he gave him had not been written out in full as usual. 但复制就给他完全像往常一样没有写出来。
  • Much to the aristocrat’s amusement, the gaoler returned a few moments later with a pair of glasses and the usual copy of the letter which he proceeded to read to the prisoner. 多以贵族的娱乐，狱卒返回几分钟后用一副眼镜和字母的通常的副本，他着手囚犯念了起来。
  • When he denied the train’s existence, I borrowed his copy of the timetable. 当他否认了火车的存在，我借用了他的时间表的副本。

SEE> in·stance 例子, print 脚印, doc·u·ment 文献

ODE> A thing made to be similar or identical to another. – duplicate, duplication, reprint, facsimile, photocopy, carbon copy, carbon, mimeograph, mimeo.

409. cor·ner 角落 ## 3

[’kɔːrnər]n.角落；转角；困境v.将 … 逼入困境；转弯；垄断adj.位于角落的

  • It immediately ran away when she saw it, and experts confirmed that a puma will not attack a human being unless it is cornered. 它就立刻逃走了，当她看见了，专家证实，除非被逼得走投无路，美洲狮不会攻击人类。
  • The men of our family waded down through our flooded meadows with boathooks, in the hope of being able to grapple a corner of the raft and pull it out of the current towards our bank. 我们家的男人们涉水下来通过我们的水淹没草场boathooks，在能够钩住筏子一角，将它向我们银行目前的希望。
  • I landed up at the same corner. 我登陆了在同一角落。

SEE> edge 边缘, in·side 内, out·side 外面

ODE> A place or angle where two sides or edges meet. – corner, intersection, point, apex, cusp.

410. cor·rect 正确 ## 2

[kə’rekt]adj.正确的；得体的v.改正；纠正

  • Once, however, it failed to give the correct time. 然而有一次，它却把正确的时间。
  • It is a strange thought, but I believe a correct one, that twenty or thirty pages of ideas and information would be capable of turning the present-day world upside down, or even destroying it. 这是一个奇怪的想法，但我相信正确的，二三十页的想法和信息将能够转动当今世界颠倒，甚至毁灭它。

SEE> in·cor·rect , wrong 错误, fix 固定

ODE> Free from error; in accordance with fact or truth. – right, accurate, true, veracious, exact, precise, unerring, faithful, strict, faultless, flawless, errorless, error-free, perfect, word-perfect, scrupulous, meticulous.

411. cost 价钱为 ## 19

[kɔːst]n.费用；成本；代价；[律]诉讼费用v.花费；使付出；使做不愉快的事；估算成本

  • How much does this house cost? 这个多少房子成本是多少？
  • How much does it cost? 它要多少钱？
  • It costs five hundred pounds. 它的售价是500英镑。

SEE> pay 支付, ex·pense 花费, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> (of an object or action) require the payment of (a specified sum of money) before it can be acquired or done. – be priced at, sell for, be valued at, fetch, come to, amount to, be.

412. cot·tage 村舍 ## 2

[’kɑːtɪdʒ]n.小屋；村舍

  • I had come ten miles since leaving the town, and at this point, according to my father, I should be looking at farms and cottages in a valley, with the spire of the church of our village showing in the far distance. 从小镇我了10英里，而在这一点上，根据我的父亲，我应该寻找一个山谷，有农场与村舍，与我们村在远远望见教堂的塔尖。
  • I could see no valley, no farms, no cottages and no church spire – only a lake. 我却看不到山谷，没有农场，没有别墅和无教堂的尖顶 - 只是一片湖泊。

SEE> man·sion , bed·room 卧室, be·side 在旁边

ODE> A small house, typically one in the country. – small house, house, bungalow, villa, lodge, chalet, cabin, shack, shanty.

413. cot·ton 棉花 ## 2

[’kɑːtn]n.棉花；棉制品；棉布

  • I tried to say something, but my mouth was full of cotton wool. 我想说点什么，但我嘴里塞满了药棉。
  • When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth, I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth. 最后，当牙医移除从我嘴中药棉，我可以告诉他，他拔错了牙。

SEE> wool 羊毛, cloth 布料, crop 作物

ODE> A soft white fibrous substance which surrounds the seeds of the cotton plant and is made into textile fibre and thread for sewing. – thread, cotton, wool, fibre, filament, strand.

[kəd]aux.可以；能；可能；can的过去式

  • Why couldn’t Nigel decide? 不奈杰尔为什么可以决定？
  • I could answer sixteen of the questions. 我能回答的16道题。
  • But I couldn’t answer the rest. 但我不能回答的休息。

SEE> would 将, might 也许, like·ly 可能的

415. count 数数 ## 3

[kaʊnt]v.计算；视为；依赖；重要，有价值n.计数；总数n.伯爵（欧洲国家的贵族头衔）

  • I counted seven old cars and three old refrigerators. 我数了7辆旧汽车和3台上旧冰箱。
  • However, he had at last been allowed to send a fax in which he informed the editor that he had been arrested while counting the 1,084 steps leading to the fifteen-foot wall which surrounded the president’s palace. 不过，他终于获准发中，他获知，虽然计数1084个步骤导致十五英尺高的墙，其包围了总统府，他已被捕编辑传真。
  • He insisted on the assistant’s counting the money before he left – 30,000 pennies in all! 他坚持要店员的他离开前数钱 - 共有30,000便士！

SEE> in·stance 例子, ac·tu·al·ly 其实, like·wise

ODE> Determine the total number of (a collection of items) – add up, add together, find the sum of, sum up, reckon up, figure up, calculate, compute, enumerate, total, tally, add.

416. coun·ter 柜台 ## 4

[’kaʊntər]n.柜台；筹码；计数器；反驳adj.相反的adv.与…相反地v.反对；反击

  • The lady who is standing behind the counter. 谁站在柜台后面的那位女士。
  • The books which are on the counter. 这是在柜台上的书。
  • As it was extremely heavy, he dumped it on the counter. 由于这是极其沉重的，他甩在柜台上。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, in·stance 例子, like·wise

ODE> A long flat-topped fitment across which business is conducted in a shop or bank or refreshments are served in a cafeteria. – worktop, work surface, worktable, table, bench, buffet, top, horizontal surface.

417. coun·try 国家 ## 52

[’kʌntri]n.国家；乡村；区域；乡村音乐adj.乡村的；国家的；故乡的；乡村音乐的

418. coun·try·side 乡村 ## 5

[’kʌntrisaɪd]n.乡下；农村

  • I sat in the front of the bus to get a good view of the countryside. 我坐在公共汽车的前部，以便饱览农村的景色。
  • A short time before, great trees had covered the countryside for miles around. 就在不久之前，参天大树还覆盖着方圆数英里的土地。
  • It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside. 令人不安的是认为一个危险的野兽继续在宁静的乡村大。

419. cou·ple 两人 ## 3

[’kʌpl]n.对；夫妇；数个v.连结；交配

  • I left the bag in the hall and Robert and I went into the living room where we talked for a couple of hours. 我把纸袋放在门厅里，与罗伯特一起进了起居室，在那里聊了好几个小时。
  • Sitting down on a dilapidated wooden fence near the field, we opened a couple of tins of sardines and had a picnic lunch. 近场破旧的木栅栏坐下来，打开几听沙丁鱼罐头，吃了一顿野外午餐。
  • If you recognize yourself in this description, you might include a couple of heady growth stocks in your portfolio, alongside your more pedestrian investments. 如果你认识到自己在该说明中，可能包括在你的投资组合了几个令人兴奋的成长股，你旁边的行人多的投资。

SEE> few 少数, ac·tu·al·ly 其实, come 来

420. cour·age 勇气 ## 2

[’kɜːrɪdʒ]n.勇气；胆量

  • But no one has to muster up courage to enter a less pretentious antique shop. 但谁也没有鼓足勇气才敢进不太装腔作势的古玩店。
  • The high stern castle was a riot of carved gods, demons, knights, kings, warriors, mermaids, cherubs; and zoomorphic animal shapes ablaze with red and gold and blue, symbols of courage, power, and cruelty, were portrayed to stir the imaginations of the superstitious sailors of the day. 高耸的船是雕刻的神仙，妖魔，骑士，国王，勇士，美人鱼，小天使，492;和兽形动物形状的红色和金黄色，蓝色的勇气，力量和残酷的符号闪亮，以激起一天迷信的水手们的想像。

421. course 课程 ## 32

422. court 法庭 ## 2

[kɔːrt]n.法院；庭院；宫廷；球场；奉承v.献殷勤；追求；招致；设法获得

  • The word justice is usually associated with courts of law. 字义通常与法庭连在一起的。
  • It is true that during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature, equipped in a manner which would make a modern climber shudder at the thought, but they did not go out of their way to court such excitement. 确实，他们在探险中他们经常遇到的困难和极具威胁性，搭载的方式，会让一个现代登山者想一想都会浑身颤栗危险，但他们没有去他们的出路，以追求刺激的。

SEE> judge 判断, su·preme , case 箱子

ODE> A body of people presided over by a judge, judges, or magistrate, and acting as a tribunal in civil and criminal cases. – court of law, law court, bench, bar, court of justice, judicature, tribunal, forum, chancery, assizes.

423. cous·in 表姐 ## 2

[’kʌzn]n.堂(或表)兄弟(姐妹)

  • My cousin, Harry, keeps a large curiously-shaped bottle on permanent display in his study. 我的堂兄哈里，保持永久陈列在一个大奇怪形状的瓶子在他的书房。
  • Moon-dwellers will be able to fly in space at only three per cent of the cost of similar journeys by their terrestrial cousins. 月球居民将能够通过他们的表兄弟地面的只有三个在太空飞行每类似的旅行费用的份额。

424. cov·er 遮盖 ## 20

[’kʌvər]n.封面；盖子；套子；表面v.覆盖；涉及；包含；掩护；给…保险

  • The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins. 该垃圾筐是空的，地上布满纸片，烟头，旧轮胎，空瓶子和生锈的罐头。
  • The bird covered the distance in three minutes. 鸟用了3分钟的距离。
  • During that time she covered a distance of eight miles. 在那段时间里，她的8英里。

425. cow 母牛 ## 3

[kaʊ]n.母牛；雌象；雌鲸；雌犀牛；女人v.恐吓

  • This god which has the head of a cow was normally placed inside a mummy. 这个神其具有一头牛的头部通常被放在木乃伊内部。
  • The price we pay for cheap food may be already too high: Mad Cow Disease (BSE) in cattle, salmonella in chicken and eggs, and listeria in dairy products. 为了廉价食物的价格，我们的薪酬可能已经太高了：疯牛病（BSE）牛，沙门氏菌在鸡肉和鸡蛋，以及乳制品的利斯特氏菌。
  • Victorian parents believed that they kept their dignity by retreating behind an unreasoning authoritarian attitude; in fact they did nothing of the kind, but children were then too cowed to let them know how they really felt. 维多利亚时代的父母认为，他们可以靠无理的权威气派自己的尊严;其实他们什么也没做的那种，但孩子们则太吓倒，让他们知道他们是如何真正感受到。

SEE> mad 狂, sheep 绵羊, goat

ODE> A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef. – intimidate, daunt, browbeat, bully, badger, dragoon, bludgeon, tyrannize, overawe, awe, dismay, dishearten, unnerve, subdue, scare, terrorize, frighten, petrify.

426. crack 裂缝 ## 2

[kræk]v.破裂；砸开；发出爆裂声；撞击；破解；变嘶哑；崩溃；制裁；开玩笑n.裂缝；裂痕；爆裂声；猛击；尝试；俏皮话adj.训练有素的

  • Bruce went into a low gear and drove at a terrifying speed, keeping the front wheels astride the crack as he followed its zigzag course. 布鲁斯走进了低速挡在开车速度令人害怕，保持前轮跨地裂的他跟随它的曲折历程。
  • He no sooner recovers his equilibrium than the next porpoise comes along and hits him another crack. 他刚一恢复他的平衡比下江豚走来，并击中他另一个打击。

SEE> hard 硬, break 打破, in·stance 例子

ODE> A line on the surface of something along which it has split without breaking apart. – split, fissure, crevice, break, fracture, rupture, breach, rift, cleft, slit, chink, gap, cranny, interstice.

427. craft 船 ## 3

[kræft]n.工艺；手艺；狡诈；船舶；航空器；行会成员vt.手工制作；精心制作

  • It was the idea of supporting a craft on a ‘pad’, or cushion, of low-pressure air, ringed with a curtain of higher pressure air. 这是对一个“垫”或坐垫，低压空气的，具有更高压力的空气幕环状支撑船体的想法。
  • Ever since, people have had difficulty in deciding whether the craft should be ranged among ships, planes, or land vehicles – for it is something in between a boat and an aircraft. 从那时起，人们不得不在决定是否工艺应中的舰艇，飞机或陆地车辆被测距困难 - 因为它是介于船和飞机之间。
  • This is done by a great number of ring-shaped air jets on the bottom of the craft. 这是通过在飞行器的底部环形空气射流的大量完成。

SEE> like·wise , boat 船, in·stance 例子

ODE> An activity involving skill in making things by hand. – activity, pursuit, occupation, work, line, line of work, profession, job, business, line of business, trade, employment, position, post, situation, career, métier, vocation, calling, skill, field, province, walk of life.

428. crash 撞车 ## 10

[kræʃ]v.撞击；坠毁；发出巨响；崩溃；破产；宿夜n.轰隆声；猛撞；崩溃；暴跌；垮台；粗布adj.速成的

  • Didn’t you have a crash? 你不是有一个崩溃？
  • At one point, it seemed certain that their plane would crash. 在一个点上，似乎可以肯定，他们的飞机会崩溃。
  • A gust of wind swept the bed off the roof and sent it crashing into the courtyard below. 一阵风席卷床从屋顶上，并把它摔碎在下面的院子里。

SEE> ac·ci·dent 事故, plane 飞机, air·plane

ODE> (of a vehicle) collide violently with an obstacle or another vehicle. – smash into, collide with, be in collision with, come into collision with, hit, strike, ram, smack into, slam into, bang into, cannon into, plough into, meet head-on, run into, drive into, bump into, knock into, crack against, crack into.

429. cream 奶油 ## 3

[kriːm]n.奶油；乳酪；面霜；精华；米色v.凝成乳脂；起泡沫；撇去乳脂；提取精华；使成糊状；涂面霜；彻底打败

  • There’s an ice cream man. 有个卖冰淇淋的。
  • Two ice creams please. 请拿两份冰淇淋。
  • These ice creams are nice. 这些冰淇淋真好吃。

SEE> choc·o·late 巧克力, but·ter 黄油, cheese 奶酪

ODE> The thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid which rises to the top when milk is left to stand and which can be eaten as an accompaniment to desserts or used as a cooking ingredient. – lotion, ointment, rub, cosmetic, application, preparation, emollient, moisturizer, paste, gel, salve, unguent, embrocation, balm, liniment, pomade.

430. cre·ate 创造 ## 8

[kri’eɪt]v.创造；造成adj.创造的

  • Despite its immensity, it is both simple and elegant, fulfilling its designer’s dream to create ‘an enormous object drawn as faintly as possible’. 尽管很大，但它的结构简单，造型优美，实现了设计者的梦想，创造“为依稀描绘成可能一个巨大的物体”。
  • Students often create amusing situations which are funny to everyone except the victims. 学生往往是制造一种搞笑的，除了受害者大家有趣的情况。
  • If there is one – which I take leave to doubt – then it is older people who create it, not the young themselves. 如果有一个 - 我对此持怀疑态度 - 那么它是谁创建它，而不是年轻的自己年长的人。

SEE> cre·a·tion , bring 带来, aim 瞄准

ODE> Bring (something) into existence. – generate, produce, design, make, fabricate, fashion, manufacture, build, construct, erect, do, turn out.

431. crea·ture 生物 ## 15

[’kriːtʃər]n.生物；动物；人

  • Occasionally, unusual creatures are washed to the shore, but they are rarely caught out at sea. 偶尔，一些罕见的动物被冲到岸上来，但它们在海上很少能被捕捉到。
  • Such creatures have rarely been seen alive by man as they live at a depth of six hundred feet. 这样的动物，因为它们生活在600英尺深的水下很少能看到活着的人。
  • No creature has received more praise and abuse than the common garden snail. 没有一种生物所受到如此多的赞扬和批评花园里常见的蜗牛。

SEE> mon·ster , sup·pos·ed·ly , mys·te·ri·ous 神秘的

ODE> An animal, as distinct from a human being. – animal, beast, brute.

432. cred·it 信用 ## 2

[’kredɪt]n.信用；荣誉；学分；赞扬；贷款；赊欠；贷方；存款(复)credits: 演职员名单.v.归功于；相信；记入贷方

  • Primarily, the banker-customer relationship is that of debtor and creditor – who is which depending on whether the customer’s account is in credit or is overdrawn. 首先，银行家与客户的关系是债务人和债权人的 - 谁是取决于客户的帐户是否在信用卡或透支。
  • Marine Studio biologists have pointed out that, however intelligent they may be, it is probably a mistake to credit dolphins with any motive of lifesaving. 海洋摄影室的生物学家指出，但是聪明的，他们可能是，它可能是一个错误的信用海豚具有救生的动机。

SEE> card 卡片, fi·nan·cial 金融, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The ability of a customer to obtain goods or services before payment, based on the trust that payment will be made in the future. – financial standing, financial status, solvency.

433. crime 犯罪 ## 2

[kraɪm]n.犯罪；恶行

  • Obtaining ‘protection money’ is not a modern crime. 榨取“保护金”并不是一个现代的罪恶行径。
  • Of course a writer doing this is misunderstood: he might as well try to explain a crime or a love affair. 作家如此行事当然这是误解：他还不如给人讲一个犯罪案件或一个恋爱故事。

SEE> crim·i·nal 刑事, mur·der 谋杀, in·deed 确实

434. crit·i·cal 极重要的 ## 2

[’krɪtɪkl]adj.批评的；挑剔的；决定性的；危险的adj.临界的

  • From an attic window we could get a sweeping view of the river where their land joined ours, and at the most critical juncture we took turns in watching that point. 从阁楼的窗口，我们可以得到他们的土地与我们的，在最关键的时刻，我们轮流监视那段河流一览无余。
  • In man’s early days, competition with other creatures must have been critical. 在人类的早期，与其他生物的竞争一定是必不可少的。

435. crop 作物 ## 5

[krɑːp]n.农作物；收成；庄稼；(一)批v.修剪；啃吃；收获；出现

  • Two of the leading growers, Giuseppe Moldova and Riccardo Brabante, tell me that they have been expecting a splendid crop this year and harvesting has begun earlier than usual. 领先的种植者二，朱塞佩·瓦和里卡多。布拉班特告诉我，他们今年已经期待一个大丰收，收割工作比往年早。
  • The whole village has been working day and night gathering and threshing this year’s crop before the September rains. 全村已夜以继日地工作，收集和脱粒今年的收成九月下雨前。
  • Mrs. Brabante is talking to the manager of the local factory where the crop is processed. 布拉班特太太正在和当地工厂，其中作物加工的经理。

ODE> A cultivated plant that is grown on a large scale commercially, especially a cereal, fruit, or vegetable. – harvest, year’s growth, yield, produce, vintage, gathering, reaping, gleaning, garnering.

436. cross 横穿 ## 11

[krɔːs]v.穿过；交叉；杂交；反对；勾掉；碰见；阻挠n.十字架；十字形；杂交动植物；苦难adj.交叉的；相反的；生气的；杂交的

  • I crossed the street to avoid meeting him, but he saw me and came running towards me. 我穿过马路以便避开他，但他看到我并朝我跑过来。
  • Let us suppose that a child suddenly crosses the road in front of you. 让我们假设一个小孩子突然在你前面的道路。
  • For hundreds of years, St. Bernard dogs have saved the lives of travellers crossing the dangerous Pass. 几百年来，圣伯纳德狗拯救了许多翻越这道山口的旅游者的生命。

SEE> cross·ing , both 两者, a·cross 横过

ODE> A mark, object, or figure formed by two short intersecting lines or pieces (+ or ×) – crucifix, rood.

437. crowd 人群 ## 11

[kraʊd]n.人群；群众；大群；朋友v.拥挤；挤满；涌入；贴近；逼迫

  • You can see us in the crowd. 你可以看到我们在人群中。
  • It was the last day of the year and a large crowd of people had gathered under the Town Hall clock. 那是一年的最后一天，人大群人在市政厅的大钟下聚集。
  • The crowd began to shout, but the drunk was unaware of the danger. 人群开始大叫起来，但醉汉却没有意识到危险。

SEE> au·di·ence 听众, cheer , en·thu·si·as·tic 热情

438. cry 哭 ## 5

[kraɪ]v.哭；(大声)叫喊；(强烈)要求n.叫声；哭；喊

  • The man let out a cry and jumped back several paces. 该男子让出了一声，惊退了几步。
  • Towards midday, a girl heard a muffled cry coming from behind one of the walls. 快到中午的时候，一个女孩听到了一声闷响从后面墙上的一个未来。
  • As the cry was repeated several times, she ran to tell the manager who promptly rang up the fire brigade. 由于这种喊叫声重复了几次，她跑去告诉谁及时响了起来消防队经理。

SEE> re·mem·ber 记得, scream 尖叫, shout 叫喊

ODE> Shed tears, typically as an expression of distress, pain, or sorrow. – weep, shed tears, sob, wail, be in tears, cry one’s eyes out, cry one’s heart out, cry as if one’s heart would break, bawl, howl, snivel, whimper, whine, squall, mewl, bleat.

439. cul·ture 文化 ## 3

[’kʌltʃər]n.栽培；文化；教养vt.培养，栽培

  • In primitive cultures the obligation to seek and to receive the traditional instruction is binding to all. 在原始文化中的义务，寻求和接受传统教育结合所有。
  • By the time he can talk, he is the little creature of his culture, and by the time he is grown and able to take part in its activities, its habits are his habits, its beliefs his beliefs, its impossibilities his impossibilities. 到会说话的时候，他是他的文化的小动物，并通过他长大并能参与其活动的习惯就是他的习惯，它的信仰他的信仰，其不可能的事他办不到的事情。
  • It is well known that where the white man has invaded a primitive culture, the most destructive effects have come not from physical weapons but from ideas. 这是众所周知，凡是白人侵入原始文化中，最具破坏性的影响并没有杀人的武器，而是思想。

SEE> cul·tur·al 文化, tra·di·tion 传统, con·text 上下文

ODE> The arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively. – the arts, the humanities.

440. cup 杯子 ## 9

[kʌp]n.杯子；一杯之量；奖杯；罩杯vt.使成杯形；把某物放入杯中

  • There is a cup on the table, too. 还有桌子上还有一只杯子。

441. cup·board 橱柜 ## 7

[’kʌbərd]n.碗橱；衣柜；壁橱

  • There are some in the cupboard. 有一些在柜子里。
  • The terrible secret is called ‘a skeleton in the cupboard’. 惊人的秘密被称作“柜中骷髅”。
  • To varying degrees, we all have secrets which we do not want even our closest friends to learn, but few of us have skeletons in the cupboard. 在不同程度上，我们都有，我们不希望连我们最亲密的朋友知道的秘密，但是却极少有人有柜中骷髅。

SEE> fridge 冰箱, clos·et 壁橱, book·case

442. cure 治愈 ## 2

[kjʊr]n.治疗；治愈；疗法；对策v.治愈；治疗；纠正

  • Furthermore, the acquisition of this bottle cured him of a bad habit he had been developing for years. 此外，这瓶香水泥还治好一个坏习惯，他已经发展了多年的他。
  • The great advantage of taking medicine is that it makes no demands on the taker beyond that of putting up for a moment with a disgusting taste, and that is what all patients demand of their doctors – to be cured at no inconvenience to themselves. 服药的最大优点是它使得在超出忍受一下令人作呕的味道一时的接受者没有需求，而这正是所有患者要求医生的 - 在没有任何不便，自己被治愈。

443. cu·ri·ous 好奇的 ## 6

[’kjʊriəs]adj.好奇的；奇特的

  • Everybody on board was worried and we were curious to find out what had happened. 飞机上的人都很着急，大家都急于想知道出了什么事。
  • It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years. 这是一个奇怪的巧合，他退休的前一天，佩奇将已经教了一满40年。
  • This can give rise to curious situations, as it did in the case of Alfred Bloggs who worked as a dustman for the Ellesmere Corporation. 这种种奇怪的现象引起的，因为它在艾尔弗雷德布洛斯的谁作为埃尔斯米尔公司一个清洁工的工作的情况下做到了。

SEE> in·ter·est·ing 有趣, cu·ri·ous·ly 好奇地, fas·ci·nat·ing

ODE> Eager to know or learn something. – eager, excited, impatient, in suspense, on tenterhooks, on the edge of one’s seat, on pins and needles, keen, anxious, longing.

444. cu·ri·ous·ly 好奇地 ## 2

[’kjʊəriəsli]adv.好奇地；奇异的

  • Sally did not answer, but looked at her curiously. 萨莉没回答，但她好奇地看着。
  • I was not surprised to find that the machine still refused to work after I had reassembled it, for the simple reason that I was left with several curiously shaped bits of metal which did not seem to fit anywhere. 我并不感到惊讶地发现，机器仍然拒绝工作，我已经装完后，原因很简单，我留下了金属几个形状奇特位，似乎并不适合任何地方。

SEE> odd·ly 奇怪, strange·ly 奇怪, in·ter·est·ing·ly

ODE> In a way that shows eagerness to know or learn something. –

445. cur·rent 水流 ## 6

[’kɜːrənt]n.趋势；(水、气、电)流adj.现在的；流通的

  • They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side. 他们跳入湖中，并装上一只充气橡皮艇自己的装备后，让他们当前进到另一侧。
  • We welcome the seasons by the riverside, crowning the youngest girl with flowers in the spring, holding a summer festival on Midsummer Eve, giving thanks for the harvest in the autumn, and throwing a holly wreath into the current in the winter. 我们在河边迎接一年四季加冕最年轻的女孩在春天的花朵，抱着仲夏前夜夏季节，在秋季收获感恩，并抛出一个冬青花环到冬天的电流。
  • Next came a horse, swimming bravely, but we were afraid that the strength of the current would prevent its landing anywhere before it became exhausted. 接下来是一匹马，勇敢地游着，但我们担心的是，当前的力量将使它在任何地方降落前就筋疲力尽了。

SEE> pre·sent 目前的, same 相同, the 该

ODE> Belonging to the present time; happening or being used or done now. – contemporary, present-day, present, contemporaneous, ongoing.

446. cur·tain 窗帘 ## 3

[’kɜːrtn]n.窗帘；门帘；幕(布)vt.(用帘)装饰；(以帘)遮蔽

  • We like them in the same way that we like pretty curtain material. 我们喜欢他们以同样的方式，我们喜欢漂亮的窗帘布。
  • The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell. 该大幕拉开上的最后一幕戏，并透露了贵族独自坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房。
  • It was the idea of supporting a craft on a ‘pad’, or cushion, of low-pressure air, ringed with a curtain of higher pressure air. 这是对一个“垫”或坐垫，低压空气的，具有更高压力的空气幕环状支撑船体的想法。

SEE> i·ron·i·cal·ly , door 门, once 一次

ODE> A piece of material suspended at the top to form a screen, typically movable sideways along a rail and found as one of a pair at a window. – window hanging, hanging, screen, blind.

447. curved 弯曲的 ## 2

[kɜːrvd]adj.弯曲的

  • We can perhaps forgive those who said the moons of Jupiter were produced by Galileo’s spyglass if we recall that in his day, as for centuries before, curved glass was the popular contrivance for producing not truth but illusion, untruth; and if a single curved glass would distort nature, how much more would a pair of them? 我们或许可以原谅那些谁说，木星的卫星是由伽利略的望远镜产生的，如果我们还记得，在他的一天，几个世纪前，弧形玻璃是用于生产不是真理，而是幻觉，谎言流行的诡计;如果一个单一的曲面玻璃会扭曲性质，多少那么一对他们的？

ODE> Having the form of a curve; bent. –

448. cus·tom 习惯 ## 15

[’kʌstəm]n.习惯；风俗；惯例（复）Customs: 海关；关税adj.定做的；定制的

  • Customs Officers are quite tolerant these days, but they can still stop you when you are going through the Green Channel and have nothing to declare. 海关官员往往相当宽容这些天，但他们仍可以拦住你，当你通过绿色通道，没有什么要申报。
  • When I returned from abroad recently, a particularly officious young Customs Officer clearly regarded me as a smuggler. 当我从最近国外回来，一个特别好管闲事的年轻海关官员，他显然把我当成走私犯。
  • As the heads of next-generation start-ups, these Asian innovators can draw on customs and languages to forge tighter links with crucial Pacific Rim markets. 作为下一代创业的带头人，亚裔发明家可以凭借他们在习惯和语言，以加强与关键的太平洋沿岸市场更紧密的联系。

SEE> in·stance 例子, in·cor·po·rate , like·wise

ODE> A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something that is specific to a particular society, place, or time. – tradition, practice, usage, observance, way, convention, procedure, ceremony, ritual, ordinance, form, formality, fashion, mode, manner.

449. cus·tom·er 顾客 ## 15

[’kʌstəmər]n.顾客；主顾；家伙

  • Why didn’t Caroline recognize the customer straight away? 为什么卡罗琳没有认识到客户马上？
  • Recognizing who the customer was, the manager was most apologetic and reprimanded the assistant severely. 认识谁是顾客，表示经理深深的歉意，还严厉地训斥了店员。
  • Why is there no risk to the customer when a bank prints the customer’s name on his cheques? 为什么会出现当银行打印对他检查客户的姓名客户没有风险？

SEE> em·ploy·ee 雇员, in·stance 例子, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A person who buys goods or services from a shop or business. – shopper, consumer, buyer, purchaser.

450. cus·toms 海关 ## 3

[’kʌstəmz]n.海关

  • Is there a problem with the Customs officer? 是否存在与海关官员有问题吗？
  • Two men took the parcel off the plane and carried it into the Customs House. 有两个人把包裹拿下飞机，进了海关大楼。
  • What was the Customs Officer looking for? 什么是海关官员找？

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, im·port 进口, im·mi·gra·tion

ODE> The official department that administers and collects the duties levied by a government on imported goods. – import taxes.

451. cut 切 ## 18

[kʌt]v.切；割；剪；削减；伤害；切牌n.切口；切；式样；剪辑

  • The Wayle is a small river that cuts across the park near my home. 该Wayle是一条小河穿过公园是我家附近。
  • Why does the vicar refuse to cut down the tree? 为什么牧师垃圾，以减少树？
  • The vicar has been asked to have the tree cut down, but so far he has refused. 牧师一直问到有没有把树砍掉，但到目前为止，他已经拒绝了。

SEE> slash , put 放, re·duce 降低

ODE> Make an opening, incision, or wound in (something) with a sharp-edged tool or object. – gash, slash, lacerate, slit, pierce, penetrate, wound, injure.

452. cy·cle 周期 ## 2

[’saɪkl]n.循环；周期；自行车；摩托车v.骑自行车；(使)轮转；(使)循环

  • He showed that the average individual’s sleep cycle is punctuated with peculiar bursts of eye-movements, some drifting and slow, others jerky and rapid. 他指出，平常人的睡眠周期中不时用眼睛运动，有的飘忽而缓慢，有的急剧而快速的阵阵奇特。
  • Education, with its cycles of instruction so carefully worked out, punctuated by textbooks – those purchasable wells of wisdom – what would civilization be like without its benefits? 教育，指导其周期如此精心地安排，并以教科书 - 智慧那些购买井 - 将文明是什么样子没有它的好处是什么？

SEE> be·gin·ning 开始, fur·ther·more , where·as 而

ODE> A series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order. – round, rotation, revolution.

453. dad 爸 ## 4

[dæd]n.爸爸

  • I’m going to meet some friends, Dad. 我打算去看几个朋友，爸爸。
  • I can’t get home so early, Dad! 我不能回家，所以早，爸爸！
  • Yes, Dad. 是的，爸爸。

SEE> mom 妈妈, fa·ther 父亲, grand·fa·ther 祖父

ODE> One’s father. – male parent, begetter, patriarch, paterfamilias.

454. dai·ly 日常的 ## 4

[’deɪli]adj.每日的；日常的adv.每日；天天n.日报(复)dailies：工作样片.

  • However, there is an even more insidious kind of pollution that particularly affects urban areas and invades our daily lives, and that is noise. 然而，还有一个更加隐蔽有害的污染，它专门影响城镇地区，侵袭我们的日常生活，那就是噪音。
  • The daily exercises lasted only eleven minutes and I proposed to do them early in the morning before anyone had got up. 早锻炼一共只有11分钟，我建议早做他们早上别人起床之前。
  • We still do; living in a world in which undeclared aggression, war, hypocrisy, chicanery, anarchy and impending immolation are part of our daily lives, we all want a code to live by. 我们仍然做;生活在一个世界里，不宣战，侵略，虚伪，欺骗，无政府状态和一触即发的杀戮，是我们日常生活的一部分，我们都希望通过住一个代码。

SEE> news·pa·per 报纸, week·ly 每周, times

ODE> Done, produced, or occurring every day or every weekday. – done every day, occurring every day, produced every day, everyday, day-to-day, quotidian.

455. dam·age 损坏 ## 9

[’dæmɪdʒ]n.损害；损失；毁坏vt.损害；毁坏

  • Recently it was damaged by a visitor. 它最近被一个客人弄坏了。
  • The thieves’ car was badly damaged and easy to recognize. 小偷的车损坏严重，很容易辨认。
  • The plane wasn’t too badly damaged, but over the years, the crash was forgotten and the wreck remained undisturbed. 这架飞机是不是太严重损坏，但是，多年来，飞机失事已被遗忘，飞机残骸也不受干扰。

SEE> dam·aged , harm 伤害, cause 原因

ODE> Physical harm that impairs the value, usefulness, or normal function of something. – harm, injury, destruction, vandalization, vandalism.

456. dance 舞蹈 ## 4

[dæns]n.舞会；跳舞；舞蹈；舞步vi.跳舞；手舞足蹈vt.跳舞；使跳跃

  • The snake, however, continued to ‘dance’ slowly. 蛇，然而，持续地“舞动”慢。
  • All night long, people dance and sing. 整整一夜，人们载歌载舞。
  • Dancing proved to be more than the dish could bear, for during the party it capsized and sank in seven feet of water. 他们跳起了舞，盘子难以承受。舞会进行过程中，盘子倾覆，七英尺深的水中。

SEE> danc·ing 跳舞, mu·sic 音乐, danc·er 舞蹈家

ODE> Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps. – trip, sway, spin, whirl, twirl, pirouette, gyrate.

457. dan·ger 危险 ## 9

[’deɪndʒər]n.【U】危险n.【C】危险物（或人）；威胁

  • What was the danger to the villages after the fire? 什么是危险的火灾后的村庄？
  • The crowd began to shout, but the drunk was unaware of the danger. 人群开始大叫起来，但醉汉却没有意识到危险。
  • What was the danger? 什么是危险？

SEE> threat 威胁, pose 姿势, warn 警告

ODE> The possibility of suffering harm or injury. – peril, hazard, risk, jeopardy, endangerment, imperilment, insecurity.

458. dan·ger·ous 危险 ## 11

[’deɪndʒərəs]adj.危险的；不安全的

  • Does Captain Fawcett think any trip is too dangerous? 不弗西特机长认为任何行程太危险了？
  • The man wanted to fly to Rockall, a lonely island in the Atlantic Ocean, but Captain Fawcett did not take him because the trip was too dangerous. 这个人想要飞往罗卡尔，在大西洋上的一个孤岛，但福塞特上尉没有走他，因为行程太危险了。
  • It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside. 令人不安的是认为一个危险的野兽继续在宁静的乡村大。

SEE> potentially 可能, dif·fi·cult 困难的, ex·treme·ly 非常地

ODE> Able or likely to cause harm or injury. – menacing, threatening, treacherous.

459. dark 黑暗的 ## 9

[dɑːrk]adj.黑暗的；深色的n.黑暗；暗处；深色调v.使变黑；变黑

  • Who called out to the thieves in the dark? 谁大声在黑暗盗贼？
  • It was very dark, so they turned on a torch. 很暗，于是他们打开了手电筒。
  • It was dark outside. 外面一片昏暗。

SEE> gray , bright 明亮的, dark·ness

ODE> With little or no light. – black, pitch black, pitch dark, inky, jet black, unlit, unlighted, unilluminated, ill-lit, poorly lit.

460. date 日期 ## 2

[deɪt]n.日期；年代；会晤时间；约会；约会对象；枣椰树；枣子v.给 … 标明日期；确定年代；过时；显老；和 … 约会；追溯到

  • The body of one statue was found among remains dating from the fifteenth century B.C. 一尊雕像，她的躯体是在公元前15世纪的历史文物中发现公元前
  • He loved to be told that one of his imaginary products was temporarily out of stock and he would faithfully promise to call again at some future date, but of course he never did. 他爱听售货员说他想像的那种东西暂时脱销，于是他就煞有介事地许诺改天再来打电话，当然，他从来没有。

SEE> be·gin·ning 开始, pri·or 先前的, al·though 虽然

ODE> The day of the month or year as specified by a number. – day, day of the month, occasion, year, anniversary, time.

461. daugh·ter 女儿 ## 10

[’dɔːtər]n.女儿；子代adj.女儿的；女儿似的

  • It’s for my daughter, Susan. 这是为我的女儿苏珊。
  • Please don’t telephone my daughter again!’ 请不要再给我女儿打电话了！”
  • Last week, my four-year-old daughter, Sally, was invited to a children’s party. 上周，我4岁的女儿萨莉被邀请去参加一个儿童聚会。

SEE> wife 妻子, moth·er 母亲, grand·daugh·ter 孙女

ODE> A girl or woman in relation to either or both of her parents. – female child, girl.

462. day 天 ## 121

[deɪ]n.白天；一天；时代

  • It is a fine day today. 这是今天天气很好。
  • The sun shines every day. 太阳每天照射。
  • The days are long and the nights are short. 日子长而夜晚短。

SEE> week 周, week·end 周末, month 月

ODE> Each of the twenty-four-hour periods, reckoned from one midnight to the next, into which a week, month, or year is divided, and corresponding to a rotation of the earth on its axis. – twenty-four-hour period, full day, twenty-four hours, working day.

463. dead 死的 ## 15

[ded]adj.死的；不起作用的；无趣的；筋疲力尽的；麻木的；完全的；无效的；沉闷的；（指球）界外的adv.完全地；直接地；突然地

  • I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud enough to wake the dead. 我刚回到厨房，门铃响起，响声足以把死人唤醒。
  • Working rapidly in the darkness, he soon changed into the dead man’s clothes. 在黑暗中迅速工作，他很快就换上了死者的衣服。
  • A Festival for the Dead is held once a year in Japan. 一种死节在日本举行一年一次。

SEE> a·live 活着的, kill·ing 谋杀, least 最小

ODE> No longer alive. – deceased, expired, departed, gone, no more, passed on, passed away.

464. deal 交易 ## 18

[diːl]n.协定；交易；大量v.应付；分配；处理；交易；经营

  • A lot of cars entered for this race last year and there was a great deal of excitement just before it began. 很多小汽车参加了这种比赛，去年和有兴奋的大量之前就开始了。
  • The race gave everyone a great deal of pleasure. 这场比赛给了大家一个快乐的很大。
  • The Hubble will tell us a great deal about the age and size of the universe. 哈勃将告诉我们有关宇宙的年龄和大小的许多事情。

SEE> a·gree·ment 协议, a·gree 同意, ne·go·ti·ate

ODE> Distribute (cards) in an orderly rotation to players for a game or round. – distribute, give out, share out, divide out, divide up, hand out, pass out, pass round, dole out, mete out, dispense, allocate, allot, assign, apportion, bestow.

465. dear 亲爱的 ## 11

[dɪr]adj.亲爱的；宝贵的；昂贵的n.可爱的人；亲爱的人adv.高价地int.啊；哎呀(用以表示惊奇、害怕以及其他强烈感情)

  • Do you like it, dear? 你喜欢吗，亲爱的？
  • ‘Dear me,’ she said. “天啊，”她说。
  • ‘Oh dear,’ said the conductor suddenly. “哎呀，”售票员突然说。

SEE> thank 谢谢, yes 是, re·mem·ber 记得

ODE> Regarded with deep affection. – beloved, loved, much loved, darling, adored, cherished, precious.

466. death 死亡 ## 16

[deθ]n.死；死亡；毁灭；死因

  • So far, not one of them has been struck down by sudden death! 到目前为止，他们没有一个人已经被暴死呢！
  • You either starve to death or live like Robinson Crusoe, waiting for a boat which never comes. 你要么饿死，要么像鲁滨逊漂流记，等待它永远不会到来船。
  • Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents. 喜剧演员在横死和严重事故这类悲剧家们的笑话。

SEE> dead 死的, vic·tim 受害者, mur·der 谋杀

ODE> The action or fact of dying or being killed; the end of the life of a person or organism. – demise, dying, end, passing, passing away, passing on, loss of life, expiry, expiration, departure from life, final exit, eternal rest.

467. debt 债务 ## 2

[det]n.债务；恩情；负债状态；义务；罪

  • Despite this, he was so extravagant that he was always in debt. 尽管如此，但他挥霍无度，他总是在债务。
  • He was sent to prison for failing to pay his debts and died in poverty in 1836. 他被送进监狱，未能按时支付他的债务，并在贫困中去世1836。

SEE> re·pay , cred·it 信用, loan 贷款

ODE> A sum of money that is owed or due. – bill, account, tally, financial obligation, outstanding payment, amount due, money owing.

468. dec·ade 十年 ## 2

[’dekeɪd]n.十年

  • Audiences in the second decade of the twentieth century found it pleasant to escape to a time when life, though hard, was relatively simple. 在二十世纪的第二个十年的观众发现它令人愉快逃脱的时候，生活，虽然辛苦，相对简单。
  • Some of us will die sooner, a few will live longer – on into a ninth or tenth decade. 有些人会死得早一些，少数会活得更长 - 上到第九或第十十年。

SEE> a·go 前, since 从…以来, be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> A period of ten years. – age, time, period, era, epoch, century, decade, year, stage.

469. de·cay 腐烂 ## 3

[dɪ’keɪ]v.(使)衰退；(使)腐败；(使)腐烂n.衰退；腐烂；腐败

  • Stone does not decay, and so the tools of long ago have remained when even the bones of the men who made them have disappeared without trace. 石头不会腐烂，所以很久以前的工具时，是谁使他们的人连骨头已经消失得无影无踪一直保持。
  • And if, with the decay of vitality, weariness increases, the thought of rest will be not unwelcome. 再者，随着精力的衰退，倦意日增，安息的想法并非是要不得的。
  • But even in the most favourable circumstances only a small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them. 但是，即使在最有利的情况下，只有死的生物的一小部分以这种方式被保存开始腐烂前，或，甚至更容易，食腐动物吃掉它们之前。

SEE> hence 因此, fur·ther·more , con·se·quent·ly

ODE> (of organic matter) rot or decompose through the action of bacteria and fungi. – decompose, rot, putrefy, go bad, go off, spoil, fester, perish, deteriorate.

470. de·cide 决定 ## 36

[dɪ’saɪd]v.决定；判断；断定

  • Why couldn’t Nigel decide? 不奈杰尔为什么可以决定？
  • Well, I like the house, but I can’t decide yet. 嗯，我喜欢这房子，但我还不能决定。
  • What’s the problem about deciding on a holiday? 关于什么的决定放假的问题？

SEE> wheth·er 是否, ask 问, should 应该

ODE> Come or bring to a resolution in the mind as a result of consideration. – form the opinion, come to the conclusion, conclude, decide, determine.

471. de·clare 申报 ## 3

[dɪ’kler]v.宣布（声明）；申报；声明

  • Customs Officers are quite tolerant these days, but they can still stop you when you are going through the Green Channel and have nothing to declare. 海关官员往往相当宽容这些天，但他们仍可以拦住你，当你通过绿色通道，没有什么要申报。
  • ‘Have you anything to declare?’ “你有什么要申报的吗？”
  • ’You should have declared that. “你应该申报。

SEE> rec·og·nize 认出, in·ten·tion 意向, a·ban·don 放弃

ODE> Say something in a solemn and emphatic manner. – proclaim, announce, make known, state, communicate, reveal, divulge, mention, talk about, raise, moot, air, bring into the open, voice, articulate, pronounce, express, vent, set forth, make public, publicize, disseminate, circulate, publish, broadcast, promulgate, trumpet, blazon.

472. de·cline 下降 ## 2

[dɪ’klaɪn]v.下降；减少；变弱；拒绝；倾斜n.衰微；跌落；晚年

  • This decline in vigour with the passing of time is called ageing. 这种下降与时间的推移活力叫做衰老。
  • It is one of the most unpleasant discoveries which we all make that we must decline in this way, that if we escape wars, accidents and diseases we shall eventually ‘die of old age’, and that this happens at a rate which differs little from person to person, so that there are heavy odds in favour of our dying between the ages of sixty-five and eighty. 这是最令人不快的发现之一，我们都使我们必须以这种方式下降，如果我们能避开战争，意外事故和疾病，我们最终也会“老死”，而这发生在一个速度，从不同的小人与人之间，以便有利于我们的65和八十岁之间死亡的重几率。

SEE> rise 上升, drop 掉落, de·crease 减少

ODE> (typically of something regarded as good) become smaller, fewer, or less; decrease. – decrease, reduce, get smaller, grow smaller, lessen, get less, diminish, wane, dwindle, contract, shrink, fall off, taper off, tail off, peter out.

473. dec·o·rate 装饰 ## 2

[’dekəreɪt]v.装饰；布置；装修；授予某人奖章或其他奖状

  • They had large rooms with beautifully decorated walls. 他们与装饰精美的墙壁大房间。
  • Armed with the right tools and materials, newlyweds gaily embark on the task of decorating their own homes. 使用正确的工具及材料，兴高采烈地踏上新婚夫妇布置新房的任务。

SEE> pop·u·late , last·ly , de·pict

ODE> Make (something) look more attractive by adding extra items or images to it. – ornament, adorn, trim, embellish, garnish, furnish, accessorize, enhance, grace, enrich.

474. deep 深的 ## 17

[diːp]adj.深的；深刻的；深奥的；深切的adv.深深地n.深处

  • Very excited, the party dug a hole two feet deep. 很激动，就地挖了一个洞深更生。
  • Haroun Tazieff, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and deep caves in all parts of the world. 哈龙塔捷耶夫，波兰科学家，已经花了毕生的研究在世界各地的活火山和探洞。
  • As we were walking past a shop, he held a diamond firmly against the window and made a deep impression in the glass. 当我们路过一家商店时，他坚定地拿起一块钻石，窗户和玻璃做了深刻的印象。

SEE> pro·found , be·neath 在下面, shal·low 浅

ODE> Extending far down from the top or surface. – extending far down.

475. deep·ly 深深地 ## 2

[’diːpli]adv.深深地；强烈地；（颜色）浓浓地；（声音）低沉地

  • Such a loss of dignity and descent into childish behaviour on the part of the adults deeply shocks the adolescents, and makes them resolve that in future they will not talk to their parents about the places or people they visit. 尊严和下降的这样的损失插入成人的一部分幼稚的行为深感震惊着少年，并让他们的决心，今后他们不会跟父母讲述去过的地方和人。
  • Parents would be greatly surprised and deeply touched if they realized how much belief their children usually have in their character and infallibility, and how much this faith means to a child. 家长会大为吃惊，如果他们意识到有多少相信他们的孩子通常在他们的品行和绝对正确，又有多少这种信念的手段对孩子深深打动了。

SEE> pro·found·ly , con·cerned 关心的, ob·vi·ous·ly 显然

ODE> Far down or in. – greatly, enormously, extremely, very much, to a great degree, to a great extent.

476. de·feat 打败 ## 7

[dɪ’fiːt]n.挫败；败北vt.战胜；击败；使…不能实现

  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • When he asked if Mr. Lane lived there, the policeman on duty told him that since his defeat, the ex-Prime Minister had gone abroad. 当他询问莱恩先生是否住在那里时，值班的警察告诉他，因为他的失败，前首相出国去了。
  • ‘I told you yesterday and the day before yesterday,’ he shouted, ’Mr. Lane was defeated in the elections. “我告诉你，昨天和前天，”他大叫着，“先生里在大选中被击败。

SEE> vic·to·ry 胜利, tri·umph , setback

ODE> Win a victory over (someone) in a battle or other contest; overcome or beat. – beat, conquer, win against, win a victory over, triumph over, prevail over, get the better of, best, worst, vanquish.

477. def·i·nite 确定的 ## 4

[’defɪnət]adj.明确的；一定的；有把握的

  • They had a definite meaning, for they were as near as early man could get to writing. 他们有一定的含义，因为它们已接近古代人的文字形式。
  • It is possible that there is a definite relation between these paintings and the markings that sometimes accompany them. 这可能是有这些画作和有时陪他们的标记之间的一定的联系。
  • He sees it edited by a definite set of customs and institutions and ways of thinking. 他把它编辑一个受特定的风俗习惯，制度和思维方式。

SEE> in·di·ca·tion 迹象, de·fin·i·tive , nec·es·sar·i·ly 一定

ODE> Clearly stated or decided; not vague or doubtful. – explicit, specific, express, precise, exact, defined, well defined, clear-cut.

478. de·gree 程度 ## 9

[dɪ’ɡriː]n.学位；程度；度数

  • To varying degrees, we all have secrets which we do not want even our closest friends to learn, but few of us have skeletons in the cupboard. 在不同程度上，我们都有，我们不希望连我们最亲密的朋友知道的秘密，但是却极少有人有柜中骷髅。
  • Why do small errors make it impossible to predict the weather system with a high degree of accuracy? 为什么小错误使人们无法预测天气系统，具有高精确度的？
  • The degree of secrecy naturally varies considerably. 保密程度自然差别很大。

SEE> grad·u·ate , mas·ter 主人, di·plo·ma

ODE> The amount, level, or extent to which something happens or is present. – level, stage, point, rung, standard, grade, gradation, mark.

479. de·lay 推迟 ## 2

[dɪ’leɪ]v.耽搁；推迟；延误n.耽搁；延期；推迟

  • Even this was remarkable, considering that she had had so many delays. 即使这是显着的，考虑到她有这么多的延误。
  • Ships may be delayed by storms; flights may be cancelled because of bad weather; but trains must be on time. 一般可能因风暴而延迟;航班可能因恶劣天气而取消;但火车必须准时。

SEE> post·pone , rea·son 理由, wait 等待

ODE> Make (someone or something) late or slow. – detain, hold up, make late, retard, keep, keep back, slow up, slow down, set back, bog down.

480. de·lib·er·ate·ly 有意地 ## 3

[dɪ’lɪbərətli]adv.故意地；不慌不忙地

  • He has deliberately chosen to lead the life he leads and is fully aware of the consequences. 他是故意在选择过那种生活的，并完全清楚后果的生活。
  • True eccentrics never deliberately set out to draw attention to themselves. 真正古怪的人从来没有刻意要引人注意。
  • Some things are collected deliberately in the home in an attempt to avoid waste. 有些东西是故意收集在家里，企图避免浪费。

SEE> ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, ev·i·dent·ly , pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> Consciously and intentionally; on purpose. – intentionally, on purpose, purposely, by design, knowingly, wittingly, consciously, purposefully.

481. del·i·cate 娇美的 ## 2

[’delɪkət]adj.微妙的；精美的；纤细的；脆弱的；敏锐的；美味的

  • Despite the fact that the bottle is tinted a delicate shade of green, an observant visitor would soon notice that it is filled with what looks like a thick, greyish substance. 尽管瓶子是偏绿的淡色，但细心的客人很快就会发现它装的是一种看上去黏稠，颜色发灰的。
  • But instruments far more delicate than that were needed if any really serious advance was to be made. 但仪器远不止这些微妙的，如果真正重大的进展是进行了必要的。

SEE> com·pli·cat·ed 复杂的, trick·y , ex·qui·site

ODE> Very fine in texture or structure; of intricate workmanship or quality. – fine, exquisite, intricate, dainty, airy, elegant, graceful.

482. de·light 喜悦 ## 2

[dɪ’laɪt]n.高兴；快乐v.(使)高兴；(使)欣喜

  • Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey – still in perfect condition. 想象一下，他们惊讶和高兴，当他们拆开包装箱的情况下，发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 - 完好无损。
  • He had spotted a tiny bottle at the bottom of my case and he pounced on it with delight. 他在我的箱底发现了一只小瓶，他一把抓了起来喜悦。

SEE> a·ston·ish·ment , joy 喜悦, a·maze·ment

ODE> Please (someone) greatly. – please greatly, charm, enchant, captivate, entrance, bewitch, thrill, excite, take someone’s breath away.

483. de·light·ed 欣喜的 ## 2

[dɪ’laɪtɪd]adj.高兴的；快乐的v.快乐；喜悦

  • My wife was delighted that things had returned to normal once more. 我的妻子很高兴，因为一切又再次恢复正常。
  • Robert was delighted to see me and equally pleased with my little gift. 罗伯特很高兴地看到我，同样感到高兴与我的小礼物。

SEE> thrilled , pleased 高兴, sur·prised 惊讶

ODE> Feeling or showing great pleasure. – very pleased, glad, happy, joyful, thrilled, overjoyed, ecstatic, euphoric, elated, blissful, enraptured, on cloud nine, on cloud seven, walking on air, in seventh heaven, in transports of delight, jumping for joy, beside oneself with happiness, excited.

484. de·mand 需求 ## 4

[dɪ’mænd]n.要求；需求v.要求；查问；需要

  • Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other, Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded. 每当意大利城邦在战争与对方，霍克沃德用于雇佣他的士兵诸侯谁愿意付出高昂的代价，他的要求。
  • When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money, repayment of which he may demand at any time, either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person. 任何人在银行开一个活期账户，他在借钱给银行，还款，而他可以在任何时间要求，以现金或通过绘制有利于他人的支票。
  • The great advantage of taking medicine is that it makes no demands on the taker beyond that of putting up for a moment with a disgusting taste, and that is what all patients demand of their doctors – to be cured at no inconvenience to themselves. 服药的最大优点是它使得在超出忍受一下令人作呕的味道一时的接受者没有需求，而这正是所有患者要求医生的 - 在没有任何不便，自己被治愈。

SEE> ex·pect 期望, more·o·ver 此外, rise 上升

ODE> An insistent and peremptory request, made as of right. – request, call.

485. den·tist 牙医 ## 9

[’dentɪst]n.牙科医生

  • I want to see the dentist, please. 我想看牙科医生。
  • I must see the dentist now, nurse. 我必须现在就见牙科医生，护士。
  • The dentist is very busy at the moment. 牙科医生这会儿很忙。

SEE> phar·ma·cist , sur·geon , hair·dress·er 理发师

ODE> A person who is qualified to treat diseases and other conditions that affect the teeth and gums, especially the repair and extraction of teeth and the insertion of artificial ones. –

486. de·ny 否认 ## 4

[dɪ’naɪ]vt.否认；拒绝承认；拒绝给予；自制

  • Aleko denied taking it and led Dimitri into his backyard. 阿列科不承认，并迪米特里领进院子。
  • When he denied the train’s existence, I borrowed his copy of the timetable. 当他否认了火车的存在，我借用了他的时间表的副本。
  • There was nothing in the record to show that the foreigner’s complaint was justified and the Chief of Police strongly denied the accusation. 材料中没有任何文字记载证明外国人的情况符合事实，警察局长矢口否认这一指控。

SEE> nor 也不, nei·ther 两者都不, in·sist 坚持

ODE> State that one refuses to admit the truth or existence of. – contradict, repudiate, gainsay, declare untrue, dissent from, disagree with, challenge, contest, oppose.

487. de·part·ment 部门 ## 5

[dɪ’pɑːrtmənt]n.部门；系；科；处；局n.知识范围

  • John went to see his bank manager who sent the remains of wallet and the money to the special department of the Bank of England in Newcastle: the Mutilated Ladies! 约翰去看望他的是谁发送的钱包和钱给英国银行在纽卡斯尔的一个专门部门的遗体银行经理：肢解的女子！
  • In the 1970s, computers were common enough, but only in big business, government departments, and large organizations. 在20世纪70年代，计算机已经普遍不够，但只用在大公司，政府部门和大的组织。
  • In so far as any inquiry is a secret one, it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities, or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm. 在迄今为止的任何调查都涉及到保密，自然受到了限制所有从事从有效接触与他们的同胞科学家们无论是在其他国家或大学，甚至往往不能在同一公司的其他部门实施它。

SEE> ad·min·is·tra·tion , of·fice 办公室, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A division of a large organization such as a government, university, or business, dealing with a specific area of activity. – division, section, sector, subsection, subdivision, unit, branch, arm, wing, segment, compartment.

488. de·par·ture 离开 ## 2

[dɪ’pɑːrtʃər]n.出发；离开；分歧；新的尝试

  • On the day before our departure, several bus loads of tourists descended on the town. 在我们出发的前一天，游客的几个总线负载下降的小镇。
  • After her departure, Aunt Harriet discovered that there were piles of empty wine bottles of all shapes and sizes neatly stacked in what had once been Bessie’s wardrobe. 她走之后，哈丽特终于发现，有整齐堆放在什么贝西以前用过的衣柜各种形状和大小的空酒瓶成堆。

SEE> ar·ri·val 到达, an·nounce·ment , leave 离开

ODE> The action of leaving, especially to start a journey. – leaving, going, going away, going off, leave-taking, withdrawal, exit, egress, quitting, decamping, retreat, retirement, retiral.

489. de·pend 依靠 ## 12

[dɪ’pend]vi.依赖；依靠；取决于

  • It’s a pleasant dream but everything depends on ‘if’! 这是一个美好的梦，但一切都取决于“如果”！
  • Whether we find a joke funny or not largely depends on where we have been brought up. 无论我们好笑，觉得一则笑话，很大程度上取决于我们在那里长大。
  • Whether a planet can support life depends on the size and brightness of its star, that is its ‘sun’. 一颗行星是否能够维持生命取决于它的恒星的大小和亮度，也就是它的“太阳”。

SEE> re·ly 依赖, af·fect 影响, de·pend·ent

ODE> Be controlled or determined by. – be contingent on, be conditional on, be dependent on, turn on, pivot on, hinge on, hang on, rest on, be based on, rely on.

490. de·pos·it 沉积 ## 4

[dɪ’pɑːzɪt]v.放置；(使)沉淀；存储；付(订金等)；寄存n.存款；定金；堆积物；矿床

  • You can pay a deposit of thirty pounds, and then fourteen pounds a month for three years. 您可以交纳押金30英镑，然后每月14镑，三年。
  • But we do not need to send men down to get the oil out, as we must with other mineral deposits. 但是，我们并不需要派人下去把油了，因为我们必须与其他矿藏。
  • It is animals and plants which lived in or near water whose remains are most likely to be preserved, for one of the necessary conditions of preservation is quick burial, and it is only in the seas and rivers, and sometimes lakes, where mud and silt have been continuously deposited, that bodies and the like can be rapidly covered over and preserved. 它是动物和植物，其生活在水中或水边的尸体最有可能被保存下来，因为保存的必要条件之一是迅速掩埋，并且只有在海洋和河流，有时在湖泊，这里的泥和淤泥一直在不断堆积，即机构等能够被迅速地覆盖而保存下来。

SEE> guar·an·tee 保证, savings , check 检查

ODE> A sum of money paid into a bank or building society account. – down payment, part payment, advance payment, prepayment, instalment, security, retainer, pledge, stake.

491. depth 深度 ## 5

[depθ]n.深度；深刻；深奥；深；厚度

  • Such creatures have rarely been seen alive by man as they live at a depth of six hundred feet. 这样的动物，因为它们生活在600英尺深的水下很少能看到活着的人。
  • The platforms extend to a depth of over 100 feet under the sea. 该平台扩展到超过100英尺的海底深度。
  • It extends to a depth of 3,723 feet. 它达3,723英尺的深度。

SEE> breadth , ex·tent 程度, deep 深的

ODE> The distance from the top or surface to the bottom of something. – deepness, distance downwards, distance inwards, distance from the outside.

492. de·scribe 描述 ## 18

[dɪ’skraɪb]vt.描述；说成；形容；画(尤指几何图形)

  • Can you describe it, sir? 你能描述一下吗，先生？
  • He described it as ‘a very agreeable situation located within two small hills in the midst of which flowed a great river.’ 他将其形容为“一家位于其中的流入一条大河中间的两个小山头一个非常愉快的局面。”
  • The English language possesses a vivid saying to describe this sort of situation. 英语中有一个生动的说法来形容这种情况。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·plain 解释, in·deed 确实

ODE> Give a detailed account in words of. – report, narrate, recount, relate, tell of, set out, chronicle.

493. de·scrip·tion 描述 ## 3

[dɪ’skrɪpʃn]n.描述；刻画；类型；说明书

  • However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the Zoo felt obliged to investigate, for the descriptions given by people who claimed to have seen the puma were extraordinarily similar. 然而，随着证据越来越多，动物园的专家们感到有必要调查，通过谁声称见到过美洲狮的人们所描述的情况竟是出奇地相似。
  • And the sensitive observer of sculpture must also learn to feel shape simply as shape, not as description or reminiscence. 和雕塑的敏感者也必须学会去感受形状简单的形状，而不是描述或联想。
  • If you recognize yourself in this description, you might include a couple of heady growth stocks in your portfolio, alongside your more pedestrian investments. 如果你认识到自己在该说明中，可能包括在你的投资组合了几个令人兴奋的成长股，你旁边的行人多的投资。

SEE> de·scribe 描述, ex·pla·na·tion 解释, con·text 上下文

ODE> A spoken or written account of a person, object, or event. – account, explanation, elucidation, illustration, representation, interpretation.

494. de·sert 沙漠 ## 10

[’dezərt]n.沙漠；荒地；应得(的惩罚或奖励)v.遗弃；离弃；放弃；擅离职守

  • Once he landed on the roof of a block of flats and on another occasion, he landed in a deserted car park. 一次，他降落在单位，并在另一个场合块的屋顶，降落在了一个废弃的停车场上。
  • What was exceptional about the two men’s stay on the desert island? 是什么特殊的关于两个男人的停留在荒岛？
  • Most of us have formed an unrealistic picture of life on a desert island. 我们大多数人的生活形成了一个荒岛上一种不切实际的想法。

SEE> ar·id , vast 广大, dust·y

ODE> Abandon (a person, cause, or organization) in a way considered disloyal or treacherous. – abandoned, forsaken, cast aside, cast off, thrown over, betrayed, jilted.

495. de·sign 设计 ## 5

[dɪ’zaɪn]n.设计；图样；图案；目的v.设计；计划

  • The fantastic modern buildings have been designed by Kurt Gunter. 这些巨大的现代化建筑是由库尔特·冈特设计的。
  • The great statue, which was designed by the sculptor Auguste Bartholdi, took ten years to complete. 伟大的雕像，这是由雕塑家奥古斯特·巴托尔迪设计，花了10年时间。
  • The Verrazano Bridge, which was designed by Othmar Ammann, joins Brooklyn to Staten Island. 维拉萨诺大桥由奥斯马。阿曼设计，连结着布鲁克林与斯塔顿岛。

SEE> ar·chi·tec·ture , con·cept 概念, in·no·va·tive

ODE> A plan or drawing produced to show the look and function or workings of a building, garment, or other object before it is made. – plan, blueprint, drawing, scale drawing, sketch, outline, map, plot, diagram, delineation, draft, depiction, representation, artist’s impression, scheme, model, prototype, proposal.

496. de·sire 渴望 ## 2

[dɪ’zaɪər]n.渴望；愿望；欲望v.渴望；向往；要求

  • Perhaps it is the desire for solitude or the chance of making an unexpected discovery that lures people down to the depths of the earth. 也许这是独处或渴望寻求意外发现的机会，吸引人们来到地下深处。
  • As for the unfortunate people who can command everything they want, who can gratify every caprice and lay their hands on almost every object of desire – for them a new pleasure, a new excitement is only an additional satiation. 而对于不幸的人谁可以命令他们想要的一切，谁又能取悦每一个任性和染指的欲望几乎每一个对象 - 为他们一种新的乐趣，新的刺激只是无所谓的事情。

SEE> wish 希望, rea·son 理由, will·ing·ness 愿意

ODE> A strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen. – wish, want.

497. desk 书桌 ## 7

[desk]n.书桌；服务台；柜台；部门；小台架

  • He did not look up from his desk when I entered. 他没有从他的办公桌看起来我进去的时候。
  • A girl came in and put an envelope on his desk. 一个女孩走了进来，把一个信封放在他的办公桌上。
  • He led me into his room and hurriedly hid a large parcel under his desk. 他把我带进了他的房间，慌忙把桌子下面把一个大包藏。

SEE> draw·er 抽屉, room 房间, be·side 在旁边

ODE> A piece of furniture with a flat or sloping surface and typically with drawers, at which one can read, write, or do other work. – table, work surface, bureau, writing desk, writing table, roll-top desk, lectern.

498. de·spite 尽管 ## 6

[dɪ’spaɪt]prep.尽管；不管n.憎恨；轻视

  • Despite her great age, she was very graceful indeed, but, so far, the archaeologists have been unable to discover her identity. 尽管上了年纪，她很优雅确实，但是，到目前为止，考古学家一直未能发现她的身份。
  • Despite the new tunnel, there are still a few people who rashly attempt to cross the Pass on foot. 尽管新的隧道，但仍有一些人谁莽撞地企图跨越山口徒步。
  • Despite its immensity, it is both simple and elegant, fulfilling its designer’s dream to create ‘an enormous object drawn as faintly as possible’. 尽管很大，但它的结构简单，造型优美，实现了设计者的梦想，创造“为依稀描绘成可能一个巨大的物体”。

SEE> spite 尽管, how·ev·er 然而, though 虽然

ODE> Without being affected by; in spite of. – in spite of, notwithstanding, regardless of, in defiance of, without being affected by, in the face of, for all, even with, undeterred by.

499. de·stroy 破坏 ## 9

[dɪ’strɔɪ]v.破坏；杀死；消灭；摧毁

  • If the money was not paid promptly, the gangsters would quickly put a man out of business by destroying his shop. 如果资金不及时，歹徒们就会很快把人歇业通过破坏他的商店。
  • As long ago as the fourteenth century, an Englishman, Sir John Hawkwood, made the remarkable discovery that people would rather pay large sums of money than have their life work destroyed by gangsters. 早在14世纪，英国人约翰。霍克伍德就有过非凡的发现：人们情愿付出的钱，也不愿毕生的心血毁于歹徒大笔。
  • Meanwhile, his unit was lost and all records of him had been destroyed. 与此同时，他所在部队被击溃，他的所有档案已被销毁。

SEE> threat·en 威胁, kill 杀, rid 摆脱

ODE> End the existence of (something) by damaging or attacking it. – demolish, knock down, pull down, tear down, level, raze, raze to the ground, fell, dismantle, break up, wreck, ruin, smash, shatter, crash, blast, blow up, blow to bits, blow to pieces, dynamite, explode, bomb, torpedo.

500. de·tail 详情 ## 5

[’diːteɪl]n.细节；琐事；枝节vt.详述；详细说明

  • Acting on the contention that facts are sacred, reporters can cause untold suffering to individuals by publishing details about their private lives. 代理的论点的事实是神圣的，记者可以通过发布关于他们私生活的细节，有时会给当事人造成极大的痛苦。
  • He has eight lawyer assistants to help him and he examines every single letter in detail. 他有8位律师助理帮助他，他详细检查了每一个字母。
  • She felt in her handbag for the piece of paper on which her father had written down all the details of the journey and gave it to the porter. 她从钱包里摸出了一张上她父亲写下旅途的所有细节纸，给了搬运工。

SEE> de·tailed 详细, re·veal 揭示, de·scrip·tion 描述

ODE> An individual fact or item. – particular, feature, characteristic, respect, ingredient, attribute, item, specific, fact, piece of information, point, factor, element, circumstance, consideration, aspect, facet, side, part, unit, component, constituent, member, accessory.

501. de·ter·mine 决定 ## 4

[dɪ’tɜːrmɪn]v.决定；决心；确定；测定

  • I have been offered a large sum of money to go away, but I am determined to stay here. 我已经提供的一大笔钱让我搬走，但我决定留在这儿。
  • I determined to lodge a complaint as soon as we arrived. 我决定一到站就去投诉。
  • It is not a simple competition for a fixed amount of food determined by the physical environment, because the environment that determines our evolution is no longer essentially physical. 它不是由物质环境所决定的食物固定量的简单竞争，因为决定我们进化的环境不再是物理本质。

SEE> de·ter·mined 决心, wheth·er 是否, ex·am·ine 检查

ODE> Cause (something) to occur in a particular way or to have a particular nature. – deciding, decisive, conclusive, final, settling, definitive, key, pivotal, crucial, critical, most influential, significant, major, chief, principal, prime, paramount.

502. de·vel·op 开发 ## 13

[dɪ’veləp]v.发展；发育；开发；冲洗(照片)

  • Since then, he has developed another bad habit. 从那时起，他已经开发出另外一种坏习惯。
  • After years of conditioning, most of us have developed an unshakable faith in railway timetables. 经过多年的适应，我们大多数人对火车时刻表产生了不可动摇的信念。
  • Furthermore, the acquisition of this bottle cured him of a bad habit he had been developing for years. 此外，这瓶香水泥还治好一个坏习惯，他已经发展了多年的他。

SEE> de·vel·oped , de·vel·op·ing , build 建造

ODE> Grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate. – grow, evolve, mature, expand, enlarge, spread, advance, progress, prosper, succeed, thrive, get on well, flourish, blossom, bloom, burgeon, make headway, be successful.

503. de·vel·op·ment 发展 ## 12

[dɪ’veləpmənt]n.发展；开发；生长；进展；[摄]显影；新开发区

  • What was the ‘future’ electronic development that Leon Bagrit wasn’t able to foresee? 什么是“未来”电子发展是巴格瑞特无法预见？
  • From those humble beginnings, we have seen the development of the user-friendly home computers and multimedia machines which are in common use today. 从那些简陋的初级阶段，我们看到了人性化的家用电脑和多媒体机今天是普遍使用的发展。
  • Considering how recent these developments are, it is even more remarkable that as long ago as the 1960s, an Englishman, Leon Bagrit, was able to predict some of the uses of computers which we know today. 考虑到这些发展是如何最近是，它更是了不起，早在20世纪60年代，一个英国人，他在60年代能够预测一些电脑今天我们所知道的用途。

SEE> de·vel·op·ing , proj·ect 项目, de·vel·op 开发

ODE> The process of developing or being developed. – evolution, growth, maturing, expansion, enlargement, spread, buildout, progress, success, blossoming, blooming, burgeoning, headway.

504. de·vice 设备 ## 3

[dɪ’vaɪs]n.装置；设备；策略；设计

  • The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing. 美国人很愿意就医疗器械的标准达成一个协议，然后推敲出不同的合同，用以涵盖，比如说 - 电子产品和药品的生产。
  • First the electroencephalograph (which is simply a device for recording the electrical activity of the brain by attaching electrodes to the scalp) shows that while there is a change in the pattern of activity during sleep, there is no evidence that the total amount of activity is any less. 第一点，脑电图（这是简单地对电极接到头皮记录大脑电活动的装置）显示，虽然有在睡眠期间活动的图案的变化，没有证据表明活性的总量是任何减少。
  • Some devices were quite simple. 有些装置非常简单。

SEE> ex·plo·sive , in·stance 例子, at·tached 附

ODE> A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment. – implement, gadget, utensil, tool, appliance, piece of equipment, apparatus, piece of apparatus, piece of hardware, instrument, machine, mechanism, contrivance, contraption, invention, convenience, amenity, aid.

505. di·a·mond 钻石 ## 10

[’daɪəmənd]n.钻石；菱形；棒球内场；纸牌的方块vt.用钻石装饰

  • Did the detectives save the diamonds? 难道侦探拯救钻石？
  • They were expecting a valuable parcel of diamonds from South Africa. 他们正期待从南非钻石贵重包裹。
  • A few hours earlier, someone had told the police that thieves would try to steal the diamonds. 几个小时前，有人曾告诉警方，盗贼会去抢钻石。

SEE> neck·lace , jew·el , ring 响铃

ODE> A precious stone consisting of a clear and colourless crystalline form of pure carbon, the hardest naturally occurring substance. – diamond, precious stone, jewel.

506. dic·tion·ar·y 字典 ## 2

[’dɪkʃəneri]n.字典；辞典；词典

  • It’s a dictionary. 这是一本字典。
  • I bought two expensive dictionaries here half an hour ago, but I forgot to take them with me. 我这里买了两次很贵的辞典半小时前，但是我忘了拿走我。

SEE> slang , vo·cab·u·lar·y 词汇, bi·og·ra·phy

ODE> A book or electronic resource that lists the words of a language (typically in alphabetical order) and gives their meaning, or gives the equivalent words in a different language, often also providing information about pronunciation, origin, and usage. – lexicon, wordbook, glossary, vocabulary list, vocabulary, word list, wordfinder.

507. die 死亡 ## 23

[daɪ]v.死；枯竭；消失；渴望n.骰子；印模；金属模子

  • It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he will have bad luck; if he picks a leaf, he will die. 有人说，如果有人触摸了这棵树，他将有倒霉的事。如果他摘了一片树叶，他会死。
  • Did the doctors find out how the woman died? 难道医生发现那个女人是怎么死的？
  • The mummy of an Egyptian woman who died in 800 B.C. 一位埃及妇女谁在800死亡的公元前木乃伊

SEE> dead 死的, an·y·way 无论如何, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> (of a person, animal, or plant) stop living. – pass away, pass on, lose one’s life, depart this life, expire, breathe one’s last, draw one’s last breath, meet one’s end, meet one’s death, lay down one’s life, be no more, perish, be lost, go the way of the flesh, go the way of all flesh, go to glory, go to one’s last resting place, go to meet one’s maker, cross the great divide, cross the Styx.

508. di·et 饮食 ## 6

[’daɪət]n.日常食物；规定饮食；节食n.（日本等国的）国会v.节食；照规定饮食；喂食

  • Why did Hugh’s diet not work? 为什么休的饮食不工作？
  • My friend, Hugh, has always been fat, but things got so bad recently that he decided to go on a diet. 我的朋友休一直很胖，但情况变得越发糟糕最近，他决定节食。
  • He began his diet a week ago. 他一个星期前就开始了他的饮食。

SEE> eat 吃, veg·e·tar·i·an , nu·tri·tion

ODE> The kinds of food that a person, animal, or community habitually eats. – selection of food, food and drink, food, foodstuffs, provisions, edibles, fare.

509. dif·fer·ence 区别 ## 7

[’dɪfrəns]n.差异；不同；差额；分歧vt. 区别

  • It obviously could not tell the difference between Indian music and jazz! 显然，它分辨不出印度音乐和爵士乐的区别！
  • In spite of national differences, certain funny situations have a universal appeal. 尽管民族不同，有些滑稽的情节却能产生普遍的效果。
  • What was the difference between Bruce’s behaviour and that of other people? 是什么布鲁斯的行为之间和其他人的区别？

SEE> fact 事实, in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> A point or way in which people or things are dissimilar. – dissimilarity, contrast, distinction, distinctness, differentiation.

510. dif·fer·ent 不同 ## 25

[’dɪfrənt]adj.不同的；差异的；分别的；各不相同的

  • He is working for a big firm and he has already visited a great number of different places in Australia. 他正在为一家大公司，他已经去过澳大利亚的不少地方的大数目。
  • In England, each person speaks a different language. 在英国，人们各自说着不同的语言。
  • It was very different from modern car races but no less exciting. 它与现代汽车比赛大不相同，但同样令人振奋。

SEE> var·i·ous 各种, these 这些, same 相同

ODE> Not the same as another or each other; unlike in nature, form, or quality. – dissimilar, unalike, unlike, non-identical, contrasting, divergent, disparate, poles apart.

511. dif·fi·cult 困难的 ## 27

[’dɪfɪkəlt]adj.困难的；艰难的；(人)难对付的；不易相处的

  • They were too difficult for me. 他们对我来说太难了。
  • Why will the police have a difficult time? 为什么警察有困难的时候？
  • As usual, the police will have a difficult time. 像往常一样，警方将有一个艰难的时刻。

SEE> im·pos·si·ble 不可能, quite 相当, ver·y 非常

ODE> Needing much effort or skill to accomplish, deal with, or understand. – hard, strenuous, arduous, laborious, heavy, tough, onerous, burdensome, demanding, punishing, gruelling, grinding, back-breaking, painful.

512. dif·fi·cul·ty 困难 ## 12

[’dɪfɪkəlti]n.困难；争议；麻烦

  • The aircraft was able to fly over the endless white plains without difficulty. 飞机可以飞越茫茫无际的白色平原毫无困难。
  • With great difficulty, he climbed into the shop window to get the dress. 好大劲儿，他爬进橱窗去取那件衣服。
  • Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run. 尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，他在控制汽车，因为轮胎在第一次运行时突发很大的困难。

SEE> trou·ble 麻烦, be·sides , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The state or condition of being difficult. – strain, struggling, awkwardness, trouble, toil, labour, laboriousness, strenuousness, arduousness.

513. din·ner 晚餐 ## 19

[’dɪnər]n.晚餐；晚宴；主餐

  • Is dinner ready, Carol? 饭好了，卡罗尔？
  • We can have dinner at seven o’clock. 我们可以在七点钟吃晚饭。
  • Tell Mary we’ll be late for dinner this evening. 你告诉玛丽我们将这个深夜吃饭。

SEE> lunch 午餐, break·fast 早餐, meal 餐

ODE> The main meal of the day, taken either around midday or in the evening. – evening meal, supper, main meal, repast.

514. di·rect 直接 ## 3

[də’rekt]adj.直接的；笔直的；坦白的v.对准；指挥；指示；命令

  • After the alarm had been given, the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision. 警报响过不久，巨轮急转弯，以避免直接碰撞。
  • It went direct from my local station and the journey lasted a mere hour and seventeen minutes. 它接着直接从我的本地站的旅程仅仅持续了一个小时17分钟。
  • The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards, as well as in the line of its course, are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings sufficient sustenance and progress. 空气船舶的墙壁直接向上，以及在其过程中的线路中的电流，足以给其巨大的翅膀足够的支撑力和前进的巨大鸟。

SEE> in·di·rect 间接, di·rect·ly 直接, in·stance 例子

ODE> Extending or moving from one place to another without changing direction or stopping. – straight, undeviating, unswerving.

515. di·rec·tion 方向 ## 7

[də’rekʃn]n.方向；指导；用法说明；趋势；目标；管理

  • No matter how much we like honey, or how much we have read about the uncanny sense of direction which bees possess, we have a horror of being stung. 无论多少，我们似蜜，或有多少我们如何阅读方向的不可思议感，这蜜蜂具有，我们有害怕被蜂蜇。
  • Fortunately for me, as I was wondering what to do next, there appeared on the horizon a man on horseback, riding in my direction. 幸运的是我，因为我不知道下一步该怎么做，有从天边出现一个骑马的人，骑在我的方向。
  • It is a harmless habit, but it litters up her desk to such an extent that every time she opens it, loose bits of paper fall out in every direction. 它是一种无害的习惯，但她的办公桌上最多乱丢到这样的程度，每次她打开它时，纸张的松位在每一个方向脱落。

SEE> di·rec·tions , mov·ing 移动, op·po·site 对面的

ODE> A course along which someone or something moves. – way, route, course, line, run, bearing, orientation.

516. dirt·y 肮脏的 ## 2

[’dɜːrti]adj.脏的；肮脏的；下流的；卑鄙的；腐败的；不正当的v.弄脏；玷污

  • There was no trace of fingerprints, but the inspector found a dirty red bundle that contained jewellery which the old lady said was not hers. 有没有指纹痕迹，却发现了一个装有珠宝的老妇人说那不是她的肮脏的红包袱。
  • Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine. 因为有一般都很肮脏和跳蚤深重例如旅馆;食物是当地的干酪和面包通常存放了一年的时候，都冲下来的粗酒。

SEE> filth·y , stuff 东西, ug·ly 丑陋

ODE> Covered or marked with an unclean substance. – soiled, grimy, grubby, filthy, mucky, stained, unwashed, greasy, smeared, smeary, spotted, smudged, cloudy, muddy, dusty, sooty.

517. dis·ap·pear 消失 ## 6

[ˌdɪsə’pɪr]vi.消失；不见；失踪

  • On his way to the sweet shop, he dropped his fifty pence and it bounced along the pavement and then disappeared down a drain. 在他的途中去糖果店，他放弃了他50便士，它沿着人行道上跳了几下，掉进排水。
  • The next morning, the box had disappeared but Mrs. Ramsay was sure that the kidnapper would keep his word. 第二天早晨，放钱的盒子不见了。但拉姆齐太太确信绑架者是会履行诺言。
  • What a relief it was when the boulders suddenly disappeared, giving way to a stretch of plain where the only obstacles were clumps of bushes. 什么救济是突然大石块不见了，让位给平淡的舒展，唯一的障碍是灌木丛的团块。

SEE> van·ish , fade , an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> Cease to be visible. – vanish, pass from sight, cease to be visible, vanish from sight, recede from view, be lost to sight, be lost to view, fade, fade away, melt away.

518. dis·ap·point 失望 ## 2

[ˌdɪsə’pɔɪnt]v.使失望；使破灭

  • Why is Carol disappointed? 为什么卡罗尔感到失望？
  • After his attempt, Campbell was disappointed to learn that his average speed had been 299 miles per hour. 比赛结束后，坎贝尔非常失望地得知他的平均时速已经每小时299英里。

SEE> im·press 给留下印象, ap·plaud , like·wise

ODE> Fail to fulfil the hopes or expectations of. – let down, fail, dash the hopes of.

519. dis·ap·point·ed 失望 ## 2

[ˌdɪsə’pɔɪntɪd]adj.失望的

  • Jeremy was a little disappointed by this but he did as his daughter asked. 这不免使杰里米感到失望一点点，但他还是按照他女儿的要求。
  • Those who failed to get in need not have felt disappointed, as many of the artistes who should have appeared did not come. 这些谁失败没有必要感到失望拿到，因为许多谁应该出现没来的艺人。

SEE> sur·prised 惊讶, pleased 高兴, frus·trat·ed

ODE> Sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfil one’s hopes or expectations. – saddened, upset, let down, disheartened, downhearted, cast down, downcast, depressed, dispirited, discouraged, despondent, dismayed, crestfallen, distressed, chagrined.

520. disappointing 令人失望 ## 2

[ˌdɪsə’pɔɪntɪŋ]adj.令人失望的动词disappoint的现在分词.

  • The pictures it sent us were very disappointing because its main mirror was faulty! 这些照片寄给我们很令人失望，因为它的主要镜子有误差。
  • The contents were disappointing. 内容令人失望。

SEE> dis·ap·point·ed 失望, sur·pris·ing 令人吃惊的, me·di·o·cre

ODE> Failing to fulfil someone’s hopes or expectations. – saddening, disheartening, dispiriting, discouraging, upsetting, dismaying, depressing, distressing.

521. dis·as·ter 灾难 ## 2

[dɪ’zæstər]n.灾难

  • We are lucky in that only the lower fields, which make up a very small proportion of our farm, are affected by flooding, but other farms are less favourably sited, and flooding can sometimes spell disaster for their owners. 我们是只有较低的领域，从而弥补了我们农场比例很小幸运，是由洪水的影响，但其他农场地势欠佳，和洪水有时会给农场主带来灾难。
  • The first sign of disaster was a dead sheep floating down. 灾难的第一迹象是一只死羊顺流而下。

SEE> ca·tas·tro·phe , trag·e·dy , flood 洪水

ODE> A sudden accident or a natural catastrophe that causes great damage or loss of life. – catastrophe, calamity, cataclysm, tragedy, act of God, holocaust.

522. dis·ci·pline 纪律 ## 3

[’dɪsəplɪn]n.纪律；训练；学科vt.训练；惩罚

  • He noticed at once that discipline was slack: the Danes had the self-confidence of conquerors, and their security precautions were casual. 他马上发现纪律松弛：丹麦人具有征服者的自信，他们的安全措施马马虎虎。
  • A writer makes order out of the anarchy of his heart; he submits himself to a more ruthless discipline than any critic dreamed of, and when he flirts with fame, he is taking time off from living with himself, from the search for what his world contains at its inmost point. 一个作家从他的心脏的无政府状态;他提出自己的无情的纪律比任何评论家想像，当他载誉调情，他就脱离了自我生活，脱离了对什么他的世界包含在其内心深处的点抽出时间。
  • For them discipline in one form or another is the most hopeful path. 对他们来说，纪律一种形式或另一种则是最有希望的路径。

SEE> em·pha·sis 强调, im·por·tant·ly 重要的, team·work

ODE> The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behaviour, using punishment to correct disobedience. – control, regulation, direction, order, authority, rule, strictness, a firm hand.

523. dis·cov·er 发现 ## 22

[dɪ’skʌvər]v.发现；偶然撞见；发觉

  • He was so surprised at being discovered that he did not even try to run away. 他是如此惊讶于被发现，他甚至没有试图逃跑。
  • This morning, however, a firemen accidentally discovered the cause. 然而今天上午，一个消防队员偶然发现了原因。
  • When he woke up next morning, he discovered that the boat had, in the meantime, travelled to Calais. 当他第二天早上醒来时，他发现船有，在这段时间已经到了加。

SEE> find 找到, in·deed 确实, pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> Find unexpectedly or during a search. – find, locate, come across, come upon, stumble on, chance on, light on, bring to light, uncover, unearth, turn up, track down.

524. dis·cov·er·y 发现 ## 14

[dɪ’skʌvəri]n.发现；发现物

  • Some time ago, an interesting discovery was made by archaeologists on the Aegean island of Kea. 前一段时间，一个有趣的发现是由在爱琴海的基亚岛上，考古工作者。
  • As long ago as the fourteenth century, an Englishman, Sir John Hawkwood, made the remarkable discovery that people would rather pay large sums of money than have their life work destroyed by gangsters. 早在14世纪，英国人约翰。霍克伍德就有过非凡的发现：人们情愿付出的钱，也不愿毕生的心血毁于歹徒大笔。
  • What was the ‘happy discovery’? 什么是“幸福发现”？

SEE> in·deed 确实, in·stance 例子, fact 事实

ODE> The action or process of discovering or being discovered. – finding, locating, location, uncovering, unearthing.

525. dis·ease 疾病 ## 13

[dɪ’ziːz]n.疾病v.使…生病，感染

  • As there were strange marks on the X-ray plates taken of the mummy, doctors have been trying to find out whether the woman died of a rare disease. 由于有上采取的木乃伊的X光片奇怪的标记，医生们一直试图搞清这位妇女是否死于一种罕见的疾病。
  • The price we pay for cheap food may be already too high: Mad Cow Disease (BSE) in cattle, salmonella in chicken and eggs, and listeria in dairy products. 为了廉价食物的价格，我们的薪酬可能已经太高了：疯牛病（BSE）牛，沙门氏菌在鸡肉和鸡蛋，以及乳制品的利斯特氏菌。
  • We continually wage war on them, for they contaminate our food, carry diseases, or devour our crops. 我们不断同他们斗争，因为昆虫弄脏我们的食物，传播疾病，吞噬庄稼。

SEE> ill·ness 疾病, in·fec·tion 感染, in·fec·tious 传染的

ODE> A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury. – illness, sickness, ill health.

526. dish 盘子 ## 19

[dɪʃ]n.盘；碟；一道菜；菜肴；碟状物vt.使成碟状；装盘vi.闲谈

  • Fish and chips has always been a favourite dish in Britain, but as the oceans have been overfished, fish has become more and more expensive. 鱼和炸土豆片一直是英国人喜爱的一道菜，但是随着海洋里的滥捕滥捞，鱼已经变得越来越昂贵。
  • Snails would, of course, be the main dish. 蜗牛当然的，是道主菜。
  • Who owned the pie dish and why? 谁拥有的馅饼盘子，为什么？

SEE> des·sert , soup 汤, de·li·cious

ODE> A shallow, flat-bottomed container for cooking or serving food. – bowl, plate, soup plate, platter, salver.

527. dis·like 讨厌 ## 3

[dɪs’laɪk]v.不喜欢；厌恶n.不喜爱；厌恶；反感

  • Dickie disliked snobs intensely. 迪基对势利小人。
  • The survey revealed a large number of sources of noise that we really dislike. 这个调查揭示了大量的噪声源，我们真的不喜欢。
  • On the other hand, those who dislike noise will sometimes use most inadequate evidence to support their pleas for a quieter society. 在另一方面，那些谁不喜欢噪音有时会用不充分的证据来支持他们希望有一个较为安静的社会。

SEE> loathe , af·fec·tion 感情, ev·i·dent·ly

ODE> Feel distaste for or hostility towards. – hate, detest, loathe, abominate, abhor, despise, scorn, shun, execrate.

528. dis·miss 解雇 ## 2

[dɪs’mɪs]vt.开除；解散；屏除；（法律）驳回

  • The poor girl was dismissed instantly. 这个可怜的姑娘当即被解雇了。
  • Bagrit dismissed the idea that computers would learn to ‘think’ for themselves and would ‘rule the world’, which people liked to believe in those days. 巴格瑞特驳斥了这种观点，电脑会学会“思考”自己，并会“统治世界”，里面的人都愿意相信在那些日子里。

SEE> dis·mis·sal , sug·ges·tion 建议, ig·nore 忽视

ODE> Order or allow to leave; send away. – send away, let go, release, free.

529. dis·play 展示 ## 10

[dɪ’spleɪ]n.显示；陈列；炫耀vt.显示；表现；夸示

  • There was also a great deal of machinery on display. 也有展出机械很大。
  • Mr. Taylor, the owner of a jewellery shop was admiring a new window display. 泰勒先生，珠宝店的老板正在欣赏新布置的橱窗。
  • After gazing at the display for several minutes, Mr. Taylor went back into his shop. 在显示器凝神欣赏了几分钟，泰勒先生又回到了店里。

SEE> ex·hib·it 展览, ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子

ODE> Put (something) in a prominent place in order that it may readily be seen. – exhibit, show, put on show, put on view, expose to view, present, unveil, set forth.

530. dis·tance 距离 ## 16

[’dɪstəns]n.距离；路程；远方vt.与 … 保持距离；把(对手)甩在后面

  • The bird covered the distance in three minutes. 鸟用了3分钟的距离。
  • During that time she covered a distance of eight miles. 在那段时间里，她的8英里。
  • Tomorrow he will be watching her anxiously as she swims the long distance to England. 明天他将焦急地注视着女儿游到英国的长途。

SEE> a·part 分开, in·stance 例子, hence 因此

ODE> The length of the space between two points. – interval, space, span, gap, separation, interspace, stretch, extent.

531. dis·tin·guish 区分 ## 2

[dɪ’stɪŋɡwɪʃ]vt.区别；辨认；使显著

  • Now the snag in this sort of anecdote is of course that one cannot distinguish cause and effect. 现在，这类轶闻中的疑难处当然在于人们无法区别因果关系。
  • The child learning to see, first distinguishes only two-dimensional shape; it cannot judge distances, depths. 孩子学习，看，起初只会分辨二维形状;它不能判断距离和深度。

SEE> dif·fer·en·ti·ate , de·scribe 描述, fur·ther·more

ODE> Recognize or treat (someone or something) as different. – differentiate, tell apart, discriminate, discern, determine, pick out.

532. dis·trict 区 ## 3

[’dɪstrɪkt]n.地区；行政区vt.把 … 划分成区

  • It must be the only modern house in the district. 它必须是唯一的一栋现代化住宅小区。
  • The Ombudsman immediately wrote to the Chief of Police in the district asking him to send a record of the case. 司法特派员立即写信给当地的警察局长，请他寄送情况的记录。
  • We were, however, worried about our nearest neighbours, whose farm was low lying and who were newcomers to the district. 我们，但是，担心我们的近邻，他们的农场地势低洼，而且谁是新来乍到。

SEE> ar·e·a 区域, vil·lage 村庄, town 城镇

ODE> An area of a country or city, especially one characterized by a particular feature or activity. – neighbourhood, area, region, place, locality, locale, community, quarter, sector, vicinity, zone, territory, block, part, spot, patch, domain.

533. dis·turb 打扰 ## 4

[dɪ’stɜːrb]v.扰乱；妨碍；使 … 不安；打破…的平静；打乱…的治安

  • It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside. 令人不安的是认为一个危险的野兽继续在宁静的乡村大。
  • So their entry into this flat was apparently not the burglars’ first job that day and they must have been disturbed. 所以他们进入这个单位是显然不是窃贼第一份工作的那一天，他们必须感到不安。
  • If one group of people were disturbed from their eye-movement sleep for several nights on end, and another group were disturbed for an equal period of time but when they were not exhibiting eye-movements, the first group began to show some personality disorders while the others seemed more or less unaffected. 如果人一组从他们的眼动睡眠不安就结束了好几个晚上，另一组被打乱了相等的时间段，但是当他们并没有表现出眼睛运动，第一组人开始出现，而一些人格障碍其他人似乎没受什么影响。

SEE> in·ter·fere , dis·rupt , con·fuse 迷惑

ODE> Interfere with the normal arrangement or functioning of. – disarrange, muddle, rearrange, disorganize, disorder, mix up, interfere with.

534. di·vide 划分 ## 3

[dɪ’vaɪd]vt.划分；隔开；分割；[数]除vi.分裂；分开n.分水岭；分歧；分

  • The real dividing line between continents and oceans occurs at the foot of a steeper slope. 大陆和海洋之间的真实划分线发生在更陡的斜率的脚下。
  • Broadly speaking, human beings may be divided into three classes: those who are toiled to death, those who are worried to death, and those who are bored to death. 从广义上讲，人类可以分为三类：那些谁是劳累而死，那些谁是急死了，和那些谁是无聊死了。
  • It may also be said that rational, industrious, useful human beings are divided into two classes: first, those whose work is work and whose pleasure is pleasure; and secondly, those whose work and pleasure are one. 这也可以说是理性的，勤劳的，有用的人可以分为两类：第一类人而言，工作就是工作，娱乐就是娱乐;其次，他们的工作和娱乐是一回事。

SEE> split 分裂, di·vid·ed , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Separate or be separated into parts. – split, cut up, cleave, carve up, slice up, chop up, split up.

535. do 做 ## 496

[du]v.做；干n.注意事项；聚会；事情

  • Does the man get his umbrella back? 难道男人得到他的伞回来？
  • How do you do? 你好吗？
  • How do you do? 你好吗？

SEE> want 想要, know 知道, you 你

ODE> Perform (an action, the precise nature of which is often unspecified) – carry out, undertake, discharge, execute, perpetrate, perform, accomplish, implement, achieve, complete, finish, conclude.

536. doc·tor 医生 ## 32

[’dɑːktər]n.博士；医生v.篡改，伪造；阉割

  • He looks ill. We must call the doctor. 他觉得不舒服。我们得去请医生。
  • Can you remember the doctor’s telephone number? 你还记得医生的电话号码吗？
  • What’s the matter with him, doctor? 什么是他的事，医生？

SEE> nurse 护士, den·tist 牙医, sur·geon

ODE> A person who is qualified to treat people who are ill. – physician, medical practitioner, medical man, medical woman, clinician, doctor of medicine, MD.

537. dog 狗 ## 19
