  • What about the dog? 什么狗？
  • The dog’s in the garden, too. 狗在花园里了。
  • Who’s going to look after the dog? 谁去狗照顾？

SEE> cat 猫, pet 宠物, pup·py

ODE> A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, non-retractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice. – hound, canine, mongrel, cur, tyke.

538. dol·lar 美元 ## 2

[’dɑːlər]n.美元

  • The Hubble telescope was launched into space by NASA on April 20, 1990 at a cost of over a billion dollars. 哈勃望远镜于超过十亿美元的价格于1990年4月20日发射升空的美国宇航局。
  • As the time and cost of making a chip drop to a few days and a few hundred dollars, engineers may soon be free to let their imaginations soar without being penalized by expensive failures. 随着时间和制造一块芯片几天和几百美元的成本，工程师们可能很快可以任他们的想象驰骋而不会被昂贵的失败所惩罚。

SEE> cur·ren·cy , euro 欧元, rise 上升

ODE> The basic monetary unit of the US, Canada, Australia, and certain countries in the Pacific, Caribbean, SE Asia, Africa, and South America. –

539. do·mes·tic 家的 ## 3

[də’mestɪk]adj.家庭的；国内的；驯养的n.佣人；家仆

  • If she were alive today she would not be able to air her views on her favourite topic of conversation: domestic servants. 如果她活到今天，她将不能就她自己的观点谈话喜爱的主题：家庭佣人。
  • Though my aunt pursued what was, in those days, an enlightened policy, in that she never allowed her domestic staff to work more than eight hours a day, she was extremely difficult to please. 姑妈追求的是什么，在那些日子里，开明的政策，她从来不让佣人的工作人员每天工作超过八小时，她是极难讨好。
  • During that time she so gained my aunt’s confidence, that she was put in charge of the domestic staff. 在此期间，她赢得了姑母的赏识，甚至当上了大管家的。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, ad·di·tion 加, ra·ther 相当

ODE> Relating to the running of a home or to family relations. – family, home, private.

541. dot 点 ## 2

  • Historians have long been puzzled by dots, lines and symbols which have been engraved on walls, bones, and the ivory tusks of mammoths. 历史学家们长久以来已被刻在墙壁上，骨头，和猛犸象的象牙点，线和符号感到困惑不解。

ODE> A small round mark or spot. – spot, speck, fleck, speckle, point, pinpoint, pinprick, mark, dab.

542. doubt 怀疑 ## 8

[daʊt]n.怀疑；疑惑；悬而未定vt.怀疑；不信任vi.不确定

  • There is no doubt that if she had not lost her rudder she would have won the race easily. 毫无疑问，如果她没有失去舵，她会轻松地赢得了比赛。
  • We might say that justice has been done when a man’s innocence or guilt has been proved beyond doubt. 我们可以说，当一个人的无罪或有罪已被证明毫无疑问正义得到了伸张。
  • There was no doubt that we were unwelcome visitors. 毫无疑问，我们的来访是不受欢迎。

SEE> cer·tain·ly 当然, in·deed 确实, fact 事实

ODE> A feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction. – uncertainty, lack of certainty, unsureness, indecision, hesitation, hesitancy, dubiousness, suspicion, confusion.

543. down 下 ## 72

[daʊn]adv.向下prep.沿着 … 而下adj.向下的；消沉的；无礼的n.绒毛；汗毛v.击倒；打败；吞下；被抑制

  • Sit down here. 在这里坐下。
  • After I had sat down, he said that business was very bad. 我坐下后，他说生意非常不景气。
  • Sometimes I think this house will be knocked down by a passing plane. 有时我觉得这房子就要被一架飞过的飞机撞倒。

SEE> up 上, back 背部, out 出

ODE> Towards or in a lower place or position, especially to or on the ground or another surface. – towards a lower position, downwards, downstairs, towards the bottom, from top to bottom.

  • A young English writer made the pertinent observation a year or two back that the talent goes into the first draft, and the art into the drafts that follow. 一位年轻的英国作家发表了一年了中肯的看法或两回了人才进入的第一稿，并在艺术进入后面的草稿。

  • By this time, however, three men had come into the ring and they quickly dragged the drunk to safety. 到这个时候，然而，三个人进入斗牛场，迅速把醉汉拉到安全。
  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。
  • Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them. 很多孩子用脚三轮车，但大多数都喜欢推或拖他们。

547. draw 描画 ## 18

[drɔː]v.拖；接近；画；提取；拉；绘制n.平局；抽签；拉；拽；吸引人的事物

  • This would solve the problem of ventilation, for if a train entered this tunnel, it would draw in fresh air behind it. 这样就解决了通风问题，因为如果有列火车开进这条隧道，它会在它背后新鲜空气借鉴。
  • Despite its immensity, it is both simple and elegant, fulfilling its designer’s dream to create ‘an enormous object drawn as faintly as possible’. 尽管很大，但它的结构简单，造型优美，实现了设计者的梦想，创造“为依稀描绘成可能一个巨大的物体”。
  • The use of gloves was not introduced until 1860, when the Marquis of Queensberry drew up the first set of rules. 使用手套并没有出台，直到1860年，昆斯伯里侯爵制定了第一套规则。

[drɔːr]n.抽屉；出票人；制图员；拖曳者（复）drawers：内裤.

  • They leave unwanted objects in drawers, cupboards and attics for years, in the belief that they may one day need just those very things. 他们留在抽屉，柜子和阁楼不需要的对象了多年，相信他们可能有一天需要的正好是那些东西。

553. driv·er 司机 ## 14

  • A short while ago, however, he became a bus driver and he has not regretted it. 前一阵子，但是，他成为一名公交车司机，他不后悔。
  • Many of the cars broke down on the course and some drivers spent more time under their cars than in them! 许多汽车抛锚在球场上，而有些驾驶员他们的汽车下花更多的时间比他们！
  • It sped downhill at the end of the race and its driver had a lot of trouble trying to stop it. 它下坡加速在比赛结束及其驱动程序有很多试图阻止它的麻烦。

554. drop 掉落 ## 15

  • Don’t drop it! 别摔了！
  • When my husband was going into the dining room this morning, he dropped some coins on the floor. 当我的丈夫走进饭厅今天上午，他掉在地上一些硬币。
  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

SEE> rise 上升, fall 下落, de·cline 下降

555. drug 药物 ## 2

[drʌɡ]n.毒品；药vt.使服麻醉药；使服毒品；掺麻醉药（或毒药）于

  • The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing. 美国人很愿意就医疗器械的标准达成一个协议，然后推敲出不同的合同，用以涵盖，比如说 - 电子产品和药品的生产。
  • This modern faith in medicines is proved by the fact that the annual drug bill of the Health Services is mounting to astronomical figures and shows no signs at present of ceasing to rise. 这现代人对药物是由卫生部门的年度药费在停止上涨的目前安装到天文数字，且没有迹象事实证明。

SEE> pre·scrip·tion , ad·dic·tion , crack 裂缝

ODE> A medicine or other substance which has a physiological effect when ingested or otherwise introduced into the body. – medicine, medical drug, medication, medicament.

556. drum 鼓 ## 2

[drʌm]n.鼓；鼓状物；鼓声vi.击鼓；连续敲击；引起兴趣vt.灌输；击鼓；逐出

  • It was upon this principle that the first instruments were made, but the paper was wrapped round a drum which rotated slowly. 正是根据这一原理，第一个仪器进行了改造，但纸是包圆其缓慢旋转的鼓。
  • As long as all was still, the pen drew a straight line, but while the drum was being shaken, the line that the pen was drawing wriggled from side to side. 只要一切都还在，钢笔画了一条直线，但是，圆筒受到震动，行笔所吸引来自扭腰一边到另一边。

SEE> gui·tar , trum·pet , like·wise

ODE> A percussion instrument sounded by being struck with sticks or the hands, typically cylindrical, barrel-shaped, or bowl-shaped, with a taut membrane over one or both ends. – beat, rhythm, patter, tap, chatter, pounding, thump, thumping, thud, thudding, rattle, rattling, pitter-patter, rat-a-tat, pit-a-pat, thrum, tattoo, vibration, throb, throbbing, pulsation.

557. drunk 喝醉的 ## 11

[drʌŋk]adj.醉酒的；陶醉的n.醉鬼；醉酒动词drink的过去分词形式.

  • He also said that he had found five empty whisky bottles which the ghost must have drunk the night before. 他还表示，他发现了鬼魂肯定昨天晚上喝的5个空的威士忌酒瓶。
  • How was the drunk removed from the ring? 如何在醉酒从环去掉？
  • During a bullfight, a drunk suddenly wandered into the middle of the ring. 在斗牛时，一个醉汉突然溜达到环的中间。

SEE> an·y·way 无论如何, a·sleep 睡着, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Affected by alcohol to the extent of losing control of one’s faculties or behaviour. – intoxicated, inebriated, drunken, befuddled, incapable, tipsy, the worse for drink, under the influence, maudlin.

558. dry 干的 ## 8

[draɪ]adj.干的；干燥的；干旱的；口渴的；枯燥的v.（使）变干

  • It’s terribly dry. 它的可怕干燥。
  • Last summer it was very dry, too. 去年夏天也是干得很。
  • An ancient bus stopped by a dry river bed and a party of famous actors and actresses got off. 一个古老的车停了一个干涸的河床和著名演员和女演员的聚会下车。

SEE> wet 湿, warm 暖, cool 凉爽的

ODE> Free from moisture or liquid; not wet or moist. – parched, dried, withered, shrivelled, wilted, wizened.

559. due 到期 ## 4

[duː]adj.应有的；到期的；预定的；应付的n.应得物；会费

  • The strike is due to begin on Tuesday. 罢工定于星期二开始。
  • She entered the station twenty minutes before the train was due, since her parents had impressed upon her that it would be unforgivable to miss it and cause the friends with whom she was going to stay to make two journeys to meet her. 她进了车站二十分钟车前是由于，因为她的父母对她印象深刻，这将是不可原谅错过它和谁在一起，她要留进行两次旅行，以满足她引起朋友。
  • It is almost always due to some very special circumstances that traces of land animals survive, as by falling into inaccessible caves, or into an ice crevasse, like the Siberian mammoths, when the whole animal is sometimes preserved, as in a refrigerator. 它几乎总是由于某些非常特殊的情况下，陆地动物的生存痕迹，如掉进难以到达的洞穴，或掉进冰河裂缝里，或者像西伯利亚长毛象，当整个动物有时保存，如在冰箱中。

SEE> re·sult 结果, how·ev·er 然而, be·cause 因为

ODE> Expected at or planned for at a certain time. – expected, required, awaited, anticipated, scheduled for.

560. dull 钝的 ## 2

[dʌl]adj.呆滞的；钝的；迟钝的；无趣的；暗的v.变钝；迟钝

  • This invariably wins them the love and respect of others, for they add colour to the dull routine of everyday life. 这往往使他们赢得了爱和他人的尊重，因为他们增添色彩日常生活的平淡单一。
  • Bagrit foresaw a time when computers would be small enough to hold in the hand, when they would be capable of providing information about traffic jams and suggesting alternative routes, when they would be used in hospitals to help doctors to diagnose illnesses, when they would relieve office workers and accountants of dull, repetitive clerical work. 巴格瑞特预示有一天计算机可以小到拿在手上，当他们将能够提供有关交通阻塞的信息，并建议替代路线，当他们将在医院使用，以帮助医生诊断疾病，当他们将减轻上班族的平淡会计师，重复的文职工作。

SEE> bor·ing 无聊, un·in·ter·est·ing , bland

ODE> Lacking interest or excitement. – uninteresting, boring, tedious, tiresome, wearisome, dry, dry as dust, flat, bland, characterless, featureless, colourless, monotonous, unexciting, uninspiring, unstimulating, lacking variety, lacking variation, lacking excitement, lacking interest, unimaginative, uneventful, lifeless, soulless, insipid.

561. dump 倾倒 ## 2

[dʌmp]vt.倾倒；抛弃；倾销；抛售；倾卸；[计]转储vi.倾倒；突然落下n.垃圾场；军需供应站

  • As it was extremely heavy, he dumped it on the counter. 由于这是极其沉重的，他甩在柜台上。
  • When you come to think about it, there are only four ways you can deal with rubbish: dump it, burn it, turn it into something you can use again, attempt to produce less of it. 当你去想它，只有四种方法可以处理垃圾的方法：倾倒，焚烧，把它变成东西，你可以再次使用，试图产生的却很少。

SEE> gar·bage 垃圾, trash , waste 浪费

ODE> A site for depositing rubbish. – rubbish tip, rubbish dump, refuse dump, rubbish heap, refuse heap, tip, dumping ground, dustheap, slag heap, midden, dunghill, dung heap.

562. dur·ing 在期间 ## 43

[’dʊrɪŋ]prep.在 … 期间

  • This is a photograph I took during my trip to Australia. 这是一张照片我到澳大利亚旅行时我花了。
  • They’re people I met during the trip. 他们是我旅行时认识的。
  • I grew a beard during the trip. 我在旅行时留了胡子。

SEE> af·ter 在之后, when 什么时候, be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> Throughout the course or duration of (a period of time) – throughout, through, in, in the course of, throughout the time of, for the time of, in the time of.

563. dust 灰尘 ## 7

[dʌst]n.灰尘；尘土；粉尘vt.去掉 … 的灰尘；撒粉末于vi.除尘

  • Dust the dressing table. 粉尘的梳妆台。
  • The more expensive kind of antique shop where rare objects are beautifully displayed in glass cases to keep them free from dust is usually a forbidding place. 高档一点的古玩店，其中稀有的物品漂亮地陈列在玻璃柜从无尘让他们往往令人望而却步的地方。
  • The parquet floors shone like mirrors; highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets; even my uncle’s huge collection of books was kept miraculously free from dust. 洁如镜的镶木地板;高度抛光的银陈列在明亮的玻璃橱柜;连姑夫的大量藏书保持奇迹般地一尘不染。

SEE> dirt 污垢, sand 沙子, smoke 抽烟

ODE> Fine, dry powder consisting of tiny particles of earth or waste matter lying on the ground or on surfaces or carried in the air. – fine powder, fine particles.

564. du·ty 责任 ## 3

[’duːti]n.义务；职责；责任；税；关税

  • When he asked if Mr. Lane lived there, the policeman on duty told him that since his defeat, the ex-Prime Minister had gone abroad. 当他询问莱恩先生是否住在那里时，值班的警察告诉他，因为他的失败，前首相出国去了。
  • Perfume is not exempt from import duty.’ 香水是不免税的。”
  • When their father died, they thought it their duty to keep Eric in hiding. 当他们的父亲去世了，他们认为有责任继续把埃里克藏起来。

SEE> ob·li·ga·tion , like·wise , ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility. – responsibility, obligation, commitment, obedience, allegiance, loyalty, faithfulness, fidelity, respect, deference, reverence, homage.

[iːtʃ]pron.每个；个人；个自adj.每；每个adv.每个

  • He can get up for about two hours each day, but you must keep the room warm. 他可以起床，每天约两个小时，但您必须保持房间温暖。
  • Nearly everybody enters for ‘The Nicest Garden Competition’ each year, but Joe wins every time. 几乎每个人都在每年举办的“最佳花园竞赛”，但每次都是乔获胜。
  • Both girls write to each other regularly now. 这两位姑娘定期通信了。

SEE> one 一, eve·ry 每个, same 相同

  • The sun rises early and sets late. 太阳升起早，晚集。

  • They arrive home early. 他们到家很早。

  • He earned enormous sums of money and was paid as much as ￡100 for a single appearance. 他赚了大笔大笔的钱，一次出场费就高达£100单的外观。
  • Modern industry is based on the conception of the maximum production at lowest cost, in order that an individual or a group of individuals may earn as much money as possible. 现代工业的基础上，最高产量以最低成本的概念，为了个人或一组个人可以赚取尽可能多的钱越好。

[ɜːrθ]n.地球；泥土；世间

  • Of course, the Hubble is above the earth’s atmosphere, so it will soon be sending us the clearest pictures of the stars and distant galaxies that we have ever seen. 当然，哈勃位于地球的大气层之外，因此，它很快就会给我们发送的行星和远距离星系的最清晰的照片，我们已经见过。
  • The bridge is so long that the shape of the earth had to be taken into account by its designer. 这座桥很长，所以地球的形状有它的设计师必须考虑到。
  • Perhaps it is the desire for solitude or the chance of making an unexpected discovery that lures people down to the depths of the earth. 也许这是独处或渴望寻求意外发现的机会，吸引人们来到地下深处。

  • His few material possessions make it possible for him to move from place to place with ease. 他几乎没有什么财产，这使他能够从一个地方移动到的地方轻松。
  • There they collected women as well as food and drink, and a life of ease had made them soft. 在那里，他们收集的妇女以及食品和饮料，和安逸的生活过软使他们。

  • They would have continued to struggle against economic odds and would have lived in obscurity. 他们会继续为克服经济上的拮据而奋斗，并默默无闻地活下去。
  • This increases the expense of government, and reduces correspondingly the amount of economic resources that could be used for developing the country. 这增加了政府的开支，从而相应地减少了可以用来发展国家经济的资源量。

575. edge 边缘 ## 5

  • They had to edge their way along this, sometimes wading across shallow streams, or swimming across deep pools. 他们不得不边沿着他们这样，有时过浅溪涉水或游过深潭。
  • The dish now had to be lifted vertically because one edge was resting against the side of the canal. 菜现在有，因为一个一边靠在耳道的侧面垂直抬起。

  • Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics. 报纸和杂志的编辑常常走极端为了向读者提供一些无关紧要的事实和统计数字。
  • When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it. 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

577. ed·u·ca·tion 教育 ## 10

[ˌedʒu’keɪʃn]n.教育；修养；教育学

  • Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law, which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing. 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育反过来其添加到库：知识的增长遵循着一种复利法，这得到了印刷术的发明增强。
  • Why is education democratic in bookless, tribal societies? 为什么教育在民主效法没有书籍，部落社会？
  • Education is one of the key words of our time. 教育是我们这个时代的关键词之一。

578. ef·fect 影响 ## 14

[ɪ’fekt]n.效应；结果；影响；印象；效果；要旨v.使产生；引起

  • Jasper has put up ‘No Parking’ signs outside his gate, but these have not had any effect. 贾斯珀曾把几块“禁止停车”他门外的迹象，但这些都没有任何效果。
  • Even this had no effect. 即使这没有任何影响。
  • A recent survey of the effects of noise revealed (surprisingly?) 最近一个有关噪音的影响进行的调查显示（令人吃惊地）

SEE> re·sult 结果, im·pact 撞击, in·deed 确实

579. ef·fec·tive 有效的 ## 3

[ɪ’fektɪv]adj.有效的；生效的；实际的

  • Though the costume consisted only of a sheet, it was very effective. 尽管化装服仅由一个被单的，这是非常有效的。
  • In so far as any inquiry is a secret one, it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities, or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm. 在迄今为止的任何调查都涉及到保密，自然受到了限制所有从事从有效接触与他们的同胞科学家们无论是在其他国家或大学，甚至往往不能在同一公司的其他部门实施它。
  • Ethanol is more effective at a concentration of 50-70 per cent; below 20 per cent, its bactericidal action is negligible. 乙醇是在50-70％的浓度更有效;低于20％时，它的杀菌作用是可忽略的。

SEE> there·fore 因此, ap·pro·pri·ate 适当, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Successful in producing a desired or intended result. – successful, effectual, efficacious, productive, constructive, fruitful, functional, potent, powerful.

580. ef·fort 努力 ## 13

[’efərt]n.努力；努力的成果

  • They made no effort to hide their amusement whenever I produced a packet of sweets from my pocket. 他们毫不掩饰地取笑，每当我生产一包糖果从我的口袋里。
  • Realizing that this was no ordinary fish, the fisherman made every effort not to damage it in any way. 意识到这是一条普通的鱼，渔夫尽了一切努力，不要破坏它以任何方式。
  • In their efforts to persuade us to buy this or that product, advertisers have made a close study of human nature and have classified all our little weaknesses. 在他们的努力劝说我们买这个或那个产品，广告商作出人性的仔细研究，并已列为我们所有的小弱点。

581. egg 蛋 ## 3

[ɛɡ]n.蛋；卵；蛋形物vt.用蛋覆盖；向 … 扔蛋vt.怂恿；煽动

  • The price we pay for cheap food may be already too high: Mad Cow Disease (BSE) in cattle, salmonella in chicken and eggs, and listeria in dairy products. 为了廉价食物的价格，我们的薪酬可能已经太高了：疯牛病（BSE）牛，沙门氏菌在鸡肉和鸡蛋，以及乳制品的利斯特氏菌。
  • He must, for example, perceive an egg as a simple single solid shape, quite apart from its significance as food, or from the literary idea that it will become a bird. 他必须，例如，从它的意义感知一个鸡蛋作为一个单一的实体形态，撇开食品，还是从文学的想法，它会变成鸟。
  • The Frenchman’s breakfast coffee competes with the Englishman’s bacon and eggs. 法国人的早餐咖啡和英国人的咸肉煎蛋竞争。

SEE> milk 牛奶, chick·en 鸡, nest 巢

ODE> An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo. The eggs of birds are enclosed in a chalky shell, while those of reptiles are in a leathery membrane. – ovum, gamete, germ cell, zygote.

SEE> six 六, nine 九, sev·en 七

ODE> Equivalent to the product of two and four; one more than seven, or two less than ten; 8. – octet, eightsome, octuplets.

583. eight·een 十八 ## 5

  • Jill’s eighteen years old, Tom. 吉尔的十八岁了，汤姆。
  • He had had a long and uncomfortable trip, for he had been confined to the wooden box for over eighteen hours. 他经历了一次漫长而又难受的旅程，因为他已经被限制在木箱了18个多小时。
  • After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. 通过墙上挖了厚18英寸碎裂后，他们发现，一男子已被困在烟囱里。

SEE> four·teen 十四, fif·teen 十五, six·teen 十六

ODE> Equivalent to the product of two and nine; one more than seventeen, or eight more than ten; 18. –

584. eight·y 八十 ## 6

[’eɪti]num.八十

  • I was doing eighty when I overtook you. 我是80英里的速度赶上你的。
  • When he died at the age of eighty, the Florentines gave him a state funeral and had a picture painted which was dedicated to the memory of ‘the most valiant soldier and most notable leader, Signor Giovanni Haukodue’. 当他80岁那年死去时，佛罗伦萨人为他举行了国葬，并曾画了一幅画这是献给“最英勇的战士，最显着的领先地位，贝卢斯科尼乔瓦尼Haukodue”的记忆。
  • Some so-called ‘modern’ pieces have been on display for nearly eighty years. 有些所谓的“现代”艺术品在那里已经陈列了近80年。

ODE> Equivalent to the product of eight and ten; ten less than ninety; 80. –

585. ei·ther 任何一个 ## 17

[’iðər]adj.任一的；两方的pron.任一adv.也（用于否定句中）conj.或者（常用于either…or…的结构中）

  • To tell you the truth, Mrs. Bird, I don’t like chicken either! 说句实话，伯德夫人，我也不喜欢鸡！
  • Well, I haven’t got much either! 唉，我也不多了！
  • I don’t like the colour either. 我不喜欢这种颜色。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, in·stead 代替, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Used before the first of two (or occasionally more) given alternatives (the other being introduced by ‘or’) –

586. e·lec·tion 选举 ## 3

[ɪ’lekʃn]n.选举；当选；选举权

  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • After the elections, Patrick went to the former Prime Minister’s house. 大选结束后，帕特里克来到了前首相的房子。
  • ‘I told you yesterday and the day before yesterday,’ he shouted, ’Mr. Lane was defeated in the elections. “我告诉你，昨天和前天，”他大叫着，“先生里在大选中被击败。

SEE> vote 投票, can·di·date 候选人, presidential

ODE> A formal and organized choice by vote of a person for a political office or other position. – ballot, vote, poll, referendum, plebiscite, general election, local election, popular vote, straw poll, straw vote, show of hands.

587. e·lec·tric 电动 ## 5

[ɪ’lektrɪk]adj.电的；电动的；带电的；刺激的n.电动产品

  • What colour is the electric cooker? 是什么颜色的电饭煲？
  • There is an electric cooker in the kitchen. 有厨房的电饭煲。
  • He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line. 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏的电源线的电线蛇的遗骸。

SEE> e·lec·tri·cal 电动, e·lec·tric·i·ty 电力, in·stance 例子

ODE> Of, worked by, charged with, or producing electricity. – generated by electricity, galvanic, voltaic.

588. e·lec·tric·i·ty 电力 ## 2

[ɪˌlek’trɪsəti]n.电；电学；电流；热情

  • Mrs. Richards realized that it must be the man from the Electricity Board who had come to read the metre. 理查兹夫人这才想到一定是供电局的人谁曾来查电表。
  • Portable boiling elements that can boil small quantities of water are useful when the right voltage of electricity is available. 当市电的电压权是可以煮少量水的便携式热水装置是有用的。

SEE> sup·ply 供应, pow·er 力量, e·lec·tri·cal 电动

ODE> A form of energy resulting from the existence of charged particles (such as electrons or protons), either statically as an accumulation of charge or dynamically as a current. – power, electric power, energy, current, static, power supply.

589. e·lec·tron·ic 电子的 ## 3

[ɪˌlek’trɑːnɪk]adj.电子的；电子学的

  • It was rather like an exhibition of prehistoric electronic equipment. 这是很像古老的电子设备的展览。
  • What was the ‘future’ electronic development that Leon Bagrit wasn’t able to foresee? 什么是“未来”电子发展是巴格瑞特无法预见？
  • The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing. 美国人很愿意就医疗器械的标准达成一个协议，然后推敲出不同的合同，用以涵盖，比如说 - 电子产品和药品的生产。

SEE> com·put·er 电脑, ad·di·tion 加, in·stance 例子

ODE> (of a device) having or operating with components such as microchips and transistors that control and direct electric currents. – mechanized, mechanical, automated, push-button, preprogrammed, computerized, electronic, robotic, unmanned.

590. el·e·ment 要素 ## 4

[’elɪmənt]n.要素；元素；（学科的）基本原则；(复数)恶劣天气；元件

  • Perhaps there is an element of truth in both these pictures, but few of us have had the opportunity to find out. 也许有这两种都像真实的成分，但很少有人能有机会了解一下。
  • Men accustomed to struggling for survival against the elements and Indians were bewildered by politicians, bankers and businessmen, and unhorsed by fences, laws and alien taboos. 习惯作斗争以求和印第安人生存的拓荒者被政客，银行家和商人搞得晕头转向，最后被圈地，法律和外来的清规戒律unhorsed。
  • Portable boiling elements that can boil small quantities of water are useful when the right voltage of electricity is available. 当市电的电压权是可以煮少量水的便携式热水装置是有用的。

SEE> as·pect 方面, com·po·nent , par·tic·u·lar 特定的

ODE> An essential or characteristic part of something abstract. – component, constituent, part, section, portion, piece, segment, bit.

591. e·lev·en 十一 ## 5

[ɪ’levn]n.十一；十一个一组adj.十一的pron.十一个

  • But you mustn’t come home after a quarter past eleven. 但你一定不是一个季度以后回家十一点。
  • Debbie is only eleven years old and she hopes to set up a new world record. 黛比只有11岁，她希望能建立一个新的世界纪录。
  • The daily exercises lasted only eleven minutes and I proposed to do them early in the morning before anyone had got up. 早锻炼一共只有11分钟，我建议早做他们早上别人起床之前。

SEE> four·teen 十四, thir·teen 十三, fif·teen 十五

ODE> Equivalent to the sum of six and five; one more than ten; 11. –

592. else 其他 ## 13

[els]adv.其他；此外；(常与or连用)否则、不然

  • What else do you want? 你还想要什么？
  • Who else is in bed today? 还有谁今天也卧床休息？
  • What else does he say? 还有什么说的？

SEE> no·bod·y 没有人, an·y·thing 任何东西, an·y·bod·y 任何人

ODE> In addition; besides. – too, as well, besides, in addition, additionally, furthermore, further, moreover, into the bargain, on top, on top of that, over and above that, what’s more, to boot, else, then, equally.

593. embarrassed 尴尬 ## 3

[ɪm’bærəst]adj.尴尬的；拮据的；局促不安的

  • Sally was amused, but I was very embarrassed! 萨莉感到很有趣，但我很尴尬！
  • It was obvious that he was very embarrassed. 很明显，他感到很尴尬。
  • When he got married, Alf was too embarrassed to say anything to his wife about his job. 当他结婚了，阿尔夫都不好意思说什么他对他的工作的妻子。

SEE> annoyed 恼怒的, a·shamed 羞愧, hu·mil·i·at·ed

ODE> Feeling or showing embarrassment. – awkward, self-conscious, uneasy, uncomfortable, unsettled, sheepish, red-faced, blushing, shy.

594. e·merge 出现 ## 3

[i’mɜːrdʒ]vi.浮现；(由某种状态)脱出；(事实)显现出来

  • The sorry-looking, blackened figure that emerged, admitted at once that he had tried to break into the shop during the night but had got stuck in the chimney. 惋惜的前瞻性，熏黑的数字一出来，一旦他曾试图在夜间闯入店铺，但已经陷入了烟囱录取。
  • As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow, her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze, and the red and gold of her superstructure ablaze with colour, she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before. 当她从她的漂泊与搅动泡沫水炮烟的云下她的弓，她彩旗飘扬，锦旗挥舞，帆填充在微风中，红色和她的金上层建筑色闪亮出现，她提出了更加宏伟的场面比斯德哥尔摩人从未见过之前。
  • Today, although the old Galileo lives on in many popular writings, among historians of science a new and more sophisticated picture has emerged. 如今，虽然老伽利略在许多通俗读物住在科学史家中间，一个新的，更复杂的形象出现了。

SEE> un·like·ly 不太可能, in·deed 确实, like·ly 可能的

ODE> Move out of or away from something and become visible. – come out, appear, come into view, become visible, make an appearance.

595. e·mo·tion 情感 ## 2

[ɪ’moʊʃn]n.情感；感情；情绪

  • A young man sees a sunset and, unable to understand or to express the emotion that it rouses in him, concludes that it must be the gateway to a world that lies beyond. 一个年轻人看到日落，由于无法理解或者说，它在他唤起来表达情感，得出结论认为，它必须是通往世界深藏超越。
  • A gifted American psychologist has said, ‘Worry is a spasm of the emotion; the mind catches hold of something and will not let it go.’ 一位天才的美国心理学家曾经说过：“烦恼是感情的发作;心灵纠缠住的东西，不会让他走了。”

SEE> em·pa·thy , e·mo·tion·al 情感的, ex·cite·ment 激动

ODE> A strong feeling deriving from one’s circumstances, mood, or relationships with others. – feeling, sentiment, sensation.

596. em·ploy 雇用 ## 7

[ɪm’plɔɪ]v.雇佣；使用

  • In a few years the small workshop had become a large factory which employed seven hundred and twenty-eight people. 在几年之后，小铺子已经发展成了一个大工厂雇用728人。
  • They employed a few farmhands, but no one was willing to work there long. 他们雇了几个农工，但谁也不愿意在那儿长期工作下去。
  • In time, it became an accepted fact that the Cox brothers employed a conscientious ghost that did most of their work for them. 随着时间的推移，它成为考克斯兄弟雇的是做大部分工作对他们来说一个有良心的鬼公认的事实。

SEE> hire 租用, more·o·ver 此外, re·ly 依赖

ODE> Give work to (someone) and pay them for it. – hire, engage, recruit, take on, take into employment, secure the services of, sign up, sign, put on the payroll, enrol, appoint, commission, enlist.

597. emp·ty 空的 ## 13

[’empti]adj.空的；空洞的；空虚的；空腹的v.倒空；变空；排空n.空物

  • The bottle is empty. 瓶子是空的。
  • I’m afraid it’s empty. 恐怕是空的。
  • The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins. 该垃圾筐是空的，地上布满纸片，烟头，旧轮胎，空瓶子和生锈的罐头。

SEE> fill 装满, be·side 在旁边, a·ban·doned 弃

ODE> Containing nothing; not filled or occupied. – vacant, unoccupied, uninhabited, untenanted, clear, free, bare, desolate, deserted, abandoned.

598. en·a·ble 使能够 ## 9

[ɪ’neɪbl]vt.使能够；使可能

  • Meanwhile, a microphone, which was lowered into the mine two hours ago, has enabled the men to keep in touch with their closest relatives. 同时，麦克风，这是两小时前放进去了，使井下的人保持联系与他们的近亲。
  • They devise hundreds of competitions which will enable us to win huge sums of money. 他们设计数以百计的竞赛，这将使我们赢得的巨额奖金。
  • The following example of ‘sick humour’ will enable you to judge for yourself. “病态幽默”的下面的例子将让你自己判断。

ODE> Give (someone) the authority or means to do something; make it possible for. – authorize, sanction, warrant, license, qualify, allow, permit, entitle, empower, accredit, legalize, validate.

599. en·cour·age 鼓励 ## 2

[ɪn’kɜːrɪdʒ]vt.鼓励；促进；支持

  • Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air. 同时，他们鼓励我们中的那些他们正在大口喘气前谁也游不了5码。
  • So while the rest of the world was trying to get rid of mosquitoes, Australia was encouraging this one. 因此，尽管世界其他地区正试图驱除蚊虫，澳大利亚却在促使这一个。

SEE> en·cour·ag·ing , dis·cour·age , pro·mote 促进

600. end 结束 ## 41

[end]n.结束；末端；目标；死亡；部分；终点站；端点；半边球场；剩余物，残余；过世v.终止，结束

  • Where does Sam put the vase in the end? 哪里萨姆把花瓶到底是谁？
  • In the end, we stay at home and look after everything! 最后，我们呆在家里来照看一切！
  • The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins. 该垃圾筐是空的，地上布满纸片，烟头，旧轮胎，空瓶子和生锈的罐头。

ODE> A final part of something, especially a period of time, an activity, or a story. – conclusion, termination, ending, finish, close, resolution, climax, finale, culmination, denouement.

601. en·e·my 敌人 ## 5

[’enəmi]n.敌人；敌军；有害物

  • The Karen had been sailing in a convoy to Russia when she was torpedoed by an enemy submarine. 卡伦曾在一个车队对俄罗斯的途中突然遭到敌方潜水艇鱼雷的袭击。
  • Because they destroy so many insects, and insects include some of the greatest enemies of the human race. 因为它们能消灭那么多的昆虫，其中包括一些人类的最大敌人。
  • So, faced with the Danish advance, Alfred did not risk open battle but harried the enemy. 因此，面对丹麦人的进攻，阿尔弗雷德没有冒险作战，而是不断地袭扰敌人。

SEE> de·stroy 破坏, al·lied 联盟的, in·deed 确实

ODE> A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something. – foe, adversary, opponent, rival, nemesis, antagonist, combatant, challenger, competitor, opposer, hostile party.

602. en·er·gy 能量 ## 5

[’enərdʒi]n.精力；活力；能源

  • Such things provide an excellent outlet for pent up creative energy, but unfortunately not all of us are born handymen. 这些东西为人们潜在的创造力极好的出口，但不幸的是我们，不是所有的都是能工巧匠。
  • As they grow old, people also accumulate belongings for two other reasons, lack of physical and mental energy, both of which are essential in turning out and throwing away, and sentiment. 当他们老去，人们也积累财物其他两个原因，缺乏体力，精力的，这两者都是在清理和扔掉，而情绪是至关重要的。
  • Because the Moon has only an eightieth of the Earth’s mass, it requires 97 per cent less energy to travel the quarter of a million miles from the Moon to Earth-orbit than the 200 mile-journey from Earth’s surface into orbit! 因为月球只有地球质量的8，636，它需要97％的能量较少，从月球到地球轨道旅行25万英里超过200英里的旅程从地球表面进入轨道！

SEE> e·lec·tric·i·ty 电力, renewable , nat·u·ral 自然的

ODE> The strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity. – vitality, vigour, life, liveliness, animation, vivacity, spirit, spiritedness, fire, passion, ardour, zeal, verve, enthusiasm, zest, vibrancy, spark, sparkle, effervescence, exuberance, buoyancy, perkiness, sprightliness.

603. en·gage 从事 ## 4

[ɪn’ɡeɪdʒ]v.雇佣；啮合；与……交战；答应；订婚；预定；参加；从事

  • How many spiders are engaged in this work on our behalf? 有多少蜘蛛在代表我们的这项工作？
  • For one thing, being a problem gives you a certain identity, and that is one of the things the young are busily engaged in seeking. 一方面，是一个问题给你一定的身份，那就是事物的年轻人所热衷追求的。
  • In so far as any inquiry is a secret one, it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities, or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm. 在迄今为止的任何调查都涉及到保密，自然受到了限制所有从事从有效接触与他们的同胞科学家们无论是在其他国家或大学，甚至往往不能在同一公司的其他部门实施它。

SEE> en·gaged 订婚, par·tic·i·pate , will·ing 愿意

ODE> Occupy or attract (someone’s interest or attention) – capture, catch, arrest, grab, seize, draw, attract, gain, win, captivate, hold, grip, engross, absorb, occupy.

604. en·gine 发动机 ## 10

[’endʒɪn]n.发动机；引擎；机车；火车头vt.给 … 装引擎

  • It has four Rolls-Royce Merlin engines, but the group will need to have only three of them rebuilt. 它有4台罗尔斯 - 罗伊斯的默林发动机，但是该集团将需要只有三个他们重建。
  • Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey – still in perfect condition. 想象一下，他们惊讶和高兴，当他们拆开包装箱的情况下，发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 - 完好无损。
  • A colony of bees had turned the engine into a hive and it was totally preserved in beeswax! 一群蜜蜂已经变成发动机进入一个蜂房，它完整地保存在蜂蜡！

SEE> die·sel , air·plane , de·sign 设计

ODE> A machine with moving parts that converts power into motion. – motor, mechanism, machine, power source, drive.

605. en·gi·neer 工程师 ## 9

[ˌendʒɪ’nɪr]n.工程师；机(械)师vt.设计；建造；策划

  • I’m an engineer. 我是个工程师。
  • You are John Smith, the engineer, aren’t you? 你是约翰·史密斯，工程师，不是吗？
  • I’m John Smith the telephone engineer and I’m repairing your telephone line. 我是约翰·史密斯的电话工程师，我正在修理您的电话线。

SEE> tech·ni·cian , me·chan·ic , en·gi·neer·ing 工程

ODE> A person who designs, builds, or maintains engines, machines, or structures. – designer, planner, builder, architect, producer, fabricator, developer, creator.

606. en·gi·neer·ing 工程 ## 2

[ˌendʒɪ’nɪrɪŋ]n.工程学；工程

  • You work for the Overseas Engineering Company, don’t you? 你在海外工程公司上班，是吗？
  • Already, orientals and Asian Americans constitute the majority of the engineering staffs at many Valley firms. 目前，东方人和亚裔美国人占了大多数的工程技术人员的硅谷许多公司中。

ODE> The branch of science and technology concerned with the design, building, and use of engines, machines, and structures. – practical, scientific, applied, applying science, non-theoretical.

608. e·nor·mous 巨大的 ## 6

[ɪ’nɔːrməs]adj.巨大的；庞大的

  • I had all the usual symptoms of someone giving up smoking: a bad temper and an enormous appetite. 我只好一个人戒烟的所有常见的症状：脾气暴躁和食欲旺盛。
  • Despite its immensity, it is both simple and elegant, fulfilling its designer’s dream to create ‘an enormous object drawn as faintly as possible’. 尽管很大，但它的结构简单，造型优美，实现了设计者的梦想，创造“为依稀描绘成可能一个巨大的物体”。
  • He earned enormous sums of money and was paid as much as ￡100 for a single appearance. 他赚了大笔大笔的钱，一次出场费就高达£100单的外观。

609. e·nough 足够的 ## 27

[ɪ’nʌf]adj.足够的adv.足够地；充分地；相当；尚pron.足够

  • The English and Maths papers weren’t easy enough for me. 英语和数学试题不容易够我。
  • That’s enough for me. 这对我足够了。
  • I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud enough to wake the dead. 我刚回到厨房，门铃响起，响声足以把死人唤醒。

SEE> so 所以, a·ble 能够, e·ven 甚至

610. en·ter 进入 ## 19

[’entər]v.进入【计算机】送入

  • After they had entered the house, they went into the dining room. 他们进到屋里后，走进了饭厅。
  • Nearly everybody enters for ‘The Nicest Garden Competition’ each year, but Joe wins every time. 几乎每个人都在每年举办的“最佳花园竞赛”，但每次都是乔获胜。
  • Every year I enter for the garden competition too, and I always win a little prize for the worst garden in the town! 我每年的花园竞赛进入过了，我总是得全镇最差花园的小奖！

SEE> en·try 进入, al·low 允许, a·ble 能够

611. en·ter·tain·ment 娱乐 ## 2

[ˌentər’teɪnmənt]n.娱乐

  • My friend fails to mention the long and friendless winter evenings in front of the TV – virtually the only form of entertainment. 我的朋友没有提到在电视机前度过的漫长寂寞的冬夜 - 几乎是唯一的娱乐形式。
  • They invariably live nearby and are always available for an informal chat or an evening’s entertainment. 他们都住在附近，并随时可以聊天或在晚上一起娱乐。

612. en·tire·ly 完全地 ## 5

[ɪn’taɪərli]adv.完全地；全部地

  • For him, this will be an entirely new hobby. 对他来说，这将是一种全新的爱好。
  • The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground, and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them. 形状和摩天大楼的尺寸完全取决于获得每平方英尺的地面最高收入的必要性，并提供使他满意的租户办公室和住房。
  • Carlyle was entirely ignorant of what the bottle in his pocket contained, of the nature of the illness from which his friend was suffering, and of what had previously been wrong with his wife, but a medicine that had worked so well in one form of illness would surely be of equal benefit in another, and comforted by the thought of the help he was bringing to his friend, he hastened to Henry Taylor’s house. 卡莱尔不知道什么样的瓶子在他的口袋里所含知道他的朋友得的是什么病的性质，以及什么以前一直错误与他的妻子，但已在疾病的一种形式运作得非常好药品肯定是对另利益，并通过帮助下，他把他的朋友的想法安慰，于是急急忙忙来到了亨利的房子。

SEE> com·plete·ly 完全, es·sen·tial·ly 本质上, to·tal·ly 完全地

ODE> Completely (often used for emphasis) – absolutely, completely, totally, fully, wholly.

613. en·ti·tle 命名 ## 3

[ɪn’taɪtl]vt.取名为；使有权利

  • After reading an article entitled ‘Cigarette Smoking and Your Health’ I lit a cigarette to calm my nerves. 阅读一篇文章，题为“吸烟与健康”后，我点了一支烟，镇静一下紧张情绪。
  • In fact, I have just bought a book entitled How to Read a Thousand Words a Minute. 事实上，我刚买来一本如何读一千字一分钟的书。
  • All are entitled to an equal start. 人人都享有平等起步的。

SEE> de·prive , hes·i·tate 犹豫, last·ly
