ODE> A folder or box for holding loose papers together and in order for easy reference. – folder, portfolio, binder, box, document case.

719. fill 装满 ## 7

[fɪl]vt.装满；弥漫；填充；担任n.足量

  • Only very thrifty children manage to fill up a money box. 只有非常节俭的儿童才会设法填满一个储蓄罐。
  • No matter how hard I tried, it was impossible to fill this beautiful pen with ink and to this day it has never written a single word! 无论怎么说我试过了，这是不可能填补这个漂亮的钢笔墨水，并到今天它也没写过一个字！
  • All at once, I noticed that my wife seemed to be filled with alarm. 突然，我发现我的妻子十分惊恐。

SEE> in·stead 代替, in·stance 例子, re·place 代替

ODE> Cause (a space or container) to become full or almost full. – become full, make full, fill up, fill to the brim, fill to overflowing, top up, charge, load, load up, pack.

720. film 电影 ## 16

[fɪlm]n.电影；薄膜；胶卷vt.把 … 拍成电影；给 … 覆上一薄层；拍照片vi.变朦胧；拍摄电影

  • It’s an old film, but it’s very good. 这是一个老电影，但它是非常好的。
  • Have you just made a new film, Miss Marsh? 您刚拍完一部新电影吗，马什小姐？
  • I don’t want to make another film for a long time. 我不想再拍电影了很长一段时间。

SEE> mov·ie 电影, doc·u·men·ta·ry , cin·e·ma 电影

ODE> A thin flexible strip of plastic or other material coated with light-sensitive emulsion for exposure in a camera, used to produce photographs or motion pictures. – layer, coat, coating, covering, cover, surface, sheet, patina, blanket, dusting, skin, overlay, screen, mask, wash, glaze, varnish, veneer, veil.

721. fi·nal 最终的 ## 3

[’faɪnl]adj.最终的；最后的；决定性的；不可改变的n.决赛；大学毕业考试；期终考试

  • The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell. 该大幕拉开上的最后一幕戏，并透露了贵族独自坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房。
  • The reader’s hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands. 读者的头发看台上结束的时候，他在小说的最后几页了解到书中女主人公，一个亲爱的老太太谁一直是这样善待每个人，曾在她的青春，她毒死五个丈夫的每一个读取。
  • The guests had, of course, realized this from the moment Bessie opened the door for them and, long before the final catastrophe, had had a difficult time trying to conceal their amusement. 客人们，当然，从目前意识到这贝西打开门让他们和长最后灾难之前，曾经有过困难的时候试图掩盖他们的娱乐。

SEE> se·cond 第二, first 第一, next 下一个

ODE> Coming at the end of a series. – last, closing, concluding, finishing, end, ending, terminating, terminal, culminating, ultimate, eventual, endmost.

722. fi·nal·ly 终于 ## 6

[’faɪnəli]adv.最后；决定性地；最终

  • They finally found a small gold coin which was almost worthless. 他们终于找到了一枚小金币几乎一钱不值。
  • Though she hesitated for a moment, she finally went in and asked to see a dress that was in the window. 尽管她迟疑了片刻，她终于走进了商店，要求看一件衣服，这是在窗口中。
  • She enjoyed herself making the assistant bring almost everything in the window before finally buying the dress she had first asked for. 她开心地迫使这位售货员终于买的衣服，她首先问提起几乎所有的窗口。

SEE> e·ven·tu·al·ly 终于, soon 不久, a·gain 再次

ODE> After a long time, typically when there has been difficulty or delay. – eventually, ultimately, in the end, by and by, at length, after a long time, after some time.

723. find 找到 ## 136

[faɪnd]v.发现；找到；认为；觉得；感到；裁决；判定n.发现

  • Can you find them? 你能找到他们吗？
  • He opened the book and found a phrase. 他翻开书找到了一条短语。
  • We looked for them, but we could not find them all. 我们找了，但我们无法找到他们。

SEE> a·ble 能够, come 来, in·deed 确实

ODE> Discover or perceive by chance or unexpectedly. – discover, become aware, realize, observe, notice, note, perceive, learn, detect.

724. fi·ne 好的 ## 9

[faɪn]adj.好的；优质的；精致的；晴朗的；健康的；细微的adv.合适地；恰好地n.罚款；罚金；结尾v.罚款；优化；净化；细化

  • I’m fine, thanks. 我很好谢谢。
  • He’s fine, thanks. 他很好，谢谢。
  • That’s fine. 没关系。

SEE> well 好, ad·di·tion 加, be·sides

ODE> Of very high quality; very good of its kind. – excellent, first-class, first-rate, great, exceptional, outstanding, admirable, quality, superior, splendid, magnificent, beautiful, exquisite, choice, select, prime, supreme, superb, wonderful, sublime, superlative, very good, of high quality, of a high standard, second to none, top, rare.

725. fin·ger 手指 ## 5

[’fɪŋɡər]n.指针；手指（尤指大拇指以外的手指）v.触碰；用指抚摸

  • I picked up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice of Helen Bates. 我用两个沾满面糊的手指拿起听筒，当我听出是海伦·贝茨的声音感到沮丧。
  • There was pastry on my fingers, on the telephone, and on the doorknobs. 有我的手指糕点，通过电话，并在门把手。
  • I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay ￡5. 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我愿意支付£5。

SEE> thumb 拇指, hand 手, cheek 脸颊

ODE> Each of the four slender jointed parts attached to either hand (or five, if the thumb is included) – digit.

726. fin·ish 完成 ## 13

[’fɪnɪʃ]v.完成；结束；最后加工；用完n.结束；完成；最后一层涂饰

  • It was an exciting finish. 这是一个令人兴奋的光洁度。
  • Have your mechanics finished yet? 有你的机械师做完了吗？
  • Have you finished already? 你是否已经完成？

SEE> fi·nal 最终的, start 开始, a·head 在前面

ODE> Bring (a task or activity) to an end; complete. – completed, concluded, consummated, finalized, terminated, over and done with, over, in the past, at an end.

727. fire 火 ## 27

[’faɪər]n.火；失火；炉火；开火；热情v.开火；解雇；点燃；急速地连续说

  • As soon as this was done, they cooked a meal over an open fire. 只要这事就上烧起了饭明火。
  • The boys felt tired so they put out the fire and crept into their tent. 于是他们把火扑灭，钻进了帐篷男孩感到累了。
  • What caused the fire? 是什么原因造成的火？

SEE> ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, im·me·di·ate·ly 立即, when 什么时候

ODE> A process in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and typically give out bright light, heat, and smoke; combustion or burning. – blaze, conflagration, inferno, holocaust, firestorm.

728. firm 公司 ## 11

[fɜːrm]n.公司；商行adj.坚定的；结实的；坚固的；严格的v.(使)变得坚实；确定adv.稳固地；坚定地

  • He is working for a big firm and he has already visited a great number of different places in Australia. 他正在为一家大公司，他已经去过澳大利亚的不少地方的大数目。
  • He told me that the firm could not afford to pay such large salaries. 他告诉我，公司无法支付如此巨额的工资。
  • Already, orientals and Asian Americans constitute the majority of the engineering staffs at many Valley firms. 目前，东方人和亚裔美国人占了大多数的工程技术人员的硅谷许多公司中。

SEE> com·pa·ny 公司, part·ner 伙伴, busi·ness 商业

ODE> Having a solid, almost unyielding surface or structure. – hard, solid, unyielding, resistant.

729. firm·ly 牢牢地 ## 5

[’fɜːrmli]adv.牢牢地；坚定地

  • A crowd of people gathered round him and a lady rubbed his arm with soap and butter, but George was firmly stuck. 一大群人围拢过来，一位女士胳膊上抹了肥皂，黄油，但乔治是牢牢卡住。
  • As we were walking past a shop, he held a diamond firmly against the window and made a deep impression in the glass. 当我们路过一家商店时，他坚定地拿起一块钻石，窗户和玻璃做了深刻的印象。
  • The mower firmly refused to mow, so I decided to dismantle it. 割草机还是纹丝不动，所以我决定把它拆开。

SEE> nev·er·the·less 然而, strongly 强烈, con·vinced

ODE> With little possibility of movement; securely. –

730. first 第一 ## 76

[fɜːrst]adj.第一的；最初的adv.首先；第一n.最初；(序数词)第一

  • My wife must see it first. 我的妻子必须先来看一看。
  • I must water the garden first. 首先我必须花园浇水。
  • Yesterday, a pigeon carried the first message from Pinhurst to Silbury. 昨天，鸽子把第一消息从树丛到梳。

SEE> se·cond 第二, third 第三, on·ly 只有

ODE> Coming before all others in time or order; earliest; 1st. – earliest, initial, opening, introductory, original.

731. fish 鱼 ## 21

[fɪʃ]n.鱼；鱼肉；笨蛋；新手；新囚犯v.钓鱼；捕鱼；摸索；搜寻

  • Why is fishing the writer’s favourite sport? 为什么钓鱼笔者最喜欢的运动？
  • I often fish for hours without catching anything. 我经常一钓数小时却一无所获。
  • Instead of catching fish, they catch old boots and rubbish. 相反捕的鱼，他们抓住旧靴子和垃圾。

SEE> salm·on , tu·na , meat 肉

ODE> A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water. – go fishing, angle, cast, trawl.

732. fish·ing 钓鱼 ## 8

[’fɪʃɪŋ]n.钓鱼；渔场；渔业

  • Fishing is my favourite sport. 钓鱼是我最喜欢的运动。
  • ‘You must give up fishing!’ “你可别再钓鱼了！”
  • I’m not really interested in fishing. 我没有真正的兴趣在钓鱼。

SEE> fish·er·man , boat 船, rec·re·a·tion·al

ODE> The activity of catching fish, either for food or as a sport. – angling, trawling, catching fish.

733. fit 适合 ## 8

[fɪt]adj.适宜的；合适的；健康的v.适合；安装n.发作；适宜

  • A temporary rudder was made on board from spare planks and it was fitted with great difficulty. 临时舵有人在船上备用的木板，它装备有很大的困难。
  • After crossing the Equator, the captain called in at a port to have a new rudder fitted, but by now the Thermopylae was over five hundred miles ahead. 跨越赤道，在口叫有装新舵队长后，但现在的温泉是早已在500多英里。
  • Though the new rudder was fitted at tremendous speed, it was impossible for the Cutty Sark to win. 尽管换装新舵以惊人的速度，这是不可能的卡蒂萨克取胜。

SEE> sure 当然, look 看, in·deed 确实

ODE> Of a suitable quality, standard, or type to meet the required purpose. – suitable, good enough.

734. five 五 ## 35

[faɪv]num.五

  • Number five. 是5号。
  • Five other cars were just behind him. 其他5辆汽车跟在他后面。
  • Size five. 五号的。

SEE> six 六, four 四, three 三

ODE> Equivalent to the sum of two and three; one more than four, or half of ten; 5. – quintet, quintuplets.

735. fix 固定 ## 7

[fɪks]v.使 … 固定；修理，处理，解决；确定；准备；操纵n.困境；(船只、飞机等的)定方位；贿赂；（暂时的）解决方法；理解

  • Her eyes were fixed on her plate and in a short time, she was busy eating. 她的眼睛盯着自己的盘子，并在很短的时间，她就忙着吃起来。
  • Eventually chains were fixed to one end of the dish and a powerful winch was put into operation. 最终链条固定在盘子的一端，具有强大的绞盘被投入运行。
  • This time they fixed heavy metal clamps to both sides of the dish so that they could fasten the chains. 这一次，他们用沉重的金属夹在盘子的两侧，使他们能够安装铁链。

SEE> cor·rect 正确, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> Fasten (something) securely in a particular place or position. – fasten, attach, affix, secure.

736. flag 旗 ## 2

[flæɡ]n.旗；旗帜；信号旗vt.(以旗子)标出v.无力地下垂；减退；枯萎

  • As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow, her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze, and the red and gold of her superstructure ablaze with colour, she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before. 当她从她的漂泊与搅动泡沫水炮烟的云下她的弓，她彩旗飘扬，锦旗挥舞，帆填充在微风中，红色和她的金上层建筑色闪亮出现，她提出了更加宏伟的场面比斯德哥尔摩人从未见过之前。
  • In that first glorious hour, the mighty Vasa, which was intended to rule the Baltic, sank with all flags flying – in the harbour of her birth. 在这第一个辉煌时刻，强大的瓦萨，其目的是统治波罗的海，沉没飞行的所有标志 - 在她诞生的港口。

SEE> sym·bol 符号, same 相同, like·wise

ODE> A piece of cloth or similar material, typically oblong or square, attachable by one edge to a pole or rope and used as the symbol or emblem of a country or institution or as a decoration during public festivities. – banner, standard, ensign, pennant, pennon, banderole, streamer, jack.

737. flash 闪光 ## 2

[flæʃ]v.闪光；闪现；掠过；忽然…；亵渎性暴露n.闪光（灯）；恍然大悟；一刹那；闪现；[计算机]Adobe公司的动画技术

  • Sparks were emitted from small black boxes and red lamps flashed on and off angrily. 火花从小黑框发射和红色灯闪烁的情况下愤怒地。
  • A yellow light on the dashboard flashed angrily and Bruce cheerfully announced that there was no oil in the engine! 仪表盘上一盏黄灯闪着刺眼的光芒，布鲁斯兴致勃勃地宣布有发动机是没油了！

SEE> burst 爆裂, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, in·stance 例子

ODE> Shine in a bright but brief, sudden, or intermittent way. – light up, shine, flare, blaze, glare, beam, gleam, glint, sparkle, spark, burn, fluoresce.

738. flat 平面的 ## 14

[flæt]adj.平坦的；扁平的；单调的；断然的；[音乐]降音的；气不足的adv.平直地；直截了当；低于标准音高地n.公寓；平面部分；[音乐]降半音；泄气轮胎v.变平；降调；住公寓

  • Once he landed on the roof of a block of flats and on another occasion, he landed in a deserted car park. 一次，他降落在单位，并在另一个场合块的屋顶，降落在了一个废弃的停车场上。
  • Mrs. Eleanor Ramsay, a very wealthy old lady, has shared a flat with her cat, Rastus, for a great many years. 拉姆齐太太，一个非常富有的老妇人，分享了与她的猫拉斯特斯平坦，为一个伟大的多年。
  • As his flat is in a large town, he has no garden of his own. 由于他的公寓是一个大镇，他没有自己的花园。

SEE> ba·si·cal·ly 基本上, es·sen·tial·ly 本质上, like·wise

ODE> Having a level surface; without raised areas or indentations. – level, horizontal, levelled.

739. flight 飞行 ## 11

[flaɪt]n.飞行；航班；镖尾；逃走，逃离，溃逃

  • In 1929, three years after his flight over the North Pole, the American explorer, R.E. 1929年，他的飞越北极，美国探险家，R.E.后三年
  • A flight attendant would take charge of me and I never had an unpleasant experience. 一位空中乘务员照顾我，我从未有过不愉快的经历。
  • While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to keep calm and to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. 在我们等待降落时，一位空中乘务员告诉我们要保持镇静，因为它感动了下来静静地尽快离开飞机。

SEE> plane 飞机, air·plane , pi·lot 飞行员

ODE> The action or process of flying through the air. – flying, soaring, gliding.

740. float 漂浮 ## 4

[floʊt]v.漂浮；浮现；飘动；提出n.浮标；漂浮物；漂浮

  • Even if two of these were flooded, she would still be able to float. 即使其中的两个被洪水淹没，她仍然能够漂浮在水面。
  • The ‘Antoinette’ floated on the water until Latham was picked up by a ship. 安特瓦特“在海上漂浮，莱瑟姆，后来有船接走。
  • The first sign of disaster was a dead sheep floating down. 灾难的第一迹象是一只死羊顺流而下。

SEE> like·wise , in·stead 代替, pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> Rest or move on or near the surface of a liquid without sinking. – stay afloat, stay on the surface, be buoyant, be buoyed up.

741. flood 洪水 ## 7

[flʌd]v.淹没；充满n.洪水

  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。
  • What would have happened if only two of the sixteen water-tight compartments had been flooded? 如果只有两个十六个水密舱已被洪水淹没，将会发生什么？
  • Even if two of these were flooded, she would still be able to float. 即使其中的两个被洪水淹没，她仍然能够漂浮在水面。

SEE> dis·as·ter 灾难, more·o·ver 此外, surge

ODE> An overflow of a large amount of water beyond its normal limits, especially over what is normally dry land. – inundation, swamping, deluge.

742. flooding 洪水 ## 2

[flʌdɪŋ]n.泛滥；[医]产后出血adj.泛滥的动词flood的现在分词形式.

  • We are lucky in that only the lower fields, which make up a very small proportion of our farm, are affected by flooding, but other farms are less favourably sited, and flooding can sometimes spell disaster for their owners. 我们是只有较低的领域，从而弥补了我们农场比例很小幸运，是由洪水的影响，但其他农场地势欠佳，和洪水有时会给农场主带来灾难。

ODE> The covering or submerging of normally dry land with a large amount of water. –

743. floor 地面 ## 21

[flɔːr]n.地面；地板；楼层；底部vt.铺地板；击倒；(油门)踩到底

  • How must Amy clean the floor? 艾米需要如何来清扫地面？
  • Then sweep the floor. 然后扫地。
  • When my husband was going into the dining room this morning, he dropped some coins on the floor. 当我的丈夫走进饭厅今天上午，他掉在地上一些硬币。

SEE> room 房间, base·ment , up·stairs 楼上

ODE> The lower surface of a room, on which one may walk. – ground, flooring.

744. flour 面粉 ## 2

[’flaʊər]n.面粉；粉末v.研成粉末；撒上粉

  • In a short time I was busy mixing butter and flour and my hands were soon covered with sticky pastry. 在很短的时间，我就忙着调拌黄油和面粉，我的手很快就沾满面粉。
  • It had been baked by a college student who had used over 1,000 pounds of flour, 800 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of fat, and 400 pounds of various other ingredients. 它是由一个大学生谁使用了超过1000磅面粉，800磅食糖，200磅动物脂肪及400磅其他各种原料出炉。

SEE> bread 面包, but·ter 黄油, sug·ar 糖

ODE> A powder obtained by grinding grain, typically wheat, and used to make bread, cakes, and pastry. –

745. flow 流动 ## 5

[floʊ]n.流动；涨潮；流；流量vi.流动；涌出；飘动；流畅vt.淹没

  • The stream wound its way across the field and then flowed right under their tent! 那小溪弯弯曲曲穿过田野，然后右键他们的帐篷底下流！
  • He described it as ‘a very agreeable situation located within two small hills in the midst of which flowed a great river.’ 他将其形容为“一家位于其中的流入一条大河中间的两个小山头一个非常愉快的局面。”
  • Gradually the river grows wider, the banks recede, the waters flow more quietly, and in the end, without any visible break, they become merged in the sea, and painlessly lose their individual being. 渐渐地，河面变宽，两岸后撤，河水流得平缓起来，最后，没有任何明显的突破，他们成为融入了大海，毫无痛苦地失去了自我的存在。

SEE> stream 溪流, more·o·ver 此外, fur·ther·more

ODE> (of a liquid, gas, or electricity) move steadily and continuously in a current or stream. – run, move, go along, course, pass, proceed, glide, slide, drift, circulate, trickle, dribble, drizzle, spill, gurgle, babble, ripple.

746. flow·er 花 ## 3

[’flaʊər]n.花；开花植物；精华；盛时v.开花；成熟；用花装饰

  • Those flowers are lovely, too. 这些花也很漂亮啊。
  • Bill works harder than Joe and grows more flowers and vegetables, but Joe’s garden is more interesting. 比尔工作难度比乔，种植的花卉和蔬菜，但乔的花园更富有情趣。
  • We welcome the seasons by the riverside, crowning the youngest girl with flowers in the spring, holding a summer festival on Midsummer Eve, giving thanks for the harvest in the autumn, and throwing a holly wreath into the current in the winter. 我们在河边迎接一年四季加冕最年轻的女孩在春天的花朵，抱着仲夏前夜夏季节，在秋季收获感恩，并抛出一个冬青花环到冬天的电流。

SEE> fruit 水果, gar·den 花园, bright 明亮的

ODE> The seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs (stamens and carpels) that are typically surrounded by a brightly coloured corolla (petals) and a green calyx (sepals). – bloom, blossom, floweret, floret.

747. fly 飞 ## 33

[flaɪ]v.飞；坐飞机；驾驶；逃跑；悬挂n.苍蝇；飞行；两翼昆虫

  • The aeroplane is flying over the river. 飞机正从河上飞过。
  • He will fly to New York next month. 他将飞往纽约下个月。
  • The month after next he’ll fly to Tokyo. 后年，他将飞往东京的月份。

SEE> in·stead 代替, flight 飞行, go 去

ODE> (of a bird, bat, or insect) move through the air using wings. – travel through the air, wing its way, wing, glide, soar, wheel.

748. fol·low 跟随 ## 22

[’fɑːloʊ]v.跟随；追赶；紧接着；注意；遵循；沿着；明白

  • The following day, the patient asked for a bedside telephone. 第二天，这位病人要了一部床头电话。
  • It rose out of the basket and began to follow the movements of the pipe. 它上升筐而出，并开始跟随管的运动。
  • She returned to the shop the following morning dressed in a fur coat, with a handbag in one hand and a long umbrella in the other. 第二天上午，她回到了家商店，穿了一件裘皮大衣，一只手拎着手提包，长柄伞等。

SEE> come 来, should 应该, in·deed 确实

ODE> Go or come after (a person or thing proceeding ahead); move or travel behind. – come behind, come after, go behind, go after, walk behind, tread on the heels of.

749. food 食物 ## 29

[fud]n.食物；食品

  • And he mustn’t eat rich food. 而且不能吃油腻的食物。
  • He ate the food and drank the beer. 他吃的食物，喝啤酒。
  • They were all hungry and the food smelled good. 他们都饿了，饭菜散发出阵阵香味。

SEE> eat 吃, sup·ply 供应, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth. – nourishment, sustenance, nutriment, subsistence, fare, bread, daily bread.

750. foot 脚 ## 41

[fʊt]n.脚；英尺；最底部；音步v.表演舞步；步行；付账；踏；共计

  • The children go to school by car every day, but today, they are going to school on foot. 孩子们每天都去学校的车程，但今天，他们正步行上学。
  • It could only get over the mountains if it rose to 10,000 feet. 它只能得到翻山越岭，如果它上升至10,000英尺。
  • The plane was then able to rise and it cleared the mountains by 400 feet. 于是飞机可以上升了，它400英尺的高度飞越山区。

SEE> back 背部, hand 手, in·side 内

ODE> The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands or walks. – tootsie, trotter.

751. foot·ball 足球 ## 6

[’fʊtbɔːl]n.足球；橄榄球

  • Are you doing the football pools, Brain? 你做足球池，脑？
  • If we spend all the money we’ll try and win the football pools again. 如果我们花光了所有的钱，我们会尝试，并再次赢得了足球池。
  • One authority on spiders made a census of the spiders in a grass field in the south of England, and he estimated that there were more than 2,250,000 in one acre; that is something like 6,000,000 spiders of different kinds on a football pitch. 研究蜘蛛的权威提出在英国南部一块草坪上的蜘蛛作了一次调查，他估计，目前每英亩均超过2,250,000;这就是说，在一个足球场上不同种类6,000,000蜘蛛。

SEE> soc·cer , bas·ket·ball , base·ball

ODE> Any of various forms of team game involving kicking (and in some cases also handling) a ball, in particular (in the UK) soccer or (in the US) American football. –

752. for 为了 ## 512

[fər]prep.为；因为；代表；往；支持；关于；给conj.因为

  • This bookcase isn’t for me. 这个书架是不适合我。
  • It’s for my daughter, Susan. 这是为我的女儿苏珊。
  • Who is the tin of tobacco for? 谁是烟草中的锡？

SEE> time 时间, while 当的时候, in·stead 代替

ODE> In support of or in favour of (a person or policy) – on the side of, pro, for, all for, giving support to, giving backing to, right behind, encouraging of, approving of, sympathetic to.

753. force 力 ## 11

[fɔːrs]n.武力；暴力；力量；影响力；力量大的人或（事物）；权力；（为某目的组织起来的）一群人；军队；部队；武装力量；警察部门；力；风力v.迫使；强迫；强制；使发生；强装（欢笑）；人工催长

  • A pilot noticed a balloon which seemed to be making for a Royal Air Force Station nearby. 一位飞行员注意到似乎的一个皇家空军基地附近的气球。
  • He had travelled only seven miles across the Channel when his engine failed and he was forced to land on the sea. 当他的引擎故障，他被迫在海面上的土地，他曾前往横渡英吉利海峡只有七英里。
  • At such times, justice acts like a living force. 在这种时候，正义像一种有生命的力量。

SEE> com·mand 命令, pres·ence 存在, mil·i·tar·y 军事

ODE> Strength or energy as an attribute of physical action or movement. – strength, power, energy, might, potency, vigour, muscle, stamina, effort, exertion, impact, pressure, weight, impetus.

754. for·eign 国外 ## 3

[’fɔːrən]adj.外来的；外国的；异质的；不相符的

  • But people who are cut off not only from foreign tourists, but even from their own countrymen can be hostile to travellers. 但谁是不仅来自外国游客，而且与本国同胞隔绝的人可以对游客抱有敌意。
  • Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office – spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U.S. a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast. 米德预言发明者可以在办公室用一个周末的完善强大的定制化芯片 - 造就新一代的车库创业企业，并给予美国把它的外国对手一个跳跃在把产品推向市场的速度快。
  • From one’s own front door to home or foreign hills or sands and back again, everything is to hand. 从自家的前门到国内国外的山区或沙滩上露营然后返回，一切都很便利。

SEE> o·ver·seas , min·is·try 部, a·broad 在国外

ODE> Of, from, in, or characteristic of a country or language other than one’s own. – overseas, distant, remote, far off, far flung, external, outside.

755. for·est 森林 ## 6

[’fɔːrɪst]n.森林；林火vt.(用树林)覆盖；置于(树林中)

  • Mrs. Anne Sterling did not think of the risk she was taking when she ran through a forest after two men. 安妮·斯特林夫人没想到，当她穿过森林追赶两个男人，她承担的风险。
  • They had rushed up to her while she was having a picnic at the edge of a forest with her children and tried to steal her handbag. 他们赶到了她，而她出在与她的孩子们在森林边缘野餐，并试图抢走她的手提包。
  • At last firemen have put out a big forest fire in California. 最后，消防员已在加州扑灭一场森林大火。

SEE> wood·land , pine , wild·life

ODE> A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth. – wood, woods, woodland, trees, tree plantation, plantation.

756. for·get 忘记 ## 14

[fər’ɡet]v.忘记；忽略

  • I bought two expensive dictionaries here half an hour ago, but I forgot to take them with me. 我这里买了两次很贵的辞典半小时前，但是我忘了拿走我。
  • ‘I forgot to put you off.’ “我忘了让您下车了。”
  • As soon as I went outside, I forgot all about Madam Bellinsky because my wife hurried towards me. 当我走到外面，我忘记了所有关于别林斯夫人因为我的妻子对我匆匆。

SEE> re·mem·ber 记得, may·be 也许, an·y·more

ODE> Fail to remember. – fail to remember, fail to recall, fail to think of, let slip.

757. for·give 原谅 ## 4

[fər’ɡɪv]v.原谅；宽恕；饶恕

  • He is therefore forgiven if late for a dinner party. 因此，他被原谅，如果迟到了晚宴。
  • Hart’s good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited, and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way, his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive, especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians. 哈特的好，坏男人总是一个局外人，总是剥夺继承权的一个，如果他认为有必要枪击一个司法官或抢劫一个银行，他的早期观众很容易理解和原谅，特别是当它是哈特谁，最终战胜了前来进攻的印第安人。
  • We can perhaps forgive those who said the moons of Jupiter were produced by Galileo’s spyglass if we recall that in his day, as for centuries before, curved glass was the popular contrivance for producing not truth but illusion, untruth; and if a single curved glass would distort nature, how much more would a pair of them? 我们或许可以原谅那些谁说，木星的卫星是由伽利略的望远镜产生的，如果我们还记得，在他的一天，几个世纪前，弧形玻璃是用于生产不是真理，而是幻觉，谎言流行的诡计;如果一个单一的曲面玻璃会扭曲性质，多少那么一对他们的？

SEE> for·get 忘记, for·give·ness , con·fess

ODE> Stop feeling angry or resentful towards (someone) for an offence, flaw, or mistake. – pardon, excuse, exonerate, absolve, acquit, let off, grant an amnesty to, amnesty.

758. form 形成 ## 37

[fɔːrm]n.形式；形状；表格；良好的健康状态；表现状态；常规v.形成；建立

  • It was raining heavily and they found that a stream had formed in the field. 雨下得很大，他们发现，甲流已在该领域形成。
  • Most of us have formed an unrealistic picture of life on a desert island. 我们大多数人的生活形成了一个荒岛上一种不切实际的想法。
  • Strange forms stand in gardens, and outside buildings and shops. 竖立着的奇形怪状的花园，建筑物内外和商店。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, ra·ther 相当, which 哪一个

ODE> The visible shape or configuration of something. – shape, configuration, formation, conformation, structure, construction, arrangement, disposition, appearance, outward appearance, outward form, exterior.

759. for·mer 以前的 ## 7

[’fɔːrmər]adj.前者的；前任的；以前的n.创造者；学校某一年级的学生

  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • After the elections, Patrick went to the former Prime Minister’s house. 大选结束后，帕特里克来到了前首相的房子。
  • I have just received a letter from my old school, informing me that my former headmaster, Mr. Stuart Page, will be retiring next week. 我刚刚收到一封来自我的老同学，通知我说以前的校长斯图亚特·佩奇，将于下周退休。

SEE> for·mer·ly 以前, vet·er·an , re·tired 退休

ODE> Having previously been a particular thing. – one-time, erstwhile, sometime, late, as was.

760. for·mu·la 公式 ## 2

[’fɔːrmjələ]n.配方；公式；规则；代乳品adj.方程式的；（赛车的）级的

  • It is said that the nerve poison is the more primitive of the two, that the blood poison is, so to speak, a newer product from an improved formula. 据说，神经毒是更原始的两个，即血毒是，使从一个改良配方，较新的产品。
  • It was Hart who created the basic formula of the Western film, and devised the protagonist he played in every film he made, the good-bad man, the accidental-noble outlaw, or the honest-but-framed cowboy, or the sheriff made suspect by vicious gossip; in short, the individual in conflict with himself and his frontier environment. 这是哈特谁创造了西部电影的基本公式，并设计了他，他拍的电影几乎扮演主角，好的坏的男人，意外贵金属逃犯，诚实的，但是，遭陷害的牛仔或司法官。因流言蜚语怀疑;总之，在与他自己和他的拓荒环境相矛盾的人物。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子, hence 因此

ODE> A mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols. – recipe, formula, blueprint, magic formula, key, answer, solution.

761. for·tune 财富 ## 4

[’fɔːrtʃən]n.命运；财产；运气

  • The story of a poor family that acquired fame and fortune overnight, dramatically illustrates the power of the press. 一个贫穷的家庭是获得名利一夜的故事戏剧性地说明了新闻报道的威力。
  • Who, according to the author, are ‘Fortune’s favoured children’? 谁，根据作者，是“命运的宠儿”？
  • But Fortune’s favoured children belong to the second class. 但是，命运的宠儿则属于第二类。

762. for·ty 四十 ## 4

[’fɔːrti]num.四十adj.四十pron.四十(个；只 … )

  • I read she’s twenty-nine, but she must be at least forty. 我读了她的29岁，但她一定至少有40岁。
  • The winning car reached a speed of forty miles an hour – much faster than any of its rivals. 获胜的那辆车达到了每小时四十英里的速度 - 比任何竞争对手的要快得多。
  • It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years. 这是一个奇怪的巧合，他退休的前一天，佩奇将已经教了一满40年。

SEE> thir·ty 三十, twen·ty 二十, fif·ty 五十

ODE> The number equivalent to the product of four and ten; ten less than fifty; 40. –

763. for·ward 向前 ## 6

[’fɔːrwərd]adj.向前的；前部的；未来的；将来的；莽撞的；热心的；早熟的adv.向前地v.促进；转交；发送n.[体]前锋

  • We are all very excited and are looking forward to the Olympic Games because they have never been held before in this country. 我们都非常兴奋，因为他们从来没有在这个国家举行前都期待着奥运会。
  • In 1860, a better plan was put forward by an Englishman, William Low. 1860年，一个更好的计划是由一个英国人，名叫威廉提出。
  • I suddenly pressed the brake pedal hard and we were both thrown forward. 我突然用力踩刹车踏板努力，我们俩都朝前一甩。

SEE> back 背部, mov·ing 移动, put 放

764. found 建立 ## 2

  • The famous monastery of St. Bernard, which was founded in the eleventh century, lies about a mile away. 圣伯纳，始建于十一世纪的著名修道院，约一英里远的谎言。
  • Meanwhile, he founded a highly successful Academy and even Lord Byron became one of his pupils. 同时，他建立了一个非常成功，连拜伦勋爵也成了他的学生之一。

765. four 四 ## 21

[fɔːr]num.四

  • It is four o’clock. 现在是4点钟。
  • He telephoned me four times yesterday and three times the day before yesterday. 他四次，昨天和前天三次打电话给我。
  • Five days ago, the policeman told him, the bicycle was picked up in a small village four hundred miles away. 5天前的警察告诉他，那辆自行车是在一个小村里发现了400英里外。

SEE> three 三, five 五, six 六

ODE> Equivalent to the product of two and two; one more than three, or six less than ten; 4. – quartet, foursome, tetralogy, quadruplets.

766. four·teen 十四 ## 3

[ˌfɔːr’tiːn]num.十四

  • You can pay a deposit of thirty pounds, and then fourteen pounds a month for three years. 您可以交纳押金30英镑，然后每月14镑，三年。
  • It was his job to repair bicycles and at that time he used to work fourteen hours a day. 这是他的工作是修理自行车，当时他曾经每天工作14个小时。
  • Mendoza rose to fame swiftly after a boxing match when he was only fourteen years old. 门多萨成名拳击比赛后迅速时年仅十四岁。

ODE> Equivalent to the product of seven and two; one more than thirteen, or six less than twenty; 14. –

767. fourth 第四 ## 2

[fɔːrθ]n.第四；四分之一；第四音阶；第四档

  • He must be her fourth or fifth. 他一定是她的第四或第五。
  • Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey – still in perfect condition. 想象一下，他们惊讶和高兴，当他们拆开包装箱的情况下，发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 - 完好无损。

SEE> third 第三, fifth 第五, se·cond 第二

ODE> Constituting number four in a sequence; 4th. –

768. free 自由的 ## 18

[friː]adj.自由的；免费的；畅通的；没有…的；未使用的；空闲的；随意的v.释放；使自由；使摆脱；解除；使可用于(某目的)adv.免费地；自由地

  • The girl ‘gave’ her mother a free dress once a week! 女孩“送”她母亲一件免费的衣服，每周一次！
  • When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head. 当我建议一些村民进来偷喝掉的，汤普森先生摇摇头。
  • Many owners of private cars are going to offer ‘free rides’ to people on their way to work. 很多私人汽车的车主正准备提供“免费乘车”的人对他们的工作方式。

SEE> but 但是, put 放, give 给

ODE> Able to act or be done as one wishes; not under the control of another. – able to, in a position to, capable of.

769. free·dom 自由 ## 9

[’friːdəm]n.自由；直率；特许，特权

  • The dogs have greater freedom, too, for they are allowed to wander outside their enclosure. 狗也比较自由，也为他们被允许围栏，四处遛达。
  • He may hunt, beg, or steal occasionally to keep himself alive; he may even, in times of real need, do a little work; but he will never sacrifice his freedom. 他可能会去打猎，乞讨，偶尔偷来保持自己活着;他甚至可能在确实需要的时候，做了一点工作;但他决不会牺牲自由。
  • We often speak of tramps with contempt and put them in the same class as beggars, but how many of us can honestly say that we have not felt a little envious of their simple way of life and their freedom from care? 我们常常带有轻蔑流浪汉，并把它们放在同一类乞丐，但我们又有多少人能够坦率地说，我们还没有感受到生活的简单方法和照顾他们的自由，有点羡慕？

SEE> lib·er·ty , de·moc·ra·cy , in·deed 确实

ODE> The power or right to act, speak, or think as one wants. – right to, entitlement to.

770. fre·quent·ly 经常 ## 3

[’friːkwəntli]adv.频繁地；经常地

  • Oil rigs have to be repaired frequently and divers, who often have to work in darkness a hundred feet under water, have been frightened out of their wits by giant fish bumping into them as they work. 钻井平台需要经常修理，潜水员，谁往往要在黑暗中工作的水下一百英尺的地方，已被巨鱼撞到他们，因为他们的工作受到惊吓魂飞魄散了。
  • People who work in offices are frequently referred to as ‘white-collar workers’ for the simple reason that they usually wear a collar and tie to go to work. 人谁在办公室工作，常常被称作“白领”，原因很简单，他们通常是穿着硬领和领带去上班。
  • People travelling long distances frequently have to decide whether they would prefer to go by land, sea, or air. 人们长途跋涉，经常要决定他们是否希望由陆，海，或空气中去。

SEE> oc·ca·sion·al·ly 偶尔, of·ten 经常, reg·u·lar·ly 经常

ODE> Regularly or habitually; often. – regularly, often, very often, all the time, habitually, customarily, routinely, usually, normally, commonly.

771. fresh 新鲜 ## 4

[freʃ]adj.新鲜的；清新的；新近的；无经验的adv.最近地

  • This would solve the problem of ventilation, for if a train entered this tunnel, it would draw in fresh air behind it. 这样就解决了通风问题，因为如果有列火车开进这条隧道，它会在它背后新鲜空气借鉴。
  • However you decide to spend your time, one thing is certain: you will arrive at your destination fresh and uncrumpled. 不管你打算如何消磨时间，有一两件事是肯定的：你会在你的目的地新鲜和折皱到达。
  • And if you think you’ll abandon meat and become a vegetarian, you have the choice of very expensive organically-grown vegetables or a steady diet of pesticides every time you think you’re eating fresh salads and vegetables, or just having an innocent glass of water! 如果你想放弃肉类而变成一位素食者，那么你很昂贵的有机种植的蔬菜每一个你认为你吃新鲜的沙拉和蔬菜，或者只是有一个无辜的玻璃时间的选择或农药的稳定的饮食水！

SEE> bring 带来, plen·ty 丰富, come 来

ODE> (of food) recently made or obtained; not tinned, frozen, or otherwise preserved. – newly harvested, garden-fresh, not stale, crisp, firm, unwilted, unfaded.

772. friend 朋友 ## 41

[frend]n.朋友；支持者；友人vt.与 … 为友

  • Are your friends Danish, too? 是你的朋友也是丹麦人？
  • Are your friends tourists too? 是你的朋友也是来旅游的？
  • In the afternoon, she usually sees her friends. 下午，她总是会见她的朋友。

SEE> col·league 同事, hus·band 丈夫, boy·friend 男朋友

ODE> A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations. – companion, boon companion, bosom friend, best friend, close friend, intimate, confidante, confidant, familiar, soul mate, alter ego, second self, shadow, playmate, playfellow, classmate, schoolmate, workmate, ally, comrade, associate.

773. friend·ly 友好的 ## 5

[’frendli]adj.友好的；友善的adv.友好地

  • A friendly waiter taught me a few words of Italian. 一位好客的服务员教了我意大利的几句话。
  • These friendly dogs, which were first brought from Asia, were used as watchdogs even in Roman times. 这些友善的狗，这是首次从亚洲引进的，被用作早在罗马时代的监督者。
  • They can be friendly and affectionate towards humans, but they lead mysterious lives of their own as well. 它们可以是深情，柔情的人，但他们过自己的神秘生活为好。

SEE> good 好, well 好, both 两者

ODE> Kind and pleasant. – affectionate, affable, amiable, genial, congenial, cordial, warm, demonstrative, convivial, companionable, company-loving, sociable, gregarious, outgoing, clubbable, comradely, neighbourly, hospitable, approachable, easy to get along with, accessible, communicative, open, unreserved, easy-going, good-natured, kindly, benign, amenable, agreeable, obliging, sympathetic, well disposed, benevolent.

774. fright·en 惊吓 ## 3

[’fraɪtn]vt.使惊吓；害怕vi.惊吓

  • Oil rigs have to be repaired frequently and divers, who often have to work in darkness a hundred feet under water, have been frightened out of their wits by giant fish bumping into them as they work. 钻井平台需要经常修理，潜水员，谁往往要在黑暗中工作的水下一百英尺的地方，已被巨鱼撞到他们，因为他们的工作受到惊吓魂飞魄散了。
  • Not wanting to frighten the poor man, Mrs. Richards quickly hid in the small storeroom under the stairs. 不想吓唬这个可怜人，理查兹夫人便赶紧躲到了楼梯下的小储藏室里。
  • We realized that they must have become unduly frightened by the rising flood, for their house, which had sound foundations, would have stood stoutly even if it had been almost submerged. 我们意识到他们一定是吓坏通过不断上涨的洪水，因为他们的房子，其中有声音的基础，会坚决地站在即使它已经几乎被淹没。

SEE> ter·ri·fy , con·fuse 迷惑, dis·tract

ODE> Make (someone) afraid or anxious. – scare, startle, alarm, terrify, petrify, shock, chill, appal, agitate, panic, throw into panic, fluster, ruffle, shake, disturb, disconcert, unnerve, unman, intimidate, terrorize, cow, daunt, dismay.

775. from 从 ## 261

[frəm]prep.出自；来自；从( … 起)

  • Where do you come from? 你从哪里来的？
  • I come from Greece. 我来自希腊。
  • Where do you come from? 你从哪里来的？

SEE> back 背部, same 相同, come 来

ODE> Indicating the point in space at which a journey, motion, or action starts. – by, made by, done by, carried out by, caused by, from, in, of.

776. front 前面 ## 21

[frʌnt]n.正面；前面；前线；【气象学】锋vt.朝向；面对；对付vi.面朝；掩护adj.前面的

  • I’m going to put it here, in front of the window. 我打算把它放在这里，在窗口的前面。
  • It’s in front of you! 这是在你的面前！
  • Does Jill take the key to the front door? 吉尔有没有带钥匙的前门？

SEE> be·hind 在后面, the 该, side 侧

ODE> The side or part of an object that presents itself to view or that is normally seen or used first; the most forward part of something. – forepart, fore, foremost part, anterior, forefront, nose, head.

777. fruit 水果 ## 2

[fruːt]n.果实；成果；水果v.结果实

  • Ripe fruit falls from the trees and you never have to work. 成熟的水果从树上掉下来，你永远不会有工作。
  • The seeds must be carefully chosen; they must fall on good ground; they must be sedulously tended, if the vivifying fruits are to be at hand when needed. 种子必须仔细选择;他们必须落在好土;所以一定要精心呵护，如果生机水果有需要时就在眼前。

SEE> ed·i·ble , man·go , veg·e·ta·ble 蔬菜

ODE> The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seed and can be eaten as food. – reward, benefit, advantages.

778. full 满的 ## 18

[fʊl]adj.满的；充满的；完全的n.全部；极点adv.非常；直接地vt.使衣服宽松；增厚

  • This letter’s full of mistakes. 这封信是错误百出。
  • To their surprise, the precious parcel was full of stones and sand! 令他们吃惊的是，珍贵的包裹里面装的全是石头和沙子！
  • The tent was full of water! 帐篷里全是水！

SEE> com·plete 完成, all 所有, on·ly 只有

ODE> Containing or holding as much or as many as possible; having no empty space. – filled, filled up, filled to capacity, filled to the brim, brimming, brimful, topped up.

779. ful·ly 充分 ## 4

[’fʊli]adv.十分地；完全地；全部；足足

  • The experts were now fully convinced that the animal was a puma, but where had it come from? 现在专家们充分肯定那只动物就是美洲狮，但如果有它从何而来？
  • He has deliberately chosen to lead the life he leads and is fully aware of the consequences. 他是故意在选择过那种生活的，并完全清楚后果的生活。
  • Though Mrs. Bussman was fully acquainted with this story, she thought that there was a chance in a million that she might be right. 尽管巴斯曼夫人进行充分的这个故事熟悉，她认为有机会在一万元，她可能是正确的。

SEE> sufficiently 充分地, must 必须, yet 还

ODE> Completely or entirely; to the fullest extent. – completely, entirely, wholly, totally, thoroughly, quite, utterly, perfectly, altogether, exhaustively, extensively, intimately, in all respects, in every respect, without reservation, without exception, lock, stock, and barrel, from first to last, to the hilt.

780. fun 开玩笑 ## 2

[fʌn]n.乐趣；玩笑adj.有趣的

  • He spent a miserable day in bed thinking of all the fun he was missing. 他在他失踪的乐趣的所有床上想度过一个悲痛的日子。
  • On the village green, where you pick up sides and no feeling of local patriotism is involved, it is possible to play simply for the fun and exercise: but as soon as a the question of prestige arises, as soon as you feel that you and some larger unit will be disgraced if you lose, the most savage combative instincts are aroused. 在乡间的草坪上，当你拿起两侧，没有当地的爱国主义情绪受影响，则可以简单地为了娱乐和锻炼：你觉得，但只要威信的问题是，一旦你和如果你失去了一些大的单位将被蒙羞，最野蛮的好斗本能就会激发出来。

SEE> stuff 东西, re·al·ly 真的, kind 种类

ODE> Enjoyment, amusement, or light-hearted pleasure. – pleasure, entertainment, enjoyment, amusement, excitement, gratification.

781. func·tion 功能 ## 4

[’fʌŋkʃn]n.职务；功能；函数；重大聚会；应变量，有相关关系者；取决于vi.运行；起作用

  • Though these large machines still exist, many of their functions have been taken over by small powerful personal computers, commonly known as PCs. 虽然这种大计算机仍然存在，但它们的许多功能已被体积小功能强大的个人电脑，俗称电脑。
  • It is fairly clear that the sleeping period must have some function, and because there is so much of it the function would seem to be important. 这是相当清楚的是，睡眠必然具有某种功能，因为有这么多的功能吧，似乎是很重要的。
  • The body’s tissues are self-repairing and self-restoring to a degree, and function best when more or less continuously active. 人体的组织是自我修复和自我恢复到一定程度，和功能最好的时候，或多或少地连续活动。

SEE> hence 因此, fur·ther·more , there·fore 因此

ODE> An activity that is natural to or the purpose of a person or thing. – purpose, task, use, role.

782. fun·da·men·tal 基本的 ## 4

[ˌfʌndə’mentl]adj.基本的；根本的；重要的n.基础；基本原理

  • We also make the fundamental error of announcing our resolutions to everybody so that we look even more foolish when we slip back into our bad old ways. 我们也做宣布我们决心向大家一个根本性的错误，使我们，当我们重新陷入我们的那些老习惯看起来更加愚蠢。
  • Let us get down to fundamentals and agree that the young are after all human beings – people just like their elders. 让我们来认真研究一些基本事实：承认青年人都是人后 - 人就像他们的长辈。
  • Some of the bigger firms are engaged in researches which are of such general and fundamental nature that it is a positive advantage to them not to keep them secret. 某些大公司所从事的研究属于一般和基础性的，这是一个积极的优势，他们不会让他们的秘密。

SEE> prin·ci·ple 原则, ba·sic 基本, es·sen·tial 必要

ODE> Forming a necessary base or core; of central importance. – basic, foundational, rudimentary, elemental, elementary, underlying, basal, radical, root.

783. fu·ner·al 葬礼 ## 3

[’fjuːnərəl]adj.葬礼(的)n.葬礼

  • When he died at the age of eighty, the Florentines gave him a state funeral and had a picture painted which was dedicated to the memory of ‘the most valiant soldier and most notable leader, Signor Giovanni Haukodue’. 当他80岁那年死去时，佛罗伦萨人为他举行了国葬，并曾画了一幅画这是献给“最英勇的战士，最显着的领先地位，贝卢斯科尼乔瓦尼Haukodue”的记忆。
  • Everyone went to the funeral, for the ‘ghost’ was none other than Eric Cox, a third brother who was supposed to have died as a young man. 大家都去参加了葬礼，因为那“鬼”不是别人埃里克·考克斯，谁应该已经死亡作为一个年轻人三哥等。
  • After the funeral, Joe and Bob revealed a secret which they had kept for over fifty years. 葬礼之后，乔和鲍勃透露了他们保守了长达50多年的秘密。

SEE> bur·i·al , pro·ces·sion , de·ceased

ODE> A ceremony or service held shortly after a person’s death, usually including the person’s burial or cremation. – burial, burying, interment, entombment, committal, inhumation, laying to rest, consignment to the grave.

784. fun·ny 好笑的 ## 9

[’fʌni]adj.可笑的；有趣的；滑稽的；奇怪的；非法的

  • The lady was dressed in a blue coat and a large, funny hat. 那位妇女穿着一件蓝色的大衣和一个大型的，滑稽的帽子。
  • What was so funny about the words on the sign? 什么好笑的牌子上的字？
  • He had included a large number of funny stories in the speech and, of course, it was a great success. 他收录了大量在讲话中有趣的故事，当然的，这是一个巨大的成功。

SEE> hi·lar·i·ous , a·mus·ing 有趣的, wit·ty

ODE> Causing laughter or amusement; humorous. – amusing, humorous, comic, comical, droll, laughable, chucklesome.

785. fur 毛皮 ## 3

[fɜːr]n.毛皮；软毛；毛皮制品；皮衣v.使生苔；使生垢

  • She returned to the shop the following morning dressed in a fur coat, with a handbag in one hand and a long umbrella in the other. 第二天上午，她回到了家商店，穿了一件裘皮大衣，一只手拎着手提包，长柄伞等。
  • Paw prints were seen in a number of places and puma fur was found clinging to bushes. 掌印被认为在许多地方和美洲狮的皮毛被发现抱住了灌木丛。
  • It spread through France, where wild rabbits are not generally regarded as a pest but as a sport and a useful food supply, and it spread to Britain where wild rabbits are regarded as a pest but where domesticated rabbits, equally susceptible to the disease, are the basis of a profitable fur industry. 它蔓延至法国，在那里的野生兔子一般不被当作有害动物，而作为体育和有用的食物来源，并蔓延到英国，野兔被当作有害的，但在那里驯化的野兔，同样易患本病，是赚钱的毛皮工业的基础。

SEE> wool 羊毛, coat 外套, gray

ODE> The short, fine, soft hair of certain animals. – hair, wool.

786. fur·ni·ture 家具 ## 8

[’fɜːrnɪtʃər]n.家具；设备，装置；床罩；必要的附属品；【会计】家俬

  • The next morning, he found that the doors had been blocked by chairs and the furniture had been moved. 第二天早上，他发现门都被椅子堵上了，家具也被挪动过。
  • He and his staff began throwing furniture out of the window. 他和他的工作人员开始投掷家具窗外。
  • A recent case concerns Jane Butlin whose fiancé, John, runs a successful furniture business. 最近的一个案例是关于简Butlin的未婚夫约翰，运行一个成功的家具企业。

SEE> an·tique , jew·el·ry , cloth·ing 服装

ODE> The movable articles that are used to make a room or building suitable for living or working in, such as tables, chairs, or desks. – furnishings, house fittings, fittings, fitments, movables, fixtures, appointments, appliances, effects, chattels, amenities, units, equipment, paraphernalia.

787. fur·ther 进一步 ## 9

[’fɜːrðər]adj.更远的adv.进一步地；此外v.促进；推动

  • It seems that the further cats fall, the less they are likely to injure themselves. 看来，猫跌落，他们是不太可能伤害自己。
  • We needed no further warning. 我们不需要进一步的警告。
  • This brief experiment would dispel any further doubts you might have. 这个简单的试验会消除任何疑虑进一步，你可能有。

SEE> re·sult 结果, how·ev·er 然而, could 可以

ODE> At, to, or by a greater distance (used to indicate the extent to which one thing or person is or becomes distant from another). – at a greater distance, more distant, farther.

788. fu·ture 未来 ## 16

[’fjuːtʃər]adj.将来的n.将来；前程；期货

  • I will have to ask my future husband. 我得问一下我的未婚夫。
  • Your future husband, Miss Marsh? 您的未婚夫，马什小姐？
  • She said she would have to ask her future husband. 她说她得问问她的未婚夫。

SEE> pos·si·ble 可能, pos·si·bil·i·ty 可能性, would 将

ODE> A period of time following the moment of speaking or writing; time regarded as still to come. – time to come, time ahead.

789. gain 获得 ## 5

[ɡeɪn]n.获得；收益；增益v.获得；到达；增加；获利；(钟、表等)走得快

  • The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago, but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation. 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，但它只是在最近几年才得到了一个坏名声。
  • After taking off, we were flying low over the city and slowly gaining height, when the plane suddenly turned round and flew back to the airport. 起飞之后，我们在城市上空低空飞行，然后慢慢爬高，当飞机突然调转头来，飞回了机场。
  • Does the writer think the parents were lucky or unlucky to gain prosperity in this way? 这位作家是否觉得父母是幸运还是不幸以这种方式获得的繁荣？

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, ad·van·tage 优点, a·ble 能够

ODE> Obtain or secure (something wanted or desirable) – obtain, get, acquire, come by, procure, secure, attain, achieve, earn, win, capture, clinch, pick up, carry off, reap, gather.

790. game 游戏 ## 12

[ɡeɪm]n.游戏；运动会；比赛；一场比赛；比赛得分；猎物；花招v.赌博adj.勇敢的；乐意的；跛的

  • Some children were playing games on the bank and there were some people rowing on the river. 一些孩子们在岸上玩游戏，并有一些人正在划船在河上。
  • A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race. 一种游戏是非常流行的这些年轻的游泳运动员是水下三轮车比赛。
  • Though he was technically a prizefighter, Mendoza did much to change crude prizefighting into a sport, for he brought science to the game. 虽然他是个职业拳击手，门多萨做了很多改变粗野的拳击变成一种体育运动方面，他作出了重大的比赛。

SEE> play 玩, play·er 运动员, match 比赛

ODE> An activity that one engages in for amusement or fun. – pastime, diversion, entertainment, amusement, distraction, divertissement, recreation, sport, activity, leisure activity.

791. ga·rage 车库 ## 10

[ɡə’rɑːʒ]n.汽车修理厂；车库vt.把 … 放入车库

  • Let’s go into the garage and have a look at it. 让我们走进车库，看看它。
  • Mr.James Scott has a garage in Silbury and now he has just bought another garage in Pinhurst. 斯科特先生在锡尔伯里有一个汽车修理部，现在他买了在平赫斯特另一个车库。
  • Pinhurst is only five miles from Silbury, but Mr. Scott cannot get a telephone for his new garage, so he has just bought twelve pigeons. 松树丛离锡尔伯里只有5英里，但斯科特先生不能为他新的汽车修理部搞到一部电话机，所以他买了只鸽子。

SEE> base·ment , park·ing , ware·house

ODE> A building for housing a motor vehicle or vehicles. – car port, lock-up.

792. gar·den 花园 ## 36

[’ɡɑːrdn]n.园地(用于种植花、果、菜)v.从事园艺活动

  • She’s in the garden, Jean. 她在花园里，琼。
  • Is Tim in the garden, too? 蒂姆也在花园里吗？
  • The dog’s in the garden, too. 狗在花园里了。

SEE> gar·den·ing , lawn , in·stance 例子

ODE> A piece of ground adjoining a house, in which grass, flowers, and shrubs may be grown. – piece of land, plot.

793. gas 气体 ## 3

[ɡæs]n.煤气；气体；汽油；空话vt.使吸入毒气；毒(死)；给 … 加汽油vi.空谈；加汽油

  • Once we get down to the oil, it usually flows to the surface because great pressure, either from gas or water, is pushing it. 一旦到达油，这通常是因为巨大的压力，无论是从气或水，是推动它流到地面。
  • We endeavour to avoid the old, romantic idea of a gusher, which wastes oil and gas. 我们尽量避免井喷，浪费石油和天然气的老，浪漫的想法。
  • The modern city consists of monstrous edifices and of dark, narrow streets full of petrol fumes and toxic gases, torn by the noise of the taxicabs, lorries and buses, and thronged ceaselessly by great crowds. 现代城市是由滔天的高楼和阴暗，狭窄的街道上充斥着汽油味和有毒气体，由出租车，卡车和公共汽车的噪音撕裂的，并通过人群挤来挤去。

SEE> nat·u·ral 自然的, gas·o·line 汽油, oil 石油

ODE> A substance or matter in a state in which it will expand freely to fill the whole of a container, having no fixed shape (unlike a solid) and no fixed volume (unlike a liquid) – intestinal gas, wind, gas.

794. gate 大门 ## 11

[ɡeɪt]n.大门；登机门；出入口；门票收入；道路；方式v.惩罚(禁止学生离校)；解雇suf.常表示政治丑闻

  • When he returns home at night, he always finds that someone has parked a car outside his gate. 当他夜里回到家时，总是发现有人把车停在大门之外的车。
  • Jasper has put up ‘No Parking’ signs outside his gate, but these have not had any effect. 贾斯珀曾把几块“禁止停车”他门外的迹象，但这些都没有任何效果。
  • Now he has put an ugly stone head over the gate. 现在他把一个丑陋的石雕头像放在了大门。

SEE> en·trance 入口, out·side 外面, ad·ja·cent

ODE> A hinged barrier used to close an opening in a wall, fence, or hedge. – barrier, wicket, wicket gate, lychgate, five-barred gate, turnstile.

795. gath·er 聚集 ## 3

[’ɡæðər]v.聚集；集合；收集；推测n.聚集；褶子

  • It was the last day of the year and a large crowd of people had gathered under the Town Hall clock. 那是一年的最后一天，人大群人在市政厅的大钟下聚集。
  • A crowd of people gathered round him and a lady rubbed his arm with soap and butter, but George was firmly stuck. 一大群人围拢过来，一位女士胳膊上抹了肥皂，黄油，但乔治是牢牢卡住。
  • While Alfred’s little army slowly began to gather at Athelney, the king himself set out to penetrate the camp of Guthrum, the commander of the Danish invaders. 阿尔弗雷德的小军开始慢慢聚集在阿塞尔纳，国王亲自着手渗透加思拉姆的阵营，丹麦军队的指挥官。

SEE> gath·er·ing , col·lect 收集, pre·pare 准备

ODE> Come together; assemble or accumulate. – congregate, convene, assemble, meet, collect, come together, get together, muster, rally, converge.

796. gear 齿轮 ## 2

[ɡɪr]n.传动装置；齿轮；排挡；工具；装备v.调整；使适应于；以齿轮连起

  • Bruce went into a low gear and drove at a terrifying speed, keeping the front wheels astride the crack as he followed its zigzag course. 布鲁斯走进了低速挡在开车速度令人害怕，保持前轮跨地裂的他跟随它的曲折历程。
  • They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side. 他们跳入湖中，并装上一只充气橡皮艇自己的装备后，让他们当前进到另一侧。

SEE> e·quip·ment 设备, in·stead 代替, wheel 轮子

ODE> A toothed wheel that works with others to alter the relation between the speed of a driving mechanism (such as the engine of a vehicle) and the speed of the driven parts (the wheels) – gearwheel, toothed wheel, cog, cogwheel.

797. gen·er·al 一般的 ## 10

[’dʒenrəl]adj.普遍的；全面的；一般性的；大致的；笼统的；常规的；总的；首席的n.将军；一般

  • The busmen have stated that the strike will continue until general agreement is reached about pay and working conditions. 司机们声称罢工将持续到就工资和工作条件达成全面协议。
  • Tramps seem to be the only exception to this general rule. 流浪汉似乎是唯一的例外一般规则。
  • This hobby educates one not only in the chosen subject, but also in general matters which have some bearing on it. 这种爱好灌输一个不仅在所选择的主题，而且在其中有一些关于它的轴承一般事项。

SEE> how·ev·er 然而, same 相同, mean·while 与此同时

ODE> Affecting or concerning all or most people or things; widespread. – widespread, common, extensive, universal, wide, popular, public, mainstream, prevalent, prevailing, rife, established, well established, conventional, traditional, traditionalist, orthodox, accepted.

798. gen·er·al·ly 通常 ## 4

[’dʒenrəli]adv.一般地；通常；普遍地

  • Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea-ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine. 因为有一般都很肮脏和跳蚤深重例如旅馆;食物是当地的干酪和面包通常存放了一年的时候，都冲下来的粗酒。
  • It spread through France, where wild rabbits are not generally regarded as a pest but as a sport and a useful food supply, and it spread to Britain where wild rabbits are regarded as a pest but where domesticated rabbits, equally susceptible to the disease, are the basis of a profitable fur industry. 它蔓延至法国，在那里的野生兔子一般不被当作有害动物，而作为体育和有用的食物来源，并蔓延到英国，野兔被当作有害的，但在那里驯化的野兔，同样易患本病，是赚钱的毛皮工业的基础。
  • People woken during these periods of eye-movements generally reported that they had been dreaming. 在眼睛运动的期间被叫醒的人通常报告说，他们是在做梦。

SEE> u·su·al·ly 通常, typ·i·cal·ly 一般, al·though 虽然

ODE> In most cases; usually. – usually, traditionally, normally, as a rule, conventionally, generally, in the ordinary way, ordinarily, commonly.

799. gen·er·ate 产生 ## 6

[’dʒenəreɪt]vt.产生；发生；引起

  • Our own warm atmosphere and the heat generated by the telescope would make it impossible to detect objects as small as planets. 我们自己温暖的大气层和望远镜所产生的热量，就不可能检测到物体小的行星。
  • It is bacteria that have generated the oxygen we breathe on earth. 这是生产出我们在地球上呼吸氧气的细菌。
  • The undulating waves of the open sea are generated by three natural causes: wind, earth movements or tremors, and the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun. 风，地球的运动或震颤和月亮，太阳的引力：在公海上起伏的波浪是由3个自然因素。

SEE> pro·duce 生产, cre·ate 创造, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Produce or create. – cause, give rise to, lead to, result in, bring about, bring into being, create, make, produce, initiate, engender, spawn, sow the seeds of, occasion, effect, originate, bring to pass, bring on, precipitate, prompt, provoke, kindle, trigger, spark off, touch off, stir up, whip up, induce, inspire, promote, foster, conjure.

[ˌdʒenə’reɪʃn]n.代；（产品类型的）代；产生；繁殖

  • The only way that they can preserve their history is to recount it as sagas – legends handed down from one generation of storytellers to another. 他们可以保留他们的历史的唯一办法就是讲述它作为传奇 - 从一个代说书的传世另一个传说。
  • Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office – spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U.S. a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast. 米德预言发明者可以在办公室用一个周末的完善强大的定制化芯片 - 造就新一代的车库创业企业，并给予美国把它的外国对手一个跳跃在把产品推向市场的速度快。

SEE> un·like 不像, in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> All of the people born and living at about the same time, regarded collectively. – crop, batch, wave, type, range.

801. gen·tle 温和的 ## 6

[’dʒentl]adj.温和的；轻柔的；温顺的；文雅的；出身名门的

  • He is forever talking about the friendly people, the clean atmosphere, the closeness to nature and the gentle pace of living. 他滔滔不绝地大谈友好的农民，洁净的空气，贴近大自然的环境和悠闲的生活节奏。
  • From the shore line, out to a distance which may be anywhere from a few miles to a few hundred miles, runs the gentle slope of the continental shelf, geologically part of the continents. 从岸上行，出这可能是几百英里几英里的任何地方的距离，运行大陆架的缓坡，大陆的地质一部分。
  • The slope averages about 1 in 30, but contains steep, probably vertical, cliffs, and gentle sediment-covered terraces, and near its lower reaches there is a long tailing-off which is almost certainly the result of material transported out to deep water after being eroded from the continental masses. 大约在30 1坡度平均，但其中包括陡峭的，乃至垂直的峭壁，温柔沉积物覆盖的露台，并接近其下游还有很长的拖尾过这几乎肯定是材料后运出深水结果从大陆块体被侵蚀。

  • You are better now, but you mustn’t get up yet. 你现在好些了，但你不能起床。
  • He can get up for about two hours each day, but you must keep the room warm. 他可以起床，每天约两个小时，但您必须保持房间温暖。

  • So it comes as a surprise to learn that giant fish are terrifying the divers on North Sea oil rigs. 因此，它是一个意外地得知，巨型鱼类的恐吓，对北海石油钻井平台的潜水员。
  • Oil rigs have to be repaired frequently and divers, who often have to work in darkness a hundred feet under water, have been frightened out of their wits by giant fish bumping into them as they work. 钻井平台需要经常修理，潜水员，谁往往要在黑暗中工作的水下一百英尺的地方，已被巨鱼撞到他们，因为他们的工作受到惊吓魂飞魄散了。
  • In the early 1980s, the computer giant, IBM produced the world’s first Personal Computer. 在20世纪80年代初，计算机巨头IBM生产出世界上第一台个人电脑。

  • The machine was used in a cave near the seashore where – it is said – pirates used to hide gold. 据说 - - 用来隐藏黄金海盗的机器是在海边附近的一个山洞里使用。
  • The pirates would often bury gold in the cave and then fail to collect it. 海盗们过去常把金子埋藏在那个洞里，可后来却没能取走。

[’ɡrædʒuəli]adv.逐渐地

  • The time I spent at exercises gradually diminished. 花在锻炼上的时间，我逐渐减少。
  • In the new country he became absorbed in making a new life for the two of us, so that he gradually ceased to grieve. 在新的国家里，父亲专心致志做我们两个人的新生活，让他渐渐不再悲伤。
  • Things owned for a long time are full of associations with the past, perhaps with relatives who are dead, and so they gradually acquire a value beyond their true worth. 很长一段时间所有的东西都充满着与过去岁月的联系，或许与亲戚谁已经死了，所以他们逐渐获得了一种超出自己的真正价值的值。

820. grain 谷物 ## 3

  • The use of pesticides and fertilizers produces cheap grain and vegetables. 使用杀虫剂和化肥生产出廉价的谷物和蔬菜。
  • Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt, but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training. 这种极端的事例虽不可用一粒盐，但他们强调了一项基本原则，象和象夫之间的关系是成功的关键培训。
  • If we could actually see the path described by a particle, such as a sand grain in the rock, it would be more like that of a bluebottle buzzing round the room; it would be up and down, to and fro and from side to side. 如果我们真能看到一个粒子，描述的路径，例如在岩石沙粒，这将是更像是一个青蝇嗡嗡的在房间里打转的;这将是上上下下，来来回回，并从一边到另一边。

822. grant 授予 ## 4

[ɡrænt]v.授予；同意；承认；认为n.授予物；补助金；同意；给予；财产转让Grant.n.格兰特(男名)

  • Permission was granted and a policeman accompanied him to a pay phone. 获得了许可后，一名警察陪他来到一个公用电话。
  • There is no quicker method of disposing of patients than by giving them what they are asking for, and since most medical men in the Health Services are overworked and have little time for offering time-consuming and little-appreciated advice on such subjects as diet, right living, and the need for abandoning bad habits etc., the bottle, the box, and the jar are almost always granted them. 有处置的患者比给他们，他们都在问什么的没有更快的方法，并且因为卫生部门的大多数医生超负荷工作并有很少的时间发行费时了诸如饮食小赞赏的建议，正确的生活，需要克服坏习惯等等，瓶，盒，和瓶子几乎总是授予他们。
  • Granted, a snobbery of camping itself, based upon equipment and techniques, already exists; but it is of a kind that, if he meets it, he can readily understand and deal with. 诚然，露营本身的势利，基于设备和技术，已经存在;但它是一种，如果他满足，他可以很容易地理解和处理的。

SEE> give 给, re·quest 请求, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Agree to give or allow (something requested) to. – allow, accord, permit, afford, concede, vouchsafe.

823. grass 青草 ## 6

[ɡræs]n.草；草地vt.喂(草)；(以草)覆盖；告发

  • It’s running across the grass. 它的运行穿过草地。
  • By then, however, in many places the grass had already taken root. 届时，但是，在很多地方的草已经生了根。
  • The weeks passed and the grass grew. 几个星期过去了，草长了起来。

SEE> lawn , ground 地面, dirt 污垢

ODE> Vegetation consisting of typically short plants with long, narrow leaves, growing wild or cultivated on lawns and pasture, and as a fodder crop. – turf, greenery, green, sod.

824. gra·ve 坟墓 ## 3

[ɡreiv]n.坟墓；死亡adj.严肃的；严重的；庄重的v.雕刻；铭记；

  • Did the narrator find his mother’s grave? 难道叙述者发现他母亲的坟墓？
  • But he wanted to see the old folk again and to visit my mother’s grave. 但是，他想再次看到老人们，为我的母亲的坟墓。
  • Between twelve and eighty years we gradually lose this power; an illness which at twelve would knock us over, at eighty can knock us out, and into our grave. 之间的12岁至80年来，我们逐渐丧失这种能力。它在12岁时敲我们结束了，在80的疾病可以敲我们出去，并进入坟墓。

SEE> se·ri·ous 严重的, in·deed 确实, dan·ger 危险

ODE> A hole dug in the ground to receive a coffin or dead body, typically marked by a stone or mound. – burying place, tomb, sepulchre, vault, burial chamber, burial pit, mausoleum, crypt, catacomb.

825. great 巨大的 ## 83

[ɡreɪt]adj.很好的；美好的；伟大的；重要的；大量的adv.(口语)好极了

  • He is working for a big firm and he has already visited a great number of different places in Australia. 他正在为一家大公司，他已经去过澳大利亚的不少地方的大数目。
  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。
  • As a great many people will be visiting the country, the government will be building new hotels, an immense stadium, and a new Olympic-standard swimming pool. 作为一个伟大的很多人将访问的国家，政府准备建造一些新的饭店，一个大型体育场和一个新的奥运会标准游泳池。

SEE> good 好, well 好, tre·men·dous

ODE> Of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above average. – considerable, substantial, pronounced, sizeable, significant, appreciable, serious, exceptional, inordinate, extraordinary, special.

826. great·ly 非常 ## 4

[’ɡreɪtli]adv.很；非常；大大地

  • This greatly reduced the speed of the ship, for there was a danger that if she travelled too quickly, this rudder would be torn away as well. 这大大降低了船的速度，因为有一种危险是，如果它走得太快，这个舵也会被刮走为好。
  • Cats, for instance, would be greatly helped; no running fights with large, fierce rats or tussles with grown rabbits – just a bite and no more effort needed. 猫，例如，将极大的帮助;只要咬一口，就不必再努力 - 没有与大又凶的老鼠角力与成年兔运行打架。
  • Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law, which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing. 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育反过来其添加到库：知识的增长遵循着一种复利法，这得到了印刷术的发明增强。

SEE> con·sid·er·a·bly 相当大地, sub·stan·tial·ly 基本上, dra·mat·i·cal·ly 显著地

ODE> By a considerable amount; very much. – very much, much, by a considerable amount, considerably, to a great extent, substantially, appreciably, significantly, markedly, sizeably, seriously, materially, signally, profoundly, to a great degree, to a great extent.

827. green 绿色 ## 12

[ɡriːn]adj.绿色的；长满绿色植物的；环保的；无经验的；未成熟的n.绿色；草地vi.变绿vt.使…变绿；使…恢复活力Green.n.格林(姓氏)

  • It’s green. 它是绿色的。
  • It’s green, too. 它是绿色的。
  • I’m afraid this green dress is too small for me as well. 恐怕这件绿色的衣服对我来说太小了为好。

ODE> Of the colour between blue and yellow in the spectrum; coloured like grass or emeralds. – greenish, viridescent.

828. grey 灰色 ## 3

[ɡreɪ]adj.灰色的n.灰色vi.变成灰色=gray

  • This is Nicola Grey, and this is Claire Taylor. 这是尼克拉。格雷，这位是克莱尔。
  • He was rather elderly with grey hair and clear blue eyes. 他上了年纪，灰白的头发和明亮的蓝眼睛。
  • Even under a clear blue sky, the village looked forbidding, as all the houses were built of grey mud bricks. 即使在晴朗的蓝天，村庄看上去可怕的，因为所有的房子建造的泥灰色的砖块。

ODE> Of a colour intermediate between black and white, as of ashes or lead. – greyish, silvery.

829. ground 地面 ## 21

[ɡraʊnd]n.地面；地方；根据；主题；立场；水平；背景v.使停飞；困在家中；放在地上；使 … 搁浅；打基础动词grind的过去式和过去分词形式

  • The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins. 该垃圾筐是空的，地上布满纸片，烟头，旧轮胎，空瓶子和生锈的罐头。
  • The young man did not wake up until the bed had struck the ground. 年轻人没有醒过来，直到床撞到地上。
  • Yesterday the firemen examined the ground carefully, but were not able to find any broken glass. 昨天，消防队员仔细查看了地面，但未能找到任何碎玻璃。

SEE> well 好, both 两者, but 但是

ODE> The solid surface of the earth. – floor, earth, terra firma.

830. group 组 ## 10

[ɡruːp]n.群；组；团体；集团v.聚合；成群、组；把 … 聚集；把 … 分类

  • The Greenwood Boys are a group of pop singers. 绿林少年是一个流行歌曲演唱团。
  • Now a group of enthusiasts are going to have the plane restored. 一群热心人计划修复这架飞机。
  • It has four Rolls-Royce Merlin engines, but the group will need to have only three of them rebuilt. 它有4台罗尔斯 - 罗伊斯的默林发动机，但是该集团将需要只有三个他们重建。

SEE> which 哪一个, or·gan·i·za·tion 组织, an·oth·er 另一个

831. grow 生长 ## 28

[ɡroʊ]v.增加；生长；变成；种植；逐渐开始

  • I grew a beard during the trip. 我在旅行时留了胡子。
  • Bill works harder than Joe and grows more flowers and vegetables, but Joe’s garden is more interesting. 比尔工作难度比乔，种植的花卉和蔬菜，但乔的花园更富有情趣。
  • If anyone ever asks her how old she is, she always answers, ‘Darling, it must be terrible to be grown up!’ 如果有人问起她有多大年纪，她总是回答：“亲爱的，真可怕长大了！”

SEE> grow·ing , shrink , ex·pand 扩大

ODE> (of a living thing) undergo natural development by increasing in size and changing physically. – get bigger, get taller, get larger, increase in size, increase in weight, fill out, fatten.

832. growth 成长 ## 4

[ɡroʊθ]n.【U】增长；生长；发展；种植n.【C】生长物；【医】瘤;赘生物

  • Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law, which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing. 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育反过来其添加到库：知识的增长遵循着一种复利法，这得到了印刷术的发明增强。
  • The growth of alternative mental interests is a long process. 精神上多种情趣的培养是一个长期的过程。
  • Whether the remarkable growth of organized camping means the eventual death of the more independent kind is hard to say. 无论是有组织的露营方式的显着增长，较独立的最终消失，还很难说。

SEE> in·crease 增加, rise 上升, e·con·o·my 经济

ODE> The process of increasing in size. – growing, extension, widening, thickening, broadening, heightening, swelling, magnification, ballooning.

833. guard 守卫 ## 4

[ɡɑːrd]v.看守；守卫；保卫；提防n.警戒；哨兵；防护装置；警卫；【体】后卫

  • While two detectives were keeping guard at the door, two others opened the parcel. 虽然两个侦探把住门口，两个人打开了包裹。
  • Dressed up as Father Christmas and accompanied by a ‘guard of honour’ of six pretty girls, he set off down the main street of the city riding a baby elephant called Jumbo. 他打扮成圣诞老人，在由6个漂亮姑娘组成的“仪仗队”，他掀起，沿着城里骑着名叫Jumbo的小象的主要街道。
  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。

SEE> per·son·nel , ad·di·tion 加, force 力

ODE> Watch over in order to protect or control. – keep under surveillance, keep under guard, keep watch over, mind, supervise, restrain, control.

834. guess 猜测 ## 4

[ɡes]v.推测；猜中；以为n.猜测；猜想

  • Guess! 猜测！
  • It is impossible to make more than the wildest guess at how many they kill, but they are hungry creatures, not content with only three meals a day. 这是不可能做出比最大胆的猜测更在他们杀了多少，但它们是吃不饱的动物，而不是满足于一日三餐。
  • The modern weather models work with a grid of points of the order of sixty miles apart, and even so, some starting data has to be guessed, since ground stations and satellites cannot see everywhere. 现代气象模型以60英里。为了点的网格工作分开，即使如此，有些开始时的资料也不得不猜测，因为地面工作站和卫星不可能看到无处不在。

SEE> may·be 也许, an·y·way 无论如何, know 知道

ODE> Estimate or conclude (something) without sufficient information to be sure of being correct. – estimate, calculate, approximate, make a guess at, make an estimate of.

835. guest 客人 ## 8

[ɡest]n.客人；宾客；特别来宾；[动植物]寄生生物v.做特邀嘉宾；做特约演员；客串；招待；做客

  • As if this were not enough to reduce you to tears, your husband arrives, unexpectedly bringing three guests to dinner. 好像这一切还不足以使你急得掉泪，你的丈夫到达时，意外地带来3个客人吃饭。
  • No matter how many guests were present, the great house was always immaculate. 不管有多少客人是如何目前，大房子总是收拾得干干净净。
  • After being absent from The Gables for a week, my aunt unexpectedly returned one afternoon with a party of guests and instructed Bessie to prepare dinner. 正在从山墙缺席了一周后，我的她出其不意地回来一个下午的客人，吩咐贝西准备晚饭。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, be·sides , a·long·side 在旁边

ODE> A person who is invited to visit someone’s home or attend a particular social occasion. – visitor, caller.

836. gun 枪 ## 3

[ɡʌn]n.枪；炮；节流阀vt.枪击；打开节流阀vi.用枪打猎

  • As they had brought a spear gun with them, they had plenty to eat. 由于他们随身带了一支捕鱼枪他们，他们有很多吃的。
  • From a heavy gun that was raised, the captain realized that the ship must have been a cruiser. 从捞起的一门大炮来看，船长认为那艘船一定是艘巡洋舰。
  • As she emerged from her drifting cloud of gun smoke with the water churned to foam beneath her bow, her flags flying, pennants waving, sails filling in the breeze, and the red and gold of her superstructure ablaze with colour, she presented a more majestic spectacle than Stockholmers had ever seen before. 当她从她的漂泊与搅动泡沫水炮烟的云下她的弓，她彩旗飘扬，锦旗挥舞，帆填充在微风中，红色和她的金上层建筑色闪亮出现，她提出了更加宏伟的场面比斯德哥尔摩人从未见过之前。

SEE> weap·on 武器, ma·chine 机器, shoot 射击

ODE> A weapon incorporating a metal tube from which bullets, shells, or other missiles are propelled by explosive force, typically making a characteristic loud, sharp noise. – firearm, weapon.

837. hab·it 习惯 ## 10

  • Since then, he has developed another bad habit. 从那时起，他已经开发出另外一种坏习惯。
  • That proved to be my undoing, for I soon got back to my old bad habit of dozing off in front of the screen. 这证明了我的失败，因为我不久就回到电视屏幕前打瞌睡的坏习惯去。
  • Furthermore, the acquisition of this bottle cured him of a bad habit he had been developing for years. 此外，这瓶香水泥还治好一个坏习惯，他已经发展了多年的他。

SEE> ten·den·cy 趋势, an·noy·ing 恼人的, sim·ply 只是

ODE> A settled or regular tendency or practice, especially one that is hard to give up. – practice, custom, pattern, routine, style, convention, policy, wont, way, manner, mode, norm, tradition, matter of course, rule, usage.

838. hair 头发 ## 3

  • He was rather elderly with grey hair and clear blue eyes. 他上了年纪，灰白的头发和明亮的蓝眼睛。
  • ‘It’s hair gel.’ “这是发胶。”
  • The reader’s hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands. 读者的头发看台上结束的时候，他在小说的最后几页了解到书中女主人公，一个亲爱的老太太谁一直是这样善待每个人，曾在她的青春，她毒死五个丈夫的每一个读取。

  • You must be home at half past ten. 你必须回家十点半。
  • I had lunch at half past twelve. 我吃了午饭12点半。

  • The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Nasmyth’s steam hammer. 其中最奇妙的上是内史密斯的蒸汽锤。

ODE> A tool with a heavy metal head mounted at right angles at the end of a handle, used for jobs such as breaking things and driving in nails. – mallet, beetle, gavel.

  • Then he put his hand into his pocket, and took out a phrasebook. 然后，他把他的手伸进口袋，掏出了一本常用语。
  • The big minute hand did not move. 大分针不动了。
  • After a little time, she chose one of the most expensive dresses in the shop and handed it to an assistant who wrapped it up for her as quickly as possible. 过了一会儿，她又选了商场里最昂贵的一件衣服，把它递给了助手谁尽快包好了她越好。

843. hang 悬挂 ## 7

[hæŋ]v.悬挂；(使)低垂；悬浮(在空中)；逗留；绞死n.悬挂方式；悬挂；绞刑

  • ‘I’m hanging this picture on the wall,’ I answered. “我挂在墙上这幅画，”我回答。
  • At last I hung up the receiver. 我终于挂上了话筒。
  • A painter who had been working on the tower hung a pot of paint on one of the hands and slowed it down! 谁一直工作在塔架上的画家挂漆一壶在手之一，慢了！

SEE> down 下, mean·time , up 上

ODE> Suspend or be suspended from above with the lower part dangling free. – be suspended, hang down, be pendent, dangle, swing, sway.

844. hap·pen 发生 ## 36

  • It happened to a friend of mine a year ago. 它发生在我的一个朋友一年前。
  • We waited and waited, but nothing happened. 我们等了又等，却什么都没有发生。
  • What happened to the clavichord? 发生了什么事击弦古钢琴？

SEE> an·y·way 无论如何, cer·tain·ly 当然, come 来

845. hap·pi·ly 快乐地 ## 2

[’hæpɪli]adv.幸福地；快乐地；幸好；恰当地形容词happy的副词形式.

  • Readers happily accepted the fact that an obscure maidservant was really the hero’s mother. 读者却愉快地接受了事实，一个低贱的女佣实际上是主人公的母亲。
  • The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing. 美国人很愿意就医疗器械的标准达成一个协议，然后推敲出不同的合同，用以涵盖，比如说 - 电子产品和药品的生产。

SEE> cheer·ful·ly 欢快地, qui·et·ly 悄悄, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> In a happy way. – contentedly, merrily, delightedly, joyfully, gaily, cheerfully, cheerily, agreeably, blithely, light-heartedly, gleefully, blissfully, with pleasure, to one’s heart’s content.

846. hap·py 快乐 ## 3

[’hæpi]adj.高兴的；幸福的；幸运的；乐意的

  • What was the ‘happy discovery’? 什么是“幸福发现”？
  • This shows how long it was before we deemed it necessary to make sure that all our children could share in the knowledge accumulated by the ‘happy few’ during the past centuries. 这说明，经过多么漫长的时间之后，我们才认识到，以确保它需要我们所有的孩子们，在过去几个世纪以来由“少数幸运者”积累起来的知识。
  • To be really happy and really safe, one ought to have at least two or three hobbies, and they must all be real. 要想获得真正的快乐与安宁，一个人应该有至少两个三种爱好，而且必须是真正的爱好。

SEE> glad 高兴的, pleased 高兴, al·ways 总是

ODE> Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment. – contented, content, cheerful, cheery, merry, joyful, jovial, jolly, joking, jocular, gleeful, carefree, untroubled, delighted, smiling, beaming, grinning, glowing, satisfied, gratified, buoyant, radiant, sunny, blithe, joyous, beatific, blessed.

847. hard 硬 ## 25

[hɑːrd]adj.硬的；困难的；棘手的；坚强的；残酷的；用力的；液态的；严寒的；确凿的adv.努力地；强烈地；严重地；坚定地

  • You’re working hard, George. 你干得真辛苦，乔治。
  • I like gardens too, but I do not like hard work. 我也喜欢花园，但我不喜欢艰苦的工作。
  • She struck the keys too hard and two of the strings were broken. 她在击琴键时用力过猛两根琴弦被打破。

SEE> so 所以, e·ven 甚至, too 太

ODE> Solid, firm, and rigid; not easily broken, bent, or pierced. – firm, solid, dense, rigid, stiff, resistant, unbreakable, inflexible, unpliable, impenetrable, unyielding, solidified, hardened, compact, compacted, steely, tough, strong, stony, rocklike, flinty, close-packed, compressed, as hard as iron, as hard as stone.

848. hard·ly 几乎不 ## 12

[’hɑːrdli]adv.几乎不；简直不；刚刚

  • He had hardly had time to settle down when he sold the house and left the country. 他几乎没有时间安顿下来就卖掉了房子，离开了这个国家。
  • Both men had hardly had time to realize what was happening when they were thrown violently into the sea. 他们两个还没来得及意识到，当他们被猛地抛入海中发生了什么事。
  • There were hardly any trees on the island and there was no water, but this did not prove to be a problem. 有几乎岛上的任何树木，也没有淡水，但这并没有被证明是一个问题。

SEE> in·deed 确实, noth·ing 没有, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> Scarcely (used to qualify a statement by saying that it is true to an insignificant degree) – scarcely, barely, only just, not much, faintly, narrowly, slightly, rarely, little.

849. harm 伤害 ## 2

[hɑːrm]n.危害；伤害；损害vt.伤害；损害

  • We regard them as unnecessary creatures that do more harm than good. 我们把它们看作是做弊大于利的无用东西。
  • Moreover, unlike some of the other insect eaters, spiders never do the least harm to us or our belongings. 此外，不同于其他食虫动物，蜘蛛丝毫不危害我们和我们的财物。

SEE> threat·en 威胁, un·der·mine , af·fect 影响

ODE> Physical injury, especially that which is deliberately inflicted. – injury, hurt, pain, suffering, distress, anguish, trauma, torment, grief.

850. harm·less 无害 ## 2

[’hɑːrmləs]adj.无害的；无恶意的

  • We live in dread not only of unpleasant insects like spiders or wasps, but of quite harmless ones like moths. 我们生活在一个既类令人讨厌的昆虫如蜘蛛，黄蜂恐惧，但并无大害的飞蛾等。
  • It is a harmless habit, but it litters up her desk to such an extent that every time she opens it, loose bits of paper fall out in every direction. 它是一种无害的习惯，但她的办公桌上最多乱丢到这样的程度，每次她打开它时，纸张的松位在每一个方向脱落。

SEE> use·less 无用, su·per·flu·ous , mere·ly 仅仅

ODE> Not able or likely to cause harm. – safe, innocuous, benign, gentle, mild, wholesome, non-dangerous, non-toxic, non-poisonous, non-irritant, non-addictive.

851. hat 帽子 ## 12

[hæt]n.帽子vt.给 … 戴帽子vi.提供帽子；制造帽子

  • What colour is Anna’s hat? 什么颜色是安娜的帽子吗？
  • My hat’s new, too. 我的帽子是新的，太。
  • That is a lovely hat! 这是一个可爱的帽子！

SEE> trick 诡计, jack·et 夹克, shirt 衬衫

ODE> A shaped covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform. – titfer.

852. hate 讨厌 ## 4

[heɪt]v.憎恨；厌恶；讨厌n.憎恨；厌恶

  • I hate them. 我恨他们。
  • I hate to interrupt a man when he’s busy working, but would you mind coming with me to the station?’ 我是不愿意去打断，当他忙于工作的人，但你介意跟我到警察局去一趟？”
  • In the process, he enjoyed himself thoroughly and kept telling everybody how much he hated hospitals. 在这个过程中，他尽情娱乐，一再告诉大家他是多么讨厌医院。

SEE> ha·tred 仇, in·deed 确实, noth·ing 没有

ODE> Feel intense dislike for. – loathe, detest, dislike greatly, abhor, abominate, despise, execrate, feel aversion towards, feel revulsion towards, feel hostile towards, be repelled by, be revolted by, regard with disgust, not be able to bear, not be able to stand, be unable to stomach, find intolerable, shudder at, recoil from, shrink from.

853. have 有 ## 1084

[həv]aux.已经vt.有；吃；得到；从事；允许；雇用；享有n.[常用复数]富人，有产者，有钱人；富国

  • Do you have any writing paper? 你有信纸吗？
  • I don’t have any small pads. 我没有小本的信纸。
  • I only have large ones. 我只有路数。

SEE> they 他们, al·read·y 已经, man·y 许多

ODE> Possess, own, or hold. – possess, own, be in possession of, be the owner of, be the possessor of, be the proud possessor of, have in one’s possession, have to one’s name, count among one’s possessions, be blessed with, boast, enjoy.

854. he 他 ## 1136

[hi:]pron.他；任何人n.男人；雄性动物

  • Does the man get his umbrella back? 难道男人得到他的伞回来？
  • He is German. 他是德国人。
  • He’s Korean. 他是韩国人。

SEE> but 但是, him 他, then 然后

ODE> Used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal previously mentioned or easily identified. – masculine, to do with men, he-.

855. head 头 ## 14

[hed]n.头部；头脑；顶端；领袖；硬币的正面v.前进；为首；朝向adj.首要的；前面的

  • In return for this, the beggar stood on his head and sang songs. 作为回报，那乞丐站在他的头上还唱着歌。
  • Now he has put an ugly stone head over the gate. 现在他把一个丑陋的石雕头像放在了大门。
  • Before he retired, Frank was the head of a very large business company, but as a boy he used to work in a small shop. 他在退休前，弗兰克是一家非常大的商业公司的负责人，但作为一个男孩，他曾经工作在一个小商店。

SEE> hand 手, then 然后, put 放

ODE> The upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs. – skull, cranium, crown.

856. health 健康 ## 8

[helθ]n.健康；医疗保健

  • After reading an article entitled ‘Cigarette Smoking and Your Health’ I lit a cigarette to calm my nerves. 阅读一篇文章，题为“吸烟与健康”后，我点了一支烟，镇静一下紧张情绪。
  • The Swedes were the first to recognize that public officials like civil servants, police officers, health inspectors or tax-collectors can make mistakes or act over-zealously in the belief that they are serving the public. 是瑞典人首先认识到政府工作人员如文职人员，警官，卫生稽查员，税务，也会犯错误或行为过分热心的信念，他们所服务的公众。
  • Vera’s curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives, and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic. 维拉的好奇人才被带到一个科研单位在乌里扬诺夫斯克镇的通知，她家附近，并在4月，她被俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对一系列的测试。

SEE> care 关心, ed·u·ca·tion 教育, med·i·cal 医学的

ODE> The state of being free from illness or injury. – good physical condition, healthiness, fitness, physical fitness, well-being, haleness, good trim, good shape, fine fettle, good kilter.

857. hear 听见 ## 34

  • Do you hear? 你听到了吗？
  • I’m afraid I can’t hear you. 恐怕我不能听你的。
  • Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them. 突然，他们听到身后有声音。

SEE> lis·ten 听, tell 告诉, come 来

ODE> Perceive with the ear the sound made by (someone or something) – perceive, catch, get, make out, take in, apprehend, discern.

858. heart 心脏 ## 6

[hɑːrt]n.心；内心；中心；要点；红桃v.将…记在心里，铭记；鼓励

  • If they knew how difficult it was to drill through the hard rock, they would lose heart. 如果他们知道这是多么困难钻取坚硬的岩石，他们将失去心脏。
  • One would expect them to know their parts by heart and never have cause to falter. 人们会期望他们知道通过心脏及其零件，从来没有理由结巴。
  • One night, the gaoler decided to play a joke on his colleague to find out if, after so many performances, he had managed to learn the contents of the letter by heart. 一天晚上，狱卒决定捉弄他的同事，以找出是否，经过这么多场演出，他已经设法通过心脏学会的信的内容。

SEE> mind 心神, in·deed 确实, suf·fer·ing 痛苦

ODE> A hollow muscular organ that pumps the blood through the circulatory system by rhythmic contraction and dilation. In vertebrates there may be up to four chambers (as in humans), with two atria and two ventricles. – ticker.

859. heat 热 ## 2

[hiːt]n.热度；热；热烈；激烈；发烧v.(使)变热；(使)激动

  • Our own warm atmosphere and the heat generated by the telescope would make it impossible to detect objects as small as planets. 我们自己温暖的大气层和望远镜所产生的热量，就不可能检测到物体小的行星。
  • In a heat wave we choose a midnight birthday party and that is the most exciting of all. 天气炎热时，我们便选择在半夜生日派对，这是最令人激动的。

SEE> cool 凉爽的, hot 热, tem·per·a·ture 温度

ODE> The quality of being hot; high temperature. – hotness, warmth, warmness, high temperature.

860. heav·i·ly 重重地 ## 3

[’hevɪli]adv.重重地；沉重地；沉闷地；猛烈地；厉害地；稠密地

  • It was raining heavily and they found that a stream had formed in the field. 雨下得很大，他们发现，甲流已在该领域形成。
  • Even when it was raining heavily, he refused to carry an umbrella. 即使大雨倾盆，他拒绝带伞。
  • Two factors weigh heavily against the effectiveness of scientific research in industry. 有两个因素严重地妨碍工业中科学研究的效率。

SEE> al·though 虽然, sim·i·lar·ly 同样, re·ly 依赖

ODE> To a great degree; in large amounts. – laboriously, slowly, ponderously, steadily, deliberately, woodenly, stiffly, with heavy steps, with leaden steps.

861. heav·y 重的 ## 19

[’hevi]adj.大(量)的；重的；沉重的；猛烈的

  • Is that bag heavy, Penny? 那个提包重，竹篙？
  • Byrd at once ordered his men to throw out two heavy food sacks. 伯德马上命令他的士兵扔掉两个沉重的食物袋。
  • No one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy. 没有人可以解释这个事实，即一个箱子特别重。

SEE> de·spite 尽管, due 到期, mas·sive 大规模的

ODE> Of great weight; difficult to lift or move. – weighty, hefty, big, large, substantial, massive, ponderous.

862. height 高度 ## 7

[haɪt]n.高度；高处；顶点

  • After taking off, we were flying low over the city and slowly gaining height, when the plane suddenly turned round and flew back to the airport. 起飞之后，我们在城市上空低空飞行，然后慢慢爬高，当飞机突然调转头来，飞回了机场。
  • The editor at once sent the journalist a fax instructing him to find out the exact number of steps and the height of the wall. 立即给那位记者发去传真，要求他的编辑器来找出台阶的确切数字和围墙的高度。
  • How do cats try to protect themselves when falling from great heights? 如何猫尝试从很高的地方落下时保护自己？

SEE> length 长度, width 宽度, hence 因此

ODE> The measurement of someone or something from head to foot or from base to top. – highness, tallness, loftiness, distance upwards, extent upwards, vertical measurement, elevation, stature, altitude, distance above the ground.

864. help 帮助 ## 23

[help]v.帮助；有助于；促进；擅自拿取；（不）能防止或避免某事物n.帮助；援助；帮手；佣人；仆人int.救命！

  • I hope it’ll help you. 我希望它会帮助你。

866. he·ro 英雄 ## 4

[’hɪroʊ]n.英雄n.男主角；男主人公

  • In spite of this, the Italians regarded him as a sort of hero. 尽管如此，意大利人还是把他视作某种英雄。
  • Readers happily accepted the fact that an obscure maidservant was really the hero’s mother. 读者却愉快地接受了事实，一个低贱的女佣实际上是主人公的母亲。
  • A long-lost brother, who was presumed dead, was really alive all the time and wickedly plotting to bring about the hero’s downfall. 失散多年的兄弟，谁以为他死了，其实一直活着，而且在居心叵测地策划暗算主人公的垮台。
