920. im·por·tance 重要性 ## 5

[ɪm’pɔːrtns]n.重要；重要性

  • What is the special importance of a telescope in space? 什么是太空望远镜的特殊重要性？
  • What is the importance of the dots, lines, and symbols engraved on stone, bones and ivory? 什么是点，线，并刻在石头，骨头和象牙符号的重要性？
  • Convinced of the importance of education, modern states ‘invest’ in institutions of learning to get back ‘interest’ in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders. 深信教育的重要性，现代国家在机构投资，学习，取回一大群开明青年男女谁是潜在的领导人形式的“兴趣”的。

SEE> sig·nif·i·cance , im·por·tant 重要, em·pha·sis 强调

ODE> The state or fact of being of great significance or value. – significance, momentousness, import, consequence, note, noteworthiness, substance, value.

921. im·por·tant 重要 ## 15

[ɪm’pɔːrtnt]adj.重要的；重大的；（指人）有很大影响或权威的

  • He will take part in an important race across the Atlantic. 他将参加横渡大西洋的重要比赛。
  • But they don’t realize one important thing. 但他们没有认识到重要的事情。
  • Later we learnt that there was a very important person on board. 后来我们才得知，飞机上坐了一位非常重要的人物。

SEE> es·pe·cial·ly 特别, cru·cial 关键, sig·nif·i·cant 显著的

ODE> Of great significance or value. – main, chief, principal, key, major, salient, prime, dominant, foremost, supreme, predominant, paramount, overriding, cardinal, crucial, vital, indispensable, critical, essential, significant, urgent.

922. im·pos·si·ble 不可能 ## 23

[ɪm’pɑːsəbl]adj.不可能的；做不到的

  • But that’s impossible. 但这是不可能的。
  • Dentists always ask questions when it is impossible for you to answer. 牙科医生们总是问问题时，它是不可能为你解答。
  • Just as it was leaving, Mr. Taylor rushed out and ran after it throwing ashtrays and vases, but it was impossible to stop the thieves. 正如它离开时，泰勒先生冲了出来，将其掷烟灰缸，花瓶后跑了，但他已无法阻止盗贼。

SEE> dif·fi·cult 困难的, in·deed 确实, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> Not able to occur, exist, or be done. – not possible, beyond the bounds of possibility, out of the question, not worth considering.

923. im·press 给留下印象 ## 2

[ɪm’pres]n.印记；印象；特征v.使 … 有印象；影响；印刻；传送

  • I had no intention of buying one, but I could not conceal the fact that I was impressed by the size of the diamonds. 我根本不想买的意图，但我无法掩饰我被钻石的个头给吸引住了。
  • She entered the station twenty minutes before the train was due, since her parents had impressed upon her that it would be unforgivable to miss it and cause the friends with whom she was going to stay to make two journeys to meet her. 她进了车站二十分钟车前是由于，因为她的父母对她印象深刻，这将是不可原谅错过它和谁在一起，她要留进行两次旅行，以满足她引起朋友。

SEE> con·vince 使相信, ea·ger , impressed 印象深刻

ODE> Make (someone) feel admiration and respect. – make an impression on, have an impact on, influence, affect, leave a mark on, move, stir, rouse, excite, inspire, galvanize.

924. im·pres·sion 印象 ## 6

[ɪm’preʃn]n.印象；感觉；模仿n.印迹；印刷

  • The sudden movement of the door made it sway slightly and it gave me the impression that it was about to leap out at me. 门的突然运动使它稍微摇摆，它给我的印象是，它是关于我扑过来。
  • As we were walking past a shop, he held a diamond firmly against the window and made a deep impression in the glass. 当我们路过一家商店时，他坚定地拿起一块钻石，窗户和玻璃做了深刻的印象。
  • Though the crew were at first under the impression that the lost ship had been found, the contents of the chest proved them wrong. 虽然船员们开始的印象是，沉船已被发现，胸部的物品证明他们错了。

SEE> ev·i·dent·ly , cer·tain·ly 当然, per·cep·tion

ODE> An idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone, especially one formed without conscious thought or on the basis of little evidence. – feeling, sense, fancy, suspicion, sneaking suspicion, inkling, intuition, hunch, apprehension.

925. im·pres·sive 令人印象深刻的 ## 2

[ɪm’presɪv]adj.给人深刻印象的

  • She serves as an impressive reminder of the great ships of the past. 她还担任了过去的伟大船只的令人印象深刻的提醒。
  • Few things could be more impressive than the peace that descends on deserted city streets at weekends when the thousands that travel to work every day are tucked away in their homes in the country. 没有什么能比这和平周末在冷清的城市街道下降时，成千上万的旅行每天上下班在自己的国家家庭都局促更令人印象深刻。

SEE> re·mark·a·ble 显著的, as·ton·ish·ing , su·perb

ODE> Evoking admiration through size, quality, or skill; grand, imposing, or awesome. – magnificent, majestic, imposing, splendid, spectacular, grand, august, awe-inspiring, stirring, stunning, breathtaking.

926. im·prove 改善 ## 3

[ɪm’pruːv]vt.改善；改进；提高vi.变得更好；改进

  • With experience, and with improved apparatus, it is now possible not only to locate a shoal but to tell if it is herring, cod, or other well-known fish, by the pattern of its echo. 根据经验和改进了的仪器，它现在不仅能够找到一个浅滩，而是判断它是鲱鱼，鳕鱼，或其他知名的鱼，它的回声的特点。
  • My particular experience is largely in oil, and the search for oil has done more to improve deep drilling than any other mining activity. 我是专门搞石油的，并且对石油的搜索已经做得更多，以提高深钻比其他任何采矿业。
  • It is said that the nerve poison is the more primitive of the two, that the blood poison is, so to speak, a newer product from an improved formula. 据说，神经毒是更原始的两个，即血毒是，使从一个改良配方，较新的产品。

SEE> im·proved , en·hance , bet·ter 更好

ODE> Make or become better. – make better, better, ameliorate, upgrade, refine, enhance, boost, build on, help, raise, revamp, brush up, polish up, perk up, tweak.

927. in 在之内 ## 1091

[ɪn]prep.在 … 里；在 … 地方；在 … 期间；在 … 方面；进入…里面；处于…状态；穿着…；以…的方式adv.在家；入；进；向里；在某地；并入；在某种关系中adj.在里面的；新来的；执政的；时髦的n.当权者；影响；达成目标的路径

  • There is a refrigerator in the kitchen. 有一个在厨房的冰箱。
  • There is an electric cooker in the kitchen. 有厨房的电饭煲。
  • There is a table in the middle of the room. 有一个在屋子中间一张桌子。

SEE> where 哪里, same 相同, last 最后的

ODE> Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else. – inside, within, in the middle of, within the bounds of, within the confines of.

928. inch 英寸 ## 2

[ɪntʃ]n.英寸；少量v.慢慢移动（复）inches: 身高.

  • At the moment, they cover every inch of floor space and I actually have to walk on them to get in or out of the room. 目前，它们覆盖的地面每一寸空间，我实际上是踩着这些书进出房间的获得。
  • After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. 通过墙上挖了厚18英寸碎裂后，他们发现，一男子已被困在烟囱里。

SEE> cen·ti·me·ter , mil·li·me·ter , thick 厚

ODE> A unit of linear measure equal to one twelfth of a foot (2.54 cm) – little bit, small amount, particle, degree, speck, fragment, scrap, crumb, grain, morsel, taste, soupçon, shred, mite, dash, drop, pinch, ounce, touch, tinge, dab, jot, iota, whit, tittle, jot or tittle, atom, inch, snippet, sliver, smattering, scintilla, hint, suggestion, whisper, trifle.

929. in·clude 包括 ## 7

[ɪn’kluːd]vt.包括；包含；列入

  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。
  • He had included a large number of funny stories in the speech and, of course, it was a great success. 他收录了大量在讲话中有趣的故事，当然的，这是一个巨大的成功。
  • In spite of this, some people – including myself – were surprised by a recent exhibition of modern sculpture. 尽管如此，一些人 - 包括我自己 - 是由最近的展览现代雕塑的惊讶。

SEE> in·clud·ing 包含, ad·di·tion 加, such 这样

ODE> Comprise or contain as part of a whole. – incorporate, comprise, encompass, cover, embrace, involve, take in, number, contain.

930. in·come 收入 ## 6

[’ɪnkʌm]n.收入；所得；收益

  • He has pointed out that the tree is a useful source of income, as tourists have been coming from all parts of the country to see it. 他指出，这棵树是收入的有效来源，游客已经从全国各地来看望它。
  • Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income. 爸爸妈妈，当然，提供的零花钱正常供应，但叔叔和婶婶总是额外收入来源。
  • The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground, and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them. 形状和摩天大楼的尺寸完全取决于获得每平方英尺的地面最高收入的必要性，并提供使他满意的租户办公室和住房。

SEE> tax 税, rev·e·nue , ben·e·fit 益处

ODE> Money received, especially on a regular basis, for work or through investments. – earnings, salary, pay, remuneration, wages, stipend, emolument.

931. in·crease 增加 ## 7

[ɪn’kriːs]v.增加；提高n.增加；增强；提高

  • Because the tree was mentioned in a newspaper, the number of visitors to Frinley has now increased. 因为树是在报上提到，来弗林利参观的人数已经增加。
  • This increases their air-resistance and reduces the shock of impact when they hit the ground. 这样就加大了空气阻力，并减少冲击的冲击，当他们击中了地面。
  • Reading about them increases our understanding without dispelling our fears. 阅读他们没有消除我们的恐惧增加了我们的理解。

SEE> de·crease 减少, re·duce 降低, rise 上升

ODE> Become or make greater in size, amount, or degree. – grow, get bigger, get larger, become greater, enlarge, expand, swell.

932. in·creas·ing·ly 日益 ## 2

[ɪn’kriːsɪŋli]adv.逐渐地；越来越多地

  • So great is our passion for doing things for ourselves, that we are becoming increasingly less dependent on specialized labour. 如此之大的是我们自己动手做事的激情，我们正变得越来越少依赖于专门的劳动。
  • The best way to overcome it – so at least it seems to me – is to make your interests gradually wider and more impersonal, until bit by bit the walls of the ego recede, and your life becomes increasingly merged in the universal life. 战胜它的最好办法 - 至少在我看来 - 是使你的兴趣爱好更广泛和更客观的，直到一点一点地自我退去的墙，你的生命在宇宙的生活变得越来越合并。

SEE> par·tic·u·lar·ly 尤其, be·come 成为, es·pe·cial·ly 特别

ODE> To an increasing extent; more and more. – more and more, progressively, to an increasing extent, steadily more, continuously more, gradually more, growingly.

933. in·deed 确实 ## 11

[ɪn’diːd]adv.真正地；的确，确实；事实上；甚至

  • Despite her great age, she was very graceful indeed, but, so far, the archaeologists have been unable to discover her identity. 尽管上了年纪，她很优雅确实，但是，到目前为止，考古学家一直未能发现她的身份。
  • Finding that he could not remember a word of the letter either, the gaoler replied: ’The light is indeed dim, sire. 发现他已经不记得信的一个字也，于是便说：“光线的确太暗了，陛下。
  • This was indeed the case. 这确实如此。

SEE> fact 事实, more·o·ver 此外, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> Used to emphasize a statement or response confirming something already suggested. – as expected, to be sure, in fact, in point of fact, as a matter of fact, in truth, truly, actually, really, in reality, as it happened, as it happens, certainly, surely, for sure, undeniably, veritably, nay, if truth be told, you could say.

934. in·de·pend·ence 独立 ## 3

[ˌɪndɪ’pendəns]n.独立；自立

  • As a result, humans have learned to respect feline independence. 其结果是，人们已经学会尊重猫的独立性。
  • In seeking independence, they do not sacrifice their human dignity. 在追求独立自由，他们并不牺牲为人的尊严。
  • The contemporary phenomenon of car worship is to be explained not least by the sense of independence and freedom that ownership entails. 崇拜汽车现象可以通过独立和自由与所有权相伴的意义来解释并非最不重要的。

SEE> strug·gle 斗争, rule 规则, free·dom 自由

ODE> The fact or state of being independent. – self-government, self-rule, home rule, self-legislation, self-determination, sovereignty, autonomy, non-alignment, freedom, liberty.

935. in·de·pend·ent 独立 ## 3

[ˌɪndɪ’pendənt]adj.独立的；自主的；独自的；无偏见的n.无党派者；独立派人士

  • Reward or punishment are meted out quite independent of human interference. 奖励或惩罚是入狱相当独立的人为干扰。
  • If parents were prepared for this adolescent reaction, and realized that it was a sign that the child was growing up and developing valuable powers of observation and independent judgment, they would not be so hurt, and therefore would not drive the child into opposition by resenting and resisting it. 如果家长对青少年的这种反应准备，并且意识到这是一个迹象，表明孩子正在成长和发展的观察和独立判断有价值的权力，他们就不会感到如此伤心，所以也就不会由于怨恨而把孩子推到对立面和抵御它。
  • Whether the remarkable growth of organized camping means the eventual death of the more independent kind is hard to say. 无论是有组织的露营方式的显着增长，较独立的最终消失，还很难说。

SEE> sep·a·rate 分开, own 自己的, both 两者

ODE> Free from outside control; not subject to another’s authority. – freethinking, individualistic, unconventional, maverick.

936. in·di·cate 表明 ## 3

[’ɪndɪkeɪt]v.指示；象征；显示；暗示，预示v.表明；指明

  • I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay ￡5. 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我愿意支付£5。
  • Recent scientific evidence seems to indicate that this assumption is incorrect. 最近的科学研究发现，好像这种假设是不正确。
  • The porter went to fetch one and arrived back with the station master, who produced it with a flourish and pointed out a microscopic ‘o’ beside the time of the arrival of the train at his station; this little ‘o’ indicated that the train only stopped for mail. 搬运工跑回去取和到达同站主，谁一挥手，并指出了微观的“o”火车在他站的到达时间旁;这个小“O”表示，火车只停了邮件。

SEE> sug·gest 建议, more·o·ver 此外, fur·ther·more

ODE> Point out; show. – designate, specify, stipulate.

937. in·di·vid·u·al 个人 ## 18

[ˌɪndɪ’vɪdʒuəl]adj.单独的；一个人的；独有的n.个人；个体

  • Acting on the contention that facts are sacred, reporters can cause untold suffering to individuals by publishing details about their private lives. 代理的论点的事实是神圣的，记者可以通过发布关于他们私生活的细节，有时会给当事人造成极大的痛苦。
  • Sweden has evolved an excellent system for protecting the individual citizen from high-handed or incompetent public officers. 瑞典，已逐渐一种完善的制度以保护每个公民不受专横或无能的政府官员。
  • As long ago as 1809, the Swedish Parliament introduced a scheme to safeguard the interest of the individual. 早在1809年，瑞典议会就建立了一个保护个人的利益。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, these 这些, fur·ther·more

ODE> Single; separate. – single, separate, discrete, independent.

938. in·dus·tri·al 产业 ## 4

[ɪn’dʌstriəl]adj.工业的；产业的n.工业公司

  • In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected. 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人的生理和精神状态的影响完全被忽视了。
  • In 1953, a former electronics engineer in his fifties, Christopher Cockerell, who had turned to boat-building on the Norfolk Broads, suggested an idea on which he had been working for many years to the British Government and industrial circles. 1953年，一个原电子工程师，在他五十多岁，克里斯托弗·科克雷尔，谁曾转向造船在诺福克湖区，建议上，他已经工作多年向英国政府和工业界的想法。
  • The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System, supplying the rocket fuels for its ships, easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen. 月亮很可能成为太阳系的工业中心，其船舶，从在液态氧的形式月球上的岩石易于获得供给火箭燃料。

SEE> man·u·fac·tur·ing 制造业, sec·tor 扇形, ma·chin·er·y 机械

ODE> Relating to or characterized by industry. – manufacturing, factory.

939. in·dus·try 行业 ## 8

[’ɪndəstri]n.工业；产业；行业；勤勉；勤劳

  • What does the computer industry thrive on apart from anarchy? 什么是计算机行业从混乱兴旺分开？
  • Why is secrecy particularly important in the chemical industries? 为什么是秘密的化工行业特别重要？
  • Two factors weigh heavily against the effectiveness of scientific research in industry. 有两个因素严重地妨碍工业中科学研究的效率。

SEE> busi·ness 商业, sec·tor 扇形, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Economic activity concerned with the processing of raw materials and manufacture of goods in factories. – manufacturing, production, fabrication, construction.

940. in·ev·i·ta·bly 不可避免地 ## 2

[ɪn’evɪtəbli]adv.不可避免地

  • Inevitably you arrive at your destination almost exhausted. 一旦抵达目的地，你总是疲惫不堪。
  • Inevitably the repair job was not quite so simple. 事实上，修理工作远不是那么简单。

SEE> in·var·i·a·bly , sure·ly 一定, un·doubt·ed·ly

ODE> As is certain to happen; unavoidably. – naturally, automatically, as a matter of course, necessarily, of necessity, by force of circumstance, inescapably, unavoidably, ineluctably, certainly, surely, definitely, incontrovertibly, undoubtedly.

941. in·flu·ence 影响 ## 5

[’ɪnfluəns]v.影响；感染；在(饮料)中加烈酒n.影响力；影响；权势；势力；有影响的人(或事物)

  • No one can avoid being influenced by advertisements. 没有人能避免受广告的影响。
  • Much as we may pride ourselves on our good taste, we are no longer free to choose the things we want, for advertising exerts a subtle influence on us. 尽管我们可以对我们的好味道感到自豪，我们不再自由选择我们想要的东西，广告发挥对我们有潜移默化的影响。
  • Newspapers exert such tremendous influence that they can not only bring about major changes to the lives of ordinary people but can even overthrow a government. 新闻具有巨大的影响力，他们不仅能带来重大的变化，对普通百姓的生活，甚至还能推翻一个政府。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, par·tic·u·lar 特定的, in·deed 确实

ODE> The capacity to have an effect on the character, development, or behaviour of someone or something, or the effect itself. – effect, impact.

942. in·form 通知 ## 8

[ɪn’fɔːrm]v.通知；告诉；使熟悉；告发；赋特征于

  • I have just received a letter from my old school, informing me that my former headmaster, Mr. Stuart Page, will be retiring next week. 我刚刚收到一封来自我的老同学，通知我说以前的校长斯图亚特·佩奇，将于下周退休。
  • He informed the station at once, but no one there was able to explain the mystery. 他立刻通知了车站，但没有一个人能解释其中的奥秘。
  • He sent yet another fax informing the journalist that if he did not reply soon he would be fired. 他又发了一份传真，通知那位记者说，若再不迅速答复，将被解雇。

SEE> no·ti·fy , ad·vise 劝告, in·struct

ODE> Give (someone) facts or information; tell. – tell, let someone know, notify, apprise, advise, announce to, impart to, communicate to.

943. in·for·mal 非正式的 ## 2

[ɪn’fɔːrml]adj.非正式的；不拘形式的

  • They invariably live nearby and are always available for an informal chat or an evening’s entertainment. 他们都住在附近，并随时可以聊天或在晚上一起娱乐。
  • Over the years, one may well become an authority on one’s hobby and will very probably be asked to give informal talks to little gatherings and then, if successful, to larger audiences. 多年来，一个可能成为自己这种爱好的权威，很可能被要求在小型集会上作非正式的会谈，然后，如果成功，为更多受众群体。

SEE> for·mal 正式, dis·cus·sion 讨论, gath·er·ing

ODE> Having a relaxed, friendly, or unofficial style, manner, or nature. – casual, relaxed, easy-going, natural, unceremonious, unofficial, non-formal, unstudied, unaffected.

944. in·for·ma·tion 信息 ## 8

[ˌɪnfər’meɪʃn]n.信息；情报；资料；通知

  • From this the captain was able to piece together all the information that had come to light. 据此，船长能够拼凑所有的那些已经对光线的信息。
  • Films, videos, CDs and CD-ROMs are just some of the bewildering amount of information they will have. 电影，录像，光盘和CD-ROM都只是一些他们将有信息的扑朔迷离量。
  • Both the police and the workmen were grateful to the student for this piece of advance information. 无论是警察与工人都感谢那个学生事先通报。

SEE> pro·vide 提供, knowl·edge 知识, da·ta 数据

ODE> Facts provided or learned about something or someone. – details, particulars, facts, figures, statistics, data.

945. ink 墨水 ## 2

[ɪŋk]n.墨水；墨汁

  • No matter how hard I tried, it was impossible to fill this beautiful pen with ink and to this day it has never written a single word! 无论怎么说我试过了，这是不可能填补这个漂亮的钢笔墨水，并到今天它也没写过一个字！
  • But as the paper moved from side to side under the pen point, its movement would be recorded in ink upon its surface. 但是，随着从纸侧的笔尖下移动到侧，它的运动将在其表面记录在墨水。

SEE> pen·cil 铅笔, pa·per 纸, sup·pos·ed·ly

ODE> A coloured fluid or paste used for writing, drawing, printing, or duplicating. – intoxicated, inebriated, drunken, befuddled, incapable, tipsy, the worse for drink, under the influence, maudlin.

946. in·sect 昆虫 ## 16

[’ɪnsekt]n.昆虫；虫子；卑微的人

  • We have been brought up to fear insects. 我们一直从小就害怕昆虫。
  • We live in dread not only of unpleasant insects like spiders or wasps, but of quite harmless ones like moths. 我们生活在一个既类令人讨厌的昆虫如蜘蛛，黄蜂恐惧，但并无大害的飞蛾等。
  • At the same time, however, insects are strangely fascinating. 与此同时，然而，昆虫又是迷人的。

SEE> mos·qui·to , rep·tile , prey

ODE> A small arthropod animal that has six legs and generally one or two pairs of wings. –

947. in·side 内 ## 7

[ˌɪn’saɪd]adj.里面的adv.在里面n.内部prep.在 … 里面

  • When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield. 当飞机到达时，一些侦探在主楼内等待而其他人则守候在停机坪上。
  • When it grew dark, she turned a suitcase into a bed and put the children inside it, covering them with all the clothes she could find. 天黑下来的时候，她把提箱当作小床，把两个孩子放里面，涵盖了他们所有的衣服，她能找到。
  • This god which has the head of a cow was normally placed inside a mummy. 这个神其具有一头牛的头部通常被放在木乃伊内部。

SEE> out·side 外面, where 哪里, un·der·neath 下

ODE> The inner side or surface of something. – interior, inner part, inner side, inner surface.

948. in·sist 坚持 ## 3

[ɪn’sɪst]vt.坚持；坚决主张vi.坚持；强调

  • No matter how busy you are, he always insists on coming with you. 不管你多忙，他总是坚持要跟你去。
  • Even though the noble was expected to read the letter at each performance, he always insisted that it should be written out in full. 尽管那个贵族预计将在阅读每场信中，他一直坚持应该在全写出来。
  • He insisted on the assistant’s counting the money before he left – 30,000 pennies in all! 他坚持要店员的他离开前数钱 - 共有30,000便士！

SEE> ar·gue 争论, a·gree 同意, ac·knowl·edge 确认

ODE> Demand something forcefully, not accepting refusal. – stand firm, be firm, stand one’s ground, make a stand, stand up for oneself, be resolute, be determined, show determination, hold on, hold out, be emphatic, not take no for an answer, brook no refusal.

949. in·stance 例子 ## 14

[’ɪnstəns]n.例子；场合；情况；要求；诉讼程序vt.举例说明

  • If you lived in the Mediterranean, for instance, you would consider octopus a great delicacy. 如果你住在地中海地区，比如，你会考虑章鱼是一种美味。
  • A Frenchman, for instance, might find it hard to laugh at a Russian joke. 一个法国人，例如，可能会发现很难在俄罗斯的笑话发笑。
  • There are rare instances when justice almost ceases to be an abstract concept. 在极少数情况下，正义不再是一个抽象的概念。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, more·o·ver 此外, like·wise

ODE> An example or single occurrence of something. – example, occasion, occurrence, case, representative case, typical case, case in point, illustration, specimen, sample, exemplar, exemplification.

950. in·stead 代替 ## 8

[ɪn’sted]adv.代替；反而

  • Have a biscuit instead. 有饼干代替。
  • It means I can have tea, instead. 这意味着我可以喝茶了。
  • Instead of catching fish, they catch old boots and rubbish. 相反捕的鱼，他们抓住旧靴子和垃圾。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, sim·ply 只是, ei·ther 任何一个

ODE> As an alternative or substitute. – as an alternative, as a substitute, as a replacement, in lieu, alternatively.

951. in·sti·tute 机构 ## 2

[’ɪnstɪtuːt]n.学院；学会；协会vt.开始；制定；创立

  • Vera’s curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives, and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic. 维拉的好奇人才被带到一个科研单位在乌里扬诺夫斯克镇的通知，她家附近，并在4月，她被俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对一系列的测试。
  • Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh. 米德 - 集成电路的一位先驱，加州技术学院的计算机科学教授，注意到，现在的工作站，使工程师可以设计，试验和生产芯片在他们的办公桌，就像一位编辑器上创建一个简讯在Macintosh。

SEE> re·search 研究, stud·y 研究, in·sti·tu·tion 机构

ODE> An organization having a particular purpose, especially one that is involved with science, education, or a specific profession. – organization, establishment, institution, foundation, centre.

952. in·sti·tu·tion 机构 ## 3

[ˌɪnstɪ’tuːʃn]n.制定；制度；机构；名流

  • Convinced of the importance of education, modern states ‘invest’ in institutions of learning to get back ‘interest’ in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders. 深信教育的重要性，现代国家在机构投资，学习，取回一大群开明青年男女谁是潜在的领导人形式的“兴趣”的。
  • He sees it edited by a definite set of customs and institutions and ways of thinking. 他把它编辑一个受特定的风俗习惯，制度和思维方式。
  • It was necessary to recognize that these institutions which are based on the same premises, let us say the supernatural, must be considered together, our own among the rest. 这是必须认识到，这些机构是基于相同的前提下，让我们说是超自然的，必须放在一起加以考虑，我们自己之间的休息。

SEE> es·tab·lish·ment , more·o·ver 此外, fur·ther·more

ODE> An organization founded for a religious, educational, professional, or social purpose. – organization, establishment, institute, foundation, centre.

953. in·struc·tion 指令 ## 4

[ɪn’strʌkʃn]n.指令；教学；教诲；说明

  • She withdrew ￡1000 from her bank and followed the kidnapper’s instructions. 她从银行取出£1000，随后绑架者的要求。
  • The bank must obey its customer’s instructions, and not those of anyone else. 银行必须服从客户的指示，而不是那些别人的。
  • Education, with its cycles of instruction so carefully worked out, punctuated by textbooks – those purchasable wells of wisdom – what would civilization be like without its benefits? 教育，指导其周期如此精心地安排，并以教科书 - 智慧那些购买井 - 将文明是什么样子没有它的好处是什么？

SEE> teach·ing 教学, cur·ric·u·lum , learn·ing

ODE> A direction or order. – order, command, directive, direction, decree, edict, injunction, mandate, dictate, commandment, diktat, demand, bidding, requirement, stipulation, charge, ruling, mandate, pronouncement.

954. in·stru·ment 仪器 ## 10

[’ɪnstrəmənt]n.仪器；乐器；工具；器械v.用器械（或仪器）装备；向…提交文书

  • We have an old musical instrument. 我们有一个古老的乐器。
  • The instrument was bought by my grandfather many years ago. 该仪器是我祖父在很多年以前买的。
  • His telescopic observations are justly immortal; they aroused great interest at the time, they had important theoretical consequences, and they provided a striking demonstration of the potentialities hidden in instruments and apparatus. 他的望远镜的观察结果当然是不朽;他们在当时引起了极大的兴趣，具有重要的理论意义，而且提供隐藏在仪表和仪器的潜在力量的示范。

SEE> tool 工具, fur·ther·more , in·stance 例子

ODE> A tool or implement, especially one for precision work. – implement, tool, utensil, device, apparatus, contrivance, gadget, contraption, appliance, mechanism.

955. in·sur·ance 保险 ## 3

[ɪn’ʃʊrəns]n.保险；保险费；安全保障

  • Insurance companies are normally willing to insure anything. 通常保险公司愿意承保一切东西。
  • Needless to say, the bigger the risk an insurance company takes, the higher the premium you will have to pay. 不用说，更大的保险公司承担风险，较高溢价，你将不得不支付。
  • We’ll assume that you have sorted out the basics – like mortgages, pensions, insurance and access to sufficient cash reserves. 我们假设你已经基本情况弄清楚了 - 如抵押贷款，养老金，保险和获得足够的现金储备。

SEE> care 关心, ben·e·fit 益处, pen·sion 养老金

ODE> An arrangement by which a company or the state undertakes to provide a guarantee of compensation for specified loss, damage, illness, or death in return for payment of a specified premium. – assurance, indemnity, indemnification, protection, financial protection, security, surety, cover.

956. in·tel·li·gence 智力 ## 3

[ɪn’telɪdʒəns]n.智力；理解力n.情报；情报工作；情报机关

  • Although mankind has undergone no general improvement in intelligence or morality, it has made extraordinary progress in the accumulation of knowledge. 虽然人类在智力和道德上没有得到普遍提高，但在知识的积累取得了非凡的进步。
  • It has yet to reach its full size and strength, and its owner his or her full intelligence; but at this age the likelihood of death is least. 这还没有充分发挥其规模和实力，和它的主人他或她的全智能;但在这个年龄死亡的可能性最小。
  • Without something of this kind, searching for intelligences on other planets would be like trying to meet a friend in London without a pre-arranged rendezvous and absurdly wandering the streets in the hope of a chance encounter. 如果没有这样的东西，寻找其他星球上的智力生命，就如同去伦敦见一位朋友，事先未安排的地点，而荒唐徘徊在一个偶然的相遇，希望街道。

SEE> in·for·ma·tion 信息, se·cret 秘密, knowl·edge 知识

ODE> The ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills. – intellectual capacity, mental capacity, intellect, mind, brain, brains, brainpower, powers of reasoning, judgement, reason, reasoning, understanding, comprehension, acumen, wit, sense, insight, perceptiveness, perception, perspicaciousness, perspicacity, penetration, discernment, sharpness, quickness of mind, quick-wittedness, smartness, canniness, astuteness, intuition, acuity, alertness, cleverness, brilliance, aptness, ability, giftedness, talent.

957. in·tel·li·gent 智能的 ## 8

[ɪn’telɪdʒənt]adj.聪明的；智能的

  • How do you spell ‘intelligent’? 你怎么拼写“智能”？
  • Marine Studio biologists have pointed out that, however intelligent they may be, it is probably a mistake to credit dolphins with any motive of lifesaving. 海洋摄影室的生物学家指出，但是聪明的，他们可能是，它可能是一个错误的信用海豚具有救生的动机。
  • What does the ‘uniquely rational way’ for us to communicate with other intelligent beings in space depend on? 什么是“唯一合理的方法”为我们在太空中其他智慧生物交流依赖？

SEE> smart 聪明, thought·ful , clev·er 聪明

ODE> Having or showing intelligence, especially of a high level. – clever, bright, brilliant, sharp, quick, quick-witted, quick on the uptake, smart, canny, astute, intuitive, thinking, acute, alert, keen, insightful, perceptive, perspicacious, penetrating, discerning.

958. in·tend 打算 ## 7

[ɪn’tend]vt.想要；打算；意指

  • Debbie intends to take short rests every two hours. 黛比打算采取短暂休息，每两小时。
  • She will be arriving this evening and intends to stay for a few days. 她将于今天傍晚到达，并准备住上几天。
  • They intend to bring the men up in a special capsule. 他们打算把男人了一种特制的容器。

SEE> hes·i·tate 犹豫, in·sist 坚持, want 想要

ODE> Have (a course of action) as one’s purpose or intention; plan. – plan, mean, have every intention, have the intention, have in mind, have in view, have plans, aim, propose, aspire, hope, expect, be looking, be going, be resolved, have resolved, be determined, have set out, purpose, be plotting.

959. in·ter·est 兴趣 ## 16

[’ɪntrəst]n.兴趣；嗜好；利息；股份v.使…感兴趣

  • Even people who take no interest in art cannot have failed to notice examples of modern sculpture on display in public places. 即使谁对艺术不感兴趣的人也不会在公共场所都未能现代雕塑的通知例子展出。
  • Kidnappers are rarely interested in animals, but they recently took considerable interest in Mrs. Eleanor Ramsay’s cat. 绑架者很少对动物感兴趣，但他们最近参加了拉姆齐太太的猫相当大的兴趣。
  • Nothing of value was found, but the numerous items which were brought to the surface proved to be of great interest. 什么值钱的东西被发现，但打捞出来的众多的物品被证明是极大的兴趣。

SEE> con·cern 与有关, raise 举起, con·cerned 关心的

ODE> The feeling of wanting to know or learn about something or someone. – attentiveness, undivided attention, absorption, engrossment, heed, regard, notice, scrutiny.

960. in·ter·est·ed 感兴趣 ## 3

[’ɪntrəstɪd]adj.感兴趣的；有利害关系的

  • I’m not really interested in fishing. 我没有真正的兴趣在钓鱼。
  • I am only interested in sitting in a boat and doing nothing at all! 我只坐在船上，并在所有无所事事感兴趣！
  • Kidnappers are rarely interested in animals, but they recently took considerable interest in Mrs. Eleanor Ramsay’s cat. 绑架者很少对动物感兴趣，但他们最近参加了拉姆齐太太的猫相当大的兴趣。

SEE> con·cerned 关心的, be·sides , in·volved 参与

ODE> Showing curiosity or concern about something or someone; having a feeling of interest. – attentive, intent, focused, absorbed, engrossed, fascinated, riveted, gripped, captivated, rapt, agog, intrigued, inquiring, inquisitive, curious, burning with curiosity.

961. in·ter·est·ing 有趣 ## 11

[’ɪntrəstɪŋ]adj.有趣的；引人入胜的

  • Our climate is not very good, but it’s certainly interesting. 我们的气候不是很好，但它肯定有意思。
  • At the moment, he’s reading an interesting book. 目前，他正在读有趣的书。
  • The play was very interesting. 戏很有意思。

SEE> in·tri·guing , fas·ci·nat·ing , ex·cit·ing 令人兴奋的

ODE> Arousing curiosity or interest; holding or catching the attention. – absorbing, engrossing, fascinating, riveting, gripping, compelling, compulsive, spellbinding, captivating, engaging, enthralling, entrancing, beguiling.

962. in·ter·na·tion·al 国际 ## 5

[ˌɪntər’næʃnəl]adj.国际的；世界性的n.国际比赛

  • How does the writer describe sport at the international level? 这位作者如何在国际层面上描述的运动吗？
  • Even if one didn’t know from concrete examples (the 1936 Olympic Games, for instance) that international sporting contests lead to orgies of hatred, one could deduce it from general principles. 一个人即使不能从具体的事例（如1936年奥林匹克运动会）了解到国际运动比赛会导致疯狂的仇恨知道，人们可以从一般的原则推断出这一点。
  • At the international level, sport is frankly mimic warfare. 在国际比赛中，体育是一场模拟战争。

SEE> glob·al 全球的, which 哪一个, well 好

ODE> Existing, occurring, or carried on between nations. – global, worldwide, intercontinental.

963. in·ter·rupt 打断 ## 5

[ˌɪntə’rʌpt]v.打断；打扰；中断；阻碍n.[计算机]中断

  • ‘Don’t interrupt,’ he said. “不要打断我，”他说。
  • He started to complain about this wicked world but was interrupted by a knock at the door. 他开始抱怨世道不好，但却被敲门声打断了。
  • ’Excuse my interrupting you. “请原谅我打断你。

SEE> in·ter·fere , when·ev·er 每当, like·wise

ODE> Stop the continuous progress of (an activity or process) – cut in, cut in on, break in, break in on, barge in, barge in on, intrude, intrude on, interfere, interfere with, intervene, intervene in.

964. in·ter·rup·tion 中断 ## 2

[ˌɪntə’rʌpʃn]n.打岔；中断

  • What two interruptions did the writer have? 没有作家有哪两种中断？
  • Each day is a holiday, and ordinary holidays, when they come, are grudged as enforced interruptions in an absorbing vocation. 每天都是假日，而通常的假期，当他们来，都抱怨自己有趣的吸收假期强制打断。

SEE> dis·rup·tion , con·se·quence 后果, con·tin·u·al

ODE> The action of interrupting or being interrupted. – cutting in, interference, intervention, intrusion, obtrusion, disturbance.

965. in·ter·val 间隔 ## 4

[’ɪntərvl]n.间隔；休息时间；(数学)区间；(音乐)音程

  • A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom, and by measuring the time interval between the taps and the receipt of the echoes, the depth of the sea at that point can be calculated. 通过敲击一个船体发出的声音将被反射从海底，并通过测量抽头和接收回波之间的时间间隔，海的在该点的深度可以计算出来。
  • But suppose the earth could be covered with sensors spaced one foot apart, rising at one-foot intervals all the way to the top of the atmosphere. 假设地球上可以布满传感器，每个相隔1英尺，并按1英尺的间隔一路上升到大气层的顶端。
  • When the instrument is situated at more than 700 miles from the earthquake centre, the graphic record shows three waves arriving one after the other at short intervals. 当仪器从地震中心位于700多英里远，图形记录显示三个波到达短的时间间隔一个接一个。

SEE> like·wise , fur·ther·more , hence 因此

ODE> An intervening time. – interim, interlude, intervening time, intervening period, meantime, meanwhile.

966. in·ter·view 面谈 ## 2

[’ɪntərvjuː]n.面谈；会见；面试；接见vt.接见；采访；对 … 进行面试vi.面试；采访

  • Reporters kept pressing for interviews so lawyers had to be employed to act as spokesmen for the family at press conferences. 记者纷纷要求会见，律师不得不被用来充当代言人的家人在记者招待会上。
  • But neither psychiatric interviews nor objective tests were able to show any effects upon these American sailors. 但无论是精神病学的调查访问，还是进行客观的测试，都不能显示对这些美国水兵有任何影响。

SEE> say·ing , af·ter·ward , talk 谈论

ODE> A meeting of people face to face, especially for consultation. – meeting, discussion, conference, question and answer session, examination, evaluation, interrogation.

967. in·to 进入 ## 143

[’ɪntə]prep.到 … 里；进入；朝；除；对…有兴趣

  • Are the children coming out of the park or going into it? 是孩子们走出园或进入呢？
  • Some of them are going into the park. 他们中有几个正走进公园。
  • Then he put his hand into his pocket, and took out a phrasebook. 然后，他把他的手伸进口袋，掏出了一本常用语。

SEE> then 然后, out 出, turn 转动

ODE> Expressing movement or action with the result that someone or something becomes enclosed or surrounded by something else. – infatuated with, besotted with, smitten with, in love with, head over heels in love with, hopelessly in love with, obsessed with, enamoured of, very attracted to, very taken with, devoted to, charmed by, captivated by, enchanted by, enthralled by, bewitched by, beguiled by, under someone’s spell.

968. in·tro·duce 介绍 ## 6

[ˌɪntrə’duːs]vt.介绍；引进；采用；提出；提倡；放入

  • Let me introduce him to you. 让我把他介绍给你。
  • Then she introduced us to Carlos and told us they would get married next week.’ 然后她把我们介绍给卡洛斯，并告诉我们说他们下星期结婚。”
  • The use of gloves was not introduced until 1860, when the Marquis of Queensberry drew up the first set of rules. 使用手套并没有出台，直到1860年，昆斯伯里侯爵制定了第一套规则。

SEE> in·tro·duc·tion 介绍, in·cor·po·rate , pro·pose 提议

ODE> Bring (something, especially a product, measure, or concept) into use or operation for the first time. – institute, initiate, launch, inaugurate, establish, found, instigate, put in place.

969. in·vent 发明 ## 6

[ɪn’vent]vt.发明；捏造

  • A new machine called ‘The Revealer’ has been invented and it has been used to detect gold which has been buried in the ground. 一种叫“探宝器”的新机器已经发明，它已被用于检测已埋在地下的黄金。
  • He would invent fanciful names on the spot. 他会当场想出些稀奇古怪的名字。
  • From then on, Harry decided that this little game he had invented might prove to be expensive. 从那时起，哈里决定，这他发明的小游戏可能被证明是昂贵的。

SEE> pre·tend 假装, rec·re·ate , en·vi·sion

ODE> Create or design (something that has not existed before); be the originator of. – originate, create, innovate, design, devise, contrive, formulate, develop.

970. in·ven·tion 发明 ## 3

[ɪn’venʃn]n.发明；虚构；发明物

  • To get a full appreciation of what this means we must turn first to some recent human inventions. 要获得这意味着什么，我们必须首先找一些最近的人类发明的充分理解。
  • With the invention of writing, a great advance was made, for knowledge could then be not only communicated but also stored. 随着书写的发明，一大进步作出，知识然后可以不仅能交流，而且能储存了。
  • Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law, which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing. 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育反过来其添加到库：知识的增长遵循着一种复利法，这得到了印刷术的发明增强。

SEE> in·ven·tor , i·ron·i·cal·ly , in·vent 发明

ODE> The action of inventing something, typically a process or device. – origination, creation, innovation, devising, contriving, contrivance, formulation, development, design.

971. in·vest 投资 ## 3

[ɪn’vest]v.投资；投入

  • If we glimpse the unutterable, it is unwise to try to utter it, nor should we seek to invest with significance that which we cannot grasp. 如果我瞥见了难言，这是不明智的乱说吧，我们也不应该去与这是我们无法把握的意义进行投资。
  • Convinced of the importance of education, modern states ‘invest’ in institutions of learning to get back ‘interest’ in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders. 深信教育的重要性，现代国家在机构投资，学习，取回一大群开明青年男女谁是潜在的领导人形式的“兴趣”的。
  • As administrative overheads rise, so the earnings of the business after meeting the expense of administration, will fall; and the business will have less money to distribute as dividends or invest directly in its future progress and development. 管理费用增加了，所以企业的会议管理费用后的收益将下降;而企业只能以较少的钱作为红利分配或直接在其未来的进步和发展的投资。

SEE> spend 花费, in·vest·ment 投资, ven·ture 冒险

ODE> Put (money) into financial schemes, shares, property, or a commercial venture with the expectation of achieving a profit. – put money into, sink money into, lay out money on, plough money into.

972. in·ves·ti·gate 调查 ## 5

[ɪn’vestɪɡeɪt]v.调查；研究

  • However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the Zoo felt obliged to investigate, for the descriptions given by people who claimed to have seen the puma were extraordinarily similar. 然而，随着证据越来越多，动物园的专家们感到有必要调查，通过谁声称见到过美洲狮的人们所描述的情况竟是出奇地相似。
  • A parliamentary committee representing all political parties appoints a person who is suitably qualified to investigate private grievances against the State. 代表各政党利益的议会委员会任命谁称职的人选来调查个人对国家的不满的人。
  • He investigates complaints large and small that come to him from all levels of society. 他研究大，小抱怨，来找他从社会的各个层面。

SEE> ex·am·ine 检查, in·ves·ti·ga·tion 调查, in·quir·y

ODE> Carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts of (an incident, allegation, etc.) so as to establish the truth. – inquire into, look into, go into, look over, probe, explore, scrutinize, conduct an investigation into, conduct an inquiry into, make inquiries about, try to get to the bottom of.

973. in·ves·ti·ga·tion 调查 ## 2

[ɪnˌvestɪ’ɡeɪʃn]n.调查

  • Many people in industry and the Services, who have practical experience of noise, regard any investigation of this question as a waste of time; they are not prepared even to admit the possibility that noise affects people. 许多人在工业和服务，谁都有噪音的实践经验，认为对这个问题是浪费时间的任何调查;他们不准备甚至承认噪音可能对人有影响。
  • The inner workings of our own brains we feel to be uniquely worthy of investigation, but custom, we have a way of thinking, is behaviour at its most commonplace. 我们觉得我们自己的大脑内部的活动情况才值得研究，但定制，我们有一种思维方式，是在其最司空见惯的行为。

SEE> in·quir·y , in·ves·ti·gate 调查, case 箱子

ODE> The action of investigating something or someone; formal or systematic examination or research. – examination, inquiry, study, inspection, exploration, consideration, analysis, appraisal.

974. in·vest·ment 投资 ## 6

[ɪn’vestmənt]n.投资；投资额；投入

  • How does the older investor differ in his approach to investment from the younger investor? 如何老投资者对他的做法有所不同，从年轻的投资者的投资？
  • The serious investor needs a proper ‘portfolio’ – a well-planned selection of investments, with a definite structure and a clear aim. 认真的投资者需要一份正规的投资组合表 - 投资的一个精心策划的选择，具有一定的结构和明确的目标。
  • Well, if you go to five reputable stock brokers and ask them what you should do with your money, you’re likely to get five different answers, – even if you give all the relevant information about your age, family, finances and what you want from your investments. 好吧，如果你去到五个信誉的股票经纪人咨询，询问你应该如何使用你的资金，你可能得到5个不同的答案， - 即使你提供了有关于你的年龄，家庭，财源和什么相关信息你想从投资。

SEE> in·vest 投资, fund 基金, as·set

ODE> The action or process of investing money for profit. – investing, speculation.

975. in·vite 邀请 ## 8

[ɪn’vaɪt]vt.邀请；请求；招致；招待

  • Carol and Tom invited us to lunch. 卡罗尔和汤姆请我们来吃午饭。
  • She invited Charlotte and me to dinner this evening. 她今晚邀请我和夏洛特去吃饭。
  • Last week, my four-year-old daughter, Sally, was invited to a children’s party. 上周，我4岁的女儿萨莉被邀请去参加一个儿童聚会。

SEE> ask 问, in·vi·ta·tion 请帖, par·tic·i·pate

ODE> Make a polite, formal, or friendly request to (someone) to go somewhere or to do something. – ask, bid, summon.

976. in·volve 包含 ## 3

[ɪn’vɑːlv]vt.包含；使忙于；牵涉；使卷入；使陷入

  • For them this is a major operation which involves considerable planning. 对他们来说，这是一个涉及到大量的规划的主要操作。
  • On the village green, where you pick up sides and no feeling of local patriotism is involved, it is possible to play simply for the fun and exercise: but as soon as a the question of prestige arises, as soon as you feel that you and some larger unit will be disgraced if you lose, the most savage combative instincts are aroused. 在乡间的草坪上，当你拿起两侧，没有当地的爱国主义情绪受影响，则可以简单地为了娱乐和锻炼：你觉得，但只要威信的问题是，一旦你和如果你失去了一些大的单位将被蒙羞，最野蛮的好斗本能就会激发出来。
  • That is perhaps why sculpture has been described as the most difficult of all arts; certainly it is more difficult than the arts which involve appreciation of flat forms, shape in only two dimensions. 这也许就是为什么雕塑已被形容为最困难的艺术;当然它比其中涉及的平坦形式升值艺术更加困难，塑造只有两个维度。

SEE> in·volved 参与, be·sides , in·stance 例子

ODE> Have or include (something) as a necessary or integral part or result. – require, necessitate, demand, call for.

977. i·ron 铁 ## 2

[’aɪərn]n.熨斗；铁；刚强(复）irons: 镣铐.v.熨；烫adj.铁的；刚强的

  • The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass. 水晶宫是从世界上所有的其他建筑，因为它是用钢和玻璃。
  • One man stayed at the wheel while two others with black stockings over their faces jumped out and smashed the window of the shop with iron bars. 一人留在驾驶座上，另外两个用黑色长筒丝袜他们的脸跳了出来，砸坏用铁棒在商店的橱窗。

SEE> steel 钢, met·al 金属, cop·per

ODE> A strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, the chemical element of atomic number 26, much used as a material for construction and manufacturing, especially in the form of steel. – made of iron.

978. is·land 岛 ## 16

[’aɪlənd]n.岛；岛屿；岛状物

  • The man wanted to fly to Rockall, a lonely island in the Atlantic Ocean, but Captain Fawcett did not take him because the trip was too dangerous. 这个人想要飞往罗卡尔，在大西洋上的一个孤岛，但福塞特上尉没有走他，因为行程太危险了。
  • In 1963 a Lancaster bomber crashed on Wallis Island, a remote place in the South Pacific, a long way west of Samoa. 1963年兰开斯特轰炸机坠毁在委内瑞拉岛，在南太平洋一个偏远的地方，萨摩亚的一个很长的路以西。
  • Then in 1989, twenty-six years after the crash, the plane was accidentally rediscovered in an aerial survey of the island. 然后，在1989年，崩溃26年后，飞机却意外地在海岛的航测重新发现。

SEE> coast 海岸, shore , o·cean 海洋

ODE> A piece of land surrounded by water. – isle, islet.

979. it 它 ## 895

[ɪt]pron.它

  • Whose handbag is it? 是谁的手袋？
  • Yes, it is. 是的。
  • No, it isn’t. 不，事实并非如此。

SEE> IT , but 但是, this 这个

ODE> Used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified. –

980. i·tem 条目 ## 5

[’aɪtəm]n.项目；条款；一件商品（或物品）；一则或一条新闻adv.也

  • Nothing of value was found, but the numerous items which were brought to the surface proved to be of great interest. 什么值钱的东西被发现，但打捞出来的众多的物品被证明是极大的兴趣。
  • All the items that were found were sent to the War Museum. 所有被发现的物品被送往军事博物馆。
  • Country people run wild when they go shopping in the city and stagger home loaded with as many of the exotic items as they can carry. 国家的人，当他们在城市和错开回家装载尽可能多的外来商品，他们可以携带逛街撒野。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·cep·tion 例外, par·tic·u·lar 特定的

ODE> An individual article or unit, especially one that is part of a list, collection, or set. – thing, article, object, unit, module, artefact, piece, commodity, product, bit.

981. its 它的 ## 106

[ɪts]pron.（it的所有格)它的

  • The stream wound its way across the field and then flowed right under their tent! 那小溪弯弯曲曲穿过田野，然后右键他们的帐篷底下流！
  • The winning car reached a speed of forty miles an hour – much faster than any of its rivals. 获胜的那辆车达到了每小时四十英里的速度 - 比任何竞争对手的要快得多。
  • It sped downhill at the end of the race and its driver had a lot of trouble trying to stop it. 它下坡加速在比赛结束及其驱动程序有很多试图阻止它的麻烦。

SEE> the 该, which 哪一个, own 自己的

ODE> Belonging to or associated with a thing previously mentioned or easily identified. –

982. it·self 本身 ## 6

[ɪt’self]pron.它自己

  • The snake then wound itself round the wires. 蛇然后缠绕在电线。
  • He could hear shouting in the camp itself. 他听得军营里面的喧闹声。
  • He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself; he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight; he realizes its volume, as the space that the shape displaces in the air. 他的大脑从全面本身就是一个复杂的形式;他知道当他看着一面是什么对方等;他把自己与形体的重心，它的质量，它的重量;他意识到物体的体积，其形状在空气中所占的空间。

SEE> which 哪一个, IT , it 它

ODE> Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a thing or animal previously mentioned as the subject of the clause. –

983. jam 果酱 ## 2

[dʒæm]n.果酱n.堵塞；拥挤；困境v.塞满；挤；卡住；夹伤；干扰；猛压

  • We haven’t got much tea or coffee, and we haven’t got any sugar or jam. 我们没有得到太多茶或咖啡，而我们还没有得到任何糖和果酱。
  • Bagrit foresaw a time when computers would be small enough to hold in the hand, when they would be capable of providing information about traffic jams and suggesting alternative routes, when they would be used in hospitals to help doctors to diagnose illnesses, when they would relieve office workers and accountants of dull, repetitive clerical work. 巴格瑞特预示有一天计算机可以小到拿在手上，当他们将能够提供有关交通阻塞的信息，并建议替代路线，当他们将在医院使用，以帮助医生诊断疾病，当他们将减轻上班族的平淡会计师，重复的文职工作。

SEE> tri·o , in·stance 例子, i·ron·i·cal·ly

ODE> Squeeze or pack tightly into a specified space. – stuff, shove, force, ram, thrust, wedge, press, push, stick, squeeze, compress, confine, cram, pack, sandwich, insert.

984. jew·el·ler·y 首饰 ## 3

[’dʒuːəlri]n.=jewelry （总称）珠宝；首饰

  • Mr. Taylor, the owner of a jewellery shop was admiring a new window display. 泰勒先生，珠宝店的老板正在欣赏新布置的橱窗。
  • When a thief was caught on the premises of a large jewellery store one morning, the shop assistants must have found it impossible to resist the temptation to say ‘it serves him right’. 当一个小偷在一家大型珠宝店里一上午被人抓住时，店员一定会发现无法抗拒的诱惑，说“他罪有应得”。
  • There was no trace of fingerprints, but the inspector found a dirty red bundle that contained jewellery which the old lady said was not hers. 有没有指纹痕迹，却发现了一个装有珠宝的老妇人说那不是她的肮脏的红包袱。

ODE> Personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets, that are typically made from or contain jewels and precious metal. – jewels, gems, gemstones, precious stones, semi-precious stones, bijouterie.

985. job 工作 ## 22

[dʒɑːb]n.工作；职业；职位；(一项)任务；活儿；职责；犯罪行为；物件

  • What is Rober’s job? 什么是罗伯特的工作？
  • What’s your job? 你的工作是什么？
  • What’s your job? 你的工作是什么？

SEE> work·ing 工作, work 工作, bet·ter 更好

ODE> A paid position of regular employment. – position of employment, position, post, situation, place, appointment, posting, placement, day job.

986. join 连接 ## 4

[dʒɔɪn]v.连接；加入；参与；和…一起

  • The Verrazano Bridge, which was designed by Othmar Ammann, joins Brooklyn to Staten Island. 维拉萨诺大桥由奥斯马。阿曼设计，连结着布鲁克林与斯塔顿岛。
  • He had been obliged to join the army during the Second World War. 他曾被迫在二战期间参军。
  • From an attic window we could get a sweeping view of the river where their land joined ours, and at the most critical juncture we took turns in watching that point. 从阁楼的窗口，我们可以得到他们的土地与我们的，在最关键的时刻，我们轮流监视那段河流一览无余。

SEE> par·tic·i·pate , soon 不久, in·vite 邀请

ODE> Link; connect. – connect, unite, fix, affix, attach, add, annex, fasten, stick, glue, fuse, knit, weld, amalgamate, consolidate, combine, bond, append, link, bridge, secure, lock, make fast, tie, bind, string, lash, couple, marry, pair, yoke, team, chain, merge, dovetail, splice, blend.

987. joke 玩笑 ## 16

[dʒoʊk]n.笑话；玩笑v.说笑话；开玩笑

  • She’s only joking. 她只是在开玩笑。
  • What was the joke? 什么是笑话？
  • Who made the only funny joke that evening and why? 谁做出的唯一有趣的笑话，当天晚上，为什么？

SEE> laugh 笑, sort 种类, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> A thing that someone says to cause amusement or laughter, especially a story with a funny punchline. – funny story, jest, witticism, quip, pleasantry.

988. jour·nal·ist 记者 ## 7

[’dʒɜːrnəlɪst]n.记者；新闻工作者

  • Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president’s palace in a new African republic. 去年，一位记者受一家知名杂志写在总统府的一篇文章中一个新的中非共和国。
  • The editor at once sent the journalist a fax instructing him to find out the exact number of steps and the height of the wall. 立即给那位记者发去传真，要求他的编辑器来找出台阶的确切数字和围墙的高度。
  • The journalist immediately set out to obtain these important facts, but he took a long time to send them. 记者立即出发去核实这些重要的事实，但他花了很长时间给他们。

SEE> re·port·er , pho·tog·ra·pher 摄影师, writ·er 作家

ODE> A person who writes for newspapers, magazines, or news websites or prepares news to be broadcast. – reporter, correspondent, newsman, newswoman, newspaperman, newspaperwoman, columnist, writer, commentator, reviewer, blogger.

989. jour·ney 旅程 ## 20

[’dʒɜːrni]n.旅程；旅行；行程v.旅行

  • Neither of us spoke during the journey. 无论我们的旅程中发言。
  • As they are expected to be hungry after their long journey, food is laid out for them. 因为预料到是他们经过长途跋涉后感到饥饿，因此给他们准备了。
  • Thousands of lanterns slowly drift out to sea guiding the dead on their return journey to the other world. 成千上万只灯笼慢慢漂向大海，指引在回来的路上死去的另一个世界。

SEE> trip 旅行, voy·age , quest

ODE> An act of travelling from one place to another. – trip, expedition, period of travelling, tour, trek, voyage, cruise, safari, ride, drive, transfer.

990. joy 喜悦 ## 2

[dʒɔɪ]n.欢乐；喜悦；乐趣；[大写] 乔伊(女子名)v.高兴；喜悦

  • It provides relaxation for leisure hours, as just looking at one’s treasures is always a joy. 它可以使人在闲暇中得到休息，因为欣赏自己收藏的珍品总会充满了乐趣。
  • But in an old man who has known human joys and sorrows, and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do, the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble. 但是，在一个老人谁知道人的悲欢离合，并都经历过了，自己做的，死亡的恐惧是有些可怜且可耻。

SEE> de·light 喜悦, hap·pi·ness 幸福, ex·cite·ment 激动

ODE> A feeling of great pleasure and happiness. – delight, great pleasure, joyfulness, jubilation, triumph, exultation, rejoicing, happiness, gladness, glee, exhilaration, ebullience, exuberance, elation, euphoria, bliss, ecstasy, transports of delight, rapture, radiance.

991. judge 判断 ## 3

[dʒʌdʒ]n.法官；裁判v.断定；判断；审判

  • The following example of ‘sick humour’ will enable you to judge for yourself. “病态幽默”的下面的例子将让你自己判断。
  • The child learning to see, first distinguishes only two-dimensional shape; it cannot judge distances, depths. 孩子学习，看，起初只会分辨二维形状;它不能判断距离和深度。
  • Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly three-dimensonal distances. 后来，由于自身安全和实际需要，就必须发展（部分通过触觉）粗略判断三dimensonal距离的能力。

SEE> court 法庭, su·preme , case 箱子

ODE> A public officer appointed to decide cases in a law court. – justice, magistrate, Her Honour, His Honour, Your Honour.

992. jump 跳 ## 7

[dʒʌmp]n.跳跃；跳动；上涨v.跳越；暴涨

  • Towards evening, the boat struck a rock and the girl jumped into the sea. 到了傍晚，船触礁女孩跳入海中。
  • Then, jumping into the car, he drove off as quickly as he could. 然后，跳进车里，他以最快的速度把车开走。
  • One man stayed at the wheel while two others with black stockings over their faces jumped out and smashed the window of the shop with iron bars. 一人留在驾驶座上，另外两个用黑色长筒丝袜他们的脸跳了出来，砸坏用铁棒在商店的橱窗。

SEE> leap , drop 掉落, fall 下落

ODE> Push oneself off a surface and into the air by using the muscles in one’s legs and feet. – leap, spring, bound, hop, bounce.

993. just 刚刚 ## 72

[dʒʌst]adv.刚才；仅仅；正好；正是；简直adj.公平的；公正的；适当的；精确的

  • Five other cars were just behind him. 其他5辆汽车跟在他后面。
  • I’ve just had a cup, thank you. 我刚喝了一杯，谢谢。
  • Have you just been to the cinema? 你刚去过电影院吗？

SEE> but 但是, so 所以, IT

ODE> Based on or behaving according to what is morally right and fair. – fair, fair-minded, equitable, even-handed, impartial, unbiased, objective, neutral, disinterested, unprejudiced, open-minded, non-partisan, non-discriminatory, anti-discrimination.

994. jus·tice 正义 ## 8

[’dʒʌstɪs]n.公平；公正；正义；司法；法官；法律制裁

  • The word ‘justice’ is given two different meanings in the text. 这个词“正义”被赋予在文本两种不同的含义。
  • The word justice is usually associated with courts of law. 字义通常与法庭连在一起的。
  • We might say that justice has been done when a man’s innocence or guilt has been proved beyond doubt. 我们可以说，当一个人的无罪或有罪已被证明毫无疑问正义得到了伸张。

SEE> su·preme , crim·i·nal 刑事, case 箱子

ODE> Just behaviour or treatment. – fairness, justness, fair play, fair-mindedness, equity, equitableness, even-handedness, egalitarianism, impartiality, impartialness, lack of bias, objectivity, neutrality, disinterestedness, lack of prejudice, open-mindedness, non-partisanship.

995. jus·ti·fied 合理 ## 2

[’dʒʌstɪfaɪd]adj.合理的；合法化的

  • If a citizen’s complaint is justified, the Ombudsman will act on his behalf. 如果公民的意见正确，司法特派员便为他伸张正义。
  • There was nothing in the record to show that the foreigner’s complaint was justified and the Chief of Police strongly denied the accusation. 材料中没有任何文字记载证明外国人的情况符合事实，警察局长矢口否认这一指控。

SEE> jus·ti·fy 辩解, jus·ti·fi·ca·tion , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Having, done for, or marked by a good or legitimate reason. – valid, sound, well founded, well grounded, justified, justifiable, warranted, warrantable, defensible, defendable, legitimate, reasonable, logical.

996. keen 热切 ## 2

[kiːn]adj.敏锐的；强烈的；锋利的；热衷的；精明的

  • Some really keen enthusiasts go so far as to build their own computers. 有些热衷于走那么远，以建立自己的计算机。
  • The long hours in the office or the factory bring with them as their reward, not only the means of sustenance, but a keen appetite for pleasure even in its simplest and most modest forms. 在办公室或工厂给他们带来了酬劳，这不仅是谋生的手段的时间很长，但很高兴，即使在其最简单最朴实的形式产生了浓厚兴趣。

SEE> ea·ger , in·ter·est·ed 感兴趣, nev·er·the·less 然而

ODE> Having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm. – eager, anxious, impatient, determined, desirous, longing, wishing, itching, dying, yearning, ambitious, ready.

997. keep 保持 ## 53

[kiːp]v.保持；保留；继续；贮藏；经营；遵守；供给；照管；饲养；耽搁；保持食物不变质；健康状况如何；保守（秘密@）；记录；遵守；保护n.生计；保存；城堡主楼；监狱；围墙

  • He can get up for about two hours each day, but you must keep the room warm. 他可以起床，每天约两个小时，但您必须保持房间温暖。
  • How are you all keeping? 你怎么样都好吗？
  • Visitors have been asked to keep the woods clean and tidy. 游客已被告知要保持树林的整洁。

SEE> sure 当然, stay 停留, put 放

ODE> Have or retain possession of. – retain, hold on to, keep for oneself, retain possession of, keep possession of, retain in one’s possession, keep hold of, not part with, hold fast to, hold back.

998. key 钥匙 ## 11

[kiː]n.键；关键；钥匙；答案adj.关键的；主要的vt.键入；用钥匙锁上；为 … 调音

  • Does Jill take the key to the front door? 吉尔有没有带钥匙的前门？
  • Can I have the key to the front door, please? 我能有钥匙前门吗？
  • Give her the key. 把钥匙给她。

SEE> cru·cial 关键, im·por·tant 重要, vi·tal 重要

ODE> A small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock, which is inserted into a lock and turned to open or close it. – answer, clue, solution, explanation, pointer, cue, lead.
