1000. kick 踢 ## 2

[kɪk]v.踢；反冲n.踢；反冲；后座力

  • Suddenly, one of the children kicked a ball very hard and it went towards a passing boat. 突然，一个孩子踢一个球非常艰苦，这对路过的船去了。
  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。

SEE> cor·ner 角落, mi·nute 分钟, ball 球

ODE> Strike or propel forcibly with the foot. – boot, punt, strike with the foot.

1001. kill 杀 ## 15

[kɪl]v.杀死；终止；消灭；使痛苦；消磨；使精疲力竭n.杀；猎获物

  • ‘Mr. Eames,’ he said, in a mournful voice, ‘you have just killed that child!’ ‘先生。埃姆斯，”他说，在凄厉的声音，‘你刚刚把那个小孩压死了！’
  • When a light passenger plane flew off course some time ago, it crashed in the mountains and its pilot was killed. 当轻型客机当然前段时间飞走了，它在山区坠毁，飞行员丧生。
  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。

SEE> de·stroy 破坏, kill·ing 谋杀, shoot 射击

ODE> Cause the death of (a person, animal, or other living thing) – murder, cause the death of, end the life of, take the life of, do away with, make away with, assassinate, do to death, eliminate, terminate, dispatch, finish off, put to death, execute.

1002. kind 种类 ## 22

[kaɪnd]adj.亲切的；善良的；仁慈的；宽容的n.种类；本质

  • What kind of dress does the lady want? 什么样的装扮这位女士想要？
  • What kind of shopping does the writer enjoy, do you think? 什么样的购物确实作家享受，你觉得呢？
  • What kind of fish are they? 什么样的鱼他们是谁？

SEE> sort 种类, thing 事情, some·thing 某物

ODE> A group of people or things having similar characteristics. – sort, type, variety, style, form, class, category, genre.

1003. kind·ly 和蔼 ## 3

[’kaɪndli]adj.和蔼的；温和的；爽快的adv.温和地；亲切地

  • She put away her compact and smiled kindly. 她放好了粉盒，慈祥地微笑着。
  • We shall all remember Mr. Page for his patience and understanding and for the kindly encouragement he gave us when we went so unwillingly to school. 我们不会忘记佩奇先生对他的耐心和理解，因为他给我们的亲切鼓励我们不愿去上学。
  • We offered them food and spoke to them kindly, but they remained motionless. 我们给他们东西吃，客客气气地同他们交谈，但他们却一动也不动。

SEE> like·wise , in·var·i·a·bly , po·lite·ly 礼貌

ODE> In a kind manner. – benevolently, good-naturedly, warmly, affectionately, tenderly, lovingly, compassionately.

1004. king 国王 ## 4

[kɪŋ]n.国王；（纸牌）老Kadj.王的；重要的；基本的v.成为国王King.n.金（姓氏）；上帝；耶稣

  • They caught lobster and fish every day, and, as one of them put it ‘ate like kings’. 他们捕捉龙虾和鱼，每天，正如其中一位所说，吃得“像国王一样好”。
  • While Alfred’s little army slowly began to gather at Athelney, the king himself set out to penetrate the camp of Guthrum, the commander of the Danish invaders. 阿尔弗雷德的小军开始慢慢聚集在阿塞尔纳，国王亲自着手渗透加思拉姆的阵营，丹麦军队的指挥官。
  • The albatross is the king of the gliders, the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose, but must yield to its opposition. 信天翁是滑翔机之王，种类，其利用空气他们的目的传单的，但必须屈服于反对。

SEE> queen 女王, prince 王子, king·dom

ODE> The male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth. – ruler, sovereign, monarch, supreme ruler, crowned head, majesty, Crown, head of state, royal personage, emperor, prince, potentate, overlord, liege lord, lord, leader, chief.

1005. kitch·en 厨房 ## 6

[’kɪtʃɪn]n.厨房；灶间；(全套)炊具

  • Mrs. Smith’s kitchen is small. 史密斯夫人的厨房很小。
  • There is a refrigerator in the kitchen. 有一个在厨房的冰箱。
  • There is an electric cooker in the kitchen. 有厨房的电饭煲。

SEE> room 房间, bath·room 浴室, up·stairs 楼上

ODE> A room or area where food is prepared and cooked. – cooking area, kitchenette, kitchen-diner, galley, cookhouse, bakehouse, scullery.

1006. knock 敲 ## 10

[nɑːk]v.敲击；互撞；攻击n.敲；敲门；敲打

  • I’ll knock again, Helen. 我再敲，海伦。
  • Yesterday a beggar knocked at my door. 昨天一个乞丐来敲我的门。
  • Sometimes I think this house will be knocked down by a passing plane. 有时我觉得这房子就要被一架飞过的飞机撞倒。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, for·tu·nate·ly , put 放

ODE> Strike a surface noisily to attract attention, especially when waiting to be let in through a door. – bang, tap, rap, thump, pound, hammer.

1007. know 知道 ## 83

[noʊ]v.了解；知道；认识n.知情

  • How do you know Sam doesn’t make the tea very often? 你怎么知道萨姆不会使茶叶往往？
  • She does not know London very well, and she lost her way. 她不知道伦敦非常好，她迷路了。
  • How do you know? 你怎么知道的？

SEE> why 为什么, think 想, sure 当然

ODE> Be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information. – be aware, realize, be conscious, have knowledge, be informed, have information.

1008. knowl·edge 知识 ## 17

[’nɑːlɪdʒ]n.学问；了解；知识；认识；知道

  • In the light of this statement, teachers live by selling knowledge, philosophers by selling wisdom and priests by selling spiritual comfort. 根据这种说法的光，教师靠靠卖精神安慰卖知识，哲学家靠卖智慧和教士。
  • Although mankind has undergone no general improvement in intelligence or morality, it has made extraordinary progress in the accumulation of knowledge. 虽然人类在智力和道德上没有得到普遍提高，但在知识的积累取得了非凡的进步。
  • Knowledge began to increase as soon as the thoughts of one individual could be communicated to another by means of speech. 知识开始作为一个独立的思想可以通过语言同别人交流，以尽快提高。

SEE> un·der·stand·ing 理解, fur·ther·more , ex·pe·ri·ence 经验

ODE> Facts, information, and skills acquired through experience or education; the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject. – understanding, comprehension, grasp, grip, command, mastery, apprehension.

1009. la·bel 标签 ## 3

[’leɪbl]n.标记；标签；称号；唱片公司vt.贴标签于；把 … 归类

  • There’s a label on the handle with my name and address on it. 界面上有我的名字和地址手柄上的标签。
  • This one’s got a label. 这一个有一个标签。
  • Spirits labelled 95 proof contain only about 47 per cent alcohol. 精神标为95的含有47％的酒精。

SEE> re·cord·ing 记录, al·bum , stu·di·o 工作室

ODE> A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic, or similar material attached to an object and giving information about it. – tag, ticket, tab, sticker, marker, docket, chit, chitty, flag, stamp.

1010. la·bour 劳动 ## 2

[’leɪbər]n.劳动；劳工；分娩v.努力；干苦力活；困难吃力地行进；反复说明Labourn.(英国)工党

  • So great is our passion for doing things for ourselves, that we are becoming increasingly less dependent on specialized labour. 如此之大的是我们自己动手做事的激情，我们正变得越来越少依赖于专门的劳动。
  • They had laboured for three years to produce this floating work of art; she was more richly carved and ornamented than any previous ship. 他们辛辛苦苦干了3年的生产技术的这种浮动工作;她更丰富的雕刻和比以往任何船只饰。

ODE> Work, especially physical work. – task, job, chore, undertaking, mission, commission, assignment.

1011. lack 缺乏 ## 5

[læk]n.缺乏；无v.缺乏；不足

  • He did not marry again and I was brought up without a woman’s care; but I lacked for nothing, for he was both father and mother to me. 他没有再娶，因此，我从小就没有女人的关怀;但我什么都不缺，他既当父亲又当母亲。
  • As they grow old, people also accumulate belongings for two other reasons, lack of physical and mental energy, both of which are essential in turning out and throwing away, and sentiment. 当他们老去，人们也积累财物其他两个原因，缺乏体力，精力的，这两者都是在清理和扔掉，而情绪是至关重要的。
  • During all these tests Vera was blindfold; and, indeed, except when blindfold she lacked the ability to perceive things with her skin. 在所有这些实验中，维拉的双眼都是蒙着而事实上，如果不蒙上双眼她缺乏与她的皮肤的能力去感知的东西。

SEE> ab·sence 缺席, rea·son 理由, in·suf·fi·cient

ODE> The state of being without or not having enough of something. – absence, want, need, deficiency, dearth, insufficiency, shortage, shortfall, scarcity, paucity, unavailability, scarceness, undersupply, deficit, scantiness, sparseness, meagreness, inadequacy, shortness, deprivation, destitution, privation, famine, drought, poverty, non-existence, rareness, infrequency, uncommonness.

1012. la·dy 女士 ## 21

[’leɪdi]n.夫人；女士

  • Does the lady buy any chalk? 这位女士有没有买任何粉笔？
  • What kind of dress does the lady want? 什么样的装扮这位女士想要？
  • The lady who is standing behind the counter. 谁站在柜台后面的那位女士。

SEE> wife 妻子, daugh·ter 女儿, niece 侄女

ODE> A polite or formal way of referring to a woman. – woman, member of the fair sex, member of the gentle sex, female.

1013. lake 湖 ## 9

[leɪk]n.湖；湖泊n.深红色；[化]色淀

  • In 1948, he went to Lake Kivu in the Congo to observe a new volcano which he later named Kituro. 1948年，他到基伍湖刚果观察一个新火山，后来他命名为基图罗。
  • Suddenly they came to a waterfall which dropped into an underground lake at the bottom of the cave. 突然，他们来到了一个瀑布这在洞底投进一个地下湖。
  • They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side. 他们跳入湖中，并装上一只充气橡皮艇自己的装备后，让他们当前进到另一侧。

SEE> pond , shore , near·by 附近

ODE> A large area of water surrounded by land. – pond, pool, tarn, reservoir, lagoon, waterhole, inland sea, swim.

1014. land 土地 ## 21

[lænd]n.陆地；国土；土地v.靠岸；着陆；跌落地面；得到；使靠岸；使着陆

  • The most surprising thing about it, however, is that it can land anywhere: on snow, water, or even on a ploughed field. 它最令人惊奇的事情，但问题在于，它可以在任何地方降落：雪地上，水面上，甚至耕过的田里。
  • Once he landed on the roof of a block of flats and on another occasion, he landed in a deserted car park. 一次，他降落在单位，并在另一个场合块的屋顶，降落在了一个废弃的停车场上。
  • While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to keep calm and to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. 在我们等待降落时，一位空中乘务员告诉我们要保持镇静，因为它感动了下来静静地尽快离开飞机。

SEE> prop·er·ty 财产, ar·e·a 区域, part 部分

ODE> The part of the earth’s surface that is not covered by water. – terra firma, dry land, solid ground.

1015. lane 车道 ## 4

[leɪn]n.小路；小巷；行车道；跑道；航道

  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • My friend, Patrick, has always been a fanatical opponent of Mr. Lane’s Radical Progressive Party. 我的朋友帕特里克一直是莱恩先生的激进党的强烈反对者。
  • When he asked if Mr. Lane lived there, the policeman on duty told him that since his defeat, the ex-Prime Minister had gone abroad. 当他询问莱恩先生是否住在那里时，值班的警察告诉他，因为他的失败，前首相出国去了。

SEE> road 路, turn 转动, cor·ner 角落

ODE> A narrow road, especially in a rural area. – byroad, byway, bridleway, bridle path, path, pathway, footpath, way, towpath, trail, track, road, street, alley, alleyway, roadway, passage, thoroughfare.

1016. lan·guage 语言 ## 6

[’læŋɡwɪdʒ]n.语言；语言文字；表达方式

  • As soon as he had got into the car, I said good morning to him in French and he replied in the same language. 当他刚钻进车里，我好早上他用法语说，他在同一种语言回答。
  • In England, each person speaks a different language. 在英国，人们各自说着不同的语言。
  • The English language possesses a vivid saying to describe this sort of situation. 英语中有一个生动的说法来形容这种情况。

SEE> word 单词, mean·ing 含义, speak 讲

ODE> The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way. – speech, writing, communication, verbal expression, verbalization, vocalization, conversation, speaking, talking, words, utterance, vocabulary, articulation, enunciation, pronunciation, talk, discourse, interchange, intercourse, interaction.

1017. large 大 ## 61

[lɑːrdʒ]adj.大的；大量的；大号的；广泛的adv.夸大地；[航海]顺风地v.狂欢作乐

  • Mrs. Smith’s living room is large. 史密斯太太的客厅很大。
  • Do you want the large size or the small size? 你要大号还是小号的？
  • The large size, please. 大尺寸，请。

SEE> small 小, huge 巨大, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity. – big, great, huge, of considerable size, sizeable, substantial, immense, enormous, colossal, massive, mammoth, vast, cosmic, goodly, prodigious, tremendous, gigantic, giant, monumental, stupendous, gargantuan, elephantine, titanic, mountainous, monstrous.

1018. large·ly 大部分地 ## 3

[’lɑːrdʒli]adv.大部分；主要地

  • Whether we find a joke funny or not largely depends on where we have been brought up. 无论我们好笑，觉得一则笑话，很大程度上取决于我们在那里长大。
  • However, a new type of humour, which stems largely from U.S., has recently come into fashion. 然而，一种新型的幽默，从美国主要是茎，最近流行起来。
  • My particular experience is largely in oil, and the search for oil has done more to improve deep drilling than any other mining activity. 我是专门搞石油的，并且对石油的搜索已经做得更多，以提高深钻比其他任何采矿业。

SEE> most·ly 大多, en·tire·ly 完全地, part·ly 部分地

ODE> To a great extent; on the whole; mostly. – mostly, mainly, to a large extent, to a great extent, to a great degree, on the whole, chiefly, generally, in general, predominantly, substantially, primarily, overall, for the most part, in the main, principally, in great measure, preponderantly, first and foremost, for all intents and purposes, basically.

1019. last 最后的 ## 66

[læst]v.持续；维持adj.最近的；上一个的；末尾的；最后的adv.最后；最近一次n.最后来的人（或发生的事）；鞋楦(做鞋的模型)

  • Was he absent from school last week? 在他缺席上周的学校吗？
  • Did he telephone again last night? 难道他昨晚又打电话了吗？
  • Last week Mrs. Mills went to London. 上星期米尔斯夫人去了伦敦。

SEE> month 月, week 周, a·go 前

ODE> Coming after all others in time or order; final. – rearmost, rear, hindmost, bringing up the rear, nearest the rear, at the end, furthest back, at the back, at the back of the queue, aftermost, endmost, furthest behind, final, ultimate, most remote, remotest, furthest, utmost, extreme.

1020. late 晚的 ## 17

[leɪt]adj.迟的；晚的；末期的；最近的；已故的adv.晚；迟

  • The sun rises early and sets late. 太阳升起早，晚集。
  • The sun rises late and sets early. 太阳升得迟，并设置月初。
  • He arrives home late. 他后期到家。

SEE> ear·ly 早, lat·er 后来, af·ter 在之后

ODE> Doing something or taking place after the expected, proper, or usual time. – behind time, behind schedule, behind, behindhand.

1021. lat·er 后来 ## 45

[’leɪtər]adv.后来；稍后adj.后来的；以后的；接近末期的

  • Later that morning, when I was doing the housework, My husband phoned me from the office. 那天早上，当我正做家务时，我丈夫打电话给我从办公室。
  • Later a neighbour told me about him. 后来，一位邻居告诉了我他。
  • She never thought of it again, but ten months later, she received a letter from a girl in Holland. 她从来没有想过一遍，但10个月后，她收到了荷兰一位姑娘的来信。

SEE> sub·se·quent·ly , when 什么时候, then 然后

ODE> Goodbye for the present; see you later. – farewell, adieu.

1022. lat·est 最新 ## 5

[’leɪtɪst]adj.最近的；最新的；最后的n.最迟的时间；最新的潮流；最新消息形容词late的最高级形式.

  • Listen: ’Karen Marsh: The latest. 听：“卡伦。马什：最新消息。
  • Bleriot had been making planes since 1905 and this was his latest model. 1905年以来布莱里奥已经使飞机是他的最新型号。
  • The latest exhibitions, films, or plays are only a short bus ride away. 最新的展览，电影，戏剧只有很短的车程。

SEE> re·cent 最近, week 周, month 月

ODE> Of most recent date. – most recent, newest, brand new, just out, just released, fresh, present-day, up to date, up to the minute, state-of-the-art, current, modern, contemporary, modernistic, fashionable, in fashion, in vogue, voguish, bang up to date, in.

1023. laugh 笑 ## 8

[læf]v.发笑；笑；嘲笑n.笑声；笑；笑料

  • At that moment, everybody began to laugh and sing. 在那一刻，每个人都开始笑和唱歌。
  • The man laughed when he realized what had happened. 当他意识到发生了什么事的人都笑了。
  • Jeremy asked her why this was so and she told him that she did not like to see so many people laughing at him! 杰里米问他为何如此，她告诉他，她不喜欢看到那么多的人嘲笑他！

SEE> joke 玩笑, laugh·ter , cry 哭

ODE> Make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of derision. – chuckle, chortle, guffaw, giggle, titter, snigger, snicker, cackle, howl, roar, tee-hee, burst out laughing, hoot with laughter, roar with laughter, shake with laughter, be convulsed with laughter, dissolve into laughter, split one’s sides, hold one’s sides, be doubled up.

1024. launch 发射 ## 4

[lɔːntʃ]v.发起；推出（新产品）；发射；使(船)下水n.发射；产品推介

  • The Hubble telescope was launched into space by NASA on April 20, 1990 at a cost of over a billion dollars. 哈勃望远镜于超过十亿美元的价格于1990年4月20日发射升空的美国宇航局。
  • Shortly after it was launched, the pie committee went to a local inn to celebrate. 下水后不久，馅饼委员会成员们来到当地一家小酒店庆贺。
  • In 1975, a primitive machine called the Altair, was launched in the USA. 1975年，一个名为Altair的原始机型是在美国推出。

SEE> aim 瞄准, read·y 准备, be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> Set (a boat) in motion by pushing it or allowing it to roll into the water. – set afloat, float.

1025. law 法律 ## 12

[lɔː]n.法律；法规；准则；起诉v.起诉；打官司

  • The word justice is usually associated with courts of law. 字义通常与法庭连在一起的。
  • Justice is part of the complex machinery of the law. 正义是法律的复杂机制的组成部分。
  • He may gently reprimand an official or even suggest to parliament that a law be altered. 他可以温和地指责一个官员，或者甚至建议议会修改法律条款。

SEE> le·gal 法律, leg·is·la·tion , pro·vi·sion

ODE> The system of rules which a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members and which it may enforce by the imposition of penalties. – rules and regulations, system of laws, body of laws, constitution, legislation, code, legal code, charter.

1026. law·yer 律师 ## 6

[’lɔːjər]n.律师

  • Tony worked in a lawyer’s office years ago, but he is now working at a bank. 托尼在一家律师事务所年前的工作，但他现在在一家银行上班。
  • Reporters kept pressing for interviews so lawyers had to be employed to act as spokesmen for the family at press conferences. 记者纷纷要求会见，律师不得不被用来充当代言人的家人在记者招待会上。
  • He has eight lawyer assistants to help him and he examines every single letter in detail. 他有8位律师助理帮助他，他详细检查了每一个字母。

SEE> at·tor·ney 律师, case 箱子, coun·sel

ODE> A person who practises or studies law, especially (in the UK) a solicitor or a barrister or (in the US) an attorney. – legal practitioner, attorney, legal officer, legal adviser, legal representative, legal executive, agent, member of the bar.

1027. lay 下蛋 ## 11

[leɪ]lie的过去式.v.放置；躺下；打赌；设计；击倒；产卵；使平静；压平n.地形；位置；叙事短诗；交媾adj.外行的；世俗的

  • Though, at first, Byrd and his men were able to take a great many photographs of the mountains that lay below, they soon ran into serious trouble. 虽然开始时伯德和他的助手们拍下了飞机下面连绵群山的大量照片，但他们很快就陷入了困境。
  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。
  • Snow lay thick on the ground. 雪厚躺在地上。

SEE> be·side 在旁边, lie 躺, pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> Put (something) down gently or carefully. – put, place, set, put down, set down, deposit, rest, situate, sit, settle, stow, balance, station, drop, leave, let fall, throw down, fling down, deploy, locate, position.

1028. lead 领导 ## 23

[liːd]v.引导；领先；带领；过 … (的生活)；导致n.领头位置；主角；榜样；引言；铅

  • He led me into his room and hurriedly hid a large parcel under his desk. 他把我带进了他的房间，慌忙把桌子下面把一个大包藏。
  • She will speak to you and then she will lead you away from this place. 她会跟你说话，然后她将带领你远离这个地方。
  • Two of the leading growers, Giuseppe Moldova and Riccardo Brabante, tell me that they have been expecting a splendid crop this year and harvesting has begun earlier than usual. 领先的种植者二，朱塞佩·瓦和里卡多。布拉班特告诉我，他们今年已经期待一个大丰收，收割工作比往年早。

SEE> lead·ing 最重要的, se·cond 第二, ad·van·tage 优点

ODE> Cause (a person or animal) to go with one by holding them by the hand, a halter, a rope, etc. while moving forward. – guide, conduct, show, show someone the way, lead the way, usher, escort, steer, pilot, marshal, shepherd.

1029. lead·er 领导 ## 3

[’liːdər]n.领袖；领导者；指挥者；领先的人

  • The leader of the party was examining the soil near the entrance to the cave when the machine showed that there was gold under the ground. 党的队长正在检查附近的洞口土壤时，机器显示有地下金。
  • When he died at the age of eighty, the Florentines gave him a state funeral and had a picture painted which was dedicated to the memory of ‘the most valiant soldier and most notable leader, Signor Giovanni Haukodue’. 当他80岁那年死去时，佛罗伦萨人为他举行了国葬，并曾画了一幅画这是献给“最英勇的战士，最显着的领先地位，贝卢斯科尼乔瓦尼Haukodue”的记忆。
  • Convinced of the importance of education, modern states ‘invest’ in institutions of learning to get back ‘interest’ in the form of a large group of enlightened young men and women who are potential leaders. 深信教育的重要性，现代国家在机构投资，学习，取回一大群开明青年男女谁是潜在的领导人形式的“兴趣”的。

SEE> lead·er·ship , op·po·si·tion 反对, mean·while 与此同时

ODE> The person who leads or commands a group, organization, or country. – chief, head, principal, boss.

1030. leaf 叶子 ## 5

[liːf]n.页；叶；金属薄片v.长叶；翻页

  • It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he will have bad luck; if he picks a leaf, he will die. 有人说，如果有人触摸了这棵树，他将有倒霉的事。如果他摘了一片树叶，他会死。
  • In spite of all that has been said, the tourists have been picking leaves and cutting their names on the tree-trunk. 尽管所有的已经说了，但游客们还是照常摘树叶和切割的树干他们的名字。
  • During the summer, I noticed that the leaves of the tree were beginning to wither. 到了夏天，我发现树的叶子开始枯萎。

SEE> in·stance 例子, like·wise , pur·ple 紫色

ODE> A flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and blade-like, that is attached to a stem directly or via a stalk. Leaves are the main organs of photosynthesis and transpiration. – frond.

1031. learn 学习 ## 29

[lɜːrn]v.学会；学习；得知

  • As I soon learnt, he was English himself! 我很快了解到，他自己就是个英国人！
  • ‘You’ll soon learn English!’ “您会很快学会英语的！”
  • The whole village soon learnt that a large sum of money had been lost. 整个村子很快了解到一大笔钱丢失了。

SEE> un·der·stand 懂, teach 教, how 怎么样

ODE> Gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught. – acquire a knowledge of, gain an understanding of, acquire skill in, become competent in, become proficient in, grasp, master, take in, absorb, assimilate, pick up, digest, familiarize oneself with.

1032. least 最小 ## 17

[liːst]adj.最小的；最少的adv.最小地；最少地；最轻微地n.最小；最少

  • I read she’s twenty-nine, but she must be at least forty. 我读了她的29岁，但她一定至少有40岁。
  • She must be at least thirty-five years old. 她必须至少有三十五岁。
  • Most people believe that the strike will last for at least a week. 大多数人认为罢工将至少持续一个星期。

SEE> than 比, more 更多, on·ly 只有

ODE> Smallest in amount, extent, or significance. – slightest, smallest, minimum, minimal, minutest, tiniest, littlest.

1033. leave 离开 ## 53

[liːv]v.委托；离开；留给；遗留；遗赠；听任n.许可；准假；告别vi.生出叶子

  • We’re going to leave tomorrow. 我们打算明天离开。
  • He didn’t want to leave this house. 他不想离开这个家。
  • No, he didn’t want to leave, but his wife did! 不，他不想离开，可是他妻子！

SEE> stay 停留, come 来, re·turn 返回

ODE> Go away from. – depart from, go away from, go from, withdraw from, retire from, take oneself off from, exit from, take one’s leave of, pull out of, quit, be gone from, decamp from, disappear from, abandon, vacate, absent oneself from, evacuate.

1034. left 左边 ## 5

[left]adj.左边的adv.向左n.左边；左派分子；【体】左手拳动词leave的过去式和过去分词形式.

  • It is on the left. 这是在左边。
  • We are on the left. 我们是在左边。
  • We are standing on the left. 我们站在左边。

SEE> leave 离开, when 什么时候, but 但是

ODE> On, towards, or relating to the side of a human body or of a thing that is to the west when the person or thing is facing north. – left-hand, sinistral, at nine o’clock.

1035. leg 腿 ## 7

[leɡ]n.腿vi.用脚走路

  • They stretch out their legs like flying squirrels. 它们伸展四肢，就像飞行的松鼠。
  • A man who had broken his right leg was taken to hospital a few weeks before Christmas. 一个人谁打破了他的右腿被送进医院圣诞节前几个星期。
  • On Christmas Day, the man still had his right leg in plaster. 在圣诞节，该男子仍然有他的石膏的右腿。

SEE> wound 伤口, thigh , shoul·der 肩膀

ODE> Each of the limbs on which a person or animal walks and stands. – lower limb, shank.

1036. lend 借 ## 3

[lend]v.借给；贷款；借(出)

  • Then he lent me a book. 然后，他借给我一本书。
  • While he was eating, I asked him to lend me twenty pounds. 当他吃饭时，我问他借20英镑。
  • When anyone opens a current account at a bank, he is lending the bank money, repayment of which he may demand at any time, either in cash or by drawing a cheque in favour of another person. 任何人在银行开一个活期账户，他在借钱给银行，还款，而他可以在任何时间要求，以现金或通过绘制有利于他人的支票。

SEE> bor·row 借, like·wise , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Grant to (someone) the use of (something) on the understanding that it will be returned. – loan, give someone the loan of, let someone use, let someone have the use of.

1037. length 长度 ## 10

[leŋθ]n.长度；时间长短；距离；一段；距离的测量单位

  • It was over 30 feet in length and had a 2,500-horsepower engine. 它的车身长30英尺，有一个2,500马力的发动机。
  • The fish are not sharks or killer whales, but favourite eating varieties like cod and skate which grow to unnatural sizes, sometimes as much as twelve feet in length. 这些鱼并不是鲨鱼或逆戟鲸，而是深受人们喜爱的食用鱼品种，如鳕鱼和鳐它们长得出奇地大，有时长达12英尺长。
  • Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once. 有些孩子能够跑完游泳池的全长而不用露出水面换气一次。

SEE> short 短, width 宽度, du·ra·tion

ODE> The measurement or extent of something from end to end; the greater of two or the greatest of three dimensions of an object. – extent, extent lengthwise, distance, distance lengthwise, linear measure, span, reach.

1038. less 减 ## 31

[les]adj.更少的；较少的adv.更少地；较少地n.少量；次要prep.减

  • No, less than that. 不，再少一些。
  • Eat more and smoke less! 多吃点，少抽点！
  • This model’s less expensive than that one. 这种模式比那种要便宜些。

SEE> more 更多, than 比, much 许多

ODE> A smaller amount of; not as much. – not so much, not so great, smaller, slighter, shorter, reduced.

1039. let 让 ## 37

[let]v.让；允许；(用于祈使句表建议、请求、命令)让；假设；出租n.出租；阻碍；(网球等)触网重发

  • Let’s go into the living room, Carol. 让我们走进客厅，卡罗尔。
  • Let’s go into the garage and have a look at it. 让我们走进车库，看看它。
  • Let’s go and have a drink. 让我们喝一杯。

SEE> want 想要, go 去, tell 告诉

ODE> Not prevent or forbid; allow. – allow, permit, give permission to, give leave to, authorize, sanction, grant, grant the right to, warrant, license, empower, enable, entitle.

1040. let·ter 信件 ## 38

[’letər]n.信；字母v.写下；印刷n.租赁人

  • Why can’t Pamela type the letter? 帕梅拉为什么无法打信？
  • Can she type this letter for me? 她能这封信给我吗？
  • Can you type this letter for the boss please, Pamela? 您可以键入这封信的老板请，帕梅拉？

SEE> state·ment 声明, mes·sage 消息, writ·ten 书面

ODE> A character representing one or more of the sounds used in speech; any of the symbols of an alphabet. – alphabetical character, character, sign, symbol, mark, type, figure, device, rune.

1041. lev·el 水平 ## 5

[’levl]n.数量；等级；水平；水平线adj.平的；等高的v.弄平；夷平；对准adv.水平地

  • The tunnel would be well-ventilated if tall chimneys were built above sea level. 这条隧道的通风良好，如果高大的烟囱被海拔建。
  • The city at one time must have been prosperous, for it enjoyed a high level of civilization. 在这座古城肯定一度很繁荣，因为它曾享有的文明高度。
  • He investigates complaints large and small that come to him from all levels of society. 他研究大，小抱怨，来找他从社会的各个层面。

SEE> a·bove 在上方, be·low 在下面, low 低

ODE> A horizontal plane or line with respect to the distance above or below a given point. – height, highness, altitude, elevation, distance upward.

1042. li·brar·y 图书馆 ## 3

[’laɪbreri]n.图书馆；藏书；书房

  • Many firms, for instance, have great difficulty in obtaining technical or scientific books from libraries because they are unwilling to have their names entered as having taken out such and such a book, for fear the agents of other firms should be able to trace the kind of research they are likely to be undertaking. 许多公司，例如，有向图书馆借阅科技书籍时感到困难，因为他们不愿意有输入作为已经采取了这样或那样的一本书，是为了怕别人公司的代理商应该能摸到自己的名字研究它们很可能是事业。
  • Libraries made education possible, and education in its turn added to libraries: the growth of knowledge followed a kind of compound interest law, which was greatly enhanced by the invention of printing. 图书馆使教育成为可能，而教育反过来其添加到库：知识的增长遵循着一种复利法，这得到了印刷术的发明增强。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, col·lec·tion 收集物, mu·se·um 博物馆

ODE> A building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music for use or borrowing by the public or the members of an institution. – study, studio, library.

1043. li·cence 执照 ## 2

[’laɪsns]n.执照；许可；特许；自由；放纵vt.同意；许可

  • Let me see your driving licence. 让我看看你的驾驶执照。
  • I was being tested for a driving licence for the third time. 我正在测试的第三次驾驶执照。

ODE> A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade (especially in alcoholic drink) – permit, certificate, document, documentation, authorization, warrant, voucher, diploma, imprimatur.

1044. lie 躺 ## 8

[laɪ]v.躺下；位于；在于；平放；存在；延伸；说谎n.谎言

  • A man was lying in the box on top of a pile of woollen goods. 一个男人躺在箱子里的一堆毛织品之上。
  • ‘Not at all,’ I lied, ‘but I’m going to the dentist.’ “没有那回事，”我撒谎了，“但我准备去牙医那里。”
  • The famous monastery of St. Bernard, which was founded in the eleventh century, lies about a mile away. 圣伯纳，始建于十一世纪的著名修道院，约一英里远的谎言。

SEE> like·wise , in·deed 确实, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> (of a person or animal) be in or assume a horizontal or resting position on a supporting surface. – recline, lie down, lie back, be recumbent, be prostrate, be supine, be prone, be stretched out, stretch oneself out, lean back, sprawl, rest, repose, relax, lounge, loll, bask.

1045. life 生活 ## 88

[laɪf]n.一生；生命；生活；人生

  • For the first time in his life, he became the proud owner of a bed which had springs and a mattress. 平生第一次，他成了一个床自豪地拥有其中有弹簧床垫。
  • Why does Tazieff risk his life like this? 为什么塔捷耶夫冒着生命危险这样吗？
  • Tazieff has often risked his life in this way. 塔捷耶夫经常冒着生命危险，在这种方式。

SEE> e·ven 甚至, but 但是, once 一次

ODE> The condition that distinguishes animals and plants from inorganic matter, including the capacity for growth, reproduction, functional activity, and continual change preceding death. – existence, being, living, animation, aliveness, animateness.

1046. lift 抬起 ## 5

[lɪft]vt.举起；运送；偷窃；升高；还清；取消vi.提升n.举起；提升；电梯；搭便车；帮助；载货量；扒窃

  • I stopped and he asked me for a lift. 我停下来，他问我要一程。
  • Frank gently lifted the crockery out of the box and suddenly noticed a miniature painting at the bottom of the packing case. 弗兰克轻轻地把陶器拿出箱子，突然发现一个缩影，在包装盒的底部画。
  • The dish now had to be lifted vertically because one edge was resting against the side of the canal. 菜现在有，因为一个一边靠在耳道的侧面垂直抬起。

SEE> push 推, pull 拉, al·low 允许

ODE> Raise to a higher position or level. – raise, hoist, heave, haul up, uplift, heft, boost, raise aloft, raise up, upraise, elevate, thrust, hold high, bear aloft.

1047. light 光 ## 33

[laɪt]n.光；光线；灯；打火机；领悟；浅色；天窗adj.轻的；浅色的；明亮的；轻松的；容易的；清淡的v.点燃；变亮；照亮adv.清楚地；轻便地

  • He turned on the light, but he couldn’t see anyone. 他开了灯，但他什么都没看到。
  • Early next morning, she saw a light ahead. 第二天凌晨，她看到前方有灯光。
  • She knew she was near the shore because the light was high up on the cliffs. 她知道自己已经接近岸边了，因为那灯光是在高高的峭壁上。

SEE> bright 明亮的, ra·ther 相当, in·stead 代替

ODE> The natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible. – illumination, brightness, luminescence, luminosity, shining, gleaming, gleam, brilliance, radiance, lustre, glowing, glow, blaze, glare, dazzle.

1048. like 喜欢 ## 126

[laɪk]prep.像conj.如同adv.大概；和 … 一样adj.相似的；同样的v.喜欢；想；愿意n.类似的人或物

  • How does Ann like her coffee? 安想要什么样的咖啡？
  • Do you like coffee, Ann? 你喜欢咖啡吗，安？
  • I don’t like milk in my coffee. 我不喜欢在我的咖啡牛奶。

SEE> such 这样, e·ven 甚至, well 好

ODE> Having the same characteristics or qualities as; similar to. – similar to, the same as, identical to.

1049. like·ly 可能的 ## 16

[’laɪkli]adj.可能的；可信的adv.很可能

  • It seems that the further cats fall, the less they are likely to injure themselves. 看来，猫跌落，他们是不太可能伤害自己。
  • The truth is that when mistakes occur, they are more likely to be ours than theirs. 事实是，错误发生时，他们更可能是咎由自取。
  • If it is not, and you are likely to get seasick, no form of transport could be worse. 如果不是，你就可能晕船，没有交通的形式可能会更糟糕。

SEE> might 也许, un·like·ly 不太可能, could 可以

ODE> Such as well might happen or be true; probable. – probable, distinctly possible, to be expected, odds-on, on, possible, credible, plausible, believable, within the bounds of possibility, imaginable.

1050. lim·it 限制 ## 6

[’lɪmɪt]n.限度；限制；界限vt.限制；限定

  • Didn’t you see the speed limit? 难道你没看见限速牌吗？
  • I limited myself to two modest ambitions: to do physical exercises every morning and to read more of an evening. 只给自己定下两项适中的任务：每天早上锻炼身体，多读一个晚上。
  • In so far as any inquiry is a secret one, it naturally limits all those engaged in carrying it out from effective contact with their fellow scientists either in other countries or in universities, or even, often enough, in other departments of the same firm. 在迄今为止的任何调查都涉及到保密，自然受到了限制所有从事从有效接触与他们的同胞科学家们无论是在其他国家或大学，甚至往往不能在同一公司的其他部门实施它。

SEE> re·strict 限制, min·i·mum 最低限度, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A point or level beyond which something does not or may not extend or pass. – boundary, border, boundary line, bound, bounding line, partition line, frontier, edge, demarcation line, end point, cut-off point, termination.

1051. line 线 ## 22

[laɪn]n.线；界线；皱纹；路线；航线；行；台词；行业；绳子；家族v.排队；画线；加衬里

  • I’m John Smith the telephone engineer and I’m repairing your telephone line. 我是约翰·史密斯的电话工程师，我正在修理您的电话线。
  • I read a few lines, but I did not understand a word. 我读了几行，但我不明白的词。
  • They will also be building new roads and a special railway line. 他们还将兴建新的公路和一条铁路专用线。

SEE> same 相同, a·long 沿着, run·ning 运行

ODE> A long, narrow mark or band. – dash, rule, bar, score.

1052. link 链接 ## 4

[lɪŋk]v.联系；连接n.环；联系；节

  • One of the links in the chain that drives the wheels had snapped. 一个链条驱动车轮断了联系的。
  • Of course, Leon Bagrit could not possibly have foreseen the development of the Internet, the worldwide system that enables us to communicate instantly with anyone in any part of the world by using computers linked to telephone networks. 当然，巴格瑞特不可能预见到互联网的发展，世界范围内的系统，使我们能够立即与任何人在世界任何地方通过连接到电话网络上的计算机进行通信。
  • All this seems to me to link them with life, and the origins of things. 所有这一切都在我看来，他们的生活联系起来，和万物之源。

SEE> con·nec·tion 连接, con·nect 连接, in·stance 例子

ODE> A relationship between two things or situations, especially where one affects the other. – connection, relationship, relatedness, association, linkage, tie-up.

1053. liq·uid 液体 ## 2

[’lɪkwɪd]adj.液体的；液态的；清澈的；清脆的；已转化成现款的（财）n.液体

  • He noticed that a river of liquid rock was coming towards him. 他发现有一股岩浆正向他流过来。
  • The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System, supplying the rocket fuels for its ships, easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen. 月亮很可能成为太阳系的工业中心，其船舶，从在液态氧的形式月球上的岩石易于获得供给火箭燃料。

SEE> mix·ture 混合物, flu·id , boil·ing

ODE> A substance that flows freely but is of constant volume, having a consistency like that of water or oil. – fluid.

1054. list 清单 ## 8

[lɪst]n.目录；名单；明细表；条纹；倾斜；意向v.列出；(使)倾斜；使高兴；愿意；听

  • I’m making a shopping list, Tom. 我正在做一个购物清单，汤姆。
  • First of all, he wrote out a long list of all the foods which were forbidden. 首先，他写出了其被禁止在所有食品的一个长长的清单。
  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。

SEE> in·clude 包括, ad·di·tion 加, num·ber 数

ODE> A number of connected items or names written or printed consecutively, typically one below the other. – catalogue, inventory, record, register, roll, file, index, directory, listing, listicle, checklist, tally, docket, ticket, enumeration, table, tabulation.

1055. lis·ten 听 ## 3

[’lɪsn]v.听；倾听；听从；听信n.听；倾听

  • Listen to this! 听听这个！
  • Listen: ’Karen Marsh: The latest. 听：“卡伦。马什：最新消息。
  • They located the right chimney by tapping at the walls and listening for the man’s cries. 他们位于右烟囱通过在墙壁，发现该男子的哭声。

SEE> hear 听见, tell 告诉, ask 问

ODE> Give one’s attention to a sound. – hear, pay attention, be attentive, attend, concentrate on, concentrate on hearing, give ear to, lend an ear to.

1056. lit·tle 小 ## 45

[’lɪtl]adj.小的；幼小的；短的；微不足道的；少到几乎没有的adv.甚少；毫不；难得n.极少

  • And here’s a little present for you. 而且这里有一个小礼物给你。
  • Just a little, please. 只是有一点，请。
  • While we were having breakfast, our little boy, Tommy, found two small coins on the floor. 虽然我们吃早饭时，我们的小男孩汤米在地上找到两枚小硬币。

SEE> bit 一点点, much 许多, noth·ing 没有

ODE> Small in size, amount, or degree (often used to convey an appealing diminutiveness or express an affectionate or condescending attitude) – small, small-scale, compact.

1057. live 生活 ## 66

[lɪv]v.活着；居住；过着adj.活的；直播的；现场的；带电的；燃烧着的；当前的adv.现场

  • The Sawyers live at 87 King Street. 该索耶斯住在国王街87号。
  • How long have you lived here? 你在这里住了多久了？
  • I’ve lived here for twenty years. 我在这里住了二十多年。

SEE> liv·ing 活着的, where 哪里, well 好

ODE> Remain alive. – exist, be alive, be, have being, have life.

1058. liv·ing 活着的 ## 16

[’lɪvɪŋ]adj.活着的；生动的n.生活；生计动词live的现在分词.

  • Mrs. Smith’s living room is large. 史密斯太太的客厅很大。
  • In the afternoon, Mrs. Sawyer usually drinks tea in the living room. 当天下午，索耶夫人通常喝在客厅里喝茶。
  • Let’s go into the living room, Carol. 让我们走进客厅，卡罗尔。

SEE> live 生活, a·lone 单独地, work·ing 工作

ODE> An income sufficient to live on or the means of earning it. – livelihood, income, source of income, means of support, means, subsistence, keep, maintenance, sustenance, nourishment, daily bread, upkeep.

1059. load 加载 ## 7

[loʊd]n.负荷；重担；装载量v.装载；给(枪)装子弹；[计算机] 装入

  • They quickly loaded a small rubber dinghy with food, matches, and cans of beer and rowed for a few miles across the Caribbean until they arrived at a tiny coral island. 他们迅速把小橡皮艇食物，火柴，罐装啤酒和划行加勒比海几英里，到了一座珊瑚岛上。
  • Small boats loaded with wares sped to the great liner as she was entering the harbour. 满载货物的小船呼啸而至，大型班轮驶进港口。
  • The lorry was loaded with empty beer bottles and hundreds of them slid off the back of the vehicle and on to the road. 卡车上装着空啤酒瓶，成百只滑出车的后面，落在马路上。

SEE> un·load 卸下, in·stance 例子, han·dle 把手

ODE> A heavy or bulky thing that is being carried or is about to be carried. – cargo, freight, freightage, charge, burden.

1060. lo·cal 当地的 ## 19

[’loʊkl]adj.地方性的；当地的；局部的n.当地人

  • Last Tuesday he received a letter from the local police. 上星期二他收到当地警察局的一封信。
  • Sam Benton, the local butcher, had lost his wallet while taking his savings to the post office. 萨姆顿当地的屠户，而把存款送往邮局丢失了钱包。
  • There he was picked up by a policeman and sent back to England by the local authorities. 他在那儿被一个警察抓住了，之后被当局送回了英国。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, oth·er 其他, sev·er·al 一些

ODE> Relating or restricted to a particular area or one’s neighbourhood. – community, district, neighbourhood, regional, city, town, municipal, provincial, village, parish, parish-pump, parochial.

1061. lo·cate 定位 ## 6

[’loʊkeɪt]vt.找出；把 … 设置在；使坐落于vi.住下来

  • Shivering in their wet clothes, the teenagers looked on while three men dived repeatedly into the water to locate the dish. 在他们的湿衣服哆嗦，看着3名工人轮番潜入水中以确定盘子的位置。
  • So it is a comparatively simple step from locating the sea bottom to locating a shoal of fish. 因此，它是从测定海深到测定鱼群，相对简单的一步。
  • With experience, and with improved apparatus, it is now possible not only to locate a shoal but to tell if it is herring, cod, or other well-known fish, by the pattern of its echo. 根据经验和改进了的仪器，它现在不仅能够找到一个浅滩，而是判断它是鲱鱼，鳕鱼，或其他知名的鱼，它的回声的特点。

SEE> i·den·ti·fy 确认, re·trieve , find 找到

ODE> Discover the exact place or position of. – find, discover, pinpoint, detect, track down, run to earth, unearth, hit on, come across, reveal, bring to light, sniff out, smoke out, search out, ferret out, turn up, uncover, come up with, lay one’s hands on, pin down.

1062. lo·cat·ed 位于 ## 2

[’loʊkeɪtɪd]adj.处于；位于

  • He described it as ‘a very agreeable situation located within two small hills in the midst of which flowed a great river.’ 他将其形容为“一家位于其中的流入一条大河中间的两个小山头一个非常愉快的局面。”
  • They located the right chimney by tapping at the walls and listening for the man’s cries. 他们位于右烟囱通过在墙壁，发现该男子的哭声。

ODE>

1063. lock 锁 ## 5

[lɑːk]n.锁；水闸；一缕头发；一簇；一束v.固定；锁(住)；抓牢；过闸

  • She was thinking that she must reprimand her home help the next morning for such a monstrous piece of negligence, when she remembered that she had gone shopping after the home help had left and she knew that she had turned both keys in their locks. 她心想，她必须在第二天早上训斥她家的帮助竟如此疏忽大意，当她想起她走了购物的家庭帮助已经离开了，她知道，她曾在自己的锁打开这两个键后。
  • The inspector began to look for fingerprints, while the constable checked that the front door locks had not been forced, thereby proving that the burglars had either used skeleton keys or entered over the balcony. 巡官开始搜寻指纹，警察经检查发现大门锁没有被强迫，由此可以证明，窃贼或者是用万能钥匙，或者是翻越阳台进来。
  • One day she came into his office and happened to put her hands on the door of a locked safe. 有一天，她走进他的办公室，偶然把手放在一个锁着的保险柜的门。

SEE> like·wise , turn 转动, switch 开关

ODE> A mechanism for keeping a door, window, lid, or container fastened, typically operated by a key. – bolt, catch, fastener, clasp, bar, hasp, latch.

1064. lone·ly 孤独 ## 3

[’loʊnli]adj.寂寞的，孤独的；荒凉的

  • Captain Fawcett’s first passenger was a doctor who flew from Birmingham to a lonely village in the Welsh mountains. 弗西特机长的第一名乘客是位医生谁从伯明翰飞往威尔士山区一个偏僻的村庄。
  • The man wanted to fly to Rockall, a lonely island in the Atlantic Ocean, but Captain Fawcett did not take him because the trip was too dangerous. 这个人想要飞往罗卡尔，在大西洋上的一个孤岛，但福塞特上尉没有走他，因为行程太危险了。
  • One night, however, feeling cold and lonely, I went downstairs and sat in front of the television pretending to read. 一天晚上，但是，我感到又冷又孤单，便来到楼下坐在电视机假装看书的前面。

SEE> bored 无聊, cu·ri·ous·ly 好奇地, mis·er·a·ble

ODE> Sad because one has no friends or company. – isolated, alone, all alone, friendless, companionless, without companions, without friends, with no one to turn to, outcast, forsaken, abandoned, rejected, unloved, unwanted.

1065. long 长 ## 83

[lɔːŋ]adj.长的；冗长的；久的；长音的adv.长期地；久地；用于名词后强调某事发生在某整段时间v.渴望n.长时间；长音节；囤积商品者

  • The days are long and the nights are short. 日子长而夜晚短。
  • The days are short and the nights are long. 在昼短夜长。
  • How long have you lived here? 你在这里住了多久了？

SEE> short 短, once 一次, so 所以

ODE> Measuring a great distance from end to end. – lengthy, of considerable length, extended, prolonged, extensive, stretched out, spread out.

1066. look 看 ## 94

[lʊk]v.看；寻找；显得看起来；注视；面向n.看；样子；脸色

  • Look! 看！
  • Look! 看！
  • Mr. Jones and his wife are looking at them. 琼斯先生和他的妻子正在寻找他们。

SEE> come 来, way 方式, like 喜欢

ODE> Direct one’s gaze toward someone or something or in a specified direction. – glance, gaze, stare, gape, peer, fix one’s gaze, focus.

1067. loose 松动的 ## 2

[luːs]adj.松的；宽松的；不确切的；不牢固的；放纵的n.解放；放任；放纵v.弄松；释放；放枪adv.松散地

  • It is a harmless habit, but it litters up her desk to such an extent that every time she opens it, loose bits of paper fall out in every direction. 它是一种无害的习惯，但她的办公桌上最多乱丢到这样的程度，每次她打开它时，纸张的松位在每一个方向脱落。
  • By infecting animals and letting them loose in the burrows, local epidemics of this disease could be created. 通过感染动物在洞内乱跑，让他们，就可以使这种疾病在一个地区蔓延。

SEE> a·part 分开, sort 种类, put 放

ODE> Not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached or able to be detached. – not fixed in place, not secure, insecure, unsecured, unattached.

1068. lor·ry 货车 ## 7

[’lɔːri]n.卡车

  • From there, he hitchhiked to Paris in a lorry. 从那里，他搭便车到了巴黎卡车。
  • But just before the competition closed, a lorry arrived at the factory with a truly colossal biscuit which weighed 2,400 pounds. 但就在竞赛截止前，一辆卡车到达工厂，拥有真正巨大的饼干，重达2,400磅。
  • It was so heavy that a crane had to be used to remove it from the lorry. 它是如此沉重，起重机不得不被用来从卡车上卸下它。

ODE> A large, heavy motor vehicle for transporting goods or troops; a truck. – truck.

1069. lose 失去 ## 26

[luːz]vt.丢失；失败；削减；丧生；看不到；亏损；迷失vi.失败；经受损失；走慢

  • She does not know London very well, and she lost her way. 她不知道伦敦非常好，她迷路了。
  • I had just lost ￡50 and I felt very upset. 我刚刚丢了£50，我感到非常烦恼。
  • ‘Everyone’s losing money these days,’ he said. “每个人都在丢钱，”他说。

SEE> lost 丢失, an·y·way 无论如何, sure·ly 一定

ODE> Be deprived of or cease to have or retain (something) – be deprived of, suffer the loss of, no longer have, stop having.

1070. loss 损失 ## 5

[lɔːs]n.遗失；丧失；损失；失败；失落；死亡

  • He will be earning only half as much as he used to, but he feels that his rise in status is well worth the loss of money. 他用他将来挣的钱只有原来的一半，但他觉得，他的地位升高是非常值得的金钱损失。
  • The tragic sinking of this great liner will always be remembered, for she went down on her first voyage with heavy loss of life. 然而，这艘巨轮的沉没悲剧将永远被铭记，因为她去了她的首航生命的重大损失。
  • Such a loss of dignity and descent into childish behaviour on the part of the adults deeply shocks the adolescents, and makes them resolve that in future they will not talk to their parents about the places or people they visit. 尊严和下降的这样的损失插入成人的一部分幼稚的行为深感震惊着少年，并让他们的决心，今后他们不会跟父母讲述去过的地方和人。

SEE> lost 丢失, re·sult 结果, lose 失去

ODE> The fact or process of losing something or someone. – mislaying, misplacement, dropping, forgetting, overlooking.

1071. lot 很多 ## 16

[lɑːt]n.许多；大量；抽签；签；命运；一块地；拍卖品；一类或一些(人或物)；批；套；份儿adv.很；非常v.划分；分配

  • We need a lot of things this week. 我们需要很多的东西这个星期。
  • We haven’t got many tomatoes, but we’ve got a lot of potatoes. 我们没有得到很多的西红柿，但我们已经得到了很多土豆。
  • That’s a lot of money! 这是很多的钱！

SEE> re·al·ly 真的, may·be 也许, much 许多

ODE> A large number or amount; a great deal. – a large amount, a fair amount, a good deal, a great deal, a deal, a great quantity, quantities, an abundance, a wealth, a profusion, plenty, masses.

1072. loud 响 ## 3

[laʊd]adj.大声的；吵闹的；引人注目的adv.大声地；响亮地

  • I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud enough to wake the dead. 我刚回到厨房，门铃响起，响声足以把死人唤醒。
  • After a great many loud explosions, the race began. 在好一阵喧闹的爆炸声之后，比赛开始了。
  • Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat. 在移动电话大声交谈侵入我们的思想或中断和朋友在一起轻声聊天的乐趣。

SEE> hear 听见, loud·ly 高声, nois·y 吵

ODE> Producing or capable of producing much noise. – noisy, blaring, booming, deafening, roaring, thunderous, thundering, tumultuous, clamorous, blasting, head-splitting, ear-splitting, ear-piercing, piercing.

1073. loud·ly 高声 ## 2

[laʊdli]adv.大声地；高声地；花俏地

  • They were talking loudly. 私人谈话。
  • I continued driving and after some time, the examiner tapped loudly. 我继续往前开了一段时间后，主考人砰砰地敲。

SEE> en·thu·si·as·ti·cal·ly 踊跃, loud 响, when·ev·er 每当

ODE> In a way that produces much noise. –

1074. love 爱 ## 12

[lʌv]v.爱；热爱；喜欢n.爱；热爱；爱情；恋爱；喜爱；情人；(网球)零分

  • ‘Love, Jimmy.’ “爱，吉米。”
  • I love travelling in the country, but I don’t like losing my way. 我喜欢在乡间旅行，但我不喜欢迷路。
  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。

SEE> pas·sion , al·ways 总是, lov·er 情人

ODE> An intense feeling of deep affection. – deep affection, fondness, tenderness, warmth, intimacy, attachment, endearment.

1075. love·ly 可爱 ## 8

[’lʌvli]adj.可爱的；令人愉快的；好看的

  • That is a lovely hat! 这是一个可爱的帽子！
  • It’s a lovely vase. 这是一个漂亮的花瓶。
  • Those flowers are lovely, too. 这些花也很漂亮啊。

SEE> beau·ti·ful 美丽的, gor·geous , won·der·ful 精彩的

ODE> Very beautiful or attractive. – beautiful, pretty, as pretty as a picture, attractive, good-looking, appealing, handsome, adorable, exquisite, sweet, personable, charming.

1076. low 低 ## 10

[loʊ]adj.低的；少的；低落的；低声的；卑劣的；低等的adv.低地；低声地；低下地；廉价地n.低水平；低价；低谷v.哞哞叫

  • I’m sure I’ve got a low mark. 我敢肯定，我有一个小标记。
  • In 1860, a better plan was put forward by an Englishman, William Low. 1860年，一个更好的计划是由一个英国人，名叫威廉提出。
  • After taking off, we were flying low over the city and slowly gaining height, when the plane suddenly turned round and flew back to the airport. 起飞之后，我们在城市上空低空飞行，然后慢慢爬高，当飞机突然调转头来，飞回了机场。

SEE> high 高, relatively 相对地, al·though 虽然

ODE> Of less than average height from top to bottom or to the top from the ground. – short, small, little.

1077. loy·al 忠诚 ## 3

[’lɔɪəl]adj.忠诚的；忠心的

  • But if no one can be trusted to act in a loyal and responsible manner towards his job, then the business will require armies of administrators, checkers, and foremen and administrative overheads will rise correspondingly. 但是，如果没有人能够对他的工作被信任行为的忠诚和负责任的态度，那么企业就需要管理人员，检查，和工头和管理费用的军队就会相应地增加。
  • To the extent that the people can be relied upon to behave in a loyal and responsible manner, the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order. 为了我们的人民能够在以忠诚和负责任的方式行事的依据的范围内，政府就不需要警察和公务员的军队，让他们为了。
  • The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages, but produces a cheerful, good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service. 温柔法要求在最初阶段保持较大的耐心，但产生一个开朗，好脾气的大象谁给多年的忠诚服务。

SEE> faith·ful 可信, whom 谁, sup·port·er 支持者

ODE> Giving or showing firm and constant support or allegiance to a person or institution. – faithful, true, true-hearted, tried and true, true-blue, devoted.

1078. luck 运气 ## 3

[lʌk]n.运气；幸运；侥幸v.侥幸成功；走运

  • It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he will have bad luck; if he picks a leaf, he will die. 有人说，如果有人触摸了这棵树，他将有倒霉的事。如果他摘了一片树叶，他会死。
  • What piece of bad luck prevented the Cutty Sark from winning the race? 哪块坏运气从赢得比赛防止卡蒂萨克？
  • It seemed certain that she would be the first ship home, but during the race she had a lot of bad luck. 这似乎可以肯定，她将成为第一艘家，但在比赛中她有很多运气不好的。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, an·y·way 无论如何, for·tu·nate·ly

ODE> Success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than through one’s own actions. – good fortune, good luck, success, successfulness, prosperity, advantage, advantageousness, felicity.

1079. luck·y 幸运 ## 12

[’lʌki]adj.幸运的；带来好运的

  • Aren’t you lucky! 你们真幸运！
  • Aren’t you lucky! 你们真幸运！
  • Why is Nigel a lucky man? 为什么说奈杰尔很幸运？

SEE> for·tu·nate , un·luck·y 不幸的, guess 猜测

ODE> Having, bringing, or resulting from good luck. – fortunate, in luck, blessed, blessed with good luck, favoured, born under a lucky star, charmed.

1080. lunch 午餐 ## 15

[lʌntʃ]n.午餐v.吃(午餐)；提供(午餐)

  • She always eats her lunch at noon. 她总是在正午吃午饭。
  • Sam and I had lunch together today. 我和萨姆今天一起吃的午饭。
  • We’re having lunch. 我们正在吃午饭。

SEE> din·ner 晚餐, break·fast 早餐, meal 餐

ODE> A meal eaten in the middle of the day, typically one that is lighter or less formal than an evening meal. – evening meal, supper, main meal, repast.

1081. ma·chine 机器 ## 15

[mə’ʃiːn]n.机器；做事效率高的人；工具；车辆v.以机器制造

  • A new machine called ‘The Revealer’ has been invented and it has been used to detect gold which has been buried in the ground. 一种叫“探宝器”的新机器已经发明，它已被用于检测已埋在地下的黄金。
  • The machine was used in a cave near the seashore where – it is said – pirates used to hide gold. 据说 - - 用来隐藏黄金海盗的机器是在海边附近的一个山洞里使用。
  • Armed with the new machine, a search party went into the cave hoping to find buried treasure. 随着新机的武装，搜索队进入了这个岩洞，希望找到埋藏的宝藏。

SEE> hand 手, in·stance 例子, in·stead 代替

ODE> An apparatus using mechanical power and having several parts, each with a definite function and together performing a particular task. – apparatus, appliance, instrument, tool, utensil, device, unit, contraption, contrivance, gadget, mechanism, engine, motor, lever, pulley.

1082. ma·chin·er·y 机械 ## 3

[mə’ʃiːnəri]n.机械；(总称)机器

  • There was also a great deal of machinery on display. 也有展出机械很大。
  • The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Nasmyth’s steam hammer. 其中最奇妙的上是内史密斯的蒸汽锤。
  • Justice is part of the complex machinery of the law. 正义是法律的复杂机制的组成部分。

SEE> e·quip·ment 设备, man·u·fac·ture 制造, in·dus·tri·al 产业

ODE> Machines collectively. – equipment, apparatus, hardware, plant, mechanism, gear, tackle, instruments, tools, gadgetry, technology.

1083. mad 狂 ## 5

[mæd]adj.发疯的，发狂似的；狂热的；鲁莽的；着迷的；生气的；极度激动的

  • Why do people think the writer is mad? 为什么人们认为作家是疯了吗？
  • Aeroplanes are slowly driving me mad. 飞机正在逐渐把我逼疯。
  • Everybody says I must be mad and they are probably right. 大家都说我肯定是疯了，他们可能是正确的。

SEE> cow 母牛, cra·zy 疯狂, in·deed 确实

ODE> Mentally ill; insane. – insane, mentally ill, certifiable, deranged, demented, of unsound mind, out of one’s mind, not in one’s right mind, sick in the head, not together, crazy, crazed, lunatic, non compos mentis, unbalanced, unhinged, unstable, disturbed, distracted, stark mad, manic, frenzied, raving, distraught, frantic, hysterical, delirious, psychotic, psychopathic, mad as a hatter, mad as a March hare, away with the fairies, foaming at the mouth.

1084. mag·a·zine 杂志 ## 5

[’mæɡəziːn]n.杂志；弹盘；弹药库

  • There are some magazines on the television. 有在电视上一些杂志。
  • Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics. 报纸和杂志的编辑常常走极端为了向读者提供一些无关紧要的事实和统计数字。
  • Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president’s palace in a new African republic. 去年，一位记者受一家知名杂志写在总统府的一篇文章中一个新的中非共和国。

SEE> pub·li·ca·tion 出版物, ed·i·tor 编辑, pub·lish·er

ODE> A periodical publication containing articles and illustrations, often on a particular subject or aimed at a particular readership. – journal, publication, periodical, paper, proceedings.

1085. mail 邮件 ## 2

[meɪl]n.邮件；邮政vt.邮寄

  • He agreed that a train did come into the station at the time on the paper and that it did stop, but only to take on mail, not passengers. 他认为，一列火车没有来成在纸张上的时间内站点，并说明它停止，但只采取邮件，不载旅客。
  • The porter went to fetch one and arrived back with the station master, who produced it with a flourish and pointed out a microscopic ‘o’ beside the time of the arrival of the train at his station; this little ‘o’ indicated that the train only stopped for mail. 搬运工跑回去取和到达同站主，谁一挥手，并指出了微观的“o”火车在他站的到达时间旁;这个小“O”表示，火车只停了邮件。

SEE> phone 电话, mes·sage 消息, ad·dress 地址

ODE> Letters and parcels sent by post. – post, letters, packages, parcels, correspondence, communications, airmail.

1086. main 主要 ## 17

[meɪn]adj.主要的；最重要的n.干线；总管道；[pl](水、煤、电)供应系统；大海

  • When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield. 当飞机到达时，一些侦探在主楼内等待而其他人则守候在停机坪上。
  • The pictures it sent us were very disappointing because its main mirror was faulty! 这些照片寄给我们很令人失望，因为它的主要镜子有误差。
  • Why did the police have to push Jumbo off the main street? 没有警察为什么要推巨型离主要街道？

SEE> key 钥匙, ma·jor 主要, the 该

ODE> Chief in size or importance. – principal, chief, head, leading, foremost, most important, major, ruling, dominant, central, focal, key, prime, master, premier, primary, first, high, grand, fundamental, supreme, predominant, prominent, most prominent, pre-eminent, paramount, overriding, cardinal, crucial, vital, critical, capital, pivotal, salient, elemental, essential, staple, intrinsic, urgent.

1087. main·tain 维持 ## 2

[meɪn’teɪn]vt.维持；维修；保养；坚持；断言

  • Nothing can be compared, he maintains, with the first cockcrow, the twittering of birds at dawn, the sight of the rising sun glinting on the trees and pastures. 没有什么能比的，他坚持认为，凌晨雄鸡第一声啼叫，黎明时分小鸟呢喃，眼前升起的太阳闪闪发光的树木，草场的。
  • It caused devastation by burrowing and by devouring the herbage which might have maintained millions of sheep and cattle. 它们在地下打洞，吃掉本可以饲养数百万头牛羊的牧草造成破坏。

SEE> es·tab·lish 建立, keep 保持, re·tain 保留

ODE> Cause or enable (a condition or situation) to continue. – continue, keep, keep going, keep up, keep alive, keep in existence, carry on, preserve, conserve, prolong, perpetuate, sustain, bolster, bolster up, prop up, retain, support, bear.

1088. ma·jor 主要 ## 6

[’meɪdʒər]adj.较多的；主要的；严重的；(音乐)大调的n.成年人；主修（科目）；陆军少校；举足轻重者v.主修

  • For them this is a major operation which involves considerable planning. 对他们来说，这是一个涉及到大量的规划的主要操作。
  • Newspapers exert such tremendous influence that they can not only bring about major changes to the lives of ordinary people but can even overthrow a government. 新闻具有巨大的影响力，他们不仅能带来重大的变化，对普通百姓的生活，甚至还能推翻一个政府。
  • This is a major achievement because, in relative terms, planets are very small and do not emit light. 这是一个重大的成就，因为相对来说，行星很小，而且也不发光。

SEE> sig·nif·i·cant 显著的, one 一, lead·ing 最重要的

ODE> Important, serious, or significant. – crucial, vital, great, considerable, paramount, utmost, prime, extensive.

1089. ma·jor·i·ty 多数 ## 3

[mə’dʒɔːrəti]n.大多数；多数；多数党；多数派

  • Already, orientals and Asian Americans constitute the majority of the engineering staffs at many Valley firms. 目前，东方人和亚裔美国人占了大多数的工程技术人员的硅谷许多公司中。
  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。
  • Of these the former are the majority. 这两类人占多数。

SEE> mi·nor·i·ty 少数民族, vote 投票, o·ver·whelm·ing

ODE> The greater number. – larger number, larger part, greater number, greater part, major part, best part, better part, main part, most, more than half.

1090. make 做 ## 156

[meɪk]v.做；制造；使得；赚（钱）；成功；达成n.性格；式样；制造；生产量

  • Then make the bed. 然后铺床。
  • I’m making a bookcase. 我正在做书架。
  • How do you know Sam doesn’t make the tea very often? 你怎么知道萨姆不会使茶叶往往？

SEE> come 来, take 拿取, e·ven 甚至

ODE> Form (something) by putting parts together or combining substances; create. – construct, build, assemble, put together, manufacture, produce, fabricate, create, form, fashion, model, mould, shape, forge, bring into existence.

1091. man 男人 ## 172

[mæn]n.男人；人；男子汉；情人；强者；下属v.使…振奋；为…配备人手

  • Does the man get his umbrella back? 难道男人得到他的伞回来？
  • Who is this young man? 谁是这个年轻人是谁？
  • There’s an ice cream man. 有个卖冰淇淋的。

SEE> wom·an 女人, per·son 人, an·oth·er 另一个

ODE> An adult human male. – male, adult male, gentleman, youth.

1092. man·age 管理 ## 13

[’mænɪdʒ]v.管理；经营；做成；设法对付；提供；有空

  • Though he managed to take a number of brilliant photographs, he could not stay near the volcano for very long. 虽然他设法拍摄了大量精彩的照片，他不能在火山附近停留太长的时间。
  • It threatened to surround him completely, but Tazieff managed to escape just in time. 它威胁要完全包围了他，但塔捷耶夫设法逃离了。
  • This time, he managed to climb into the mouth of Kituro so that he could take photographs and measure temperatures. 这一次，他设法爬进基图罗口，以便能拍摄照片和测试温度。

SEE> a·ble 能够, en·a·ble 使能够, help 帮助

ODE> Be in charge of (a business, organization, or undertaking); run. – be in charge of, run, be head of, head, direct, control, preside over, lead, govern, rule, command, superintend, supervise, oversee, administer, organize, conduct, handle, take forward, guide, be at the helm of.

1093. man·ag·er 经理 ## 8

[’mænɪdʒər]n.经理；管理者；管家

  • I entered the hotel manager’s office and sat down. 我走进饭店经理的办公室，坐了下来。
  • The manager was sympathetic, but he could do nothing. 这位经理表示同情，但他无能为力。
  • ‘Well,’ I said to the manager, ‘there is still some honesty in this world!’ “好吧，”我对那位经理说，“还有在这个世界上一些诚信！”

SEE> boss 老板, as·sis·tant 助理, man·age·ment 管理

ODE> A person responsible for controlling or administering an organization or group of staff. – executive, head of department, line manager, supervisor, principal, administrator, head, boss, director, managing director, employer, superintendent, foreman, forewoman, overseer.

1094. man·ner 方式 ## 4

[’mænər]n.举止；礼貌；方式；习俗

  • It is true that during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature, equipped in a manner which would make a modern climber shudder at the thought, but they did not go out of their way to court such excitement. 确实，他们在探险中他们经常遇到的困难和极具威胁性，搭载的方式，会让一个现代登山者想一想都会浑身颤栗危险，但他们没有去他们的出路，以追求刺激的。
  • We want it to stay down the hole until we can lead it off in a controlled manner. 我们希望它留在井下，直到我们能够有控制地把它放出来。
  • But if no one can be trusted to act in a loyal and responsible manner towards his job, then the business will require armies of administrators, checkers, and foremen and administrative overheads will rise correspondingly. 但是，如果没有人能够对他的工作被信任行为的忠诚和负责任的态度，那么企业就需要管理人员，检查，和工头和管理费用的军队就会相应地增加。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, sim·i·lar·ly 同样, way 方式

ODE> A way in which a thing is done or happens. – way, fashion, mode, means, method, system, style, approach, technique, procedure, process, methodology, modus operandi, form, routine, practice.

1095. man·u·fac·ture 制造 ## 3

[ˌmænju’fæktʃər]v.（手工）制造；捏造n.制造；制造业；（复）产品

  • How it came about that snakes manufactured poison is a mystery. 它是如何来到约蛇毒液是一个谜。
  • It did not; some snakes manufactured a poison different in every respect from that of others, as different as arsenic is from strychnine, and having different effects. 它没;一些蛇制造在从他人的各方面的毒物不同，因为如砒霜不同于马钱子碱，并且具有不同的效果。
  • Vipers (adders) and rattlesnakes manufacture the blood poison, which is known as haemolytic. 蝰蛇（蝮蛇）和响尾蛇产生血液毒素，这被称为溶血。

SEE> pro·duce 生产, man·u·fac·tur·er 制造商, man·u·fac·tur·ing 制造业

ODE> Make (something) on a large scale using machinery. – make, produce, mass produce, build, construct, assemble, put together, create, fabricate, prefabricate, turn out, process, form, fashion, model, mould, shape, forge, engineer.

1096. man·u·fac·tur·er 制造商 ## 3

[ˌmænju’fæktʃərər]n.制造商

  • During a radio programme, a company of biscuit manufacturers once asked listeners to bake biscuits and send them to their factory. 在一个电台节目中，一个生产饼干请听众公司烘制饼干送到他们的工厂。
  • The manufacturers had to pay more money than they had anticipated, for they bought the biscuit from the student for $24,000. 该公司不得不付出更多的钱比他们预计，他们买下那学生的饼干为$ 24,000元。
  • Gifts poured in not only from unknown people, but from baby food and soap manufacturers who wished to advertise their products. 礼品不但素昧平生的人，但婴儿食品，婴儿肥皂制造商谁希望自己的产品做广告浇英寸

SEE> mak·er , sup·pli·er , man·u·fac·ture 制造

ODE> A person or company that makes goods for sale. – maker, producer, builder, constructor, processor, creator, fabricator.

1097. man·y 许多 ## 81

[’meni]adj.许多的pron.许多人或物n.许多；许多人

  • We haven’t got many tomatoes, but we’ve got a lot of potatoes. 我们没有得到很多的西红柿，但我们已经得到了很多土豆。
  • How many cards did the writer send? 笔者没有多少卡送？
  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。

SEE> some 一些, few 少数, sev·er·al 一些

ODE> A large number of. – numerous, a good deal of, a great deal of, a lot of, a great number of, a large number of, great quantities of, plenty of, countless, innumerable, scores of, crowds of, droves of, an army of, a horde of, a multitude of, a multiplicity of, multitudinous, numberless, multiple, untold.

1098. map 地图 ## 8

[mæp]n.地图vt.绘制地图；计划

  • Glancing at his map, he informed us that the next village was a mere twenty miles away. 他瞥了一眼地图，他告诉我们，一个村庄不到20英里。
  • Bruce consulted the map once more and told us that the village was now only fifteen miles away. 布鲁斯地图再一次告诉我们，村里现在只有15英里远。
  • I stopped to let the car cool off and to study the map. 我停下车，让汽车发动机冷却一下，同时查看一下地图。

ODE> A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads, etc. – plan, chart.

1099. march 游行 ## 2

[mɑːrtʃ]n.行军；行进；游行示威；稳步前进；进行曲v.行进；前进；进发；使同行；游行示威Marchn.三月

  • Now, dressed in a blue uniform and with a rifle over his shoulder, the prisoner marched boldly up and down in front of the camp. 现在，在一个蓝色的制服，并用步枪在他的肩膀穿着，囚犯大胆进军上下在营地前。
  • In times of peace, when business was bad, Hawkwood and his men would march into a city-state and, after burning down a few farms, would offer to go away if protection money was paid to them. 在和平时期，当生意萧条时，霍克伍德和他的手下将步入一个城邦，纵火烧毁一两个农场后，将提供走开，如果保护金，支付给他们。

1100. mark 标记 ## 10

[mɑːrk]n.记号；痕迹；分数；商标v.弄污；打分；留意；做标记

  • I’m sure I’ve got a low mark. 我敢肯定，我有一个小标记。
  • As there were strange marks on the X-ray plates taken of the mummy, doctors have been trying to find out whether the woman died of a rare disease. 由于有上采取的木乃伊的X光片奇怪的标记，医生们一直试图搞清这位妇女是否死于一种罕见的疾病。
  • Pupils of the school, old and new, will be sending him a present to mark the occasion. 学校的学生，新与旧，将送他一件礼物，以纪念这个日子。

SEE> oc·ca·sion 场合, day 天, al·though 虽然

ODE> A small area on a surface having a different colour from its surroundings, typically one caused by damage or dirt. – blemish, streak, spot, fleck, dot, blot, stain, smear, trace, speck, speckle, blotch, smudge, smut, smirch, fingermark, fingerprint, impression, imprint.

1101. mar·ket 市场 ## 7

[’mɑːrkɪt]n.市场；集市v.销售；推销；买卖

  • As we had had a long walk through one of the markets of old Delhi, we stopped at a square to have a rest. 正如我们所穿过旧德里的市场之一的长走，我们停在一个广场上休息。
  • They had become the victims of commercialization, for their names had acquired a market value. 他们成了商业化的受害者，因为他们的名字具有了市场价值。
  • An electric razor that meets the European Union’s safety standards must be approved by American testers before it can be sold in the United States, and an American-made dialysis machine needs the EU’s okay before it hits the market in Europe. 符合欧盟安全标准的电动剃须刀必须得到美国检测人员的认可，方可在美国销售，和一个美国制造的透析仪也要得到欧盟的还好它击中欧洲市场之前。

SEE> stock 股票, price 价格, sell 卖

ODE> A regular gathering of people for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other commodities. – shopping centre, marketplace, mart, retail outlet, flea market, fair, bazaar, piazza, plaza.

  • Then she introduced us to Carlos and told us they would get married next week.’ 然后她把我们介绍给卡洛斯，并告诉我们说他们下星期结婚。”
  • When he got married, Alf was too embarrassed to say anything to his wife about his job. 当他结婚了，阿尔夫都不好意思说什么他对他的工作的妻子。

1103. mass 一堆 ## 6

[mæs]n.大量；块；众多adj.大规模的；群众的v.集中Mass.n.弥撒曲；弥撒

  • They will hardly know which facts to select from the great mass of evidence that steadily accumulates. 他们几乎不知道对于逐渐积累起来的庞大选取哪些。
  • This caused the construction of gigantic buildings where too large masses of human beings are crowded together. 这样就导致了人类的过大的群众都挤在一起巨大建筑的建设。
  • The slope averages about 1 in 30, but contains steep, probably vertical, cliffs, and gentle sediment-covered terraces, and near its lower reaches there is a long tailing-off which is almost certainly the result of material transported out to deep water after being eroded from the continental masses. 大约在30 1坡度平均，但其中包括陡峭的，乃至垂直的峭壁，温柔沉积物覆盖的露台，并接近其下游还有很长的拖尾过这几乎肯定是材料后运出深水结果从大陆块体被侵蚀。

SEE> in·deed 确实, de·struc·tion 毁坏, in·stance 例子

ODE> A large body of matter with no definite shape. – pile, heap, stack, clump, cloud, bunch, bundle, lump.

1104. mas·ter 主人 ## 6

[’mæstər]n.主人；硕士；专家vt.控制；精通adj.主要的；主人的；精通的

  • Two hours later, I was talking angrily to the station master at Westhaven. 两个小时后，我气呼呼地谈论到威斯特海温站长。
  • In this way self-confidence grows, first from mastering a subject, then from being able to talk about it. 这样的自信心不断增强，先是从能够谈论它掌握一门学问，那么。
  • The porter went to fetch one and arrived back with the station master, who produced it with a flourish and pointed out a microscopic ‘o’ beside the time of the arrival of the train at his station; this little ‘o’ indicated that the train only stopped for mail. 搬运工跑回去取和到达同站主，谁一挥手，并指出了微观的“o”火车在他站的到达时间旁;这个小“O”表示，火车只停了邮件。

SEE> grad·u·ate , ad·di·tion 加, in·stance 例子

ODE> A man who has people working for him, especially servants or slaves. – lord, overlord, lord and master, ruler, sovereign, monarch, liege, liege lord, suzerain.

1105. match 比赛 ## 10

[mætʃ]n.对手；火柴；比赛；配偶；般配的人v.相配；和…相配；相一致；较量

  • He knew I collected match boxes and asked me whether my collection was growing. 他知道我收集火柴盒，于是问我收藏是否在增加。
  • They quickly loaded a small rubber dinghy with food, matches, and cans of beer and rowed for a few miles across the Caribbean until they arrived at a tiny coral island. 他们迅速把小橡皮艇食物，火柴，罐装啤酒和划行加勒比海几英里，到了一座珊瑚岛上。
  • Boxing matches were very popular in England two hundred years ago. 拳击比赛在英国非常受欢迎两百年前。
