1106. ma·te·ri·al 材料 ## 9

[mə’tɪriəl]n.材料；原料；素材；资料；题材；物质adj.物质的；重要的；关键的；肉体上的；实质性的

  • We like them in the same way that we like pretty curtain material. 我们喜欢他们以同样的方式，我们喜欢漂亮的窗帘布。
  • Though it may be possible to measure the value of material goods in terms of money, it is extremely difficult to estimate the true value of the services which people perform for us. 虽然有可能来衡量物质产品的在金钱方面的价值，这是非常难以估算别人为我们所提供的服务的真正价值。
  • His few material possessions make it possible for him to move from place to place with ease. 他几乎没有什么财产，这使他能够从一个地方移动到的地方轻松。

SEE> fur·ther·more , in·stance 例子, in·deed 确实

ODE> The matter from which a thing is or can be made. – matter, substance, stuff, medium.

1107. mat·ter 物质 ## 28

[’mætər]n.事情；事态；问题；关于…的事情；物质；重要性v.有关系；要紧

  • What’s the matter, children? 出了什么事，孩子们？
  • What’s the matter? 怎么了？
  • What’s the matter with him? 什么是他的事？

SEE> fact 事实, ques·tion 问题, in·deed 确实

ODE> Physical substance in general, as distinct from mind and spirit; (in physics) that which occupies space and possesses rest mass, especially as distinct from energy. – material, substance, stuff, medium.

1108. max·i·mum 最大值 ## 3

[’mæksɪməm]n.最大量；最大限度；最高点adj.最高的；最大极限的

  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。
  • Modern industry is based on the conception of the maximum production at lowest cost, in order that an individual or a group of individuals may earn as much money as possible. 现代工业的基础上，最高产量以最低成本的概念，为了个人或一组个人可以赚取尽可能多的钱越好。
  • The shape and dimensions of the skyscrapers depend entirely on the necessity of obtaining the maximum income per square foot of ground, and of offering to the tenants offices and apartments that please them. 形状和摩天大楼的尺寸完全取决于获得每平方英尺的地面最高收入的必要性，并提供使他满意的租户办公室和住房。

SEE> min·i·mum 最低限度, lim·it 限制, a·mount 数量

ODE> As great, high, or intense as possible or permitted. – greatest, highest, biggest, largest, top, topmost, most, utmost, supreme, maximal, paramount, extreme.

1109. may 可以 ## 71

[meɪ]aux.可以，能够；可能，也许；祝，愿；会，能n.[大写] 五月

  • May I have a look at it, please? 请给我看看吧，好吗？
  • May I have one? 可以给我一个？
  • May I have a glass of beer please? 请给我一杯啤酒好吗？

SEE> May 五月, might 也许, like·ly 可能的

ODE> Expressing possibility. –

1110. meal 餐 ## 14

[miːl]n.一餐；膳食n.粗碾的谷物

  • He asked me for a meal and a glass of beer. 他问我要一顿饭和一杯啤酒。
  • I gave him a meal. 我给了他一顿饭。
  • He calls at every house in the street once a month and always asks for a meal and a glass of beer. 他呼吁在街上每月一次每家，总是要一顿饭和一杯啤酒。

SEE> eat 吃, din·ner 晚餐, break·fast 早餐

ODE> Any of the regular occasions in a day when a reasonably large amount of food is eaten. – repast, snack.

1111. mean 意思 ## 14

[miːn]v.意思是；打算；导致；意味adj.低劣的；刻薄的；卑鄙的；出色的；吝啬的；平均的；中等的n.平均值；平均数；中间；中庸

  • What does she mean by ‘change’ in the last sentence? 什么是她在最后一句“变”是什么意思？
  • That means you don’t need to water the garden. 这意味着你不必给花园浇水了。
  • It means I can have tea, instead. 这意味着我可以喝茶了。

SEE> nec·es·sar·i·ly 一定, means 手段, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Intend to convey or refer to (a particular thing); signify. – signify, convey, denote, designate, indicate, connote, show, express, spell out, stand for, represent, symbolize, imply, purport, suggest, allude to, intimate, hint at, insinuate, drive at, refer to.

1112. mean·ing 含义 ## 7

[’miːnɪŋ]n.意义；含义；重要性；价值adj.意味深长的

  • The word ‘justice’ is given two different meanings in the text. 这个词“正义”被赋予在文本两种不同的含义。
  • They had a definite meaning, for they were as near as early man could get to writing. 他们有一定的含义，因为它们已接近古代人的文字形式。
  • You play to win, and the game has little meaning unless you do your utmost to win. 你玩赢，比赛就没有什么意义，除非你竭尽全力获胜。

SEE> means 手段, hence 因此, word 单词

ODE> What is meant by a word, text, concept, or action. – definition, sense, explanation, denotation, connotation, interpretation, elucidation, explication.

1113. means 手段 ## 11

[miːnz]n.方法；手段；收入；财产v.意思是，意味（动词mean的第三人称单数）

  • Though Verrazano is by no means considered to be a great explorer, his name will probably remain immortal, for on November 21st, 1964, the longest suspension bridge in the world was named after him. 虽然维拉萨诺绝不认为是一个伟大的探险家，他的名字将流芳百世，对1964年11月21日，世界上最长的吊桥是以他的名字命名的。
  • This pressure must be under control, and we control it by means of the mud which we circulate down the drill pipe. 这种压力必须加以控制，我们通过我们循环钻杆向下泥浆的方法来控制。
  • Knowledge began to increase as soon as the thoughts of one individual could be communicated to another by means of speech. 知识开始作为一个独立的思想可以通过语言同别人交流，以尽快提高。

SEE> mean·ing 含义, hence 因此, thus 如此

ODE> An action or system by which a result is achieved; a method. – method, way, manner, mode, measure, fashion, process, procedure, technique, expedient, agency, medium, instrument, mechanism, channel, vehicle, avenue, course.

1114. mean·while 与此同时 ## 10

[’miːnwaɪl]adv.其间；同时

  • Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been. 与此同时，我的舌头正在忙着寻找我拔掉牙的那个洞。
  • Meanwhile, two other actors, Rockwall Slinger and Merlin Greeves, had carried two large food baskets to a shady spot under some trees. 与此同时，另外两位演员，罗克沃尔。斯林格和默林。格里夫斯，已经树下两个大食品篮子荫凉的地方。
  • Meanwhile, a number of university students have volunteered to drive buses while the strike lasts. 与此同时，许多大学生自愿在罢工期间驾驶公共汽车。

SEE> mean·time , while 当的时候, al·so 也

ODE> In the intervening period of time. – for now, for the moment, for the present, for the time being, meantime, in the meantime, in the intervening period, in the interim, in the interval, in the meanwhile, the while, temporarily.

1115. meas·ure 测量 ## 4

[’meʒər]n.措施；量度；尺寸；程度；办法v.测量；比较；给予；权衡

  • This time, he managed to climb into the mouth of Kituro so that he could take photographs and measure temperatures. 这一次，他设法爬进基图罗口，以便能拍摄照片和测试温度。
  • Though it may be possible to measure the value of material goods in terms of money, it is extremely difficult to estimate the true value of the services which people perform for us. 虽然有可能来衡量物质产品的在金钱方面的价值，这是非常难以估算别人为我们所提供的服务的真正价值。
  • A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom, and by measuring the time interval between the taps and the receipt of the echoes, the depth of the sea at that point can be calculated. 通过敲击一个船体发出的声音将被反射从海底，并通过测量抽头和接收回波之间的时间间隔，海的在该点的深度可以计算出来。

SEE> leg·is·la·tion , in·stance 例子, pro·vi·sion

ODE> Ascertain the size, amount, or degree of (something) by using an instrument or device marked in standard units. – take the measurements of, calculate, compute, estimate, count, meter, quantify, weigh, size, evaluate, rate, assess, appraise, gauge, plumb, measure out, determine, judge, survey.

1116. meat 肉 ## 6

[miːt]n.肉；主要或重要部分

  • Do you want any meat today. 你想今天所有的肉。
  • We need some meat. 我们需要些肉。
  • We haven’t got any meat at all. 我们没有在所有有任何肉类。

SEE> beef 牛肉, pork , chick·en 鸡

ODE> The flesh of an animal, typically a mammal or bird, as food (the flesh of domestic fowls is sometimes distinguished as poultry) – flesh, muscle.

1117. med·i·cal 医学的 ## 7

[’medɪkl]adj.医疗的；医学的；医药的；内科的

  • Recently the New York Animal Medical Centre made a study of 132 cats over a period of five months. 最近，纽约动物医疗中心历时五个月由132只猫进行研究。
  • You forget that I was a medical student once upon a time.’ 你忘了我以前是学医仙界“。
  • The Americans would happily reach one accord on standards for medical devices and then hammer out different pacts covering, say, electronic goods and drug manufacturing. 美国人很愿意就医疗器械的标准达成一个协议，然后推敲出不同的合同，用以涵盖，比如说 - 电子产品和药品的生产。

SEE> hos·pi·tal 医院, med·i·cine 医学, care 关心

ODE> Relating to the science or practice of medicine. – technological, technical.

1118. med·i·cine 医学 ## 8

[’medsn]n.药；医学

  • George studied medicine in his youth. 乔治年轻时学过医。
  • This is a sceptical age, but although our faith in many of the things in which our forefathers fervently believed has weakened, our confidence in the curative properties of the bottle of medicine remains the same as theirs. 这是一个怀疑一切的时代，可是虽然我们中的许多，使我们的祖先笃信的事情的信心有所减弱，我们对瓶装药品疗效的信心仍与祖先一样。
  • This modern faith in medicines is proved by the fact that the annual drug bill of the Health Services is mounting to astronomical figures and shows no signs at present of ceasing to rise. 这现代人对药物是由卫生部门的年度药费在停止上涨的目前安装到天文数字，且没有迹象事实证明。

SEE> med·i·cal 医学的, stud·y 研究, doc·tor 医生

ODE> The science or practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease (in technical use often taken to exclude surgery) – medical science, practice of medicine, healing, therapeutics, therapy, treatment, healing art.

1119. meet 遇见 ## 27

[miːt]v.遇见；满足n.运动会；集会adj.合适的

  • Nice to meet you. 很高兴见到你。
  • Nice to meet you. 很高兴见到你。
  • Nice to meet you. 很高兴见到你。

SEE> meet·ing 会议, dis·cuss 讨论, next 下一个

ODE> Arrange or happen to come into the presence or company of (someone) – encounter, meet up with, come face to face with, make contact with, run across, run into, come across, come upon, chance on, happen on, light on, stumble across, stumble on.

1120. meet·ing 会议 ## 3

[’miːtɪŋ]n.会议；集会；汇合动词meet的现在分词.

  • ‘Fancy meeting you here!’ “真想不到你在这里！”
  • Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat. 在移动电话大声交谈侵入我们的思想或中断和朋友在一起轻声聊天的乐趣。
  • Soon the hobby leads to travel, perhaps to a meeting in another town, possibly a trip abroad in search of a rare specimen, for collectors are not confined to any one country. 不久，有这种爱好旅行，也许是去另一个城市参加会议，可能是在寻找一件珍品的出国，因为收藏家是不局限于任何一个国家。

SEE> con·fer·ence 会议, meet 遇见, dis·cuss 讨论

ODE> An assembly of people for a particular purpose, especially for formal discussion. – gathering, assembly, conference, congregation, convention, summit, forum, convocation, conclave, council of war.

1121. mem·ber 成员 ## 4

[’membər]n.成员；会员；部分

  • You know he’s a member of the Y.H.A. 你知道他是Y.H.A.成员
  • The police were called in, but they could not arrest anyone, for the basket contained two Members of Parliament and the Commanding Officer of the station! 警察被召来了，但他们却不能逮捕任何人，因为筐里议会和站指挥官的两名成员！
  • Instead of being five new family members, these children had immediately become a commodity. 而不是5名新的家庭成员，这些孩子立即成了商品。

SEE> join 连接, al·so 也, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A person, animal, or plant belonging to a particular group. – constituent, element, component, part, portion, piece, unit, factor, feature, attribute.

1122. mem·o·ry 记忆 ## 4

[’meməri]n.记忆力；回忆；记忆；[计]存储

  • When he died at the age of eighty, the Florentines gave him a state funeral and had a picture painted which was dedicated to the memory of ‘the most valiant soldier and most notable leader, Signor Giovanni Haukodue’. 当他80岁那年死去时，佛罗伦萨人为他举行了国葬，并曾画了一幅画这是献给“最英勇的战士，最显着的领先地位，贝卢斯科尼乔瓦尼Haukodue”的记忆。
  • Whatever the source of noise, one thing is certain: silence, it seems, has become a golden memory. 不管噪声来自何方，有一点是肯定的：看来寂静，已经成为一种珍贵的回忆。
  • He had lived in it as a child when it was already disappearing, and his hero was firmly rooted in his memories and experiences, and in both the history and the mythology of the vanished frontier. 他住在它作为一个孩子正在消失，他塑造的英雄人物深深地扎根在他的记忆和经验，并在历史和消失前沿的神话之中。

SEE> in·stance 例子, re·mem·ber 记得, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> The faculty by which the mind stores and remembers information. – ability to remember, powers of recall, recall, powers of retention, retention, mind.

1123. men·tal 精神的 ## 8

[’mentl]adj.思想的；心理的；精神的；脑力的n.精神病患者

  • As they grow old, people also accumulate belongings for two other reasons, lack of physical and mental energy, both of which are essential in turning out and throwing away, and sentiment. 当他们老去，人们也积累财物其他两个原因，缺乏体力，精力的，这两者都是在清理和扔掉，而情绪是至关重要的。
  • In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected. 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人的生理和精神状态的影响完全被忽视了。
  • One allegation often made is that noise produces mental illness. 常见的一种指责是，噪音能引起精神病。

SEE> phys·i·cal 物理的, ill·ness 疾病, psy·cho·log·i·cal

ODE> Relating to the mind. – intellectual, cerebral, brain, rational, psychological, cognitive, abstract, conceptual, theoretical.

1124. men·tal·ly 精神上 ## 3

[’mentəli]adv.精神上；智力上；心理上

  • Mentally, at least, most of us could compile formidable lists of ‘dos’ and ‘don’ts’. 弱智，至少在大多数人的心里会编排“DOS”和“注意事项”的令人生畏的单子。
  • What is needed in the case of noise is a study of large numbers of people living under noisy conditions, to discover whether they are mentally ill more often than other people are. 我们需要在噪音的情况下是大量的噪声条件下生活的人，的研究，发现他们是否是精神病患者往往比其他人。
  • He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself; he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight; he realizes its volume, as the space that the shape displaces in the air. 他的大脑从全面本身就是一个复杂的形式;他知道当他看着一面是什么对方等;他把自己与形体的重心，它的质量，它的重量;他意识到物体的体积，其形状在空气中所占的空间。

SEE> phys·i·cal·ly 身体上, e·mo·tion·al·ly 感情上, dis·turbed

ODE> In a manner relating to the mind. – in one’s mind, in the mind, in one’s brain, in the brain, in one’s head, in the head, inwardly, intellectually, cerebrally, cognitively, psychologically, psychically.

1125. men·tion 提到 ## 6

[’menʃn]vt.提到；说起n.提及；说起

  • Because the tree was mentioned in a newspaper, the number of visitors to Frinley has now increased. 因为树是在报上提到，来弗林利参观的人数已经增加。
  • Most of my friends live in the city, yet they always go into raptures at the mere mention of the country. 我的大多数朋友都住在城市，但他们都会兴高采烈在国家色变。
  • My friend fails to mention the long and friendless winter evenings in front of the TV – virtually the only form of entertainment. 我的朋友没有提到在电视机前度过的漫长寂寞的冬夜 - 几乎是唯一的娱乐形式。

SEE> in·deed 确实, nei·ther 两者都不, be·sides

ODE> Refer to (something) briefly and without going into detail. – allude to, refer to, touch on, touch upon, speak briefly of, hint at.

1126. mer·e 仅仅 ## 8

[mɪr]adj.仅仅的；纯粹的

  • He has often described to me how he picked up a masterpiece for a mere ￡50. 他多次向我详细讲他如何拿起一件杰作仅£50。
  • It went direct from my local station and the journey lasted a mere hour and seventeen minutes. 它接着直接从我的本地站的旅程仅仅持续了一个小时17分钟。
  • Glancing at his map, he informed us that the next village was a mere twenty miles away. 他瞥了一眼地图，他告诉我们，一个村庄不到20英里。

SEE> mere·ly 仅仅, on·ly 只有, just 刚刚

ODE> Used to emphasize how small or insignificant someone or something is. – trifling, meagre, bare, trivial, paltry, basic, scant, scanty, skimpy, minimal, slender.

1127. mere·ly 仅仅 ## 5

[’mɪrli]adv.仅仅；只不过

  • He is now satisfied merely to try to stand up, but as soon as he does so a porpoise knocks him flat. 他现在仅仅满足于试图站起来，但只要他这样做一只海豚击倒了他平坦。
  • Poison to a snake is merely a luxury; it enables it to get its food with very little effort, no more effort than one bite. 毒液对蛇仅仅是一种奢侈;这使得它能够获得它的食物用很少的努力，轻咬一口没有更多的努力。
  • But, if this world is not merely a bad joke, life a vulgar flare amid the cool radiance of the stars, and existence an empty laugh braying across the mysteries; if these intimations of a something behind and beyond are not evil humour born of indigestion, or whimsies sent by the devil to mock and madden us, if, in a word, beauty means something, yet we must not seek to interpret the meaning. 但是，如果这个世界不只是一个拙劣的恶作剧，生活庸俗火炬惨淡的星光里的清凉四射，并且存在一个空虚的笑声奥秘马叫;如果后面的东西的暗示和超越都没有邪念的，或者不是一种魔鬼送来嘲笑我们并使我们发狂，如果在一个字，美指什么，但我们千万不要去阐明它的意义邪念。

SEE> sim·ply 只是, ra·ther 相当, fact 事实

ODE> Just; only. – only, purely, solely, simply, entirely, just, but.

1128. mess 混乱 ## 4

[mes]n.混乱；混杂；脏乱；一份食品；粪便；（军队的）食堂v.弄糟；弄乱；妨碍

  • Excuse the mess, Sam. 请问残局，山姆。
  • What a mess! 真是一团糟！
  • ‘How did your clothes get into such a mess?’ “怎么你的衣服怎么这么乱？

SEE> mess·y , sort 种类, aw·ful 糟糕的

ODE> A dirty or untidy state of things or of a place. – untidiness, disorder, disarray, clutter, heap, shambles, litter, tangle, jumble, muddle, mishmash, chaos, confusion, disorganization, turmoil.

1129. mes·sage 消息 ## 8

[’mesɪdʒ]n.消息；信息；要点；寓意v.传递信息；通讯

  • Yesterday, a pigeon carried the first message from Pinhurst to Silbury. 昨天，鸽子把第一消息从树丛到梳。
  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。
  • Fortunately, a pilot saw the signal and sent a message by radio to the nearest town. 幸运的是，一位飞行员看到这个信号，用无线电发送消息到最近的城镇。

SEE> let·ter 信件, in·deed 确实, clear·ly 清楚地

ODE> A verbal, written, or recorded communication sent to or left for a recipient who cannot be contacted directly. – communication, piece of information, news, word, note, memorandum, memo, email, posting, tweet, letter, line, missive, report, bulletin, communiqué, dispatch, intelligence, notification, announcement.

1130. met·al 金属 ## 8

[’metl]n.金属；合金；玻璃液vt.(以金属)覆盖、装配

  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。
  • The actual figure was made of copper supported by a metal framework which had been especially constructed by Eiffel. 实际数字是由通过已经由艾菲尔特制的金属框架支撑铜。
  • Lined up against the wall, there were long thin wires attached to metal spheres. 一字排开靠墙，有附着于金属球长细线。

SEE> steel 钢, i·ron 铁, plas·tic 塑料

ODE> A solid material which is typically hard, shiny, malleable, fusible, and ductile, with good electrical and thermal conductivity (e.g. iron, gold, silver, and aluminium, and alloys such as steel) – rail, line.

1131. meth·od 方法 ## 10

[’meθəd]n.方法；条理n.类函数；类成员函数（计算机）

  • We keep trying all four methods, but the sheer volume of rubbish we produce worldwide threatens to overwhelm us. 我们一直在试这四种方法，但垃圾的绝对数量，我们的全球生产威胁压倒我们。
  • Industrialized farming methods produce cheap meat products: beef, pork and chicken. 工业化的农作方式生产出廉价的肉类制品 - 牛肉，猪肉和鸡肉。
  • The ants had been quick to find an answer to my thoroughly unscientific methods! 蚂蚁已很快找到了答案，我完全不科学的办法！

SEE> tech·nique 技术, ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子

ODE> A particular procedure for accomplishing or approaching something, especially a systematic or established one. – procedure, technique, system, practice, routine, modus operandi, method of working, formula, process, means, medium, mechanism.

1132. me·tre 米 ## 2

[’miːtər]n.米；公尺；计量器n.（诗的）韵律；格律=meter(美).

  • At 2,473 metres, it is the highest mountain pass in Europe. 海拔2,473 O米，是最高的山口在欧洲。
  • Mrs. Richards realized that it must be the man from the Electricity Board who had come to read the metre. 理查兹夫人这才想到一定是供电局的人谁曾来查电表。

ODE> The SI base unit of length (equivalent to approximately 39.37 inches), first introduced as a unit of length in the metric system. – yardstick, test, standard, norm, barometer, touchstone, litmus test, criterion, benchmark.

1133. mid·dle 中间 ## 6

[’mɪdl]adj.中等的；中间的；中期的n.中间vt.放在中间；把 … 对折

  • There is a table in the middle of the room. 有一个在屋子中间一张桌子。
  • Late in the afternoon, the boys put up their tent in the middle of a field. 傍晚时分，孩子们搭起了帐篷在野外的中间。
  • In the middle of the night, two boys woke up and began shouting. 在半夜里，两个孩子醒了，大声叫了。

SEE> east 东, part 部分, be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> The point or position at an equal distance from the sides, edges, or ends of something. – centre, mean, median, mid point, halfway point, dead centre, focal point, focus, hub, nucleus, midst.

1134. mid·night 午夜 ## 2

[’mɪdnaɪt]n.午夜；漆黑

  • I even went out at midnight with a torch and noted with satisfaction (and surprise) that the ants were still swarming around the sticky tape without being able to do anything about it. 我甚至出去半夜用火炬，满意地（同时惊奇地）发现那些蚂蚁还围着胶带团团转，却无法做任何事情地指出。
  • In a heat wave we choose a midnight birthday party and that is the most exciting of all. 天气炎热时，我们便选择在半夜生日派对，这是最令人激动的。

SEE> noon , short·ly 不久, night 晚

ODE> Twelve o’clock at night. – twelve midnight, twelve at night, twelve o’clock, dead of night, the middle of the night, zero hours, the witching hour.

1135. might 也许 ## 35

[maɪt]aux.可能；也许；may的过去式n.威力；力量

  • We might not go anywhere. 我们可能不会去任何地方。
  • At her London Hotel today Miss Marsh told reporters she might retire. 在伦敦旅馆，今天马什小姐告诉记者她可能要退休。
  • ‘I might as well have them,’ I said sadly. “我还不如他们，”我垂头丧气地说。

SEE> could 可以, would 将, like·ly 可能的

ODE> Used in reported speech, to express possibility or permission. – strength, force, power.

1136. mild 温和 ## 2

[maɪld]adj.温和的；柔和的；宽大的；清淡的

  • It’s mild, but it’s not always pleasant. 这是温和的，但它并不总是愉快的。
  • Over the periods their saliva, a mild, digestive juice like our own, was converted into a poison that defies analysis even today. 经过漫长的时间他们的唾液，一种温和的消化液像我们自己，被改装成毒仍无法分析即使到了今天。

SEE> se·vere 严重的, un·u·su·al·ly 异常, sur·pris·ing·ly 出奇

ODE> Not severe, serious, or harsh. – lenient, clement, light.

1137. mile 英里 ## 49

[maɪl]n.英里；海里；一英里赛跑

  • You must have been driving at seventy miles an hour. 你必须一直开着，在每小时70英里的。
  • Pinhurst is only five miles from Silbury, but Mr. Scott cannot get a telephone for his new garage, so he has just bought twelve pigeons. 松树丛离锡尔伯里只有5英里，但斯科特先生不能为他新的汽车修理部搞到一部电话机，所以他买了只鸽子。
  • During that time she covered a distance of eight miles. 在那段时间里，她的8英里。

SEE> kil·o·me·ter , stretch 伸展, dis·tance 距离

ODE> A unit of linear measure equal to 1,760 yards (approximately 1.609 kilometres). – a large amount, a fair amount, a good deal, a great deal, a deal, a great quantity, quantities, an abundance, a wealth, a profusion, plenty, masses.

1138. mil·i·tar·y 军事 ## 2

[’mɪləteri]adj.军事的n.军队

  • Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations. 这种活动需要精确的规划和远见的军事行动。
  • King Gustavus Adolphus, ‘The Northern Hurricane’, then at the height of his military success in the Thirty Years’ War, had dictated her measurements and armament. 国王古斯塔夫·阿道夫，“北方飓风”，然后在他在三十年战争的军事成功的高度，他亲自规定了测量和军备。

SEE> ar·my 军队, ci·vil·ian , force 力

ODE> Relating to or characteristic of soldiers or armed forces. – fighting, service, army, armed, defence, warrior, soldierly, soldier-like, martial.

1139. milk 牛奶 ## 6

[mɪlk]n.奶；牛奶；乳汁v.挤乳；产乳；榨取

  • A bottle of milk. 一瓶牛奶。
  • Do you want any milk? 你想要的任何牛奶吗？
  • I don’t like milk in my coffee. 我不喜欢在我的咖啡牛奶。

SEE> dair·y , yo·gurt , but·ter 黄油

ODE> An opaque white fluid rich in fat and protein, secreted by female mammals for the nourishment of their young. – cow juice.

1140. mil·lion 百万 ## 15

[’mɪljən]n.百万；群众adj.无数的；百万的

  • There were six million visitors in all, and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges. 有是600万人次，并从博览会的赢利用来建造博物馆和高等学校。
  • Ever since then, the great monument has been a symbol of liberty for the millions of people who have passed through New York Harbour to make their homes in America. 从那时起，这座伟大的纪念碑一直是自由的数以百万计的人谁已通过纽约港进入他们在美国的千家万户的象征。
  • Radio and television have made it possible for advertisers to capture the attention of millions of people in this way. 电台，电视使我们能够为广告主吸引千百万人的注意以这种方式。

SEE> bil·lion 十亿的, es·ti·mat·ed , worth 值得

ODE> The number equivalent to the product of a thousand and a thousand; 1,000,000 or 10⁶ – a lot of money, a fortune, a considerable sum of money, a vast sum of money, millions, billions, a king’s ransom, a killing, a windfall, a bonanza.

1141. mind 心神 ## 19

[maɪnd]n.头脑；精神；心；想法；意见；心思；注意力；有才智的人；记忆；心情；理智；[宗]追思弥撒；上帝v.留心；注意；专心于；介意；照顾

  • We can’t make up our minds. 我们不能让我们的头脑。
  • I can’t make up my mind. 我不能让我的心灵。
  • She said she couldn’t make up her mind. 她说，她不能弥补她的头脑。

SEE> else 其他, some·thing 某物, sort 种类

ODE> The element of a person that enables them to be aware of the world and their experiences, to think, and to feel; the faculty of consciousness and thought. – brain, intelligence, intellect, intellectual capabilities, mental capacity, brains, brainpower, wits, wit, powers of reasoning, powers of comprehension, powers of thought, understanding, reasoning, judgement, sense, mentality, perception.

1142. mine 我的 ## 7

[maɪn]pron.我的n.矿；地雷；矿藏v.采矿；用地雷炸

  • No, that’s not mine. 不，这不是我的。
  • It happened to a friend of mine a year ago. 它发生在我的一个朋友一年前。
  • Six men have been trapped in a mine for seventeen hours. 六名男子已经被困在矿井十七小时。

SEE> min·ing , coal 煤, min·er

ODE> Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with the speaker. – pit, colliery, excavation, quarry, workings, diggings, lode, vein, seam, deposit, shaft, mineshaft.

1143. min·is·ter 部长 ## 3

[’mɪnɪstər]n.外交使节；部长；大臣；牧师v.照顾；给予帮助

  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • After the elections, Patrick went to the former Prime Minister’s house. 大选结束后，帕特里克来到了前首相的房子。
  • When he asked if Mr. Lane lived there, the policeman on duty told him that since his defeat, the ex-Prime Minister had gone abroad. 当他询问莱恩先生是否住在那里时，值班的警察告诉他，因为他的失败，前首相出国去了。

SEE> prime , cab·i·net 内阁, min·is·try 部

ODE> (in certain countries) a head of a government department. – member of the government, political leader, cabinet minister, secretary of state, secretary, undersecretary, department head, privy counsellor, politician.

1144. min·is·try 部 ## 2

[’mɪnɪstri]n.(政府的)部；内阁；(全体)牧师

  • This was later confirmed by a naval official at the Ministry of Defence after the Elkor had returned home. 这是后来由国防部一位海军官员证实了Elkor回家后。
  • Vera’s curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives, and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic. 维拉的好奇人才被带到一个科研单位在乌里扬诺夫斯克镇的通知，她家附近，并在4月，她被俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对一系列的测试。

SEE> of·fi·cial 官方, say·ing , mean·while 与此同时

ODE> (in certain countries) a government department headed by a minister. – government department, department, bureau, agency, office.

1145. mi·nute 分钟 ## 29

[’mɪnɪt]n.分钟；片刻；备忘；会议记录adj.微小的；仔细的vt.记录

  • Can you come here a minute please, Bob? 你能来一下好吗？鲍勃？
  • At nineteen minutes past eight. 在八时十九分。
  • It’s only three minutes to eight. 这只是七时五十七。

SEE> half 半, kick 踢, sub·sti·tute 替代

ODE> A period of time equal to sixty seconds or a sixtieth of an hour. – moment, short time, little while, second, bit, instant.

1146. mir·ror 镜子 ## 5

[’mɪrər]n.镜子；反映vt.反映；反射

  • ‘You needn’t be so rude about it,’ my wife answered as she looked at herself in the mirror. “你不必这样不客气，”我妻子回答，她看着镜子里的自己。
  • We had been in the hat shop for half an hour and my wife was still in front of the mirror. 我们已经在这家帽店半个多小时，我的妻子仍在镜子面前。
  • The pictures it sent us were very disappointing because its main mirror was faulty! 这些照片寄给我们很令人失望，因为它的主要镜子有误差。

SEE> re·flec·tion , in·stance 例子, like·wise

ODE> A surface, typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, which reflects a clear image. – looking glass, reflector, reflecting surface.

1147. miss 错过 ## 18

[mɪs]n.[M-]小姐vt.想念vt.错过；漏掉

  • This is Miss Sophie Dupont. 这是索菲娅。杜邦小姐。
  • I’ll miss him. 我会想念他的。
  • We’ll all miss him. 我们都会想念他的。

SEE> Miss , un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, a·gain 再次

ODE> Fail to hit, reach, or come into contact with (something aimed at) – fail to hit, be wide of, go wide of, fall short of.

1148. mis·take 错误 ## 10

[mɪ’steɪk]n.错误；误会；过失v.误解；弄错

  • This letter’s full of mistakes. 这封信是错误百出。
  • What mistake was made? 什么搞错了？
  • However, a few days later, he was told that a mistake had been made. 然而，几天后，他被告知，弄错了。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, wrong 错误, sim·ply 只是

ODE> An act or judgement that is misguided or wrong. – error, fault, inaccuracy, omission, slip, blunder, miscalculation, misunderstanding, flaw, oversight, misinterpretation, fallacy, gaffe, faux pas, solecism, misapprehension, misconception, misreading.

1149. mo·bile 移动 ## 2

[’moʊbl]adj.移动的；易变的；活动的n.汽车；可动雕塑；悬挂饰物；活动物体

  • A lot of people object to mobile phones, especially when they are used in public places like restaurants or on public transport. 很多人反对手机，尤其是当他们在公共场所如饭店，公共交通使用。
  • Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat. 在移动电话大声交谈侵入我们的思想或中断和朋友在一起轻声聊天的乐趣。

ODE> Able to move or be moved freely or easily. – able to move, able to move around, moving, walking, ambulant, ambulatory.

1150. mod·el 模型 ## 8

[’mɑːdl]n.模范；模特儿；模型adj.模范的；作模型用的v.做模型；模仿；塑造

  • It’s the most expensive model in the shop. 这是店里最贵的型号。
  • This model’s less expensive than that one. 这种模式比那种要便宜些。
  • I don’t like this model. 我不喜欢这种模式。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, con·cept 概念, in·stance 例子

ODE> A three-dimensional representation of a person or thing or of a proposed structure, typically on a smaller scale than the original. – replica, copy, representation, mock-up, dummy, imitation, double, duplicate, lookalike, reproduction.

1151. mod·ern 现代的 ## 33

[’mɑːdərn]adj.现代的；时髦的n.现代人；时尚人士

  • It is a very modern house, so it looks strange to some people. 这是一个非常现代化的住宅，所以它看起来奇怪，一些人。
  • It must be the only modern house in the district. 它必须是唯一的一栋现代化住宅小区。
  • Many people pretend that they understand modern art. 很多人装成很懂现代艺术。

SEE> con·tem·po·rar·y 当代, un·like 不像, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> Relating to the present or recent times as opposed to the remote past. – present-day, contemporary, present-time, present, current, twenty-first-century, latter-day, recent, latest.

1152. mo·ment 时刻 ## 30

[’moʊmənt]n.片刻；瞬间；力矩；非常重要的时机；准确时刻

  • At the moment, they are playing in the garden. 目前，他们正在花园里玩。
  • At the moment, he’s reading an interesting book. 目前，他正在读有趣的书。
  • The dentist is very busy at the moment. 牙科医生这会儿很忙。

SEE> in·deed 确实, thing 事情, per·haps 也许

ODE> A very brief period of time. – little while, short time, bit, minute, second, instant, split second.

1153. mon·ey 钱 ## 67

[’mʌni]n.财产；钱；货币

  • I hope that you’ve got some money. 我希望你还有钱。
  • That’s a lot of money! 这是很多的钱！
  • We can’t afford all that money. 我们负担不起那么多钱。

SEE> cash 现金, a·mount 数量, pay 支付

ODE> A current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes; coins and banknotes collectively. – cash, hard cash, ready money.

1154. month 月 ## 25

[mʌnθ]n.月，月份

  • But my sister bought this pair last month. 但是，我姐姐上个月买到了这样的一双。
  • No, she bought them in the U.S. We had some shoes like those a month ago, but we don’t have any now. 不，她买了他们在美国我们有这样的鞋在一个月前，但我们没有任何现在。
  • He will fly to New York next month. 他将飞往纽约下个月。

SEE> week 周, last 最后的, year 年

ODE> Each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided. – a long time, a lifetime, an eternity, seemingly forever.

1155. moon 月亮 ## 9

[muːn]n.月亮；月球v.闲逛；虚度；露光臀示人

  • They have found that it is connected with the passage of days and the phases of the moon. 他们发现，与昼夜更迭和月亮的相位连接。
  • We can perhaps forgive those who said the moons of Jupiter were produced by Galileo’s spyglass if we recall that in his day, as for centuries before, curved glass was the popular contrivance for producing not truth but illusion, untruth; and if a single curved glass would distort nature, how much more would a pair of them? 我们或许可以原谅那些谁说，木星的卫星是由伽利略的望远镜产生的，如果我们还记得，在他的一天，几个世纪前，弧形玻璃是用于生产不是真理，而是幻觉，谎言流行的诡计;如果一个单一的曲面玻璃会扭曲性质，多少那么一对他们的？
  • The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System, supplying the rocket fuels for its ships, easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen. 月亮很可能成为太阳系的工业中心，其船舶，从在液态氧的形式月球上的岩石易于获得供给火箭燃料。

SEE> earth 地球, plan·et 行星, in·deed 确实

ODE> The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun. – satellite.

1156. mor·al 道德 ## 2

[’mɔːrəl]adj.道德的；精神上的n.寓意；道德；品行；伦理

  • Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training, for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer. 除了任何道义问题，这是一种愚蠢的训练方法，因为这种方法愤懑动物谁在后一阶段可能会变成杀手。
  • Moral? 道德？

SEE> eth·i·cal , con·science , sense 感

ODE> Concerned with the principles of right and wrong behaviour. – virtuous, good, righteous, upright, upstanding, high-minded, right-minded, principled, proper, honourable, honest, just, noble, incorruptible, scrupulous, respectable, decent, irreproachable, truthful, law-abiding, clean-living, chaste, pure, blameless, sinless.

1157. more 更多 ## 132

[mɔːr]pron.更多的；另外的；更大的adv.更多；再；另外；进一步

  • Would you like some more? 你想多一些？
  • Eat more and smoke less! 多吃点，少抽点！
  • The other model’s more expensive, but it’s worth the money. 另一种模式是更昂贵，但它是值得的钱。

SEE> than 比, less 减, e·ven 甚至

ODE> A greater or additional amount or degree of. – additional, further, added, extra, increased, fresh, new, other, supplementary, supplemental, spare, alternative.

1158. more·o·ver 此外 ## 2

[mɔːr’oʊvər]adv.此外；而且

  • Moreover, unlike some of the other insect eaters, spiders never do the least harm to us or our belongings. 此外，不同于其他食虫动物，蜘蛛丝毫不危害我们和我们的财物。
  • Moreover, as soon as new knowledge is acquired, it is now turned to practical account. 此外，一旦新知识一旦获得，现在转向实际应用。

SEE> fur·ther·more , like·wise , in·deed 确实

ODE> As a further matter; besides. – besides, furthermore, what’s more, in addition, also, as well, too, to boot, additionally, on top of that, over and above that, into the bargain, at that, more.

1159. morn·ing 早上 ## 49

[’mɔːrnɪŋ]n.早晨；上午；开端

  • Good morning. 早上好。
  • Good morning, Mr. Blake. 早上好，布莱克先生。
  • In the morning, Mr. Sawyer goes to work and the children go to school. 早上，索耶先生去上班，孩子们去上学。

SEE> af·ter·noon 下午, eve·ning 晚间, Fri·day 星期五

ODE> The period of time between midnight and noon, especially from sunrise to noon. – before noon, before lunch, before lunchtime, a.m..

1160. most 最 ## 85

[moʊst]adj.最多的；大多数的adv.最；最多；极其pron.大多数；大部分n.最多

  • It’s the most expensive model in the shop. 这是店里最贵的型号。
  • Why is Joe’s garden the most beautiful one in the town? 为什么乔的花园最漂亮的小镇？
  • Joe Sanders has the most beautiful garden in our town. 桑德斯拥有我们镇上最漂亮的花园。

SEE> man·y 许多, es·pe·cial·ly 特别, par·tic·u·lar·ly 尤其

ODE> Greatest in amount, quantity, or degree. – nearly all, almost all, the greatest number, the greatest part, the greatest quantity, the majority, the bulk, the lion’s share, the mass, the preponderance.

1161. moth·er 母亲 ## 13

[’mʌðər]n.母亲；妈妈adj.母亲的；母体的；本源的vt.生育；像母亲一样关爱

  • Why do the children thank their mother? 为什么孩子们向母亲致谢？
  • We’re going to stay at my mother’s for the weekend. 我们将留在我母亲的周末。
  • I said, ’This is Pauline’s mother. 我说，“这是波琳的母亲。
