1257. op·er·ate 操作 ## 2

[’ɑːpəreɪt]v.操作；运转；经营；动手术

  • The only way to do this was to operate. 要做到这一点的唯一方法就是手术。
  • When lights fuse, furniture gets rickety, pipes get clogged, or vacuum cleaners fail to operate, some women assume that their husbands will somehow put things right. 当电灯保险丝烧断，家具榫头松动，管道堵塞，吸尘器不动时，有些妻子认为丈夫总会设法修好的。

SEE> al·low 允许, en·a·ble 使能够, a·ble 能够

ODE> (of a person) control the functioning of (a machine, process, or system) – work, make go, run, set off, use, utilize, employ, handle, control, wield, ply, manage, be in charge of.

1258. op·er·a·tion 手术 ## 12

[ˌɑːpə’reɪʃn]n.操作；运转；经营；行动；手术；运算；生效；（复）运筹学

  • While John Gilbert was in hospital, he asked his doctor to tell him whether his operation had been successful, but the doctor refused to do so. 当约翰吉尔伯特住院的时候，他问医生告诉他，他的手术是否成功，但医生拒绝这样做。
  • He asked if Mr. Gilbert’s operation had been successful and the doctor told him that it had been. 他问吉尔伯特先生的手术非常成功，医生告诉他，它一直。
  • has just had an operation. 刚刚接受了一次手术。

SEE> part 部分, in·volved 参与, ef·fort 努力

ODE> The action of functioning or the fact of being active or in effect. – functioning, working, running, performance, action, behaviour.

1259. op·po·nent 反对者 ## 2

[ə’poʊnənt]n.对手；反对者；敌手adj.反对的；敌对的

  • My friend, Patrick, has always been a fanatical opponent of Mr. Lane’s Radical Progressive Party. 我的朋友帕特里克一直是莱恩先生的激进党的强烈反对者。
  • At the same time our sympathy for Galileo’s opponents has grown somewhat. 与此同时，我们对伽利略的反对派的同情也有所增加。

SEE> i·ron·i·cal·ly , ei·ther 任何一个, e·ven 甚至

ODE> Someone who competes with or opposes another in a contest, game, or argument. – rival, adversary, opposer, the opposition, fellow contestant, competitor, fellow competitor, other candidate, other competitor, other contestant, other player, enemy, foe, antagonist, combatant, contender, challenger, critic, dissenter, disputant, objector.

1260. op·por·tu·ni·ty 机会 ## 5

[ˌɑːpər’tuːnəti]n.机会；时机

  • Perhaps there is an element of truth in both these pictures, but few of us have had the opportunity to find out. 也许有这两种都像真实的成分，但很少有人能有机会了解一下。
  • A man without an education, many of us believe, is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances, deprived of one of the greatest twentieth-century opportunities. 没有受过教育的人，很多人都认为，是逆境的牺牲品，被剥夺的最伟大的二十世纪的机遇之一。
  • When one seriously studies the social orders that have had the opportunity to develop autonomously, the figure becomes no more than an exact and matter-of-fact observation. 当一个人认真地研究有自主发展的机会的社会秩序时，这个数字变得不超过一个确切的就事论事的事实和观察。

SEE> chance 机会, give 给, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> A time or set of circumstances that makes it possible to do something. – chance, lucky chance, good time, golden opportunity, time, occasion, moment, favourable moment, favourable occasion, favourable time, right set of circumstances, appropriate moment, appropriate occasion, appropriate time, suitable moment, suitable occasion, suitable time, opportune moment, opportune occasion, opportune time, opening, option, window, window of opportunity, slot, turn, go, run, clear run, field day.

1261. op·pose 反对 ## 2

[ə’poʊz]v.反对；对抗；使对立

  • Duck, and like them the pigeons, are endowed with steel-like muscles, that are a good part of the weight of the bird, and these will ply the short wings with such irresistible power that they can bore for long distances through an opposing gale before exhaustion follows. 野鸭以及与它们相似的鸽子，都长着钢铁般般的肌肉，那是鸟的体重的很大一部分，而这些将扇动短小的翅膀与以巨大的力量，他们可以通过顶着大风很长的距离之前耗尽如下。
  • The study of custom can be profitable only after certain preliminary propositions have been accepted, and some of these propositions have been violently opposed. 风俗的研究可以盈利只有在某些基本的主张被接受，有些主张被激烈反对。

SEE> opposed 反对, re·ject 拒绝, in·sist 坚持

ODE> Disagree with and attempt to prevent, especially by argument. – disapprove of, oppose, dissent from, think wrong, be against, have a problem with, demur about, demur against, not believe in, not support.

1262. op·po·site 对面的 ## 3

[’ɑːpəzət]adj.相反的；对面的；对立的prep.在 … 对面；演对手戏adv.在对面地；处于相反位置地n.对立物；对立者；对手

  • Suddenly, a middle-age lady got on the train and sat opposite Sally. 突然，一个中年妇女上了火车，坐在萨莉的对面。
  • The other side of the picture is quite the opposite. 画面的另一侧是完全相反的。
  • Every child that is born into his group will share them with him, and no child born into one on the opposite side of the globe can ever achieve the thousandth part. 出生于一个在地球的另一侧是出生在他的研究小组将与他分享每一个孩子，并没有儿童都不能达到千分之一。

SEE> di·rec·tion 方向, same 相同, like·wise

ODE> Situated on the other or further side when seen from a specified or implicit viewpoint; facing. – facing, face to face with, across from.

1263. op·po·si·tion 反对 ## 2

[ˌɑːpə’zɪʃn]n.反对；敌对；在野党

  • The albatross is the king of the gliders, the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose, but must yield to its opposition. 信天翁是滑翔机之王，种类，其利用空气他们的目的传单的，但必须屈服于反对。
  • If parents were prepared for this adolescent reaction, and realized that it was a sign that the child was growing up and developing valuable powers of observation and independent judgment, they would not be so hurt, and therefore would not drive the child into opposition by resenting and resisting it. 如果家长对青少年的这种反应准备，并且意识到这是一个迹象，表明孩子正在成长和发展的观察和独立判断有价值的权力，他们就不会感到如此伤心，所以也就不会由于怨恨而把孩子推到对立面和抵御它。

SEE> par·ty 派对, pro·test 抗议, gov·ern·ment 政府

ODE> Resistance or dissent, expressed in action or argument. – resistance, hostility, antagonism, antipathy, enmity, objection, dissent, criticism, defiance, non-compliance, obstruction, obstructiveness, counteraction.

1264. or 或者 ## 203

[ɔːr]conj.或者；还是；否则prep.在…之前

  • Are the children coming out of the park or going into it? 是孩子们走出园或进入呢？
  • Do you want beef or lamb? 你想要牛肉还是羊肉？
  • Is it cold or warm in autumn? 它是在秋季冷还是暖？

SEE> ei·ther 任何一个, ra·ther 相当, in·stead 代替

ODE> Used to link alternatives. – or else, or, if not.

1265. or·der 顺序 ## 18

[’ɔːrdər]n.顺序；条理；订单；命令；秩序；阶层；[生]目；点的东西v.命令；定购；调整；整理；点餐；预定，订货

  • They will be trying to keep order. 他们将设法维持秩序。
  • Byrd at once ordered his men to throw out two heavy food sacks. 伯德马上命令他的士兵扔掉两个沉重的食物袋。
  • The man was ordered to pay ￡3,500 for the cost of the trip. 此人被责令支付£3,500英镑的旅费。

SEE> in·stead 代替, must 必须, thus 如此

ODE> The arrangement or disposition of people or things in relation to each other according to a particular sequence, pattern, or method. – sequence, arrangement, organization, disposition, structure, system, series, succession.

1266. or·di·nar·y 普通的 ## 4

[’ɔːrdneri]adj.平凡的；普通的；平淡的

  • Realizing that this was no ordinary fish, the fisherman made every effort not to damage it in any way. 意识到这是一条普通的鱼，渔夫尽了一切努力，不要破坏它以任何方式。
  • Newspapers exert such tremendous influence that they can not only bring about major changes to the lives of ordinary people but can even overthrow a government. 新闻具有巨大的影响力，他们不仅能带来重大的变化，对普通百姓的生活，甚至还能推翻一个政府。
  • In ordinary living, there can be some tolerance of unpunctuality. 在平常的生活中，可以有不守时的一些公差。

SEE> in·stance 例子, in·deed 确实, ra·ther 相当

ODE> With no special or distinctive features; normal. – usual, normal, standard, typical, stock, common, customary, habitual, accustomed, expected, wonted, everyday, regular, routine, day-to-day, daily, established, settled, set, fixed, traditional, quotidian, prevailing.

1267. or·gan·i·za·tion 组织 ## 3

[ˌɔːrɡənə’zeɪʃn]n.机构；组织adj.有组织的

  • In the 1970s, computers were common enough, but only in big business, government departments, and large organizations. 在20世纪70年代，计算机已经普遍不够，但只用在大公司，政府部门和大的组织。
  • But Alfred had deduced that the Danes were no longer fit for prolonged battle: and that their commissariat had no organization, but depended on irregular raids. 然而，阿尔弗雷德断定，丹麦人持久的战争，不再适合：他们的军需供应处于无组织状态，只是靠临时突击。
  • In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected. 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人的生理和精神状态的影响完全被忽视了。

SEE> or·gan·ized 有组织的, um·brel·la 雨伞, con·cerned 关心的

ODE> An organized group of people with a particular purpose, such as a business or government department. – company, firm, concern, operation, corporation, institution, group, establishment, consortium, conglomerate, combine, syndicate, body, agency, federation, confederation, alliance, coalition, association, movement, society, league, club, network, confederacy.

1268. or·gan·ize 组织 ## 3

[’ɔːrɡənaɪz]v.组织；安排；筹办

  • Knowing that the industrious ant lives in a highly organized society does nothing to prevent us from being filled with revulsion when we find hordes of them crawling over a carefully prepared picnic lunch. 即使知道勤奋的蚂蚁生活具有高度组织性的社会无助于阻止我们充满反感，当我们发现他们成群爬了精心准备的野餐。
  • The intellectual, who is working on some abstruse problem, has everything coordinated and organized for the matter in hand. 智力，谁正在处理一些深奥的问题，要把一切都协调一致，并于手头的事情安排。
  • Whether the remarkable growth of organized camping means the eventual death of the more independent kind is hard to say. 无论是有组织的露营方式的显着增长，较独立的最终消失，还很难说。

SEE> or·gan·ized 有组织的, par·tic·i·pate , pre·pare 准备

ODE> Arrange systematically; order. – put in order, order, arrange, sort, sort out, assemble, marshal, put straight, group, dispose, classify, collocate, categorize, catalogue, codify, tabulate, compile, systematize, systemize, regulate, regiment, standardize, structure, shape, mould, knock into shape, lick into shape, pigeonhole.

1269. or·i·gin 起源 ## 2

[’ɔːrɪdʒɪn]n.起源；出身；[数]原点；起因

  • All this seems to me to link them with life, and the origins of things. 所有这一切都在我看来，他们的生活联系起来，和万物之源。
  • We must conclude from the work of those who have studied the origin of life, that given a planet only approximately like our own, life is almost certain to start. 我们必须从那些谁研究生命起源的工作总结，给定一个星球上大约只有像我们自己，生活几乎肯定会产生。

SEE> mean·ing 含义, un·known 未知, hence 因此

ODE> The point or place where something begins, arises, or is derived. – beginning, start, origination, genesis, birth, dawning, dawn, emergence, inception, launch, creation, birthplace, cradle, early stages, conception, inauguration, foundation, outset.

1270. oth·er 其他 ## 94

[’ʌðər]adj.其他的；另外的；另一个；另一边pron.其他(人或物)n.其他人(或事)adv.以其他方式

  • Five other cars were just behind him. 其他5辆汽车跟在他后面。
  • I left a suitcase on the train to London the other day. 我留在火车上一个手提箱伦敦的一天。
  • The other model’s more expensive, but it’s worth the money. 另一种模式是更昂贵，但它是值得的钱。

SEE> such 这样, man·y 许多, sev·er·al 一些

ODE> Denoting a person or thing that is different or distinct from one already mentioned or known about. – alternative, different, dissimilar, disparate, distinct, separate, contrasting, unlike, variant.

1271. ours 我们的 ## 4

[ɑːrz]pron.我们的

  • The truth is that when mistakes occur, they are more likely to be ours than theirs. 事实是，错误发生时，他们更可能是咎由自取。
  • Sometimes we go upstream to a favourite backwater, sometimes we have our party at the boathouse, which a predecessor of ours at the farm built in the meadow hard by the deepest pool for swimming and diving. 有时候，我们去上游喜爱的回，有时我们有我们的船库党，在农场我们的前身是建在草地硬专供游泳，跳水的深水池。
  • From an attic window we could get a sweeping view of the river where their land joined ours, and at the most critical juncture we took turns in watching that point. 从阁楼的窗口，我们可以得到他们的土地与我们的，在最关键的时刻，我们轮流监视那段河流一览无余。

SEE> theirs 他们的, yours 你的, im·por·tant·ly 重要的

ODE> Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more other people previously mentioned or easily identified. –

1272. our·selves 我们自己 ## 14

[ɑːr’selvz]pron.我们自己

  • We always enjoy ourselves, Mum. 我们总是玩得很开心的，妈妈。
  • Much as we may pride ourselves on our good taste, we are no longer free to choose the things we want, for advertising exerts a subtle influence on us. 尽管我们可以对我们的好味道感到自豪，我们不再自由选择我们想要的东西，广告发挥对我们有潜移默化的影响。
  • Though we may enjoy reading about the lives of others, it is extremely doubtful whether we would equally enjoy reading about ourselves. 我们都喜欢看关于别人的生活，这是非常令人怀疑，我们是否同样喜欢看关于自己。

SEE> my·self 我自己, your·self 你自己, them·selves 他们自己

ODE> Used as the object of a verb or preposition when this is the same as the subject of the clause and the subject is the speaker and one or more other people considered together. –

1273. out 出 ## 149

[aʊt]adv.出；在外；完prep.向外；在外面v.出来；暴露；驱逐；熄灭；伸出；公开…的同性恋身份

  • Are the children coming out of the park or going into it? 是孩子们走出园或进入呢？
  • Some children are coming out of the building. 一些孩子正从大楼出来。
  • Then he put his hand into his pocket, and took out a phrasebook. 然后，他把他的手伸进口袋，掏出了一本常用语。

SEE> put 放, up 上, back 背部

ODE> Moving or appearing to move away from a particular place, especially one that is enclosed or hidden. – not here, not at home, not in, gone away, away, elsewhere, absent, away from one’s desk.

1274. out·er 外面的 ## 4

[’aʊtər]adj.外部的；外面的

  • A telescope would have to be as far away as the planet Jupiter to look for life in outer space, because the dust becomes thinner the further we travel towards the outer edges of our own solar system. 望远镜将不得不远在木星以寻找外太空生命，因为灰尘变得更薄，实现我们的太阳系的外缘的进一步我们旅行。
  • Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen, Venus far too hot, and so is Mercury, and the outer planets have temperatures near absolute zero and hydrogen-dominated atmospheres. 火星太干燥和在贫氧，金星太热，所以是汞，和外行星具有接近绝对零度和氢为主的气氛温度。
  • If then we are so certain that other intelligent life exists in the universe, why have we had no visitors from outer space yet? 如果我们如此肯定的是，其他智能生命在宇宙中存在，为什么我们没有天外来客吗？

SEE> in·ner 内, edge 边缘, hence 因此

ODE> Outside; external. – outside, outermost, outward, exterior, external, surface, superficial.

1275. out·line 轮廓 ## 2

[’aʊtlaɪn]n.大纲；轮廓vt.概述；画出轮廓

  • During these tests she was able to read a newspaper through an opaque screen and, stranger still, by moving her elbow over a child’s game of Lotto she was able to describe the figures and colours printed on it; and, in another instance, wearing stockings and slippers, to make out with her foot the outlines and colours of a picture hidden under a carpet. 在这些测试中，她能隔着不透明的屏幕，陌生人读报纸的是，通过在乐透的孩子的比赛，她能说出印在其上的数字和颜色移动她的胳膊肘;并且，在另一种情况下，她穿着长筒袜子和拖鞋，让与她的脚藏在地毯下面一幅画的轮廓和颜色。
  • I have heard of writers who read nothing but their own books; like adolescents they stand before the mirror, and still cannot fathom the exact outline of the vision before them. 我听说谁读什么，但自己的书作家;像少年，站在镜前，仍然无法捉摸他们之前的视野的准确轮廓。

SEE> de·tailed 详细, il·lus·trate 加插图, for·mu·late

ODE> A line or set of lines enclosing or indicating the shape of an object in a sketch or diagram. – silhouette, profile, figure, shape, contour, form, line, lineaments, delineation.

1276. out·side 外面 ## 25

[ˌaʊt’saɪd]adv.在外面n.外面adj.外部的prep.在 … 外边

  • It was dark outside. 外面一片昏暗。
  • ‘I found this outside this gentleman’s room,’ she said. “我发现这外面这位先生的房间，”她说。
  • They all leapt out of their sleeping bags and hurried outside. 他们全都跳出自己的睡袋，跑到外面。

SEE> in·side 内, where 哪里, near 近

ODE> The external side or surface of something. – external surface, outer surface, surface, exterior, outer side, case, skin, shell, crust, husk, covering, outer layer, sheath, facade, elevation, front, frontage.

1277. ov·en 烤箱 ## 2

[’ʌvn]n.烤箱；烤炉

  • John had a very good day and put his wallet containing ￡3,000 into the microwave oven for safekeeping. 约翰有一个很好的一天，他把一只装有£3,000的钱包放进内保存的微波。
  • When they got home, Jane cooked their dinner in the microwave oven and without realizing it, cooked her fiancé’s wallet as well. 当他们回家后，简熟烤箱微波炉和没有意识到他们的晚餐，煮她的未婚夫的钱包也。

SEE> bake 烘烤, stove 火炉, re·frig·er·a·tor 冰箱

ODE> An enclosed compartment, usually part of a cooker, for cooking and heating food. – stove, kitchen stove, microwave, microwave oven, range, kitchen range.

1278. o·ver 在…上方 ## 84

[’oʊvər]prep.在 … 的上方；遍及地；在 … 期间adv.穿过；完全覆盖；结束；落下n.(板球中)每个投球手一次连续所投出的球数

  • They are walking over the bridge. 他们正在过桥。
  • The aeroplane is flying over the river. 飞机正从河上飞过。
  • It’s over there, behind the teapot. 在那边，茶壶后面。

SEE> last 最后的, while 当的时候, al·read·y 已经

ODE> Extending directly upwards from. – above, on top of, higher than, higher up than, atop.

1279. o·ver·come 克服 ## 4

[ˌoʊvər’kʌm]vt.战胜；克服；使受不了；(感情等)压倒vi.获胜；赢

  • What, according to the author, is the best way to overcome the fear of death as you get older? 什么，根据作者，是克服对死亡的恐惧，你变老的最佳方式？
  • The best way to overcome it – so at least it seems to me – is to make your interests gradually wider and more impersonal, until bit by bit the walls of the ego recede, and your life becomes increasingly merged in the universal life. 战胜它的最好办法 - 至少在我看来 - 是使你的兴趣爱好更广泛和更客观的，直到一点一点地自我退去的墙，你的生命在宇宙的生活变得越来越合并。
  • Hart’s good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited, and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way, his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive, especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians. 哈特的好，坏男人总是一个局外人，总是剥夺继承权的一个，如果他认为有必要枪击一个司法官或抢劫一个银行，他的早期观众很容易理解和原谅，特别是当它是哈特谁，最终战胜了前来进攻的印第安人。

SEE> spite 尽管, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, un·doubt·ed·ly

ODE> Succeed in dealing with (a problem or difficulty) – get the better of, prevail over, control, get control of, bring under control, get under control, bridle, tame, master, gain mastery over, deal with, conquer, defeat, vanquish, beat, solve, triumph over, best, worst, overpower, overwhelm.

1280. owe 欠 ## 2

[oʊ]vt.欠（债；钱；人情等）；应当给予；感激；把…归功于

  • We owe a lot to the birds and beasts who eat insects but all of them put together kill only a fraction of the number destroyed by spiders. 我们欠了很多的鸟和谁吃虫兽，但它们都放在一起杀只相当于蜘蛛所消灭的一小部分。
  • But, in addition to that basically simple concept, the bank and its customer owe a large number of obligations to one another. 但是，除了这一基本的简单概念外，银行和储户的大量义务彼此。

SEE> im·por·tant·ly 重要的, theirs 他们的, sure·ly 一定

ODE> Have an obligation to pay or repay (something, especially money) in return for something received. – be in debt, be in debt to, be indebted, be indebted to, be in arrears, be in arrears to, be under an obligation, be under an obligation to, be obligated, be obligated to, be beholden to.

1281. own 自己的 ## 54

[oʊn]adj.自己的；特有的n.自己的东西v.承认；拥有

  • In this way, he has begun his own private ‘telephone’ service. 就这样，他开始了自己的私人“电话”业务。
  • My daughter, Jane, never dreamed of receiving a letter from a girl of her own age in Holland. 我的女儿简从未想过自己的年龄在荷兰的一个女孩收到信的。
  • Because of this, he has not been able to get his own car into his garage even once. 正因为如此，他一直没能得到自己的车开进他的车库，甚至一次。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, their 他们的, in·stead 代替

ODE> Used with a possessive to emphasize that someone or something belongs or relates to the person or thing mentioned. – personal, individual, particular, private, personalized, idiosyncratic, characteristic, unique.

1282. own·er 所有者 ## 10

[’oʊnər]n.所有人；物主

  • He has just bought a new house in the city, but ever since he moved in, he has had trouble with cars and their owners. 他刚在城里买下一所新房子，但自从搬进来，他就和汽车及车主们的麻烦。
  • Jasper hopes that she will turn cars and their owners to stone. 贾斯珀希望她把汽车和车主们都变成石头。
  • For the first time in his life, he became the proud owner of a bed which had springs and a mattress. 平生第一次，他成了一个床自豪地拥有其中有弹簧床垫。

SEE> own·er·ship , land·lord , de·vel·op·er

ODE> A person who owns something. – possessor, holder, proprietor, proprietress, homeowner, freeholder, landlord, landlady, master, mistress, keeper.

1283. pa·ce 步伐 ## 3

[peɪs]n.速度；步伐；(一)步v.踱步；(用步)测；(马)溜蹄走prep.用在人名前(礼貌的表达不同意见)

  • The man let out a cry and jumped back several paces. 该男子让出了一声，惊退了几步。
  • He is forever talking about the friendly people, the clean atmosphere, the closeness to nature and the gentle pace of living. 他滔滔不绝地大谈友好的农民，洁净的空气，贴近大自然的环境和悠闲的生活节奏。
  • Turning back down the main street, we quickened our pace and made our way rapidly towards the stream where we hoped the boatman was waiting. 掉转身子，沿着主要街道加快步伐，快速地朝我们希望船夫在等待流。

SEE> slow 慢, fast 快速, ac·cel·er·ate

ODE> A single step taken when walking or running. – step, stride, footstep.

1284. pack 打包 ## 3

[pæk]n.一群；一副；包裹；一包v.包装；解雇；塞满；收拾行李；佩戴

  • We’re packing our suitcases. 我们正在收拾手提箱。
  • All the things I had packed so carefully were soon in a dreadful mess. 所有我还带了东西，所以谨慎是一会儿工夫一塌糊涂。
  • It has been estimated that if the bridge were packed with cars, it would still only be carrying a third of its total capacity. 据估计，若桥上摆满了汽车，也只不过携带三分之一的总容量。

SEE> rest 休息, in·stead 代替, u·su·al 通常

ODE> A small cardboard or paper container and the items contained within it. – packet, container, package, box, crate, carton, parcel.

1285. pack·age 包裹 ## 2

[’pækɪdʒ]n.包裹；整批交易vt.把 … 打包；把 … 进行推销

  • The French authorities had the plane packaged and moved in parts back to France. 法国当局有包装和部分转移的飞机回法国。
  • Idealists have objected to the practice of camping, as to the package tour, that the traveller abroad thereby denies himself the opportunity of getting to know the people of the country visited. 理想主义者像反对露营的作法，对于旅行团，在国外的旅客，从而否认了了解访问了该国人民的机会。

SEE> stim·u·lus , plan 计划, pro·po·sal 提案

ODE> An object or group of objects wrapped in paper or packed in a box. – parcel, packet, container, box, carton.

1286. page 页 ## 5

[peɪdʒ]n.页；页码；侍从vt.给 … 标页码vi.翻页

  • The reader’s hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands. 读者的头发看台上结束的时候，他在小说的最后几页了解到书中女主人公，一个亲爱的老太太谁一直是这样善待每个人，曾在她的青春，她毒死五个丈夫的每一个读取。
  • A tiny asterisk conducted me to a footnote at the bottom of the page. 一个小小的星形符号在页面的底部，把我领到一个注脚。
  • Twenty or thirty pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925 would have been sufficient to change the course of world history. 的交给任何世界大国各地的1925年信息二三十页，就足以改变世界历史的进程。

SEE> ar·ti·cle 文章, read 读, web 卷筒纸

ODE> One or both sides of a sheet of paper in a book, magazine, newspaper, or other collection of bound sheets. – folio, sheet, side, leaf.

1287. paint 涂料 ## 8

[peɪnt]v.油漆；绘画n.油漆；颜料；绘画作品

  • I’m going to paint it. 我要画它。
  • What colour are you going to paint it? 什么颜色你打算把它漆成？
  • I’m going to paint it pink. 我打算把它漆成粉红色。

SEE> paint·ing 绘画, spray 喷雾, in·stead 代替

ODE> A coloured substance which is spread over a surface and dries to leave a thin decorative or protective coating. – colouring, colourant, tint, dye, stain, pigment, wash, colour.

1288. paint·ing 绘画 ## 5

[’peɪntɪŋ]n.画，油画；绘画动词paint的现在分词.

  • On another occasion, he invited a number of important critics to see his private collection of modern paintings. 还有一次，他邀请一些著名评论家看到他的现代画的私人收藏。
  • Frank gently lifted the crockery out of the box and suddenly noticed a miniature painting at the bottom of the packing case. 弗兰克轻轻地把陶器拿出箱子，突然发现一个缩影，在包装盒的底部画。
  • As its composition and line reminded him of an Italian painting he knew well, he decided to buy it. 构图与线条提醒他所熟悉的意大利绘画的他，他决定买下来。

SEE> sculp·ture , paint·er 画家, por·trait

ODE> The action or skill of using paint, either in a picture or as decoration. – picture, illustration, portrayal, depiction, delineation, representation, likeness, image, sketch, cartoon, artwork.

1289. pair 一对 ## 6

[per]n.一对；一双；一副v.（使）成对；（使）配对

  • But my sister bought this pair last month. 但是，我姐姐上个月买到了这样的一双。
  • Can you get a pair for me, please? 你可以得到一个对我，好吗？
  • He could make out three men in a basket under it and one of them was holding a pair of binoculars. 他看清了一个篮子里有三个人在它之下，其中一个拿着一副望远镜。

SEE> cou·ple 两人, two 二, both 两者

ODE> A set of two things used together or regarded as a unit. – set of two, set, matching set, matched set, two of a kind.

1290. pal·ace 宫殿 ## 7

[’pæləs]n.宫殿；豪华住宅；王室；大的公共建筑(如旅馆、影院等)

  • Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace, which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851. 也许是十九世纪最不寻常的建筑水晶宫，这是建在海德公园的1851年世界博览会。
  • The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass. 水晶宫是从世界上所有的其他建筑，因为它是用钢和玻璃。
  • On arriving in England, they were taken to the Crystal Palace by train. 一到英国，火车就把他们送到了水晶宫。

SEE> res·i·dence , man·sion , out·side 外面

ODE> A large and impressive building forming the official residence of a ruler, pope, archbishop, etc. – official residence, royal residence, castle, mansion, stately home.

1291. pa·per 纸 ## 25

[’peɪpər]n.纸；文件；报纸；论文；票据；壁纸v.用纸包；用纸糊；贴壁纸adj.纸制的；似纸的；有名无实的

  • Do you have any writing paper? 你有信纸吗？
  • I think I failed the French paper. 我想我的法语及不了。
  • The guy next to me wrote his name at the top of the paper. 坐在我旁边的那个人只在纸张上写下自己的名字。

SEE> news·pa·per 报纸, in·stead 代替, in·stance 例子

ODE> Material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances, used for writing, drawing, or printing on, or as wrapping material. – writing paper, notepaper.

1292. par·ent 父母 ## 22

[’perənt]n.父母；根源v.抚养；产生

  • My parents used to live in South America and I used to fly there from Europe in the holidays. 我的父母曾经住在南美洲和我以前在假期里，从欧洲有飞。
  • Does the writer think the parents were lucky or unlucky to gain prosperity in this way? 这位作家是否觉得父母是幸运还是不幸以这种方式获得的繁荣？
  • As the parents had five children, life was a perpetual struggle against poverty. 由于家里已有5个孩子，全家人常年在贫困中挣扎。

SEE> in·stance 例子, like·wise , sib·ling

ODE> A person’s father or mother. – mother, father.

1293. park 公园 ## 10

[pɑːrk]n.停车场；公园；园区；(球类)运动场v.停车；停放；置于

  • Are the children coming out of the park or going into it? 是孩子们走出园或进入呢？
  • It is beside a park. 它位于公园的旁边。
  • The park is on the right. 该公园是在右边。

SEE> ad·ja·cent , rec·re·a·tion , a·muse·ment

ODE> A large public garden or area of land used for recreation. – public garden, recreation ground, playground, play area, municipal park, public park.

1294. par·lia·ment 议会 ## 5

[’pɑːrləmənt]n.议会；国会；一届议会的会期

  • If the Houses of Parliament had not been burned down in 1834, the great clock would never have been erected. 如果国会大厦并没有在1834年被烧毁，这座大钟永远也不会建造。
  • Big Ben takes its name from Sir Benjamin Hall who was responsible for the making of the clock when the new Houses of Parliament were being built. 大本钟得名于本杰明霍尔爵士，谁负责的时钟的制作正在建造议会的新房时，它的名字。
  • The police were called in, but they could not arrest anyone, for the basket contained two Members of Parliament and the Commanding Officer of the station! 警察被召来了，但他们却不能逮捕任何人，因为筐里议会和站指挥官的两名成员！

SEE> as·sem·bly , op·po·si·tion 反对, cab·i·net 内阁

ODE> (in the UK) the highest legislature, consisting of the Sovereign, the House of Lords, and the House of Commons. – the Houses of Parliament, Westminster, the House of Commons, the House of Lords, the Commons, the Lords, the House, the Lower House, the Upper House, the Mother of Parliaments.

1295. part 部分 ## 37

[pɑːrt]n.部分；零件；角色；部位v.断裂；分离；离开；分开；不赞成adv.部分地adj.分离的（-前缀）

  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。
  • He will take part in an important race across the Atlantic. 他将参加横渡大西洋的重要比赛。
  • At present, they are visiting all parts of the country. 目前，他们正在访问的全国各地。

SEE> which 哪一个, the 该, this 这个

ODE> An amount or section which, when combined with others, makes up the whole of something. – bit, slice, chunk, lump, hunk, wedge, fragment, scrap, segment, piece.

1296. par·tic·u·lar 特定的 ## 9

[pər’tɪkjələr]adj.特定的；专指的；特殊的；特别的；挑剔的n.详情；细节

  • What was it about snails that made the writer collect them for his friend on that day in particular? 是什么样的有关建立作家收集他们为他当天在特别的朋友蜗牛？
  • Students specialize in a particular type of practical joke: the hoax. 大学生擅长一种特殊形式的恶作剧 - 设置骗局。
  • What particular anxiety spoils the country dweller’s visit to the theatre? 什么特别的焦虑败坏了农村居民的剧院访问？

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子, cer·tain 确定的

ODE> Used to single out an individual member of a specified group or class. – specific, certain, distinct, separate, isolated.

1297. par·tic·u·lar·ly 尤其 ## 12

[pər’tɪkjələrli]adv.特别；尤其；详细地

  • Why was the Ambassador particularly lucky? 为什么大使特别幸运？
  • When I returned from abroad recently, a particularly officious young Customs Officer clearly regarded me as a smuggler. 当我从最近国外回来，一个特别好管闲事的年轻海关官员，他显然把我当成走私犯。
  • One day, he walked into an expensive shop after having been caught in a particularly heavy shower. 有一天，他已经陷入了一个特别的一场大雨后走进了一家高档商店。

SEE> es·pe·cial·ly 特别, no·ta·bly , most 最

ODE> To a higher degree than is usual or average. – especially, specially, very, extremely, exceptionally, singularly, peculiarly, distinctly, unusually, extraordinarily, extra, uncommonly, uniquely, remarkably, strikingly, outstandingly, amazingly, incredibly, awfully, terribly, really, notably, markedly, decidedly, surprisingly, conspicuously.

1298. part·ly 部分地 ## 3

[’pɑːrtli]adv.在一定程度上；部分地；不完全地

  • Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly three-dimensonal distances. 后来，由于自身安全和实际需要，就必须发展（部分通过触觉）粗略判断三dimensonal距离的能力。
  • These are partly a matter of personal circumstances, partly a matter of psychology. 这里一方面是个人所处的环境，另一方面是个心理学的问题。

SEE> partially , large·ly 大部分地, en·tire·ly 完全地

ODE> To some extent; not completely. – to a certain degree, to a certain extent, to some degree, to some extent, to a limited degree, to a limited extent, in part, partially, a little, somewhat, not totally, not wholly, not entirely, not fully, relatively, moderately, to a point, up to a point, half, in some measure, comparatively, slightly.

1299. par·ty 派对 ## 26

[’pɑːrti]n.聚会；宴会；政党；一伙人；[律]当事人vi.开派对

  • Last week, my four-year-old daughter, Sally, was invited to a children’s party. 上周，我4岁的女儿萨莉被邀请去参加一个儿童聚会。
  • Last week at a dinner party, the hostess asked me to sit next to Mrs. Rumbold. 在上星期的一次宴会上，女主人安排我兰伯尔德太太坐。
  • Armed with the new machine, a search party went into the cave hoping to find buried treasure. 随着新机的武装，搜索队进入了这个岩洞，希望找到埋藏的宝藏。

SEE> dem·o·crat·ic , op·po·si·tion 反对, can·di·date 候选人

ODE> A social gathering of invited guests, typically involving eating, drinking, and entertainment. – social gathering, gathering, social occasion, social event, social function, function, get-together, celebration, reunion, festivity, jamboree, reception, at-home, soirée, social.

1300. pas·s 通过 ## 37

[pæs]v.通过；经过；度过；传递；发生n.通行证；及格；乘车券；传球；关隘，山口

  • I think I passed in English and Mathematics. 我想我的英语和数学及格了。
  • My holidays passed quickly, but I did not send cards to my friends. 我的假期很快就过去了，但我没寄过一张明信片给我的朋友。
  • Fifteen minutes passed and then, at five to twelve, the clock stopped. 十五分钟过去了，而就在11点55分时，大钟停了下来。

SEE> a·ble 能够, way 方式, kick 踢

ODE> Move or cause to move in a specified direction. – go, proceed, move, progress, make one’s way, travel, drive, fly.

1301. pas·sage 通道 ## 2

[’pæsɪdʒ]n.通过；通道；走廊；(文章等的)段落；(时间的)消逝

  • They have found that it is connected with the passage of days and the phases of the moon. 他们发现，与昼夜更迭和月亮的相位连接。
  • It tires not, nor does it boast of its power; but belongs to the air, travelling it may be six thousand miles to and from its northern nesting home, feeding its flown young as it flies, and slipping through a medium that seems to help its passage even when the wind is adverse. 它的轮胎没有，也不会夸耀它的力量;但属于空气，旅行也可能是6,000英里，距离北方做窝的家，喂养它的飞行年轻，因为它苍蝇，并通过似乎帮助其通过，即使风是不利的介质打滑。

SEE> pro·vi·sion , in·deed 确实, like·wise

ODE> The action or process of moving through or past somewhere on the way from one place to another. – transit, progress, passing, movement, moving, motion, going, crossing, travelling, traversal, traverse.

1302. pas·sen·ger 乘客 ## 11

[’pæsɪndʒər]n.乘客；旅客

  • I’ll ask some of the passengers. 我会问一些乘客。
  • None of our passengers can change this note. 我们的乘客中没人能换开这张钞票。
  • This wonderful plane can carry seven passengers. 这个奇妙的飞机可以载7名乘客。

SEE> car·go , train 火车, bus 公共汽车

ODE> A traveller on a public or private conveyance other than the driver, pilot, or crew. – traveller, commuter, voyager, rider, fare payer, fare.

1303. pass·port 护照 ## 2

[’pæspɔːrt]n.护照；手段

  • Your passports, please. 你的护照，请。
  • They were not fighting men, and their harp was their passport. 他们不是作战人员，他们的竖琴就是他们的通行证。

SEE> vi·sa , i·den·ti·fi·ca·tion , fake

ODE> An official document issued by a government, certifying the holder’s identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel under its protection to and from foreign countries. – travel document, travel papers, papers, travel permit, visa, identity card, ID, laissez-passer.

1304. past 过去 ## 15

[pæst]prep.过；经过adv.过adj.过去的n.过去；昔日；过去的事情；过去的经历；往事

  • You must be home at half past ten. 你必须回家十点半。
  • But you mustn’t come home after a quarter past eleven. 但你一定不是一个季度以后回家十一点。
  • I had lunch at half past twelve. 我吃了午饭12点半。

SEE> a·go 前, re·cent 最近, few 少数

ODE> Gone by in time and no longer existing. – gone by, over, over and done with, no more, gone, done, dead and buried, finished, ended, forgotten, bygone, former, old, of old, earlier, long-ago, ancient, defunct, extinct.

1305. path 路径 ## 7

[pæθ]n.路线；小路；小径；轨道；路程

  • He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool. 他提出了整洁的小路，并在池塘上架起木桥。
  • Taking a path which led out of the town, we crossed a few fields until we came to a dense wood. 以这导致镇出了道路，我们穿过几块农田，来到一片茂密的树林。
  • We expected the path to end abruptly, but we found that it traced its way through the trees. 我们原以为小路会到此突然终止，但我们发现它在树林中继续向前延伸。

SEE> way 方式, fol·low 跟随, di·rec·tion 方向

ODE> A way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading. – footpath, pathway, footway, pavement, track, jogging track, trail, trackway, bridleway, bridle path, ride, riding, towpath, walk, walkway, promenade, esplanade, avenue, lane, alley, alleyway, passage, passageway, byway, sidetrack, berm, causeway, right of way.

1306. pa·tience 耐心 ## 3

[’peɪʃns]n.耐心；忍耐；毅力

  • We shall all remember Mr. Page for his patience and understanding and for the kindly encouragement he gave us when we went so unwillingly to school. 我们不会忘记佩奇先生对他的耐心和理解，因为他给我们的亲切鼓励我们不愿去上学。
  • A truly dedicated bargain hunter must have patience, and above all, the ability to recognize the worth of something when he sees it. 一个到处找便宜的人必须具有耐心，而且最重要的，当他看到它的能力，认识事物的价值。
  • The gentle method requires more patience in the early stages, but produces a cheerful, good-tempered elephant who will give many years of loyal service. 温柔法要求在最初阶段保持较大的耐心，但产生一个开朗，好脾气的大象谁给多年的忠诚服务。

SEE> per·se·ver·ance , per·sis·tence , hu·mil·i·ty

ODE> The capacity to accept or tolerate delay, problems, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious. – forbearance, tolerance, restraint, self-restraint, resignation, stoicism, fortitude, sufferance, endurance.

1307. pa·tient 患者 ## 10

[’peɪʃnt]adj.有耐心的；能忍耐的n.病人

  • The following day, the patient asked for a bedside telephone. 第二天，这位病人要了一部床头电话。
  • When the doctor answered the phone, Mr. Gilbert said he was inquiring about a certain patient, a Mr. John Gilbert. 当这位医生接过电话时，吉尔伯特先生说他想询问一个病人的情况，约翰·吉尔伯特先生。
  • Then Dr. Millington asked the caller if he was a relative of the patient. 之后，米灵顿医生问打电话的人是否是一个相对病人的。

SEE> care 关心, per·son 人, treat·ment 治疗

ODE> Able to accept or tolerate delays, problems, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious. – forbearing, uncomplaining, tolerant, long-suffering, resigned, stoical.

1308. pat·tern 模式 ## 6

[’pætərn]n.模式；图案；典范；式样v.以图案装饰；仿造；模仿

  • They are just pretty patterns. 他们是些好看的图案。
  • With experience, and with improved apparatus, it is now possible not only to locate a shoal but to tell if it is herring, cod, or other well-known fish, by the pattern of its echo. 根据经验和改进了的仪器，它现在不仅能够找到一个浅滩，而是判断它是鲱鱼，鳕鱼，或其他知名的鱼，它的回声的特点。
  • First the electroencephalograph (which is simply a device for recording the electrical activity of the brain by attaching electrodes to the scalp) shows that while there is a change in the pattern of activity during sleep, there is no evidence that the total amount of activity is any less. 第一点，脑电图（这是简单地对电极接到头皮记录大脑电活动的装置）显示，虽然有在睡眠期间活动的图案的变化，没有证据表明活性的总量是任何减少。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子, sim·i·lar 类似

ODE> A repeated decorative design. – design, decoration, motif, marking, ornament, ornamentation, device, figure.

1309. pay 支付 ## 38

[peɪ]v.支付；赢利；受益；付出代价n.薪资；雇用；有良好信用的人adj.要钱的；具有开采价值的

  • You can pay a deposit of thirty pounds, and then fourteen pounds a month for three years. 您可以交纳押金30英镑，然后每月14镑，三年。
  • They did not pay any attention. 他们没有支付任何注意。
  • Who paid for Tony’s dinner? 谁支付了托尼的晚餐？

SEE> pay·ment 付款, cost 价钱为, af·ford 买得起

ODE> Give (someone) money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred. – reward, reimburse, recompense, give payment to, settle up with, remunerate, tip, indemnify.

1310. peace 和平 ## 4

[piːs]n.和平；安静

  • These young people, who love the peace of the mountains, always receive a warm welcome at St. Bernard’s monastery. 这些年轻人，谁爱山的和平，始终在收到圣伯纳德修道院的热烈欢迎。
  • How did Hawkwood make money in times of peace? 霍克伍德是如何赚钱在和平时期？
  • In times of peace, when business was bad, Hawkwood and his men would march into a city-state and, after burning down a few farms, would offer to go away if protection money was paid to them. 在和平时期，当生意萧条时，霍克伍德和他的手下将步入一个城邦，纵火烧毁一两个农场后，将提供走开，如果保护金，支付给他们。

SEE> ac·cord , talks , cease 停止

ODE> Freedom from disturbance; tranquillity. – tranquillity, calm, calmness, restfulness, peace and quiet, peacefulness, quiet, quietness, quietude, silence, soundlessness, hush, noiselessness, stillness, still.

1311. pen 钢笔 ## 15

[pen]n.钢笔；笔；写作；围栏；雌天鹅v.写；把…关在圈中

  • The next man to approach me was selling expensive pens and watches. 接下来的男子接近我是卖名贵钢笔和手表。
  • I examined one of the pens closely. 我仔细检查了一枝钢笔。
  • The man said that the pen was worth ￡50, but as a special favour, he would let me have it for ￡30. 那人说那支笔价值£50，但作为特别优惠，他愿意让我出30£。

SEE> pen·cil 铅笔, hand 手, in·stance 例子

ODE> An instrument for writing or drawing with ink, typically consisting of a metal nib or ball, or a nylon tip, fitted into a metal or plastic holder. – enclosure, fold, sheepfold, pound, compound, paddock, stockade, sty, coop, cage, stall, lock-up.

1312. pen·ny 便士 ## 3

[’peni]n.便士；【美】分

  • It’s worth every penny of it. 这是值得这么多钱。
  • It contained ￡300 in pennies. 它包含在便士£300。
  • He insisted on the assistant’s counting the money before he left – 30,000 pennies in all! 他坚持要店员的他离开前数钱 - 共有30,000便士！

SEE> in·stance 例子, ac·tu·al·ly 其实, i·ron·i·cal·ly

ODE> A British bronze coin and monetary unit equal to one hundredth of a pound. –

1313. pen·sion 养老金 ## 2

[’penʃn]n.养老金；退休金；抚恤金；年金；（欧洲等地的）私人小旅店v.发退休金

  • We’ll assume that you have sorted out the basics – like mortgages, pensions, insurance and access to sufficient cash reserves. 我们假设你已经基本情况弄清楚了 - 如抵押贷款，养老金，保险和获得足够的现金储备。
  • For instance, if you are older you have less time to recover from any major losses, and you may well wish to boost your pension income. 举例来说，如果你年纪较大，你有更少的时间从重大损失中恢复过来，而你很可能希望能够提高你的养老金收入。

SEE> re·tire·ment 退休, pay 支付, in·sur·ance 保险

ODE> A regular payment made by the state to people of or above the official retirement age and to some widows and disabled people. – annuity, superannuation.

1314. peo·ple 人 ## 144

[’piːpl]n.人；人民；人们v.使住人；居住于

  • There were hundreds of people there. 有数百人在那里。
  • When will the new people move into this house? 当将新人们搬进这所房子？
  • Who are these people? 这些人是谁？

SEE> those 那些, least 最小, man·y 许多

ODE> Human beings in general or considered collectively. – human beings, persons, individuals, humans, mankind, humankind, the human race, Homo sapiens, humanity, the human species, mortals, souls, living souls, personages, men, women, and children.

1315. per 每 ## 19

[pər]prep.每；每一；经过；按照

  • It had been wrapped up in newspaper and it contained half the money he had lost, together with a note which said: ‘A thief, yes, but only 50 per cent a thief!’ 它是用报纸包着的，一个纸条，上面写着含有一半，他已经失去了钱，一起：“一个小偷，是的，但只有50％的小偷！”
  • Two months later, some more money was sent to Sam with another note: ‘Only 25 per cent a thief now!’ 两个月后，又有一些钱送还给了萨姆并附上一张字条：“只有25％的小偷了！”
  • The last note said: ‘I am 100 per cent honest now!’ 最后的那张字条上写道：“我是100％的诚信了！”

SEE> av·er·age 平均, each 每, eve·ry 每个

ODE> For each (used with units to express a rate) – to, per, every, each.

1316. per·fect 完美 ## 6

[’pɜːrfɪkt]adj.完美的；完全的；完满的；十足的；理想的vt.使完美；使完全

  • Imagine their surprise and delight when they broke open the packing cases and found that the fourth engine was sweet as honey – still in perfect condition. 想象一下，他们惊讶和高兴，当他们拆开包装箱的情况下，发现第4台发动机就像蜂蜜一样甜 - 完好无损。
  • Why was their disguise ‘too perfect’? 为什么他们的伪装“太完美了”？
  • But as they soon discovered, disguises can sometimes be too perfect. 但他们很快就发现，化装的效果有时过分完美了。

SEE> i·de·al 理想的, good 好, sort 种类

ODE> Having all the required or desirable elements, qualities, or characteristics; as good as it is possible to be. – ideal, model, without fault, faultless, flawless, consummate, quintessential, exemplary, best, best-example, ultimate, copybook.

1317. per·fect·ly 完美 ## 2

[’pɜːrfɪktli]adv.完全地；无瑕疵地；完整地；完美地；圆满地

  • We enjoy reading about them, especially when we find that, like the praying mantis, they lead perfectly horrible lives. 我们喜欢阅读它们，特别是当我们发现，像螳螂，他们过着一种令人生畏的生活。
  • Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature, pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want. 假定每个传感器都给出了温度，压力，湿度，和气象学家需要的任何其他量完全准确的读数。

SEE> fit 适合, nice·ly 很好, beau·ti·ful·ly 美好地

ODE> In a manner or way that could not be better. – superbly, superlatively, excellently, flawlessly, faultlessly, to perfection, without fault, ideally, wonderfully, marvellously, magnificently, sublimely, admirably, inimitably, incomparably, impeccably, immaculately, exquisitely, consummately.

1318. per·for·mance 表演 ## 7

[pər’fɔːrməns]n.表演；实行；表现；履行；性能；本事；业绩

  • During this time, they will give five performances. 在此期间，他们将演出5场。
  • ‘Certainly,’ the girl said, ’but they’re for next Wednesday’s performance. “当然，”女孩说，“但他们下周三的表现。
  • The examiner must have been pleased with my performance, for he smiled and said, ’Just one more thing, Mr.Eames. 考官必须一直很满意自己的表现，因为他微笑着说，“还有一两件事，埃姆斯先生。

SEE> well 好, im·pres·sive 令人印象深刻的, best 最好

ODE> An act of presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment. – show, production, showing, presentation, entertainment, staging, act.

1319. per·haps 也许 ## 19

[pər’hæps]adv.也许；可能

  • Perhaps it is, sir. 也许是的，先生。
  • Perhaps we didn’t do too badly. 也许我们没有做得太惨。
  • Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace, which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851. 也许是十九世纪最不寻常的建筑水晶宫，这是建在海德公园的1851年世界博览会。

SEE> in·deed 确实, prob·a·bly 大概, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> Used to express uncertainty or possibility. – maybe, for all I know, for all you know, it could be, it could be that, it may be, it may be that, it is possible, it is possible that, possibly, conceivably, feasibly.

1320. pe·ri·od 时期 ## 11

[’pɪriəd]n.一段时间；周期；时期；课时；学时；句号；月经

  • Recently the New York Animal Medical Centre made a study of 132 cats over a period of five months. 最近，纽约动物医疗中心历时五个月由132只猫进行研究。
  • After a long period of rain the river may overflow its banks. 经过久雨，河水会泛滥成灾。
  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。

SEE> dur·ing 在期间, be·gin·ning 开始, ear·ly 早

ODE> A length or portion of time. – time, spell, interval, stretch, term, span, phase, session, bout, run, space, duration, chapter, stage.

1321. per·ma·nent 永久的 ## 2

[’pɜːrmənənt]adj.永久的；持久的n. 烫发

  • My cousin, Harry, keeps a large curiously-shaped bottle on permanent display in his study. 我的堂兄哈里，保持永久陈列在一个大奇怪形状的瓶子在他的书房。
  • The man who manoeuvres carelessly into his twenty pounds’ worth of space at one of Europe’s myriad permanent sites may find himself bumping a Bentley. 谁漫不经心地驾车驶入二十磅的价值空间在欧洲无数常年营地之一可能发现自己撞上一个宾利的人。

1322. per·son 人 ## 21

[’pɜːrsn]n.人；本人；身体

  • He’s a very nice person. 他是个很不错的人。
  • In England, each person speaks a different language. 在英国，人们各自说着不同的语言。
  • Later we learnt that there was a very important person on board. 后来我们才得知，飞机上坐了一位非常重要的人物。

ODE> A human being regarded as an individual. – human being, individual, man, woman, human, being, living soul, soul, mortal, creature, fellow.

1323. per·son·al 个人 ## 7

[’pɜːrsənl]adj.私人的；个人的n.(报刊)私人专栏

  • The chest contained the personal belongings of a seaman, Alan Fielding. 木箱内装有水手艾伦的个人物品。
  • Though these large machines still exist, many of their functions have been taken over by small powerful personal computers, commonly known as PCs. 虽然这种大计算机仍然存在，但它们的许多功能已被体积小功能强大的个人电脑，俗称电脑。
  • In the early 1980s, the computer giant, IBM produced the world’s first Personal Computer. 在20世纪80年代初，计算机巨头IBM生产出世界上第一台个人电脑。

ODE> Belonging to or affecting a particular person rather than anyone else. – distinctive, characteristic, unique, individual, one’s own, particular, private, peculiar, exclusive, idiosyncratic, individualized, personalized.

1324. per·son·al·i·ty 个性 ## 2

[ˌpɜːrsə’næləti]n.个性；名人；特色

  • If one group of people were disturbed from their eye-movement sleep for several nights on end, and another group were disturbed for an equal period of time but when they were not exhibiting eye-movements, the first group began to show some personality disorders while the others seemed more or less unaffected. 如果人一组从他们的眼动睡眠不安就结束了好几个晚上，另一组被打乱了相等的时间段，但是当他们并没有表现出眼睛运动，第一组人开始出现，而一些人格障碍其他人似乎没受什么影响。
  • There is none of the hurry which, in our society, often hampers the full development of a growing personality. 那里没有，在我们的社会，常常妨碍越来越多的个性充分发展的赶路。

SEE> char·ac·ter 性格, mind 心神, sort 种类

ODE> The combination of characteristics or qualities that form an individual’s distinctive character. – character, nature, disposition, temperament, make-up, persona, psyche, identity.

1325. per·suade 说服 ## 3

[pər’sweɪd]vt.说服；劝说

  • It took me ten minutes to persuade her to ring back later. 我用了10分钟就说服她过会儿再来。
  • In their efforts to persuade us to buy this or that product, advertisers have made a close study of human nature and have classified all our little weaknesses. 在他们的努力劝说我们买这个或那个产品，广告商作出人性的仔细研究，并已列为我们所有的小弱点。
  • Though he was reluctant to do so at first, we eventually persuaded him to take us. 虽然他不愿先这样做，我们最终说服他来接我们。

SEE> con·vince 使相信, re·luc·tant , will·ing 愿意

ODE> Induce (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument. – prevail on, talk someone into, coax, convince, make, get, press someone into, induce, win someone over, bring someone round, argue someone into, pressure someone into, pressurize someone into, coerce, influence, sway, prompt, inveigle, entice, tempt, lure, cajole, wheedle someone into, get round, blarney, prod someone into, reason someone into.

1326. pet·rol 汽油 ## 4

[’petrəl]n.汽油

  • The petrol had nearly all been used up. 汽油几乎已经用光。
  • We felt sure that sooner or later a stone would rip a hole in our petrol tank or damage the engine. 我们想念迟早石头就砸开一个窟窿，我们的油箱或损坏发动机。
  • Because of this, we kept looking back, wondering if we were leaving a trail of oil and petrol behind us. 正因为如此，我们不断回头，想知道如果我们留下了机油和汽油的痕迹。

ODE> A light fuel oil that is obtained by distilling petroleum and used in internal combustion engines. –

1327. phase 阶段 ## 4

[feɪz]n.相位；方面；局面；阶段；时期vt.逐步执行

  • They have found that it is connected with the passage of days and the phases of the moon. 他们发现，与昼夜更迭和月亮的相位连接。
  • Arthur C. Clark once suggested a revolutionary idea passes through three phases: 1 ‘It’s impossible – don’t waste my time.’ C.克拉克曾提议，一种创新的想法要经过三个阶段：1“这是不可能的 - 不要浪费我的时间。”
  • The idea of colonising Mars – a world 160 times more distant than the Moon – will move decisively from the second phase to the third, when a significant number of people are living permanently in space. 征服火星的计划 - 一个160倍，比月球更远 - 将从第二阶段果断第三，当人显著数量在太空长期居住。

SEE> be·gin·ning 开始, be·gin 开始, in·i·tial 初始

ODE> A distinct period or stage in a series of events or a process of change or development. – stage, period, chapter, episode, part, step, point, time, juncture.

1328. phone 电话 ## 8

[foʊn]n.电话；电话机；听筒；耳机；[语]音素v.打电话suf.表示“声音”或“说 … 语言的人”

  • But I didn’t answer the phone! 但我没接电话！
  • I’ll phone Dr. Carter. 我会给你打电话卡特博士。
  • Later that morning, when I was doing the housework, My husband phoned me from the office. 那天早上，当我正做家务时，我丈夫打电话给我从办公室。

1329. pho·to·graph 照片 ## 12

[’foʊtəɡræf]n.相片vi.拍照，摄影；被照相vt.给 … 照相

  • This is a photograph of our village. 这是我们村庄的一张照片。
  • Here is another photograph of the village. 这是我们村庄的另一张照片。

1330. phrase 短语 ## 3

[freɪz]n.短语；习语；措辞；[音]乐句vt.措词；将(乐曲)分成乐句

  • He opened the book and found a phrase. 他翻开书找到了一条短语。
  • He read the phrase slowly. 他缓慢地读着短语。
  • When we use a phrase like ‘it serves him right’, we are, in part, admitting that a certain set of circumstances has enabled justice to act of its own accord. 当我们用一个短语，如“他罪有应得”，我们是，部分承认了某种特定的环境使得正义自动地起了自己的协议。

SEE> word 单词, mean·ing 含义, de·scribe 描述

ODE> A small group of words standing together as a conceptual unit, typically forming a component of a clause. – expression, group of words, word group, construction, clause, locution, wording, term, turn of phrase, idiom, idiomatic expression, set phrase, phrasal idiom, phrasal verb.

1331. phys·i·cal 物理的 ## 6

[’fɪzɪkl]adj.物质的；身体的；体力的；物理的；肉体上的，身体上的体格检查

  • I limited myself to two modest ambitions: to do physical exercises every morning and to read more of an evening. 只给自己定下两项适中的任务：每天早上锻炼身体，多读一个晚上。
  • As they grow old, people also accumulate belongings for two other reasons, lack of physical and mental energy, both of which are essential in turning out and throwing away, and sentiment. 当他们老去，人们也积累财物其他两个原因，缺乏体力，精力的，这两者都是在清理和扔掉，而情绪是至关重要的。
  • This applies particularly to chemical industries, where chance discoveries play a much larger part than they do in physical and mechanical industries. 这尤其适用于化工等行业，其中偶然发现的机会比他们在物理和机械工业做一个更大的部分。

SEE> men·tal 精神的, fur·ther·more , ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Relating to the body as opposed to the mind. – bodily, corporeal, corporal, fleshly, in the flesh.

1332. pick 挑 ## 15

[pɪk]v.拾；捡；挑选；采摘；找茬；偶然学到n.拾；捡；选择；采摘；精华n.鹤嘴锄；镐；琴拨

  • Five days ago, the policeman told him, the bicycle was picked up in a small village four hundred miles away. 5天前的警察告诉他，那辆自行车是在一个小村里发现了400英里外。
  • As soon as he saw us, he picked up a long pipe which was covered with coins and opened one of the baskets. 只要他一见我们，就拿起了覆盖着硬币，打开了篮子的一个很长的管道。
  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。

SEE> choice 选择, se·lect 选择, choose 选择

ODE> Detach and remove (a flower, fruit, or vegetable) from where it is growing. – harvest, gather, gather in, collect, take in, pluck, pull, dig, crop, reap, bring home.

1333. pic·ture 图画 ## 20

[’pɪktʃər]n.照片；影片；描述；图画vt.想像；画；拍照

  • There are some pictures in the room. 有一些在房间里的照片。

1334. piece 片 ## 27

  • A piece of cheese. 一块奶酪。
  • This is a nice piece. 这是一个很好的作品。
  • Give me that piece, please. 给我那块吧。

SEE> in·stance 例子, sort 种类, in·deed 确实

ODE> A portion of an object or of material, produced by cutting, tearing, or breaking the whole. – bit, section, slice, chunk, segment, lump, hunk.

1335. pile 一摞 ## 6

[paɪl]n.堆；大量；绒面；桩；大笔钱财高大的旧建筑v.堆积；积累；拥入；夸张

  • A man was lying in the box on top of a pile of woollen goods. 一个男人躺在箱子里的一堆毛织品之上。
  • Meanwhile, the traffic piled up behind. 同时，车辆排成了长龙后面。
  • There is always hope that in its labyrinth of musty, dark, disordered rooms a real rarity will be found amongst the piles of assorted junk that litter the floors. 总是有希望在发霉，阴暗的迷宫，混乱间真正的稀罕物将各类垃圾，乱抛垃圾的地板成堆之间找到。

SEE> heap , dump 倾倒, un·der·neath 下

ODE> A heap of things laid or lying one on top of another. – heap, stack, mound, pyramid, mass, quantity, bundle, clump, bunch, jumble.

1336. pi·lot 飞行员 ## 7

[’paɪlət]n.飞行员；领航员；试播节目；排障器；[机]导向器v.驾驶；领航；向导；试点adj.试验性的；引导的

  • He’s a pilot. 他是一名飞行员。
  • When a light passenger plane flew off course some time ago, it crashed in the mountains and its pilot was killed. 当轻型客机当然前段时间飞走了，它在山区坠毁，飞行员丧生。
  • Fortunately, a pilot saw the signal and sent a message by radio to the nearest town. 幸运的是，一位飞行员看到这个信号，用无线电发送消息到最近的城镇。

SEE> flight 飞行, crew , air·plane

ODE> A person who operates the flying controls of an aircraft. – airman, airwoman, flyer, aeronaut.

1337. pink 粉 ## 3

[pɪŋk]adj.粉红色的n.粉红色

  • I’m going to paint it pink. 我打算把它漆成粉红色。
  • Pink! 粉！
  • Pink’s her favourite colour. 粉红色是她最喜欢的颜色。

SEE> pur·ple 紫色, yel·low 黄色, blue 蓝色

ODE> Of a colour intermediate between red and white, as of coral or salmon. – rosy, rose, rose-coloured, rosé, pale red, salmon, salmon-pink, shell-pink.

1338. pipe 管子 ## 8

[paɪp]n.管子；烟斗；管乐器vt.以管输送；装管道；吹奏；尖声说；(为衣服等)滚边vi.吹奏管乐；尖叫

  • As soon as he saw us, he picked up a long pipe which was covered with coins and opened one of the baskets. 只要他一见我们，就拿起了覆盖着硬币，打开了篮子的一个很长的管道。
  • It rose out of the basket and began to follow the movements of the pipe. 它上升筐而出，并开始跟随管的运动。
  • Three factors have caused these fish to grow so large: the warm water round the hot oil pipes under the sea; the plentiful supply of food thrown overboard by the crews on the rigs; the total absence of fishing boats around the oil rigs. 3个因素造成这些鱼能长得这么大：温水轮海下热油管道;由钻井平台工作人员抛到海里食品的供应充足;完全没有钻井平台周围的渔船。

SEE> pump , un·der·neath 下, in·stance 例子

ODE> A tube used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances. – tube, conduit, hose, main, duct, line, channel, canal, conveyor, pipeline, drain, tubing, piping, siphon, cylinder.

1339. pit·y 可怜 ## 4

[’pɪti]n.怜悯；同情；遗憾；可惜v.同情；怜悯

  • What a pity! 太遗憾了！
  • ‘What a pity!’ ‘太遗憾了！’
  • Beggars almost sell themselves as human beings to arouse the pity of passers-by. 乞丐出售的几乎自己作为人类路人唤起的怜悯。

SEE> shame 羞耻, em·pa·thy , un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> The feeling of sorrow and compassion caused by the sufferings and misfortunes of others. – compassion, commiseration, condolence, sorrow, regret, sadness, distress, sympathy, fellow feeling, understanding, feeling, emotion.

1340. place 地方 ## 43

[pleɪs]n.地方；地位；职位；获奖的名次v.将（某物）放置；安排；订货；寄托；辨认；获得名次

  • Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere. 废物筐已放置在树下，但人们仍到处扔垃圾。
  • He is working for a big firm and he has already visited a great number of different places in Australia. 他正在为一家大公司，他已经去过澳大利亚的不少地方的大数目。
  • If you park your car in the wrong place, a traffic policeman will soon find it. 如果你把汽车停错了地方，交通警很快就会发现。

SEE> same 相同, time 时间, where 哪里

ODE> A particular position, point, or area in space; a location. – location, site, spot, scene, setting, position, point, situation, area, region, whereabouts, locale.

1341. plain 平原 ## 6

[pleɪn]adj.清楚的；简单的；坦白的；平常的；朴素的；纯的n.平原；广阔的区域adv.完全地；纯粹地

  • The aircraft was able to fly over the endless white plains without difficulty. 飞机可以飞越茫茫无际的白色平原毫无困难。
  • The rough road across the plain soon became so bad that we tried to get Bruce to drive back to the village we had come from. 穿越平原很快崎岖不平的道路上变得如此糟糕，我们想劝说布鲁斯把车开回村，我们都来自。
  • What a relief it was when the boulders suddenly disappeared, giving way to a stretch of plain where the only obstacles were clumps of bushes. 什么救济是突然大石块不见了，让位给平淡的舒展，唯一的障碍是灌木丛的团块。

SEE> fact 事实, in·stance 例子, folks

ODE> Not decorated or elaborate; simple or basic in character. – simple, ordinary, unadorned, undecorated, unembellished, unornamented, unpretentious, unostentatious, unfussy, homely, homespun, basic, modest, unsophisticated, penny plain, without frills.

1342. plan 计划 ## 7

[plæn]n.计划；方法；策略；设计图；平面图v.打算；安排；计划；设计

  • He had often dreamed of retiring in England and had planned to settle down in the country. 过去他常幻想退休后到英国，并计划落户在该国。
  • In 1858, a French engineer, Aime Thome de Gamond, arrived in England with a plan for a twenty-one-mile tunnel under the English Channel. 1858年，法国工程师，艾梅·托梅·代·加蒙德，来到英格兰与在英吉利海峡一个21英里的隧道的计划。
  • In 1860, a better plan was put forward by an Englishman, William Low. 1860年，一个更好的计划是由一个英国人，名叫威廉提出。

SEE> pro·po·sal 提案, pro·posed , plan·ning 规划

ODE> A detailed proposal for doing or achieving something. – scheme, plan of action, idea, master plan, game plan, proposal, proposition, ploy, suggestion, project, programme, system, method, procedure, strategy, stratagem, formula, recipe, scenario, arrangement, schedule, agenda.

1343. plane 飞机 ## 32

[pleɪn]n.飞机；水平；平面n.刨子n.悬铃木adj.平的；飞机的vt.磨平；刨vi.（鸟、飞机）滑翔

  • The plane was late and detectives were waiting at the airport all morning. 飞机晚点了，侦探们在机场等了一个上午。
  • When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield. 当飞机到达时，一些侦探在主楼内等待而其他人则守候在停机坪上。
  • Two men took the parcel off the plane and carried it into the Customs House. 有两个人把包裹拿下飞机，进了海关大楼。

SEE> air·plane , je·t , flight 飞行

ODE> A flat surface on which a straight line joining any two points on it would wholly lie. – flat surface, level surface.

1344. plan·et 行星 ## 29

[’plænɪt]n.行星

  • Pollution is the price we pay for an overpopulated, over-industrialized planet. 污染就是我们为这个人口过密，过度工业化的星球所付出的代价。
  • Rubbish, however, is only part of the problem of polluting our planet. 然而，垃圾污染是我们这个星球的只是问题的一部分。
  • Which life forms are most likely to develop on a distant planet? 其生命形式最有可能在一个遥远的星球发展？

SEE> earth 地球, in·deed 确实, dis·tant

ODE> A celestial body moving in an elliptical orbit round a star. – planet, satellite, moon, star, heavenly body, orb.

  • Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations. 这种活动需要精确的规划和远见的军事行动。

ODE> The process of making plans for something. – preparation, preparations, organization, arrangement, forethought, design, designing, drafting, working out, setting up, groundwork.

1346. plant 种植 ## 11

[plænt]n.植物；工厂；设备；设施v.种植；设立；建立；安插；栽赃

  • The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago, but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation. 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，但它只是在最近几年才得到了一个坏名声。
  • The planes had been planting seed for nearly a month when it began to rain. 该飞机已经播种了近一个月的时候就开始下雨了。
  • The police had been told that a bomb had been planted on the plane. 警察已被告知，一枚炸弹已被放置在飞机上。

SEE> fac·to·ry 工厂, pro·duce 生产, fa·cil·i·ty 设施

ODE> A living organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, herbs, grasses, ferns, and mosses, typically growing in a permanent site, absorbing water and inorganic substances through its roots, and synthesizing nutrients in its leaves by photosynthesis using the green pigment chlorophyll. – herb, flower, vegetable, shrub, weed.

1347. plate 盘子 ## 3

[pleɪt]n.碟；金属板；板块；盘vt.电镀；用金属板固定；为 … 制印版；给 … 装钢板

  • Her eyes were fixed on her plate and in a short time, she was busy eating. 她的眼睛盯着自己的盘子，并在很短的时间，她就忙着吃起来。
  • As there were strange marks on the X-ray plates taken of the mummy, doctors have been trying to find out whether the woman died of a rare disease. 由于有上采取的木乃伊的X光片奇怪的标记，医生们一直试图搞清这位妇女是否死于一种罕见的疾病。
  • They also found something which the X-ray plates did not show: a small wax figure of the god Duamutef. 他们还发现了X光片所没有显示：神多姆泰夫的小蜡像。

SEE> bot·tom 底部, in·stead 代替, side 侧

ODE> A flat dish, typically circular and made of china, from which food is eaten or served. – dish, platter, bowl, salver.

1349. play 玩 ## 37

[pleɪ]v.玩；比赛；（在运动队中）担当；派…出场；带；踢；击（球）；走（棋子）；出牌；演奏；播放；扮演；假装；上演；发挥（作用）；应付；处理；掠过；浮现；使轻快地活动；（喷泉）喷涌；做游戏n.游戏；戏剧；比赛；发挥作用；玩笑；间隙；闪烁；闪现

  • At the moment, they are playing in the garden. 目前，他们正在花园里玩。
  • The play was very interesting. 戏很有意思。
  • She tried to play jazz on it! 她试图用它来弹奏爵士乐！

1352. pleased 高兴 ## 5

[pliːzd]adj.高兴的，开心的，乐意的

  • Does grandmother seem pleased to get a card from Jimmy? 祖母是否显得高兴获得从吉米的名片？
  • Was the vicar pleased that the clock was striking? 在牧师高兴的是，时钟是惊人的？
  • Robert was delighted to see me and equally pleased with my little gift. 罗伯特很高兴地看到我，同样感到高兴与我的小礼物。

1353. pleas·ure 乐趣 ## 13

[’pleʒər]n.愉快；高兴；快事；（用于回答对方的感谢）荣幸vt.使高兴vi.高兴；享受快乐

  • The race gave everyone a great deal of pleasure. 这场比赛给了大家一个快乐的很大。
  • I smoked with concentration and pleasure as I was sure that this would be my last cigarette. 我聚精会神而又愉快地吸着，因为我相信这将是我最后一根烟。
  • If you can do without the few pastoral pleasures of the country, you will find the city can provide you with the best that life can offer. 如果您可以在没有国家的少数田园乐趣的话，你会发现城市可以为您提供最好的生活可以提供。

  • We’ve got plenty of time. 我们有充足的时间。
  • Captain Alison will set out at eight o’clock, so we’ll have plenty of time. 艾利森船长将于8点钟，所以我们有充裕的时间。
  • ‘There’s always plenty to read in the waiting room!’ “总是有很多在候车室看了！”

1355. pock·et 口袋 ## 7

[’pɑːkɪt]n.口袋；袋子；球袋；钱；小块地方；在…掌握之中；保障金adj.小型的；孤立的；局部的v.装…在口袋里；私吞；击(球)落袋

  • Then he put his hand into his pocket, and took out a phrasebook. 然后，他把他的手伸进口袋，掏出了一本常用语。
  • Then he put a piece of cheese in his pocket and went away. 然后，他把一块乳酪装进衣袋里走了。
  • They made no effort to hide their amusement whenever I produced a packet of sweets from my pocket. 他们毫不掩饰地取笑，每当我生产一包糖果从我的口袋里。

ODE> A small bag sewn into or on clothing so as to form part of it, used for carrying small articles. – bag, purse, wallet, sack, sac, pocket, container, receptacle.

1356. point 点 ## 27

[pɔɪnt]n.观点；看法；要点；重点；特点；点；地点；小数点；尖端；岬角；海角；意义；目标；分数；(罗盘上的)方位点；(温度的)点；插座；(字体)磅值v.指；指向；朝向；瞄准；灰泥或水泥勾（某物）的砖缝

  • At one point, it seemed certain that their plane would crash. 在一个点上，似乎可以肯定，他们的飞机会崩溃。
  • He has pointed out that the tree is a useful source of income, as tourists have been coming from all parts of the country to see it. 他指出，这棵树是收入的有效来源，游客已经从全国各地来看望它。
  • Anyway, as Brian pointed out, it is the easiest thing in the world to give up smoking. 不管怎么说，正如布赖恩指出的那样，它是世界上最容易的事情戒烟。

SEE> just 刚刚, one 一, on·ly 只有

ODE> The tapered, sharp end of a tool, weapon, or other object. – tip, sharp end, tapered end, end, extremity.

1357. poi·son 毒 ## 20

[’pɔɪzn]n.毒药；毒害；败坏道德之事vt.毒害；摧毁；中毒adj.有毒的；危险的

  • The reader’s hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands. 读者的头发看台上结束的时候，他在小说的最后几页了解到书中女主人公，一个亲爱的老太太谁一直是这样善待每个人，曾在她的青春，她毒死五个丈夫的每一个读取。
  • What are the two different ways in which snake poison acts? 什么是其中蛇毒作用于两种不同的方式？
  • How it came about that snakes manufactured poison is a mystery. 它是如何来到约蛇毒液是一个谜。

SEE> poi·son·ous 有毒, le·thal , kill 杀

ODE> A substance that is capable of causing the illness or death of a living organism when introduced or absorbed. – toxin, venom.

1358. po·lice 警察 ## 35

[pə’liːs]n.警察；警方v.维持治安；管辖；监督

  • A few hours earlier, someone had told the police that thieves would try to steal the diamonds. 几个小时前，有人曾告诉警方，盗贼会去抢钻石。
  • Why will the police have a difficult time? 为什么警察有困难的时候？
  • As usual, the police will have a difficult time. 像往常一样，警方将有一个艰难的时刻。

SEE> po·lice·man , ar·rest 逮捕, of·fic·er 官员

ODE> The civil force of a state, responsible for the prevention and detection of crime and the maintenance of public order. – police force, police officers, policemen, policewomen, officers of the law, the forces of law and order, law enforcement officers, law enforcement agency.

1359. pol·i·cy 政策 ## 3

[’pɑːləsi]n.政策；方针n.保险单

  • Though my aunt pursued what was, in those days, an enlightened policy, in that she never allowed her domestic staff to work more than eight hours a day, she was extremely difficult to please. 姑妈追求的是什么，在那些日子里，开明的政策，她从来不让佣人的工作人员每天工作超过八小时，她是极难讨好。
  • The Scandinavian countries are much admired all over the world for their enlightened social policies. 斯堪的纳维亚国家都非常敬佩全世界为他们开明的社会政策。
  • The cultivation of a hobby and new forms of interest is therefore a policy of the first importance to a public man. 因此爱好和各种新的兴趣的培养是头等重要的社会活动的人的政策。

SEE> strat·e·gy 战略, change 改变, stance

ODE> A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization or individual. – plans, strategy, proposed action, blueprint, approach, scheme, stratagem, programme, schedule, code, system, guidelines, intentions, notions, theory, line, position, stance, attitude.

1360. pol·ish 抛光 ## 2

[’pɑːlɪʃ]n.光泽；上光剂；优雅；精良v.擦亮；磨光；推敲；完善Polish.adj.波兰的；波兰人的；波兰语的n.波兰语

  • Haroun Tazieff, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and deep caves in all parts of the world. 哈龙塔捷耶夫，波兰科学家，已经花了毕生的研究在世界各地的活火山和探洞。
  • Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished. 哈丽特姑妈统率着他们不停地擦拭，清扫，刷洗一支看不见的佣人大军。

ODE> Make the surface of (something) smooth and shiny by rubbing it. – shine, wax, buff, rub up, rub down.

1361. po·lite 有礼貌的 ## 2

[pə’laɪt]adj.有礼貌的；客气的；有教养的；文雅的

  • What was the polite request? 什么是礼貌的要求吗？
  • Traffic police are sometimes very polite. 交警有时也很客气。

SEE> cour·te·ous , re·spect·ful , cheer·ful 欢快的

ODE> Having or showing behaviour that is respectful and considerate of other people. – well mannered, civil, courteous, respectful, deferential, well behaved, well bred, gentlemanly, ladylike, chivalrous, gallant, genteel, cultivated, gracious, urbane, well brought up.

1362. po·lite·ly 礼貌 ## 2

[pə’laɪtli]adv.有礼貌地

  • Sure enough, a policeman arrived on the scene and politely asked the workmen to go away. 果然，警察赶到现场，有礼貌地请工人离开此地。
  • Refuse politely any cold drink from an unknown source. 来自未知源谢绝任何冷饮。

SEE> cheer·ful·ly 欢快地, cas·u·al·ly , re·spect·ful·ly

ODE> In a respectful and considerate manner. –

1363. po·lit·i·cal 政治 ## 5

[pə’lɪtɪkl]adj.政治的；政治上的；政党的；人事的；争权夺利的

  • He is now retiring from political life and has gone abroad. 他现在正在退出政治生活，并已出国。
  • He has retired from political life and gone to live abroad!’ 他的政治生涯退役，去国外了！”
  • Stories about people often attract far more public attention than political events. 常人轶事往往比政治事件更能引起公众注意。

SEE> pol·i·tics 政治, lead·er·ship , le·gal 法律

ODE> Relating to the government or public affairs of a country. – governmental, government, local government, ministerial, parliamentary, party political, diplomatic, legislative, policy-making, constitutional, public, civic, state, administrative, bureaucratic.

1364. pol·i·ti·cian 政治家 ## 3

[ˌpɑːlə’tɪʃn]n.政治家；政客

  • Politicians agree, in principle, so America and the EU have been trying to reach a deal which would eliminate the need to double-test many products. 政治家原则同意，因此，美国和欧洲一直在寻求达成协议将不再需要双测试许多产品的交易。
  • Men accustomed to struggling for survival against the elements and Indians were bewildered by politicians, bankers and businessmen, and unhorsed by fences, laws and alien taboos. 习惯作斗争以求和印第安人生存的拓荒者被政客，银行家和商人搞得晕头转向，最后被圈地，法律和外来的清规戒律unhorsed。
  • It is no use inviting the politician or the professional or business man, who has been working or worrying about serious things for six days, to work or worry about trifling things at the weekend. 这是没有用邀请政治家，专业人士或者商人，谁一直在左右上周末琐碎的事情工作或担心严肃的事情六天，工作或担心。

SEE> busi·ness·man 商人, prom·i·nent , bank·er

ODE> A person who is professionally involved in politics, especially as a holder of an elected office. – legislator, Member of Parliament, MP, representative, minister, statesman, stateswoman, political leader, lawmaker, public servant, elected official, office-bearer.

1365. pol·lu·tion 污染 ## 5

[pə’luːʃn]n.污染；污染物

  • Pollution is the price we pay for an overpopulated, over-industrialized planet. 污染就是我们为这个人口过密，过度工业化的星球所付出的代价。
  • The need to produce ever-increasing quantities of cheap food leads to a different kind of pollution. 需要生产廉价食物导致的不断增加的数量以不同的一种污染。
  • However, there is an even more insidious kind of pollution that particularly affects urban areas and invades our daily lives, and that is noise. 然而，还有一个更加隐蔽有害的污染，它专门影响城镇地区，侵袭我们的日常生活，那就是噪音。

SEE> en·vi·ron·men·tal 环境的, smog , re·duce 降低

ODE> The presence in or introduction into the environment of a substance which has harmful or poisonous effects. – contamination, contaminating, adulteration, adulterating, tainting, impurity, fouling, befouling, foulness, dirtiness, dirtying, soiling, filthiness, infection, infecting.

1366. pool 水池 ## 13

[puːl]n.水塘；游泳池n.共同储金；联营；美式撞球v.共用；汇集

  • Are you doing the football pools, Brain? 你做足球池，脑？
  • If we spend all the money we’ll try and win the football pools again. 如果我们花光了所有的钱，我们会尝试，并再次赢得了足球池。
  • He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool. 他提出了整洁的小路，并在池塘上架起木桥。

SEE> swim·ming 游泳的, ad·di·tion 加, in·stance 例子

ODE> A small area of still water, typically one formed naturally. – puddle, pond.

1367. poor 贫穷的 ## 16

[pʊr]adj.可怜的；贫穷的；低劣的n.穷人

  • Poor Ian! 可怜的伊恩！
  • But if we spend all that money we’ll be poor again. 但是，如果我们把所有钱都花光了，我们又很差。
  • We all know what the poor man should have said, but what he actually said was: ’This is the Poo and Ee Seed Bird Company. 我们都明白那个可怜的人应该说的，但他实际上说的是：“这是’浦伊鸟食公司。

SEE> es·pe·cial·ly 特别, be·cause 因为, lack 缺乏

ODE> Lacking sufficient money to live at a standard considered comfortable or normal in a society. – poverty-stricken, impoverished, necessitous, beggarly, in penury, penurious, impecunious, indigent, needy, needful, in need, in want, badly off, low-paid, in reduced circumstances, in straitened circumstances, destitute, hard up, short of money, on one’s beam-ends, unable to make ends meet, underprivileged, deprived, penniless, without a sou, as poor as a church mouse, moneyless.

1368. pop 流行 ## 2

[pɑːp]v.发出(砰的响声)；取出；突然行动；突然出现；爆开；睁大；开枪n.流行音乐，流行艺术；爆裂声；爸爸adj.通俗的；流行的；热门的

  • The Greenwood Boys are a group of pop singers. 绿林少年是一个流行歌曲演唱团。
  • We were very much surprised when the snake charmer suddenly began to play jazz and modern pop songs. 当耍蛇人突然又吹奏起爵士乐和现代流行乐曲，我们感到非常惊奇。

SEE> mu·sic 音乐, sing·er 歌手, rock 岩石

ODE> Make or cause to make a light explosive sound. – go bang, go off with a bang, go off, crack, snap, burst, explode.

1369. pop·u·lar 流行 ## 9

[’pɑːpjələr]adj.受欢迎的；通俗的；流行的；大众的

  • Jeremy Hampden has a large circle of friends and is very popular at parties. 杰里米·汉普登有一大群朋友，是各种聚会很受欢迎。
  • A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race. 一种游戏是非常流行的这些年轻的游泳运动员是水下三轮车比赛。
  • One of the things that fascinates us most about cats is the popular belief that they have nine lives. 其中一个最使我们感兴趣有关猫的事情就是一种通俗的信念有九条命。

SEE> pop·u·lar·i·ty , most 最, es·pe·cial·ly 特别

ODE> Liked or admired by many people or by a particular person or group. – well liked, liked, favoured, in favour, well received, approved, admired, accepted, welcome, sought-after, in demand, desired, wanted.

1370. pop·u·la·tion 人口 ## 3

[ˌpɑːpju’leɪʃn]n.人口；(全体)居民；群体

  • She always referred to them as ‘the shifting population’, for they came and went with such frequency that I never even got a chance to learn their names. 她称他们为“流动人口”，因为他们来匆匆，去的频率，我从来没有有机会知道他们的姓名。
  • It effectively spread the disease all over the continent and drastically reduced the rabbit population. 它有效地传播本病遍布大陆，大大降低了兔子的人口。
  • It later became apparent that rabbits were developing a degree of resistance to this disease, so that the rabbit population was unlikely to be completely exterminated. 后来，明显看出，兔子被开发的程度对本病的阻力，从而使兔子不可能被完全消灭。

SEE> pro·por·tion 比例, liv·ing 活着的, es·ti·mat·ed

ODE> All the inhabitants of a particular place. – inhabitants, residents, people, citizens, citizenry, public, community, populace, society, natives, occupants, occupiers.

1371. port 港口 ## 6

[pɔːrt]n.港口

  • This platform would serve as a port and a railway station. 此平台将用作码头和火车站。
  • After crossing the Equator, the captain called in at a port to have a new rudder fitted, but by now the Thermopylae was over five hundred miles ahead. 跨越赤道，在口叫有装新舵队长后，但现在的温泉是早已在500多英里。
  • As the wind freshened there came a sudden squall and the ship made a strange movement, listing to port. 由于风劲传来一阵突然袭来的狂风暴雨和船做一个奇怪的动作，向左舷。

SEE> dock , coast 海岸, ship 船

ODE> A town or city with a harbour or access to navigable water where ships load or unload. – seaport, port city, port town.

1372. po·si·tion 位置 ## 4

[pə’zɪʃn]n.位置；职位；立场；状态vt.安置；定位

  • Future historians will be in a unique position when they come to record the history of our own times. 未来的历史学家会在一个独特的位置，当他们来写我们时代的历史。
  • After jumping about on the carpet and twisting the human frame into uncomfortable positions, I sat down at the breakfast table in an exhausted condition. 在地毯上跳来蹦过去，扭曲身子，帧到不舒服的姿势后，我一副筋疲力尽的坐在早餐桌旁。
  • This may be illustrated by comparing the position of a nation with that of a private business enterprise. 这可能是由一个国家的立场与私有企业的比较来说明。

SEE> same 相同, how·ev·er 然而, lat·ter 后者

ODE> A place where someone or something is located or has been put. – location, place, situation, spot, site, locality, locale, scene, setting, area, point.

1373. pos·i·tive 正的 ## 2

[’pɑːzətɪv]adj.积极的；肯定的；明确的；正面的；正数的；阳性的 n.正面；正数；正片；[语]原级

  • But my father had described over and over again what we should see at every milestone, after leaving the nearest town, so that I was positive I should recognize it as familiar territory. 但是我的父亲描述了一遍又一遍，我们应该在每一个里程碑看到，离开最近的镇子后，让我很积极，我应该是很熟悉的领域。
  • Some of the bigger firms are engaged in researches which are of such general and fundamental nature that it is a positive advantage to them not to keep them secret. 某些大公司所从事的研究属于一般和基础性的，这是一个积极的优势，他们不会让他们的秘密。

SEE> neg·a·tive 负, en·cour·ag·ing , nev·er·the·less 然而

ODE> Consisting in or characterized by the presence rather than the absence of distinguishing features. – affirmative, favourable, approving, in the affirmative, good, constructive, enthusiastic, supportive, reassuring, encouraging, corroborative.

1374. pos·sess 拥有 ## 6

[pə’zes]vt.拥有；持有；支配

  • The tiny village of Frinley is said to possess a ‘cursed tree’. Frinley小村里，据说拥有“诅咒的树”。
  • The English language possesses a vivid saying to describe this sort of situation. 英语中有一个生动的说法来形容这种情况。
  • There are times when we would willingly give everything we possess to save our lives, yet we might grudge paying a surgeon a high fee for offering us precisely this service. 有些时候，我们愿意付出我们拥有一切，拯救我们的生命，但我们可能会吝惜付外科医生高的费用而为我们提供这种服务。

SEE> fur·ther·more , more·o·ver 此外, like·wise

ODE> Have as belonging to one; own. – own, have, be the owner of, have in one’s possession, be in possession of, be the possessor of, have to one’s name, hold.

1375. pos·ses·sion 拥有 ## 7

[pə’zeʃn]n.拥有；财产；所有；殖民地

  • In the struggle, the strap broke and, with the bag in their possession, both men started running through the trees. 在斗争中，带子断了，在他们身上的袋子，两人开始跑进了树林。
  • As no pumas had been reported missing from any zoo in the country, this one must have been in the possession of a private collector and somehow managed to escape. 由于没有美洲狮被报道曾从全国动物园失踪，这一次一定是属于一位私人收藏家的，不知怎么设法逃出来了。
  • One of Mary’s prize possessions was a little white lamb which her husband had given her. 其中玛丽最珍爱的东西之一就是她丈夫送给她的一只白色小羔羊。

SEE> pos·sess 拥有, charge 要价, in·tent

ODE> The state of having, owning, or controlling something. – ownership, proprietorship, control, hands, keeping, care, custody, charge, hold, title, guardianship.

1376. pos·si·bil·i·ty 可能性 ## 4

[ˌpɑːsə’bɪləti]n.可能；可能性；可能的事情；潜在的价值

  • Many people in industry and the Services, who have practical experience of noise, regard any investigation of this question as a waste of time; they are not prepared even to admit the possibility that noise affects people. 许多人在工业和服务，谁都有噪音的实践经验，认为对这个问题是浪费时间的任何调查;他们不准备甚至承认噪音可能对人有影响。
  • – the possibilities appear unlimited. - 可能性出现无限。
  • But other suns, start as the astronomers call them, are bound to have planets like our own, and as is the number of stars in the universe is so vast, this possibility becomes virtual certainty. 但是，其他的太阳，既天文学家所说的，也必然有行星就像我们自己，并且是在宇宙中恒星的数目极其庞大，所以这种可能性是肯定无疑的。

SEE> pos·si·ble 可能, con·sid·er·ing , con·sid·er 考虑

ODE> A thing that may happen or be the case. – chance, likelihood, probability, prospect, hope.

1377. pos·si·ble 可能 ## 28

[’pɑːsəbl]adj.可能的；尽可能的；合理的n.适合候选的人

  • After a little time, she chose one of the most expensive dresses in the shop and handed it to an assistant who wrapped it up for her as quickly as possible. 过了一会儿，她又选了商场里最昂贵的一件衣服，把它递给了助手谁尽快包好了她越好。
  • He said that it would be possible to build a platform in the centre of the Channel. 他说，这将有可能在通道的中心搭建了一个平台。
  • Despite its immensity, it is both simple and elegant, fulfilling its designer’s dream to create ‘an enormous object drawn as faintly as possible’. 尽管很大，但它的结构简单，造型优美，实现了设计者的梦想，创造“为依稀描绘成可能一个巨大的物体”。

SEE> pos·si·bil·i·ty 可能性, might 也许, like·ly 可能的

ODE> Able to be done or achieved. – feasible, able to be done, practicable, viable, within the bounds of possibility, within the realms of possibility, attainable, achievable, realizable, within reach, workable, manageable.

1378. pos·si·bly 或许 ## 4

[’pɑːsəbli]adv.可能地；也许

  • No matter what the conditions were, he believed that a car should be driven as fast as it could possibly go. 不管条件是什么，他认为车必须尽可能快，因为它可以前进。
  • The noise pollution survey revealed a rather surprising and possibly amusing old-fashioned source of noise. 噪音污染调查显示噪声相当令人惊讶，并可能会引人发笑的老式源。
  • Of course, Leon Bagrit could not possibly have foreseen the development of the Internet, the worldwide system that enables us to communicate instantly with anyone in any part of the world by using computers linked to telephone networks. 当然，巴格瑞特不可能预见到互联网的发展，世界范围内的系统，使我们能够立即与任何人在世界任何地方通过连接到电话网络上的计算机进行通信。

SEE> pre·sum·a·bly 想必, prob·a·bly 大概, per·haps 也许

ODE> Perhaps (used to indicate doubt or hesitancy) – perhaps, maybe, it could be, it may be, it is possible, it is conceivable, for all one knows, feasibly, very likely.

1379. post 邮政 ## 3

[poʊst]n.职位；邮件；标竿v.邮递；通知；布置；派遣；急行adv.快速地

  • However, they have decided to use the post office. 然而，他们已经决定利用邮局。
  • Sam Benton, the local butcher, had lost his wallet while taking his savings to the post office. 萨姆顿当地的屠户，而把存款送往邮局丢失了钱包。
  • I must definitely get that fellow posted.’ 我一定要把那个家伙“。

SEE> as 作为, once 一次, lat·er 后来

ODE> A long, sturdy piece of timber or metal set upright in the ground and used as a support or marker. – pole, stake, upright, shaft, prop, support, picket, strut, pillar, pale, paling, column, piling, standard, stanchion, pylon, stave, rod, newel, baluster, jamb, bollard, mast.

1380. pot 壶 ## 2

  • A painter who had been working on the tower hung a pot of paint on one of the hands and slowed it down! 谁一直工作在塔架上的画家挂漆一壶在手之一，慢了！
  • Before she had anchored, the men from the boats had climbed on board and the decks were soon covered with colourful rugs from Persia, silks from India, copper coffee pots, and beautiful handmade silverware. 她还未下锚，小船上的人就纷纷爬上船上，甲板上很快就布满色彩斑斓的波斯地毯，印度丝绸，铜咖啡壶以及手工制作的漂亮的银器。

1382. pound 英磅 ## 25

  • Half a pound of coffee. 咖啡半磅。

1383. pour 倾倒 ## 2

  • Franz poured scorn on the idea, pointing out that his brother had been killed in action during the war. 弗朗兹对此不屑一顾，指出他兄弟已经在战争中被杀害。
  • Gifts poured in not only from unknown people, but from baby food and soap manufacturers who wished to advertise their products. 礼品不但素昧平生的人，但婴儿食品，婴儿肥皂制造商谁希望自己的产品做广告浇英寸
