1384. pow·er 力量 ## 13

[’paʊər]n.力量；力；能力；权力；【数】幂；电力v.使有力量；给 … 提供动力adj.电力的；力量的；权力的

  • He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line. 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏的电源线的电线蛇的遗骸。
  • The story of a poor family that acquired fame and fortune overnight, dramatically illustrates the power of the press. 一个贫穷的家庭是获得名利一夜的故事戏剧性地说明了新闻报道的威力。
  • We have to ask ourselves very seriously what will happen if this twofold use of knowledge, with its ever-increasing power, continues. 我们要问自己很认真，如果这双重的使用知识，以不断增加的动力，继续会发生什么。

SEE> con·trol 控制, turn 转动, in·stead 代替

ODE> The ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way. – ability, capacity, capability, potential, potentiality, faculty, property, competence, competency.

1385. pow·er·ful 强大 ## 10

[’paʊərfl]adj.强有力的；强大的；有权的；强健的

  • A small fishing boat was carried miles out to sea by the powerful fish as it pulled on the line. 一条小渔船被强大的鱼了几英里以外的海面拉就行了。
  • The sea bed was scoured with powerful nets and there was tremendous excitement on board when a chest was raised from the bottom. 海床用结实的网冲刷并有巨大的兴奋在船上当一只箱子从海底升起。
  • After switching on powerful arc lights, they saw great stalagmites – some of them over forty feet high – rising up like tree-trunks to meet the stalactites suspended from the roof. 在强力弧光灯，看见一株株巨大的石笋 - 有的高达40英尺高 - 上升状的树干，以满足从屋顶悬挂下来的钟乳石相接。

SEE> in·flu·en·tial , strong 强大, most 最

ODE> Having great power or strength. – strong, muscular, muscly, sturdy, strapping, robust, mighty, hefty, brawny, burly, husky, athletic, manly, well built, Herculean, tough, solid, substantial, lusty.

1386. prac·ti·cal 实际的 ## 7

[’præktɪkl]adj.明智的；实际的；实用的；事实上的n.实践考试

  • It has never been explained why university students seem to enjoy practical jokes more than anyone else. 它也弄不清为什么大学生好像喜欢恶作剧比谁。
  • Students specialize in a particular type of practical joke: the hoax. 大学生擅长一种特殊形式的恶作剧 - 设置骗局。
  • Moreover, as soon as new knowledge is acquired, it is now turned to practical account. 此外，一旦新知识一旦获得，现在转向实际应用。

SEE> use·ful 有用, pur·pose 目的, ne·ces·si·ty

ODE> Of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas. – empirical, hands-on, pragmatic, real, actual, active, applied, experiential, experimental, non-theoretical, in the field.

1387. prac·tice 实践 ## 9

[’præktɪs]n.练习；实行；习惯；业务v.练习；实践；开业；执业

  • On the other hand, your stomach would turn at the idea of frying potatoes in animal fat – the normally accepted practice in many northern countries. 在另一方面，你的胃会变成在动物脂肪油炸土豆的想法 - 在北方许多国家常接受的做法。
  • Insuring public or private property is a standard practice in most countries in the world. 承办公共或私人财产是大多数国家在世界上的标准做法。
  • The Ombudsman’s prompt action at once put an end to an unpleasant practice which might have gone unnoticed. 监察员立即结束不愉快的做法可能还没有受到重视迅速行动。

SEE> in·stead 代替, same 相同, in·stance 例子

ODE> The actual application or use of an idea, belief, or method, as opposed to theories relating to it. – application, exercise, use, operation, implementation, execution, enactment, action, doing.

1388. prac·tise 练习 ## 2

[’præktɪs]v.练习；实践；实行；开业n.练习；实践；实行；业务；惯例=practice.

  • Nearly all the sports practised nowadays are competitive. 几乎所有的科技发展和生活都具有竞争力。
  • No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight; the varieties are infinite; but two classes may be roughly seen. 没有两种鸟的做法不尽相同种类的飞行;该品种有无限的;但两个班可以大致看出。

ODE> Perform (an activity) or exercise (a skill) repeatedly or regularly in order to acquire, improve or maintain proficiency in it. – rehearse, run through, go through, go over, work on, work at, repeat.

1389. praise 赞扬 ## 3

[preɪz]vt.赞美；称赞n.赞美；称赞；崇拜vi.赞美

  • No creature has received more praise and abuse than the common garden snail. 没有一种生物所受到如此多的赞扬和批评花园里常见的蜗牛。
  • Aunt Harriet could not find words to praise Bessie’s industriousness and efficiency. 哈丽特不知该用什么言辞来赞扬贝西的勤奋与高效。
  • Parents are often upset when their children praise the homes of their friends and regard it as a slur on their own cooking, or cleaning, or furniture, and often are foolish enough to let the adolescents see that they are annoyed. 父母常常心烦意乱时，他们的孩子赞扬自己朋友的家，并把它作为自己做饭一个污点，卫生，或家具，而且是愚蠢的，足以让孩子看出自己的烦恼。

SEE> ad·mi·ra·tion 钦佩, crit·i·cism 批评, like·wise

ODE> Express warm approval or admiration of. – commend, express approval of, express admiration for, applaud, pay tribute to, speak highly of, eulogize, compliment, congratulate, celebrate, sing the praises of, praise to the skies, rave about, go into raptures about, heap praise on, wax lyrical about, say nice things about, make much of, pat on the back, take one’s hat off to, throw bouquets at, lionize, admire, hail, cheer, flatter.

1390. pre·cise 精确 ## 2

[prɪ’saɪs]adj.精确的；恰好的；准确的；严格的

  • Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations. 这种活动需要精确的规划和远见的军事行动。
  • This depends on the precise radio frequency of the 21-cm wavelength, or 1420 megacycles per second. 这依赖于21-cm的波长，即每秒1420个兆周的精确无线电频率。

SEE> ex·act 精确的, pre·cise·ly 恰好地, ac·cu·rate 准确

ODE> Marked by exactness and accuracy of expression or detail. – exact, accurate, correct, error-free, pinpoint, specific, detailed, explicit, clear-cut, unambiguous, meticulous, close, strict, definite, particular, express.

1391. pre·cise·ly 恰好地 ## 5

[prɪ’saɪsli]adv.精确地

  • There are times when we would willingly give everything we possess to save our lives, yet we might grudge paying a surgeon a high fee for offering us precisely this service. 有些时候，我们愿意付出我们拥有一切，拯救我们的生命，但我们可能会吝惜付外科医生高的费用而为我们提供这种服务。
  • What invariably happens is that a great number of things choose to go wrong at precisely the same moment. 什么必然发生的是，事情大量选择出错精确地在同一时刻。
  • Precisely at noon an infinitely powerful computer takes all the data and calculates what will happen at each point at 12.01, then 12.02, then 12.03… 在正午时分，一个功能巨大的计算机搜集了所有的数据，并计算在每一个点发生在12.01，然后12.02，然后12.03什么？

SEE> ex·act·ly 确切地, in·deed 确实, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> In exact terms; without vagueness. – exhaustively, painstakingly, systematically, meticulously, rigorously, scrupulously, punctiliously, in detail.

1392. pre·dict 预测 ## 5

[prɪ’dɪkt]v.预言；预报；预知；预测

  • Predicting the future is notoriously difficult. 预测未来是非常困难的。
  • Considering how recent these developments are, it is even more remarkable that as long ago as the 1960s, an Englishman, Leon Bagrit, was able to predict some of the uses of computers which we know today. 考虑到这些发展是如何最近是，它更是了不起，早在20世纪60年代，一个英国人，他在60年代能够预测一些电脑今天我们所知道的用途。
  • Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office – spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U.S. a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast. 米德预言发明者可以在办公室用一个周末的完善强大的定制化芯片 - 造就新一代的车库创业企业，并给予美国把它的外国对手一个跳跃在把产品推向市场的速度快。

SEE> an·tic·i·pate 预料, ex·pect 期望, sug·gest 建议

ODE> Say or estimate that (a specified thing) will happen in the future or will be a consequence of something. – forecast, foretell, foresee, prophesy, divine, prognosticate, anticipate, see, say, tell in advance, project, speculate, envision, envisage, imagine, picture, estimate, conjecture, guess, hazard a guess.

1393. pre·fer 更喜欢 ## 8

[prɪ’fɜːr]vt.宁可；较喜欢；提出（控告）

  • ‘Well, in that case, I prefer to stay on the bus,’ I answered. “那么，在这种情况下，我宁愿留在车上，”我回答。
  • ‘Well, I’d prefer to stay here,’ I said. “好吧，我更愿意呆在这儿，”我说。
  • Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them. 很多孩子用脚三轮车，但大多数都喜欢推或拖他们。

SEE> tend 趋向, ra·ther 相当, opt

ODE> Like (one thing or person) better than another or others; tend to choose. – like better, would rather, would rather have, would sooner, would sooner have, favour, be more partial to, incline towards, lean towards, think preferable.

1394. pre·pare 准备 ## 9

[prɪ’per]v.预备；准备

  • He prepared the speech carefully and went to the wedding with Jenny. 他认真准备了讲稿，去与珍妮的婚礼。
  • Let us suppose that you are preparing a meal and keeping an eye on the baby at the same time. 让我们假设你在做饭，并在同一时间对照看孩子。
  • Why people are prepared to tolerate a four-hour journey each day for the dubious privilege of living in the country is beyond me. 人们为什么情愿每天忍受四个小时的旅程居住在该国的可疑特权是超越我。

SEE> pre·pared 准备, prep·a·ra·tion 制备, read·y 准备

ODE> Make (something) ready for use or consideration. – make ready, get ready, put together, draw up, produce, arrange, develop, assemble, construct, compose, edit, devise, work out, think up, conceive, formulate, concoct, fashion, work up, lay.

1395. pres·ence 存在 ## 4

[’prezns]n.出席；存在；到场；【生】存在度

  • We enjoy staring at them, entranced as they go about their business, unaware (we hope) of our presence. 我们喜欢盯着他们，迷住了，因为他们去他们的生意，不知道（但愿如此）我们的存在。
  • At present, there is no telescope in existence that is capable of detecting the presence of life. 目前，有存在，其能够检测生命的存在没有望远镜。
  • Everything around him was full of her presence, continually reopening the wound. 他身边的一切都是母亲的影子不断勾起他的伤口。

SEE> in·deed 确实, fact 事实, al·though 虽然

ODE> The state or fact of existing, occurring, or being present. – existence, being there.

1396. pre·sent 目前的 ## 23

[’preznt]n.礼物；现在adj.出席的；现在的；当前的；存在的v.提出；赠送；呈现

  • What was Sandra’s present? 是什么桑德拉的礼物呢？
  • And here’s a little present for you. 而且这里有一个小礼物给你。
  • At present, they are visiting all parts of the country. 目前，他们正在访问的全国各地。

SEE> fur·ther·more , same 相同, in·deed 确实

ODE> In a particular place. – in attendance, attending, here, there, near, nearby, at hand, close at hand, near at hand, adjacent, available, ready.

1397. pre·serve 维持 ## 10

[prɪ’zɜːrv]v.保护；保存；保持n.禁猎区；蜜饯

  • A colony of bees had turned the engine into a hive and it was totally preserved in beeswax! 一群蜜蜂已经变成发动机进入一个蜂房，它完整地保存在蜂蜡！
  • This head must have been found in Classical times and carefully preserved. 这脑袋一定是在古希腊罗马时代被发现并精心保存。
  • The only way that they can preserve their history is to recount it as sagas – legends handed down from one generation of storytellers to another. 他们可以保留他们的历史的唯一办法就是讲述它作为传奇 - 从一个代说书的传世另一个传说。

SEE> pro·tect 保护, main·tain 维持, pres·er·va·tion

ODE> Maintain (something) in its original or existing state. – conserve, protect, maintain, care for, take care of, look after, save, safeguard, keep.

1398. pres·i·dent 总统 ## 3

[’prezɪdənt]n.(国家)总统；(公司)总裁；校长；总经理；社长

  • Last year a journalist had been instructed by a well-known magazine to write an article on the president’s palace in a new African republic. 去年，一位记者受一家知名杂志写在总统府的一篇文章中一个新的中非共和国。
  • The article began: ‘Hundreds of steps lead to the high wall which surrounds the president’s palace.’ 文章的开头是：“几百级台阶通向环绕总统的高墙。”
  • However, he had at last been allowed to send a fax in which he informed the editor that he had been arrested while counting the 1,084 steps leading to the fifteen-foot wall which surrounded the president’s palace. 不过，他终于获准发中，他获知，虽然计数1084个步骤导致十五英尺高的墙，其包围了总统府，他已被捕编辑传真。

SEE> vi·ce , pres·i·den·cy , e·lect 选举

ODE> The elected head of a republican state. – head of state, chief of state, elected head of a country.

1399. press 按压 ## 9

[pres]v.按；压；逼迫；强迫服役；征用n.新闻界；出版社；报刊；新闻舆论；压；熨烫机；印刷机

  • As the neighbours complained of the noise, my husband spent weeks training him to press his paw on the latch to let himself in. 由于邻居们的噪音，我的丈夫花了几个星期的训练他按他的门闩爪子让自己英寸
  • I suddenly pressed the brake pedal hard and we were both thrown forward. 我突然用力踩刹车踏板努力，我们俩都朝前一甩。
  • But so far, the public has expressed its gratitude to the students in letters to the Press. 但到目前为止，公众已经表达了感谢学生写信给出版社。

SEE> me·di·a 媒体, in·ter·view 面谈, say·ing

ODE> Move or cause to move into a position of contact with something by exerting continuous physical force. – push, push down, press down, thumb, depress, bear down on, lean on, lower, pin, pinion, hold down, force, ram, thrust, cram, squeeze, compress, wedge.

1400. pres·sure 压力 ## 6

[’preʃər]n.压强；压力；压迫v.施压

  • This will relieve pressure on the trains to some extent. 这将减轻对火车一定程度上的压力。
  • The Ombudsman is not subject to political pressure. 申诉专员不受政治压力。
  • Once we get down to the oil, it usually flows to the surface because great pressure, either from gas or water, is pushing it. 一旦到达油，这通常是因为巨大的压力，无论是从气或水，是推动它流到地面。

SEE> push 推, put 放, de·spite 尽管

ODE> Continuous physical force exerted on or against an object by something in contact with it. – force, physical force, load, stress, thrust.

1401. pre·tend 假装 ## 6

[prɪ’tend]v.假装；装作；自以为

  • Many people pretend that they understand modern art. 很多人装成很懂现代艺术。
  • It was no use pretending that I had not seen him, so I waved to him. 这是没有用假装我从来没有见过他，所以我向他招手。
  • Pretending to speak seriously, one of the workmen asked if he might make a telephone call before being taken to the station. 假装认真地说，工人们的一个问他是否会打一个电话被带往警察局之前。

SEE> an·y·more , an·y·way 无论如何, tell 告诉

ODE> Behave so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not. – make as if, profess, affect.

1402. pret·ty 漂亮 ## 4

[’prɪti]adv.相当地adj.漂亮的；秀丽的；好看的vt.使漂亮n.漂亮的东西；美人

  • They are just pretty patterns. 他们是些好看的图案。
  • We like them in the same way that we like pretty curtain material. 我们喜欢他们以同样的方式，我们喜欢漂亮的窗帘布。
  • Dressed up as Father Christmas and accompanied by a ‘guard of honour’ of six pretty girls, he set off down the main street of the city riding a baby elephant called Jumbo. 他打扮成圣诞老人，在由6个漂亮姑娘组成的“仪仗队”，他掀起，沿着城里骑着名叫Jumbo的小象的主要街道。

SEE> quite 相当, re·al·ly 真的, ver·y 非常

ODE> (of a person, especially a woman or child) attractive in a delicate way without being truly beautiful. – attractive, lovely, good-looking, nice-looking, fetching, prepossessing, appealing, charming, delightful, nice, engaging, pleasing.

1403. pre·vent 防止 ## 6

[prɪ’vent]v.预防；防止，阻止；挡住

  • I had to think of a way of preventing him from following me around all morning. 我得想办法不让他整个上午都在跟着我周围的一种方式。
  • What piece of bad luck prevented the Cutty Sark from winning the race? 哪块坏运气从赢得比赛防止卡蒂萨克？
  • The journey is so smooth that there is nothing to prevent you from reading or sleeping. 在旅途平稳，没有什么阻止你阅读或睡眠。

SEE> a·void 避免, pro·tect 保护, stop 停止

ODE> Keep (something) from happening. – stop, put a stop to, avert, nip in the bud, fend off, turn aside, stave off, ward off, head off, shut out, block, intercept, halt, arrest, check, stay.

1404. pre·vi·ous 以前的 ## 2

[’priːviəs]adj.以前的；先于；在 … 之前

  • It had broken down the previous summer, and though I promised to repair it, I had never got round to it. 它坏了，去年夏天，尽管我答应修，但一直没腾出空来。
  • They had laboured for three years to produce this floating work of art; she was more richly carved and ornamented than any previous ship. 他们辛辛苦苦干了3年的生产技术的这种浮动工作;她更丰富的雕刻和比以往任何船只饰。

SEE> last 最后的, pri·or 先前的, re·cent 最近

ODE> Existing or occurring before in time or order. – foregoing, preceding, precursory, antecedent, above.

1405. price 价格 ## 10

[praɪs]n.价格；代价；价值v.给…定价；估价；贴价格标签；比较价格

  • I certainly do, but I don’t like the price. 我当然喜欢，但是我不喜欢的价格。
  • The normal price of a ticket is ￡2,000! 一张票的正常价格为£2000！
  • Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other, Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded. 每当意大利城邦在战争与对方，霍克沃德用于雇佣他的士兵诸侯谁愿意付出高昂的代价，他的要求。

SEE> cost 价钱为, mar·ket 市场, val·ue 价值

ODE> The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something. – cost, asking price, selling price, charge, fee, terms, payment, rate, fare, levy, toll, amount, sum, total, figure.

1406. pride 自豪 ## 2

[praɪd]n.骄傲；自豪；自尊心；引以自豪的东西vt.以 … 自豪

  • Much as we may pride ourselves on our good taste, we are no longer free to choose the things we want, for advertising exerts a subtle influence on us. 尽管我们可以对我们的好味道感到自豪，我们不再自由选择我们想要的东西，广告发挥对我们有潜移默化的影响。
  • It is a question of pride as much as anything else. 这是一件值得骄傲不亚于其他任何的问题。

SEE> sense 感, shame 羞耻, in·deed 确实

ODE> A feeling or deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one’s own achievements, the achievements of those with whom one is closely associated, or from qualities or possessions that are widely admired. – pleasure, joy, delight, gratification, fulfilment, satisfaction, sense of achievement.

1407. priest 牧师 ## 2

[priːst]n.教士；神父；牧师；僧侣；泰斗

  • In the light of this statement, teachers live by selling knowledge, philosophers by selling wisdom and priests by selling spiritual comfort. 根据这种说法的光，教师靠靠卖精神安慰卖知识，哲学家靠卖智慧和教士。
  • Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could – sometimes with the local priest (who was usually as poor as his parishioners), sometimes with shepherds or cheese-makers. 山谷里常常都没有小客栈，登山者只好随遇而安 - 有时同当地牧师（谁是通常作为穷人和他的教民），有时同牧羊人或奶酪制造商。

SEE> fa·ther 父亲, church 教会, like·wise

ODE> An ordained minister of the Catholic, Orthodox, or Anglican Church, authorized to perform certain rites and administer certain sacraments. – clergyman, clergywoman, minister, minister of religion, cleric, ecclesiastic, pastor, parson, churchman, churchwoman, man of the cloth, woman of the cloth, man of God, woman of God, father.

1408. prin·ci·ple 原则 ## 6

[’prɪnsəpl]n.原理；原则；主义；信念

  • Even if one didn’t know from concrete examples (the 1936 Olympic Games, for instance) that international sporting contests lead to orgies of hatred, one could deduce it from general principles. 一个人即使不能从具体的事例（如1936年奥林匹克运动会）了解到国际运动比赛会导致疯狂的仇恨知道，人们可以从一般的原则推断出这一点。
  • This echo-location in bats is often compared with radar, the principle of which is similar. 蝙蝠这种回声定位常常与雷达相比较，其原理是类似的。
  • Politicians agree, in principle, so America and the EU have been trying to reach a deal which would eliminate the need to double-test many products. 政治家原则同意，因此，美国和欧洲一直在寻求达成协议将不再需要双测试许多产品的交易。

SEE> fun·da·men·tal 基本的, where·by , re·gard 看待

ODE> A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behaviour or for a chain of reasoning. – truth, proposition, concept, idea, theory, postulate.

1409. print 脚印 ## 6

[prɪnt]v.印刷；出版；打印；铭刻n.印刷字体；版画；印刷；印记；印刷物；印花adj.印刷的

  • Paw prints were seen in a number of places and puma fur was found clinging to bushes. 掌印被认为在许多地方和美洲狮的皮毛被发现抱住了灌木丛。
  • Nor could he have foreseen how we could use the Internet to obtain information on every known subject, so we can read it on a screen in our homes and even print it as well if we want to. 他也能预见我们如何能够利用互联网获取有关任何已知专题的信息，所以我们可以在家里的屏幕上阅读，甚至将其打印，以及如果我们想。
  • During these tests she was able to read a newspaper through an opaque screen and, stranger still, by moving her elbow over a child’s game of Lotto she was able to describe the figures and colours printed on it; and, in another instance, wearing stockings and slippers, to make out with her foot the outlines and colours of a picture hidden under a carpet. 在这些测试中，她能隔着不透明的屏幕，陌生人读报纸的是，通过在乐透的孩子的比赛，她能说出印在其上的数字和颜色移动她的胳膊肘;并且，在另一种情况下，她穿着长筒袜子和拖鞋，让与她的脚藏在地毯下面一幅画的轮廓和颜色。

SEE> cop·y 副本, pub·li·ca·tion 出版物, in·stance 例子

ODE> Produce (books, newspapers, etc.), especially in large quantities, by a mechanical process involving the transfer of text or designs to paper. – set in print, send to press, run off, preprint, reprint, pull, proof, copy, reproduce.

1410. pris·on 监狱 ## 2

[’prɪzn]n.监狱；监禁vt.囚禁；关入监狱

  • Not only had the poor man been arrested, but he had been sent to prison as well. 不仅那个可怜的被逮捕，但他已经被送往监狱。
  • He was sent to prison for failing to pay his debts and died in poverty in 1836. 他被送进监狱，未能按时支付他的债务，并在贫困中去世1836。

SEE> jail , im·pris·on·ment , sen·tence 句子

ODE> A building in which people are legally held as a punishment for a crime they have committed or while awaiting trial. – jail, penal institution, place of detention, lock-up, place of confinement, guardhouse, detention centre.

1411. pris·on·er 囚犯 ## 10

[’prɪznər]n.囚犯

  • Why did the prisoner attack the driver? 没有犯人为何要攻击的驱动程序？
  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。
  • Now, dressed in a blue uniform and with a rifle over his shoulder, the prisoner marched boldly up and down in front of the camp. 现在，在一个蓝色的制服，并用步枪在他的肩膀穿着，囚犯大胆进军上下在营地前。

SEE> pris·on 监狱, pre·sum·a·bly 想必, sol·dier 士兵

ODE> A person legally committed to prison as a punishment for a crime or while awaiting trial. – convict, inmate.

1412. pri·vate 私人的 ## 10

[’praɪvət]adj.私人的；个人的；私下的；私有的；缄默的n.士兵；列兵

  • ‘This is a private conversation!’ “这是私人间的谈话！”
  • In this way, he has begun his own private ‘telephone’ service. 就这样，他开始了自己的私人“电话”业务。
  • Many owners of private cars are going to offer ‘free rides’ to people on their way to work. 很多私人汽车的车主正准备提供“免费乘车”的人对他们的工作方式。

SEE> pub·lic 公众, pri·vate·ly 私自, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Belonging to or for the use of one particular person or group of people only. – personal, one’s own, individual, particular, special, exclusive, privately owned.

1413. prize 奖 ## 9

[praɪz]n.奖品；奖金；奖赏vt.珍视；估价adj.奖品的；得奖的；一流的

  • Every year I enter for the garden competition too, and I always win a little prize for the worst garden in the town! 我每年的花园竞赛进入过了，我总是得全镇最差花园的小奖！
  • One of Mary’s prize possessions was a little white lamb which her husband had given her. 其中玛丽最珍爱的东西之一就是她丈夫送给她的一只白色小羔羊。
  • In 1908 Lord Northcliffe offered a prize of ￡1,000 to the first man who would fly across the English Channel. 1908年，诺斯克利夫勋爵拿出£1,000奖颁给谁还会横渡英吉利海峡飞第一人。

SEE> a·ward 奖, win·ner 优胜者, pres·tig·ious

ODE> A thing given as a reward to the winner of a competition or in recognition of an outstanding achievement. – award, reward, premium.

1414. prob·a·bly 大概 ## 14

[’prɑːbəbli]adv.大概；或许；很可能

  • Everybody says I must be mad and they are probably right. 大家都说我肯定是疯了，他们可能是正确的。
  • ’You’ve probably woken up everyone in the village as well. “你可能唤醒每个人都在村里也是如此。
  • Though Verrazano is by no means considered to be a great explorer, his name will probably remain immortal, for on November 21st, 1964, the longest suspension bridge in the world was named after him. 虽然维拉萨诺绝不认为是一个伟大的探险家，他的名字将流芳百世，对1964年11月21日，世界上最长的吊桥是以他的名字命名的。

SEE> per·haps 也许, cer·tain·ly 当然, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Almost certainly; as far as one knows or can tell. – in all likelihood, in all probability, as likely as not, very likely, most likely, likely, as like as not, ten to one, the chances are, doubtless, no doubt, all things considered, taking all things into consideration, all things being equal, possibly, perhaps, maybe, it may be, presumably, on the face of it, apparently.

1415. prob·lem 问题 ## 23

[’prɑːbləm]n.问题；难题；习题adj.成问题的；难对付的

  • Is there a problem with the Customs officer? 是否存在与海关官员有问题吗？
  • What’s the problem about deciding on a holiday? 关于什么的决定放假的问题？
  • We have this problem every year. 我们每年都碰到这个问题。

SEE> solve 解决, fact 事实, trou·ble 麻烦

ODE> A matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome. – difficulty, issue, trouble, worry, complication, difficult situation, mess, muddle, mix-up.

1416. pro·cess 过程 ## 13

[’prɑˌsɛs]n.工序；过程v.加工；处理；起诉；列队前进

  • Mrs. Brabante is talking to the manager of the local factory where the crop is processed. 布拉班特太太正在和当地工厂，其中作物加工的经理。
  • In the process, he enjoyed himself thoroughly and kept telling everybody how much he hated hospitals. 在这个过程中，他尽情娱乐，一再告诉大家他是多么讨厌医院。
  • While you are on the phone, the baby pulls the tablecloth off the table, smashing half your best crockery and cutting himself in the process. 当你接电话时，孩子把桌布从桌子上半数摔碎，最好的陶器和切割自己的过程。

SEE> ra·ther 相当, re·sult 结果, step 脚步

ODE> A series of actions or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end. – procedure, operation, action, activity, exercise, affair, business, job, task, undertaking, proceeding.

1417. pro·duce 生产 ## 19

[prə’duːs]v.生产；引起；提出；制片；分娩n.产品；农产品

  • They made no effort to hide their amusement whenever I produced a packet of sweets from my pocket. 他们毫不掩饰地取笑，每当我生产一包糖果从我的口袋里。
  • When you come to think about it, there are only four ways you can deal with rubbish: dump it, burn it, turn it into something you can use again, attempt to produce less of it. 当你去想它，只有四种方法可以处理垃圾的方法：倾倒，焚烧，把它变成东西，你可以再次使用，试图产生的却很少。
  • We keep trying all four methods, but the sheer volume of rubbish we produce worldwide threatens to overwhelm us. 我们一直在试这四种方法，但垃圾的绝对数量，我们的全球生产威胁压倒我们。

SEE> cre·ate 创造, gen·er·ate 产生, e·nough 足够的

ODE> Make or manufacture from components or raw materials. – manufacture, make, construct, build, fabricate, put together, assemble, turn out, bring out, process, create.

1418. prod·uct 产品 ## 9

[’prɑːdʌkt]n.产品；产物；结果；某种影响下产生的人或物；乘积

  • In their efforts to persuade us to buy this or that product, advertisers have made a close study of human nature and have classified all our little weaknesses. 在他们的努力劝说我们买这个或那个产品，广告商作出人性的仔细研究，并已列为我们所有的小弱点。
  • Gifts poured in not only from unknown people, but from baby food and soap manufacturers who wished to advertise their products. 礼品不但素昧平生的人，但婴儿食品，婴儿肥皂制造商谁希望自己的产品做广告浇英寸
  • Industrialized farming methods produce cheap meat products: beef, pork and chicken. 工业化的农作方式生产出廉价的肉类制品 - 牛肉，猪肉和鸡肉。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子, brand 品牌

ODE> An article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale. – object, thing, item, unit, artefact, piece of merchandise, commodity, product.

1419. pro·fes·sion·al 专业的 ## 3

[prə’feʃənl]adj.职业的；专业的；专门的n.专业人员

  • The hardened professional smuggler, on the other hand, is never troubled by such feelings, even if he has five hundred gold watches hidden in his suitcase. 而老练的职业走私犯另一方面，从未被这样的感情困扰，就算他有500个金表藏在他的手提箱。
  • How do professional writers ignore what they were taught at school about writing? 如何专业作家忽略了他们在学校被教怎么样写？
  • It is no use inviting the politician or the professional or business man, who has been working or worrying about serious things for six days, to work or worry about trifling things at the weekend. 这是没有用邀请政治家，专业人士或者商人，谁一直在左右上周末琐碎的事情工作或担心严肃的事情六天，工作或担心。

SEE> am·a·teur , ca·reer 事业, work·ing 工作

ODE> Relating to or belonging to a profession. – white-collar, executive, non-manual.

1420. pro·fes·sor 教授 ## 2

[prə’fesər]n.教授；老师

  • Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh. 米德 - 集成电路的一位先驱，加州技术学院的计算机科学教授，注意到，现在的工作站，使工程师可以设计，试验和生产芯片在他们的办公桌，就像一位编辑器上创建一个简讯在Macintosh。
  • Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer, argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system, may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization. 罗纳德·布雷斯韦尔教授，领先美国射电天文学家，自然认为，如此优越的文明，对我们自己的太阳能系统进行访问，可能已经离开了自动信使以等待一个先进文明的觉醒。

SEE> u·ni·ver·si·ty 大学, as·so·ci·ate 联系, sci·en·tist 科学家

ODE> A university academic of the highest rank; the holder of a university chair. – holder of a chair, chair, head of faculty, head of department.

1421. pro·gramme 程序 ## 3

[’proʊɡræm]n.方案；（活动的）程序；节目；规划；课程；（机器工作的）程序v.计划；培养；编程；制作节目；预设

  • The only funny things we heard that evening came from the advertiser at the beginning of the programme. 那天晚上唯一有趣的事情是节目开始时从广告商来了。
  • During a radio programme, a company of biscuit manufacturers once asked listeners to bake biscuits and send them to their factory. 在一个电台节目中，一个生产饼干请听众公司烘制饼干送到他们的工厂。
  • Alfred had learned many of their ballads in his youth, and could vary his programme with acrobatic tricks and simple conjuring. 阿尔弗雷德学会了许多他们自己的青春歌谣，并能穿插演一些杂技和小魔术自己的节目多样化。

ODE> A set of related measures or activities with a particular long-term aim. – scheme, plan, plan of action, initiative, series of measures, project, strategy, solution.

1422. pro·gress 进展 ## 7

[’prɑːɡres]n.进步；发展；前进v.进步；发展；缓速前进；促进

  • They have been told that rescue operations are progressing smoothly. 他们被告知营救工作进行得非常顺利。
  • In what two areas have people made no ‘progress’ at all? 在哪两个方面都人都没有取得“进步”？
  • Why does the idea of progress loom so large in the modern world? 为什么进步织机的想法，在现代世界如此之大？

SEE> suc·cess 成功, im·prove·ment 改进, hope 希望

ODE> Forward or onward movement towards a destination. – forward movement, onward movement, progression, advance, advancement, headway, passage.

1423. proj·ect 项目 ## 2

[’prɑːdʒekt]n.计划；工程；项目；课题；专题研究；住房工程v.计划；预计；设计；放映；投射；表达；突出；投掷

  • The development of such a telescope will be one of the great astronomical projects of the twenty-first century. 这样一台望远镜的发展将是二十一世纪最伟大的天文项目之一。
  • Some time ago the United States Navy, for instance, examined a very large number of men working on aircraft carriers: the study was known as Project Anehin. 前段时间美国海军，比如，检查了非常多的人在航空母舰上工作：研究被称为安内欣计划。

SEE> de·vel·op·ment 发展, con·struc·tion 建造, build 建造

ODE> An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim. – scheme, plan, plan of action, programme, enterprise, undertaking, venture, activity, operation, campaign.

1424. prom·ise 承诺 ## 6

[’prɑːmɪs]n.诺言；预示；约定；(有)希望v.允诺；发誓；答应；有希望

  • It had broken down the previous summer, and though I promised to repair it, I had never got round to it. 它坏了，去年夏天，尽管我答应修，但一直没腾出空来。
  • Buried somewhere in deep grass there is a rusting lawn mower which I have promised to repair one day. 在深草埋某处有我曾答应某日要修理一个生锈的割草机。
  • He loved to be told that one of his imaginary products was temporarily out of stock and he would faithfully promise to call again at some future date, but of course he never did. 他爱听售货员说他想像的那种东西暂时脱销，于是他就煞有介事地许诺改天再来打电话，当然，他从来没有。

SEE> prom·is·ing , in·deed 确实, hope 希望

ODE> A declaration or assurance that one will do something or that a particular thing will happen. – word of honour, word, assurance, pledge, vow, guarantee, oath, bond, undertaking, agreement, commitment, contract, covenant, compact.

1425. prompt 提示 ## 2

[prɑːmpt]adj.迅速的；敏捷的；立刻的vt.激起；促进；推动；提示vi.提示n.提示；提示的内容n.[商]付款期限

  • Harry does not need to be prompted to explain how he bought his precious bottle of mud. 哈利不需要提示，解释他买下那瓶珍贵香水泥。
  • The Ombudsman’s prompt action at once put an end to an unpleasant practice which might have gone unnoticed. 监察员立即结束不愉快的做法可能还没有受到重视迅速行动。

SEE> ex·pect 期望, in·i·ti·ate , un·doubt·ed·ly

ODE> (of an event or fact) cause or bring about (an action or feeling) – give rise to, bring about, cause, occasion, result in, lead to, elicit, produce, bring on, engender, induce, call forth, evoke, precipitate, trigger, spark off, provoke, instigate.

1426. prompt·ly 立即 ## 5

[’prɑːmptli]adv.迅速地；准时地；立即

  • After he had put it on the floor, he promptly went to sleep again. 他把它放在地上后，他立刻去睡觉一次。
  • If the money was not paid promptly, the gangsters would quickly put a man out of business by destroying his shop. 如果资金不及时，歹徒们就会很快把人歇业通过破坏他的商店。
  • And he promptly handed the sheet of paper to the gaoler. 他及时交到纸张的狱卒。

SEE> im·me·di·ate·ly 立即, swift·ly , quick·ly 很快

ODE> With little or no delay; immediately. – punctually, on time, on the dot, on the nail.

1427. prop·er 适当的 ## 2

[’prɑːpər]adj.合适的；正当的；真正的

  • In his own lifetime Galileo was the centre of violent controversy; but the scientific dust has long since settled, and today we can see even his famous clash with the Inquisition in something like its proper perspective. 在伽利略在世时是激烈论战的中心;但科学的尘埃早已解决，今天我们可以在类似的适当的角度看待他那著名冲突，宗教裁判所。
  • The serious investor needs a proper ‘portfolio’ – a well-planned selection of investments, with a definite structure and a clear aim. 认真的投资者需要一份正规的投资组合表 - 投资的一个精心策划的选择，具有一定的结构和明确的目标。

SEE> ap·pro·pri·ate 适当, fur·ther·more , nec·es·sar·y 必要

ODE> Denoting something that is truly what it is said or regarded to be; genuine. – real, genuine, actual, true, bona fide.

1428. prop·er·ly 正确地 ## 2

[’prɑːpərli]adv.适当地；正确地；完全地

  • It can properly be described as the first ‘home computer’ and it pointed the way to the future. 它可以被适当地描述为第一台“家用电脑”，而且它也指了今后的方向。
  • Once we detected a planet, we would have to find a way of blotting out the light from its star, so that we would be able to ‘see’ the planet properly and analyse its atmosphere. 一旦我们这样一颗行星，我们就必须找到遮住了从它的恒星的光的方式，这样我们就能够“看见”这颗行星，并分析它的大气层。

SEE> ad·e·quate·ly 充分, ap·pro·pri·ate·ly , cor·rect·ly 正确地

ODE> Correctly or satisfactorily. – correctly, rightly, right, all right.

1429. prop·er·ty 财产 ## 2

[’prɑːpərti]n.财产；所有物；地产，房地产；性质；道具

  • Insuring public or private property is a standard practice in most countries in the world. 承办公共或私人财产是大多数国家在世界上的标准做法。
  • This is a sceptical age, but although our faith in many of the things in which our forefathers fervently believed has weakened, our confidence in the curative properties of the bottle of medicine remains the same as theirs. 这是一个怀疑一切的时代，可是虽然我们中的许多，使我们的祖先笃信的事情的信心有所减弱，我们对瓶装药品疗效的信心仍与祖先一样。

SEE> es·tate 地产, own·er·ship , land 土地

ODE> A thing or things belonging to someone; possessions collectively. – possessions, belongings, things, goods, worldly goods, effects, personal effects, stuff, chattels, movables.

1430. pro·por·tion 比例 ## 2

[prə’pɔːrʃn]n.部分；比例；均衡；（复）规模vt.使成比例；使均衡；分摊

  • We are lucky in that only the lower fields, which make up a very small proportion of our farm, are affected by flooding, but other farms are less favourably sited, and flooding can sometimes spell disaster for their owners. 我们是只有较低的领域，从而弥补了我们农场比例很小幸运，是由洪水的影响，但其他农场地势欠佳，和洪水有时会给农场主带来灾难。
  • John Dewey has said in all seriousness that the part played by custom in shaping the behaviour of the individual, as against any way in which he can affect traditional custom, is as the proportion of the total vocabulary of his mother tongue against those words of his own baby talk that are taken up into the vernacular of his family. 杜威曾经非常严肃地指出：风俗在形成个人的行为，反对任何方式中他能影响传统习惯所起的作用，是因为他的母语的词汇总量的反对的那些话的比例他被吸收入他家的白话自己的宝宝说话。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, frac·tion , fur·ther·more

ODE> A part, share, or number considered in comparative relation to a whole. – part, portion, amount, quantity, bit, piece, percentage, section, segment, share, quota, division, fraction, measure.

1431. pro·tect 保护 ## 7

[prə’tekt]v.保护；投保

  • Now they have had special cages made to protect them from these monsters. 现在，他们不得不做出保护他们免受怪物特殊的笼子。
  • How do cats try to protect themselves when falling from great heights? 如何猫尝试从很高的地方落下时保护自己？
  • To protect themselves from the icy water, they had to wear special rubber suits. 为了保护自己，湖水冰冷刺骨，他们必须穿上一种特制的橡皮服。

SEE> pre·vent 防止, pro·tec·tion 保护, de·fend 保卫

ODE> Keep safe from harm or injury. – keep safe, keep from harm, save, safeguard, shield, preserve, defend, cushion, shelter, screen, secure, fortify, guard, mount guard on, stand guard on.

1432. pro·tec·tion 保护 ## 5

[prə’tekʃn]n.保护；防卫

  • There was a time when the owners of shops and businesses in Chicago had to pay large sums of money to gangsters in return for ‘protection’. 曾经有一个时期，芝加哥的店主和商行的老板们不得不付出的钱给歹徒大笔以换取“保护”的时间。
  • Obtaining ‘protection money’ is not a modern crime. 榨取“保护金”并不是一个现代的罪恶行径。
  • In times of peace, when business was bad, Hawkwood and his men would march into a city-state and, after burning down a few farms, would offer to go away if protection money was paid to them. 在和平时期，当生意萧条时，霍克伍德和他的手下将步入一个城邦，纵火烧毁一两个农场后，将提供走开，如果保护金，支付给他们。

SEE> pro·tect 保护, more·o·ver 此外, guar·an·tee 保证

ODE> The action of protecting, or the state of being protected. – defence, shielding, shelter, preservation, conservation, safe keeping, safeguarding, safety, security, sanctuary, refuge, lee, immunity, insurance, indemnity.

1433. proud 骄傲的 ## 4

[praʊd]adj.自豪的；自尊的；自傲的；壮观盛大的

  • We are very proud of him. 我们都为他感到骄傲。
  • For the first time in his life, he became the proud owner of a bed which had springs and a mattress. 平生第一次，他成了一个床自豪地拥有其中有弹簧床垫。
  • The only person I know who has a skeleton in the cupboard is George Carlton, and he is very proud of the fact. 只有我知道谁的人有本难念的骨架是乔治·卡尔顿，他非常自豪的事实。

SEE> glad 高兴的, hap·py 快乐, thrilled

ODE> Feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of one’s own achievements, qualities, or possessions or those of someone with whom one is closely associated. – pleased, pleased with, glad, glad about, glad at, happy, happy about, happy at, happy with, delighted, delighted about, delighted at, delighted with, joyful, joyful at, overjoyed, overjoyed at, overjoyed over, thrilled, thrilled about, thrilled at, thrilled by, thrilled with, well pleased, well pleased with, satisfied, satisfied with, gratified, gratified at, content, content at, appreciative, appreciative of.

1434. prove 证明 ## 24

[pruːv]v.证明；检验；结果是；发酵

  • The operation, which lasted for over four hours, proved to be very difficult because of the hard resin which covered the skin. 操作，这持续了4个小时，证明是因为其覆盖的皮肤硬质树脂的非常困难。
  • However, rescue operations are proving difficult. 然而，救援工作非常困难。
  • Experiments have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age. 实验证明，孩子们可以在游泳在很小的时候就被指示。

SEE> in·deed 确实, cer·tain·ly 当然, con·vinced

ODE> Demonstrate the truth or existence of (something) by evidence or argument. – demonstrate, show, show beyond doubt, show to be true, manifest, produce proof, submit proof, produce evidence, submit evidence, establish evidence, evince.

1435. pro·vide 提供 ## 12

[prə’vaɪd]v.供给；提供；准备；规定；抚养

  • Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics. 报纸和杂志的编辑常常走极端为了向读者提供一些无关紧要的事实和统计数字。
  • Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income. 爸爸妈妈，当然，提供的零花钱正常供应，但叔叔和婶婶总是额外收入来源。
  • If you can do without the few pastoral pleasures of the country, you will find the city can provide you with the best that life can offer. 如果您可以在没有国家的少数田园乐趣的话，你会发现城市可以为您提供最好的生活可以提供。

SEE> en·a·ble 使能够, give 给, need 需要

ODE> Make available for use; supply. – supply, give, issue, furnish, lay out, come up with, dispense, bestow, impart, produce, yield, bring forth, bear, deliver, donate, contribute, pledge, advance, spare, part with, allocate, distribute, allot, assign, put forward, put up, proffer, present, extend, render.

1436. pub 酒馆 ## 2

[pʌb]n.酒吧；酒馆

  • After I had had lunch at a village pub, I looked for my bag. 我在一家乡村小酒店吃过午饭后，就找我的提包。
  • The villagers have told him that they will not accept the pub even if he gives it away. 村民们告诉他，即使他把它拿走，他们不会接受酒馆。

SEE> bar·tend·er , res·tau·rant 餐厅, night·club

ODE> An establishment for the sale of beer and other drinks, and sometimes also food, to be consumed on the premises. – tavern, bar, hostelry, taproom.

1437. pub·lic 公众 ## 16

[’pʌblɪk]adj.公众的；公共的；公开的n.民众；公众；大众

  • I visited museums and sat in public gardens. 我参观了博物馆，还去了公园。
  • A public house which was recently bought by Mr.Ian Thompson is up for sale. 公共房子最近被Mr.Ian汤普森买的出售。
  • But so far, the public has expressed its gratitude to the students in letters to the Press. 但到目前为止，公众已经表达了感谢学生写信给出版社。

SEE> pri·vate 私人的, e·ven 甚至, well 好

ODE> Of or concerning the people as a whole. – popular, general, common, communal, collective, shared, joint, universal, widespread.

1438. pub·lish 发布 ## 5

[’pʌblɪʃ]v.出版；发行；公开发表

  • When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it. 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。
  • When the journalist again failed to reply, the editor reluctantly published the article as it had originally been written. 但记者还是没有回复，编辑无奈地发表文章，因为它最初被写入。
  • Acting on the contention that facts are sacred, reporters can cause untold suffering to individuals by publishing details about their private lives. 代理的论点的事实是神圣的，记者可以通过发布关于他们私生活的细节，有时会给当事人造成极大的痛苦。

SEE> pub·li·ca·tion 出版物, write 写, com·pile

ODE> Prepare and issue (a book, journal, piece of music, etc.) for public sale, distribution, or readership. – issue, bring out, produce, print.

1439. pull 拉 ## 8

[pʊl]v.拉；拖；牵；拔；吸引n.拉；拉力；引力；划船；影响力

  • My dentist had just pulled out one of my teeth and had told me to rest for a while. 我的牙科医生刚刚给我拔掉了一颗牙，叫我休息一会儿。
  • When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth, I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth. 最后，当牙医移除从我嘴中药棉，我可以告诉他，他拔错了牙。
  • A small fishing boat was carried miles out to sea by the powerful fish as it pulled on the line. 一条小渔船被强大的鱼了几英里以外的海面拉就行了。

SEE> put 放, push 推, come 来

ODE> Exert force on (someone or something) so as to cause movement towards oneself. – tug, haul, drag, draw, trail, tow, heave, lug, strain at, jerk, lever, prise, wrench, wrest, twist.

1440. pu·pil 小学生 ## 4

[’pjuːpl]n.小学生；弟子；【解】瞳孔

  • Pupils of the school, old and new, will be sending him a present to mark the occasion. 学校的学生，新与旧，将送他一件礼物，以纪念这个日子。
  • A great many former pupils will be attending a farewell dinner in his honour next Thursday. 很多老学生将参加在他的荣誉下周四的告别宴会。
  • He offered to train Mendoza and his young pupil was quick to learn. 他主动提出训练门多萨和他的年轻学生一学就会。

SEE> teach·er 老师, last·ly , fur·ther·more

ODE> A person who is taught by another, especially a schoolchild or student in relation to a teacher. – student, schoolchild, schoolboy, schoolgirl, scholar.

1441. pur·chase 购买 ## 3

[’pɜːrtʃəs]vt.购买n.购买；购买的物品

  • It had been purchased by a local authority so that an enormous pie could be baked for an annual fair. 它是由一个地方当局买下，这样一个巨大的馅饼可以烘焙的年度展览会。
  • The curious bottle, which now adorns the bookcase in his study, was his first and last purchase of rare cosmetics. 好奇的瓶子，现在装饰书柜在他的书房，是他第一次也是最后一次购买的稀有化妆品。
  • As she is not rich, the chances that she will ever be able to afford such purchases are remote; but she is never sufficiently strong-minded to be able to stop the practice. 由于她并不富裕，有机会，她将永远能够买得起这些服装遥控;但她又缺乏足够坚强的头脑才能够停止这种做法。

SEE> buy 买, sale 销售, sell 卖

ODE> Acquire (something) by paying for it; buy. – buy, acquire, obtain, pick up, snap up, take, secure, procure, come by, pay for, shop for, invest in, put money into.

1442. pur·pose 目的 ## 3

[’pɜːrpəs]n.目的；决心；意图；议题v.打算；决意

  • The albatross is the king of the gliders, the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose, but must yield to its opposition. 信天翁是滑翔机之王，种类，其利用空气他们的目的传单的，但必须屈服于反对。
  • For our purposes, we are concerned only with one kind of cost – the cost of managing and administering the business. 处理和管理业务的成本 - 为了我们的目的，我们只用一种成本的关注。
  • These movements are controlled by the trainer with the metal-pointed stick, and the trunk eventually becomes so sore that the elephant curls it up and seldom afterwards uses it for offensive purposes. 这些运动是由与金属尖的棍子的教练控制，鼻子最后很痛的大象卷曲了起来，以后它就很少用进攻了。

SEE> aim 瞄准, ra·ther 相当, fur·ther·more

ODE> The reason for which something is done or created or for which something exists. – motive, motivation, grounds, cause, impetus, occasion, reason, point, basis, justification.

1443. push 推 ## 10

[pʊʃ]v.推；按；挤；逼迫；催促n.推；奋力；决心

  • Why did the police have to push Jumbo off the main street? 没有警察为什么要推巨型离主要街道？
  • Fifteen policemen had to push very hard to get him off the main street. 15名警察不得不非常用力地推，让他离主要街道。
  • Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them. 很多孩子用脚三轮车，但大多数都喜欢推或拖他们。

SEE> bring 带来, move 移动, ef·fort 努力

ODE> Exert force on (someone or something) in order to move them away from oneself. – shove, thrust, propel, impel.

1444. put 放 ## 59

[pʊt]v.放；安置；使处于；提交；记下；表达；出发；开航n.推铅球；期货买卖

  • Then put these clothes in the wardrobe. 然后把这些衣服在衣柜里。
  • Where does Sam put the vase in the end? 哪里萨姆把花瓶到底是谁？
  • I’m going to put it on this table, Sam. 我打算把它放在这张桌子上，萨姆。

SEE> out 出, but 但是, should 应该

ODE> Move to or place in a particular position. – place, set, put down, set down, lay, lay down, deposit, situate, position, settle.

1445. quan·ti·ty 数量 ## 4

[’kwɑːntəti]n.量；数量；大量

  • The seed was sprayed over the ground in huge quantities by aeroplanes. 种子是由飞机撒在地面巨大的数量。
  • The need to produce ever-increasing quantities of cheap food leads to a different kind of pollution. 需要生产廉价食物导致的不断增加的数量以不同的一种污染。
  • Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature, pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want. 假定每个传感器都给出了温度，压力，湿度，和气象学家需要的任何其他量完全准确的读数。

SEE> a·mount 数量, fur·ther·more , hence 因此

ODE> The amount or number of a material or abstract thing not usually estimated by spatial measurement. – amount, number, total, aggregate, sum, quota, group, size, mass, weight, volume, bulk, load, consignment, expanse, extent, length, area.

1446. quar·ter 四分之一 ## 3

[’kwɔːrtər]n.四分之一；一刻钟；一季；25美分；区；方向v.四等分adj.四分之一的

  • A quarter of a pound of tea. 茶一斤的四分之一。
  • But you mustn’t come home after a quarter past eleven. 但你一定不是一个季度以后回家十一点。
  • Because the Moon has only an eightieth of the Earth’s mass, it requires 97 per cent less energy to travel the quarter of a million miles from the Moon to Earth-orbit than the 200 mile-journey from Earth’s surface into orbit! 因为月球只有地球质量的8，636，它需要97％的能量较少，从月球到地球轨道旅行25万英里超过200英里的旅程从地球表面进入轨道！

SEE> fourth 第四, half 半, earn·ings

ODE> Each of four equal or corresponding parts into which something is or can be divided. – district, area, region, part, side, neighbourhood, precinct, locality, sector, section, zone, tract, belt.

1447. ques·tion 问题 ## 18

[’kwestʃən]n.问题；疑问v.询问；怀疑

  • The questions were very easy. 题目很容易。
  • I could answer sixteen of the questions. 我能回答的16道题。
  • She sat near the window and asked questions about everything she saw. 她坐在靠窗的位置，并询问了她的一切问题锯。

SEE> an·swer 回答, wheth·er 是否, why 为什么

ODE> A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information. – inquiry, query.

1448. quick 快 ## 4

[kwɪk]adj.迅速的；快的；机敏的adv.迅速地；快

  • That was quick! 那很快！
  • He offered to train Mendoza and his young pupil was quick to learn. 他主动提出训练门多萨和他的年轻学生一学就会。
  • The ants had been quick to find an answer to my thoroughly unscientific methods! 蚂蚁已很快找到了答案，我完全不科学的办法！

SEE> eas·y 容易, fast 快速, swift

ODE> Moving fast or doing something in a short time. – fast, swift, rapid, speedy, high-speed, expeditious.

1449. quick·ly 很快 ## 21

[’kwɪkli]adv.迅速地；立刻

  • On the way home, my wife said to me, ’Don’t drive so quickly! 在回家的路上，我的妻子对我说，“不要这么快开车！
  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。
  • George heard the noise and came downstairs quickly. 乔治听到了响声，迅速地下了楼。

SEE> soon 不久, e·ven·tu·al·ly 终于, fi·nal·ly 终于

ODE> At a fast speed; rapidly. – fast, swiftly, rapidly, speedily, at high speed, with all speed, at speed, at full speed, at the speed of light, at full tilt, as fast as one’s legs can carry one, at a gallop, briskly, at the double, post-haste, with all possible haste, like a whirlwind, like an arrow from a bow, at breakneck speed, expeditiously, madly, hotfoot, with dispatch.

1450. qui·et 安静 ## 9

[’kwaɪət]adj.安静的；宁静的；平静的n.安静；平静；闲适vt.使平静；使安心vi.平静下来

  • Everything’s very quiet. 一切都非常安静。
  • The children were at school, my husband was at work and the house was quiet. 孩子们在上学，我丈夫在上班，家里很安静。
  • He waited until the volcano became quiet and he was able to return two days later. 他等到火山平静下来，两天以后又返回去。

SEE> calm 平静, tran·quil , nor·mal·ly 通常

ODE> Making little or no noise. – silent, still, hushed, noiseless, soundless.

1451. qui·et·ly 悄悄 ## 3

[’kwaɪətli]adv.安静地；悄悄地；平静地

  • While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to keep calm and to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. 在我们等待降落时，一位空中乘务员告诉我们要保持镇静，因为它感动了下来静静地尽快离开飞机。
  • While the five babies were still quietly sleeping in oxygen tents in a hospital nursery, their parents were paying the price for fame. 眼下，五胞胎还静静地躺在氧气帐里医院婴儿室，他们的父母却为这名声付出了代价。
  • Gradually the river grows wider, the banks recede, the waters flow more quietly, and in the end, without any visible break, they become merged in the sea, and painlessly lose their individual being. 渐渐地，河面变宽，两岸后撤，河水流得平缓起来，最后，没有任何明显的突破，他们成为融入了大海，毫无痛苦地失去了自我的存在。

SEE> si·lent·ly , af·ter·ward , hap·pi·ly 快乐地

ODE> In a quiet manner. – silently, in silence, noiselessly, soundlessly, inaudibly.

1452. quite 相当 ## 21

[kwaɪt]adv.相当；完全；十分；很

  • They were also quite sure that a cigarette end did not start the fire. 他们还相当肯定，一个烟头没有启动火。
  • The drunk, however, seemed quite sure of himself. 这醉汉像是很有把握似的。
  • In winter, however, life at the monastery is quite different. 在冬季，然而，生活在修道院是完全不同的。

SEE> ver·y 非常, in·deed 确实, pret·ty 漂亮

ODE> To the utmost or most absolute extent or degree; absolutely; completely. – completely, fully, entirely, totally, wholly, absolutely, utterly, outright, thoroughly, altogether, in every respect, in all respects, without reservation, without exception.

1453. race 赛跑 ## 25

[reɪs]n.赛跑；竞争n.人种；种族；血统v.赛跑；竞赛

  • There is a car race near our town every year. 有每年都有一场汽车比赛我们镇子附近。
  • In 1995, there was a very big race. 1995年，有一个非常大的比赛。
  • My wife and I were at the race. 我的妻子和我在比赛中。

ODE> A competition between runners, horses, vehicles, etc. to see which is the fastest in covering a set course. – contest, competition.

1454. ra·di·o 无线电 ## 10

[’reɪdioʊ]n.收音机；无线电v.用无线电通讯

  • Fortunately, a pilot saw the signal and sent a message by radio to the nearest town. 幸运的是，一位飞行员看到这个信号，用无线电发送消息到最近的城镇。
  • Radio and television have made it possible for advertisers to capture the attention of millions of people in this way. 电台，电视使我们能够为广告主吸引千百万人的注意以这种方式。
  • During a radio programme, a company of biscuit manufacturers once asked listeners to bake biscuits and send them to their factory. 在一个电台节目中，一个生产饼干请听众公司烘制饼干送到他们的工厂。

SEE> broad·cast 广播, tel·e·vi·sion 电视, TV 电视

ODE> The transmission and reception of electromagnetic waves of radio frequency, especially those carrying sound messages. – transmit, convey, communicate.

1455. rail 铁轨 ## 2

[reɪl]n.栏杆；扶手；铁轨v.抱怨；责骂；以横木围栏；铺铁轨

  • Reading is only a partial solution, for the monotonous rhythm of the wheels clicking on the rails soon lulls you to sleep. 看书只能解决部分问题。车轮点击轨道不久的间歇，你睡觉的单调的节奏。
  • The hovercraft is particularly useful in large areas with poor communications such as Africa or Australia; it can become a ‘flying fruit-bowl’, carrying bananas from the plantations to the ports; giant hovercraft liners could span the Atlantic; and the railway of the future may well be the ‘hovertrain’, riding on its air cushion over a single rail, which it never touches, at speeds up to 300 m.p.h. 气垫船与沟通不畅，如非洲，澳大利亚大地区特别有用。它能成为“飞行水果盘子”，从种植园动到港口的香蕉;大型的气垫班轮或许能跨越大西洋。和将来的火车或许能成为“气垫火车”，乘着气垫在单个轨道，而不接触，在速度高达300 M.P.H.

SEE> rail·road 铁路, train 火车, trans·por·ta·tion 运输

ODE> A bar or series of bars fixed on upright supports or attached to a wall or ceiling, serving as part of a barrier or used to hang things on. – protest strongly at, make a protest against, fulminate against, inveigh against, rage against, thunder against, declaim against, remonstrate about, expostulate about, make a fuss about, speak out against, express disapproval of, criticize severely, denounce, censure, condemn.

1456. rail·way 铁路 ## 8

[’reɪlweɪ]n.【C】铁路

  • The railway station was big, black and dark. 火车站很大，又黑又暗。
  • They will also be building new roads and a special railway line. 他们还将兴建新的公路和一条铁路专用线。
  • This platform would serve as a port and a railway station. 此平台将用作码头和火车站。

ODE> A track made of steel rails along which trains run. –

1457. rain 下雨 ## 17

[reɪn]n.雨；雨水v.下雨；(雨点般)落下

  • It’s always warm in April and May, but it rains sometimes. 它总是温暖的四月和五月，但有时下雨。
  • It’s often cold in November and it rains sometimes. 它通常在寒冷的十一月，而且有时下雨。
  • It rained all the time. 下雨所有的时间。

SEE> tor·ren·tial , snow 雪, rain·y

ODE> The condensed moisture of the atmosphere falling visibly in separate drops. – rainfall, precipitation, raindrops, rainwater, wet weather.

1458. raise 举起 ## 5

[reɪz]n.上升；增高；高地vt.升起；举起；饲养；提出；引起；筹集，募集

  • Our vicar is always raising money for one cause or another, but he has never managed to get enough money to have the church clock repaired. 我们的牧师总是为了钱，一个原因或其他，但他从来没有设法得到足够的钱来把教堂的钟修好。
  • The sea bed was scoured with powerful nets and there was tremendous excitement on board when a chest was raised from the bottom. 海床用结实的网冲刷并有巨大的兴奋在船上当一只箱子从海底升起。
  • From a heavy gun that was raised, the captain realized that the ship must have been a cruiser. 从捞起的一门大炮来看，船长认为那艘船一定是艘巡洋舰。

SEE> bring 带来, in·crease 增加, might 也许

ODE> Lift or move to a higher position or level. – lift, lift up, raise aloft, elevate.

1459. range 范围 ## 2

[reɪndʒ]n.范围；射程；山脉；排；一系列；闲逛；炉灶；【数】值域，极差v.排列；使…站在某一方；延伸；漫游；射程达到(某距离)

  • that dogs barking incessantly in the night rated the highest form of noise pollution on a scale ranging from 1 to 7. 狗在夜间额定噪声污染的最高形式上的刻度范围从1到7个不停吠叫。
  • Ever since, people have had difficulty in deciding whether the craft should be ranged among ships, planes, or land vehicles – for it is something in between a boat and an aircraft. 从那时起，人们不得不在决定是否工艺应中的舰艇，飞机或陆地车辆被测距困难 - 因为它是介于船和飞机之间。

SEE> va·ri·e·ty 品种, var·ied 多种, be·yond 超出

ODE> The area of variation between upper and lower limits on a particular scale. – span, scope, compass, radius, scale, gamut, reach, sweep, extent, area, field, orbit, ambit, province, realm, domain, horizon, latitude.

1460. rap·id 迅速的 ## 2

[’ræpɪd]adj.短时间发生的；急速的；迅速的；快的；险峻的n.急流；湍滩

  • What is going on when a person experiences rapid eye-movements during sleep? 这是怎么回事，当一个人在睡眠中经历了快速的眼睛运动吗？
  • He showed that the average individual’s sleep cycle is punctuated with peculiar bursts of eye-movements, some drifting and slow, others jerky and rapid. 他指出，平常人的睡眠周期中不时用眼睛运动，有的飘忽而缓慢，有的急剧而快速的阵阵奇特。

SEE> ac·cel·er·ate , slow 慢, trans·for·ma·tion

ODE> Happening in a short time or at a great rate. – quick, fast, swift, speedy, high-speed, expeditious, express, brisk, lively, prompt, flying, fleeting, lightning, meteoric, overnight, whirlwind, fast-track, whistle-stop.

1461. rap·id·ly 迅速地 ## 8

[’ræpɪdli]adv.迅速地；很快地

  • Working rapidly in the darkness, he soon changed into the dead man’s clothes. 在黑暗中迅速工作，他很快就换上了死者的衣服。
  • Below, the captain realized to his horror that the Titanic was sinking rapidly, for five of her sixteen watertight compartments had already been flooded! 下面，实现了他惊恐的队长是泰坦尼克号正在急速下沉，16个密封舱已有5个进水。
  • The morning passed rapidly and Frank was about to leave when he noticed a large packing case lying on the floor. 上午很快过去了，弗兰克正准备离去，突然看见一个大包装的情况下趴在地上。

SEE> quick·ly 很快, slow·ly 慢慢地, stead·i·ly 稳步地

ODE> Very quickly; at a great rate. – quickly, fast, swiftly, speedily, at speed, at full speed, at the speed of light, post-haste, hotfoot, at full tilt, as fast as one’s legs can carry one, at a gallop, expeditiously, briskly, promptly.

1462. rare 罕见的 ## 8

[rer]adj.罕见的；珍贵的；煎得嫩的

  • Jasper White is one of those rare people who believes in ancient myths. 怀特是少有的在谁相信古代神话之一。
  • By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing. 到了这个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。
  • As there were strange marks on the X-ray plates taken of the mummy, doctors have been trying to find out whether the woman died of a rare disease. 由于有上采取的木乃伊的X光片奇怪的标记，医生们一直试图搞清这位妇女是否死于一种罕见的疾病。

SEE> un·com·mon , un·u·su·al 异常, ex·cep·tion 例外

ODE> (of an event, situation, or condition) not occurring very often. – infrequent, few and far between, scarce, sparse, scattered, thin on the ground, golden, like gold dust, as scarce as hen’s teeth.

1463. rare·ly 很少地 ## 11

[’rerli]adv.很少；难得

  • Big Ben has rarely gone wrong. 大本钟很少出差错。
  • Occasionally, unusual creatures are washed to the shore, but they are rarely caught out at sea. 偶尔，一些罕见的动物被冲到岸上来，但它们在海上很少能被捕捉到。
  • Such creatures have rarely been seen alive by man as they live at a depth of six hundred feet. 这样的动物，因为它们生活在600英尺深的水下很少能看到活着的人。

SEE> sel·dom , fre·quent·ly 经常, oc·ca·sion·al·ly 偶尔

ODE> Not often; seldom. – seldom, infrequently, on rare occasions, hardly ever, scarcely ever, hardly, scarcely, almost never, once in a while, only now and then, not often, only occasionally, sporadically.

1464. rate 率 ## 3

[reɪt]n.比率；速度；价格；费用；等级v.认为；估价；定等级；值得；怒斥；责骂

  • that dogs barking incessantly in the night rated the highest form of noise pollution on a scale ranging from 1 to 7. 狗在夜间额定噪声污染的最高形式上的刻度范围从1到7个不停吠叫。
  • But the significant thing is not the behaviour of the players but the attitude of the spectators: and, behind the spectators, of the nations who work themselves into furies over these absurd contests, and seriously believe – at any rate for short periods – that running, jumping and kicking a ball are tests of national virtue. 但显著的事情是不是运动员的行为，而是观众的态度：和自己的工作谁这些荒唐的比赛泼妇，甚至煞有介事地相信各国的观众身后 - 至少在短期内如此 - 跑跑，跳跳，踢踢球是对一个民族品德素质的检验。
  • It is one of the most unpleasant discoveries which we all make that we must decline in this way, that if we escape wars, accidents and diseases we shall eventually ‘die of old age’, and that this happens at a rate which differs little from person to person, so that there are heavy odds in favour of our dying between the ages of sixty-five and eighty. 这是最令人不快的发现之一，我们都使我们必须以这种方式下降，如果我们能避开战争，意外事故和疾病，我们最终也会“老死”，而这发生在一个速度，从不同的小人与人之间，以便有利于我们的65和八十岁之间死亡的重几率。

SEE> in·crease 增加, in·ter·est 兴趣, rise 上升

ODE> A measure, quantity, or frequency, typically one measured against another quantity or measure. – speed, pace, tempo, velocity, momentum.

1465. ra·ther 相当 ## 11

[’ræðər]adv.相当；宁愿；有点儿int. 好呀

  • To make matters worse, the room is rather small, so I have temporarily put my books on the floor. 更糟的是，房间非常小，所以我暂时把书放在了地板上。
  • He was rather elderly with grey hair and clear blue eyes. 他上了年纪，灰白的头发和明亮的蓝眼睛。
  • As long ago as the fourteenth century, an Englishman, Sir John Hawkwood, made the remarkable discovery that people would rather pay large sums of money than have their life work destroyed by gangsters. 早在14世纪，英国人约翰。霍克伍德就有过非凡的发现：人们情愿付出的钱，也不愿毕生的心血毁于歹徒大笔。

SEE> in·stead 代替, sim·ply 只是, ei·ther 任何一个

ODE> Used to indicate one’s preference in a particular matter. – by preference, sooner, preferably, by choice, from choice, more willingly, more readily.

1466. reach 达到 ## 18

[riːtʃ]v.到达；伸出；达成；取得联系；延伸；（伸手）去够n.范围；影响力；河段；等级

  • I had nearly reached the town, when the young man suddenly said, very slowly, ‘Do you speak English?’ 就要到达那个镇时，那青年突然开了口，慢慢地，“你​​会讲英语吗？”
  • Byrd now knew that he would be able to reach the South Pole which was 300 miles away, for there were no more mountains in sight. 伯德这时知道他能够顺利到达南极了300英里以外的，因为当时在没有山。
  • The winning car reached a speed of forty miles an hour – much faster than any of its rivals. 获胜的那辆车达到了每小时四十英里的速度 - 比任何竞争对手的要快得多。

SEE> a·ble 能够, be·yond 超出, come 来

ODE> Stretch out an arm in a specified direction in order to touch or grasp something. – stretch out, hold out, extend, outstretch, thrust out, stick out.

1467. re·ac·tion 反应 ## 2

[ri’ækʃn]n.反应；生理反应；反应能力；复旧；反动；化学反应

  • It is as if a single unimportant event set up a chain of reactions. 这是因为如果单不重要事件成立反应的链。
  • If parents were prepared for this adolescent reaction, and realized that it was a sign that the child was growing up and developing valuable powers of observation and independent judgment, they would not be so hurt, and therefore would not drive the child into opposition by resenting and resisting it. 如果家长对青少年的这种反应准备，并且意识到这是一个迹象，表明孩子正在成长和发展的观察和独立判断有价值的权力，他们就不会感到如此伤心，所以也就不会由于怨恨而把孩子推到对立面和抵御它。

SEE> re·sponse 响应, re·act 反应, re·sult 结果

ODE> Something done, felt, or thought in response to a situation or event. – response.

1468. read 读 ## 43

[riːd]v.识字；阅读；朗读；理解；读到；猜测；读唇语；写着；读起来（给人以某种印象）；显示；看读数；听到；将…改为；攻读；（计算机）读盘n.阅读；好读物adj.博学的；熟知的

  • I can’t read it! 我看不懂！
  • Mr. Sawyer usually reads his newspaper, but sometimes he and his wife watch television. 索耶先生总是读报纸，但有时和他的妻子一起看电视。
  • Mr. Sawyer usually reads his newspaper at night. 索耶先生通常是在晚上看报。

SEE> read·ing 阅读, write 写, in·stance 例子

ODE> Look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed. – peruse, study, scrutinize, look through.

1469. read·er 读者 ## 6

[’riːdər]n.读者；读物；读本

  • Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics. 报纸和杂志的编辑常常走极端为了向读者提供一些无关紧要的事实和统计数字。
  • The reader’s hair stands on end when he reads in the final pages of the novel that the heroine, a dear old lady who had always been so kind to everybody, had, in her youth, poisoned every one of her five husbands. 读者的头发看台上结束的时候，他在小说的最后几页了解到书中女主人公，一个亲爱的老太太谁一直是这样善待每个人，曾在她的青春，她毒死五个丈夫的每一个读取。
  • In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences – most of them wildly improbable. 大部分是牵强附会，不可思议 - 在十九世纪时，小说家将通过一系列的巧合他的读者带来了他的故事的一个结论。

SEE> view·er , lis·ten·er , in·stance 例子

ODE> A person who reads or who is fond of reading. – educator, tutor, instructor, pedagogue, schoolteacher, schoolmaster, schoolmistress, master, mistress, governess, educationalist, educationist.

1470. read·ing 阅读 ## 2

[’riːdɪŋ]n.阅读；读物；读数；理解；异文动词read的现在分词.

  • I still haven’t given up my resolution to do more reading. 我还没有放弃我的决心做更多的阅读。
  • Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature, pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want. 假定每个传感器都给出了温度，压力，湿度，和气象学家需要的任何其他量完全准确的读数。

SEE> read 读, writ·ing 写作, in·stance 例子

ODE> The action or skill of reading. – perusal, study, scan, scanning, scrutiny.

1471. read·y 准备 ## 8

[’redi]adj.准备好的；现成的；乐意的；情愿的

  • I’m nearly ready. 我马上就好。
  • Is dinner ready, Carol? 饭好了，卡罗尔？
  • It’s nearly ready. 这几乎是准备好了。

SEE> pre·pared 准备, come 来, pre·pare 准备

ODE> In a suitable state for an action or situation; fully prepared. – prepared, all set, set, organized, in a fit state, equipped, primed.

1472. re·al 真实的 ## 13

[’riːəl]adj.真实的；真的；正宗的；真正的；名副其实的；实际的；现实的；不动产的adv.非常n.真实；雷阿尔（昔日西班牙等地的货币）

  • Tired of sleeping on the floor, a young man in Teheran saved up for years to buy a real bed. 累了睡在地板上，一名年轻男子在德黑兰积蓄多年买了一张真正的床。
  • This was worse than ‘a terrible secret’; this was a real skeleton! 这是比“骇人听闻的秘密”更加这是一个真正的骷髅！
  • But real tramps are not beggars. 但真正的流浪并不是乞丐。

SEE> in·deed 确实, ac·tu·al·ly 其实, fact 事实

ODE> Actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact; not imagined or supposed. – actual, existent, non-fictional, non-fictitious, factual.

1473. re·al·i·ty 现实 ## 2

[ri’æləti]n.真实；现实；实际

  • And although no period or place in American history has been more absurdly romanticized, myth and reality did join hands in at least one arena, the conflict between the individual and encroaching civilization. 虽然在美国历史上没有任何时期或地方已被荒谬地浪漫主义，神话和现实都携手至少在某一个舞台，个人与渐渐渗入的文明之间的冲突。
  • It is always wiser and safer to face up to reality, however painful it may be at the moment. 它始终是更明智，更安全地面对现实，多么痛苦可能的时刻。

SEE> fact 事实, in·deed 确实, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> The state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them. – the real world, real life, actuality.

1474. re·al·ize 意识到 ## 21

[’riːəlaɪz]vt.实现；了解；意识到；变卖

  • But they don’t realize one important thing. 但他们没有认识到重要的事情。
  • The man laughed when he realized what had happened. 当他意识到发生了什么事的人都笑了。
  • Looking round, I realized with a shock that I was the only passenger left on the bus. 回头望望，我震惊意识到我是离开了总线上唯一的乘客。

SEE> sure·ly 一定, un·der·stand 懂, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是
