1475. re·al·ly 真的 ## 23

[’riːəli]adv.实在；真正地；事实上

  • Are you really going to retire, Miss Marsh? 你真的准备退休，马什小姐？
  • I’m not really interested in fishing. 我没有真正的兴趣在钓鱼。
  • Even really honest people are often made to feel guilty. 甚至是最诚实的人也常弄得觉得有罪似的。

SEE> think 想, thing 事情, know 知道

ODE> In actual fact, as opposed to what is said or imagined to be true or possible. – in fact, in actual fact, actually, in reality, in point of fact, as a matter of fact, in truth, if truth be told, to tell the truth, in actuality.

1476. rea·son 理由 ## 12

[’riːzn]n.原因；理由；理智；理性v.理论；论证；推理；劝说

  • What reasons did Karen Marsh give for wanting to retire? 卡伦。马什说想要退休的理由是什么？
  • The airport was built years ago, but for some reason it could not be used then. 机场是许多年前建的，但由于某种原因不能再使用。
  • People who work in offices are frequently referred to as ‘white-collar workers’ for the simple reason that they usually wear a collar and tie to go to work. 人谁在办公室工作，常常被称作“白领”，原因很简单，他们通常是穿着硬领和领带去上班。

SEE> fact 事实, why 为什么, in·deed 确实

ODE> A cause, explanation, or justification for an action or event. – cause, grounds, ground, basis, rationale.

1477. rea·son·a·ble 合理的 ## 3

[’riːznəbl]adj.合理的；通情达理的；公平适度的

  • By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing. 到了这个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。
  • Since the sea covers the greater part of the earth’s surface, it is quite reasonable to regard the sea floor as the basic form of the crust of the earth, with, superimposed upon it, the continents, together with the islands and other features of the oceans. 既然海洋覆盖了地球表面的大部分时间里，这是很合理的与岛屿和其他功能把海床看作地壳的基本形式，叠加，那么，大陆，一起海洋。
  • As a reasonable guess, they might, on an average, be 100 light years away. 作为一个合理的猜测，他们可能会，平均也有100光年。

SEE> rea·son·a·bly 相当地, ac·cept·a·ble 接受, ap·pro·pri·ate 适当

ODE> Having sound judgement; fair and sensible. – sensible, rational, open to reason, full of common sense, logical, fair, fair-minded, just, equitable, decent.

1478. rea·son·a·bly 相当地 ## 2

[’riːznəbli]adv.适度地；相当地；合理地；有理性地

  • The episode could reasonably serve as a unique epic of royal espionage! 这一幕历史可以说是王室谍报活动中最精彩的篇章！
  • Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society, one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying sufficient details to enable the thing to be constructed. 想象一下，在一个相当先进的技术社会，人们仍然不具备弹，使其认识的可能性，提供足够的细节，以使事情要构造的效果。

SEE> fair·ly 相当地, sufficiently 充分地, quite 相当

ODE> In a sensible way. – justifiably, justly, legitimately, rightly, properly, reasonably.

1479. re·ceive 收到 ## 24

[rɪ’siːv]v.接到；收到；接待

  • I have just received a letter from my brother, Tim. 我刚刚收到一封来自我的兄弟，蒂姆。
  • Then he smiled and told me I would receive an extra thousand pounds a year! 然后，他笑着告诉我一个我每年将得到1,000英镑的额外！
  • If you receive a request like this, you cannot fail to obey it! 如果你收到这样的恳求，你是不会不遵照执行的！

SEE> give 给, pay 支付, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> Be given, presented with, or paid (something) – be given, be presented with, be awarded, collect, accept, have conferred on one.

1480. re·cent 最近 ## 11

[’riːsnt]adj.近来的；新近的

  • The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago, but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation. 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，但它只是在最近几年才得到了一个坏名声。
  • The former Prime Minister, Mr. Wentworth Lane, was defeated in the recent elections. 前总理，莱恩先生在最近的大选中被击败。
  • A recent case concerns Jane Butlin whose fiancé, John, runs a successful furniture business. 最近的一个案例是关于简Butlin的未婚夫约翰，运行一个成功的家具企业。

SEE> lat·est 最新, re·cent·ly 最近, last 最后的

ODE> Having happened, begun, or been done not long ago; belonging to a past period comparatively close to the present. – new, the latest, late, current, fresh, modern, contemporary, present-day, up to date, up to the minute, latter-day, latter.

1481. re·cent·ly 最近 ## 17

[’riːsntli]adv.最近

  • Recently it was damaged by a visitor. 它最近被一个客人弄坏了。
  • A detective recently watched a well-dressed woman who always went into a large store on Monday mornings. 一名侦探最近看了一个衣冠楚楚的女人谁总是进入一家大商店在星期一上午。
  • When he was driving along Catford Street recently, he saw two thieves rush out of a shop and run towards a waiting car. 当他凯特福德街上行驶最近，他看到有两个小偷急于一家商店出来，向一辆等候着的小汽车跑去。

SEE> a·go 前, al·read·y 已经, al·so 也

ODE> At a recent time; not long ago. – not long ago, a short time ago, in the last few days, in the last few months, in the last few weeks, in the past few days, in the past few months, in the past few weeks, a little while back.

1482. re·cep·tion 招待会 ## 2

[rɪ’sepʃn]n.接待；反应；接待处；欢迎；接收；招待会

  • Why did Jenny want to leave the wedding reception? 没珍妮为什么想离开婚宴？
  • Recently, one of Jeremy’s closest friends asked him to make a speech at a wedding reception. 最近，杰里米的最亲密的朋友请他在一个婚礼的招待会上发表讲话。

SEE> wel·come 欢迎, oc·ca·sion 场合, sim·i·lar·ly 同样

ODE> The action or process of receiving something sent, given, or inflicted. – receipt, receiving, getting, acceptance.

1483. rec·og·nize 认出 ## 15

[’rekəɡnaɪz]vt.承认；认出；意识到；表示感激；识别

  • Why didn’t Caroline recognize the customer straight away? 为什么卡罗琳没有认识到客户马上？
  • I recognize him now. 我现在认出他来。
  • Can you recognize that woman, Liz? 你能认出那个女人，利兹？

SEE> ac·knowl·edge 确认, un·der·stand 懂, ac·cept 接受

ODE> Identify (someone or something) from having encountered them before; know again. – identify, place, know, know again, pick out, put a name to.

1484. re·cord 记录 ## 21

[’rekərd]n.唱片；纪录；记载；经历；前科v.记录；显示；(将声音等)录下

  • Debbie is only eleven years old and she hopes to set up a new world record. 黛比只有11岁，她希望能建立一个新的世界纪录。
  • Of course, we should arrest him, but as he has a good record, we shall let him off this time.’ 当然，我们应该逮捕他，但因为他有一个良好的记录，我们就放这个时候。”
  • He set up a new world record in September 1935 at Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah. 他在邦纳维尔盐滩，犹他州建立一个新的世界纪录，在1935年9月。

SEE> pre·vi·ous 以前的, re·cord·ing 记录, last 最后的

ODE> A thing constituting a piece of evidence about the past, especially an account kept in writing or some other permanent form. – account, accounts, document, documents, documentation, data, file, files, dossier, dossiers, information, evidence, report, reports.

1485. re·cov·er 恢复 ## 5

[rɪ’kʌvər]v.恢复；复原；重获

  • But the claim made by a local authority to recover the cost of salvaging a sunken pie dish must surely be unique. 但是，地方当局作出打捞沉没的馅饼盘成本的要求肯定是独一无二的。
  • You will not have to spend the next few days recovering from a long and arduous journey. 您将不必花费几天时间了漫长而艰苦的旅程恢复。
  • When my mother had died after a tragic accident, he did not quickly recover from the shock and loneliness. 当我的母亲在一次事故中惨死，他并没有很快从悲痛与孤独中恢复过来。

SEE> a·ble 能够, re·gain , re·cov·er·y

ODE> Return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength. – recuperate, get better, get well, convalesce, regain one’s strength, regain one’s health, get stronger, get back on one’s feet, feel oneself again, get back to normal, return to health.

1486. red 红色 ## 9

[red]adj.红色的n.红色

  • The red one. 红色之一。
  • In the play, she must appear in a bright red dress and long black stockings. 在剧中，她必须出现在鲜红色的裙子和黑色的长筒袜。
  • The bull was busy with the matador at the time, but it suddenly caught sight of the drunk who was shouting rude remarks and waving a red cap. 公牛正忙着与当时的斗牛士，但突然它看见谁喊着粗鲁的话，挥舞顶红帽子的。

SEE> yel·low 黄色, blue 蓝色, pink 粉

ODE> Of a colour at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet, as of blood, fire, or rubies. – scarlet, vermilion, ruby, ruby red, ruby-coloured, cherry, cherry red, cerise, cardinal, carmine, wine, wine red, wine-coloured, claret, claret red, claret-coloured, blood red.

1487. re·duce 降低 ## 8

[rɪ’duːs]v.减少；缩小；使落魄；简化；还原

  • This increases their air-resistance and reduces the shock of impact when they hit the ground. 这样就加大了空气阻力，并减少冲击的冲击，当他们击中了地面。
  • This greatly reduced the speed of the ship, for there was a danger that if she travelled too quickly, this rudder would be torn away as well. 这大大降低了船的速度，因为有一种危险是，如果它走得太快，这个舵也会被刮走为好。
  • Gesticulating wildly, the man acted as if he found my offer outrageous, but he eventually reduced the price to ￡10. 激动地打着手势，该男子的举动就好像他发现我的报价离谱，但他终于把价钱降低到£10英镑。

SEE> e·lim·i·nate , in·crease 增加, re·duc·tion 减少

ODE> Make smaller or less in amount, degree, or size. – lessen, make less, make smaller, lower, bring down, decrease, turn down, diminish, take the edge off, minimize.

1488. re·fer 提到 ## 4

[rɪ’fɜːr]vt.把 … 提交；把 … 归因；归类vi.参考；谈及；咨询

  • What does ‘a cold welcome’ refer to? 什么是“冷欢迎”指什么？
  • People who work in offices are frequently referred to as ‘white-collar workers’ for the simple reason that they usually wear a collar and tie to go to work. 人谁在办公室工作，常常被称作“白领”，原因很简单，他们通常是穿着硬领和领带去上班。
  • She always referred to them as ‘the shifting population’, for they came and went with such frequency that I never even got a chance to learn their names. 她称他们为“流动人口”，因为他们来匆匆，去的频率，我从来没有有机会知道他们的姓名。

SEE> de·scribe 描述, in·stance 例子, like·wise

ODE> Mention or allude to. – mention, make mention of, make reference to, allude to, touch on, speak about, speak of, talk about, talk of, write about, cite, name, comment on, deal with, go into, treat, treat of, note, point out, call attention to, bring up, raise, broach, introduce.

1489. ref·er·ence 参考 ## 2

[’refrəns]n.参考；参照；出处；推荐人；推荐函v.注明出处；附参考资料

  • Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books, china, glass, antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals, there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books. 无论它的组成邮票，唱片，书籍，瓷器，玻璃，古董家具，绘画，模型汽车，鸟类标本，玩具动物初版，总有一些东西与它连接的事，找到可以在正确的地方最新加入，以核对参考书中的事实。
  • Even in his philosophical probings he cannot go behind these stereotypes; his very concepts of the true and the false will still have reference to his particular traditional customs. 甚至在哲学领域的探索中，人们也无法超越这些定型的框框。他的真与伪的概念依然参照特定的传统风俗。

SEE> in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子, con·text 上下文

ODE> The action of mentioning or alluding to something. – mention of, allusion to, comment on, remark about.

1490. re·flect 反映 ## 3

[rɪ’flekt]v.反映；反射；反省；归咎；显示

  • I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service. 我反映，必须有自己之外了许多人谁希望借此优良的服务优势。
  • A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom, and by measuring the time interval between the taps and the receipt of the echoes, the depth of the sea at that point can be calculated. 通过敲击一个船体发出的声音将被反射从海底，并通过测量抽头和接收回波之间的时间间隔，海的在该点的深度可以计算出来。
  • Every solid object will reflect a sound, varying according to the size and nature of the object. 每个固态物体将反射声音，改变根据对象的大小和性质。

SEE> sug·gest 建议, more·o·ver 此外, in·deed 确实

ODE> (of a surface or body) throw back (heat, light, or sound) without absorbing it. – send back, throw back, cast back, give back, bounce back, shine back, return, mirror.

1491. re·frig·er·a·tor 冰箱 ## 4

[rɪ’frɪdʒəreɪtər]n.冰箱

  • There is a refrigerator in the kitchen. 有一个在厨房的冰箱。
  • The refrigerator is white. 冰箱是白色的。
  • I counted seven old cars and three old refrigerators. 我数了7辆旧汽车和3台上旧冰箱。

SEE> fridge 冰箱, freez·er , stove 火炉

ODE> An appliance or compartment which is artificially kept cool and used to store food and drink. Modern refrigerators generally make use of the cooling effect produced when a volatile liquid is forced to evaporate in a sealed system in which it can be condensed back to liquid outside the refrigerator. –

1492. re·fuse 拒绝 ## 17

[rɪ’fjuːz]v.拒绝n.垃圾；废物

  • The big clock refused to welcome the New Year. 大钟不愿意迎接新年。
  • Captain Fawcett has just refused a strange request from a businessman. 弗西特机长刚刚拒绝了一位商人的奇怪要求。
  • While John Gilbert was in hospital, he asked his doctor to tell him whether his operation had been successful, but the doctor refused to do so. 当约翰吉尔伯特住院的时候，他问医生告诉他，他的手术是否成功，但医生拒绝这样做。

SEE> ac·cept 接受, in·sist 坚持, ask 问

ODE> Indicate or show that one is not willing to do something. – decline, turn down, say no to.

1493. re·gard 看待 ## 16

[rɪ’ɡɑːrd]v.尊敬；视为；注视；留意；和 … 有关n.关心；尊敬；注意；致意；考虑

  • Please give him my regards. 请代我问候他。
  • At that time, however, she was not only the largest ship that had ever been built, but was regarded as unsinkable, for she had sixteen watertight compartments. 当时，然而，她不仅是有史以来建造的最大的船，但被认为是不会沉没的，因为她有16个密封舱。
  • When I returned from abroad recently, a particularly officious young Customs Officer clearly regarded me as a smuggler. 当我从最近国外回来，一个特别好管闲事的年轻海关官员，他显然把我当成走私犯。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, in·deed 确实, nev·er·the·less 然而

ODE> Consider or think of in a specified way. – consider, look on, view, see, hold, think, think of, contemplate, count, judge, deem, estimate, evaluate, interpret, appraise, assess, make of, find, put down as, take for, account, reckon, treat, adjudge, size up, value, rate, gauge, sum up, weigh up.

1494. re·gret 后悔 ## 4

[rɪ’ɡret]v.后悔；惋惜；为 … 感到遗憾n.遗憾；抱歉；后悔

  • A short while ago, however, he became a bus driver and he has not regretted it. 前一阵子，但是，他成为一名公交车司机，他不后悔。
  • I regretted saying it almost at once. 我后悔几乎立刻说了。
  • I immediately regretted answering in the way I did, but I said, ‘I enjoy cleaning windows at night.’ 我马上又后悔不该我做的方式回答，但我说，“我喜欢在夜里擦窗子。”

SEE> sor·row , dis·ap·point·ment 失望, dis·may

ODE> Feel sad, repentant, or disappointed over (something that one has done or failed to do) – be sorry about, feel contrite about, feel apologetic about, feel remorse about, feel remorse for, be remorseful about, rue, repent, repent of, feel repentant about, be regretful about, be regretful at, have a conscience about, blame oneself for.

1495. reg·u·lar 定期 ## 4

[’reɡjələr]adj.有规律的；定期的；经常的；正规的；整齐的；规则的

  • The only regular visitors to the monastery in winter are parties of skiers who go there at Christmas and Easter. 唯一的常客修道院冬天是谁在圣诞节和复活节去那里滑雪爱好者的聚会。
  • Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income. 爸爸妈妈，当然，提供的零花钱正常供应，但叔叔和婶婶总是额外收入来源。
  • She walked slowly into the hall and at once noticed that all the room doors were open, yet following her regular practice she had shut them before going out. 她慢慢地走进前厅，立即发现所有的房门都敞开着，跟着她经常练习，她才出门就关他们没有。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, u·su·al 通常, on·ly 只有

ODE> Arranged in or constituting a constant or definite pattern, especially with the same space between individual instances. – methodical, systematic, structured, well ordered, well organized, orderly, efficient, smooth-running, streamlined, well regulated, disciplined, planned, well planned, businesslike, meticulous, punctilious.

1496. reg·u·lar·ly 经常 ## 2

[’reɡjələrli]adv.有规律地；定期地

  • Both girls write to each other regularly now. 这两位姑娘定期通信了。
  • Against these figures, it was found that only 5% of women snore regularly, while the rest are constantly woken or kept awake by their trumpeting partners. 与这些数字相比，人们发现，只有5％的女性经常打鼾，而其余则经常被唤醒或他们像吹号清醒保持。

SEE> fre·quent·ly 经常, oc·ca·sion·al·ly 偶尔, rare·ly 很少地

ODE> With a constant or definite pattern, especially with the same space between individual items. –

1497. re·late 使联系 ## 3

[rɪ’leɪt]v.叙述；使有联系；有关联；涉及；符合；发生共鸣

  • How Harry came into the possession of this outlandish stuff makes an interesting story which he is fond of relating. 哈里如何走进拥有这种稀奇古怪的东西做了一个有趣的故事，而且他挺爱。
  • We know instinctively, just as beekeepers with their bees, that misfortune might overtake us if the important events of our lives were not related to it. 我们本能地懂得，就像他们的蜜蜂养蜂人，这可能大祸临头我们，如果我们生活中的重要事件，并没有涉及到它。
  • History does not relate whether his friend accepted his medical help, but in all probability he did. 历史没有记载他的朋友是否接受了他的医疗帮助，但很可能接受了。

SEE> de·scribe 描述, un·der·stand 懂, ex·plain 解释

ODE> Make or show a connection between. – connect, connect with, associate, associate with, link, link with, correlate, correlate with, ally, ally with, couple, couple with, bracket, bracket with.

1498. re·la·tion 关系 ## 2

[rɪ’leɪʃn]n.关系；联系；亲戚；陈述；参考

  • After I had given her some money, she looked into a crystal ball and said: ’A relation of yours is coming to see you. 我给了她一些钱后，她看着一个水晶球说道：“您的一个亲戚就要看你。
  • It is possible that there is a definite relation between these paintings and the markings that sometimes accompany them. 这可能是有这些画作和有时陪他们的标记之间的一定的联系。

SEE> fur·ther·more , hence 因此, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The way in which two or more people or things are connected; a thing’s effect on or relevance to another. – connection, relationship, association, link, correlation, correspondence, parallel, tie-in, tie-up, alliance, bond, interrelation, interconnection.

1499. re·la·tion·ship 关系 ## 2

[rɪ’leɪʃnʃɪp]n.关系；联系；亲属关系

  • Primarily, the banker-customer relationship is that of debtor and creditor – who is which depending on whether the customer’s account is in credit or is overdrawn. 首先，银行家与客户的关系是债务人和债权人的 - 谁是取决于客户的帐户是否在信用卡或透支。
  • Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt, but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training. 这种极端的事例虽不可用一粒盐，但他们强调了一项基本原则，象和象夫之间的关系是成功的关键培训。

SEE> friend·ship 友谊, re·la·tion 关系, af·fair 事务

ODE> The way in which two or more people or things are connected, or the state of being connected. – connection, relation, association, link, correlation, correspondence, parallel, tie-in, tie-up, alliance, bond, interrelation, interconnection.

1500. rel·a·tive 亲戚 ## 4

[’relətɪv]adj.相对的；比较的；相关的n.亲戚；[语]关系词

  • Then Dr. Millington asked the caller if he was a relative of the patient. 之后，米灵顿医生问打电话的人是否是一个相对病人的。
  • Meanwhile, a microphone, which was lowered into the mine two hours ago, has enabled the men to keep in touch with their closest relatives. 同时，麦克风，这是两小时前放进去了，使井下的人保持联系与他们的近亲。
  • This is a major achievement because, in relative terms, planets are very small and do not emit light. 这是一个重大的成就，因为相对来说，行星很小，而且也不发光。

SEE> hence 因此, more·o·ver 此外, like·wise

ODE> Considered in relation or in proportion to something else. – comparative, respective, comparable, correlative, parallel, corresponding, reciprocal.

1501. relatively 相对地 ## 3

[’relətɪvli]adv.相对地；比较地

  • Cave exploration, or pot-holing, as it has come to be known, is a relatively new sport. 洞穴探险，或锅入座，因为它已经到了被称为是一个比较新的体育活动。
  • Relatively few people are prepared to sacrifice holiday time for the pleasure of travelling by sea. 没有多少人愿意以牺牲假期的时间坐船旅行的乐趣。
  • Audiences in the second decade of the twentieth century found it pleasant to escape to a time when life, though hard, was relatively simple. 在二十世纪的第二个十年的观众发现它令人愉快逃脱的时候，生活，虽然辛苦，相对简单。

SEE> com·par·a·tive·ly , fair·ly 相当地, gen·er·al·ly 通常

ODE> In relation, comparison, or proportion to something else. – to a certain degree, to a certain extent, to a limited degree, to a limited extent, to some degree, to some extent, partly, partially, half, in some measure, relatively, comparatively, moderately, to a point, up to a point, a little, somewhat.

1502. re·lax 放松 ## 2

[rɪ’læks]v.休息；放松；使 … 放松；放宽

  • At high speeds, falling cats have time to relax. 在高速下落中，猫有时间放松自己。
  • And if this something else is rightly chosen, if it is really attended by the illumination of another field of interest, gradually, and often quite swiftly, the old undue grip relaxes and the process of recuperation and repair begins. 如果这别的东西是正确选择，如果是真的的兴趣，渐渐地，往往也是很顺利地，原先不适当的紧张得以放松，另一场的照明和恢复的过程和修复出席开始。

SEE> relaxing 放松, relaxed 轻松, re·lax·a·tion

ODE> Make or become less tense or anxious. – unwind, loosen up, ease off, ease up, let up, slow down, de-stress, unbend, rest, repose, put one’s feet up, take it easy, take time off, take time out, slack off, be at leisure, take one’s leisure, take one’s ease, laze, luxuriate, do nothing, sit back, lounge, loll, slump, flop, idle, loaf, enjoy oneself, amuse oneself, play, entertain oneself.

1503. rel·e·vant 相关的 ## 2

[’reləvənt]adj.相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

  • In all the less controversial fields, like the study of cacti or termites or the nature of nebulae, the necessary method of study is to group the relevant material and to take note of all possible variant forms and conditions. 在一切争议较小的领域里，如仙人掌，白蚁或星云性质的研究，研究的必要方法是，把相关的材料，并采取一切可能的变体形式和条件的注释。
  • Well, if you go to five reputable stock brokers and ask them what you should do with your money, you’re likely to get five different answers, – even if you give all the relevant information about your age, family, finances and what you want from your investments. 好吧，如果你去到五个信誉的股票经纪人咨询，询问你应该如何使用你的资金，你可能得到5个不同的答案， - 即使你提供了有关于你的年龄，家庭，财源和什么相关信息你想从投资。

SEE> ap·pro·pri·ate 适当, con·cern·ing 关于, re·gard 看待

ODE> Closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered. – pertinent, applicable, apposite, material, apropos, to the point, to the purpose, germane, admissible.

1504. re·lief 缓解 ## 3

[rɪ’liːf]n.减轻；解除；轻松；浮雕；救济(品)；安慰；替代adj.提供救济的；文本的

  • What a relief it was when the boulders suddenly disappeared, giving way to a stretch of plain where the only obstacles were clumps of bushes. 什么救济是突然大石块不见了，让位给平淡的舒展，唯一的障碍是灌木丛的团块。
  • Today, enough soundings are available to enable a relief map of the Atlantic to be drawn and we know something of the great variety of the sea bed’s topography. 现在已有足够的水深测量数据，使大西洋的地形图，可以得出，我们知道的种类繁多的海床地形的东西。
  • A man may acquire great knowledge of topics unconnected with his daily work, and yet get hardly any benefit or relief. 一个人可能获得渊博与自己日常工作的渊博知识，而没有从中得到任何好处或救济。

SEE> aid 援助, as·sis·tance 帮助, dis·as·ter 灾难

ODE> A feeling of reassurance and relaxation following release from anxiety or distress. – reassurance, consolation, comfort, solace, calmness, relaxation, repose, ease.

1505. re·ly 依赖 ## 3

[rɪ’laɪ]vi.依靠；信任

  • What is more, they will not have to rely solely on the written word. 更重要的是，他们将不必完全依赖文字材料。
  • To the extent that the people can be relied upon to behave in a loyal and responsible manner, the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order. 为了我们的人民能够在以忠诚和负责任的方式行事的依据的范围内，政府就不需要警察和公务员的军队，让他们为了。
  • Alcohol may be a medical disinfectant, but should not be relied upon to sterilize water. 酒精可能是医学上的消毒剂，但决不可用来消毒饮用水。

SEE> de·pend 依靠, more·o·ver 此外, un·like 不像

ODE> Depend on with full trust or confidence. – depend, count, bank, place reliance, bargain, plan, reckon.

1506. re·main 保持 ## 17

[rɪ’meɪn]v.剩余；逗留；留下；依然；保持n.剩余物；遗迹；残骸

  • He must remain in bed for another two days. 他必须留在床上躺了两天。
  • The plane wasn’t too badly damaged, but over the years, the crash was forgotten and the wreck remained undisturbed. 这架飞机是不是太严重损坏，但是，多年来，飞机失事已被遗忘，飞机残骸也不受干扰。
  • It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936. 它仍然是最有名的建筑之一，在世界上，直到它在1936年被焚毁。

SEE> re·mains 残余, still 仍然, stay 停留

ODE> Continue to exist, especially after other similar people or things have ceased to do so. – continue to exist, endure, last, abide, go on, carry on, persist, hang in the air, stay around, stay round, stand, be extant, hold out, prevail, survive, live on.

1507. re·mains 残余 ## 10

[rɪ’meɪnz]n.剩余物；遗迹；遗体

  • He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line. 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏的电源线的电线蛇的遗骸。
  • The body of one statue was found among remains dating from the fifteenth century B.C. 一尊雕像，她的躯体是在公元前15世纪的历史文物中发现公元前
  • Its missing head happened to be among remains of the fifth century B.C. 它缺少的脑袋却碰巧是在公元前5世纪的文物中找到公元前

SEE> re·main 保持, still 仍然, al·though 虽然

ODE> The parts left over after other parts have been removed, used, or destroyed. – remainder, residue, remaining number, remaining part, remaining quantity, number left over, part left over, quantity left over, number that is left over, part that is left over, quantity that is left over, rest, remnant, remnants.

1508. re·mark 评论 ## 4

[rɪ’mɑːrk]n.评论；备注；注意v.评论；注意到

  • ‘We mustn’t buy things we don’t need,’ I remarked suddenly. “我们不应该买我们不需要的东西，”我突然说道。
  • The bull was busy with the matador at the time, but it suddenly caught sight of the drunk who was shouting rude remarks and waving a red cap. 公牛正忙着与当时的斗牛士，但突然它看见谁喊着粗鲁的话，挥舞顶红帽子的。
  • But this does not matter, for, as he has often remarked, one is never too old to learn. 但是，这并不重要，因为正如他常说的，一个是从来没有到老学到老。

SEE> sug·ges·tion 建议, i·ron·i·cal·ly , joke 玩笑

ODE> Say something as a comment; mention. – comment, say, observe, mention, reflect, state, declare, announce, pronounce, assert.

1509. re·mark·a·ble 显著的 ## 5

[rɪ’mɑːrkəbl]adj.非凡的；值得注意的；显著的；异常的；卓越的

  • As long ago as the fourteenth century, an Englishman, Sir John Hawkwood, made the remarkable discovery that people would rather pay large sums of money than have their life work destroyed by gangsters. 早在14世纪，英国人约翰。霍克伍德就有过非凡的发现：人们情愿付出的钱，也不愿毕生的心血毁于歹徒大笔。
  • Even this was remarkable, considering that she had had so many delays. 即使这是显着的，考虑到她有这么多的延误。
  • Considering how recent these developments are, it is even more remarkable that as long ago as the 1960s, an Englishman, Leon Bagrit, was able to predict some of the uses of computers which we know today. 考虑到这些发展是如何最近是，它更是了不起，早在20世纪60年代，一个英国人，他在60年代能够预测一些电脑今天我们所知道的用途。

SEE> as·ton·ish·ing , a·maz·ing 惊人, im·pres·sive 令人印象深刻的

ODE> Worthy of attention; striking. – extraordinary, exceptional, amazing, astonishing, astounding, marvellous, wonderful, sensational, stunning, incredible, unbelievable, miraculous, phenomenal, prodigious.

1510. re·mem·ber 记得 ## 15

[rɪ’membər]v.记得；想起；记住，铭记；回忆；提及

  • Can you remember the doctor’s telephone number? 你还记得医生的电话号码吗？
  • Ah yes, I remember now. 是啊，我现在还记得。
  • I can’t remember. 我不记得了。

SEE> for·get 忘记, know 知道, tell 告诉

ODE> Have in or be able to bring to one’s mind an awareness of (someone or something from the past) – recall, call to mind, recollect, think of.

1511. re·mind 提醒 ## 3

[rɪ’maɪnd]vt.使想起；提醒

  • ‘I needn’t remind you of that terrible tie you bought yesterday.’ “我也不必提醒你昨天买的那条糟糕透了的领带。”
  • As its composition and line reminded him of an Italian painting he knew well, he decided to buy it. 构图与线条提醒他所熟悉的意大利绘画的他，他决定买下来。
  • Normal people tend to forget this process unless and until they are reminded of it. 正常的人倾向于除非和直到他们被提醒的是忘记了这个过程。

SEE> for·get 忘记, re·mem·ber 记得, sure·ly 一定

ODE> Cause (someone) to remember someone or something. – jog someone’s memory, refresh someone’s memory, help someone remember, cause someone to remember.

1512. re·mote 遥远的 ## 6

[rɪ’moʊt]adj.遥远的；偏僻的；远程的；(感情等)距离很大n.远程操作

  • In 1963 a Lancaster bomber crashed on Wallis Island, a remote place in the South Pacific, a long way west of Samoa. 1963年兰开斯特轰炸机坠毁在委内瑞拉岛，在南太平洋一个偏远的地方，萨摩亚的一个很长的路以西。
  • We always assume that villagers in remote places are friendly and hospitable. 我们总是以为偏僻的地方的村民们热情好客。
  • Visits to really remote villages are seldom enjoyable – as my wife and I discovered during a tour through the Balkans. 到真正偏僻的村庄一件愉快的事情 - 做我的妻子和我在一次周游巴尔干半岛时对此深有体会。

SEE> i·so·lat·ed , near·by 附近, where 哪里

ODE> (of a place) situated far from the main centres of population; distant. – faraway, distant, far, far off, far removed.

1513. re·move 去掉 ## 7

[rɪ’muːv]v.消除；脱掉；免除；搬迁

  • When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth, I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth. 最后，当牙医移除从我嘴中药棉，我可以告诉他，他拔错了牙。
  • Yesterday my husband removed the gate and Rex got so annoyed we have not seen him since. 昨天，我丈夫把门卸和Rex有这么生气，此后我们再也没有见过他。
  • How was the drunk removed from the ring? 如何在醉酒从环去掉？

SEE> a·side 在旁边, al·low 允许, e·lim·i·nate

ODE> Take (something) away or off from the position occupied. – detach, unfasten, separate.

1514. re·pair 修理 ## 20

[rɪ’per]v.修理；修补；补救；赴；去n.修理；修补；补救；维修工作；维修状态

  • Can the mechanics repair Mr. Wood’s car? 修理工能否修复伍德先生的汽车？
  • Can your mechanics repair it? 你的机械师能修好吗？
  • Well, they’re trying to repair it, sir. 嗯，他们正设法修呢，先生。

SEE> dam·aged , main·te·nance , dam·age 损坏

ODE> Restore (something damaged, faulty, or worn) to a good condition. – mend, fix, fix up, put right, set right, restore, restore to working order, make as good as new, patch up, put back together, overhaul, service, renovate, recondition, rehabilitate, rebuild, reconstruct, refit, adjust, regulate.

1515. re·peat 重复 ## 6

[rɪ’piːt]n.重复；反复v.重复；复述adj.重复的；反复的

  • ‘I’m having breakfast,’ I repeated. “我正在吃早饭，”我又说了一遍。
  • I repeated my question several times and at last he understood. 我重复我的问题了几次，最后他明白了。
  • In many ways, this is unfortunate for the poor actors who are required to go on repeating the same lines night after night. 在许多方面，这是不幸的，需要去夜后，重复同样的台词晚上谁可怜的演员。

SEE> re·peat·ed 重复, in·stance 例子, in·deed 确实

ODE> Say again something one has already said. – say again, restate, reiterate, go through again, go over again, run through again, iterate, rehearse, recapitulate.

1516. re·peat·ed·ly 重复地 ## 2

[rɪ’piːtɪdli]adv.重复地；再三地

  • Shivering in their wet clothes, the teenagers looked on while three men dived repeatedly into the water to locate the dish. 在他们的湿衣服哆嗦，看着3名工人轮番潜入水中以确定盘子的位置。
  • The worst thing about the do-it-yourself game is that sometimes even men live under the delusion that they can do anything, even when they have repeatedly been proved wrong. 关于做它自己的游戏最糟糕的是，有时甚至是男士生活的幻想，他们可以做任何事情，即使他们曾多次被证明是错误的下面。

SEE> fre·quent·ly 经常, re·peat·ed 重复, once 一次

ODE> Over and over again; constantly. – frequently, often, again and again, over and over, over and over again, time and again, time and time again, time after time, many times, on many occasions, many a time, many times over.

1517. re·place 代替 ## 3

[rɪ’pleɪs]vt.取代；替换；放回原处；偿还

  • Before they were replaced by steamships, sailing vessels like the Cutty Sark were used to carry tea from China and wool from Australia. 之前，他们是由轮船取代帆船像卡蒂萨克被用来携带来自中国的茶叶和羊毛来自澳大利亚。
  • The old farmhouse the family lived in was to be replaced by a new $500,000 home. 旧农舍的家人住到一个新的$ 500,000个住宅所取代。
  • For this reason also the writer, like any other artist, has no resting place, no crowd or movement in which he may take comfort, no judgment from outside which can replace the judgment from within. 也是由于这个原因，作家同任何艺术家一样，一直没有休息的地方，没有人群或运动中，他可能需要的舒适性，无论从局外人的判断也从内心的正确判断。

SEE> re·place·ment , suc·ceed 成功, in·stead 代替

ODE> Take the place of. – substitute, exchange, change.

1518. re·ply 回复 ## 7

[rɪ’plaɪ]v.回答；答复；回应n.回答；答复

  • As soon as he had got into the car, I said good morning to him in French and he replied in the same language. 当他刚钻进车里，我好早上他用法语说，他在同一种语言回答。
  • He sent the journalist two more faxes, but received no reply. 他给记者两份传真，但没有收到任何答复。
  • He sent yet another fax informing the journalist that if he did not reply soon he would be fired. 他又发了一份传真，通知那位记者说，若再不迅速答复，将被解雇。

SEE> an·swer 回答, sug·ges·tion 建议, re·quest 请求

ODE> Say something in response to something someone has said. – respond, answer, say in response, rejoin, return.

1519. re·port 报告 ## 9

[rɪ’pɔːrt]n.报告；传闻；成绩单；爆炸声v.报告；报导；叙述；举报；报到；对…负责

  • Here’s another report about Karen Marsh. 下面是关于卡伦马什另一份报告。
  • When reports came into London Zoo that a wild puma had been spotted forty-five miles south of London, they were not taken seriously. 当报告来到伦敦动物园，一只野生的美洲狮已经发现伦敦的45英里南部，他们并没有受到重视。
  • As no pumas had been reported missing from any zoo in the country, this one must have been in the possession of a private collector and somehow managed to escape. 由于没有美洲狮被报道曾从全国动物园失踪，这一次一定是属于一位私人收藏家的，不知怎么设法逃出来了。

SEE> say·ing , that 那, state·ment 声明

ODE> Give a spoken or written account of something that one has observed, heard, done, or investigated. – announce, describe, give an account of, tell of, detail, delineate, outline.

1520. rep·re·sent 代表 ## 2

[ˌreprɪ’zent]vt.表现；表示；描绘；代表；象征；说明；阐明vi.提出异议

  • Each of these represented a goddess and had, at one time, been painted. 每个代表一位女神，并在同一时间，被画。
  • A parliamentary committee representing all political parties appoints a person who is suitably qualified to investigate private grievances against the State. 代表各政党利益的议会委员会任命谁称职的人选来调查个人对国家的不满的人。

SEE> in·stance 例子, in·deed 确实, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Be entitled or appointed to act or speak for (someone), especially in an official capacity. – be elected by, be the councillor for, be the MP for, have the vote of.

1521. rep·u·ta·tion 声誉 ## 3

[ˌrepju’teɪʃn]n.好名声；声誉，名声，名气

  • The tree was planted near the church fifty years ago, but it is only in recent years that it has gained an evil reputation. 该树是50年前栽在教堂附近的，但它只是在最近几年才得到了一个坏名声。
  • At some dramatic moment in the story, the terrible secret becomes known and a reputation is ruined. 在小说的某个戏剧性时刻，可怕的秘密变得已知的声誉被破坏。
  • Aeroplanes have the reputation of being dangerous and even hardened travellers are intimidated by them. 飞机以危险而连老资格的旅行者被他们吓倒的声誉。

SEE> cred·i·bil·i·ty , in·deed 确实, i·ron·i·cal·ly

ODE> The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something. – name, good name, character, repute, standing, stature, status, position, rank, station.

1522. re·quest 请求 ## 7

[rɪ’kwest]n.请求；要求vt.请求；要求

  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。
  • What was the polite request? 什么是礼貌的要求吗？
  • If you receive a request like this, you cannot fail to obey it! 如果你收到这样的恳求，你是不会不遵照执行的！

SEE> ask 问, per·mis·sion 允许, sug·ges·tion 建议

ODE> An act of asking politely or formally for something. – appeal, entreaty, plea, petition, solicitation, supplication, prayer, invocation.

1523. re·quire 需要 ## 10

[rɪ’kwaɪər]v.要求；需要；命令；规定

  • In many ways, this is unfortunate for the poor actors who are required to go on repeating the same lines night after night. 在许多方面，这是不幸的，需要去夜后，重复同样的台词晚上谁可怜的演员。
  • They have nothing to sell and require nothing from others. 他们没有什么可卖需要从别人什么。
  • Such undertakings require the precise planning and foresight of military operations. 这种活动需要精确的规划和远见的军事行动。

SEE> need 需要, al·low 允许, must 必须

ODE> Need for a particular purpose. – essential, vital, indispensable, necessary, needed, called for, requisite, prerequisite.

1524. re·quire·ment 需求 ## 3

[rɪ’kwaɪərmənt]n.必要条件；要求

  • She produced all sorts of weird concoctions, but none of them met with Harry’s requirements. 她生产的各种稀奇古怪的化妆品，但没有一样能够符合哈里的要求。
  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。
  • But having satisfied the requirements of practical necessity, most people go no further. 不过话说满足了实际需要后，多数人就不再继续。

SEE> re·quire 需要, min·i·mum 最低限度, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A thing that is needed or wanted. – need, wish, demand, want, necessity, essential, essential item, necessary item.

1525. res·cue 救援 ## 8

[’reskjuː]vt.营救；援救n.营救；救援

  • By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing. 到了这个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。
  • It was not long before a helicopter arrived on the scene to rescue the survivors of the plane crash. 时间不长，一个直升机赶到现场之前营救飞机失事的幸存者。
  • Why is the rescue taking so long? 为什么救援要花这么长时间？

SEE> dis·as·ter 灾难, ef·fort 努力, re·lief 缓解

ODE> Save (someone) from a dangerous or difficult situation. – save, save from danger, save the life of, come to the aid of.

1526. re·search 研究 ## 7

[rɪ’sɜːrtʃ]n.研究；调查v.研究；调查

  • Vera’s curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives, and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic. 维拉的好奇人才被带到一个科研单位在乌里扬诺夫斯克镇的通知，她家附近，并在4月，她被俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对一系列的测试。
  • Two factors weigh heavily against the effectiveness of scientific research in industry. 有两个因素严重地妨碍工业中科学研究的效率。
  • One is the general atmosphere of secrecy in which it is carried out, the other the lack of freedom of the individual research worker. 一个是保密的气氛一般在其所进行的，其他缺乏单独研究工作者的自由。

SEE> stud·y 研究, in·sti·tute 机构, sci·en·tif·ic 科学的

ODE> The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions. – investigation, experimentation, testing, exploration, analysis, fact-finding, examination, scrutiny, scrutinization, probing.

1527. re·sist 抵抗 ## 4

[rɪ’zɪst]v.抵制；抵抗；反抗；忍住n.防蚀涂层

  • When a thief was caught on the premises of a large jewellery store one morning, the shop assistants must have found it impossible to resist the temptation to say ‘it serves him right’. 当一个小偷在一家大型珠宝店里一上午被人抓住时，店员一定会发现无法抗拒的诱惑，说“他罪有应得”。
  • Resisting the hypnotizing effect of television, I sat in my room for a few evenings with my eyes glued to a book. 抗拒电视的催眠效果，我坐在自己的房间里，两眼有几天晚上盯在书上。
  • It is difficult for any of us in moments of intense aesthetic experience to resist the suggestion that we are catching a glimpse of a light that shines down to us from a different realm of existence, different and, because the experience is intensely moving, in some way higher. 这是很难在强烈感受到美的时刻，我们中的任何抵抗，我们正在追赶，从另一个世界，不同的和照耀着我们的光的一瞥的建议，因为具有强烈的感染力，在一些一路走高。

SEE> temp·ta·tion , like·wise , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Withstand the action or effect of. – withstand, be proof against, hold out against, combat, counter.

1528. re·sist·ance 抵抗 ## 3

[rɪ’zɪstəns]n.抵抗；抵触；反对；阻力n.[电]阻抗

  • It later became apparent that rabbits were developing a degree of resistance to this disease, so that the rabbit population was unlikely to be completely exterminated. 后来，明显看出，兔子被开发的程度对本病的阻力，从而使兔子不可能被完全消灭。
  • As a shipbuilder, Cockerell was trying to find a solution to the problem of the wave resistance which wastes a good deal of a surface ship’s power and limits its speed. 作为一个船舶技师，科克雷尔正在试图找到一个解决的浪费水面舰艇的力量的一个很好的协议，并限制其速度的兴波阻力的问题。
  • Earlier, we were infants and young children, and consequently more vulnerable; later, we shall undergo a progressive loss of our vigour and resistance which, though imperceptible at first, will finally become so steep that we can live no longer, however well we look after ourselves, and however well society, and our doctors, look after us. 此前，我们是婴幼儿，因此更加脆弱;后来，我们就要经历生命力和抵抗力其中的逐渐丧失，虽然起初难以觉察，但最终会急转直下，我们也无法再活下去，但是还有我们照顾自己，但是很好的社会，我们的医生，看后我们。

SEE> re·sist 抵抗, strug·gle 斗争, nev·er·the·less 然而

ODE> The refusal to accept or comply with something. – opposition to, hostility to, aversion to, refusal to accept, unwillingness to accept, disinclination to accept, reluctance to accept, lack of enthusiasm for.

1529. re·solve 决心 ## 2

[rɪ’zɑːlv]vt.解决；决定；表决；分解vi.决定；分解n.决心；坚决

  • We resolve to get up earlier each morning, eat less, find more time to play with the children, do a thousand and one jobs about the house, be nice to people we don’t like, drive carefully, and take the dog for a walk every day. 我们决心每天早晨起得早些，少吃，多花点时间与孩子玩，做一千零一的家务，是不错的，我们不喜欢的人，小心驾驶，并带着狗一每天走路。
  • Such a loss of dignity and descent into childish behaviour on the part of the adults deeply shocks the adolescents, and makes them resolve that in future they will not talk to their parents about the places or people they visit. 尊严和下降的这样的损失插入成人的一部分幼稚的行为深感震惊着少年，并让他们的决心，今后他们不会跟父母讲述去过的地方和人。

SEE> solve 解决, dis·pute , de·ter·mi·na·tion 决心

ODE> Settle or find a solution to (a problem or contentious matter) – settle, sort out, solve, find a solution to, find an answer to, fix, work out, straighten out, deal with, put right, set right, put to rights, rectify, iron out, reconcile.

1530. re·source 资源 ## 4

[’riːsɔːrs]n.资源；机敏；才略；寄托；消遣

  • This increases the expense of government, and reduces correspondingly the amount of economic resources that could be used for developing the country. 这增加了政府的开支，从而相应地减少了可以用来发展国家经济的资源量。
  • And it should not be forgotten how small those resources are in a poor and backward country. 它不应忘记这些资源是很有限的一个贫穷落后的国家。
  • Where the cost of government is high, resources for development are correspondingly low. 凡是政府管理费用高，用于发展的资源就会相应地减少。

SEE> fur·ther·more , man·age·ment 管理, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets that can be drawn on by a person or organization in order to function effectively. – assets, funds, wealth, money, riches, capital, deep pockets.

1531. re·spect 尊重 ## 10

[rɪ’spekt]vt.尊敬；尊重；遵守；关于；涉及n.尊敬；敬重；关系；方面n.（复）respects: 敬意；问候

  • As a result, humans have learned to respect feline independence. 其结果是，人们已经学会尊重猫的独立性。
  • This invariably wins them the love and respect of others, for they add colour to the dull routine of everyday life. 这往往使他们赢得了爱和他人的尊重，因为他们增添色彩日常生活的平淡单一。
  • He may be conceited, ill-mannered, presumptuous or fatuous, but I do not turn for protection to dreary cliches about respect for elders – as if mere age were a reason for respect. 他也许骄傲自满，不规矩，自行其是或者昏庸，但我不会用应当尊重转保护枯燥的陈词滥调长辈 - 仿佛只有年龄才是尊敬的理由。

SEE> re·gard 看待, im·por·tant·ly 重要的, par·tic·u·lar 特定的

ODE> A feeling of deep admiration for someone or something elicited by their abilities, qualities, or achievements. – esteem, regard, high regard, high opinion, acclaim, admiration, approbation, approval, appreciation, estimation, favour, popularity, recognition, veneration, awe, reverence, deference, honour, praise, homage.

1532. re·sponse 响应 ## 4

[rɪ’spɑːns]n.反应；回答；响应；答复

  • Oddly shaped forms that are suspended from the ceiling and move in response to a gust of wind are quite familiar to everybody. 被从天花板和移动响应于一阵风悬浮异形形式是大家十分熟悉。
  • The response to this competition was tremendous. 本次比赛的反应是巨大的。
  • In response to renewed pleadings, Bruce stopped. 我们再次央求布鲁斯停止。

SEE> re·spond 响应, re·ac·tion 反应, sim·i·lar 类似

ODE> A verbal or written answer. – answer, reply, acknowledgement, rejoinder, retort, return, riposte, sally, counter.

1533. re·spon·si·ble 负责 ## 4

[rɪ’spɑːnsəbl]adj.有责任的；负责的；责任重大的；可靠的

  • Big Ben takes its name from Sir Benjamin Hall who was responsible for the making of the clock when the new Houses of Parliament were being built. 大本钟得名于本杰明霍尔爵士，谁负责的时钟的制作正在建造议会的新房时，它的名字。
  • But if no one can be trusted to act in a loyal and responsible manner towards his job, then the business will require armies of administrators, checkers, and foremen and administrative overheads will rise correspondingly. 但是，如果没有人能够对他的工作被信任行为的忠诚和负责任的态度，那么企业就需要管理人员，检查，和工头和管理费用的军队就会相应地增加。
  • To the extent that the people can be relied upon to behave in a loyal and responsible manner, the government does not require armies of police and civil servants to keep them in order. 为了我们的人民能够在以忠诚和负责任的方式行事的依据的范围内，政府就不需要警察和公务员的军队，让他们为了。

SEE> in·volved 参与, re·spon·si·bil·i·ty 责任, con·cerned 关心的

ODE> Having an obligation to do something, or having control over or care for someone, as part of one’s job or role. – in charge of, in control of, at the helm of, accountable for, liable for, charged with.

1534. rest 休息 ## 18

[rest]n.剩余的部分；休息；支撑物；休止符v.休息；(使)倚靠；使(视线)停留在；搁在；依赖；基于；搁置；埋葬

  • But I couldn’t answer the rest. 但我不能回答的休息。
  • Debbie intends to take short rests every two hours. 黛比打算采取短暂休息，每两小时。
  • As we had had a long walk through one of the markets of old Delhi, we stopped at a square to have a rest. 正如我们所穿过旧德里的市场之一的长走，我们停在一个广场上休息。

SEE> though 虽然, ex·cept 除了, in·stead 代替

ODE> Cease work or movement in order to relax, sleep, or recover strength. – relax, take a rest, ease off, ease up, let up, slow down, pause, have a break, take a break, unbend, repose, laze, idle, loaf, do nothing, take time off, slack off, unwind, recharge one’s batteries, be at leisure, take it easy, sit back, sit down, stand down, lounge, luxuriate, loll, slump, flop, put one’s feet up, lie down, go to bed, have a nap, take a nap, nap, catnap, doze, have a siesta, take a siesta, drowse, sleep.

1535. res·tau·rant 餐厅 ## 3

[’restrɑːnt]n.餐馆；饭店

  • We went to a restaurant. 我们去了一家餐厅。
  • I was having dinner at a restaurant when Tony Steele came in. 我在一家饭馆吃饭，托尼。斯蒂尔走了进来。
  • A lot of people object to mobile phones, especially when they are used in public places like restaurants or on public transport. 很多人反对手机，尤其是当他们在公共场所如饭店，公共交通使用。

SEE> ho·tel 旅馆, bak·er·y , chef

ODE> A place where people pay to sit and eat meals that are cooked and served on the premises. – eating place, eating house.

1536. re·store 恢复 ## 4

[rɪ’stɔːr]vt.恢复；归还；复原

  • Now a group of enthusiasts are going to have the plane restored. 一群热心人计划修复这架飞机。
  • Could any spectacle, for instance, be more grimly whimsical than that of gunners using science to shatter men’s bodies while, close at hand, surgeons use it to restore them? 可以在任何场面，例如，比用科学的同时，近在咫尺，外科医生用它来恢复他们打破男子的身体枪手更冷酷异想天开？
  • The mammoth has now been restored in the Palaeontological Museum in St. Petersburg. 这只长毛象现在在古生物博物馆在圣彼得堡被恢复。

SEE> re·build , pre·serve 维持, main·tain 维持

ODE> Bring back or re-establish (a previous right, practice, or situation) – reinstate, put back, replace, bring back, reinstitute, reimpose, reinstall, rehabilitate, re-establish, return to a former position, return to a former state.

1537. re·sult 结果 ## 9

[rɪ’zʌlt]n.结果；成果；答案；成绩；(足球比赛)赢v.产生；致使

  • As a result, the fish just eat and eat and grow and grow in the lovely warm water. 因此，鱼只是吃，吃，成长，在可爱的温水中成长。
  • As a result, humans have learned to respect feline independence. 其结果是，人们已经学会尊重猫的独立性。
  • If we remain inveterate smokers, it is only because we have so often experienced the frustration that results from failure. 如果我们仍然烟瘾大的人，那是因为我们经常遇到的挫折，从失败的结果。

SEE> how·ev·er 然而, be·cause 因为, con·se·quence 后果

ODE> A thing that is caused or produced by something else; a consequence or outcome. – consequence, outcome, upshot, out-turn, sequel, effect, reaction, repercussion, reverberation, ramification, end, conclusion, termination, culmination, corollary, concomitant, aftermath, footprint, fruit, fruits, product, produce, by-product, solution.

1538. re·tire 退休 ## 13

[rɪ’taɪər]v.退休；撤退；离去；就寝；主动退出比赛；收回（货币）；赎回（票据）n.退休，退职

  • Because I’ve just retired. 因为我刚退休。
  • What reasons did Karen Marsh give for wanting to retire? 卡伦。马什说想要退休的理由是什么？
  • I’m going to retire. 我要退休了。

SEE> re·tire·ment 退休, re·tired 退休, quit 放弃

ODE> Leave one’s job and cease to work, typically on reaching the normal age for leaving service. – give up work, stop working, stop work.

1539. re·tire·ment 退休 ## 2

[rɪ’taɪərmənt]n.退休；隐匿处

  • It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years. 这是一个奇怪的巧合，他退休的前一天，佩奇将已经教了一满40年。
  • Before it becomes a retirement village, Silicon Valley may prove a classroom for building a global business. 之前，它变成一个退休村，硅谷可能证明一个教室建立全球业务。

SEE> re·tire 退休, pen·sion 养老金, re·tired 退休

ODE> The action or fact of leaving one’s job and ceasing to work. – giving up work, stopping working, stopping work.

1540. re·turn 返回 ## 33

[rɪ’tɜːrn]v.返回；归还；回报；回应；申报n.归还；返回；（收益)回报；申报

  • He’ll return to London the week after next. 他将在下一周后返回伦敦。
  • Two return tickets to London, please. 两个返回到伦敦的票，请。
  • Then we’ll return home and buy a big house in the country. 然后我们返回家园，在乡下买幢大房子。

SEE> leave 离开, back 背部, bring 带来

ODE> Come or go back to a place or person. – go back, come back, get back, arrive back, arrive home, come home, come again.

1541. re·veal 揭示 ## 7

[rɪ’viːl]vt.显示；透露；揭示；展现n.(外墙与门或窗之间的)窗侧；门侧；(汽车的)窗框

  • In spite of this, many people are confident that ‘The Revealer’ may reveal something of value fairly soon. 尽管如此，很多人仍然相信“探宝器”很快就会探出值钱的东西。
  • The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell. 该大幕拉开上的最后一幕戏，并透露了贵族独自坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房。
  • After the funeral, Joe and Bob revealed a secret which they had kept for over fifty years. 葬礼之后，乔和鲍勃透露了他们保守了长达50多年的秘密。

SEE> ex·pose 暴露, ex·plain 解释, dis·close

ODE> Make (previously unknown or secret information) known to others. – divulge, disclose, tell, let out, let slip, let drop, let fall, give away, give the game away, give the show away, blurt, blurt out, babble, give out, release, leak, betray, open up, unveil, bring out into the open.

1542. re·ward 奖励 ## 5

[rɪ’wɔːrd]n.报答；赏金；报酬vt.奖赏；给 … 报酬

  • He explained that his diet was so strict that he had to reward himself occasionally. 他解释说，他的饮食控制得太严格了，以致不得不偶尔奖赏自己。
  • George was not too upset by his experience because the lady who owns the sweet shop heard about his troubles and rewarded him with a large box of chocolates. 乔治是不是太用他的经验伤心，因为谁拥有糖果店老板娘听说了他遇到的麻烦，并与巧克力的一大盒，赏给他。
  • Like a scientist bent on making a discovery, he must cherish the hope that one day he will be amply rewarded. 像科学家一样弯曲进行探索，他必须抱有希望，有一天他会取得丰硕的成果。

SEE> in·cen·tive , im·por·tant·ly 重要的, pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> A thing given in recognition of service, effort, or achievement. – recompense, prize, prize money, winnings, purse, award, honour, decoration, profit, advantage, benefit, bonus, plus, premium.

1543. rhythm 韵律 ## 2

[’rɪðəm]n.节奏；节律；（事件或过程）有规律的反复出现

  • Reading is only a partial solution, for the monotonous rhythm of the wheels clicking on the rails soon lulls you to sleep. 看书只能解决部分问题。车轮点击轨道不久的间歇，你睡觉的单调的节奏。
  • Rays from the sun excite and energize the atmosphere of the earth, awakening it to flow, to movement, to rhythm, to life. 来自太阳的光线激发波长和激励地球的大气层，唤醒它流动，迁徙，产生节奏，获得生命。

SEE> mel·o·dy , tune 曲调, gui·tar

ODE> A strong, regular repeated pattern of movement or sound. – pattern, flow, tempo, regular features, recurrent nature.

1544. rich 富有的 ## 5

[rɪtʃ]adj.富有的；富饶的；丰富的

  • And he mustn’t eat rich food. 而且不能吃油腻的食物。
  • He was adored by rich and poor alike. 他被穷人和富人都崇敬。
  • As she is not rich, the chances that she will ever be able to afford such purchases are remote; but she is never sufficiently strong-minded to be able to stop the practice. 由于她并不富裕，有机会，她将永远能够买得起这些服装遥控;但她又缺乏足够坚强的头脑才能够停止这种做法。

SEE> wealth·y , es·pe·cial·ly 特别, wealth 财富

ODE> Having a great deal of money or assets; wealthy. – wealthy, affluent, moneyed, cash rich, well off, well-to-do, with deep pockets, prosperous, opulent, substantial, propertied.

1545. rid 摆脱 ## 4

[rɪd]vt.摆脱；除去

  • It took me over half an hour to get rid of him. 我花了一个半小时，以除掉他。
  • I immediately embarked on an experiment which, even though it failed to get rid of the ants, kept me fascinated for twenty-four hours. 我当即动手作了一项试验，这项试验尽管没有使我摆脱这些蚂蚁，却使我着迷了24小时。
  • So while the rest of the world was trying to get rid of mosquitoes, Australia was encouraging this one. 因此，尽管世界其他地区正试图驱除蚊虫，澳大利亚却在促使这一个。

ODE> Make someone or something free of (an unwanted person or thing) – clear, free, make free, cleanse, purge, purify, empty, strip, scour, void, relieve, deliver.

1546. ride 骑 ## 10

[raɪd]v.骑；乘n.交通工具；骑；乘车；搭便车

  • Dressed up as Father Christmas and accompanied by a ‘guard of honour’ of six pretty girls, he set off down the main street of the city riding a baby elephant called Jumbo. 他打扮成圣诞老人，在由6个漂亮姑娘组成的“仪仗队”，他掀起，沿着城里骑着名叫Jumbo的小象的主要街道。
  • Many owners of private cars are going to offer ‘free rides’ to people on their way to work. 很多私人汽车的车主正准备提供“免费乘车”的人对他们的工作方式。
  • The latest exhibitions, films, or plays are only a short bus ride away. 最新的展览，电影，戏剧只有很短的车程。

SEE> bike 自行车, thrill , walk 走

ODE> Sit on and control the movement of (an animal, typically a horse) – sit on, mount, be mounted on, bestride.

1547. right 对 ## 42

[raɪt]adj.正确的；对的；右边的；合适的；重要的；完全的adv.正确地；直接地；向右；恰恰，就；立即；完全地n.权利；道理；正确；右边；右派v.扶直；纠正；公正对待；补偿；恢复平衡

  • Are you all right now? 你现在还好吗？
  • Are you all right now? 你现在还好吗？
  • It is on the right. 这是正确的。

SEE> left 左边, just 刚刚, back 背部

ODE> Morally good, justified, or acceptable. – just, fair, equitable, good, upright, righteous, virtuous, proper, moral, morally justified, ethical, honourable, honest, principled.

1548. right·ly 正当地 ## 3

[’raɪtli]adv.正当地；公义地；正确地

  • They could be saved so much misery and expense if they chose to live in the city where they rightly belong. 它们可以保存这么多的痛苦和费用，如果他们愿意住在城市本来属于他们。
  • In democratic countries any efforts to restrict the freedom of the press are rightly condemned. 在民主国家里，任何限制新闻自由的企图都理所当然地受到谴责。
  • And if this something else is rightly chosen, if it is really attended by the illumination of another field of interest, gradually, and often quite swiftly, the old undue grip relaxes and the process of recuperation and repair begins. 如果这别的东西是正确选择，如果是真的的兴趣，渐渐地，往往也是很顺利地，原先不适当的紧张得以放松，另一场的照明和恢复的过程和修复出席开始。

SEE> wrong·ly 错, ev·i·dent·ly , like·wise

ODE> Correctly. – correctly, accurately, properly, exactly, precisely, aright, rightly, perfectly, unerringly, faultlessly, truly.

1549. ring 响铃 ## 15

[rɪŋ]n.戒指；环；圈；拳击场；马戏场；帮派n.铃声；钟声；电话；口气v.包围；环绕；形成圈v.打电话；回响；鸣响；按铃；听上去

  • Just then, the telephone rang. 就在这时，电话铃响了。
  • I rang the bell and was not surprised to see that Hugh was still as fat as ever. 我按响了门铃，并不感到惊讶地看到，休仍象以前一样胖。
  • At exactly that moment, the telephone rang. 恰恰在此时，电话铃响了。

SEE> in·stance 例子, once 一次, same 相同

ODE> A small circular band, typically of precious metal and often set with one or more gemstones, worn on a finger as an ornament or a token of marriage, engagement, or authority. – wedding ring, band of gold, marriage token.

1550. rise 上升 ## 22

[raɪz]vi.上升；升起；增加；起床；反抗；复活n.上升；增加；斜坡；小山

  • The sun rises early and sets late. 太阳升起早，晚集。
  • The sun rises late and sets early. 太阳升得迟，并设置月初。
  • It rose out of the basket and began to follow the movements of the pipe. 它上升筐而出，并开始跟随管的运动。

SEE> de·cline 下降, drop 掉落, surge

ODE> Move from a lower position to a higher one; come or go up. – move up, move upwards, come up, go up, make its way up, make one’s way up, arise, ascend, climb, climb up, mount, soar.

1551. risk 风险 ## 9

[rɪsk]n.危险；风险；投资报酬的风险vt.冒 … 的危险；承受…的风险

  • Mrs. Anne Sterling did not think of the risk she was taking when she ran through a forest after two men. 安妮·斯特林夫人没想到，当她穿过森林追赶两个男人，她承担的风险。
  • Why does Tazieff risk his life like this? 为什么塔捷耶夫冒着生命危险这样吗？
  • Tazieff has often risked his life in this way. 塔捷耶夫经常冒着生命危险，在这种方式。

SEE> dan·ger 危险, like·li·hood , a·void 避免

ODE> A situation involving exposure to danger. – possibility, chance, probability, likelihood, danger, peril, threat, menace, fear, prospect.

1552. ri·val 竞争对手 ## 2

[’raɪvl]n.竞争者；对手；同伴adj.竞争的v.竞争；与 … 相匹敌

  • The winning car reached a speed of forty miles an hour – much faster than any of its rivals. 获胜的那辆车达到了每小时四十英里的速度 - 比任何竞争对手的要快得多。
  • Mead predicts that inventors will be able to perfect powerful customized chips over a weekend at the office – spawning a new generation of garage start-ups and giving the U.S. a jump on its foreign rivals in getting new products to market fast. 米德预言发明者可以在办公室用一个周末的完善强大的定制化芯片 - 造就新一代的车库创业企业，并给予美国把它的外国对手一个跳跃在把产品推向市场的速度快。

SEE> com·pet·i·tor , both 两者, mean·while 与此同时

ODE> A person or thing competing with another for the same objective or for superiority in the same field of activity. – competitor, opponent, contestant, contender, challenger.

1553. riv·er 河 ## 23

  • There are some boats on the river. 有河上的几艘船。
  • The aeroplane is flying over the river. 飞机正从河上飞过。
  • The village is on a river. 村庄坐落在一个山谷。

SEE> val·ley 山谷, a·long 沿着, bridge 桥

ODE> A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river. – watercourse, waterway, stream, tributary, brook, inlet, rivulet, rill, runnel, streamlet, freshet.

1554. road 路 ## 13

[roʊd]n.路；道路；途径；方法

  • Frank smiled when he remembered his hard early years and the long road to success. 弗兰克笑了，当他想起他早年的艰难经历和长期的成功之路。
  • They will also be building new roads and a special railway line. 他们还将兴建新的公路和一条铁路专用线。
  • Workers will have completed the new roads by the end of this year. 工人们将在今年年底前把新的道路。

ODE> A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use. – highway, thoroughfare, roadway.

1555. rock 岩石 ## 11

[rɑːk]n.岩石；摇滚乐；困境vt.使震惊；摇动；使动心vi.来回摇动；跳摇摆舞

  • Towards evening, the boat struck a rock and the girl jumped into the sea. 到了傍晚，船触礁女孩跳入海中。
  • He noticed that a river of liquid rock was coming towards him. 他发现有一股岩浆正向他流过来。
  • If there had not been a hard layer of rock beneath the soil, they would have completed the job in a few hours. 如果不曾有过的土壤下面的岩石的坚硬层，他们已经完成了几个小时的工作。

SEE> band 带子, pop 流行, mu·sic 音乐

ODE> The solid mineral material forming part of the surface of the earth and other similar planets, exposed on the surface or underlying the soil. – crag, cliff, tor, outcrop, outcropping.

1556. role 角色 ## 8

[roʊl]n.作用；角色

  • A famous actor in a highly successful play was once cast in the role of an aristocrat who had been imprisoned in the Bastille for twenty years. 在一个非常成功的演出中，一位著名演员有一次被选派在谁曾在巴士底狱被关押了20年的贵族的角色。
  • She acted the role of the perfect servant for three years before Aunt Harriet discovered her ‘little weakness’. 她担任了三年的完美仆人的角色之后，哈丽特终于发现她有“小小的弱点”。
  • In what way does echo-location in bats play an utilitarian role? 在哪些方面蝙蝠回声定位发挥实用价值？

SEE> as 作为, no·ta·bly , in·volved 参与

ODE> An actor’s part in a play, film, etc. – part, character.

1557. roll 翻滚 ## 3

[roʊl]n.卷；滚动；名单；压路机；颤音；圆形物，面包卷v.摇摆；滚；绕；转动；展开

  • George took off his jacket, rolled up his sleeves and pushed his right arm through the drain cover. 乔治脱掉外套，挽起袖子，并通过排盖推开他的右臂。
  • The Cutty Sark rolled from side to side and it became impossible to steer her. 卡蒂萨克从一边到另一边卷起并成为无法驾驭她。
  • He was the man who climbed the Leaning Tower of Pisa and dropped various weights from the top, who rolled balls down inclined planes, and then generalized the results of his many experiments into the famous law of free fall. 他是谁爬上比萨斜塔，并从塔顶向下抛掷各种重物，谁轧球沿斜面向下，然后他的许多实验结果推广到自由落体的著名法律的人。

SEE> turn 转动, put 放, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> Move in a particular direction by turning over and over on an axis. – turn round and round, go round and round, turn over and over, spin, rotate.

1558. roof 屋顶 ## 6

[ruːf]n.屋顶；顶vt.覆盖；给 … 覆以屋顶

  • Once he landed on the roof of a block of flats and on another occasion, he landed in a deserted car park. 一次，他降落在单位，并在另一个场合块的屋顶，降落在了一个废弃的停车场上。
  • Because the weather was very hot, he carried the bed on to the roof of his house. 由于天气很热，他便把床搬到了他的屋顶上。
  • A gust of wind swept the bed off the roof and sent it crashing into the courtyard below. 一阵风席卷床从屋顶上，并把它摔碎在下面的院子里。

SEE> win·dow 窗口, build·ing 建筑, ex·te·ri·or

ODE> The structure forming the upper covering of a building or vehicle. – roof, vault, vaulting.

1559. room 房间 ## 40

[ruːm]n.房间；空间；机会v.寄宿；给…提供留宿

  • There is a table in the middle of the room. 有一个在屋子中间一张桌子。
  • Mrs. Smith’s living room is large. 史密斯太太的客厅很大。
  • There is a television in the room. 有在房间里的电视机。

SEE> up·stairs 楼上, floor 地面, in·side 内

ODE> Space that can be occupied or where something can be done. – space, free space.

1560. root 根 ## 3

[ruːt]n.根；根源；根本v.生根；扎根；根除

  • By then, however, in many places the grass had already taken root. 届时，但是，在很多地方的草已经生了根。
  • His roots and mine had become too firmly embedded in the new land. 他的根和我一样已经深深地扎在异国的土地。
  • He had lived in it as a child when it was already disappearing, and his hero was firmly rooted in his memories and experiences, and in both the history and the mythology of the vanished frontier. 他住在它作为一个孩子正在消失，他塑造的英雄人物深深地扎根在他的记忆和经验，并在历史和消失前沿的神话之中。

SEE> in·stance 例子, hence 因此, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The part of a plant which attaches it to the ground or to a support, typically underground, conveying water and nourishment to the rest of the plant via numerous branches and fibres. – radicle, rhizome, rootstock, tuber, tap root, rootlet.

1561. rope 绳子 ## 5

[roʊp]n.绳索；一串；绞刑v.捆绑；说服（口）

  • The rope had been cut, so it was obvious that the lamb had been stolen. 绳子被人割断，所以很明显小羔羊是被人偷走了。
  • It can take as long as eight days to rig up rope ladders and to establish supply bases before a descent can be made into a very deep cave. 它可能需要长达8天时间来搭起绳梯，建立供应基地的下降可以做成一个很深的洞穴里。
  • The village seemed deserted, the only sign of life being an ugly-looking black goat on a short length of rope tied to a tree in a field nearby. 村里似乎无人居住，唯一的生命迹象是绳索在现场绑在树上附近的短长度的面目可憎的黑山羊。

SEE> lad·der , pull 拉, strap

ODE> A length of thick strong cord made by twisting together strands of hemp, sisal, nylon, or similar material. – cord, cable, line, strand, hawser.

1562. rough·ly 粗略地 ## 4

[’rʌfli]adv.粗略地；大约；粗暴地；粗糙地；粗鲁地

  • The lawyer ascertained that a policeman had indeed dealt roughly with foreigners on several occasions. 律师证实有个警察确实粗鲁地对待外国人多次。
  • No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight; the varieties are infinite; but two classes may be roughly seen. 没有两种鸟的做法不尽相同种类的飞行;该品种有无限的;但两个班可以大致看出。
  • Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly three-dimensonal distances. 后来，由于自身安全和实际需要，就必须发展（部分通过触觉）粗略判断三dimensonal距离的能力。

SEE> ap·prox·i·mate·ly 大约, near·ly 几乎, al·most 几乎

ODE> In a manner lacking gentleness; harshly or violently. – violently, forcefully, forcibly, abruptly, unceremoniously.

1563. round 围绕 ## 23

[raʊnd]adj.圆的；球形的；丰满的；完整的；整数的；不确切的；大量的；坦率的；严厉粗暴的adv.环绕地；周长；调转方向；依次；到某处prep.围绕；在另一侧；四处n.一局(轮)；常规活动；巡视；圆形物；(由一人给大家买的)一巡饮料；一整片面包；一阵(掌声)；一发(子弹)v.绕行；弄圆；使成为整数

  • If we win a lot of money we’ll travel round the world and we’ll stay at the best hotels. 如果我们赢了很多钱，我们周游世界，我们将留在最好的酒店。
  • I turned round. 我转过身来。
  • I turned round again. 我转过身一次。

SEE> fi·nal 最终的, fourth 第四, se·cond 第二

ODE> Shaped like a circle or cylinder. – circular, disc-shaped, disc-like.

1564. route 路线 ## 4

[ruːt]n.路线；(固定)线路；途径vt.为 … 安排路线；(按路线)发送

  • Bagrit foresaw a time when computers would be small enough to hold in the hand, when they would be capable of providing information about traffic jams and suggesting alternative routes, when they would be used in hospitals to help doctors to diagnose illnesses, when they would relieve office workers and accountants of dull, repetitive clerical work. 巴格瑞特预示有一天计算机可以小到拿在手上，当他们将能够提供有关交通阻塞的信息，并建议替代路线，当他们将在医院使用，以帮助医生诊断疾病，当他们将减轻上班族的平淡会计师，重复的文职工作。
  • Instead, I saw that they had discovered a new route. 相反，我发现他们已经发现了一种新途径。
  • So I drove back to the town and began to retrace the route, taking frequent glances at the map. 所以，我开车回镇，并开始重新按路线行驶，同时频频查看地图。

SEE> high·way 高速公路, road 路, a·long 沿着

ODE> A way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination. – way, course, road, path, avenue, direction.

1565. roy·al 王室的 ## 4

[’rɔɪəl]adj.盛大的；皇家的；高贵的；第一流的；堂皇的n.顶桅帆；王室成员，贵族；纸张规格（书写纸19×24寸/印刷纸20×25寸）

  • A pilot noticed a balloon which seemed to be making for a Royal Air Force Station nearby. 一位飞行员注意到似乎的一个皇家空军基地附近的气球。
  • The episode could reasonably serve as a unique epic of royal espionage! 这一幕历史可以说是王室谍报活动中最精彩的篇章！
  • This was the Vasa, royal flagship of the great imperial fleet. 这是瓦萨，帝国大舰队的皇家旗舰。

SEE> queen 女王, pal·ace 宫殿, king 国王

ODE> Having the status of a king or queen or a member of their family. – royal, regal, monarchal, monarchial, monarchical, sovereign, kingly, queenly, princely, majestic.

1566. rub 擦 ## 4

[rʌb]v.擦；摩擦；搓；惹恼n.困难；障碍；擦

  • A crowd of people gathered round him and a lady rubbed his arm with soap and butter, but George was firmly stuck. 一大群人围拢过来，一位女士胳膊上抹了肥皂，黄油，但乔治是牢牢卡住。
  • If you expressed doubt or surprise, he would immediately invite you to smell it and then to rub some into your skin. 如果你表示怀疑或惊奇，他会立即请你闻一闻，然后取出一些抹在你的皮肤。
  • There is only one difference between an old man and a young one: the young man has a glorious future before him and the old one has a splendid future behind him: and maybe that is where the rub is. 只有一个老人和一个年轻的一个区别：青年人有光辉灿烂的前景，而老年人的有他身后一个灿烂的未来：这也许就是困难之所在。

SEE> sprin·kle , last·ly , brush 刷子

ODE> Apply firm pressure to the surface of (something), using a repeated back and forth motion. – massage, knead.

1567. rub·ber 橡胶 ## 4

[’rʌbər]n.橡胶；橡皮；橡胶制品adj.橡胶的

  • They quickly loaded a small rubber dinghy with food, matches, and cans of beer and rowed for a few miles across the Caribbean until they arrived at a tiny coral island. 他们迅速把小橡皮艇食物，火柴，罐装啤酒和划行加勒比海几英里，到了一座珊瑚岛上。
  • The men collected rainwater in the rubber dinghy. 男子收集在橡皮艇的雨水。
  • They plunged into the lake, and after loading their gear on an inflatable rubber dinghy, let the current carry them to the other side. 他们跳入湖中，并装上一只充气橡皮艇自己的装备后，让他们当前进到另一侧。

1568. rub·bish 垃圾 ## 6

[’rʌbɪʃ]n.垃圾；废物；废话；碎屑v.贬损

  • Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere. 废物筐已放置在树下，但人们仍到处扔垃圾。
  • Among the rubbish, I found a sign which said, ‘Anyone who leaves litter in these woods will be prosecuted!’ 在垃圾堆中我发现了一块牌子，上面写着：“凡谁在此树林里垃圾会被起诉！”
  • Instead of catching fish, they catch old boots and rubbish. 相反捕的鱼，他们抓住旧靴子和垃圾。

ODE> Waste material; refuse or litter. – refuse, waste, garbage, litter, discarded matter, debris, detritus, scrap, dross.

1569. rude 粗鲁的 ## 4

[ruːd]adj.粗鲁无礼的；原始的；未加工的；粗糙的；猛烈的

  • ‘You needn’t be so rude about it,’ my wife answered as she looked at herself in the mirror. “你不必这样不客气，”我妻子回答，她看着镜子里的自己。
  • After seeking out the rude assistant, she asked for the same dress. 找到那个无礼的售货员后，她问的那件衣服。
  • The bull was busy with the matador at the time, but it suddenly caught sight of the drunk who was shouting rude remarks and waving a red cap. 公牛正忙着与当时的斗牛士，但突然它看见谁喊着粗鲁的话，挥舞顶红帽子的。

1570. rule 规则 ## 8

[ruːl]n.规则；条例；习惯；统治；直尺v.支配；统治；画直线

  • However, boxing was very crude, for there were no rules and a prizefighter could be seriously injured or even killed during a match. 不过，拳击是十分野蛮的，因为当时没有任何比赛规则，职业拳击手有可能会受到严重受伤或在比赛中甚至丧命。
  • The use of gloves was not introduced until 1860, when the Marquis of Queensberry drew up the first set of rules. 使用手套并没有出台，直到1860年，昆斯伯里侯爵制定了第一套规则。
  • Tramps seem to be the only exception to this general rule. 流浪汉似乎是唯一的例外一般规则。

1571. run 跑 ## 35

[rʌn]v.跑；行驶；运转；运营；持续；蔓延；传播；竞选；遭遇；熔化；褪色；流n.路程；奔跑；趋向adj.熔化的；浇铸的；洄游的

  • It’s running across the grass. 它的运行穿过草地。
  • It’s running after a cat. 这是一个猫运行后。
  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

ODE> Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time. – sprint, race, dart, rush, dash, hasten, hurry, scurry, scuttle, scamper, hare, bolt, bound, fly, gallop, career, charge, pound, shoot, hurtle, speed, streak, whizz, zoom, sweep, go like lightning, go hell for leather, go like the wind, flash, double.

1572. rush 冲 ## 8

[rʌʃ]v.冲；仓促行事；突袭；奔；急速流动n.抢购；匆忙；冲进；急速行进；蜂拥adj.繁忙的；紧急的

  • When he was driving along Catford Street recently, he saw two thieves rush out of a shop and run towards a waiting car. 当他凯特福德街上行驶最近，他看到有两个小偷急于一家商店出来，向一辆等候着的小汽车跑去。
  • They had rushed up to her while she was having a picnic at the edge of a forest with her children and tried to steal her handbag. 他们赶到了她，而她出在与她的孩子们在森林边缘野餐，并试图抢走她的手提包。
  • A woman you know well will rush towards you. 您很熟悉的女人将向您冲来。

SEE> hur·ry 匆忙, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, in·deed 确实

ODE> Move with urgent haste. – in a hurry, running about, run off one’s feet, rushing about, dashing about, pushed for time, pressed for time, time-poor.

1573. sad 伤心 ## 2

[sæd]adj.悲哀的；忧愁的；伤心的

  • What I saw made me very sad. 我所看到的让我很伤心。
  • The sad truth is that most of us have been brought up to eat certain foods and we stick to them all our lives. 可悲的事实是，我们大多数人已经长大吃某些食物，我们坚持给他们所有我们的生活。

SEE> sor·ry 抱歉, trag·ic , hap·py 快乐

ODE> Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy. – unhappy, sorrowful, dejected, regretful, depressed, downcast, miserable, downhearted, down, despondent, despairing, disconsolate, out of sorts, desolate, bowed down, wretched, glum, gloomy, doleful, dismal, blue, melancholy, melancholic, low-spirited, mournful, woeful, woebegone, forlorn, crestfallen, broken-hearted, heartbroken, inconsolable, grief-stricken.

1574. sad·ly 伤心地 ## 5

[’sædli]adv.悲哀地；遗憾的是；极为

  • ‘I might as well have them,’ I said sadly. “我还不如他们，”我垂头丧气地说。
  • Glancing at the bits of wood and metal that lay around him, the man sadly picked up the mattress and carried it into his house. 在木材和金属，在他周围铺设的瞥了一眼位，伤心地捡起了床垫，把它拿进了屋。
  • The examiner looked at me sadly. 主考人伤心地看着我。

1575. safe 安全 ## 11

[seɪf]adj.安全的；安然无恙的；可靠的；谨慎的n.保险箱

  • The writer stated that Rastus was in safe hands and would be returned immediately if Mrs. Ramsay paid a ransom of ￡1,000. 写信人声称拉斯特斯是安然无恙，只要拉姆齐太太支付£1,000英镑赎金，可以立即返回。
  • One day she came into his office and happened to put her hands on the door of a locked safe. 有一天，她走进他的办公室，偶然把手放在一个锁着的保险柜的门。
  • As it happens, a razor that is safe in Europe is unlikely to electrocute Americans. 碰巧，一个剃须刀是欧洲安全是不大可能使美国人触电。

SEE> sure 当然, se·cure 安全, sup·pos·ed·ly

ODE> Protected from or not exposed to danger or risk; not likely to be harmed or lost. – protected from danger, protected from harm, shielded, sheltered, guarded, defended, secure, safe and sound, out of harm’s way, all right.

1576. safe·ty 安全 ## 3

[’seɪfti]n.安全；保险

  • By this time, however, three men had come into the ring and they quickly dragged the drunk to safety. 到这个时候，然而，三个人进入斗牛场，迅速把醉汉拉到安全。
  • An electric razor that meets the European Union’s safety standards must be approved by American testers before it can be sold in the United States, and an American-made dialysis machine needs the EU’s okay before it hits the market in Europe. 符合欧盟安全标准的电动剃须刀必须得到美国检测人员的认可，方可在美国销售，和一个美国制造的透析仪也要得到欧盟的还好它击中欧洲市场之前。
  • Later, for its personal safety and practical needs, it has to develop (partly by means of touch) the ability to judge roughly three-dimensonal distances. 后来，由于自身安全和实际需要，就必须发展（部分通过触觉）粗略判断三dimensonal距离的能力。

ODE> The condition of being protected from or unlikely to cause danger, risk, or injury. – welfare, well-being, protection, security.

1577. sail 帆 ## 9

[seɪl]v.航行；驾(船)n.帆；航行；航海

  • Our neighbour, Captain Charles Alison, will sail from Portsmouth tomorrow. 我们的邻居查尔斯。艾利森船长明天就要从朴次茅斯起航。
  • It has sailed across the Atlantic many times. 它横跨大西洋很多次航行。
  • The great ship, Titanic, sailed for New York from Southampton on April 10th, 1912. 巨轮泰坦尼克号，航行于纽约南安普敦1912年4月10日。

SEE> sail·ing 帆船, ship 船, boat 船

ODE> A piece of material extended on a mast to catch the wind and propel a boat or ship or other vessel. – canvas.

1578. sail·ing 帆船 ## 3

[’seɪlɪŋ]n.航行；航海；启航动词sail的现在分词.

  • One of the most famous sailing ships of the nineteenth century, the Cutty Sark, can still be seen at Greenwich. 其中最有名的帆船十九世纪的，卡蒂萨克，仍可在格林威治看到。
  • Before they were replaced by steamships, sailing vessels like the Cutty Sark were used to carry tea from China and wool from Australia. 之前，他们是由轮船取代帆船像卡蒂萨克被用来携带来自中国的茶叶和羊毛来自澳大利亚。
  • The Cutty Sark was one of the fastest sailing ships that has ever been built. 卡蒂萨克是有史以来建造的最快的一艘帆船。

SEE> sail 帆, yacht , boat 船

ODE> The action of sailing in a ship or boat. – journey, trip, expedition, excursion, tour, hike, trek, tramp, safari, pilgrimage, quest, crusade, odyssey.

1579. sail·or 水手 ## 3

[’seɪlər]n.海员；水手；扁平的硬边草帽

  • Fishermen and sailors sometimes claim to have seen monsters in the sea. 渔夫和水手们有时声称看到过海里的妖怪。
  • But neither psychiatric interviews nor objective tests were able to show any effects upon these American sailors. 但无论是精神病学的调查访问，还是进行客观的测试，都不能显示对这些美国水兵有任何影响。
  • The high stern castle was a riot of carved gods, demons, knights, kings, warriors, mermaids, cherubs; and zoomorphic animal shapes ablaze with red and gold and blue, symbols of courage, power, and cruelty, were portrayed to stir the imaginations of the superstitious sailors of the day. 高耸的船是雕刻的神仙，妖魔，骑士，国王，勇士，美人鱼，小天使，492;和兽形动物形状的红色和金黄色，蓝色的勇气，力量和残酷的符号闪亮，以激起一天迷信的水手们的想像。

SEE> fish·er·man , young·ster , like·wise

ODE> A person whose job it is to work as a member of the crew of a commercial or naval ship or boat, especially one who is below the rank of officer. – seaman, seafarer, seafaring man, mariner.

1580. sal·a·ry 薪水 ## 2

[’sæləri]n.薪水v.给 … 薪水

  • He gets a good salary, but he always borrows money from his friends and never pays it back. 他的薪水很高，但他却总是向朋友借钱，并且从来不还。
  • He told me that the firm could not afford to pay such large salaries. 他告诉我，公司无法支付如此巨额的工资。

  • They’re sales reps. 他们是推销员。
