1582. salt 盐 ## 2

[sɔːlt]n.盐；刺激；盐类vt.用盐腌；加盐于

  • He set up a new world record in September 1935 at Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah. 他在邦纳维尔盐滩，犹他州建立一个新的世界纪录，在1935年9月。
  • Such extreme cases must probably be taken with a grain of salt, but they do underline the general principle that the relationship between elephant and mahout is the key to successful training. 这种极端的事例虽不可用一粒盐，但他们强调了一项基本原则，象和象夫之间的关系是成功的关键培训。

SEE> taste 味道, lake 湖, pep·per 胡椒

ODE> A white crystalline substance which gives seawater its characteristic taste and is used for seasoning or preserving food. – sodium chloride.

1583. same 相同 ## 37

[seɪm]adj.同样的，一样的adv.同样地pron.同样的人或事

  • It’s the same colour. 这是相同的颜色。
  • Tony saw me and came and sat at the same table. 托尼看见了我，就走过来和我坐到同一张桌子。
  • It is always the same on these occasions. 它始终是在这些场合相同。

SEE> this 这个, in·stance 例子, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Identical; not different. – the identical, the very same, selfsame, one and the same, the very.

1584. sam·ple 样品 ## 3

[’sæmpl]n.样品；样本vt.采样；取样；品尝，体验

  • These days, advertisers not only offer free samples, but free cars, free houses, and free trips round the world as well. 这些天来，广告客户不仅提供免费样品，而且提供免费汽车，免费住房，免费周游世界。
  • The geologist needs to know what rocks the drill has reached, so every so often a sample is obtained with a coring bit. 地质学家需要知道什么岩石钻头已经达到，因此时常要用芯钻头取样。
  • Sir James Clark Ross had obtained a sounding of over 2,400 fathoms in 1839, but it was not until 1869, when H.M.S.Porcupine was put at the disposal of the Royal Society for several cruises, that a series of deep soundings was obtained in the Atlantic and the first samples were collected by dredging the bottom. 詹姆斯·克拉克罗斯爵士曾获得1839年探测超过2400英寻的，但直到1869年，当HMSPorcupine支配皇家学会的几个航次是说，就是一系列深探测的是在大西洋和获得第一样品通过清淤底部收集。

SEE> in·stance 例子, fur·ther·more , more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A small part or quantity intended to show what the whole is like. – representative, illustrative, selected, specimen, test, trial, typifying, typical.

1585. sand 沙子 ## 4

[sænd]n.沙；沙子；沙滩；黄灰色vt.撒沙；打磨；以沙掩盖

  • To their surprise, the precious parcel was full of stones and sand! 令他们吃惊的是，珍贵的包裹里面装的全是石头和沙子！
  • These days, it is differences in national regulations, far more than tariffs, that put sand in the wheels of trade between rich countries. 这些天来，这是在国家法规的差异，而不是关税，在富裕国家之间的贸易轮子放沙子。
  • If we could actually see the path described by a particle, such as a sand grain in the rock, it would be more like that of a bluebottle buzzing round the room; it would be up and down, to and fro and from side to side. 如果我们真能看到一个粒子，描述的路径，例如在岩石沙粒，这将是更像是一个青蝇嗡嗡的在房间里打转的;这将是上上下下，来来回回，并从一边到另一边。

SEE> mud 泥, sand·y , dirt 污垢

ODE> A loose granular substance, typically pale yellowish brown, resulting from the erosion of siliceous and other rocks and forming a major constituent of beaches, river beds, the seabed, and deserts. – beach, sands, shore, seaside, seashore, foreshore, dunes, sand dunes, sandhills, desert.

1586. sat·is·fac·tion 满足 ## 3

[ˌsætɪs’fækʃn]n.满意；赔偿；乐事；妥善处理；确信

  • I took one guiltily, lit it and smoked with satisfaction. 我内疚地拿了一支，把它点燃，心满意足地抽起来。
  • After consulting my railway timetable, I noted with satisfaction that there was an express train to Westhaven. 我查看了列车时刻表，满意地指出，有快车不可动摇的信念。
  • I even went out at midnight with a torch and noted with satisfaction (and surprise) that the ants were still swarming around the sticky tape without being able to do anything about it. 我甚至出去半夜用火炬，满意地（同时惊奇地）发现那些蚂蚁还围着胶带团团转，却无法做任何事情地指出。

SEE> sat·is·fied 满意, im·por·tant·ly 重要的, dis·ap·point·ment 失望

ODE> Fulfilment of one’s wishes, expectations, or needs, or the pleasure derived from this. – contentment, contentedness, content, pleasure, gratification, fulfilment, happiness, sense of well-being, pride, sense of achievement, delight, joy, enjoyment, relish, triumph.

1587. save 保存 ## 9

[seɪv]v.救；节省；保存n.救援，救助

  • Did the detectives save the diamonds? 难道侦探拯救钻石？
  • He saved money for years and in 1958 he bought a small workshop of his own. 他靠多年积蓄，于1958年买下了自己的一个小作坊。
  • Tired of sleeping on the floor, a young man in Teheran saved up for years to buy a real bed. 累了睡在地板上，一名年轻男子在德黑兰积蓄多年买了一张真正的床。

SEE> put 放, ef·fort 努力, help 帮助

ODE> Keep safe or rescue (someone or something) from harm or danger. – rescue, come to someone’s rescue, save someone’s life, come to someone’s aid.

1588. say 说 ## 150

[seɪ]v.说；讲；比如说；表明n.发言权；意见

  • Say,‘Ah’. 我说，“啊”。
  • On the way home, my wife said to me, ’Don’t drive so quickly! 在回家的路上，我的妻子对我说，“不要这么快开车！
  • What did your boss say to him? 你老板是怎么对他说？

SEE> be·lieve 相信, what 什么, know 知道

ODE> Utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, a feeling or intention, or an instruction. – speak, utter, voice, pronounce, give utterance to, give voice to, vocalize.

1589. scale 规模 ## 3

[skeɪl]n.刻度；等级，规模；音阶；量程；天枰，磅秤；鳞片，鳞状物v.攀登；按比例决定；称重；刮鳞；剥落

  • Things can go wrong on a big scale, as a number of people recently discovered in Parramatta, a suburb of Sydney. 事情都可能出错规模很大，多项最近在帕拉马塔，悉尼的郊区发现的人。
  • that dogs barking incessantly in the night rated the highest form of noise pollution on a scale ranging from 1 to 7. 狗在夜间额定噪声污染的最高形式上的刻度范围从1到7个不停吠叫。
  • Soon the errors will have multiplied to the ten-foot scale, and so on up to the size of the globe. 很快这种偏差会增加到十英尺标，等等一直到全球的规模。

SEE> mas·sive 大规模的, ex·tent 程度, sim·i·lar 类似

ODE> Each of the small, thin horny or bony plates protecting the skin of fish and reptiles, typically overlapping one another. – plate.

1590. scene 场景 ## 6

[siːn]n.情景；场；景

  • It was not long before a helicopter arrived on the scene to rescue the survivors of the plane crash. 时间不长，一个直升机赶到现场之前营救飞机失事的幸存者。
  • This last scene shows you what will happen at the end of the harvest: the famous Calabrian macaroni-eating competition! 这最后一个镜头向您展示将发生在收获的到底是什么：著名的卡拉布里亚通心粉吃的竞争！
  • It has long been known that the hunting scenes depicted on walls were not simply a form of artistic expression. 人们早就知道，画在墙上的狩猎图景并不是单纯的艺术表现形式。

SEE> where 哪里, an·oth·er 另一个, in·deed 确实

ODE> The place where an incident in real life or fiction occurs or occurred. – location, site, place, position, point, spot.

1591. scheme 方案 ## 2

[skiːm]n.阴谋；计划；方案v.图谋；设计；策划；认为

  • Most of us fail in our efforts at self-improvement because our schemes are too ambitious and we never have time to carry them out. 我们大多数人无法在我们的努力完善自我，因为我们的规划过于宏大，而又根本没有时间去实施。
  • As long ago as 1809, the Swedish Parliament introduced a scheme to safeguard the interest of the individual. 早在1809年，瑞典议会就建立了一个保护个人的利益。

SEE> where·by , plan 计划, in·stance 例子

ODE> A large-scale systematic plan or arrangement for attaining a particular object or putting a particular idea into effect. – plan, project, plan of action, programme, strategy, stratagem, game plan.

1592. school 学校 ## 26

[skuːl]n.学校；学派；院系；鱼群v.教育；训练；成群地游

  • This is the school building. 这是学校大楼。
  • In the morning, Mr. Sawyer goes to work and the children go to school. 早上，索耶先生去上班，孩子们去上学。
  • Their father takes them to school every day. 他们的父亲每天送他们上学。

SEE> el·e·men·ta·ry , col·lege 学院, teach·er 老师

ODE> An institution for educating children. – educational institution, centre of learning.

1593. sci·ence 科学 ## 9

[’saɪəns]n.科学；学科；理科；自然科学；专门技巧

  • Though he was technically a prizefighter, Mendoza did much to change crude prizefighting into a sport, for he brought science to the game. 虽然他是个职业拳击手，门多萨做了很多改变粗野的拳击变成一种体育运动方面，他作出了重大的比赛。
  • But this hope is always in the realms of science fiction. 但是，这种希望总是只在科幻小说中存在。
  • Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh. 米德 - 集成电路的一位先驱，加州技术学院的计算机科学教授，注意到，现在的工作站，使工程师可以设计，试验和生产芯片在他们的办公桌，就像一位编辑器上创建一个简讯在Macintosh。

SEE> sci·en·tif·ic 科学的, phys·ics 物理, tech·nol·o·gy 技术

ODE> The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment. – branch of knowledge, body of facts, body of information, body of knowledge, area of study, discipline, field.

1594. sci·en·tif·ic 科学的 ## 7

[ˌsaɪən’tɪfɪk]adj.科学的

  • Recent scientific evidence seems to indicate that this assumption is incorrect. 最近的科学研究发现，好像这种假设是不正确。
  • Vera’s curious talent was brought to the notice of a scientific research institute in the town of Ulyanovsk, near where she lives, and in April she was given a series of tests by a special commission of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federal Republic. 维拉的好奇人才被带到一个科研单位在乌里扬诺夫斯克镇的通知，她家附近，并在4月，她被俄罗斯联邦共和国卫生部的一个特别委员会对一系列的测试。
  • Two factors weigh heavily against the effectiveness of scientific research in industry. 有两个因素严重地妨碍工业中科学研究的效率。

SEE> re·search 研究, sci·ence 科学, knowl·edge 知识

ODE> Based on or characterized by the methods and principles of science. – technological, technical.

1595. sci·en·tist 科学家 ## 7

[’saɪəntɪst]n.科学家

  • Haroun Tazieff, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and deep caves in all parts of the world. 哈龙塔捷耶夫，波兰科学家，已经花了毕生的研究在世界各地的活火山和探洞。
  • The fish, which has since been sent to a museum where it is being examined by a scientist, is called an oarfish. 鱼，这已经被送到那里正被科学家检查了博物馆，被称为皇带鱼。
  • Like a scientist bent on making a discovery, he must cherish the hope that one day he will be amply rewarded. 像科学家一样弯曲进行探索，他必须抱有希望，有一天他会取得丰硕的成果。

SEE> re·search·er , pro·fes·sor 教授, ex·pert 专家

ODE> A person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences. – researcher, technologist.

1596. scream 尖叫 ## 3

[skriːm]n.尖叫声v.尖叫；（指风﹑ 机器等）发出大而尖的声音

  • Car alarms constantly scream at us in the street and are a source of profound irritation. 汽车警报不断对我们在街上吼叫，这是人们极度烦燥的一个来源。
  • A recent article in a weekly newspaper, for instance, was headed with a striking illustration of a lady in a state of considerable distress, with the caption ‘She was yet another victim, reduced to a screaming wreck’. 在一家周报刊登了最近的一篇文章，例如，与一位女士在相当大的困扰状态的鲜明的例子为首，用文字说明：“她是又一个受害者，一个尖叫击毁”。
  • The captive elephant, still roped to a tree, plunges and screams every time a man approaches, and for several days will probably refuse all food through anger and fear. 圈养的大象，还是拉拢在树上，猛冲并发出尖叫每一个男人接近的时间，几天很可能会拒绝所有食物愤怒和恐惧。

SEE> cry 哭, shout 叫喊, yell

ODE> Give a long, loud, piercing cry or cries expressing extreme emotion or pain. – shriek, screech, yell, howl, shout, bellow, bawl, cry out, call out, yawp, yelp, squeal, wail, squawk, squall, caterwaul, whoop.

1597. screen 屏幕 ## 3

[skriːn]n.屏幕；银幕；隔板；屏风；掩蔽物；纱窗；纱门；筛子v.掩蔽；包庇；放映；筛；检查

  • That proved to be my undoing, for I soon got back to my old bad habit of dozing off in front of the screen. 这证明了我的失败，因为我不久就回到电视屏幕前打瞌睡的坏习惯去。
  • Nor could he have foreseen how we could use the Internet to obtain information on every known subject, so we can read it on a screen in our homes and even print it as well if we want to. 他也能预见我们如何能够利用互联网获取有关任何已知专题的信息，所以我们可以在家里的屏幕上阅读，甚至将其打印，以及如果我们想。
  • During these tests she was able to read a newspaper through an opaque screen and, stranger still, by moving her elbow over a child’s game of Lotto she was able to describe the figures and colours printed on it; and, in another instance, wearing stockings and slippers, to make out with her foot the outlines and colours of a picture hidden under a carpet. 在这些测试中，她能隔着不透明的屏幕，陌生人读报纸的是，通过在乐透的孩子的比赛，她能说出印在其上的数字和颜色移动她的胳膊肘;并且，在另一种情况下，她穿着长筒袜子和拖鞋，让与她的脚藏在地毯下面一幅画的轮廓和颜色。

SEE> pic·ture 图画, fea·ture 特征, tou·ch 触摸

ODE> A fixed or movable upright partition used to divide a room, give shelter from draughts, heat, or light, or to provide concealment or privacy. – partition, divider, room divider, dividing wall, separator, curtain, arras, blind, awning, shade, shutter, canopy, windbreak.

1598. sea 海洋 ## 40

[siː]n.海；海洋

  • Will you travel by sea or by air? 您将通过海运或空运旅行？
  • We may travel by sea. 我们可能乘船去。
  • She threw the bottle into the sea. 她把瓶子扔进了大海。

SEE> o·cean 海洋, coast 海岸, shore

ODE> The expanse of salt water that covers most of the earth’s surface and surrounds its land masses. – ocean, the ocean, the waves.

1599. search 搜索 ## 15

[sɜːrtʃ]v.搜寻；探求；调查n.搜寻；搜索；调查

  • Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been. 与此同时，我的舌头正在忙着寻找我拔掉牙的那个洞。
  • Armed with the new machine, a search party went into the cave hoping to find buried treasure. 随着新机的武装，搜索队进入了这个岩洞，希望找到埋藏的宝藏。
  • The party then searched the whole cave thoroughly but did not find anything except an empty tin trunk. 然后，将彻底搜寻了整个洞穴，但没有发现除了一个空铁皮箱外什么。

SEE> find 找到, lo·cate 定位, in·stance 例子

ODE> Try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly. – hunt, look, explore, forage, fish about, fish around, look high and low, cast about, cast around, cast round, ferret, ferret about, ferret around, root about, root around, rummage about, rummage around.

1600. sea·son 季节 ## 4

[’siːzn]n.季节；赛季；旺季；时期v.给 … 调味；适应；风干

  • Which seasons do you like best? 哪些季节你最喜欢？
  • Up to now, historians have assumed that calendars came into being with the advent of agriculture, for then man was faced with a real need to understand something about the seasons. 截至目前，历史学家们认为日历是随农业的问世而出现的，因为当时人们面临着一个真正需要了解一些有关的季节。
  • It seems that man was making a real effort to understand the seasons 20,000 years earlier than has been supposed. 看来人类正在作出真正的努力要早20,000年比人们想像的季节。

SEE> year 年, last 最后的, start 开始

ODE> Each of the four divisions of the year (spring, summer, autumn, and winter) marked by particular weather patterns and daylight hours, resulting from the earth’s changing position with regard to the sun. – period, active period, time, time of year, spell, term, phase, stage.

1601. seat 座位 ## 2

[siːt]n.座位；底座；席位；臀部；所在地vt.使坐下；可容纳vi.坐

  • I had a very good seat. 我有一个非常好的座位。
  • She did not even look up when I took my seat beside her. 她连看都不看，当我在她身旁的座位。

SEE> chair 椅子, in·stead 代替, same 相同

ODE> A thing made or used for sitting on, such as a chair or stool. – chair, place, space.

1602. se·cond 第二 ## 17

[’sekənd]adj.第二的；次等的；再一个的num.第二n.片刻；秒adv.第二；其次v.支持；赞成；附和；调派

  • His engine failed and he landed on the sea for the second time. 他因引擎故障，他降落在海面上的第二次。
  • Mendoza met Humphries in the ring on a later occasion and he lost for a second time. 门多萨满足环汉弗莱斯以后有机会和他失去了第二次。
  • He had been obliged to join the army during the Second World War. 他曾被迫在二战期间参军。

SEE> third 第三, fourth 第四, first 第一

ODE> Constituting number two in a sequence; coming after the first in time or order; 2nd. – next, following, after the first, subsequent, ensuing, succeeding, coming.

1603. se·cret 秘密 ## 14

[’siːkrət]n.秘密；奥秘；秘诀adj.秘密的；机密的

  • Alf did this for over two years and his fellow dustmen kept his secret. 阿尔夫这样做了两年多和他的同事清洁工保持他的秘密。
  • We often read in novels how a seemingly respectable person or family has some terrible secret which has been concealed from strangers for years. 我们经常读到小说中一个看似受人尊重的人物或家庭，却已经从陌生人隐藏多年的一些可怕的秘密。
  • The terrible secret is called ‘a skeleton in the cupboard’. 惊人的秘密被称作“柜中骷髅”。

SEE> sup·pos·ed·ly , se·cret·ly 偷偷, re·veal 揭示

ODE> Not known or seen or not meant to be known or seen by others. – confidential, strictly confidential, top secret, classified, restricted, unrevealed, undisclosed, unpublished, untold, unknown, uncommunicated, behind someone’s back, under wraps, unofficial, off the record, not for circulation, not for publication, not to be made public, not to be disclosed.

1604. see 看见 ## 139

[siː]v.看见；明白；了解；经历；设想n.主教教区；主角权限

  • Nice to see you. 很高兴见到你。
  • Nice to see you, too, Steven. 很高兴见到你，也史蒂芬。
  • Come upstairs and see it. 到楼上去看它。

SEE> come 来, what 什么, look 看

ODE> Perceive with the eyes; discern visually. – discern, perceive, glimpse, catch a glimpse of, get a glimpse of, spot, notice, catch sight of, sight.

1605. seed 种子 ## 5

[siːd]n.种子vi.播种；(植物)结实vt.播种

  • The seed was sprayed over the ground in huge quantities by aeroplanes. 种子是由飞机撒在地面巨大的数量。
  • The planes had been planting seed for nearly a month when it began to rain. 该飞机已经播种了近一个月的时候就开始下雨了。
  • When the news got round that a comedy show would be presented at our local cinema by the P. and U. Bird Seed Company, we all rushed to see it. 当消息传开喜剧节目将在我们皮尤鸟食公司当地影院介绍，大家都赶紧跑去观看。

SEE> up·set 烦恼, round 围绕, sixth 第六

ODE> The unit of reproduction of a flowering plant, capable of developing into another such plant. – pip, stone, pit, nut, kernel, germ.

1606. seek 寻求 ## 9

[siːk]vt.寻求；追求；试图vi.寻找

  • After seeking out the rude assistant, she asked for the same dress. 找到那个无礼的售货员后，她问的那件衣服。
  • In seeking independence, they do not sacrifice their human dignity. 在追求独立自由，他们并不牺牲为人的尊严。
  • Those who seek it undertake an arduous journey and can never be sure that they will find it. 那些谁寻求的是一条崎岖的道路，从来没有把握他们会找到它。

SEE> al·low 允许, bring 带来, to 至

ODE> Attempt to find (something) – search for, try to find, look for, look about for, look around for, look round for, cast about for, cast around for, cast round for, be on the lookout for, be after, hunt for, be in quest of, quest, quest after, be in pursuit of.

1607. seem 似乎 ## 31

[siːm]vi.似乎；好像

  • Does grandmother seem pleased to get a card from Jimmy? 祖母是否显得高兴获得从吉米的名片？
  • At one point, it seemed certain that their plane would crash. 在一个点上，似乎可以肯定，他们的飞机会崩溃。
  • The drunk, however, seemed quite sure of himself. 这醉汉像是很有把握似的。

SEE> in·deed 确实, hard·ly 几乎不, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> Give the impression of being something or having a particular quality. – appear, appear to be, have the air of being, have the appearance of being, give the impression of being, look, look like, look as though one is, look to be, have the look of, show signs of.

1608. se·lect 选择 ## 3

[sɪ’lekt]v.选择；挑选adj.精选的；优等的n.被挑选出来的人或物

  • They will hardly know which facts to select from the great mass of evidence that steadily accumulates. 他们几乎不知道对于逐渐积累起来的庞大选取哪些。
  • But, of the vertebrates, unpredictable Nature selected only snakes (and one lizard). 但是，在脊椎动物中，不可预知的性质只选择了蛇（和一种蜥蜴）。
  • In the first place, any scientific study requires that there be no preferential weighting of one or another of the items in the series it selects for its consideration. 首先，任何科学研究都要求存在一个或另一个则选择供其审议一系列的项目没有优先权。

SEE> choose 选择, se·lec·tion 选择, in·stance 例子

ODE> Carefully choose as being the best or most suitable. – choose, pick, hand-pick, single out, pick out, sort out, take, opt for, decide on, settle on, set, fix, fix on, adopt, determine, designate, name, nominate, appoint, elect, specify, stipulate, prefer, favour.

1609. se·lec·tion 选择 ## 2

[sɪ’lekʃn]n.选择；挑选；挑选出来的人或事

  • He says nothing about the poor selection of goods in the shops, or about those unfortunate people who have to travel from the country to the city every day to get to work. 他也不说货物在商店穷人的选择，或对那些不幸的人每天去工作，谁拥有从乡下到城市旅游。
  • The serious investor needs a proper ‘portfolio’ – a well-planned selection of investments, with a definite structure and a clear aim. 认真的投资者需要一份正规的投资组合表 - 投资的一个精心策划的选择，具有一定的结构和明确的目标。

SEE> choice 选择, se·lect 选择, in·clu·sion

ODE> The action or fact of carefully choosing someone or something as being the best or most suitable. – anthology, assortment, choice, miscellany, medley, pot-pourri, collection, assemblage.

1610. sell 卖 ## 19

[sel]v.出售；卖

  • Then why do you want to sell it? 那么，您为什么要卖掉它？
  • Who wanted to sell the house? 谁曾想卖房子？
  • Has Ian sold his house yet? 伊恩已卖掉了自己的房子了吗？

SEE> buy 买, sale 销售, pur·chase 购买

ODE> Give or hand over (something) in exchange for money. – vending, selling off, auctioning, trading, trade, trade in.

1611. send 发送 ## 44

[send]vt.发送；派遣；使处于…的状态；放出；运输vi.差遣；发出；传送

  • How many cards did the writer send? 笔者没有多少卡送？
  • My holidays passed quickly, but I did not send cards to my friends. 我的假期很快就过去了，但我没寄过一张明信片给我的朋友。
  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。

SEE> ask 问, come 来, help 帮助

ODE> Cause to go or be taken to a particular destination; arrange for the delivery of, especially by post. – dispatch, post, mail, put in the mail, put in the post, address, get off, convey, consign, direct, forward, redirect, send on, remit, airmail.

1612. sense 感 ## 7

[sens]n.感官；感觉；意识；鉴赏力；意义；理智；道理；见识v.感觉；意识到；理解；检测

  • Everybody admires him for his great sense of humour – everybody, that is, except his six-year-old daughter, Jenny. 人人都钦佩他那绝妙的幽默感 - 人人，就是说，除他6岁的女儿珍妮。
  • The sense of humour is mysteriously bound up with national characteristics. 幽默感是神秘莫测的具有民族特色。
  • He simply had no sense of danger at all. 他压根儿没有危险感可言。

SEE> kind 种类, sort 种类, in·deed 确实

ODE> A faculty by which the body perceives an external stimulus; one of the faculties of sight, smell, hearing, taste, and touch. – sensory faculty, feeling, sensation, perception.

1613. sen·si·tive 敏感 ## 2

[’sensətɪv]adj.灵敏的；敏感的；感光的；易受伤害的；善解人意的n.敏感的人

  • Apparently sensitive to criticism, the bull forgot all about the matador and charged at the drunk. 批评显然非常敏感的公牛完全斗牛士和醉汉。
  • And the sensitive observer of sculpture must also learn to feel shape simply as shape, not as description or reminiscence. 和雕塑的敏感者也必须学会去感受形状简单的形状，而不是描述或联想。

SEE> par·tic·u·lar·ly 尤其, es·pe·cial·ly 特别, sub·ject 话题

ODE> Quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences. – responsive to, quick to respond to, sensitized to, reactive to, sentient of.

1614. sen·tence 句子 ## 2

[’sentəns]n.句子；判决vt.宣判；判决

  • What does she mean by ‘change’ in the last sentence? 什么是她在最后一句“变”是什么意思？
  • When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it. 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

SEE> jail , im·pris·on·ment , con·vic·tion

ODE> A set of words that is complete in itself, typically containing a subject and predicate, conveying a statement, question, exclamation, or command, and consisting of a main clause and sometimes one or more subordinate clauses. – judgement, ruling, pronouncement, decision, determination, decree.

1615. sep·a·rate 分开 ## 2

[’sepərət]adj.分开的；不同的；单独的；各自的v.分开；隔开；区分；分居；脱离n.分开；抽印本

  • After having been wounded towards the end of the war, he had been sent to hospital and was separated from his unit. 已经受伤对战争结束后，他被送进医院，并从他的单位分离。
  • But here we come up against the most difficult of all obstacles to contact with people on other planets – the astronomical distances which separate us. 但在这里我们遇到了最困难的与人在其他星球上接触的一切障碍 - 是分隔我们的天文距离。

SEE> sep·a·rate·ly 分别地, ad·di·tion 加, two 二

ODE> Forming or viewed as a unit apart or by itself. – unconnected, unrelated, different, discrete, distinct, disparate.

1616. se·ries 系列 ## 7

[’sɪriːz]n.（单复同）系列；丛书；连续

  • What incident began the series of traffic accidents? 什么事件开始了一系列的交通事故？
  • The telephone rings and this marks the prelude to an unforeseen series of catastrophes. 电话铃响了，它预示着一连串意想不到的灾难的来临。
  • In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences – most of them wildly improbable. 大部分是牵强附会，不可思议 - 在十九世纪时，小说家将通过一系列的巧合他的读者带来了他的故事的一个结论。

SEE> first 第一, sub·se·quent , be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> A number of events, objects, or people of a similar or related kind coming one after another. – sequence, succession, string, chain, concatenation, train, run, chapter, round, progression, procession.

1617. se·ri·ous 严重的 ## 11

[’sɪriəs]adj.严肃的；严重的；认真的；危急的；庄重的

  • Though, at first, Byrd and his men were able to take a great many photographs of the mountains that lay below, they soon ran into serious trouble. 虽然开始时伯德和他的助手们拍下了飞机下面连绵群山的大量照片，但他们很快就陷入了困境。
  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。
  • Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents. 喜剧演员在横死和严重事故这类悲剧家们的笑话。

SEE> se·vere 严重的, prob·lem 问题, yet 还

ODE> Demanding or characterized by careful consideration or application. – important, significant, consequential, of consequence, momentous, of moment, key, grave, weighty, far-reaching, major.

1618. se·ri·ous·ly 严肃地 ## 8

[’sɪriəsli]adv.严肃地；认真地；严重地

  • When reports came into London Zoo that a wild puma had been spotted forty-five miles south of London, they were not taken seriously. 当报告来到伦敦动物园，一只野生的美洲狮已经发现伦敦的45英里南部，他们并没有受到重视。
  • However, boxing was very crude, for there were no rules and a prizefighter could be seriously injured or even killed during a match. 不过，拳击是十分野蛮的，因为当时没有任何比赛规则，职业拳击手有可能会受到严重受伤或在比赛中甚至丧命。
  • As soon as he had hung up, he went over to the workmen and told them that if a policeman ordered them to go away, they were not to take him seriously. 只要他挂了，他走到工人，告诉他们若有个警察来让他们走开，他们不把他当回事。

SEE> hurt 使受伤, se·vere·ly 严厉地, con·cerned 关心的

ODE> In a solemn or considered manner. – solemnly, earnestly, gravely, soberly, sombrely, without smiling, with a poker face, sternly, grimly, dourly, humourlessly.

1619. serv·ant 仆人 ## 7

[’sɜːrvənt]n.仆人

  • If she were alive today she would not be able to air her views on her favourite topic of conversation: domestic servants. 如果她活到今天，她将不能就她自己的观点谈话喜爱的主题：家庭佣人。
  • Aunt Harriet lived in that leisurely age when servants were employed to do housework. 哈丽特生活在一个悠闲的年代都由雇来的佣人代劳。
  • Aunt Harriet presided over an invisible army of servants that continuously scrubbed, cleaned, and polished. 哈丽特姑妈统率着他们不停地擦拭，清扫，刷洗一支看不见的佣人大军。

SEE> like·wise , col·league 同事, sup·pos·ed·ly

ODE> A person who performs duties for others, especially a person employed in a house on domestic duties or as a personal attendant. – attendant, retainer.

1620. serve 服务 ## 16

[sɜːrv]v.服务；侍候；担任；可作 … 用；度过；对待n.发球

  • Who served you, sir? 谁接待您的，先生？
  • Did you serve this gentleman half an hour ago, Caroline? 你接待过这位绅士半小时前，卡罗琳？
  • The man who I served was wearing a hat. 谁我接待的那个人戴着一顶帽子。

SEE> in·stead 代替, well 好, as 作为

ODE> Perform duties or services for (another person or an organization) – work for, be in the service of, perform duties for, be employed by, have a job with.

1621. ser·vice 服务 ## 12

[’sɜːrvɪs]n.服务；发球；服役；公务部门；礼拜仪式；(车辆、机器等定期的)维修v.保养；维护；提供服务；支付(借款)利息

  • In this way, he has begun his own private ‘telephone’ service. 就这样，他开始了自己的私人“电话”业务。
  • Captain Ben Fawcett has bought an unusual taxi and has begun a new service. 弗西特机长买了一个不寻常的出租汽车，并开始了新的服务。
  • Though it may be possible to measure the value of material goods in terms of money, it is extremely difficult to estimate the true value of the services which people perform for us. 虽然有可能来衡量物质产品的在金钱方面的价值，这是非常难以估算别人为我们所提供的服务的真正价值。

SEE> ad·di·tion 加, same 相同, on·ly 只有

ODE> The action of helping or doing work for someone. – act of assistance, good turn, favour, kindness, helping hand.

1622. set 一套 ## 34

[set]v.放置；设定；确定；规定；调整；分配；(太阳)落下去；将（宝石）镶嵌到（某物）；配乐n.集合；组合；日落；一套；一副；一局比赛；舞台；姿态；头发的定型adj.规定的；固定的；不变的；做好准备的；固执的；不自然的

  • The sun rises early and sets late. 太阳升起早，晚集。
  • The sun rises late and sets early. 太阳升得迟，并设置月初。
  • Captain Alison will set out at eight o’clock, so we’ll have plenty of time. 艾利森船长将于8点钟，所以我们有充裕的时间。

SEE> set·ting , up 上, put 放

ODE> Put, lay, or stand (something) in a specified place or position. – put, place, put down, lay, lay down, deposit, position, settle, station.

1623. set·tle 解决 ## 8

[’setl]v.解决；定居；安顿；平静；结算n.背长椅，座位；定居，安顿

  • He had often dreamed of retiring in England and had planned to settle down in the country. 过去他常幻想退休后到英国，并计划落户在该国。
  • He had hardly had time to settle down when he sold the house and left the country. 他几乎没有时间安顿下来就卖掉了房子，离开了这个国家。
  • Six hundred years ago, Sir John Hawkwood arrived in Italy with a band of soldiers and settled near Florence. 六百年前，约翰。霍克伍德就有来到意大利，在一队士兵佛罗伦萨附近驻扎下来。

SEE> dis·pute , re·solve 决心, mean·time

ODE> Resolve or reach an agreement about (an argument or problem) – resolve, sort out, reach an agreement about, find a solution to, find an answer to, solve, clear up, bring to an end, fix, work out, iron out, smooth over, straighten out, deal with, put right, set right, put to rights, rectify, remedy, reconcile.

1624. sev·en 七 ## 13

[’sevn]num.七

  • We can have dinner at seven o’clock. 我们可以在七点钟吃晚饭。
  • I counted seven old cars and three old refrigerators. 我数了7辆旧汽车和3台上旧冰箱。
  • My sister is only seven, but she always tells me whether my pictures are good or not. 我的妹妹只有7岁，但她总能说出我的画是好还是不好。

SEE> eight 八, five 五, nine 九

ODE> Equivalent to the sum of three and four; one more than six, or three less than ten; 7. – septet, septuplets.

1625. sev·en·teen 十七 ## 4

[ˌsevn’tiːn]num.十七

  • This time, she will be a girl of seventeen. 这一次，她将扮演一个17岁的少女。
  • Six men have been trapped in a mine for seventeen hours. 六名男子已经被困在矿井十七小时。
  • It went direct from my local station and the journey lasted a mere hour and seventeen minutes. 它接着直接从我的本地站的旅程仅仅持续了一个小时17分钟。

SEE> four·teen 十四, fif·teen 十五, six·teen 十六

ODE> One more than sixteen, or seven more than ten; 17. –

1626. sev·er·al 一些 ## 27

[’sevrəl]pron.若干adj.几个的；若干的；各自的

  • I repeated my question several times and at last he understood. 我重复我的问题了几次，最后他明白了。
  • When the fire had at last been put out, the forest authorities ordered several tons of a special type of grass-seed which would grow quickly. 最后，当有火被扑灭后，森林管理当局订购了好几吨一种特殊类型的草籽生长迅速的。
  • We had to queue for hours to get in and there must have been several hundred people present just before the show began. 我们不得不排了小时才进得和一定有几百人提出之前演出开始。

SEE> nu·mer·ous , man·y 许多, few 少数

ODE> More than two but not many. – some, a number of, a few, not very many, a handful of, a small group of, various, a variety of, assorted, sundry, diverse.

1627. se·vere 严重的 ## 2

[sɪ’vɪr]adj.严厉的；严重的；剧烈的；严格的；严峻的

  • I am especially proud of it, not only because it has survived several severe winters, but because it occasionally produces luscious peaches. 我感到特别自豪的是，不仅是因为它已经存活几个寒冬，但因为它有时甜美的桃子。
  • If it were severe, they all fell. 如果是严重的，他们都倒下了。

SEE> suf·fer·ing 痛苦, se·ri·ous 严重的, suf·fer 遭受

ODE> (of something bad or undesirable) very great; intense. – acute, very bad, serious, grave, critical, dire, drastic, grievous, extreme, dreadful, terrible, awful, frightful, appalling, sore.

1628. se·vere·ly 严厉地 ## 2

[sə’vɪrlɪ]adv.严格地；严重地；严肃地；严厉地；朴实地

  • Recognizing who the customer was, the manager was most apologetic and reprimanded the assistant severely. 认识谁是顾客，表示经理深深的歉意，还严厉地训斥了店员。
  • The policeman in question was severely reprimanded and was informed that if any further complaints were lodged against him, he would be prosecuted. 当事的警察受到严厉斥责，并被告知，如果任何进一步的投诉是针对他提出，他将受到起诉。

SEE> se·ri·ous·ly 严肃地, bad·ly 惨, dam·aged

ODE> To an undesirably great or intense degree. – very badly, extremely badly, seriously, gravely, critically, grievously, acutely, sorely.

1629. shake 摇动 ## 6

[ʃeɪk]v.摇动；震动；握手n.片刻；摇晃；奶昔

  • When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head. 当我建议一些村民进来偷喝掉的，汤普森先生摇摇头。
  • I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay ￡5. 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我愿意支付£5。
  • When the woman shook her head in bewilderment, Harry went on to explain that ‘myrolite’ was a hard, amber-like substance which could be used to remove freckles. 当女人摇了摇在困惑的头，哈里便进一步解释“myrolite”是一场艰苦的，琥珀的东西，可以用来除去雀斑。

SEE> shak·en , bring 带来, let 让

ODE> (of a structure or area of land) tremble or vibrate. – vibrate, tremble, quiver, quake, shiver, shudder, judder, jiggle, wobble, rock, sway, swing, roll, oscillate.

1630. shall 将要 ## 6

[ʃəl]aux.将要；应该；一定；表示提供建议

  • Shall I make some coffee, Jane? 我煮点咖啡好吗，简？
  • Of course, we should arrest him, but as he has a good record, we shall let him off this time.’ 当然，我们应该逮捕他，但因为他有一个良好的记录，我们就放这个时候。”
  • We shall all remember Mr. Page for his patience and understanding and for the kindly encouragement he gave us when we went so unwillingly to school. 我们不会忘记佩奇先生对他的耐心和理解，因为他给我们的亲切鼓励我们不愿去上学。

ODE> (in the first person) expressing the future tense. –

1631. shal·low 浅 ## 3

[’ʃæloʊ]adj.浅的；薄的n.浅滩；浅处v.变浅

  • Our next obstacle was a shallow pool of water about half a mile across. 我们的下一个障碍是浅水塘有关跨半英里。
  • They had to edge their way along this, sometimes wading across shallow streams, or swimming across deep pools. 他们不得不边沿着他们这样，有时过浅溪涉水或游过深潭。
  • Our knowledge of the oceans a hundred years ago was confined to the two-dimensional shape of the sea surface and the hazards of navigation presented by the irregularities in depth of the shallow water close to the land. 我们的海洋一百年前的知识仅限于海面的二维形状和导航的浅水接近土地的深浅不一提出的危害。

SEE> deep 深的, be·neath 在下面, mud·dy

ODE> Of little depth. – superficial, facile, glib, simplistic, oversimplified, schematic, slight, flimsy, insubstantial, lightweight, empty, trivial, trifling.

1632. shape 形状 ## 19

[ʃeɪp]n.形状；形式；身材；定形vt.塑造；定形；使 … 成形

  • The bridge is so long that the shape of the earth had to be taken into account by its designer. 这座桥很长，所以地球的形状有它的设计师必须考虑到。
  • Before long, biscuits of all shapes and sizes began arriving at the factory. 不久，形状各异，大小不一的饼干陆续送到工厂。
  • You really see the shape of the land. 你真的看到了土地的形状。

SEE> look 看, re·sem·ble , in·deed 确实

ODE> The external form, contours, or outline of someone or something. – form, appearance, configuration, formation, structure.

1633. shaped 成形 ## 2

[ʃeɪpt]adj.具有…形状的；合适的；有计划的动词shape的过去式和过去分词形式

  • Oddly shaped forms that are suspended from the ceiling and move in response to a gust of wind are quite familiar to everybody. 被从天花板和移动响应于一阵风悬浮异形形式是大家十分熟悉。
  • I was not surprised to find that the machine still refused to work after I had reassembled it, for the simple reason that I was left with several curiously shaped bits of metal which did not seem to fit anywhere. 我并不感到惊讶地发现，机器仍然拒绝工作，我已经装完后，原因很简单，我留下了金属几个形状奇特位，似乎并不适合任何地方。

ODE> Having a defined external form or outline. –

1634. share 分享 ## 10

[ʃer]vt.分享，共享；分配；共有vi.分享n.一份；股份；分担；犁头

  • Mrs. Eleanor Ramsay, a very wealthy old lady, has shared a flat with her cat, Rastus, for a great many years. 拉姆齐太太，一个非常富有的老妇人，分享了与她的猫拉斯特斯平坦，为一个伟大的多年。
  • The swallow shares the virtues of both schools in highest measure. 燕子股最高测量两所学校的美德。
  • In some moods, Nature shares it. 在某种状态下，大自然吧。

SEE> gain 获得, same 相同, while 当的时候

ODE> A part or portion of a larger amount which is divided among a number of people, or to which a number of people contribute. – portion, part, division, bit, quota, allowance, ration, allocation, allotment, lot, measure, due.

1635. sharp 锋利 ## 2

[ʃɑːrp]adj.锋利的；突然的；灵敏的；明显的；辛辣的；【音】升音阶的adv.准时地；突然地；偏高地

  • As the man came near, the prisoner knocked him to the ground with a sharp blow. 当人走近时，战俘把他撞倒在地，猛烈的冲击。
  • The trainer stands in front of the elephant holding a long stick with a sharp metal point. 训练者，站在象保持一个长棒用锋利的金属点的前面。

SEE> drop 掉落, con·trast 对比, sharp·ly 急剧地

ODE> (of an object) having an edge or point that is able to cut or pierce something. – keen, sharp-edged, razor-sharp, razor-edged.

1636. shave 剃须 ## 2

[ʃeɪv]v.刮；剃；修剪；掠过；削减n.剃须；修面；剃刀

  • but I shaved it off when I came home. 但是我就把它刮了，当我回家。
  • Why did you shave it off? 你为什么把它刮了？

SEE> hair·cut , last·ly , beard 胡子

ODE> (of a man) cut the hair off the face with a razor. – cut off, snip off.

1637. she 她 ## 465

[ʃi:]pron.她（主格）

  • She is French. 她是法国人。
  • She’s Japanese. 她是日本人。
  • She’s Chinese, too. 她是中国人。

SEE> her 她的, he 他, her·self 她自己

ODE> Used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal previously mentioned or easily identified. – feminine, womanly, womanlike, ladylike.

1638. sheep 绵羊 ## 2

[ʃiːp]n.绵羊；羊；羊皮

  • The first sign of disaster was a dead sheep floating down. 灾难的第一迹象是一只死羊顺流而下。
  • It caused devastation by burrowing and by devouring the herbage which might have maintained millions of sheep and cattle. 它们在地下打洞，吃掉本可以饲养数百万头牛羊的牧草造成破坏。

SEE> cat·tle , goat , cow 母牛

ODE> A domesticated ruminant mammal with a thick woolly coat and (typically only in the male) curving horns. It is kept in flocks for its wool or meat, and is proverbial for its tendency to follow others in the flock. – woollyback.

1639. sheet 一张 ## 5

[ʃiːt]n.被单；纸；(薄)片；一片n.[船]帆脚索v.铺盖；使成片adj.片状的

  • Though the costume consisted only of a sheet, it was very effective. 尽管化装服仅由一个被单的，这是非常有效的。
  • It was simply a blank sheet of paper. 它简单地的一张白纸。
  • The noble stared at the blank sheet of paper for a few seconds. 在纸几秒钟的白纸贵族盯着。

SEE> pa·per 纸, cov·er 遮盖, piece 片

ODE> A large rectangular piece of cotton or other fabric, used on a bed to cover the mattress and as a layer beneath blankets when these are used. – bed linen, linen, bedclothes.

1640. shelf 架 ## 5

[ʃelf]n.架子；搁板；搁板状物n.搁置；闲置

  • The ones on the shelf. 在书架上的。
  • Put it here, on this shelf. 放在这儿，这个架子上。
  • This explanation evidently conveyed something to the woman who searched shelf after shelf. 这种解释显然东西，谁后货架货架搜索的女人。

SEE> like·wise , in·stance 例子, fur·ther·more

ODE> A flat length of wood or rigid material, attached to a wall or forming part of a piece of furniture, that provides a surface for the storage or display of objects. – ledge, bracket, sill, rack.

1641. shell 贝壳 ## 4

[ʃel]n.壳；炮弹；[计]外壳程序v.脱落；去壳；拾贝壳；炮轰

  • Almost any day a young porpoise may be seen trying to turn a 300-pound sea turtle over by sticking his snout under the edge of his shell and pushing up for dear life. 几乎每天一只小海豚可以看到试图通过他的壳的边缘下坚持他的鼻子顶入了亲爱的生活把一个300磅重的海龟了。
  • In another game, as the turtle swims across the oceanarium, the first porpoise swoops down from above and butts his shell with his belly. 在另一场比赛，作为横跨水族馆海龟游，第一只海豚从上方俯冲下来，龟壳与他的腹部。
  • The turtle at last gives up by pulling his feet under his shell and the game is over. 最后乌龟的硬壳下拉他的脚放弃，比赛就结束了。

SEE> in·stance 例子, sim·i·lar·ly 同样, like·wise

ODE> The hard protective outer case of a mollusc or crustacean. – carapace, outside, exterior.

1642. shine 闪耀 ## 7

[ʃaɪn]v.照耀；出色；发光；投光于；使发光n.光泽；光辉；阳光；擦皮鞋（美）；喜欢；鬼把戏（复）

  • There are some clouds in the sky, but the sun is shining. 还有在天空中飘着几朵云，但阳光灿烂。
  • The sun shines every day. 太阳每天照射。
  • It had a head like a horse, big blue eyes, shining silver skin, and a bright red tail. 它有一个头似马，蓝色的大眼睛，闪闪发光的银色皮肤，还有一条鲜红色的尾巴。

SEE> spot·light , bright 明亮的, like·wise

ODE> (of the sun or another source of light) give out a bright light. – emit light, give off light, beam, radiate, gleam, glow, glint, glimmer, sparkle, twinkle, flicker, glitter, glisten, shimmer, flash, dazzle, flare, glare, fluoresce.

1643. ship 船 ## 46

[ʃɪp]n.船；舰v.装运；(用船)运送；上(船)；乘(船)

  • Sally is looking at a big ship. 莎莉正在观看一艘大船。
  • The ship is going under the bridge. 船正从桥下驶过。
  • That’s the ship we travelled on. 这是我们所乘的那条船。

SEE> boat 船, a·board , sail 帆

ODE> A large boat for transporting people or goods by sea. – vessel, craft, boat.

1644. shirt 衬衫 ## 11

[ʃɜːrt]n.衬衫v.给…穿上衬衫

  • Whose shirt is white? 谁的衬衣是白色的？
  • Whose shirt is that? 是谁的衬衫？
  • Is this your shirt, Dave? 这是你的衬衫，戴夫？

SEE> jack·et 夹克, jeans 牛仔裤, pants 裤子

1645. shock 震惊 ## 13

[ʃɑːk]n.震惊；震动；冲击；休克v.使震惊；使震动；使受电击

  • My father was shocked. 我父亲大为吃惊。
  • After so many years of sunshine, Harrison got a shock. 经过这么多年的阳光，哈里森对此感到惊奇。
  • Looking round, I realized with a shock that I was the only passenger left on the bus. 回头望望，我震惊意识到我是离开了总线上唯一的乘客。

SEE> sur·prise 惊奇, shocked 震惊, dis·ap·point·ment 失望

ODE> A sudden upsetting or surprising event or experience. – blow, upset, disturbance, source of distress, source of amazement, source of consternation.

1646. shoe 鞋 ## 6

[ʃuː]n.鞋；鞋状物；蹄铁；制动蹄片vt.穿鞋；装防护物

  • What’s wrong with the fashionable shoes? 有什么不对这些时髦的鞋？
  • Do you have any shoes like these? 你有没有像这样的鞋子？
  • No, she bought them in the U.S. We had some shoes like those a month ago, but we don’t have any now. 不，她买了他们在美国我们有这样的鞋在一个月前，但我们没有任何现在。

SEE> sneak·er , cloth·ing 服装, boot 靴子

ODE> A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle. – adornment, embellishment, finery, trimming, ornament, ornamentation, decoration, complement, fashion detail, frill.

1647. shoot 射击 ## 3

[ʃuːt]v.发射；开枪；疾驰；拍照n.发射；嫩枝int.哇! 可恶! 哎呀!

  • ’Someone fired a shot through my office window. “有人向我办公室窗户开了一枪。
  • In this part of the cave, they could hear an insistent booming sound which they found was caused by a small waterspout shooting down into a pool from the roof of the cave. 在洞穴的这一部分，他们可以听见一种连续不断的轰鸣声，他们发现这是由一个小的水龙卷从洞顶击落成池造成的。
  • Hart’s good-bad man was always an outsider, always one of the disinherited, and if he found it necessary to shoot a sheriff or rob a bank along the way, his early audiences found it easy to understand and forgive, especially when it was Hart who, in the end, overcame the attacking Indians. 哈特的好，坏男人总是一个局外人，总是剥夺继承权的一个，如果他认为有必要枪击一个司法官或抢劫一个银行，他的早期观众很容易理解和原谅，特别是当它是哈特谁，最终战胜了前来进攻的印第安人。

SEE> shot 射击, shooting 射击, kill 杀

ODE> Kill or wound (a person or animal) with a bullet or arrow. – gun down, shoot down, mow down, hit, wound, injure, cut down, bring down.

1648. shop 店 ## 45

[ʃɑːp]n.商店；车间v.逛商店；购物；买东西

  • Mrs. Sawyer usually stays at home in the morning, but this morning, she is going to the shops. 索耶夫人通常是呆在家里的早晨，但今天上午，她正去商店买东西。
  • This is the largest dress in the shop. 这是店里最大一件。
  • It’s the most expensive model in the shop. 这是店里最贵的型号。

SEE> store 商店, bak·er·y , res·tau·rant 餐厅

ODE> A building or part of a building where goods or services are sold. – store, retail store, outlet, retail outlet, reseller, cash and carry.

1649. shop·ping 购物 ## 6

[’ʃɑːpɪŋ]n.购物；买东西动词shop的现在分词形式.

  • I’m making a shopping list, Tom. 我正在做一个购物清单，汤姆。
  • What kind of shopping does the writer enjoy, do you think? 什么样的购物确实作家享受，你觉得呢？
  • However, when I was going out shopping last week, I noticed him in the garden near the gate. 然而，当我上周走出去逛街，我注意到他在门附近的花园。

SEE> mall 购物中心, store 商店, bus·y 忙碌的

ODE> The action or activity of buying goods from shops. – acquisition, investment, buy, order, deal, bargain, property, asset, possession, holding.

1650. short 短 ## 23

[ʃɔːrt]adj.短的；矮的；短期的；短缺的；简略的；粗暴无礼的；[语]短音的adv.缺少；未达到；半中间(打断)；过早地(终止)n.烈酒；电影短片；[电]短路v.(使)短路

  • What are Michael Baker and Jeremy Short’s jobs? 什么是迈克尔·贝克和杰里米的工作吗？
  • This is Michael Baker, and this is Jeremy Short. 这是迈克尔。贝克，这位是杰里米。
  • The days are long and the nights are short. 日子长而夜晚短。

SEE> long 长, though 虽然, in·stead 代替

ODE> Measuring a small distance from end to end. – small, little, tiny, minuscule.

1651. short·ly 不久 ## 4

[’ʃɔːrtli]adv.立刻；马上

  • Shortly afterwards, the police stopped the car and both men were arrested. 不久，警察就截住了那辆车，两个小偷被逮捕。
  • Shortly afterwards, four more policemen arrived and remonstrated with the workmen. 紧接着，4名警察，并规劝工人离开。
  • Shortly after it was launched, the pie committee went to a local inn to celebrate. 下水后不久，馅饼委员会成员们来到当地一家小酒店庆贺。

SEE> af·ter 在之后, lat·er 后来, be·fore 在之前

ODE> In a short time; soon. – soon, directly, presently, quite soon, in a short time, in a little while, in a short while, at any minute, at any moment, at any second, in a minute, in a moment, in a second, in less than no time, in less than no time at all, in next to no time, before long, by and by.

1652. should 应该 ## 31

[ʃəd]aux.应该；可能；应当；竟然；将要

  • He suggested that a double railway-tunnel should be built. 他建议，双铁路隧道应建。
  • He should have known that the police would never allow this sort of thing. 他应该知道，警察绝不会允许这样的事情。
  • Of course, we should arrest him, but as he has a good record, we shall let him off this time.’ 当然，我们应该逮捕他，但因为他有一个良好的记录，我们就放这个时候。”

SEE> must 必须, would 将, not 不

ODE> Used to indicate obligation, duty, or correctness, typically when criticizing someone’s actions. – ought to, should.

1653. shoul·der 肩膀 ## 3

[’ʃoʊldər]n.肩膀；肩部v.承担；扛；肩负；(用肩)推挤

  • Now, dressed in a blue uniform and with a rifle over his shoulder, the prisoner marched boldly up and down in front of the camp. 现在，在一个蓝色的制服，并用步枪在他的肩膀穿着，囚犯大胆进军上下在营地前。
  • Shrugging my shoulders, I began to walk away when, a moment later, he ran after me and thrust the pen into my hands. 耸肩我的肩膀，我开始走开时，片刻之后，他追了上来，把笔塞到我手里。
  • Other experiments showed that her knees and shoulders had a similar sensitivity. 其他实验表明，她的膝盖和肩膀有类似的感觉。

SEE> el·bow 肘部, knee 膝盖, wrist 腕

ODE> The upper joint of each of a person’s arms and the part of the body between this and the neck. – take on, take on oneself, undertake, accept, assume.

1654. shout 叫喊 ## 10

  • Suddenly someone shouted, ’It’s two minutes past twelve! 突然有人喊道：“这是十二时二！
  • In the middle of the night, two boys woke up and began shouting. 在半夜里，两个孩子醒了，大声叫了。
  • The crowd began to shout, but the drunk was unaware of the danger. 人群开始大叫起来，但醉汉却没有意识到危险。

SEE> cry 哭, scream 尖叫, yell

1655. show 节目 ## 25

[ʃoʊ]v.证明；显现；展示；解说；指示；表示；表现；流露；带路；标示；描绘；陈列；证明；上映；出现n.表演；展览；显示；行为；样子；景象；场面；表现

  • Show me your tongue. 让我看看你的舌头。
  • Could you show me another blue dress? 您能再给我看一件蓝色的？
  • Then he showed me the contents of the parcel. 然后，他给我看了包里的内容。

1656. show·er 淋浴 ## 3

[’ʃaʊər]n.淋浴；阵雨；送礼会；(大量)涌泻v.冲(淋浴)；下(阵雨)；倾注

  • Before returning home at night, he took a shower and changed back into his suit. 晚上回家前，他洗个淋浴，重新换上那身黑色西服。
  • The idea never appealed to me very much, but one day, after a heavy shower, I happened to be walking in my garden when I noticed a huge number of snails taking a stroll on some of my prize plants. 该想法没有引起我多大兴趣，但有一天，一个大雨后，我正好走在我的花园时，我注意到在服用一些心爱的花木上慢悠悠蜗牛的一个巨大的数字。
  • One day, he walked into an expensive shop after having been caught in a particularly heavy shower. 有一天，他已经陷入了一个特别的一场大雨后走进了一家高档商店。

SEE> bath·room 浴室, toi·let 厕所, restroom

ODE> A brief and usually light fall of rain, hail, sleet, or snow. – fall, light fall, drizzle, flurry, sprinkling, mizzle.

1657. shut 关闭 ## 3

[ʃʌt]v.关闭；合拢；停止adj.关闭的；停止营业的n.关闭

  • Shut the door, please. 关上了门，请。
  • As soon as he opens the gate from the outside, he comes into the garden and waits until the gate shuts. 当他从外面把门一打开，就走进花园，等着门自动关上。
  • She walked slowly into the hall and at once noticed that all the room doors were open, yet following her regular practice she had shut them before going out. 她慢慢地走进前厅，立即发现所有的房门都敞开着，跟着她经常练习，她才出门就关他们没有。

SEE> tem·po·rar·i·ly 暂时, closed 关闭, clo·sure

ODE> Move (something) into position so as to block an opening; close. – close, draw to, pull to, push to, slam, fasten.

1658. sick 生病 ## 3

  • What is the basis of ‘sick’ humour? 什么是“病态”幽默的基础是什么？
  • It is called ‘sick humour’. 这就是所谓的“病态幽默”。
  • The following example of ‘sick humour’ will enable you to judge for yourself. “病态幽默”的下面的例子将让你自己判断。
