  • She struck the keys too hard and two of the strings were broken. 她在击琴键时用力过猛两根琴弦被打破。
  • The ball struck him so hard that he nearly fell into the water. 球击中了他，使他差点儿落入水中。

SEE> strik·ing 引人注目的, pro·test 抗议, re·sult 结果

ODE> Hit forcibly and deliberately with one’s hand or a weapon or other implement. – bang, beat, hit, pound.

1790. strik·ing 引人注目的 ## 4

[’straɪkɪŋ]adj.显著的；吸引人的动词strike的现在分词形式.

  • you can hear the clock when it is actually striking because microphones are connected to the clock tower. 你可以听到时钟时，它实际上是惊人的，因为麦克风连接到钟楼。
  • Was the vicar pleased that the clock was striking? 在牧师高兴的是，时钟是惊人的？
  • A recent article in a weekly newspaper, for instance, was headed with a striking illustration of a lady in a state of considerable distress, with the caption ‘She was yet another victim, reduced to a screaming wreck’. 在一家周报刊登了最近的一篇文章，例如，与一位女士在相当大的困扰状态的鲜明的例子为首，用文字说明：“她是又一个受害者，一个尖叫击毁”。

SEE> strike 撞击, con·trast 对比, un·u·su·al 异常

ODE> Attracting attention by reason of being unusual, extreme, or prominent. – noticeable, obvious, conspicuous, evident, salient, visible, distinct, prominent, marked, clear-cut, notable, manifest, unmistakable, distinctive, strong.

1791. string 一串 ## 4

[strɪŋ]n.线；弦；一串；字串vt.串起；收紧；悬挂；系；扎；抽去筋；使紧张；使兴奋vi.连成一串

  • She struck the keys too hard and two of the strings were broken. 她在击琴键时用力过猛两根琴弦被打破。
  • Among these I would list string and brown paper, kept by thrifty people when a parcel has been opened, to save buying these two requisites. 其中我想举出线绳和包装纸为例，当包裹已经被打开节俭起来，省得日后购买这两个必要条件。
  • Tie a heavy weight at the end of a long piece of string. 在一根长绳子的端部扎一个重物。

SEE> tri·o , re·cent 最近, in·stance 例子

ODE> Material consisting of threads of cotton, hemp, or other material twisted together to form a thin length. – twine, cord, yarn, thread, strand, fibre.

1792. strong 强大 ## 3

[strɔːŋ]adj.强烈的；坚强的；强壮的；强劲的；强大的；确凿的；有影响力的；坚定的；浓的；浓烈的；结实的；可能性大的；擅长的；大量的；稳固的；坚挺的；景气的；强硬的；重读的

  • She is a strong swimmer and many people feel that she is sure to succeed. 她是一个游泳能手，很多人认为她一定能成功。
  • By this time her legs were beginning to tremble, so she sat down and accepted a cup of very strong tea, while he telephoned the police. 这时她的腿开始发抖，于是坐了下来，非常强的一杯茶，而他打电话报了警。
  • Their humbler followers, such as partridges, have a like power of strong propulsion, but soon tire. 它们的低级同类，如鹧鸪，有一个像功率强劲的推进，但很快就疲劳。

SEE> de·spite 尽管, weak 弱, con·sist·ent

ODE> Having the power to move heavy weights or perform other physically demanding tasks. – powerful, muscular, brawny, well built, powerfully built, strapping, sturdy, hefty, burly, meaty, robust, fit, athletic, vigorous, tough, rugged.

1793. struc·ture 结构 ## 3

[’strʌktʃər]n.结构；构造；建筑物vt.构造；建造；组织

  • In the centre of the hall, there were a number of tall structures which contained coloured lights. 在大厅的中央，有一些含有彩色灯光高层结构。
  • The serious investor needs a proper ‘portfolio’ – a well-planned selection of investments, with a definite structure and a clear aim. 认真的投资者需要一份正规的投资组合表 - 投资的一个精心策划的选择，具有一定的结构和明确的目标。
  • There is no one ‘right’ way to structure a portfolio. 有没有一个“正确”的方式来构建投资组合。

SEE> build·ing 建筑, ex·am·ple 例子, shape 形状

ODE> The arrangement of and relations between the parts or elements of something complex. – construction, form, formation, shape, composition, fabric, anatomy, make-up, constitution.

1794. strug·gle 斗争 ## 7

[’strʌɡl]vi.努力；奋斗；斗争；挣扎n.斗争；竞争；奋斗

  • On arriving at the shore, the girl struggled up the cliff towards the light she had seen. 在到达岸边后，女孩挣扎着朝她看见光悬崖。
  • In the struggle, the strap broke and, with the bag in their possession, both men started running through the trees. 在斗争中，带子断了，在他们身上的袋子，两人开始跑进了树林。
  • The workmen struggled fiercely and one of them lost his temper. 两个工人奋力抗争，其中一个发了脾气。

SEE> in·deed 确实, nev·er·the·less 然而, fight 战斗

ODE> Make forceful or violent efforts to get free of restraint or constriction. – fight, grapple, wrestle, scuffle, brawl, spar, exchange blows, come to blows.

1795. stu·dent 学生 ## 23

[’stuːdnt]n.学生；学者

  • Sophie is a new student. 苏菲是一个新学生。
  • I am a new student. 我是个新学生。
  • Who is the student’s best critic? 谁是学生的最好的评论家？

SEE> teach·er 老师, grad·u·ate , cam·pus

ODE> A person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education. – undergraduate, postgraduate, scholar, tutee.

1796. stu·di·o 工作室 ## 2

[’stuːdioʊ]n.画室；工作室；播音室；制片厂；摄影场

  • We’re now going back to the studio.’ 现在我们回到工作室“。
  • Marine Studio biologists have pointed out that, however intelligent they may be, it is probably a mistake to credit dolphins with any motive of lifesaving. 海洋摄影室的生物学家指出，但是聪明的，他们可能是，它可能是一个错误的信用海豚具有救生的动机。

SEE> re·cord·ing 记录, o·rig·i·nal 最初的, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A room where an artist, photographer, sculptor, etc. works. – workshop, workroom, atelier.

1797. stud·y 研究 ## 24

[’stʌdi]n.研究；学习；学科；书房；(绘画或文学)习作；练习曲；沉思；记忆力…的人；台词记得…的人v.研究；学习；读书；仔细观察；努力

  • Haroun Tazieff, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and deep caves in all parts of the world. 哈龙塔捷耶夫，波兰科学家，已经花了毕生的研究在世界各地的活火山和探洞。
  • Recently the New York Animal Medical Centre made a study of 132 cats over a period of five months. 最近，纽约动物医疗中心历时五个月由132只猫进行研究。
  • Of course, New York is the ideal place for such an interesting study, because there is no shortage of tall buildings. 当然，纽约是进行这种有趣的试验的理想场所，因为有高大建筑物的不乏其人。

SEE> re·search 研究, in·stance 例子, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> The devotion of time and attention to gaining knowledge of an academic subject, especially by means of books. – learning, education, schooling, work, academic work, book work, scholarship, tuition, research.

1798. stuff 东西 ## 2

[stʌf]n.东西；原料；材料n.素质；本质；废物；无用的想法；废话，蠢话vt.塞满；填满

  • How Harry came into the possession of this outlandish stuff makes an interesting story which he is fond of relating. 哈里如何走进拥有这种稀奇古怪的东西做了一个有趣的故事，而且他挺爱。
  • Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books, china, glass, antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals, there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books. 无论它的组成邮票，唱片，书籍，瓷器，玻璃，古董家具，绘画，模型汽车，鸟类标本，玩具动物初版，总有一些东西与它连接的事，找到可以在正确的地方最新加入，以核对参考书中的事实。

SEE> thing 事情, an·y·more , sort 种类

ODE> Matter, material, articles, or activities of a specified or indeterminate kind that are being referred to, indicated, or implied. – material, fabric, cloth, textile.

1799. sub·ject 话题 ## 11

[’sʌbdʒɪkt]n.话题；科目；主题；题材；主观；[语]主语n.实验对象；(君主国)国民adj.易患的；服从的vt.使服从；使隶属；使遭遇

  • What is the favourite subject of conversation in England? 什么是谈话的英格兰最喜欢的科目？
  • It’s our favourite subject of conversation. 这是我们最喜欢谈论的话题。
  • No one can plead ignorance of a subject any longer, for there are countless do-it-yourself publications. 没有人能认罪对象的无知任何更长，有无数的做它自己的刊物。

SEE> top·ic 话题, in·stance 例子, par·tic·u·lar 特定的

ODE> A person or thing that is being discussed, described, or dealt with. – theme, subject matter, topic, issue, question, concern, text, thesis, content, point, motif, thread.

1800. sub·stance 物质 ## 2

[’sʌbstəns]n.实质；物质；财产；内容；重要性

  • Despite the fact that the bottle is tinted a delicate shade of green, an observant visitor would soon notice that it is filled with what looks like a thick, greyish substance. 尽管瓶子是偏绿的淡色，但细心的客人很快就会发现它装的是一种看上去黏稠，颜色发灰的。
  • When the woman shook her head in bewilderment, Harry went on to explain that ‘myrolite’ was a hard, amber-like substance which could be used to remove freckles. 当女人摇了摇在困惑的头，哈里便进一步解释“myrolite”是一场艰苦的，琥珀的东西，可以用来除去雀斑。

SEE> nei·ther 两者都不, sort 种类, in·deed 确实

ODE> A particular kind of matter with uniform properties. – material, matter, stuff, medium, fabric.

1801. suc·cess 成功 ## 4

[sək’ses]n.成功；成就；胜利；成功的人或事

  • Frank smiled when he remembered his hard early years and the long road to success. 弗兰克笑了，当他想起他早年的艰难经历和长期的成功之路。
  • He had included a large number of funny stories in the speech and, of course, it was a great success. 他收录了大量在讲话中有趣的故事，当然的，这是一个巨大的成功。
  • Intoxicated by his success, Harry then asked for perfumed mud. 因为成功而狂喜，哈利又提出要买香泥。

SEE> suc·cess·ful 成功, in·deed 确实, nev·er·the·less 然而

ODE> The accomplishment of an aim or purpose. – favourable outcome, successfulness, favourable result, successful outcome, positive result, victory, triumph.

1802. suc·cess·ful 成功 ## 13

[sək’sesfl]adj.成功的；圆满的

  • While John Gilbert was in hospital, he asked his doctor to tell him whether his operation had been successful, but the doctor refused to do so. 当约翰吉尔伯特住院的时候，他问医生告诉他，他的手术是否成功，但医生拒绝这样做。
  • He asked if Mr. Gilbert’s operation had been successful and the doctor told him that it had been. 他问吉尔伯特先生的手术非常成功，医生告诉他，它一直。
  • A recent case concerns Jane Butlin whose fiancé, John, runs a successful furniture business. 最近的一个案例是关于简Butlin的未婚夫约翰，运行一个成功的家具企业。

SEE> suc·cess 成功, well 好, un·suc·cess·ful 不成功

ODE> Accomplishing a desired aim or result. – victorious, triumphant.

1803. suc·cess·ful·ly 成功地 ## 4

[sək’sesfəli]adv.成功地，圆满地

  • Byrd, successfully flew over the South Pole for the first time. 伯德，成功地飞越南极首次。
  • I had been asked to drive in heavy traffic and had done so successfully. 我被要求在繁忙的马路上开车，有这么成功完成。
  • The mummy successfully survived the operation. 这具木乃伊成功经受了这次手术。

SEE> ef·fec·tive·ly 有效, sub·se·quent·ly , once 一次

ODE> In a way that accomplishes a desired aim or result. –

1804. such 这样 ## 67

[sʌtʃ]adj.这样的；如此的adv.如此地pron.这样的人或事；其本身；这；那

  • He told me that the firm could not afford to pay such large salaries. 他告诉我，公司无法支付如此巨额的工资。
  • The one with the money got such a fright that he dropped the bag. 拿钱的一个吓得魂不附体，他扔下袋子。
  • The men got such a fright that they dropped the bag and ran away. 男人们有这样一个吓得扔下袋子就跑了。

SEE> oth·er 其他, these 这些, in·clude 包括

ODE> Of the type previously mentioned. –

1805. sud·den 突然的 ## 8

[’sʌdn]adj.突然的；出乎意料的n.突发之事

  • So far, not one of them has been struck down by sudden death! 到目前为止，他们没有一个人已经被暴死呢！
  • Acting on a sudden impulse, I collected several dozen, put them in a paper bag, and took them to Robert. 作用于一时冲动，我收集了几十只，装进一只纸袋里，带着去找罗伯特。
  • The sudden movement of the door made it sway slightly and it gave me the impression that it was about to leap out at me. 门的突然运动使它稍微摇摆，它给我的印象是，它是关于我扑过来。

SEE> un·ex·pec·ted 意外, ab·rupt , sud·den·ly 突然地

ODE> Occurring or done quickly and unexpectedly or without warning. – unexpected, unforeseen, unanticipated, unlooked-for, without warning, without notice, not bargained for.

1806. sud·den·ly 突然地 ## 37

[’sʌdənli]adv.突然地

  • Suddenly, she saw a man near a bus stop. 突然，她看到附近的一个公共汽车站一个人。
  • Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them. 突然，他们听到身后有声音。
  • Suddenly, a middle-age lady got on the train and sat opposite Sally. 突然，一个中年妇女上了火车，坐在萨莉的对面。

SEE> fi·nal·ly 终于, when 什么时候, soon 不久

ODE> Quickly and unexpectedly. – immediately, instantaneously, instantly, in an instant, straight away, all of a sudden, at once, all at once, promptly, abruptly, in a trice, swiftly.

1807. suf·fer 遭受 ## 7

[’sʌfər]vt.遭受；忍受；容忍，宽恕，听任；允许，准许vi.受苦；患病；受损失；变差，变糟；处于不利地位

  • For a whole week I did not smoke at all and during this time, my wife suffered terribly. 整整一个星期我根本不抽烟，在此期间，我妻子吃尽了苦头。
  • One cat, Sabrina, fell 32 storeys, yet only suffered from a broken tooth. 一只猫，萨布丽娜，下跌32层高，但只有从断齿遭遇。
  • Acting on the contention that facts are sacred, reporters can cause untold suffering to individuals by publishing details about their private lives. 代理的论点的事实是神圣的，记者可以通过发布关于他们私生活的细节，有时会给当事人造成极大的痛苦。

SEE> suf·fer·ing 痛苦, en·dure , se·vere 严重的

ODE> Experience or be subjected to (something bad or unpleasant) – hardship, distress, misery, wretchedness, adversity, tribulation.

1808. suf·fi·cient 足够的 ## 4

[sə’fɪʃnt]adj.足够的；充分的

  • The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards, as well as in the line of its course, are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings sufficient sustenance and progress. 空气船舶的墙壁直接向上，以及在其过程中的线路中的电流，足以给其巨大的翅膀足够的支撑力和前进的巨大鸟。
  • Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society, one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying sufficient details to enable the thing to be constructed. 想象一下，在一个相当先进的技术社会，人们仍然不具备弹，使其认识的可能性，提供足够的细节，以使事情要构造的效果。
  • Twenty or thirty pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925 would have been sufficient to change the course of world history. 的交给任何世界大国各地的1925年信息二三十页，就足以改变世界历史的进程。

SEE> ad·e·quate 充足, in·suf·fi·cient , nec·es·sar·y 必要

ODE> Enough; adequate. – enough, adequate, plenty of, ample, abundant.

1809. sug·ar 糖 ## 5

[’ʃʊɡər]n.糖，食糖；糖缸；甜言蜜语，阿谀奉承；宝贝，心肝v.使甜；在…上撒糖

  • A pound of sugar. 一斤糖。
  • Do you want any sugar? 你要糖吗？
  • We haven’t got much tea or coffee, and we haven’t got any sugar or jam. 我们没有得到太多茶或咖啡，而我们还没有得到任何糖和果酱。

SEE> juice 果汁, flour 面粉, milk 牛奶

ODE> A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet, consisting essentially of sucrose, and used as a sweetener in food and drink. – darling, sweetheart, dearest, dear.

1810. sug·gest 建议 ## 14

[sə’dʒest]vt.建议；暗示；使想起；表明；要求

  • When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head. 当我建议一些村民进来偷喝掉的，汤普森先生摇摇头。
  • He suggested that a double railway-tunnel should be built. 他建议，双铁路隧道应建。
  • ‘I suggest,’ said the inspector, ’that you are not telling the truth. “我建议，”探长说，“你不说实话。

SEE> in·di·cate 表明, in·deed 确实, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> Put forward for consideration. – propose, put forward, submit, recommend, advocate.

1811. sug·ges·tion 建议 ## 3

[sə’dʒestʃən]n.建议；意见；有…迹象；联想

  • I would not hear of the suggestion and said that I would fix it myself. 我不愿听妻子的建议，说我自己会修。
  • It is difficult for any of us in moments of intense aesthetic experience to resist the suggestion that we are catching a glimpse of a light that shines down to us from a different realm of existence, different and, because the experience is intensely moving, in some way higher. 这是很难在强烈感受到美的时刻，我们中的任何抵抗，我们正在追赶，从另一个世界，不同的和照耀着我们的光的一瞥的建议，因为具有强烈的感染力，在一些一路走高。
  • That sounds a silly suggestion, but that was precisely the idea adopted in some of the early instruments (seismometers) for recording earthquake waves. 这听起来愚蠢的想法，但正是在一些早期的仪器（地震）记录地震波所采用的想法。

SEE> i·de·a 想法, like·wise , no·tion

ODE> An idea or plan put forward for consideration. – proposal, proposition, motion, submission, recommendation.

1812. suit 适合 ## 7

[suːt]n.套装；诉讼；请求v.适合；方便；满足

  • It doesn’t suit me at all. 它完全不适合我。
  • Every morning, he left home dressed in a smart black suit. 每天早晨，他离开家漂亮的黑色西装打扮。
  • Before returning home at night, he took a shower and changed back into his suit. 晚上回家前，他洗个淋浴，重新换上那身黑色西服。

SEE> law·suit , com·plaint 抱怨, in·stance 例子

ODE> A set of outer clothes made of the same fabric and designed to be worn together, typically consisting of a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt. – outfit, set of clothes, costume, ensemble.

1813. suit·case 手提箱 ## 5

[’suːtkeɪs]n.手提箱

  • We’re packing our suitcases. 我们正在收拾手提箱。
  • I left a suitcase on the train to London the other day. 我留在火车上一个手提箱伦敦的一天。
  • When it grew dark, she turned a suitcase into a bed and put the children inside it, covering them with all the clothes she could find. 天黑下来的时候，她把提箱当作小床，把两个孩子放里面，涵盖了他们所有的衣服，她能找到。

SEE> back·pack , lug·gage 行李, bag 袋

ODE> A case with a handle and a hinged lid, used for carrying clothes and other personal possessions. – travelling bag, travel bag, case, grip, valise, overnight case, portmanteau, vanity case, holdall.

1814. sum 和 ## 9

[sʌm]n.金额；总数；要点v.概括；总结；归纳；总计

  • I have been offered a large sum of money to go away, but I am determined to stay here. 我已经提供的一大笔钱让我搬走，但我决定留在这儿。
  • The whole village soon learnt that a large sum of money had been lost. 整个村子很快了解到一大笔钱丢失了。
  • There was a time when the owners of shops and businesses in Chicago had to pay large sums of money to gangsters in return for ‘protection’. 曾经有一个时期，芝加哥的店主和商行的老板们不得不付出的钱给歹徒大笔以换取“保护”的时间。

SEE> a·mount 数量, frac·tion , lump 块

ODE> A particular amount of money. – amount, quantity, volume.

1815. sum·mer 夏天 ## 14

[’sʌmər]n.夏天；夏季adj.夏季的v.度过夏天

  • What’s it like in summer? 它是什么样的夏天？
  • I like spring and summer. 我喜欢春天和夏天。
  • Last summer it was very dry, too. 去年夏天也是干得很。

SEE> win·ter 冬季, spring 春天, be·gin·ning 开始

ODE> The warmest season of the year, in the northern hemisphere from June to August and in the southern hemisphere from December to February. –

1816. sun 太阳 ## 15

[sʌn]n.太阳；阳光；中心人物v.晒太阳

  • There are some clouds in the sky, but the sun is shining. 还有在天空中飘着几朵云，但阳光灿烂。
  • The sun shines every day. 太阳每天照射。
  • The sun rises early and sets late. 太阳升起早，晚集。

SEE> bright 明亮的, sky 天空, moon 月亮

ODE> The star round which the earth orbits. – star.

1817. su·pe·ri·or 优越 ## 3

[suː’pɪriər]n.上级；高手；上标adj.高傲的；上层的；上好的；出众的

  • Even he still lives under the illusion that country life is somehow superior to town life. 即使他也仍存有幻觉，好像乡村生活是某种比城市生活优越。
  • Professor Ronald Bracewell, a leading American radio astronomer, argued in Nature that such a superior civilization, on a visit to our own solar system, may have left an automatic messenger behind to await the possible awakening of an advanced civilization. 罗纳德·布雷斯韦尔教授，领先美国射电天文学家，自然认为，如此优越的文明，对我们自己的太阳能系统进行访问，可能已经离开了自动信使以等待一个先进文明的觉醒。
  • There is no superior ‘they’ in the shape of managements and hotel hierarchies to darken his holiday days. 有和酒店里的等级制度，以加深他的假期天无“人上人”。

SEE> in·fe·ri·or , like·wise , fur·ther·more

ODE> Higher in rank, status, or quality. – higher-ranking, higher-level, senior, higher, higher-up, upper-level, upper, loftier.

1818. sup·ply 供应 ## 10

[sə’plaɪ]n.供应；补给；贮备vt.供应；提供；补充

  • Three factors have caused these fish to grow so large: the warm water round the hot oil pipes under the sea; the plentiful supply of food thrown overboard by the crews on the rigs; the total absence of fishing boats around the oil rigs. 3个因素造成这些鱼能长得这么大：温水轮海下热油管道;由钻井平台工作人员抛到海里食品的供应充足;完全没有钻井平台周围的渔船。
  • Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income. 爸爸妈妈，当然，提供的零花钱正常供应，但叔叔和婶婶总是额外收入来源。
  • It can take as long as eight days to rig up rope ladders and to establish supply bases before a descent can be made into a very deep cave. 它可能需要长达8天时间来搭起绳梯，建立供应基地的下降可以做成一个很深的洞穴里。

SEE> short·age , more·o·ver 此外, pro·vide 提供

ODE> Make (something needed or wanted) available to someone; provide. – give, contribute, provide, furnish, donate, bestow, grant, endow, afford, impart, lay on, come up with, make available, proffer.

1819. sup·port 支撑 ## 11

[sə’pɔːrt]vt.支持；承受；支撑；供养；资助；证实；支援；担任演出嘉宾n.支持；支撑；援助；供养；依据；助演嘉宾

  • The actual figure was made of copper supported by a metal framework which had been especially constructed by Eiffel. 实际数字是由通过已经由艾菲尔特制的金属框架支撑铜。
  • How is the bridge supported? 桥是怎样的支持？
  • Two great towers support four huge cables. 两座巨塔支撑着四个巨大的电缆。

SEE> back·ing , pro·vide 提供, both 两者

ODE> Bear all or part of the weight of; hold up. – hold up, bear, carry, prop up, keep up, bolster up, brace, shore up, underpin, buttress, reinforce.

1820. sup·pose 假设 ## 11

[sə’poʊz]vt.假设；假定；认为；想；应该；让(虚拟语气)vi.推测

  • Let us suppose that a child suddenly crosses the road in front of you. 让我们假设一个小孩子突然在你前面的道路。
  • ‘I suppose it would, but I never catch a later train.’ “我认为可以，但我从来不乘晚一点儿的车。”
  • Everyone went to the funeral, for the ‘ghost’ was none other than Eric Cox, a third brother who was supposed to have died as a young man. 大家都去参加了葬礼，因为那“鬼”不是别人埃里克·考克斯，谁应该已经死亡作为一个年轻人三哥等。

SEE> guess 猜测, in·deed 确实, sure·ly 一定

ODE> Think or assume that something is true or probable but lack proof or certain knowledge. – assume, dare say, take for granted, take as read, presume, expect, take it.

1821. sure 当然 ## 29

[ʃʊr]adj.肯定的；确信的；必定；可靠的；沉着自信的adv.当然；确实地；无疑地；不用客气

  • I’m sure that you need an X-ray, Andy. 我敢肯定，你需要一个X射线，安迪。
  • I’m sure I’ve got a low mark. 我敢肯定，我有一个小标记。
  • I’m sure there’s no one at home. 我敢肯定有没有人在家。

SEE> know 知道, cer·tain·ly 当然, eve·ry·one 大家

ODE> Completely confident that one is right. – certain, positive, convinced, definite, confident, decided, assured, secure, satisfied, persuaded, easy in one’s mind, free from doubt.

1822. sure·ly 一定 ## 4

[’ʃʊrli]adv.无疑；一定；稳当地；显然

  • He has surely set up a record for the thousands of children who dream of evading school. 他无疑建立了数以千计的儿童谁的梦想逃避上学的记录。
  • But the claim made by a local authority to recover the cost of salvaging a sunken pie dish must surely be unique. 但是，地方当局作出打捞沉没的馅饼盘成本的要求肯定是独一无二的。
  • Surely because progress of a particular kind is actually taking place around us and is becoming more and more manifest. 无疑是因为有一种特殊的进步实际上正在我们周围发生，而且变得越来越明显。

SEE> un·doubt·ed·ly , cer·tain·ly 当然, in·deed 确实

ODE> Used to emphasize the speaker’s firm belief that what they are saying is true and often their surprise that there is any doubt of this. – it must be the case that, I believe that, assuredly, without question.

1823. sur·face 表面 ## 20

[’sɜːrfɪs]n.表面；外表；平面adj.表面的；肤浅的vt.在 … 上加表层；使 … 成平面vi.浮到水面；显露；在表面工作

  • If they are not brought to the surface soon they may lose their lives. 如果他们没有带出水面很快他们可能会失去他们的生命。
  • Above the surface of the water, the towers rise to a height of nearly 700 feet. 水的表面上，塔上升到将近700英尺的高度。
  • Nothing of value was found, but the numerous items which were brought to the surface proved to be of great interest. 什么值钱的东西被发现，但打捞出来的众多的物品被证明是极大的兴趣。

SEE> be·neath 在下面, un·der·neath 下, hence 因此

ODE> The outside part or uppermost layer of something. – outside, exterior.

1824. sur·prise 惊奇 ## 23

[sər’praɪz]n.惊奇；惊喜；惊讶；突然vt.使惊奇；使惊喜；突然袭击；惊讶地发现

  • That was a pleasant surprise. 这是一个意外的惊喜。
  • Why was the writer’s aunt surprised? 为什么作家的阿姨感到惊讶吗？
  • To their surprise, the precious parcel was full of stones and sand! 令他们吃惊的是，珍贵的包裹里面装的全是石头和沙子！

SEE> sur·pris·ing 令人吃惊的, un·ex·pec·ted 意外, sur·prised 惊讶

ODE> An unexpected or astonishing event, fact, etc. – shock, bolt from of the blue, bolt out of the blue, thunderbolt, bombshell, revelation, source of amazement, rude awakening, eye-opener.

1825. sur·prised 惊讶 ## 3

[sər’praɪzd]adj.惊讶的，吃惊的，惊奇的动词surprise的过去式和过去分词.

  • Dan was most surprised when he heard the news. 丹后，惊奇万分，当他听到这个消息。
  • He was so surprised at being discovered that he did not even try to run away. 他是如此惊讶于被发现，他甚至没有试图逃跑。
  • Parents would be greatly surprised and deeply touched if they realized how much belief their children usually have in their character and infallibility, and how much this faith means to a child. 家长会大为吃惊，如果他们意识到有多少相信他们的孩子通常在他们的品行和绝对正确，又有多少这种信念的手段对孩子深深打动了。

SEE> pleased 高兴, dis·ap·point·ed 失望, impressed 印象深刻

ODE> Feeling or showing surprise. –

1826. sur·pris·ing 令人吃惊的 ## 2

[sər’praɪzɪŋ]adj.令人惊讶的，出人意料的动词surprise的现在分词.

  • The most surprising thing about it, however, is that it can land anywhere: on snow, water, or even on a ploughed field. 它最令人惊奇的事情，但问题在于，它可以在任何地方降落：雪地上，水面上，甚至耕过的田里。
  • The noise pollution survey revealed a rather surprising and possibly amusing old-fashioned source of noise. 噪音污染调查显示噪声相当令人惊讶，并可能会引人发笑的老式源。

SEE> sur·prise 惊奇, un·ex·pec·ted 意外, sur·prised 惊讶

ODE> Causing surprise; unexpected. –

1827. sur·round 环绕 ## 9

[sə’raʊnd]vt.包围；环绕n.环绕物

  • I live in a very old town which is surrounded by beautiful woods. 我住在一个古老的小镇上被美丽的树林环绕。
  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。
  • It threatened to surround him completely, but Tazieff managed to escape just in time. 它威胁要完全包围了他，但塔捷耶夫设法逃离了。

SEE> sur·round·ing 周围, in·cor·po·rate , like·wise

ODE> Be all round (someone or something) – neighbouring, nearby, near, neighbourhood, local.

1828. sur·vey 调查 ## 4

[’sɜːrveɪ]n.问卷；测量；调查；纵览；视察v.调查；审视；研究；测量；勘定；环视

  • Then in 1989, twenty-six years after the crash, the plane was accidentally rediscovered in an aerial survey of the island. 然后，在1989年，崩溃26年后，飞机却意外地在海岛的航测重新发现。
  • A recent survey of the effects of noise revealed (surprisingly?) 最近一个有关噪音的影响进行的调查显示（令人吃惊地）
  • The survey revealed a large number of sources of noise that we really dislike. 这个调查揭示了大量的噪声源，我们真的不喜欢。

SEE> stud·y 研究, re·port 报告, sug·gest 建议

ODE> Look closely at or examine (someone or something) – look at, look over, take a look at, observe, view, contemplate, regard, see, gaze at, stare at, eye, get a bird’s-eye view of.

1829. sur·vive 幸存 ## 6

[sər’vaɪv]vt.幸免于难；存活；艰难度过；比 … 活得长vi.活着；继续存在

  • The mummy successfully survived the operation. 这具木乃伊成功经受了这次手术。
  • A cat’s ability to survive falls is based on fact. 猫的生存瀑布能力是基于事实。
  • I am especially proud of it, not only because it has survived several severe winters, but because it occasionally produces luscious peaches. 我感到特别自豪的是，不仅是因为它已经存活几个寒冬，但因为它有时甜美的桃子。

SEE> a·ble 能够, thrive , in·deed 确实

ODE> Continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship. – remain alive, live, sustain oneself, cling to life, pull through, get through, hold on, hold out, make it, keep body and soul together.

1830. sus·pect 怀疑 ## 3

[sə’spekt]v.怀疑；猜想n.嫌疑犯adj.可疑的；不可信的

  • No one suspected that there might be someone else on the farm who had never been seen. 没有人怀疑，有可能是别人对谁那会儿农场。
  • It was Hart who created the basic formula of the Western film, and devised the protagonist he played in every film he made, the good-bad man, the accidental-noble outlaw, or the honest-but-framed cowboy, or the sheriff made suspect by vicious gossip; in short, the individual in conflict with himself and his frontier environment. 这是哈特谁创造了西部电影的基本公式，并设计了他，他拍的电影几乎扮演主角，好的坏的男人，意外贵金属逃犯，诚实的，但是，遭陷害的牛仔或司法官。因流言蜚语怀疑;总之，在与他自己和他的拓荒环境相矛盾的人物。
  • Intermittent tap-water supplies should be regarded as particularly suspect. 间歇自来水应该被视为是非常可疑的。

SEE> ar·rest 逮捕, ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, al·leged

ODE> Have an idea or impression of the existence, presence, or truth of (something) without certain proof. – have a suspicion, have a feeling, feel, be inclined to think, fancy, reckon, guess, surmise, conjecture, think, think it likely, think it probable, have a sneaking feeling, have a hunch.

1831. sus·pi·cious 可疑 ## 2

[sə’spɪʃəs]adj.可疑的；多疑的

  • Though a little suspicious this time, the policeman gave him the same answer. 虽然这次有点疑心，警察给了他同样的回答。
  • Most cats remain suspicious of humans all their lives. 大多数猫总能引起人们的所有他们的生活。

SEE> un·a·ware , ap·par·ent·ly 显然地, sus·pect 怀疑

ODE> Having or showing a cautious distrust of someone or something. – doubtful, unsure, dubious, wary, chary, sceptical, distrustful, mistrustful, disbelieving, having reservations, apprehensive, cynical, jaundiced.

1832. swal·low 吞咽 ## 2

[’swɑːloʊ]n.燕子；吞咽；一次吞咽的量v.忍受；吞下；咽下；轻信；不流露感情；收回

  • Tommy had already swallowed them! 汤米已经咽了下去！
  • The swallow shares the virtues of both schools in highest measure. 燕子股最高测量两所学校的美德。

SEE> in·ci·den·tal·ly , un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, last·ly

ODE> Cause or allow (something, especially food or drink) to pass down the throat. – eat, gulp down, consume, devour, eat up, put away, gobble, gobble up, bolt, bolt down, wolf down, stuff down, gorge oneself on, feast on, polish off.

1833. sweep 扫 ## 4

[swiːp]v.打扫；掠过；扫视；席卷；全胜；清除n.清扫；连绵一片；席卷；掠过；范围；搜寻；(竞赛中)全胜；赌金

  • Then sweep the floor. 然后扫地。
  • A gust of wind swept the bed off the roof and sent it crashing into the courtyard below. 一阵风席卷床从屋顶上，并把它摔碎在下面的院子里。
  • She was wearing a full-length skirt which swept the ground. 她穿着一件拖地全长裙子。

SEE> tri·umph , head·ing , vic·to·ry 胜利

ODE> Clean (an area) by brushing away dirt or litter. – brush, clean, scrub, wipe, mop, dust, scour, scrape, rake, buff.

1834. sweet 甜 ## 8

[swiːt]adj.甜的；芳香的；悦耳的；漂亮的n.甜食；糖

  • The list included most of the things Hugh loves: butter, potatoes, rice, beer, milk, chocolate, and sweets. 单子上的大多数食物都是休喜欢吃的：黄油，土豆，米饭，啤酒，牛奶，巧克力和糖果。
  • It contained five large bars of chocolate and three bags of sweets! 里面装了5个大块巧克力和3袋糖果！
  • What was ‘sweet as honey’ and why? 什么是“甜如蜜”，为什么？

SEE> love·ly 可爱, de·li·cious , spic·y 辣

ODE> Having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar or honey; not salt, sour, or bitter. – sugary, sweetened, saccharine.

1835. swim 游泳 ## 14

[swɪm]v.游泳n.游泳

  • He is swimming across the river. 他游泳渡河。
  • Then she swam to the shore after spending the whole night in the water. 然后，她游到岸边水中整整一夜之后。
  • Debbie Hart is going to swim across the English Channel tomorrow. 黛比·哈特准备横渡英吉利海峡游泳的明天。

SEE> swim·ming 游泳的, swimmer , walk 走

ODE> Propel the body through water by using the limbs, or (in the case of a fish or other aquatic animal) by using fins, tail, or other bodily movement. – bathe, go swimming, take a dip, dip, splash around.

1836. swim·ming 游泳的 ## 3

[’swɪmɪŋ]n.游泳adj.会游泳的；游泳的动词swim的现在分词.

  • As a great many people will be visiting the country, the government will be building new hotels, an immense stadium, and a new Olympic-standard swimming pool. 作为一个伟大的很多人将访问的国家，政府准备建造一些新的饭店，一个大型体育场和一个新的奥运会标准游泳池。
  • At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles, children become expert at holding their breath under water even before they can walk. 在一个特别的游泳池在洛杉矶，孩子成为下他们能走甚至在水下屏住呼吸了专家。
  • Sometimes we go upstream to a favourite backwater, sometimes we have our party at the boathouse, which a predecessor of ours at the farm built in the meadow hard by the deepest pool for swimming and diving. 有时候，我们去上游喜爱的回，有时我们有我们的船库党，在农场我们的前身是建在草地硬专供游泳，跳水的深水池。

SEE> swim 游泳, pool 水池, div·ing

ODE> The sport or activity of propelling oneself through water using the limbs. –

1837. sym·bol 符号 ## 4

[’sɪmbl]n.符号；象征；标志

  • Ever since then, the great monument has been a symbol of liberty for the millions of people who have passed through New York Harbour to make their homes in America. 从那时起，这座伟大的纪念碑一直是自由的数以百万计的人谁已通过纽约港进入他们在美国的千家万户的象征。
  • What is the importance of the dots, lines, and symbols engraved on stone, bones and ivory? 什么是点，线，并刻在石头，骨头和象牙符号的重要性？
  • Historians have long been puzzled by dots, lines and symbols which have been engraved on walls, bones, and the ivory tusks of mammoths. 历史学家们长久以来已被刻在墙壁上，骨头，和猛犸象的象牙点，线和符号感到困惑不解。

SEE> ex·am·ple 例子, hence 因此, in·deed 确实

ODE> A mark or character used as a conventional representation of an object, function, or process, e.g. the letter or letters standing for a chemical element or a character in musical notation. – sign, character, mark, letter, hieroglyph, ideogram.

1838. sys·tem 系统 ## 16

[’sɪstəm]n.系统；体系；身体；制度

  • The city was even equipped with a drainage system, for a great many clay pipes were found beneath the narrow streets. 在这座城市甚至还敷设了排水系统，为一个伟大的许多陶土制的管道被发现在狭窄的街道下面。
  • This ran on an ‘operating system’ called DOS, produced by a then small company named Microsoft. 这种电脑采用了所谓的DOS的“操作系统”上，由当时规模不大的微软公司生产的。
  • Of course, Leon Bagrit could not possibly have foreseen the development of the Internet, the worldwide system that enables us to communicate instantly with anyone in any part of the world by using computers linked to telephone networks. 当然，巴格瑞特不可能预见到互联网的发展，世界范围内的系统，使我们能够立即与任何人在世界任何地方通过连接到电话网络上的计算机进行通信。

SEE> which 哪一个, ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子

ODE> A set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network; a complex whole. – structure, organization, order, arrangement, complex, apparatus, network.

1839. ta·ble 桌子 ## 18

[’teɪbl]n.桌子；台子；餐桌；一桌人；表格；目录；（竞赛的）排名榜vt.搁置；将 … 放于桌上；提交讨论；列入表中adj.桌子的

  • There is a table in the middle of the room. 有一个在屋子中间一张桌子。
  • There is a bottle on the table. 有在桌子上的瓶子。
  • There is a cup on the table, too. 还有桌子上还有一只杯子。

SEE> sit 坐, put 放, in·stead 代替

ODE> A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working at. – bench, board, work surface, worktop, counter, desk, bar, buffet, stand, workbench, worktable, top, horizontal surface, surface.

1840. take 拿取 ## 111

[teɪk]v.拿；取；执行；需要；接受；理解；修(课程)；花费；吃（喝）；认为；搭乘n.拿取；取得物

  • Their father takes them to school every day. 他们的父亲每天送他们上学。
  • Does Jill take the key to the front door? 吉尔有没有带钥匙的前门？
  • Then he put his hand into his pocket, and took out a phrasebook. 然后，他把他的手伸进口袋，掏出了一本常用语。

SEE> give 给, come 来, should 应该

ODE> Lay hold of (something) with one’s hands; reach for and hold. – lay hold of, take hold of, get hold of, get into one’s hands.

1841. talk 谈论 ## 20

[tɔːk]v.交谈；商讨；演讲；阐述；劝服n.谈话；会谈；讨论；讲话；空谈

  • Which John Smith does Graham Turner think he is talking to? 约翰。史密斯格雷厄姆特纳以为他在跟谁说话？
  • I don’t know what you’re talking about. 我不知道你在说什么。
  • They were talking loudly. 私人谈话。

SEE> tell 告诉, come 来, why 为什么

ODE> Speak in order to give information or express ideas or feelings; converse or communicate by spoken words. – speak, give voice, chat.

1842. tall 高 ## 7

[tɔːl]adj.高的

  • The tunnel would be well-ventilated if tall chimneys were built above sea level. 这条隧道的通风良好，如果高大的烟囱被海拔建。
  • By 1884, a statue which was 151 feet tall had been erected in Paris. 到1884年，达151英尺高的雕像已竖立在巴黎。
  • Of course, New York is the ideal place for such an interesting study, because there is no shortage of tall buildings. 当然，纽约是进行这种有趣的试验的理想场所，因为有高大建筑物的不乏其人。

SEE> height 高度, thick 厚, hand·some

ODE> Of great or more than average height, especially (with reference to an object) relative to width. – big, high, large, huge, towering.

1843. tank 罐 ## 3

[tæŋk]n.箱；罐；槽；贮水池；坦克vt.把 … 储于槽中

  • We felt sure that sooner or later a stone would rip a hole in our petrol tank or damage the engine. 我们想念迟早石头就砸开一个窟窿，我们的油箱或损坏发动机。
  • One young calf especially enjoyed raising a turtle to the surface with his snout and then shoving him across the tank like an aquaplane. 一只小海豚特别喜欢养乌龟用鼻子表面，然后顺手把他从水池像滑水板。
  • Eventually the turtle has been butted all the way down to the floor of the tank. 最后，海龟已对接一路下跌至箱底。

SEE> in·side 内, at·tached 附, put 放

ODE> A large receptacle or storage chamber, especially for liquid or gas. – container, receptacle, vat, cistern, barrel, storage chamber, repository, reservoir, holder, basin.

1844. tap 轻拍 ## 7

[tæp]n.龙头；塞子；窃听n.轻拍；轻敲；鞋掌v.轻拍；轻击；补鞋掌；选择v.开发；利用；索要；装龙头；窃听

  • As soon as I tap on the window, you must stop within five feet.’ 只要我一敲车窗，你必须在五英尺内停止“。
  • I continued driving and after some time, the examiner tapped loudly. 我继续往前开了一段时间后，主考人砰砰地敲。
  • They located the right chimney by tapping at the walls and listening for the man’s cries. 他们位于右烟囱通过在墙壁，发现该男子的哭声。

SEE> in·stance 例子, turn 转动, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A device by which a flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container can be controlled. – valve, spout, stopcock, cock, spile.

1845. tape 带子 ## 3

[teɪp]n.磁带；胶布；终点v.录音；录像；用胶布粘；用绳子捆绑；用卷尺测量

  • I bound the base of the tree with sticky tape, making it impossible for the ants to reach the aphids. 我绑定的树的根部用胶带，使它不可能为蚂蚁接近蚜虫。
  • The tape was so sticky that they did not dare to cross it. 胶带极粘，蚂蚁不敢从上面爬过。
  • I even went out at midnight with a torch and noted with satisfaction (and surprise) that the ants were still swarming around the sticky tape without being able to do anything about it. 我甚至出去半夜用火炬，满意地（同时惊奇地）发现那些蚂蚁还围着胶带团团转，却无法做任何事情地指出。

ODE> A narrow strip of material, typically used to hold or fasten something. – band, strip, strap, belt, binding, string, ribbon, stripe, braid.

1846. task 任务 ## 6

[tæsk]n.任务；工作vt.交给某人（任务)；使做艰苦的工作

  • But the historian attempting to reconstruct the distant past is always faced with a difficult task. 但是，历史学家企图重现遥远的过去可是一项艰巨的任务。
  • Exploring really deep caves is not a task for the Sunday afternoon rambler. 探测非常深的洞穴不是那些在星期日下午漫步的任务。
  • Armed with the right tools and materials, newlyweds gaily embark on the task of decorating their own homes. 使用正确的工具及材料，兴高采烈地踏上新婚夫妇布置新房的任务。

SEE> dif·fi·cult 困难的, un·der·tak·ing , ac·com·plish

ODE> A piece of work to be done or undertaken. – job, duty, chore, charge, labour, piece of work, piece of business, assignment, function, commission, mission, engagement, occupation, undertaking, exercise, business, responsibility, errand, detail, endeavour, enterprise, venture, quest, problem, burden.

1847. taste 味道 ## 2

[teɪst]n.味觉；味道；尝试；品味；爱好v.品尝；有 … 味道的；体验

  • Much as we may pride ourselves on our good taste, we are no longer free to choose the things we want, for advertising exerts a subtle influence on us. 尽管我们可以对我们的好味道感到自豪，我们不再自由选择我们想要的东西，广告发挥对我们有潜移默化的影响。
  • The great advantage of taking medicine is that it makes no demands on the taker beyond that of putting up for a moment with a disgusting taste, and that is what all patients demand of their doctors – to be cured at no inconvenience to themselves. 服药的最大优点是它使得在超出忍受一下令人作呕的味道一时的接受者没有需求，而这正是所有患者要求医生的 - 在没有任何不便，自己被治愈。

SEE> fla·vor , smell 闻, in·deed 确实

ODE> The sensation of flavour perceived in the mouth and throat on contact with a substance. – flavour, savour, relish, tang, smack.

1848. tax·i 出租车 ## 4

[’tæksi]n.出租车v.用出租车运送；乘计程车；（飞机）滑行

  • Captain Ben Fawcett has bought an unusual taxi and has begun a new service. 弗西特机长买了一个不寻常的出租汽车，并开始了新的服务。
  • The ‘taxi’ is a small Swiss aeroplane called a ‘Pilatus Porter’. “出租汽车”是叫“皮勒特斯波特”小瑞士飞机。
  • Roy Trenton used to drive a taxi. 罗伊特伦顿用来开出租车。

SEE> cab , bus 公共汽车, driv·er 司机

ODE> A motor vehicle licensed to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare and typically fitted with a taximeter. – taxi, cab, taxi cab, minicab, hackney cab.

1849. tea 茶 ## 16

[tiː]n.茶；茶叶；茶树；茶点

  • A quarter of a pound of tea. 茶一斤的四分之一。
  • How do you know Sam doesn’t make the tea very often? 你怎么知道萨姆不会使茶叶往往？
  • Can you make the tea, Sam? 你可以使茶，山姆？

SEE> cof·fee 咖啡, lunch 午餐, drink 喝

ODE> A hot drink made by infusing the dried crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water. – drink.

1850. teach 教 ## 7

[tiːtʃ]vt.教；教导；教授；教训vi.给予指导

  • A friendly waiter taught me a few words of Italian. 一位好客的服务员教了我意大利的几句话。
  • How long has Mr. Page been teaching? 有多久佩奇一直教？
  • It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years. 这是一个奇怪的巧合，他退休的前一天，佩奇将已经教了一满40年。

SEE> learn 学习, teach·ing 教学, les·son 课

ODE> Impart knowledge to or instruct (someone) as to how to do something. – educate, instruct, school, tutor, give lessons to, coach, train, upskill, ground, enlighten, illuminate, verse, edify, prepare, din something into, indoctrinate, brainwash.

1851. teach·er 老师 ## 3

[’tiːtʃər]n.教师

  • Are you a teacher? 你是老师吗？
  • My teacher never spoke English like that! 我的老师从来不那样讲英语！
  • In the light of this statement, teachers live by selling knowledge, philosophers by selling wisdom and priests by selling spiritual comfort. 根据这种说法的光，教师靠靠卖精神安慰卖知识，哲学家靠卖智慧和教士。

SEE> stu·dent 学生, teach·ing 教学, class·room 教室

ODE> A person who teaches, especially in a school. – educator, tutor, instructor, pedagogue, schoolteacher, schoolmaster, schoolmistress, master, mistress, governess, educationalist, educationist.

1852. team 团队 ## 4

[tiːm]n.队；组v.使相配；使合作；结成一队adj.团队的

  • What did the team find? 什么球队找到？
  • An American team explored a temple which stands in an ancient city on the promontory of Ayia Irini. 一个美国考古队矗立在古城的阿依Irini酒店的海角寺庙。
  • Fortunately for them, the Bank of England has a team called Mutilated Ladies which deals with claims from people who fed their money to a machine or to their dog. 幸运的是，英国央行有一个队叫残钞鉴别其与谁把钱塞进机器或塞给狗的人提出的索赔要求。

SEE> squad , first 第一, same 相同

ODE> A group of players forming one side in a competitive game or sport. – group, squad, side, band, bunch, company, party, gang, selection, crew, troupe, set, line-up, array.

1853. tear 眼泪 ## 7

[ter]vt.撕掉；扯下；扰乱vi.流泪；撕破n.眼泪；（撕破的）洞或裂缝；撕扯

  • In August, she was struck by a very heavy storm during which her rudder was torn away. 在8月，她被一场特大风暴，在此期间她舵撕掉袭击。
  • This greatly reduced the speed of the ship, for there was a danger that if she travelled too quickly, this rudder would be torn away as well. 这大大降低了船的速度，因为有一种危险是，如果它走得太快，这个舵也会被刮走为好。
  • In the same way, a Russian might fail to see anything amusing in a joke which would make an Englishman laugh to tears. 以同样的方式，一个俄国人可能看不到任何东西的笑话这将使英国人笑出泪来会哄。

SEE> ri·ot , a·part 分开, break 打破

ODE> Pull (something) apart or to pieces with force. – rip up, rip in two, pull apart, pull to pieces, shred.

1854. tech·nique 技术 ## 2

[tek’niːk]n.技术；技巧；技能

  • Two main techniques have been used for training elephants, which we may call respectively the tough and the gentle. 两种主要的方法已被用于训练大象，我们分别称之为强硬法和温柔。
  • Granted, a snobbery of camping itself, based upon equipment and techniques, already exists; but it is of a kind that, if he meets it, he can readily understand and deal with. 诚然，露营本身的势利，基于设备和技术，已经存在;但它是一种，如果他满足，他可以很容易地理解和处理的。

SEE> meth·od 方法, ex·am·ple 例子, in·stance 例子

ODE> A way of carrying out a particular task, especially the execution or performance of an artistic work or a scientific procedure. – skill, skilfulness, ability, capability, proficiency, expertise, expertness, mastery, talent, genius, artistry, art, craftsmanship, craft.

1855. tech·nol·o·gy 技术 ## 3

[tek’nɑːlədʒi]n.技术；工艺；工艺学

  • New technology has also made its own contribution to noise. 新技术也作出了自己的贡献噪音。
  • Technology trends may push Silicon Valley back to the future. 技术的发展趋势有可能把硅谷重新推向未来。
  • Carver Mead, a pioneer in integrated circuits and a professor of computer science at the California Institute of Technology, notes there are now workstations that enable engineers to design, test and produce chips right on their desks, much the way an editor creates a newsletter on a Macintosh. 米德 - 集成电路的一位先驱，加州技术学院的计算机科学教授，注意到，现在的工作站，使工程师可以设计，试验和生产芯片在他们的办公桌，就像一位编辑器上创建一个简讯在Macintosh。

SEE> technological , in·no·va·tion , ad·vanced 高级的

ODE> The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry. – equipment, apparatus, hardware, plant, mechanism, gear, tackle, instruments, tools, gadgetry, technology.

1856. tel·e·phone 电话 ## 30

[’telɪfoʊn]n.电话v.打电话

  • Can you remember the doctor’s telephone number? 你还记得医生的电话号码吗？
  • How did Pauline answer the telephone at nine o’clock? 波林是如何接听电话九点钟？
  • He telephoned me four times yesterday and three times the day before yesterday. 他四次，昨天和前天三次打电话给我。

SEE> phone 电话, call 呼叫, in·stance 例子

ODE> A system for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals. – phone, handset, receiver.

1857. tel·e·vi·sion 电视 ## 13

[’telɪvɪʒn]n.电视机；电视节目；电视行业

  • There is a television in the room. 有在房间里的电视机。
  • The television is near the window. 电视机靠近窗子。
  • There are some magazines on the television. 有在电视上一些杂志。

SEE> TV 电视, broad·cast 广播, chan·nel 渠道

ODE> A system for converting visual images (with sound) into electrical signals, transmitting them by radio or other means, and displaying them electronically on a screen. – TV, television set.

1858. tell 告诉 ## 92

[tel]v.告诉；吩咐；讲述；表达；辨别；判断；泄露；告发；产生效果

  • To tell you the truth, Mrs. Bird, I don’t like chicken either! 说句实话，伯德夫人，我也不喜欢鸡！
  • ‘Can you tell me the way to King Street, please?’ “你能告诉我到国王街，好吗？”
  • But to tell you the truth, you need a new car! 不过说实话，你需要一辆新车！

SEE> know 知道, why 为什么, ask 问

ODE> Communicate information to someone in spoken or written words. – inform, let know, notify, apprise, make aware, mention something to, acquaint with, advise, put in the picture, brief, fill in, break the news to.

1859. tem·per·a·ture 温度 ## 5

[’temprətʃər]n.气温；体温；温度；发烧

  • Does he have a temperature, doctor? 他有一个温度，医生？
  • This time, he managed to climb into the mouth of Kituro so that he could take photographs and measure temperatures. 这一次，他设法爬进基图罗口，以便能拍摄照片和测试温度。
  • The temperature drops to -30˚, and very few people attempt to cross the Pass. 气温下降到-30˚，只有极少数人试图跨越山口。

SEE> heat 热, cool 凉爽的, sur·face 表面

ODE> The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object, especially as expressed according to a comparative scale and shown by a thermometer or perceived by touch. – meteorological conditions, atmospheric conditions, meteorology, climate.

1860. tem·po·rar·i·ly 暂时 ## 3

[’temprərəli]adv.暂时地；临时地

  • To make matters worse, the room is rather small, so I have temporarily put my books on the floor. 更糟的是，房间非常小，所以我暂时把书放在了地板上。
  • Only an exceptionally heavy snowfall might temporarily dislocate railway services. 只有非同寻常的大雪才可能暂时打乱铁路运行。
  • He loved to be told that one of his imaginary products was temporarily out of stock and he would faithfully promise to call again at some future date, but of course he never did. 他爱听售货员说他想像的那种东西暂时脱销，于是他就煞有介事地许诺改天再来打电话，当然，他从来没有。

SEE> per·ma·nent·ly 永久性, ef·fec·tive·ly 有效, shut 关闭

ODE> For a limited period of time; not permanently. – for the time being, for the moment, for now, for the present, in the interim, for the nonce, for the meantime, in the meantime, in the meanwhile.

1861. ten 十 ## 11

[ten]num.十

  • It is ten o’clock. 现在是十点钟。
  • You must be home at half past ten. 你必须回家十点半。
  • That clock’s ten minutes slow. 那时钟的慢了10分钟。

SEE> twen·ty 二十, fif·teen 十五, e·lev·en 十一

ODE> Equivalent to the product of five and two; one more than nine; 10. – decade.

1862. tend 趋向 ## 8

[tend]v.趋向；易于；朝向v.照料；照管

  • Some wives tend to believe that their husbands are infinitely resourceful and can fix anything. 妻子常常认为她们的丈夫无比聪明能干。
  • People tend to amass possessions, sometimes without being aware of doing so. 人们喜欢收藏东西，有时并没有意识到这样做的。
  • Except for one or two places such as Zermatt and Chamonix, which had rapidly become popular, Alpine villages tended to be impoverished settlements cut off from civilization by the high mountains. 除了一个两个地方，比如采尔马特和夏蒙尼，这已经迅速普及，高山小村几乎被的穷乡僻壤高山从文明切断。

SEE> pre·fer 更喜欢, gen·er·al·ly 通常, typ·i·cal·ly 一般

ODE> Regularly or frequently behave in a particular way or have a certain characteristic. – be inclined, be apt, be disposed, be prone, be liable, have a tendency, show a tendency, be likely, have a propensity.

1863. tent 帐篷 ## 8

[tent]n.帐篷v.住帐篷；宿营

  • Late in the afternoon, the boys put up their tent in the middle of a field. 傍晚时分，孩子们搭起了帐篷在野外的中间。
  • The boys felt tired so they put out the fire and crept into their tent. 于是他们把火扑灭，钻进了帐篷男孩感到累了。
  • The tent was full of water! 帐篷里全是水！

SEE> in·side 内, out·side 外面, be·side 在旁边

ODE> A portable shelter made of cloth, supported by one or more poles and stretched tight by cords or loops attached to pegs driven into the ground. – camp, military camp, bivouac, cantonment, barracks, base, station, post.

1864. term 术语 ## 5

[tɜːrm]n.学期；术语；条件；条款；期限；名词vt.把 … 称为

  • Though it may be possible to measure the value of material goods in terms of money, it is extremely difficult to estimate the true value of the services which people perform for us. 虽然有可能来衡量物质产品的在金钱方面的价值，这是非常难以估算别人为我们所提供的服务的真正价值。
  • This is a major achievement because, in relative terms, planets are very small and do not emit light. 这是一个重大的成就，因为相对来说，行星很小，而且也不发光。
  • ‘Rest’, in terms of muscle relaxation and so on, can be achieved by a brief period lying, or even sitting down. “休息”，使肌肉得到放松的条件等，可以通过稍微躺一躺，甚至坐一坐来实现的。

SEE> terms , means 手段, mean·ing 含义

ODE> A word or phrase used to describe a thing or to express a concept, especially in a particular kind of language or branch of study. – word, expression, phrase, turn of phrase, idiom, locution.

1865. ter·ri·ble 可怕 ## 8

[’terəbl]adj.可怕的；极度的；糟糕的

  • The boss’s handwriting is terrible! 老板的书写太糟糕了！
  • I have a terrible toothache. 我牙疼得厉害。
  • If anyone ever asks her how old she is, she always answers, ‘Darling, it must be terrible to be grown up!’ 如果有人问起她有多大年纪，她总是回答：“亲爱的，真可怕长大了！”

SEE> hor·ri·ble , aw·ful 糟糕的, dread·ful

ODE> Extremely bad or serious. – dreadful, awful, appalling, horrific, horrifying, horrible, horrendous, atrocious, abominable, abhorrent, frightful, fearful, shocking, hideous, ghastly, grim, dire, hateful, unspeakable, gruesome, monstrous, sickening, heinous, vile.

1866. ter·ri·bly 可怕 ## 3

[’terəbli]adv.可怕地；非常地；很

  • It’s terribly dry. 它的可怕干燥。
  • During the night, it got terribly cold. 在夜里，天冷得厉害。
  • For a whole week I did not smoke at all and during this time, my wife suffered terribly. 整整一个星期我根本不抽烟，在此期间，我妻子吃尽了苦头。

SEE> in·cred·i·bly , ob·vi·ous·ly 显然, quite 相当

ODE> Very; extremely. – very, extremely, awfully, dreadfully, really, frightfully, exceptionally, exceedingly, immensely, thoroughly, uncommonly, remarkably, eminently, extraordinarily, incredibly, most, positively, decidedly, downright.

1867. test 测试 ## 15

[test]n.考验；试验；测试vt.试验；测试；接受测验

  • French tests are awful, aren’t they? 法语太可怕了，不是吗？
  • Do you think that the writer passed his driving test? 你认为作家通过驾驶考试？
  • I was being tested for a driving licence for the third time. 我正在测试的第三次驾驶执照。

SEE> first 第一, on·ly 只有, next 下一个

ODE> A procedure intended to establish the quality, performance, or reliability of something, especially before it is taken into widespread use. – trial, experiment, pilot study, try-out.

1868. text 文本 ## 3

[tekst]n.正文；文本；课文；原文v.发短信

  • The word ‘justice’ is given two different meanings in the text. 这个词“正义”被赋予在文本两种不同的含义。
  • On turning eagerly to the text, one learns that the lady was a typist who found the sound of office typewriters worried her more and more until eventually she had to go into a mental hospital. 在热切地转向文字，便知道这女子是谁，办公室打字机的声音打字员担心她的多，直到最后她不得不进入精神病院。
  • What does this text describe? 这是什么文字描述？

SEE> doc·u·ment 文献, read 读, cop·y 副本

ODE> A book or other written or printed work, regarded in terms of its content rather than its physical form. – written work, book, work, printed work, narrative.

1869. than 比 ## 93

[ðən]conj.比；除…外（用于other等之后）；与其…（用于 rather等之后）；一…就（用于 no sooner等之后） prep.比

  • It’s smaller than the blue one. 它比那件蓝色的小。
  • No, less than that. 不，再少一些。
  • This model’s less expensive than that one. 这种模式比那种要便宜些。

SEE> more 更多, less 减, much 许多

ODE> Used to introduce the second element in a comparison. –

1870. thank 谢谢 ## 24

[θæŋk]v.感谢；谢谢；责怪n.谢意；感谢

  • Thank you very much. 非常感谢你。
  • Thank you, sir. 谢谢你，先生。
  • Thank you very much. 非常感谢你。

SEE> glad 高兴的, wish 希望, thank·ful

ODE> Express gratitude to (someone), especially by saying ‘Thank you’ – express gratitude to, express one’s gratitude to, express one’s thanks to, extend thanks to, offer thanks to, say thank you to, show appreciation to.

1871. thanks 谢谢 ## 10

[θæŋks]int.谢谢n.谢谢(只用复数)

  • I’m fine, thanks. 我很好谢谢。
  • He’s fine, thanks. 他很好，谢谢。
  • Thanks, Mum. 谢谢你，妈妈。

SEE> de·spite 尽管, spite 尽管, in·deed 确实

ODE> An expression of gratitude. – gratitude, gratefulness, appreciation.

1872. that 那 ## 741

[ðæt]pron.那conj.引导从句adj.那个；上文提到的adv.非常；那么地

  • Whose shirt is that? 是谁的衬衫？
  • That’s a nice dress. 这是一个不错的衣服。
  • That is a lovely hat! 这是一个可爱的帽子！

SEE> but 但是, which 哪一个, what 什么

ODE> Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker. –

1873. the 该 ## 4087

[ðə]art.那；这；这些；那些adv.（用于比较级前）更加；用于最高级前；(用于形容词、副词比较级前)越 … 越 …

  • Does the man get his umbrella back? 难道男人得到他的伞回来？
  • It’s the same colour. 这是相同的颜色。
  • Is there a problem with the Customs officer? 是否存在与海关官员有问题吗？

SEE> which 哪一个, same 相同, of 的

ODE> Denoting one or more people or things already mentioned or assumed to be common knowledge. – the beginning, the very beginning, the start, the outset, the commencement.

1874. the·a·tre 剧院 ## 3

[’θiːətər]n.戏院；剧场；戏剧；手术室；战区adj.戏院的=theater.

  • Last week I went to the theatre. 上星期我去看戏。
  • What particular anxiety spoils the country dweller’s visit to the theatre? 什么特别的焦虑败坏了农村居民的剧院访问？
  • Some of my acquaintances in the country come up to town once or twice a year to visit the theatre as a special treat. 我的一些在国内熟人，他们到镇上去，一次或每年两次参观剧院作为一种特殊的享受。

ODE> A building or outdoor area in which plays and other dramatic performances are given. – playhouse, auditorium, amphitheatre, hippodrome, coliseum.

1875. theirs 他们的 ## 2

[ðerz]pron.他(她；它)们的

  • The truth is that when mistakes occur, they are more likely to be ours than theirs. 事实是，错误发生时，他们更可能是咎由自取。
  • This is a sceptical age, but although our faith in many of the things in which our forefathers fervently believed has weakened, our confidence in the curative properties of the bottle of medicine remains the same as theirs. 这是一个怀疑一切的时代，可是虽然我们中的许多，使我们的祖先笃信的事情的信心有所减弱，我们对瓶装药品疗效的信心仍与祖先一样。

SEE> ours 我们的, hers 她的, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with two or more people or things previously mentioned. –

1876. them·selves 他们自己 ## 14

[ðəm’selvz]pron.他/她/它们自己；他/她/它们亲自；指性别不详的人时用以代替himself或herselfhimself/herself/itself的复数.

  • When they had all made themselves comfortable, a stranger appeared. 当他们都已安排舒适时，一个陌生人出现了。
  • How do cats try to protect themselves when falling from great heights? 如何猫尝试从很高的地方落下时保护自己？
  • It seems that the further cats fall, the less they are likely to injure themselves. 看来，猫跌落，他们是不太可能伤害自己。

SEE> them 他们, they 他们, our·selves 我们自己

ODE> Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a group of people or things previously mentioned as the subject of the clause. –

1877. then 然后 ## 111

[ðen]adv.那么；然后；当时；而且adj.当时的n.当时

  • Then put these clothes in the wardrobe. 然后把这些衣服在衣柜里。
  • Then make the bed. 然后铺床。
  • Then sweep the floor. 然后扫地。

SEE> when 什么时候, a·gain 再次, fi·nal·ly 终于

ODE> At that time; at the time in question. – at that time, at that point, in those days.

1878. there 那里 ## 201

[ðer]adv.在那里；到那里；从那里pron.表示存在（与be连用）n.那个地方；那一点

  • Is there a problem with the Customs officer? 是否存在与海关官员有问题吗？
  • There’s an ice cream man. 有个卖冰淇淋的。
  • There is a refrigerator in the kitchen. 有一个在厨房的冰箱。

SEE> but 但是, no 不, few 少数

ODE> In, at, or to that place or position. – in attendance, attending, here, there, near, nearby, at hand, close at hand, near at hand, adjacent, available, ready.

1879. there·fore 因此 ## 8

[’ðerfɔːr]adv.因此；所以

  • Rescue workers are therefore drilling a hole on the north side of the mine. 因此，营救人员钻了矿井的北侧一个洞。
  • He is therefore forgiven if late for a dinner party. 因此，他被原谅，如果迟到了晚宴。
  • It ‘flies’, therefore, but it cannot fly higher – its action depends on the surface, water or ground, over which it rides. 它“苍蝇”，因此，但它不能飞得更高 - 其作用依赖于水面或地面上，它越过它。

SEE> thus 如此, con·se·quent·ly , hence 因此

ODE> For that reason; consequently. – for that reason, consequently, so, as a result, as a consequence, hence, thus, accordingly, then, that being so, that being the case, on that account.

1880. these 这些 ## 82

[ðiːz]pron.这些adj.这些的

  • Are these your cases? 这些是你的情况？
  • These ice creams are nice. 这些冰淇淋真好吃。
  • These glasses? 这些眼镜？

SEE> those 那些, such 这样, man·y 许多

ODE>

1881. they 他们 ## 701

[ðeɪ]pron.他们

  • No, they aren’t. 不，他们不是。
  • They are Norwegian. 他们是挪威。
  • Here they are. 他们来了。

SEE> have 有, so 所以, but 但是

ODE> Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified. –

1882. thick 厚 ## 4

[θɪk]adj.厚的；浓密的；粗的；愚笨的

  • Snow lay thick on the ground. 雪厚躺在地上。
  • After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. 通过墙上挖了厚18英寸碎裂后，他们发现，一男子已被困在烟囱里。
  • Despite the fact that the bottle is tinted a delicate shade of green, an observant visitor would soon notice that it is filled with what looks like a thick, greyish substance. 尽管瓶子是偏绿的淡色，但细心的客人很快就会发现它装的是一种看上去黏稠，颜色发灰的。

SEE> dense , thin 瘦, lay·er 层

ODE> With opposite sides or surfaces that are far or relatively far apart. – in diameter, in extent, across, wide, broad, deep.

1883. thief 贼 ## 21

[θiːf]n.贼；小偷

  • Who called out to the thieves in the dark? 谁大声在黑暗盗贼？
  • While my friend, George, was reading in bed, two thieves climbed into his kitchen. 当我的朋友乔治在床上正在读，两个小偷爬进了他的厨房。
  • The thieves dropped the torch and ran away as quickly as they could. 小偷扔下了手电筒，飞快地逃走了。

SEE> bur·glar , jew·el , steal 偷

ODE> A person who steals another person’s property, especially by stealth and without using force or threat of violence. – robber, burglar, housebreaker, cat burglar, shoplifter, pickpocket, sneak thief, mugger, larcenist, stealer, pilferer, poacher.

1884. thing 事情 ## 64

[θɪŋ]n.东西；事情（复）things: 所有物；用具；情况

  • We need a lot of things this week. 我们需要很多的东西这个星期。
  • Millionaires don’t buy things on instalments! 百万富翁是不会分期付款买东西的！
  • But they don’t realize one important thing. 但他们没有认识到重要的事情。

SEE> re·al·ly 真的, some·thing 某物, think 想

ODE> An object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to. – object, article, item, artefact, commodity.

1885. think 想 ## 56

[θɪŋk]v.认为；想；记起；考虑n.想

  • What time of day is it, do you think? 一天中的时间是什么，你觉得呢？
  • I think that they’ll move in the day after tomorrow. 我想他们将会在后天搬进。
  • I think that I’ve hurt my back. 我认为我已经伤害了我的背。

SEE> re·al·ly 真的, know 知道, cer·tain·ly 当然

ODE> Have a particular belief or idea. – believe, be of the opinion, have as one’s opinion, be of the view, be under the impression.

1886. think·ing 思考 ## 3

[’θɪŋkɪŋ]n.思考；思想adj.好思考的；有理性的动词think的现在分词.

  • He spent a miserable day in bed thinking of all the fun he was missing. 他在他失踪的乐趣的所有床上想度过一个悲痛的日子。
  • The inner workings of our own brains we feel to be uniquely worthy of investigation, but custom, we have a way of thinking, is behaviour at its most commonplace. 我们觉得我们自己的大脑内部的活动情况才值得研究，但定制，我们有一种思维方式，是在其最司空见惯的行为。
  • He sees it edited by a definite set of customs and institutions and ways of thinking. 他把它编辑一个受特定的风俗习惯，制度和思维方式。

ODE> The process of considering or reasoning about something. – reasoning, idea, ideas, theory, thoughts, line of thought, philosophy, beliefs.

1887. third 第三 ## 8

[θɜːrd]num.第三；三分之一adj.第三的；三分之一的

  • Isn’t he her third husband? 他不是她的第三任丈夫？
  • He slept very well for the first two nights, but on the third night, a storm blew up. 他睡得非常好。前两个晚上，但在第三天晚上，起了风暴。
  • I was being tested for a driving licence for the third time. 我正在测试的第三次驾驶执照。

SEE> se·cond 第二, fourth 第四, fifth 第五

ODE> Constituting number three in a sequence; 3rd. –

1888. thirst·y 口渴 ## 2

[’θɜːrsti]adj.口渴的；渴望的

  • We’re tired… …and thirsty, Mum. 我们累了……和渴，妈妈。
  • He looked very well, though he was rather thirsty, for he drank half a bottle of milk. 他看上去很好，虽然他是相当口渴得很，喝了半瓶牛奶。

SEE> hun·gry 饥饿, thirst , fright·ened 受惊

ODE> Feeling a need to drink. – longing for a drink, in need of a drink, dry, dehydrated.

1889. thir·teen 十三 ## 4

[ˌθɜːr’tiːn]num.十三

  • When it was eventually brought to shore, it was found to be over thirteen feet long. 当终于把它弄上岸，发现是超过了13英尺长。
  • Looking at his watch, he saw that it was one o’clock, but the bell struck thirteen times before it stopped. 看他的手表，他看到才1点钟，可是那钟敲了13下才停。
  • ‘It’s working all right, but I’m afraid that at one o’clock it will strike thirteen times and there’s nothing I can do about it.’ “它的工作不错，但恐怕在一点钟它会罢工13下，有什么我可以做些什么。”

SEE> four·teen 十四, e·lev·en 十一, fif·teen 十五

ODE> Equivalent to the sum of six and seven; one more than twelve, or seven less than twenty; 13. –

1890. thir·ty 三十 ## 7

[’θɜːrti]num.三十

  • You can pay a deposit of thirty pounds, and then fourteen pounds a month for three years. 您可以交纳押金30英镑，然后每月14镑，三年。
  • She has been helping her husband for thirty years now. 她已经帮了她的丈夫30年了。
  • It suddenly dawned on me that this express was not roaring down the line at ninety miles an hour, but barely chugging along at thirty. 我突然醒悟过来了，这个快递是不是以90英里的时速呼啸前进，但仅30隆隆一起。

SEE> twen·ty 二十, for·ty 四十, fif·teen 十五

ODE> The number equivalent to the product of three and ten; ten less than forty; 30. –

1891. this 这个 ## 373

[ðɪs]pron.这；这个adj.这个adv.这样；这么

  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？
  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？
  • This is not my umbrella. 这不是我的伞。

SEE> it 它, IT , same 相同

ODE> Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced. – unnamed, unstated, unidentified, unquantified, undesignated, undefined, unfixed, undecided, undetermined, uncertain, uncounted.

1892. thor·ough·ly 彻底地 ## 4

[’θɜːrəli]adv.彻底地；完全；非常

  • The party then searched the whole cave thoroughly but did not find anything except an empty tin trunk. 然后，将彻底搜寻了整个洞穴，但没有发现除了一个空铁皮箱外什么。
  • After we had landed, the plane was searched thoroughly. 我们降落之后，飞机被彻底搜查。
  • In the process, he enjoyed himself thoroughly and kept telling everybody how much he hated hospitals. 在这个过程中，他尽情娱乐，一再告诉大家他是多么讨厌医院。

SEE> sufficiently 充分地, com·pre·hen·sive·ly , com·plete·ly 完全

ODE> In a thorough manner. – rigorously, in depth, exhaustively, from top to bottom, minutely, closely, in detail, meticulously, scrupulously, assiduously, conscientiously, painstakingly, methodically, carefully, sedulously, completely, comprehensively, fully, to the fullest extent, intensively, extensively.

[ðoʊz]pron.那些adj.那些

  • Those women are very hard-working. 这些妇女非常勤劳。
  • No, not those. 不，不是的。
  • Those flowers are lovely, too. 这些花也很漂亮啊。

SEE> these 这些, all 所有, e·ven 甚至

1894. though 虽然 ## 44

[ðoʊ]conj.虽然；尽管；然而；可是adv.（用在句末补充说明使语气减弱）不过

  • Almost immediately he began to complain about the weather, for even though it was still summer, it rained continually and it was often bitterly cold. 但紧接着他就开始抱怨那里的天气了。因为即使那时仍为夏季，它不断地下雨，而且常常冷得厉害。
  • Though, at first, Byrd and his men were able to take a great many photographs of the mountains that lay below, they soon ran into serious trouble. 虽然开始时伯德和他的助手们拍下了飞机下面连绵群山的大量照片，但他们很快就陷入了困境。
  • Though Mr.Thompson had turned the lights off before he went to bed, they were on in the morning. 虽然汤普森先生已经变成灯关闭之前，他上了床，他们在今天上午分别上。

SEE> al·though 虽然, but 但是, how·ev·er 然而

ODE> Despite the fact that; although. – although, in spite of the fact that, despite the fact that, even though, though, for all that.

1895. thought 想法 ## 13

[θɔːt]n.思想；想法；意向；思念；观念；打算；关心；顾虑v.想，思考，考虑（动词think的过去式和过去分词）

  • Loud conversations on mobile phones invade our thoughts or interrupt the pleasure of meeting friends for a quiet chat. 在移动电话大声交谈侵入我们的思想或中断和朋友在一起轻声聊天的乐趣。
  • No human endeavour or thought would be unchanged by it.’ 任何人类的努力和想法都会发生变化。”
  • In the lift her thoughts were on lunch and a good rest; but when she got out at her own floor, both were forgotten in her sudden discovery that her front door was open. 她乘上电梯后，只想着午餐和好好休息一下。但是当她到自己的楼层走出，两人都在她忘记突然发现她家的大门开着。

SEE> ac·tu·al·ly 其实, in·deed 确实, prob·a·bly 大概

ODE> An idea or opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the mind. – idea, notion, line of thinking, belief, concept, conception, conviction, opinion, view, impression, image, perception, mental picture.

1896. thou·sand 千 ## 23

[’θaʊznd]n.千n.【C】成千上万；许许多多

  • Then he smiled and told me I would receive an extra thousand pounds a year! 然后，他笑着告诉我一个我每年将得到1,000英镑的额外！
  • This has not been easy because I own over a thousand books. 这并不容易，因为我有1,000多本书。
  • By the time you read this, the Hubble’s eagle eye will have sent us thousands and thousands of wonderful pictures. 当你读到这篇文章时，哈勃的鹰之眼已经为我们送来了成千上万张精彩的照片。

SEE> hun·dred 百, for·ty 四十, fif·ty 五十

ODE> The number equivalent to the product of a hundred and ten; 1,000. – K, thou.

1897. threat·en 威胁 ## 5

[’θretn]v.威胁；恐吓；似将发生

  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。
  • It threatened to surround him completely, but Tazieff managed to escape just in time. 它威胁要完全包围了他，但塔捷耶夫设法逃离了。
  • When he received a very rude reply from one of the workmen, he threatened to remove them by force. 当他从工人中的一个接收一个非常粗鲁的答复，他威胁用武力将其删除。

ODE> State one’s intention to take hostile action against (someone) in retribution for something done or not done. – menace, intimidate, browbeat, bully, cow, pressurize, lean on, terrorize, frighten, scare, alarm.

[θriː]num.三n.三；三个adj.三个的

  • We’re going to spend three days in the country! 我们将花三天的国家！
  • He telephoned me four times yesterday and three times the day before yesterday. 他四次，昨天和前天三次打电话给我。
  • I brought it here three days ago. 我把它3天前。

1899. through 通过 ## 43

[θruː]adv.通过；径直；自始至终；(电话)接通；完全prep.穿过；凭借；一直到adj.直达的；直通的；贯穿的；完成的；结束的

  • Look through the window. 看透过窗户。
  • On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods. 周日，数百人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林散步。
  • As we had had a long walk through one of the markets of old Delhi, we stopped at a square to have a rest. 正如我们所穿过旧德里的市场之一的长走，我们停在一个广场上休息。

SEE> way 方式, well 好, a·cross 横过

ODE> Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location) – into and out of, to the far side of, to the other side of, from one side of … to the other, from end to end of, between, past, by, down, along, across, by way of, via.

1900. throw 扔 ## 15

[θroʊ]v.扔；投；掷；抛n.抛；投掷

  • Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere. 废物筐已放置在树下，但人们仍到处扔垃圾。
  • She threw the bottle into the sea. 她把瓶子扔进了大海。
  • He called out to the children and threw the ball back to the bank. 他呼吁那些孩子，把球扔回到岸上。

SEE> grab 抓住, put 放, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> Propel (something) with force through the air by a movement of the arm and hand. – hurl, toss, fling, pitch, cast, lob, launch, flip, catapult, shy, dash, aim, direct, project, propel, send, bowl.

1901. thus 如此 ## 3

[ðʌs]adv.这样；如此；因此；从而

  • Thus the rods, by falling, and by the direction in which they fell, recorded for the slumbering scientist the strength of a shock that was too weak to waken him, and the direction from which it came. 因此，棒，落下的，以及由它们下跌的方向，记录了沉睡已久的科学家，这是太虚弱了唤醒他的冲击力，并从它来的方向。
  • The apparatus thus described, however, records only the horizontal component of the wave movement, which is, in fact, much more complicated. 该装置如此描述的，然而，只记录波运动，这是，在实际上，更复杂的水平分量。
  • Such a messenger, receiving our radio and television signals, might well re-transmit them back to its home-planet, although what impression any other civilization would thus get from us is best left unsaid. 这样的使者，我们接收广播电视信号，很可能会重新发送它们回到原来的行星，虽然什么印象其他文明将因此从我们这里得到最好没有明说。

SEE> there·fore 因此, hence 因此, there·by

ODE> As a result or consequence of this; therefore. – consequently, as a consequence, in consequence, so, that being so, therefore, accordingly, hence, as a result, for that reason, for this reason, because of that, because of this, on that account, on this account.

1902. tick·et 票 ## 13

[’tɪkɪt]n.票；券；标签；罚单；候选人名单vt.加标签于；售票；开罚单；检票，查验票证

1903. tie 领带 ## 6

[taɪ]n.束缚；使人结合在一起的事物；领带；绳；不分胜负v.系；约束；捆绑；打结；连结

  • ‘I needn’t remind you of that terrible tie you bought yesterday.’ “我也不必提醒你昨天买的那条糟糕透了的领带。”
  • ‘A man can never have too many ties.’ “一个人不能有太多的联系。”
  • People who work in offices are frequently referred to as ‘white-collar workers’ for the simple reason that they usually wear a collar and tie to go to work. 人谁在办公室工作，常常被称作“白领”，原因很简单，他们通常是穿着硬领和领带去上班。

SEE> break 打破, pair 一对, draw 描画

ODE> Attach or fasten with string or similar cord. – bind, tie up, tether, hitch, strap, truss, fetter, rope, chain, make fast, moor, lash, attach, fasten, fix, secure, join, connect, link, couple.

1904. till 直到 ## 3

[tɪl]prep.直到 … 为止conj.直到 … 为止n.放钱的抽屉；备用现金；[地质]冰碛土(物)v.耕作

  • Can’t you wait till this afternoon? 你就不能等到今天下午吗？
  • I waited till he came near, then I asked him the way to our old village. 我等他走近了，我问他的方式给我们的老村。
  • A blurred image appears; he adds a brushstroke and another, and it is gone; but something was there, and he will not rest till he has captured it. 出现一个模糊图像;他增添了一笔，另外，它是走了;但事情在那里，他不会休息，直到把它捕捉。

SEE> un·til 直到, be·gin·ning 开始, wait 等待

ODE> Up to (the point in time or the event mentioned); until. – until, up to, up till, up until, as late as, up to the time of, up to the time that, until such time as, pending.

1905. time 时间 ## 188

[taɪm]n.时间；时代；时期；倍；次数；节拍v.为…安排时间；计时；[体]在某一时刻击球adj.时间的；定时的；分期（付款）的；定期的

  • He telephoned me four times yesterday and three times the day before yesterday. 他四次，昨天和前天三次打电话给我。
  • What time of day is it, do you think? 一天中的时间是什么，你觉得呢？
  • At what time of year did Ken visit Paris? 在一年中什么时候做肯访问巴黎的？

SEE> when 什么时候, but 但是, be·fore 在之前

ODE> The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future regarded as a whole. – hour.

1906. time·ta·ble 时间表 ## 4

[’taɪmteɪbl]n.时间表；时刻表；课程表

  • After years of conditioning, most of us have developed an unshakable faith in railway timetables. 经过多年的适应，我们大多数人对火车时刻表产生了不可动摇的信念。
  • After consulting my railway timetable, I noted with satisfaction that there was an express train to Westhaven. 我查看了列车时刻表，满意地指出，有快车不可动摇的信念。
  • When he denied the train’s existence, I borrowed his copy of the timetable. 当他否认了火车的存在，我借用了他的时间表的副本。

ODE> A chart showing the departure and arrival times of trains, buses, or aircraft. – schedule, programme, agenda, calendar, diary, appointment book, appointment diary, engagement diary, social life.

  • The tiny village of Frinley is said to possess a ‘cursed tree’. Frinley小村里，据说拥有“诅咒的树”。
  • In towns that are near the sea, the tiny lanterns which had been hung in the streets the night before, are placed into the water when the festival is over. 在靠海的城镇中，已经挂在大街小巷的前一天晚上，这些小灯笼，放入水中时，节日过后。
  • He had spotted a tiny bottle at the bottom of my case and he pounced on it with delight. 他在我的箱底发现了一只小瓶，他一把抓了起来喜悦。

1909. tire 疲劳 ## 5

[’taɪər]n.轮胎；金属圈v.使疲倦；厌烦；劳累

  • We’re tired… …and thirsty, Mum. 我们累了……和渴，妈妈。
  • Her shopping had tired her and her basket had grown heavier with every step of the way home. 她，就感到她和她的篮子已经与回家的路上的每一步变得越来越重。
  • Their humbler followers, such as partridges, have a like power of strong propulsion, but soon tire. 它们的低级同类，如鹧鸪，有一个像功率强劲的推进，但很快就疲劳。

SEE> wheel 轮子, car 汽车, for·tu·nate·ly

ODE> Feel or cause to feel in need of rest or sleep. – exhausting, wearying, fatiguing, enervating, draining, sapping, stressful, wearing, trying, crushing.

1910. tired 累的 ## 4

  • I feel very tired. 我感觉很累。
  • She told reporters she felt very tired and didn’t want to make another film for a long time.’ 她告诉记者她感到很疲劳，不想再拍电影了很长一段时间“。
  • The boys felt tired so they put out the fire and crept into their tent. 于是他们把火扑灭，钻进了帐篷男孩感到累了。

SEE> wea·ry , frus·trat·ed , scared 恐惧的

ODE> In need of sleep or rest; weary. – worn out, exhausted, fatigued, tired out, overtired, weary, sleepy, drowsy, wearied, sapped, dog-tired, spent, drained, jet-lagged, played out, debilitated, prostrate, enervated, jaded, low.

  • Nice to meet you. 很高兴见到你。

  • It is a fine day today. 这是今天天气很好。

1913. to·geth·er 一起 ## 15

  • They often drink tea together. 他们经常一起喝茶。
  • Sam and I had lunch together today. 我和萨姆今天一起吃的午饭。
