1915. ton 吨 ## 3

[tʌn]n.吨；大量

  • When the fire had at last been put out, the forest authorities ordered several tons of a special type of grass-seed which would grow quickly. 最后，当有火被扑灭后，森林管理当局订购了好几吨一种特殊类型的草籽生长迅速的。
  • ‘Jumbo must weigh a few tons,’ said a policeman afterwards, ’so it was fortunate that we didn’t have to carry him. “江伯一定有好几吨重，说：”一个警察事后“，所以这很幸运，我们没有携带他。
  • Even by modern standards, the 46,000 ton Titanic was a colossal ship. 即使按照现代的标准，46000吨的泰坦尼克号是一艘巨轮。

SEE> kil·o·gram 公斤, bulk , load 加载

ODE> A unit of weight equal to 2,240 lb avoirdupois (1016.05 kg). – a lot, a great deal, a great amount, a large amount, a large quantity, a number, an abundance, a wealth, a profusion, a mountain.

1916. tongue 舌头 ## 3

[tʌŋ]n.舌头；语言；口才；舌状物v.舔；用舌吹奏管乐器；发音

  • Show me your tongue. 让我看看你的舌头。
  • Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been. 与此同时，我的舌头正在忙着寻找我拔掉牙的那个洞。
  • John Dewey has said in all seriousness that the part played by custom in shaping the behaviour of the individual, as against any way in which he can affect traditional custom, is as the proportion of the total vocabulary of his mother tongue against those words of his own baby talk that are taken up into the vernacular of his family. 杜威曾经非常严肃地指出：风俗在形成个人的行为，反对任何方式中他能影响传统习惯所起的作用，是因为他的母语的词汇总量的反对的那些话的比例他被吸收入他家的白话自己的宝宝说话。

SEE> cheek 脸颊, mouth 口, in·ci·den·tal·ly

ODE> The fleshy muscular organ in the mouth of a mammal, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in humans) articulating speech. – manner of speaking, way of speaking, manner of talking, way of talking, form of expression, mode of expression, choice of words, verbal expression.

1917. to·night 今晚 ## 3

[tə’naɪt]adv.今晚n.今晚

  • What is Mr. Sawyer doing tonight? 什么是索耶先生今晚正在做什么？
  • But he’s not reading his newspaper tonight. 但他没看报今晚。
  • Well, you’re going to have roast beef and potatoes again tonight! 那么，你就要有烤牛肉和土豆再次今晚！

SEE> to·mor·row 明天, night 晚, may·be 也许

ODE> On the present or approaching evening or night. –

1918. too 太 ## 77

[tuː]adv.也；太；而且；很

  • She’s Chinese, too. 她是中国人。
  • Are you French too? 你是法国人吗？
  • She’s very well, too, Helen. 她很好，海伦。

SEE> so 所以, but 但是, e·ven 甚至

ODE> To a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible; excessively. – excessively, overly, over, unduly, immoderately, inordinately, unreasonably, ridiculously, to too great an degree, to too great an extent, extremely, very.

1919. tool 工具 ## 3

[tuːl]n.工具；用具；手段；被利用者vt.用工具加工vi.使用工具

  • Armed with the right tools and materials, newlyweds gaily embark on the task of decorating their own homes. 使用正确的工具及材料，兴高采烈地踏上新婚夫妇布置新房的任务。
  • Fortunately, however, ancient men made tools of stone, especially flint, because this is easier to shape than other kinds. 但幸运的是，远古人用石头，特别是燧石工具，因为这是比其他的更容易成形。
  • Stone does not decay, and so the tools of long ago have remained when even the bones of the men who made them have disappeared without trace. 石头不会腐烂，所以很久以前的工具时，是谁使他们的人连骨头已经消失得无影无踪一直保持。

SEE> use·ful 有用, in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> A device or implement, especially one held in the hand, used to carry out a particular function. – implement, instrument, utensil, device, apparatus, gadget, appliance, machine, contrivance, contraption, mechanism, aid.

1920. tooth 牙齿 ## 5

[tuːθ]n.牙齿；齿状物；粗糙表面；嗜好（复）teeth: 有效手段.

  • My dentist had just pulled out one of my teeth and had told me to rest for a while. 我的牙科医生刚刚给我拔掉了一颗牙，叫我休息一会儿。
  • Meanwhile, my tongue was busy searching out the hole where the tooth had been. 与此同时，我的舌头正在忙着寻找我拔掉牙的那个洞。
  • When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth, I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth. 最后，当牙医移除从我嘴中药棉，我可以告诉他，他拔错了牙。

SEE> nail 钉子, jaw , last·ly

ODE> Each of a set of hard, bony enamel-coated structures in the jaws of most vertebrates, used for biting and chewing. – fang, denticulation.

1921. top 顶部 ## 7

[tɑːp]n.顶部；顶；上面；极点；陀螺adj.最高的；顶端的vt.形成顶部； 达到…的顶端； 处于…的最前头vi.总结； 超越； 高耸； 结束

  • The guy next to me wrote his name at the top of the paper. 坐在我旁边的那个人只在纸张上写下自己的名字。
  • A man was lying in the box on top of a pile of woollen goods. 一个男人躺在箱子里的一堆毛织品之上。
  • The early climbers were looking for the easiest way to the top, because the summit was the prize they sought, especially if it had never been attained before. 早期登山者所寻找的是通往山顶的最方便的方法，因为本次峰会是他们寻求的奖赏，尤其​​是如果它以前从来没有实现。

SEE> one 一, lead·ing 最重要的, put 放

ODE> The highest or uppermost point, part, or surface of something. – summit, peak, pinnacle, crest, crown, brow, brink, ridge, head, highest part, highest point, mountaintop, tip, apex, vertex, acme, apogee.

1922. top·ic 话题 ## 2

[’tɑːpɪk]n.题目；话题；标题

  • If she were alive today she would not be able to air her views on her favourite topic of conversation: domestic servants. 如果她活到今天，她将不能就她自己的观点谈话喜爱的主题：家庭佣人。
  • A man may acquire great knowledge of topics unconnected with his daily work, and yet get hardly any benefit or relief. 一个人可能获得渊博与自己日常工作的渊博知识，而没有从中得到任何好处或救济。

SEE> dis·cus·sion 讨论, sub·ject 话题, ques·tion 问题

ODE> A matter dealt with in a text, discourse, or conversation; a subject. – subject, subject matter, theme, issue, matter, point, talking point, question, concern, argument, discussion, thesis, text, concept, field, area, keynote, leitmotif.

1923. to·tal 总计的 ## 7

[’toʊtl]adj.总的；全体的；完全的n.总数；合计v.共计；总计

  • It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years. 这是一个奇怪的巧合，他退休的前一天，佩奇将已经教了一满40年。
  • Three factors have caused these fish to grow so large: the warm water round the hot oil pipes under the sea; the plentiful supply of food thrown overboard by the crews on the rigs; the total absence of fishing boats around the oil rigs. 3个因素造成这些鱼能长得这么大：温水轮海下热油管道;由钻井平台工作人员抛到海里食品的供应充足;完全没有钻井平台周围的渔船。
  • It has been estimated that if the bridge were packed with cars, it would still only be carrying a third of its total capacity. 据估计，若桥上摆满了汽车，也只不过携带三分之一的总容量。

SEE> near·ly 几乎, es·ti·mat·ed , a·mount 数量

ODE> Comprising the whole number or amount. – entire, complete, whole, full, comprehensive, combined, aggregate, gross, overall, composite, integral.

1924. to·tal·ly 完全地 ## 2

[’toʊtəli]adv.完全

  • A colony of bees had turned the engine into a hive and it was totally preserved in beeswax! 一群蜜蜂已经变成发动机进入一个蜂房，它完整地保存在蜂蜡！
  • Modern readers would find such naive solutions totally unacceptable. 现代读者会觉得这种天真的结局完全无法接受。

SEE> com·plete·ly 完全, utterly , en·tire·ly 完全地

ODE> Completely; absolutely. – completely, absolutely, entirely, wholly, fully, thoroughly, utterly, quite, altogether, one hundred per cent.

1925. tou·ch 触摸 ## 11

[tʌtʃ]vt.触摸；感动；吃；喝；触及vi.接触；联系n.触觉；接触；修饰；少许；痕迹

  • Now we are not allowed to touch it. 现在，我们是不允许去碰它。
  • It is said that if anyone touches the tree, he will have bad luck; if he picks a leaf, he will die. 有人说，如果有人触摸了这棵树，他将有倒霉的事。如果他摘了一片树叶，他会死。
  • While we were waiting to land, a flight attendant told us to keep calm and to get off the plane quietly as soon as it had touched down. 在我们等待降落时，一位空中乘务员告诉我们要保持镇静，因为它感动了下来静静地尽快离开飞机。

SEE> sort 种类, hand 手, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> Come into or be in contact with. – be in contact, be in contact with, come into contact, come into contact with, come together, come together with, meet, join, connect, converge, converge with, be contiguous, be contiguous with, border, border on, be against, be up against, link up, link up with, adjoin, abut, neighbour.

1926. tour 游览 ## 3

[tʊr]n.旅游；观光；巡回v.周游；旅行；巡回

  • While on a walking tour with his wife, he stopped to talk to a workman. 虽然上一次徒步旅行与他的妻子，他停下来与一个工人交谈。
  • Visits to really remote villages are seldom enjoyable – as my wife and I discovered during a tour through the Balkans. 到真正偏僻的村庄一件愉快的事情 - 做我的妻子和我在一次周游巴尔干半岛时对此深有体会。
  • Idealists have objected to the practice of camping, as to the package tour, that the traveller abroad thereby denies himself the opportunity of getting to know the people of the country visited. 理想主义者像反对露营的作法，对于旅行团，在国外的旅客，从而否认了了解访问了该国人民的机会。

SEE> trip 旅行, first 第一, con·cert 音乐会

ODE> A journey for pleasure in which several different places are visited. – excursion, journey, expedition, trip, jaunt, outing, day trip, junket, voyage, trek, safari.

1927. tour·ist 游客 ## 9

[’tʊrɪst]n.旅游者；二等舱adj.观光的；乘坐二等舱的

  • Are you tourists? 你们是来旅游？
  • Are your friends tourists too? 是你的朋友也是来旅游的？
  • He was a tourist. 他是个旅游者。

SEE> des·ti·na·tion , tour·ism , at·trac·tion 引力

ODE> A person who is travelling or visiting a place for pleasure. – holidaymaker, traveller, sightseer, visitor, excursionist, backpacker, globetrotter, day tripper, tripper.

1928. to·wards 朝向 ## 26

[tɔːrdz]prep.向；朝；关于adj.在即的；有希望的

  • Suddenly, one of the children kicked a ball very hard and it went towards a passing boat. 突然，一个孩子踢一个球非常艰苦，这对路过的船去了。
  • Towards evening, the boat struck a rock and the girl jumped into the sea. 到了傍晚，船触礁女孩跳入海中。
  • On arriving at the shore, the girl struggled up the cliff towards the light she had seen. 在到达岸边后，女孩挣扎着朝她看见光悬崖。

ODE> In the direction of. – in the direction of, to, toward, so as to approach, so as to near.

1929. tow·er 塔楼 ## 8

[’taʊər]n.塔；高楼vi.高耸；胜过

  • you can hear the clock when it is actually striking because microphones are connected to the clock tower. 你可以听到时钟时，它实际上是惊人的，因为麦克风连接到钟楼。
  • A painter who had been working on the tower hung a pot of paint on one of the hands and slowed it down! 谁一直工作在塔架上的画家挂漆一壶在手之一，慢了！
  • The officer in the control tower was very angry when he heard the news, because balloons can be a great danger to aircraft. 在控制塔上的官员非常生气，当他听到这个消息，因为气球有可能有很大的危险飞机。

SEE> build·ing 建筑, ad·ja·cent , roof 屋顶

ODE> A tall, narrow building, either free-standing or forming part of a building such as a church or castle. – steeple, spire.

1930. town 城镇 ## 30

[taʊn]n.城市；城镇；（某一城镇的）居民；商业区

  • There is a car race near our town every year. 有每年都有一场汽车比赛我们镇子附近。
  • I live in a very old town which is surrounded by beautiful woods. 我住在一个古老的小镇上被美丽的树林环绕。
  • On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods. 周日，数百人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林散步。

SEE> vil·lage 村庄, near 近, near·by 附近

ODE> A built-up area with a name, defined boundaries, and local government, that is larger than a village and generally smaller than a city. – urban area, conurbation, municipality, borough, township, settlement.

1931. trace 痕迹 ## 7

[treɪs]n.痕迹；微量；踪迹v.追踪；描绘；找出根源

  • I had traced the cause of the trouble. 我找到了毛病的原因。
  • We expected the path to end abruptly, but we found that it traced its way through the trees. 我们原以为小路会到此突然终止，但我们发现它在树林中继续向前延伸。
  • There was no trace of fingerprints, but the inspector found a dirty red bundle that contained jewellery which the old lady said was not hers. 有没有指纹痕迹，却发现了一个装有珠宝的老妇人说那不是她的肮脏的红包袱。

SEE> fur·ther·more , in·deed 确实, like·wise

ODE> Find or discover by investigation. – track down, find, discover, detect, unearth, uncover, turn up, hunt down, dig up, ferret out, run to ground.

1932. track 小道 ## 3

[træk]n.轨道；跑道；踪迹；小路；乐曲v.追踪；跟踪

  • On a race track? 上赛道？
  • He said that someone might be spying on the station and the pilot was ordered to keep track of the strange object. 他说可能有人对基地进行侦察，因此命令那个飞行员跟踪那个奇怪的飞行物。
  • As we bumped over the dusty track, we swerved to avoid large boulders. 当我们碰到过尘土飞扬的道路，还得东躲西藏让那些大石块。

SEE> well 好, same 相同, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> A rough path or road, typically one beaten by use rather than constructed. – path, pathway, footpath, lane, trail, route, way, course.

1933. trade 贸易 ## 2

[treɪd]n.贸易；交易；行业；同行；顾客；营业额；交易量v.做生意；从事贸易；购物；营业；(在证券交易所)交易；交换

  • These days, it is differences in national regulations, far more than tariffs, that put sand in the wheels of trade between rich countries. 这些天来，这是在国家法规的差异，而不是关税，在富裕国家之间的贸易轮子放沙子。
  • They hope to finish in time for a trade summit between America and the EU on May 28th. 他们希望尽早完成对5月28日，美国和欧洲之间的贸易峰会。

SEE> ex·port 出口, com·merce , im·port 进口

ODE> The action of buying and selling goods and services. – commerce, buying and selling, dealing, traffic, trafficking, business, marketing, merchandising, bargaining.

1934. tra·di·tion 传统 ## 3

[trə’dɪʃn]n.传统；惯例

  • It marked the end of the great tradition of ships with sails and the beginning of a new era. 它标志着船舶带帆的伟大传统的结束和一个新时代的开始。
  • The EU – following fine continental traditions – wants agreement on general principles, which could be applied to many types of products and perhaps extended to other countries. 欧盟 - 以下优良的大陆传统 - 希望就普遍的原则，这些原则可以适用于许多不同产品，同时可能延伸到其它国家。
  • Among tribal people all knowledge inherited by tradition is shared by all; it is taught to every member of the tribe so that in this respect everybody is equally equipped for life. 在部落中，通过传统继承的知识为所有人共享;它传授给部落的每一个成员，在这方面大家都同样配备了生活。

SEE> tra·di·tion·al 传统的, in·deed 确实, like·wise

ODE> The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation, or the fact of being passed on in this way. – historical convention, unwritten law, oral history, heritage.

1935. tra·di·tion·al 传统的 ## 5

[trə’dɪʃənl]adj.传统的

  • What has modified our traditional view of Galileo in recent times? 什么修改了近来我国传统伽利略的看法？
  • In primitive cultures the obligation to seek and to receive the traditional instruction is binding to all. 在原始文化中的义务，寻求和接受传统教育结合所有。
  • Traditional custom, taken the world over, is a mass of detailed behaviour more astonishing than what any one person can ever evolve in individual actions, no matter how aberrant. 传统习俗，在世界各地拍摄，是行为细节的质量更令人惊讶的比任何一个人都不能在发展个人行为，不管多么异常。

SEE> tra·di·tion 传统, traditionally 传统, un·like 不像

ODE> Existing in or as part of a tradition; long-established. – handed-down, folk, historical, unwritten, oral.

1936. traf·fic 交通 ## 11

[’træfɪk]n.（人或车等）交通流量；不正当生意（走私）v.做生意（多指违法的）；游览

  • If you park your car in the wrong place, a traffic policeman will soon find it. 如果你把汽车停错了地方，交通警很快就会发现。
  • Traffic police are sometimes very polite. 交警有时也很客气。
  • A policeman approached Jimmy and told him he ought to have gone along a side street as Jumbo was holding up the traffic. 一个警察走过来告诉吉米，他应该走一条小街走了，因为江泊阻碍了交通。

SEE> con·ges·tion , pe·des·tri·an , in·stance 例子

ODE> Vehicles moving on a public highway. – vehicles, cars, lorries, trucks.

1937. train 火车 ## 50

[treɪn]n.列车；火车；行列；一系列vt.训练；培训；瞄准vi.进行锻炼，接收训练；练习

  • Why did George and Ken miss the train? 没有乔治和肯为什么赶不上火车？
  • What time will the next train leave? 什么时候会下一班火车？
  • What time will the next train leave? 什么时候会下一班火车？

SEE> bus 公共汽车, rail 铁轨, pas·sen·ger 乘客

ODE> Teach (a person or animal) a particular skill or type of behaviour through practice and instruction over a period of time. – instruct, teach, coach, tutor, give lessons to, school, educate, upskill, edify, prime, drill, demonstrate something to, make something clear to.

1938. train·ing 训练 ## 9

[’treɪnɪŋ]n.训练；培养动词train的现在分词形式.

  • At what point does the training of a captive wild elephant begin? 在什么时候圈养野象的训练开始？
  • Two main techniques have been used for training elephants, which we may call respectively the tough and the gentle. 两种主要的方法已被用于训练大象，我们分别称之为强硬法和温柔。
  • Apart from any moral considerations this is a stupid method of training, for it produces a resentful animal who at a later stage may well turn man-killer. 除了任何道义问题，这是一种愚蠢的训练方法，因为这种方法愤懑动物谁在后一阶段可能会变成杀手。

SEE> prep·a·ra·tion 制备, prac·tice 实践, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> The action of teaching a person or animal a particular skill or type of behaviour. – instruction, teaching, coaching, tuition, tutoring, tutelage, schooling, education, pedagogy, andragogy, drilling, priming, preparation, grounding, guidance, indoctrination, inculcation.

1939. trans·port 运输 ## 9

[’trænspɔːrt]n.运输；心醉v.运输；传播；流放；激动

  • Before it could be transported to the United States, a site had to be found for it and a pedestal had to be built. 之前，它被运往美国，一个网站有它被发现和一个基座，同时必须建造。
  • The pie committee decided that the best way to transport the dish would be by canal, so they insured it for the trip. 馅饼委员会决定，运菜的最佳途径是通过运河水运，所以他们投了保的行程。
  • Which type of transport does the writer prefer, do you think? 哪种类型的代步这位作家是否愿意，你觉得呢？

SEE> trans·por·ta·tion 运输, rail 铁轨, fur·ther·more

ODE> Take or carry (people or goods) from one place to another by means of a vehicle, aircraft, or ship. – convey, carry, take, transfer, move, shift, bring, fetch, send, deliver, bear, conduct, haul, lug, cart, run, ship, ferry.

1940. trap 陷阱 ## 3

[træp]n.圈套；陷阱；困境；双轮轻便马车；U（或S）型管道；防臭瓣v.设圈套；陷入（困境）

  • Six men have been trapped in a mine for seventeen hours. 六名男子已经被困在矿井十七小时。
  • After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney. 通过墙上挖了厚18英寸碎裂后，他们发现，一男子已被困在烟囱里。
  • Other animals were trapped in tar pits, like the elephants, sabre-toothed cats, and numerous other creatures that are found at Rancho la Brea, which is now just a suburb of Los Angeles. 其他动物被困在沥青坑里，比如大象，剑齿虎和许多其他生物，在牧场拉布雷亚，这是现在只是一个洛杉矶的郊区发现。

SEE> pre·sum·a·bly 想必, es·cape 逃跑, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是

ODE> A device or enclosure designed to catch and retain animals, typically by allowing entry but not exit or by catching hold of a part of the body. – snare, net.

1941. trav·el 旅行 ## 36

[’trævl]v.旅行；去某地；传播；快速移动；[体]走步n.旅行；移动

  • That’s the ship we travelled on. 这是我们所乘的那条船。
  • Will you travel by sea or by air? 您将通过海运或空运旅行？
  • We may travel by sea. 我们可能乘船去。

SEE> trip 旅行, al·low 允许, leave 离开

ODE> Go from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length. – journey, tour, take a trip, go on a trip, voyage, go on an expedition, go on an excursion, go sightseeing, globetrot, backpack.

1942. trav·el·ler 旅客 ## 8

[’trævələr]n.旅行者=traveler(美).

  • For hundreds of years, St. Bernard dogs have saved the lives of travellers crossing the dangerous Pass. 几百年来，圣伯纳德狗拯救了许多翻越这道山口的旅游者的生命。
  • Now that a tunnel has been built through the mountains, the Pass is less dangerous, but each year, the dogs are still sent out into the snow whenever a traveller is in difficulty. 现在，隧道已通过山而建，该过程不那么危险，但每一年，还要派狗外面雪地里，只要旅客有困难。
  • Aeroplanes have the reputation of being dangerous and even hardened travellers are intimidated by them. 飞机以危险而连老资格的旅行者被他们吓倒的声誉。

ODE> A person who is travelling or who often travels. – passenger, tourist, tripper, tourer, journeyer, voyager, excursionist, holidaymaker, sightseer, visitor, globetrotter, jet-setter.

1943. treat 对待 ## 3

[triːt]v.对待；视为；探讨；治疗；处理；请客n.款待；宴飨

  • Some of my acquaintances in the country come up to town once or twice a year to visit the theatre as a special treat. 我的一些在国内熟人，他们到镇上去，一次或每年两次参观剧院作为一种特殊的享受。
  • How does the writer like to treat young people? 如何像作家对待年轻人？
  • Boiling is always a good way of treating water. 烧开一直是水处理的一种好办法。

SEE> treat·ment 治疗, in·stance 例子, cure 治愈

ODE> Behave towards or deal with in a certain way. – behave towards, act towards, conduct oneself towards, use, serve.

1944. treat·ment 治疗 ## 2

[’triːtmənt]n.治疗；对待；处理

  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。
  • It is best to keep to hot drinks, bottled or canned drinks of well-known brand names – international standards of water treatment are usually followed at bottling plants. 最好是饮用开水，知名品牌的瓶装或罐装饮料 - 水处理的国际标准通常跟随在装瓶厂。

SEE> treat 对待, ther·a·py , pa·tient 患者

ODE> The manner in which someone behaves towards or deals with someone or something. – behaviour towards, conduct towards, action towards, usage of, use of.

1945. tree 树 ## 34

[triː]n.树；树状物

  • Is the cat climbing the tree? 是猫爬树？
  • She’s sitting under the tree. 她坐在树下。
  • He’s climbing the tree. 他爬树。

SEE> pine , in·stance 例子, shade 阴凉处

ODE> A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground. – sapling.

1946. trip 旅行 ## 19

[trɪp]n.旅行；摔倒；差错；轻快的步伐vt.使跌倒；使失败；使犯错；起锚；竖帆vi.绊倒；旅行；轻快地走；失误；结巴

  • This is a photograph I took during my trip to Australia. 这是一张照片我到澳大利亚旅行时我花了。
  • They’re people I met during the trip. 他们是我旅行时认识的。
  • I grew a beard during the trip. 我在旅行时留了胡子。

1947. trou·ble 麻烦 ## 9

[’trʌbəl]n.困难；烦恼；麻烦v.使烦恼；麻烦；苦恼；费神

  • He has just bought a new house in the city, but ever since he moved in, he has had trouble with cars and their owners. 他刚在城里买下一所新房子，但自从搬进来，他就和汽车及车主们的麻烦。
  • Though, at first, Byrd and his men were able to take a great many photographs of the mountains that lay below, they soon ran into serious trouble. 虽然开始时伯德和他的助手们拍下了飞机下面连绵群山的大量照片，但他们很快就陷入了困境。
  • It sped downhill at the end of the race and its driver had a lot of trouble trying to stop it. 它下坡加速在比赛结束及其驱动程序有很多试图阻止它的麻烦。

SEE> dif·fi·cul·ty 困难, e·ven 甚至, be·sides

ODE> Difficulty or problems. – problems, difficulty, issues, bother, inconvenience, worry, anxiety, distress, concern, disquiet, unease, irritation, vexation, annoyance, stress, agitation, harassment, unpleasantness.

1948. trou·sers 长裤 ## 2

[’traʊzərz]n.裤子

  • Have you ever put your trousers in the washing machine and then remembered there was a large bank note in your back pocket? 你有没有把你的裤子在洗衣机，然后又想在你的背部口袋大面值的纸币？
  • When you rescued your trousers, did you find the note was whiter than white? 当你把裤子抢救出来，你有没有发现那张纸币较白较白的？

SEE> pants 裤子, jack·et 夹克, jeans 牛仔裤

ODE> An outer garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg. – slacks.

1949. truck 卡车 ## 3

[trʌk]n.卡车；手推车；敞篷货车n.交易；交往；商品蔬菜；实物工资；垃圾v.以卡车运v.交易；打交道

  • The pie committee telephoned a local garage owner who arrived in a recovery truck to salvage the pie dish. 馅饼委员会给当地汽车修理库老板谁在回收的卡车抵达打捞盘子。
  • The winch was again put into operation and one of the men started up the truck. 绞盘机再次投入运行，其中一名男子启动了车。
  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。

SEE> car 汽车, ve·hi·cle 车辆, trac·tor

ODE> A large, heavy road vehicle used for carrying goods, materials, or troops; a lorry. – lorry, articulated lorry, heavy goods vehicle, juggernaut.

1950. true 真正的 ## 13

[truː]adj.真实的；真的；准确的；精确的；忠诚的adv.真实地；准确地n.真相；精确vt.使…平衡

  • I want to tell you a true story. 我要告诉你一个真实的故事。
  • It was true. 这是真的。
  • Dreams of finding lost treasure almost came true recently. 寻找失落的宝藏的梦想差一点儿最近真。

SEE> in·deed 确实, fact 事实, rea·son 理由

ODE> In accordance with fact or reality. – accurate, correct, verifiable, faithful, literal, veracious.

1951. tru·ly 真正地 ## 2

[’truːli]adv.真实地；真诚地；正确地

  • But just before the competition closed, a lorry arrived at the factory with a truly colossal biscuit which weighed 2,400 pounds. 但就在竞赛截止前，一辆卡车到达工厂，拥有真正巨大的饼干，重达2,400磅。
  • A truly dedicated bargain hunter must have patience, and above all, the ability to recognize the worth of something when he sees it. 一个到处找便宜的人必须具有耐心，而且最重要的，当他看到它的能力，认识事物的价值。

1952. trust 信任 ## 4

[trʌst]n.信任；信托vi.信任vt.相信；委托

  • The administrative overheads of a business are low to the extent that everyone working in the business can be trusted to behave in a way that best promotes the interests of the firm. 一个企业的管理费用低的程度，每个人都在企业工作的可以信任的最促进公司利益的方式行事。
  • If they can each be trusted to take such responsibilities, and to exercise such initiative as falls within their sphere, then administrative overheads will be low. 如果他们每个人都能予以信任承担这样的职责，并行使这样的举措为各自的工作范围之内，那么企业的管理费用就会降低。
  • But if no one can be trusted to act in a loyal and responsible manner towards his job, then the business will require armies of administrators, checkers, and foremen and administrative overheads will rise correspondingly. 但是，如果没有人能够对他的工作被信任行为的忠诚和负责任的态度，那么企业就需要管理人员，检查，和工头和管理费用的军队就会相应地增加。

SEE> mu·tu·al , more·o·ver 此外, ben·e·fit 益处

ODE> Firm belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something. – confidence, belief, faith, freedom from doubt, freedom from suspicion, sureness, certainty, certitude, assurance, conviction, credence, reliance.

1953. truth 真相 ## 9

[truːθ]n.事实；真理；真实；真相

  • To tell you the truth, Mrs. Bird, I don’t like chicken either! 说句实话，伯德夫人，我也不喜欢鸡！
  • But to tell you the truth, you need a new car! 不过说实话，你需要一辆新车！
  • ‘I suggest,’ said the inspector, ’that you are not telling the truth. “我建议，”探长说，“你不说实话。

SEE> true 真正的, fact 事实, in·deed 确实

ODE> The quality or state of being true. – veracity, truthfulness, verity, sincerity, candour, honesty, genuineness.

1955. tun·nel 隧道 ## 9

[’tʌnl]n.隧道；地道；洞穴v.挖地道；挖隧道

  • Why was the first tunnel not completed? 为什么第一巷道没有完成？
  • In 1858, a French engineer, Aime Thome de Gamond, arrived in England with a plan for a twenty-one-mile tunnel under the English Channel. 1858年，法国工程师，艾梅·托梅·代·加蒙德，来到英格兰与在英吉利海峡一个21英里的隧道的计划。
  • The tunnel would be well-ventilated if tall chimneys were built above sea level. 这条隧道的通风良好，如果高大的烟囱被海拔建。

SEE> bridge 桥, cross·ing , un·der·neath 下

ODE> An artificial underground passage, especially one built through a hill or under a building, road, or river. – underground passage, subterranean passage.

  • It was very dark, so they turned on a torch. 很暗，于是他们打开了手电筒。
  • He turned on the light, but he couldn’t see anyone. 他开了灯，但他什么都没看到。

[twelv]num.十二

  • I had lunch at half past twelve. 我吃了午饭12点半。
  • Pinhurst is only five miles from Silbury, but Mr. Scott cannot get a telephone for his new garage, so he has just bought twelve pigeons. 松树丛离锡尔伯里只有5英里，但斯科特先生不能为他新的汽车修理部搞到一部电话机，所以他买了只鸽子。

1959. twice 两次 ## 3

[twaɪs]adv.两倍；两次

  • Officials from Greenwich Observatory have the clock checked twice a day. 从格林尼治天文台的官员们时钟每天两次检查。
  • Some of my acquaintances in the country come up to town once or twice a year to visit the theatre as a special treat. 我的一些在国内熟人，他们到镇上去，一次或每年两次参观剧院作为一种特殊的享受。
  • It is a world of red sandy deserts (hence its name – the Red Planet), cloudless skies, savage sandstorms, chasms wider than the Grand Canyon and at least one mountain more than twice as tall as Everest. 这是一个红色沙漠（因此它的名字 - 红色行星）的世界里，无云的天空，凶猛的沙暴，裂痕比大峡谷更宽，起码有一座山超过两倍高的珠穆朗玛峰。

1962. tyre 轮胎 ## 3

[’taɪər]n.轮胎=tire（美）.Tyre：提尔(古代腓尼基的有名港口； 现属黎巴嫩).

  • The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins. 该垃圾筐是空的，地上布满纸片，烟头，旧轮胎，空瓶子和生锈的罐头。
  • Although Campbell reached a speed of over 304 miles per hour, he had great difficulty in controlling the car because a tyre burst during the first run. 尽管坎贝尔达到了每小时超过304英里的速度，他在控制汽车，因为轮胎在第一次运行时突发很大的困难。
  • If no accidents occur on the way, like punctured tyres, diversions of traffic, sudden descent of fog, they will be on time. 如果不出意外的方式出现，如爆胎，交通，突然起雾的改道，他们将准时。

1965. un·a·ble 不能 ## 6

[ʌn’eɪbl]adj.不能的；不会的

  • Despite her great age, she was very graceful indeed, but, so far, the archaeologists have been unable to discover her identity. 尽管上了年纪，她很优雅确实，但是，到目前为止，考古学家一直未能发现她的身份。
  • As it was extremely narrow, the man was unable to move, but the fire fighters were eventually able to free him by cutting a huge hole in the wall. 由于这是极窄，那人无法动弹，但消防员们终于在墙上切割大洞，把他解救出来。
  • Not only was the meal well below the usual standard, but Bessie seemed unable to walk steadily. 不仅是饭菜远不如平时的标准，而且贝西走起路来似乎东倒西歪。

1966. un·cer·tain 不确定 ## 2

[ʌn’sɜːrtn]adj.不确定的；不稳定的；易变的

  • When I was a teenager, I felt that I was just young and uncertain – that I was a new boy in a huge school, and I would have been very pleased to be regarded as something so interesting as a problem. 当我还是个十几岁，我觉得我只是年轻的和不确定的 - 我是一所大学里的一名新生，我会一直很高兴被视为东西这么有趣的一个问题。
  • Travellers on short trips to areas with water supplies of uncertain quality should avoid drinking tap-water, or untreated water from any other source. 短途旅客地区水质不水，应避免任何其他来源的饮用自来水，或未经处理的水。

SEE> un·clear , un·sure , in·deed 确实

ODE> Not able to be relied on; not known or definite. – unknown, undetermined, unsettled, unresolved, unsure, pending, in the balance, in limbo, up in the air, debatable, open to question, in doubt.

[’ʌŋkl]n.伯；姑父；舅；叔；姨父

  • Mum or dad, of course, provide a regular supply of pocket money, but uncles and aunts are always a source of extra income. 爸爸妈妈，当然，提供的零花钱正常供应，但叔叔和婶婶总是额外收入来源。
  • The parquet floors shone like mirrors; highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets; even my uncle’s huge collection of books was kept miraculously free from dust. 洁如镜的镶木地板;高度抛光的银陈列在明亮的玻璃橱柜;连姑夫的大量藏书保持奇迹般地一尘不染。

  • But women always wear uncomfortable shoes! 可是女人们总是穿不舒服的鞋！

1969. un·der 在下面 ## 33

[’ʌndər]prep.低于；在 … 下；在 … 内；在 … 控制下adv.在昏迷中；在 … 下adj.下面的；从属的；少于的

  • She’s sitting under the tree. 她坐在树下。
  • The ship is going under the bridge. 船正从桥下驶过。
  • Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere. 废物筐已放置在树下，但人们仍到处扔垃圾。

SEE> same 相同, which 哪一个, put 放

ODE> Extending or directly below. – beneath, below, underneath, at the bottom of, at the foot of.

1970. un·der·ground 地下的 ## 2

[ˌʌndə’ɡraʊnd]adj.地下的；秘密的adv.在地下；秘密地n.地下；地铁；地道；秘密活动

  • This immense chasm has been formed by an underground stream which has tunnelled a course through a flaw in the rocks. 这巨大的鸿沟已被已通过在岩石中的缺陷隧道课程地下流形成的。
  • Suddenly they came to a waterfall which dropped into an underground lake at the bottom of the cave. 突然，他们来到了一个瀑布这在洞底投进一个地下湖。

ODE> Beneath the surface of the ground. – below ground, below the surface, under the earth, in the earth.

1971. un·der·stand 懂 ## 19

[ˌʌndər’stænd]v.懂得；明白；理解；认识到；听说；获悉

  • He did not understand English! 他不懂英语！
  • I’m afraid I don’t understand. 我怕我不明白。
  • I read a few lines, but I did not understand a word. 我读了几行，但我不明白的词。

SEE> know 知道, ex·plain 解释, how 怎么样

ODE> Perceive the intended meaning of (words, a language, or a speaker) – comprehend, apprehend, grasp, see, take in, perceive, discern, make out, puzzle out, recognize, keep up with, master, get to know, follow, fathom, get to the bottom of, penetrate, divine, interpret, unravel, decipher, see the light about, envisage.

1972. un·der·stand·ing 理解 ## 2

[ˌʌndər’stændɪŋ]n.理解；非正式协议；谅解；同情心adj.有同情心的

  • We shall all remember Mr. Page for his patience and understanding and for the kindly encouragement he gave us when we went so unwillingly to school. 我们不会忘记佩奇先生对他的耐心和理解，因为他给我们的亲切鼓励我们不愿去上学。
  • Reading about them increases our understanding without dispelling our fears. 阅读他们没有消除我们的恐惧增加了我们的理解。

SEE> knowl·edge 知识, un·der·stand 懂, im·por·tant·ly 重要的

ODE> The ability to understand something; comprehension. – comprehension, apprehension, grasp, grip, mastery, perception, discernment, appreciation, interpretation, cognizance, ken, conception, digestion, assimilation, absorption.

1973. un·der·wa·ter 水下的 ## 3

[ˌʌndər’wɔːtər]adj.在水中生长的；水下的adv.在水下

  • A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race. 一种游戏是非常流行的这些年轻的游泳运动员是水下三轮车比赛。
  • The towers are built on immense underwater platforms made of steel and concrete. 该塔建在由钢和混凝土的巨大的水下平台。
  • A burst of activity associated with the laying of submarine cables soon confirmed the Challenger’s observation that many parts of the ocean were two to three miles deep, and the existence of underwater features of considerable magnitude. 海底电缆的铺设相关活动的热潮很快证实了挑战者的观察结果：海洋中很多地方两到三英里深，和幅度相当水下的存在特征。

SEE> wreck , vi·cin·i·ty , be·neath 在下面

ODE> Situated, occurring, or done beneath the surface of the water. – undersea, submarine, sub-aquatic, subaqueous.

1974. un·ex·pect·ed·ly 意外地 ## 2

[ˌʌnɪk’spektɪdli]adv.未料到地；意外地

  • As if this were not enough to reduce you to tears, your husband arrives, unexpectedly bringing three guests to dinner. 好像这一切还不足以使你急得掉泪，你的丈夫到达时，意外地带来3个客人吃饭。
  • After being absent from The Gables for a week, my aunt unexpectedly returned one afternoon with a party of guests and instructed Bessie to prepare dinner. 正在从山墙缺席了一周后，我的她出其不意地回来一个下午的客人，吩咐贝西准备晚饭。

SEE> sur·pris·ing·ly 出奇, sud·den·ly 突然地, un·ex·pec·ted 意外

ODE> In a way that was not expected or regarded as likely. –

1975. un·for·tu·nate 不幸的 ## 4

[ʌn’fɔːrtʃənət]adj.不幸的；令人遗憾的n.不幸的人

  • In many ways, this is unfortunate for the poor actors who are required to go on repeating the same lines night after night. 在许多方面，这是不幸的，需要去夜后，重复同样的台词晚上谁可怜的演员。
  • He says nothing about the poor selection of goods in the shops, or about those unfortunate people who have to travel from the country to the city every day to get to work. 他也不说货物在商店穷人的选择，或对那些不幸的人每天去工作，谁拥有从乡下到城市旅游。
  • A man without an education, many of us believe, is an unfortunate victim of adverse circumstances, deprived of one of the greatest twentieth-century opportunities. 没有受过教育的人，很多人都认为，是逆境的牺牲品，被剥夺的最伟大的二十世纪的机遇之一。

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, trag·ic , con·se·quence 后果

ODE> Having or marked by bad fortune; unlucky. – unlucky, hapless, out of luck, down on one’s luck, luckless, wretched, miserable, forlorn, unhappy, poor, pitiful.

1976. un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是 ## 2

[ʌn’fɔːrtʃənətli]adv.不幸地；遗憾地

  • Unfortunately, the show was one of the dullest we have ever seen. 不幸的是，这次演出是我们所见过的最乏味的。
  • Such things provide an excellent outlet for pent up creative energy, but unfortunately not all of us are born handymen. 这些东西为人们潜在的创造力极好的出口，但不幸的是我们，不是所有的都是能工巧匠。

SEE> for·tu·nate·ly , in·deed 确实, an·y·way 无论如何

ODE> It is unfortunate that. – unluckily, sadly, regrettably, unhappily, woefully, lamentably, alas, sad to say, sad to relate.

1977. un·im·por·tant 不重要 ## 2

[ˌʌnɪm’pɔːrtnt]adj.不重要的

  • Editors of newspapers and magazines often go to extremes to provide their readers with unimportant facts and statistics. 报纸和杂志的编辑常常走极端为了向读者提供一些无关紧要的事实和统计数字。
  • It is as if a single unimportant event set up a chain of reactions. 这是因为如果单不重要事件成立反应的链。

SEE> in·sig·nif·i·cant , un·in·ter·est·ing , su·per·flu·ous

ODE> Lacking in importance or significance. – insignificant, inconsequential, trivial, minor, slight, trifling, of little importance, of no importance, of little consequence, of no consequence, of no account, of no moment, non-essential, immaterial, irrelevant, peripheral, extraneous, not worth mentioning, not worth speaking of, petty, paltry, insubstantial, light, inconsiderable, superficial, inferior, worthless, nugatory, pointless, frivolous.

1978. u·nique 独特 ## 3

[ju’niːk]adj.独特的；独一无二的；稀罕的

  • Future historians will be in a unique position when they come to record the history of our own times. 未来的历史学家会在一个独特的位置，当他们来写我们时代的历史。
  • But the claim made by a local authority to recover the cost of salvaging a sunken pie dish must surely be unique. 但是，地方当局作出打捞沉没的馅饼盘成本的要求肯定是独一无二的。
  • The episode could reasonably serve as a unique epic of royal espionage! 这一幕历史可以说是王室谍报活动中最精彩的篇章！

SEE> par·tic·u·lar 特定的, un·u·su·al 异常, dis·tinc·tive

ODE> Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else. – distinctive, individual, special, especial, idiosyncratic, quirky, eccentric, isolated.

1979. u·nit 单位 ## 3

[’juːnɪt]n.单元；单位；部件；组件

  • After having been wounded towards the end of the war, he had been sent to hospital and was separated from his unit. 已经受伤对战争结束后，他被送进医院，并从他的单位分离。
  • Meanwhile, his unit was lost and all records of him had been destroyed. 与此同时，他所在部队被击溃，他的所有档案已被销毁。
  • On the village green, where you pick up sides and no feeling of local patriotism is involved, it is possible to play simply for the fun and exercise: but as soon as a the question of prestige arises, as soon as you feel that you and some larger unit will be disgraced if you lose, the most savage combative instincts are aroused. 在乡间的草坪上，当你拿起两侧，没有当地的爱国主义情绪受影响，则可以简单地为了娱乐和锻炼：你觉得，但只要威信的问题是，一旦你和如果你失去了一些大的单位将被蒙羞，最野蛮的好斗本能就会激发出来。

SEE> di·vi·sion 分开, ad·di·tion 加, part 部分

ODE> An individual thing or person regarded as single and complete but which can also form an individual component of a larger or more complex whole. – component, part, section, element, constituent, subdivision, portion, segment, module, item, member, ingredient, factor, feature, piece, fragment.

1980. u·nit·ed 联合的 ## 5

[ju’naɪtɪd]adj.联合的；一致的；共同形成的动词unite的过去式和过去分词.

  • One of the most famous monuments in the world, the Statue of Liberty, was presented to the United States of America in the nineteenth century by the people of France. 一个是世界上最有名的古迹，自由女神像，是由法国人民赠送给美国的美国在十九世纪。
  • Before it could be transported to the United States, a site had to be found for it and a pedestal had to be built. 之前，它被运往美国，一个网站有它被发现和一个基座，同时必须建造。
  • Chickens slaughtered in the United States, claim officials in Brussels, are not fit to grace European tables. 鸡在美国屠宰，在布鲁塞尔的官员说，不适于用来装点欧洲的餐桌。

SEE> both 两者, al·though 虽然, al·so 也

ODE> Joined together politically, for a common purpose, or by common feelings. – unified, integrated, consolidated, amalgamated, joined, merged, banded together.

1981. u·ni·verse 宇宙 ## 8

[’juːnɪvɜːrs]n.宇宙；万物；世界

  • The Hubble will tell us a great deal about the age and size of the universe. 哈勃将告诉我们有关宇宙的年龄和大小的许多事情。
  • They have also assumed that all animals, and probably other organisms such as trees, or even the universe itself, must in the nature of things ‘wear out’. 他们还认为所有的动物，大概其他有机物，如树木，甚至宇宙本身，从事物的本质“磨损”。
  • Most animals we commonly observe do in fact age as we do, if given the chance to live long enough; and mechanical systems like a wound watch, or the sun, do in fact run out of energy in accordance with the second law of thermodynamics (whether the whole universe does so is a moot point at present). 大多数动物，我们通常看到的其实年龄，因为我们做，如果有机会到现场足够长;和机械系统像上了发条的手表，或者太阳，也实际上能根据热力学第二定律用完（整个宇宙是否如此，目前尚有争论）。

SEE> earth 地球, in·deed 确实, plan·et 行星

ODE> All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos. The universe is believed to be at least 10 billion light years in diameter and contains a vast number of galaxies; it has been expanding since its creation in the Big Bang about 13 billion years ago. – cosmos, macrocosm, totality, whole world, Creation, space, outer space, the heavens, the firmament.

1982. u·ni·ver·si·ty 大学 ## 5

[ˌjuːnɪ’vɜːrsəti]n.大学

  • Meanwhile, a number of university students have volunteered to drive buses while the strike lasts. 与此同时，许多大学生自愿在罢工期间驾驶公共汽车。
  • ‘University students set the Embassy on fire this morning.’ 大学生们今天上午放火焚烧了大使馆。“
  • It has never been explained why university students seem to enjoy practical jokes more than anyone else. 它也弄不清为什么大学生好像喜欢恶作剧比谁。

SEE> pro·fes·sor 教授, grad·u·ate , col·lege 学院

ODE> A high-level educational institution in which students study for degrees and academic research is done. – college, academy, educational establishment, educational institution, institute, varsity.

1983. un·known 未知 ## 3

[ˌʌn’noʊn]adj.未知的；不出名的

  • The tiny painting proved to be an unknown masterpiece by Correggio and was worth hundreds of thousands of pounds. 在极小的油画被证明是由科雷乔一个未知的杰作，价值几十万英镑。
  • Gifts poured in not only from unknown people, but from baby food and soap manufacturers who wished to advertise their products. 礼品不但素昧平生的人，但婴儿食品，婴儿肥皂制造商谁希望自己的产品做广告浇英寸
  • Refuse politely any cold drink from an unknown source. 来自未知源谢绝任何冷饮。

SEE> pre·sum·a·bly 想必, un·clear , sup·pos·ed·ly

ODE> Not known or familiar. – undisclosed, unrevealed, undivulged, untold, unspecified, secret, mysterious, dark, hidden, concealed.

1984. un·less 除非 ## 6

[ən’les]conj.除非；如果不prep.除 … 外

  • It immediately ran away when she saw it, and experts confirmed that a puma will not attack a human being unless it is cornered. 它就立刻逃走了，当她看见了，专家证实，除非被逼得走投无路，美洲狮不会攻击人类。
  • You play to win, and the game has little meaning unless you do your utmost to win. 你玩赢，比赛就没有什么意义，除非你竭尽全力获胜。
  • The majority of the patients attending the medical out-patients departments of our hospitals feel that they have not received adequate treatment unless they are able to carry home with them some tangible remedy in the shape of a bottle of medicine, a box of pills, or a small jar of ointment, and the doctor in charge of the department is only too ready to provide them with these requirements. 大多数参加我们医院的医疗门诊科室的患者觉得自己没有得到足够的治疗，除非他们能够带回家与他们一些实实在在的补救一瓶药，药丸盒的形状，或药膏的小罐子，医生主管部门的也非常乐意为他们提供这些要求。

SEE> if 如果, oth·er·wise 否则, can·not 不能

ODE> Except if (used to introduce the case in which a statement being made is not true or valid) –

1985. un·like 不像 ## 4

[ˌʌn’laɪk]adj.不同的，不相似的prep.不像，与…不同；与 … 平时不同

  • Moreover, unlike some of the other insect eaters, spiders never do the least harm to us or our belongings. 此外，不同于其他食虫动物，蜘蛛丝毫不危害我们和我们的财物。
  • Many of these obligations can give rise to problems and complications but a bank customer, unlike, say, a buyer of goods, cannot complain that the law is loaded against him. 许多这样的义务可以产生问题和纠纷，但银行的客户，不同的是，说，货物的买主，无法抱怨法律对自己不利。
  • William S. Hart was, perhaps, the greatest of all Western stars, for unlike Gary Cooper and John Wayne he appeared in nothing but Westerns. 威廉·哈特，也许，西部电影明星中，对于不同加里·库珀和约翰·韦恩，他出现在什么，但西部片。

SEE> though 虽然, in·stance 例子, where·as 而

ODE> Different from; not similar to. – different from, unalike, dissimilar to, not like, not similar to, not resembling, far from, far apart from, distant from.

1986. un·like·ly 不太可能 ## 2

[ʌn’laɪkli]adj.不太可能的

  • As it happens, a razor that is safe in Europe is unlikely to electrocute Americans. 碰巧，一个剃须刀是欧洲安全是不大可能使美国人触电。
  • It later became apparent that rabbits were developing a degree of resistance to this disease, so that the rabbit population was unlikely to be completely exterminated. 后来，明显看出，兔子被开发的程度对本病的阻力，从而使兔子不可能被完全消灭。

SEE> like·ly 可能的, in·deed 确实, might 也许

ODE> Not likely to happen, be done, or be true; improbable. – improbable, not likely, doubtful, dubious, unexpected, beyond belief, implausible.

1987. un·luck·y 不幸的 ## 4

[ʌn’lʌki]adj.倒霉的；不幸的；不吉利的

  • Some fishermen are unlucky. 有些垂钓者就是不走运。
  • In the early morning, the food that had been laid out for the dead is thrown into a river or into the sea as it is considered unlucky for anyone living to eat it. 清晨，人们便把为死者摆放的食品扔进河中或因为它被认为是不吉利的生活的人吃了大海。
  • Latham made another attempt a week later and got within half a mile of Dover, but he was unlucky again. 莱瑟姆作了一次尝试一个星期后和多佛不到半英里之内得到的，但是他又是不幸的。

SEE> for·tu·nate , luck·y 幸运, luck·i·ly

ODE> Having, bringing, or resulting from bad luck. – unfortunate, luckless, out of luck, down on one’s luck, hapless, ill-fated, ill-starred, star-crossed, blighted, unhappy, unsuccessful, wretched, miserable, poor, pitiful.

1988. un·pleas·ant 不愉快 ## 10

[ʌn’pleznt]adj.使人不愉快的；讨厌的；不合意的；不友好的，粗鲁的

  • A flight attendant would take charge of me and I never had an unpleasant experience. 一位空中乘务员照顾我，我从未有过不愉快的经历。
  • He was greeted by an unpleasant smell which convinced him that I was telling the truth. 他被这让他相信我说的是真话难闻的气味招呼。
  • To compensate for his unpleasant experiences in hospital, the man drank a little more than was good for him. 为了补偿他住院期间的不愉快的经历，那人喝得多一点，对他好。

SEE> ir·ri·tat·ing 恼人的, aw·ful 糟糕的, frightening 可怕的

ODE> Causing discomfort, unhappiness, or revulsion; disagreeable. – disagreeable, irksome, troublesome, annoying, irritating, vexatious, displeasing, uncomfortable, distressing, nasty, horrible, appalling, terrible, awful, dreadful, hateful, detestable, miserable, abominable, execrable, odious, invidious, objectionable, offensive, obnoxious, repugnant, repulsive, repellent, revolting, disgusting, distasteful, nauseating, unsavoury, unpalatable, ugly.

1989. un·ti·dy 凌乱 ## 2

[ʌn’taɪdi]adj.不整齐的；懒散的

  • This bedroom’s very untidy. 这间卧室很凌乱。
  • This room’s very untidy. 这个房间很凌乱。

ODE> Not arranged neatly and in order. – disordered, messy, in a mess, disorderly, disorganized, in disorder, in confusion, confused, cluttered, in a clutter, mixed up, in a muddle, muddled, in a jumble, jumbled, in chaos, chaotic, haywire, topsy-turvy, in disarray, awry, askew, upside down, upset, disrupted, at sixes and sevens.

1990. un·til 直到 ## 33

[ən’tɪl]prep.直到 … 的时候；在…以前；直到…为止conj.直到 … 时候才 …；在…之前；直到…的程度；直到…为止

  • I sometimes stay in bed until lunchtime. 我有时会留在床上，直到中午。
  • The young man did not wake up until the bed had struck the ground. 年轻人没有醒过来，直到床撞到地上。
  • Every time he wanted to come into the garden he would bark until someone opened the gate. 他希望每一次来到这个花园，他会吠叫，直到有人把门打开。

SEE> a·gain 再次, be·fore 在之前, when 什么时候

ODE> Up to (the point in time or the event mentioned) – till, up to, up till, up until, as late as, up to the time of, up to the time that, until such time as, pending.

1991. un·u·su·al 异常 ## 8

[ʌn’juːʒuəl]adj.异常的；独特的；与众不同的

  • Captain Ben Fawcett has bought an unusual taxi and has begun a new service. 弗西特机长买了一个不寻常的出租汽车，并开始了新的服务。
  • Since then, Captain Fawcett has flown passengers to many unusual places. 自那时以来，福塞特上尉空运乘客到过许多不寻常的地方。
  • The explanation was simple but very unusual. 解释很简单，但非常不寻常的。

SEE> un·com·mon , in·stance 例子, pe·cu·li·ar

ODE> Not habitually or commonly occurring or done. – uncommon, abnormal, atypical, unexpected, surprising, unfamiliar, unwonted, different.

1992. up 上 ## 171

[ʌp]adv.向上；起来；上升；往上prep.向上adj.向上的；上行的n.上升v.上升；增加

  • Hurry up, Sam! 快点，萨姆！
  • You are better now, but you mustn’t get up yet. 你现在好些了，但你不能起床。
  • He can get up for about two hours each day, but you must keep the room warm. 他可以起床，每天约两个小时，但您必须保持房间温暖。

SEE> out 出, put 放, down 下

ODE> Towards a higher place or position. – up, upward, uphill, towards a higher level, to the top.

1993. up·on 在上面 ## 21

[ə’pɑːn]prep.在 … 上；紧接着；逼近

  • You forget that I was a medical student once upon a time.’ 你忘了我以前是学医仙界“。
  • She entered the station twenty minutes before the train was due, since her parents had impressed upon her that it would be unforgivable to miss it and cause the friends with whom she was going to stay to make two journeys to meet her. 她进了车站二十分钟车前是由于，因为她的父母对她印象深刻，这将是不可原谅错过它和谁在一起，她要留进行两次旅行，以满足她引起朋友。
  • In the organization of industrial life the influence of the factory upon the physiological and mental state of the workers has been completely neglected. 在工业生活的组织中，工厂对工人的生理和精神状态的影响完全被忽视了。

SEE> lat·ter 后者, in·stead 代替, thus 如此

1994. up·set 烦恼 ## 3

[ʌp’set]adj.心烦的；苦恼的；不安的；不适的v.推翻；翻倒；颠覆；打乱；使心烦n.混乱；推翻

  • I had just lost ￡50 and I felt very upset. 我刚刚丢了£50，我感到非常烦恼。
  • George was not too upset by his experience because the lady who owns the sweet shop heard about his troubles and rewarded him with a large box of chocolates. 乔治是不是太用他的经验伤心，因为谁拥有糖果店老板娘听说了他遇到的麻烦，并与巧克力的一大盒，赏给他。
  • Parents are often upset when their children praise the homes of their friends and regard it as a slur on their own cooking, or cleaning, or furniture, and often are foolish enough to let the adolescents see that they are annoyed. 父母常常心烦意乱时，他们的孩子赞扬自己朋友的家，并把它作为自己做饭一个污点，卫生，或家具，而且是愚蠢的，足以让孩子看出自己的烦恼。

SEE> sur·prised 惊讶, stunned , shocked 震惊

ODE> Make (someone) unhappy, disappointed, or worried. – distress, trouble, perturb, disturb, discompose, unsettle, disconcert, discountenance, dismay, disquiet, worry, bother, inconvenience, agitate, fluster, throw, ruffle, unnerve, shake, frighten, alarm, anger, annoy, irritate, vex, irk, fret, pester, harass, torment, plague, hurt, grieve.

1995. up·stairs 楼上 ## 5

[ˌʌp’sterz]adv.在楼上；往楼上；在高处；头脑上n.楼上adj.楼上的；上层的

  • Come upstairs and see it. 到楼上去看它。
  • Come upstairs. 上楼。
  • He’s upstairs. 他在楼上。

SEE> down·stairs 楼下, bed·room 卧室, room 房间

1996. up·ward 向上 ## 2

[’ʌpwərd]adj.向上的；上升的adv.向上；上升

  • Errors and uncertainties multiply, cascading upward through a chain of turbulent features, from dust devils and squalls up to continent-size eddies that only satellites can see. 错误和不可靠性，通过链条的动荡特性，从尘暴级联向上和暴风发展到大陆，大小漩涡，只有卫星上可以看到。
  • The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards, as well as in the line of its course, are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings sufficient sustenance and progress. 空气船舶的墙壁直接向上，以及在其过程中的线路中的电流，足以给其巨大的翅膀足够的支撑力和前进的巨大鸟。

SEE> down·ward 向下, up·wards 向上, trend 趋势

ODE> Towards a higher place, point, or level. – up, upward, uphill, towards a higher level, to the top.

1997. ur·gent 紧急的 ## 3

[’ɜːrdʒənt]adj.紧急的；急迫的；坚持要求的

  • Is it urgent? 急吗？
  • It’s very urgent. 这是非常紧迫的。
  • Up to now, Mr.Scott has sent a great many requests for spare parts and other urgent messages from one garage to the other. 截至目前，Mr.Scott已派出备件的信件和其他紧急了大量索取从一个汽车到另一个。

SEE> pre·cede , urgently , im·me·di·ate 立即

ODE> Requiring immediate action or attention. – acute, grave, pressing, dire, desperate, critical, crucial, sore, serious, intense, crying, burning, compelling, drastic, extreme.

1998. use 使用 ## 79

[juːs]n.使用；用法；使用权；运用v.利用；对待；使用； 吸（烟）；服用（毒品）

  • The airport was built years ago, but for some reason it could not be used then. 机场是许多年前建的，但由于某种原因不能再使用。
  • Last year, however, it came into use. 然而去年，开始使用了。
  • However, they have decided to use the post office. 然而，他们已经决定利用邮局。

SEE> used 用过的, al·low 允许, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> Take, hold, or deploy (something) as a means of accomplishing or achieving something; employ. – utilize, make use of, avail oneself of, employ, work, operate, wield, ply, apply, manoeuvre, manipulate, put to use, put into service, find a use for, resort to.

1999. use·ful 有用 ## 9

[’juːsfl]adj.有用的；有益的；实用的

  • He has pointed out that the tree is a useful source of income, as tourists have been coming from all parts of the country to see it. 他指出，这棵树是收入的有效来源，游客已经从全国各地来看望它。
  • Indeed they can have a delightful surprise when they find something useful which they did not know they owned. 事实上，他们可以有一个愉快的惊喜，当他们发现一些有用的东西，他们不知道自己拥有。
  • They are often more industrious, useful citizens than those who are never late. 他们往往是谁比那些从不迟到更勤奋有用的公民。

SEE> help·ful 有帮助, prac·ti·cal 实际的, im·por·tant·ly 重要的

ODE> Able to be used for a practical purpose or in several ways. – functional, practical, handy, neat, convenient, utilitarian, utility, helpful, applicable, serviceable, of use, of service.

2000. u·su·al 通常 ## 10

[’juːʒuəl]adj.通常的；惯常的；惯例的

  • As usual, the police will have a difficult time. 像往常一样，警方将有一个艰难的时刻。
  • It was warm last Sunday, so I went and sat on the river bank as usual. 它上星期日天气很暖和，所以我走过去坐在河堤上如常。
  • One Monday, there were fewer people in the shop than usual when the woman came in, so it was easier for the detective to watch her. 一个星期一，还有人在店里比平时少当女人走了进来，所以它更容易为侦探监视她。

SEE> typ·i·cal 典型, ra·ther 相当, nor·mal·ly 通常

ODE> Habitually or typically occurring or done; customary. – habitual, customary, accustomed, wonted, normal, routine, regular, constant, standard, typical, established, recognized, set, fixed, settled, stock, conventional, traditional, orthodox, accepted, expected, predictable, familiar, average, general, ordinary, everyday, daily, quotidian.

2001. u·su·al·ly 通常 ## 19

[’juːʒuəli]adv.通常；经常

  • In the afternoon, she usually sees her friends. 下午，她总是会见她的朋友。
  • Mr. Sawyer usually reads his newspaper, but sometimes he and his wife watch television. 索耶先生总是读报纸，但有时和他的妻子一起看电视。
  • Mrs. Sawyer usually stays at home in the morning, but this morning, she is going to the shops. 索耶夫人通常是呆在家里的早晨，但今天上午，她正去商店买东西。

SEE> typ·i·cal·ly 一般, nor·mal·ly 通常, of·ten 经常

ODE> Under normal conditions; generally. – normally, generally, habitually, customarily, standardly, routinely, regularly, typically, ordinarily, commonly, conventionally, traditionally, historically.

2002. val·ley 山谷 ## 9

[’væli]n.山谷；溪谷；流域

  • Our village is in a valley. 我们的村庄坐落在一个山谷。
  • You soar effortlessly over high mountains and deep valleys. 你毫不费劲地飞越高山和深谷。
  • I had come ten miles since leaving the town, and at this point, according to my father, I should be looking at farms and cottages in a valley, with the spire of the church of our village showing in the far distance. 从小镇我了10英里，而在这一点上，根据我的父亲，我应该寻找一个山谷，有农场与村舍，与我们村在远远望见教堂的塔尖。

SEE> ar·e·a 区域, a·long 沿着, riv·er 河

ODE> A low area of land between hills or mountains, typically with a river or stream flowing through it. – dale, vale.

2003. val·u·a·ble 有价值的 ## 3

[’væljuəbl]adj.贵重的；宝贵的n.(pl.)贵重物品

  • They were expecting a valuable parcel of diamonds from South Africa. 他们正期待从南非钻石贵重包裹。
  • The most valuable find of all was the ship’s log book, parts of which it was still possible to read. 其中最有价值的是船上的航海日志，其中有一部分仍然清晰可读。
  • If parents were prepared for this adolescent reaction, and realized that it was a sign that the child was growing up and developing valuable powers of observation and independent judgment, they would not be so hurt, and therefore would not drive the child into opposition by resenting and resisting it. 如果家长对青少年的这种反应准备，并且意识到这是一个迹象，表明孩子正在成长和发展的观察和独立判断有价值的权力，他们就不会感到如此伤心，所以也就不会由于怨恨而把孩子推到对立面和抵御它。

SEE> use·ful 有用, im·por·tant·ly 重要的, in·val·u·a·ble

2004. val·ue 价值 ## 6

[’væljuː]n.价值；价格；重要性；(pl)价值观；数值v.估价；重视；评价

  • In spite of this, many people are confident that ‘The Revealer’ may reveal something of value fairly soon. 尽管如此，很多人仍然相信“探宝器”很快就会探出值钱的东西。
  • Though it may be possible to measure the value of material goods in terms of money, it is extremely difficult to estimate the true value of the services which people perform for us. 虽然有可能来衡量物质产品的在金钱方面的价值，这是非常难以估算别人为我们所提供的服务的真正价值。
  • Nothing of value was found, but the numerous items which were brought to the surface proved to be of great interest. 什么值钱的东西被发现，但打捞出来的众多的物品被证明是极大的兴趣。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, in·stance 例子, ex·am·ple 例子

ODE> The regard that something is held to deserve; the importance, worth, or usefulness of something. – merit, worth, usefulness, use, utility, practicality, advantage, desirability, benefit, gain, profit, good, service, help, helpfulness, assistance, effectiveness, efficacy, avail, importance, significance, point, sense.

2005. va·ri·e·ty 品种 ## 8

[və’raɪəti]n.多样；种类；多样化n.杂耍

  • The fish are not sharks or killer whales, but favourite eating varieties like cod and skate which grow to unnatural sizes, sometimes as much as twelve feet in length. 这些鱼并不是鲨鱼或逆戟鲸，而是深受人们喜爱的食用鱼品种，如鳕鱼和鳐它们长得出奇地大，有时长达12英尺长。
  • There is so much variety that you never have to make do with second best. 有如此多的品种，你永远不必凑合着第二个最好的。
  • By comparison, ferry trips or cruises offer a great variety of civilized comforts. 相比之下，坐船旅行或环游可以得到文明世界的各种享受。

SEE> var·i·ous 各种, var·ied 多种, ad·di·tion 加

ODE> The quality or state of being different or diverse; the absence of uniformity or monotony. – diversity, variation, diversification, multifariousness, heterogeneity, variegation, many-sidedness, change, difference.

2006. var·i·ous 各种 ## 8

[’veriəs]adj.各种各样的

  • A great many goods were sent to the exhibition from various parts of the world. 大量的商品从世界各地运送到了展览。
  • Cooked in wine, snails are a great luxury in various parts of the world. 用酒烹调蜗牛，在世界各地有很大的奢侈品。
  • It had been baked by a college student who had used over 1,000 pounds of flour, 800 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of fat, and 400 pounds of various other ingredients. 它是由一个大学生谁使用了超过1000磅面粉，800磅食糖，200磅动物脂肪及400磅其他各种原料出炉。

2007. var·y 变化 ## 5

[’veri]v.改变；变化；使多样化

  • To varying degrees, we all have secrets which we do not want even our closest friends to learn, but few of us have skeletons in the cupboard. 在不同程度上，我们都有，我们不希望连我们最亲密的朋友知道的秘密，但是却极少有人有柜中骷髅。
  • The action he takes varies according to the nature of the complaint. 他采取的行动因该投诉的性质不同而不同。
  • Every solid object will reflect a sound, varying according to the size and nature of the object. 每个固态物体将反射声音，改变根据对象的大小和性质。

SEE> dif·fer , var·ied 多种, typ·i·cal·ly 一般

ODE> Differ in size, amount, degree, or nature from something else of the same general class. – differ, be different, be unlike, be dissimilar.

2008. vast 广大 ## 2

  • But other suns, start as the astronomers call them, are bound to have planets like our own, and as is the number of stars in the universe is so vast, this possibility becomes virtual certainty. 但是，其他的太阳，既天文学家所说的，也必然有行星就像我们自己，并且是在宇宙中恒星的数目极其庞大，所以这种可能性是肯定无疑的。
  • Although perhaps only 1 per cent of the life that has started somewhere will develop into highly complex and intelligent patterns, so vast is the number of planets, that intelligent life is bound to be a natural part of the universe. 虽然可能只有1％在某处已经开始将发展成高度复杂，有智慧的型式生命的份额，如此巨大的行星的数目，有智力的生命必然是宇宙的自然组成部分。

  • The lorry was loaded with empty beer bottles and hundreds of them slid off the back of the vehicle and on to the road. 卡车上装着空啤酒瓶，成百只滑出车的后面，落在马路上。
  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。
  • Ever since, people have had difficulty in deciding whether the craft should be ranged among ships, planes, or land vehicles – for it is something in between a boat and an aircraft. 从那时起，人们不得不在决定是否工艺应中的舰艇，飞机或陆地车辆被测距困难 - 因为它是介于船和飞机之间。

2011. ver·ti·cal 垂直 ## 2

[’vɜːrtɪkl]adj.垂直的；纵向的；顶点的n.垂直物；垂直的位置

  • The slope averages about 1 in 30, but contains steep, probably vertical, cliffs, and gentle sediment-covered terraces, and near its lower reaches there is a long tailing-off which is almost certainly the result of material transported out to deep water after being eroded from the continental masses. 大约在30 1坡度平均，但其中包括陡峭的，乃至垂直的峭壁，温柔沉积物覆盖的露台，并接近其下游还有很长的拖尾过这几乎肯定是材料后运出深水结果从大陆块体被侵蚀。
  • The basic features include a crest (the highest point of the wave), a trough (the lowest point), a height (the vertical distance from the trough to the crest), a wave length (the horizontal distance between two wave crests), and a period (which is the time it takes a wave crest to travel one wave length). 的基本特征包括浪峰（波的最高点），波谷（最低点），高度（从波谷到波峰的垂直距离），波长（两个波峰之间的水平距离），和周期（这是它需要一个波峰到旅行一个波长的时间）。

  • If the landscape is hidden from view, you can enjoy the extraordinary sight of unbroken cloud plains that stretch out for miles before you, while the sun shines brilliantly in a clear sky. 如果景色被遮住了，你可以观赏一下展现在伸出你之前英里完整的云平原，而太阳在晴朗的天空灿烂。

2016. vi·o·lent 暴力的 ## 3

[’vaɪələnt]adj.猛烈的；强烈的；暴力的；极端的

  • Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents. 喜剧演员在横死和严重事故这类悲剧家们的笑话。

  • In his own lifetime Galileo was the centre of violent controversy; but the scientific dust has long since settled, and today we can see even his famous clash with the Inquisition in something like its proper perspective. 在伽利略在世时是激烈论战的中心;但科学的尘埃早已解决，今天我们可以在类似的适当的角度看待他那著名冲突，宗教裁判所。

[’vaɪələntli]adv.猛烈地；强烈地；暴力地

  • Tazieff was able to set up his camp very close to the volcano while it was erupting violently. 塔捷耶夫能够非常接近设立他的阵营火山，同时它猛烈地喷发。
  • Both men had hardly had time to realize what was happening when they were thrown violently into the sea. 他们两个还没来得及意识到，当他们被猛地抛入海中发生了什么事。
  • The study of custom can be profitable only after certain preliminary propositions have been accepted, and some of these propositions have been violently opposed. 风俗的研究可以盈利只有在某些基本的主张被接受，有些主张被激烈反对。

2018. vis·i·ble 可见 ## 2

[’vɪzəbl]adj.看得见的；可见的；显而易见的

  • Gradually the river grows wider, the banks recede, the waters flow more quietly, and in the end, without any visible break, they become merged in the sea, and painlessly lose their individual being. 渐渐地，河面变宽，两岸后撤，河水流得平缓起来，最后，没有任何明显的突破，他们成为融入了大海，毫无痛苦地失去了自我的存在。
  • Any ship that crosses the Pacific is accompanied for many days by the smaller albatross, which may keep company with the vessel for an hour without visible or more than occasional movement of wing. 跨越太平洋的船只是由较小的信天翁，这样可以保持公司与容器一小时不可见或超过翼的运动偶尔伴随着许多天。
