2019. vi·sion 视力 ## 4

[’vɪʒn]n.视力；视觉；幻觉；眼光；洞察力；想象力v.幻想；设想

  • One case concerns an eleven-year-old schoolgirl, Vera Petrova, who has normal vision but who can also perceive things with different parts of her skin, and through solid walls. 有一起案件涉及一个11岁的女学生，维拉佩特洛娃，谁拥有正常视力，但谁也能感知的东西和她皮肤的不同部位，并通过坚实的墙壁。
  • There is no sky in June so blue that it does not point forward to a bluer, no sunset so beautiful that it does not waken the vision of a greater beauty, a vision which passes before it is fully glimpsed, and in passing leaves an indefinable longing and regret. 有一个在六月蔚蓝的天空，它不向前指向一个更蓝，落日美丽的，它并没有唤醒的一个更加绚丽的视觉，这传递之前它完全瞥见一个愿景，并在消逝中给人留下一种说不清渴望和遗憾。
  • I have heard of writers who read nothing but their own books; like adolescents they stand before the mirror, and still cannot fathom the exact outline of the vision before them. 我听说谁读什么，但自己的书作家;像少年，站在镜前，仍然无法捉摸他们之前的视野的准确轮廓。

SEE> per·spec·tive , mind 心神, in·deed 确实

ODE> The faculty or state of being able to see. – eyesight, sight, power of sight, faculty of sight, ability to see, power of seeing, powers of observation, observation, perception, visual perception.

2020. vis·it 访问 ## 28

[’vɪzɪt]v.拜访；参观；闲谈n.拜访；参观；聊天

  • At what time of year did Ken visit Paris? 在一年中什么时候做肯访问巴黎的？
  • I visited museums and sat in public gardens. 我参观了博物馆，还去了公园。
  • He is working for a big firm and he has already visited a great number of different places in Australia. 他正在为一家大公司，他已经去过澳大利亚的不少地方的大数目。

SEE> trip 旅行, here 这里, ar·rive 到达

ODE> Go to see and spend time with (someone) socially. – call on, call in on, pay a call on, pay a visit to, pay someone a call, pay someone a visit, go to see, come to see, look in on.

2021. vis·i·tor 游客 ## 11

[’vɪzɪtər]n.参观者；访问者；访客

  • Visitors have been asked to keep the woods clean and tidy. 游客已被告知要保持树林的整洁。
  • Recently it was damaged by a visitor. 它最近被一个客人弄坏了。
  • Because the tree was mentioned in a newspaper, the number of visitors to Frinley has now increased. 因为树是在报上提到，来弗林利参观的人数已经增加。

SEE> tour·ist 游客, at·trac·tion 引力, in·stance 例子

ODE> A person visiting someone or somewhere, especially socially or as a tourist. – guest, caller.

2022. voice 嗓音 ## 8

[vɔɪs]n.声音；嗓音；[语]语态；发言权；意见vt.表达；[语]发音；[音]调音

  • Suddenly, they heard a voice behind them. 突然，他们听到身后有声音。
  • ‘Mr. Harmsworth,’ I said in a weak voice. ’先生。哈姆斯沃思，”我无力地说。
  • I picked up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice of Helen Bates. 我用两个沾满面糊的手指拿起听筒，当我听出是海伦·贝茨的声音感到沮丧。

SEE> sing·ing 唱歌, tone 音调, in·deed 确实

ODE> The sound produced in a person’s larynx and uttered through the mouth, as speech or song. – power of speech.

2023. vol·ume 体积 ## 3

[’vɑːljuːm]n.卷；体积；册；音量；容量

  • We keep trying all four methods, but the sheer volume of rubbish we produce worldwide threatens to overwhelm us. 我们一直在试这四种方法，但垃圾的绝对数量，我们的全球生产威胁压倒我们。
  • Lawn mowers whining on a summer’s day, late-night parties in apartment blocks, noisy neighbours, vehicles of all kinds, especially large container trucks thundering through quiet villages, planes and helicopters flying overhead, large radios carried round in public places and played at maximum volume. 割草机呜呜作响的夏天的一天，深夜方在公寓楼，吵闹的邻居，各式各样的车辆，特别是大型集装箱卡车穿越寂静的村庄，飞机和直升机轰鸣飞过，大型收音机进行全面在公共场所和最大发挥体积。
  • He mentally visualizes a complex form from all round itself; he knows while he looks at one side what the other side is like; he identifies himself with its centre of gravity, its mass, its weight; he realizes its volume, as the space that the shape displaces in the air. 他的大脑从全面本身就是一个复杂的形式;他知道当他看着一面是什么对方等;他把自己与形体的重心，它的质量，它的重量;他意识到物体的体积，其形状在空气中所占的空间。

SEE> re·spec·tive·ly , in·stance 例子, more·o·ver 此外

ODE> A book forming part of a work or series. – book, publication, tome, hardback, paperback, softback, work, opus, title, treatise, manual, almanac, compendium.

2024. wait 等待 ## 20

[weɪt]v.等；等待n.等待；等候

  • Can’t you wait till this afternoon? 你就不能等到今天下午吗？
  • I can wait, but my toothache can’t! 我可以等待，但我的牙痛等不了啊！
  • The plane was late and detectives were waiting at the airport all morning. 飞机晚点了，侦探们在机场等了一个上午。

SEE> come 来, an·y·way 无论如何, go 去

ODE> Stay where one is or delay action until a particular time or event. – stand by, hold back, be patient, bide one’s time, hang fire, mark time, kill time, waste time, cool one’s heels, kick one’s heels, twiddle one’s thumbs.

2025. wake 唤醒 ## 15

[weɪk]v.醒来；唤醒；意识到n.航迹；守夜

  • In the middle of the night, two boys woke up and began shouting. 在半夜里，两个孩子醒了，大声叫了。
  • When she woke up a day later, she found herself in hospital. 当她醒来一天后，她发现自己躺在医院里。
  • The young man did not wake up until the bed had struck the ground. 年轻人没有醒过来，直到床撞到地上。

SEE> fol·low·ing 接着, in·deed 确实, come 来

ODE> Emerge or cause to emerge from sleep; stop sleeping. – awake, awaken, waken, waken up, rouse, stir, come to, come around.

2026. walk 走 ## 23

[wɔːk]v.步行；陪…走；散步；偷走；走过n.步行；散步；人行道

  • They are walking over the bridge. 他们正在过桥。
  • My wife and I are walking along the banks of the river. 我和妻子沿河岸上散步。
  • On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods. 周日，数百人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林散步。

SEE> walk·ing 步行, go 去, stroll

ODE> Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once. – stroll, saunter, amble, wend one’s way, trudge, plod, hike, tramp, trek, march, stride, troop, patrol, step out, wander, ramble, tread, prowl, footslog, promenade, roam, traipse.

2027. wall 墙壁 ## 24

[wɔːl]n.墙壁；垣；墙状物v.围住；隔开；演戏般地转动(眼睛)

  • The pictures are on the wall. 这些照片挂在墙上。
  • ‘I’m hanging this picture on the wall,’ I answered. “我挂在墙上这幅画，”我回答。
  • I tried to wake up my wife by ringing the doorbell, but she was fast asleep, so I got a ladder from the shed in the garden, put it against the wall, and began climbing towards the bedroom window. 我试着按响了门铃，试图唤醒我的妻子，但她睡得很熟，所以我在花园里接到了棚里拿来一架梯子，把它靠在墙边，开始攀爬向卧室的窗口。

SEE> street 街, in·side 内, once 一次

ODE> A continuous vertical brick or stone structure that encloses or divides an area of land. – barrier, partition, room divider, enclosure, screen, panel, separator.

2028. wal·let 钱包 ## 8

[’wɑːlɪt]n.皮夹；钱包

  • Sam Benton, the local butcher, had lost his wallet while taking his savings to the post office. 萨姆顿当地的屠户，而把存款送往邮局丢失了钱包。
  • Sam was sure that the wallet must have been found by one of the villagers, but it was not returned to him. 萨姆确信那钱包一定是被发现的村民之一，但它并没有还给他。
  • Three months passed, and then one morning, Sam found his wallet outside his front door. 三个月过去了，后来在一天早晨，萨姆发现他的钱包自己的大门外。

SEE> back·pack , bag 袋, hers 她的

ODE> A pocket-sized flat folding case for holding money and plastic cards. – notecase, purse, pouch, pochette.

2029. wan·der 漫步 ## 4

[’wɑːndər]vi.漫步；蜿蜒；迷路；闲逛；徘徊vt.漫步于n.漫游；徘徊；闲逛

  • During a bullfight, a drunk suddenly wandered into the middle of the ring. 在斗牛时，一个醉汉突然溜达到环的中间。
  • The dogs have greater freedom, too, for they are allowed to wander outside their enclosure. 狗也比较自由，也为他们被允许围栏，四处遛达。
  • In those days wandering minstrels were welcome everywhere. 在那些日子里，吟游诗人到处受欢迎。

SEE> stroll , stum·ble , pop·u·late

ODE> Walk or move in a leisurely or aimless way. – stroll, amble, saunter, walk, dawdle, potter, ramble, maunder, meander.

2030. want 想要 ## 76

[wɑːnt]v.要；想要；通缉n.缺乏；贫穷；需求品

  • Which book does the man want? 哪本书的人想要什么？
  • Which glasses does the man want? 哪几只？男人想要？
  • Do you want a cup? 你想要一杯吗？

SEE> know 知道, should 应该, do 做

ODE> Have a desire to possess or do (something); wish for. – desire, wish for, hope for, fancy, have a fancy for, take a fancy to, have an inclination for, care for, like, set one’s heart on.

2031. war 战争 ## 12

[wɔːr]n.战争；斗争v.作战；斗争

  • When he had killed the guard, the prisoner of war quickly dragged him into the bushes. 当他杀死了卫兵，战俘迅速地把尸体拖进了灌木丛。
  • Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other, Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded. 每当意大利城邦在战争与对方，霍克沃德用于雇佣他的士兵诸侯谁愿意付出高昂的代价，他的要求。
  • He had been obliged to join the army during the Second World War. 他曾被迫在二战期间参军。

SEE> con·flict 冲突, dur·ing 在期间, bat·tle 战斗

ODE> A state of armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country. – conflict, warfare, combat, fighting, struggle, armed conflict, action, military action, bloodshed, contest, tussle.

2032. warm 暖 ## 15

[wɔːrm]adj.温暖的；暖和的；热情的v.变暖；使暖和n.温暖的空气

  • It’s always warm in April and May, but it rains sometimes. 它总是温暖的四月和五月，但有时下雨。
  • Is it cold or warm in autumn? 它是在秋季冷还是暖？
  • It’s always warm in September and October. 它总是温暖在九月和十月。

SEE> cool 凉爽的, chil·ly , cold 寒冷的

ODE> Of or at a fairly or comfortably high temperature. – hot, warming.

2033. warn·ing 警告 ## 2

[’wɔːrnɪŋ]n.警告；警报；预兆adj.警告的；告诫的

  • We needed no further warning. 我们不需要进一步的警告。
  • An earthquake comes like a thief in the night, without warning. 地震就像夜间的小偷，不打招呼。

SEE> warn 警告, a·lert , threat 威胁

ODE> A statement or event that warns of something or that serves as a cautionary example. – example, deterrent, lesson, caution, exemplar, message, moral.

2034. wash 洗 ## 7

[wɑːʃ]n.洗；洗涤v.洗；洗涤；洗清

  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。
  • Occasionally, unusual creatures are washed to the shore, but they are rarely caught out at sea. 偶尔，一些罕见的动物被冲到岸上来，但它们在海上很少能被捕捉到。
  • Have you ever put your trousers in the washing machine and then remembered there was a large bank note in your back pocket? 你有没有把你的裤子在洗衣机，然后又想在你的背部口袋大面值的纸币？

SEE> like·wise , when·ev·er 每当, brush 刷子

ODE> Clean with water and, typically, soap or detergent. – clean, cleanse, sponge, scrub, wipe, scour.

2035. waste 浪费 ## 9

[weɪst]n.废物；浪费；荒地v.浪费；滥用；消耗adj.荒芜的；无用的；浪费的

  • ‘It’s a waste of time.’ “这是在浪费时间。”
  • Some things are collected deliberately in the home in an attempt to avoid waste. 有些东西是故意收集在家里，企图避免浪费。
  • It is hard for energetic, quick-minded people to waste time, so they are often tempted to finish a job before setting out to keep an appointment. 这是精力充沛，思维敏捷的人浪费时间，因此他们常想做完一件事后再去赴约之前。

SEE> dis·pos·al , recycling , gar·bage 垃圾

ODE> Use or expend carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose. – squander, fritter away, misspend, misuse, spend recklessly, throw away, lavish, be wasteful with, dissipate, spend like water, throw around like confetti.

2036. watch 看着 ## 27

[wɑːtʃ]v.注视；看守；观看n.手表；监视；看守；值班

  • Mr. Sawyer usually reads his newspaper, but sometimes he and his wife watch television. 索耶先生总是读报纸，但有时和他的妻子一起看电视。
  • I looked at my watch. 我看了看表。
  • A detective recently watched a well-dressed woman who always went into a large store on Monday mornings. 一名侦探最近看了一个衣冠楚楚的女人谁总是进入一家大商店在星期一上午。

SEE> wait 等待, look 看, sure 当然

ODE> Look at or observe attentively over a period of time. – observe, view, look at, eye, gaze at, stare at, gape at, peer at.

2037. wa·ter 水 ## 73

[’wɔːtər]n.水；海域；雨水；海水v.给 … 浇水；给 … 供水；加水稀释；充满眼泪；给…水喝

  • There is a boy in the water. 有一个在水中的男孩。
  • Is there any water in this kettle? 有没有在这水壶里有水？
  • I must water the garden first. 首先我必须花园浇水。

SEE> sup·ply 供应, well 好, clean 清洁

ODE> A colourless, transparent, odourless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms. – aqua.

2038. wave 波浪 ## 37

[weɪv]n.波浪；波纹；波v.挥动；飘动

  • That policeman’s waving to you. 那个警察向你招手。
  • On the way, a young man waved to me. 在路上，一个年轻人向我招手。
  • It was no use pretending that I had not seen him, so I waved to him. 这是没有用假装我从来没有见过他，所以我向他招手。

SEE> surge , wake 唤醒, mas·sive 大规模的

ODE> Move one’s hand to and fro in greeting or as a signal. – gesture, gesticulate, signal, sign, beckon, indicate, motion, nod, bid.

2039. way 方式 ## 88

[weɪ]n.路；路线；方法；方式；作风；样子；方向；出入通道；距离；时间段；地区；方面；情况adv.非常；远远地adj.途中的，中途的

  • On the way home, my wife said to me, ’Don’t drive so quickly! 在回家的路上，我的妻子对我说，“不要这么快开车！
  • She does not know London very well, and she lost her way. 她不知道伦敦非常好，她迷路了。
  • ‘I can ask him the way,’ she said to herself. “我可以向他问路，”她对自己说。

SEE> so 所以, what 什么, e·ven 甚至

ODE> A method, style, or manner of doing something; an optional or alternative form of action. – method, course of action, process, procedure, technique, system.

2040. we 我们 ## 570

[wi]pron.我们

  • No, we are not. 不，我们不是。
  • We are Danish. 我们是丹麦人。
  • Our cases are brown. 我们的箱子是棕色的。

SEE> know 知道, think 想, they 他们

ODE> Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together. –

2041. weak 弱 ## 2

[wiːk]adj.弱的；虚弱的；无力的；差的；淡薄的

  • ‘Mr. Harmsworth,’ I said in a weak voice. ’先生。哈姆斯沃思，”我无力地说。
  • Thus the rods, by falling, and by the direction in which they fell, recorded for the slumbering scientist the strength of a shock that was too weak to waken him, and the direction from which it came. 因此，棒，落下的，以及由它们下跌的方向，记录了沉睡已久的科学家，这是太虚弱了唤醒他的冲击力，并从它来的方向。

SEE> fee·ble , strong 强大, weak·ness 弱点

ODE> Lacking the power to perform physically demanding tasks; having little physical strength or energy. – frail, feeble, puny, fragile, delicate, weakly.

2042. weak·ness 弱点 ## 3

[’wiːknəs]n.软弱；弱点；嗜好

  • In their efforts to persuade us to buy this or that product, advertisers have made a close study of human nature and have classified all our little weaknesses. 在他们的努力劝说我们买这个或那个产品，广告商作出人性的仔细研究，并已列为我们所有的小弱点。
  • What was Bessie’s ‘little weakness’? 什么是贝茜的“小小的弱点”？
  • She acted the role of the perfect servant for three years before Aunt Harriet discovered her ‘little weakness’. 她担任了三年的完美仆人的角色之后，哈丽特终于发现她有“小小的弱点”。

SEE> weak 弱, nerv·ous·ness , con·cern 与有关

ODE> The state or condition of being weak. – frailty, feebleness, enfeeblement, puniness, fragility, delicateness, delicacy, weakliness.

2043. weap·on 武器 ## 4

[’wepən]n.武器；兵器

  • In fact, it would be an assistance to all carnivores though it would be a two-edged weapon when they fought each other. 事实上，这将是一个帮助所有的食肉动物虽然这将是一柄武器，当他们相互交战。
  • As is so often pointed out, knowledge is a two-edged weapon which can be used equally for good or evil. 正像人们常常指出的，知识是一柄武器，同样可以为善或恶来使用。
  • I am sure that, without modern weapons, I would make a very poor show of disputing the ownership of a cave with a bear, and in this I do not think that I stand alone. 我相信，没有现代化的武器，我会去争洞穴的所有权与熊的非常差的节目，在此我不认为我一人。

SEE> gun 枪, in·deed 确实, pos·sess 拥有

ODE> A thing designed or used for inflicting bodily harm or physical damage. –

2044. wear 穿 ## 14

[wer]v.磨损；穿戴；使疲劳n.磨损；穿着；耐久性

  • But women always wear uncomfortable shoes! 可是女人们总是穿不舒服的鞋！
  • The man who I served was wearing a hat. 谁我接待的那个人戴着一顶帽子。
  • She was wearing a blue dress and a mink coat. 她穿着一身蓝色的套装和一件貂皮大衣。

SEE> dress 连衣裙, clothes 衣服, pants 裤子

ODE> Have (something) on one’s body as clothing, decoration, or protection. – be dressed in, be clothed in, have on, sport.

2045. weath·er 天气 ## 15

[’weðər]n.天气；气象；境遇vt.使风化；经受住；使日晒雨淋vi.风化；褪色；经受风雨adj.上风的；天气预报的

  • What’s the weather like in spring? 怎么样在春天的天气如何？
  • The weather’s often cold in the North and windy in the East. 天气经常是在北方寒冷多风的地区。
  • It was spring, but the weather was awful. 这是春天，但天气太糟了。

SEE> rain·y , rain 下雨, win·ter 冬季

ODE> The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time as regards heat, cloudiness, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc. – meteorological conditions, atmospheric conditions, meteorology, climate.

2046. wed·ding 婚礼 ## 3

[’wedɪŋ]n.婚礼；结合

  • Why did Jenny want to leave the wedding reception? 没珍妮为什么想离开婚宴？
  • Recently, one of Jeremy’s closest friends asked him to make a speech at a wedding reception. 最近，杰里米的最亲密的朋友请他在一个婚礼的招待会上发表讲话。
  • He prepared the speech carefully and went to the wedding with Jenny. 他认真准备了讲稿，去与珍妮的婚礼。

SEE> bride , cou·ple 两人, groom

ODE> A marriage ceremony, especially considered as including the associated celebrations. – marriage, marriage ceremony, wedding ceremony, nuptial ceremony, marriage service, wedding service, marriage rites, wedding rites, matrimony, holy matrimony, nuptials, union.

2047. week 周 ## 38

[wiːk]n.星期；周

  • He has a bad cold, Mr. Williams, so he must stay in bed for a week. 他得了重感冒，威廉斯先生，因此他必须卧床一周。
  • Was he absent from school last week? 在他缺席上周的学校吗？
  • Last week Mrs. Mills went to London. 上星期米尔斯夫人去了伦敦。

SEE> month 月, last 最后的, Fri·day 星期五

ODE> A period of seven days. – break, rest, period of leave, day off, week off, month off, recess, school holiday, half-term.

2048. week·end 周末 ## 7

[’wiːkend]n.周末vi.过周末adj.周末的

  • What are the Johnsons going to do at the weekend? 什么是约翰逊会在周末做什么？
  • We’re going to stay at my mother’s for the weekend. 我们将留在我母亲的周末。
  • I once spent an uncomfortable weekend which I shall never forget at his house. 我曾经花了一个周末的不舒服，我永远不会在他家里。

SEE> week 周, Sun·day 星期日, Sat·ur·day 星期六

ODE> Saturday and Sunday, especially regarded as a time for leisure. –

2049. weigh 称重 ## 5

[weɪ]v.衡量；称(重量)；重达 …

  • ‘Jumbo must weigh a few tons,’ said a policeman afterwards, ’so it was fortunate that we didn’t have to carry him. “江伯一定有好几吨重，说：”一个警察事后“，所以这很幸运，我们没有携带他。
  • It weighed nearly 500 pounds. 它重达500磅左右。
  • All the biscuits that were sent were carefully weighed. 凡送来的饼干都仔细权衡。

SEE> more·o·ver 此外, mean·time , like·ly 可能的

ODE> Find out how heavy (someone or something) is, typically using scales. – measure the weight of, measure how heavy someone is, measure how heavy something is, put someone on the scales, put something on the scales.

2050. weight 重量 ## 11

[weɪt]n.重量；体重；重任；重要vt.使 … 负重；使倾斜

  • It is not long before they are so accustomed to swimming that they can pick up weights from the floor of the pool. 这不是他们很快便适应了游泳，在此之前，他们可以从池底的回暖权重。
  • It has been estimated that the weight of all the insects destroyed by spiders in Britain in one year would be greater than the total weight of all the human beings in the country. 据估计，所有在一年中英国蜘蛛破坏了昆虫的重量会比在国内所有人类的总重量。
  • Duck, and like them the pigeons, are endowed with steel-like muscles, that are a good part of the weight of the bird, and these will ply the short wings with such irresistible power that they can bore for long distances through an opposing gale before exhaustion follows. 野鸭以及与它们相似的鸽子，都长着钢铁般般的肌肉，那是鸟的体重的很大一部分，而这些将扇动短小的翅膀与以巨大的力量，他们可以通过顶着大风很长的距离之前耗尽如下。

SEE> load 加载, fur·ther·more , where·as 而

ODE> A body’s relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by it, giving rise to a downward force; the heaviness of a person or thing. – heaviness, mass, load, burden, pressure, force.

2051. wel·come 欢迎 ## 7

[’welkəm]vt.欢迎adj.受欢迎的n.欢迎int.欢迎(客人来访或新成员的加入)

  • What does ‘a cold welcome’ refer to? 什么是“冷欢迎”指什么？
  • The big clock refused to welcome the New Year. 大钟不愿意迎接新年。
  • During a holiday in Sweden, I found this note on my car: ’sir, we welcome you to our city. 有一次在瑞典度假，我发现我的车上有这样一个字条：“先生，欢迎您光临我们的城市。

SEE> greet , in·deed 确实, come 来

ODE> An instance or manner of greeting someone. – greeting, salutation, hail, welcoming.

2052. well 好 ## 67

[wel]adv.很好地；相当地int.好吧；啊adj.健康的；良好的；适宜的n.井；源泉；楼梯井v.涌出

  • I’m very well, thank you. 我很好，谢谢你。
  • She’s very well, too, Helen. 她很好，海伦。
  • Well, it’s certainly not for me! 那么，它肯定不是我！

SEE> both 两者, and 和, so 所以

ODE> In a good or satisfactory way. – skilfully, with skill, ably, competently, proficiently, adeptly, adroitly, deftly, dexterously, effectively, expertly, with expertise, admirably, excellently, consummately, professionally.

2053. west 西 ## 4

[west]n.西；西方；西部；西方国家adj.西方的；西部的adv.向(在)西方

  • It’s often wet in the West and sometimes warm in the South. 人们常常弄湿西方有时在南方温暖。
  • In 1963 a Lancaster bomber crashed on Wallis Island, a remote place in the South Pacific, a long way west of Samoa. 1963年兰开斯特轰炸机坠毁在委内瑞拉岛，在南太平洋一个偏远的地方，萨摩亚的一个很长的路以西。
  • Unlike most of his contemporaries in Hollywood, Hart actually knew something of the old West. 不像大多数他在好莱坞的同时代人，他确实了解老西的东西。

SEE> east 东, north 北, west·ern 西部的

ODE> The direction towards the point of the horizon where the sun sets at the equinoxes, on the left-hand side of a person facing north, or the part of the horizon lying in this direction. – the Occident.

2054. west·ern 西部的 ## 5

[’westərn]adj.西方的；西洋的；西部的n.西方人；西部片；西部小说

  • The hospital had been bombed and Hans had made his way back into Western Germany on foot. 医院遭到轰炸，汉斯做了他的徒步的方式回到了西德。
  • How did William Hart’s childhood prepare him for his acting role in Western films? 威廉·哈特的童年是怎么他准备在西方电影他的演技的角色？
  • William S. Hart was, perhaps, the greatest of all Western stars, for unlike Gary Cooper and John Wayne he appeared in nothing but Westerns. 威廉·哈特，也许，西部电影明星中，对于不同加里·库珀和约翰·韦恩，他出现在什么，但西部片。

SEE> east·ern 东, south·ern 南部的, west 西

ODE> Situated in the west, or directed towards or facing the west. – western, westerly, westwardly, occidental.

2055. wet 湿 ## 4

[wet]adj.湿的；雨天的；懦弱的n.潮气；雨天vt.(使)弄湿

  • It’s often wet in the West and sometimes warm in the South. 人们常常弄湿西方有时在南方温暖。
  • There is something comforting about the warm glow shed by advertisements on cold wet winter nights. 有某种安慰寒冷潮湿的冬夜里，广告的暖光棚。
  • Shivering in their wet clothes, the teenagers looked on while three men dived repeatedly into the water to locate the dish. 在他们的湿衣服哆嗦，看着3名工人轮番潜入水中以确定盘子的位置。

SEE> dry 干的, damp 潮湿, soaking

ODE> Covered or saturated with water or another liquid. – damp, dampened, moist, moistened.

2056. what 什么 ## 266

[wɑːt]pron.什么adj.什么；哪个adv.用于感叹句中int.什么

  • What is Rober’s job? 什么是罗伯特的工作？
  • What nationality are you? 你是哪国人？
  • What’s your job? 你的工作是什么？

SEE> how 怎么样, know 知道, why 为什么

ODE> Asking for information specifying something. – what.

2057. what·ev·er 无论什么 ## 5

[wət’evər]pron.无论什么；任何事物adj.不管怎样的；所有的；丝毫的

  • ‘Whatever are you doing up here Bill?’ “你究竟在干什么，比尔？”
  • Whatever the source of noise, one thing is certain: silence, it seems, has become a golden memory. 不管噪声来自何方，有一点是肯定的：看来寂静，已经成为一种珍贵的回忆。
  • Whatever it consists of, stamps, records, first editions of books, china, glass, antique furniture, pictures, model cars, stuffed birds, toy animals, there is always something to do in connection with it, from finding the right place for the latest addition, to verifying facts in reference books. 无论它的组成邮票，唱片，书籍，瓷器，玻璃，古董家具，绘画，模型汽车，鸟类标本，玩具动物初版，总有一些东西与它连接的事，找到可以在正确的地方最新加入，以核对参考书中的事实。

SEE> else 其他, noth·ing 没有, an·y·thing 任何东西

ODE> Used to emphasize a lack of restriction in referring to any thing or amount, no matter what. – regardless of, without regard for, without regard to, disregarding, ignoring, notwithstanding, whatever, no matter what, without reference to, without consideration of, setting aside, discounting.

2058. wheel 轮子 ## 8

[wiːl]n.方向盘；车轮；旋转；周期vi.旋转；转动；改变方向vt.用车运；转动；给 … 装轮子

  • The most unusual car was a Benz which had only three wheels. 最奇特的车是一辆奔驰其中只有三个轮子。
  • As the man tried to swing the speedboat round, the steering wheel came away in his hands. 由于该男子试图使快艇轮，方向盘在手里离开时。
  • One man stayed at the wheel while two others with black stockings over their faces jumped out and smashed the window of the shop with iron bars. 一人留在驾驶座上，另外两个用黑色长筒丝袜他们的脸跳了出来，砸坏用铁棒在商店的橱窗。

SEE> brake , tire 疲劳, rear 后部

ODE> A circular object that revolves on an axle and is fixed below a vehicle or other object to enable it to move easily over the ground. – disc, hoop, ring, circle.

2059. when 什么时候 ## 234

[wen]adv.什么时候；当 … 时conj.然后；可是；当 … 时pron.什么时候n.时间

  • When do the children do their homework? 什么时候孩子们做功课？
  • When are you going to have a holiday, Sam? 你什么时候去度假，萨姆？
  • It’s LFZ 312 G. When did you bring it to us? 这是LFZ 312 G.你什么时候把它给我们吗？

SEE> then 然后, a·gain 再次, be·fore 在之前

ODE> At what time. – as soon as, the moment, the instant, the second, once, when, immediately after.

2060. when·ev·er 每当 ## 3

[wen’evər]adv.无论何时conj.每当；无论何时；随时

  • They made no effort to hide their amusement whenever I produced a packet of sweets from my pocket. 他们毫不掩饰地取笑，每当我生产一包糖果从我的口袋里。
  • Now that a tunnel has been built through the mountains, the Pass is less dangerous, but each year, the dogs are still sent out into the snow whenever a traveller is in difficulty. 现在，隧道已通过山而建，该过程不那么危险，但每一年，还要派狗外面雪地里，只要旅客有困难。
  • Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other, Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded. 每当意大利城邦在战争与对方，霍克沃德用于雇佣他的士兵诸侯谁愿意付出高昂的代价，他的要求。

SEE> an·y·way 无论如何, wher·ev·er 哪里, else 其他

ODE> At whatever time; on whatever occasion (emphasizing a lack of restriction) – whenever, every time.

2061. where 哪里 ## 71

[wer]adv.在哪里；在那个地方conj.在 … 地方

  • Where are the books? 书在哪里？
  • Where’s Sally, Jack? 哪里是萨利，杰克？
  • Where is the Jones family? 哪里是琼斯的家人吗？

SEE> in 在之内, same 相同, once 一次

ODE> In or to what place or position. –

2062. wher·ev·er 哪里 ## 2

[wer’evər]adv.无论什么地方conj.无论在哪里

  • Wherever it went, it left behind it a trail of dead deer and small animals like rabbits. 无论它去，它留下一串死鹿和小动物如兔子的踪迹。
  • Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could – sometimes with the local priest (who was usually as poor as his parishioners), sometimes with shepherds or cheese-makers. 山谷里常常都没有小客栈，登山者只好随遇而安 - 有时同当地牧师（谁是通常作为穷人和他的教民），有时同牧羊人或奶酪制造商。

SEE> when·ev·er 每当, what·ev·er 无论什么, an·y·where 任何地方

ODE> In or to whatever place (emphasizing a lack of restriction) –

2063. wheth·er 是否 ## 25

[’weðər]conj.是否；不管；无论

  • My sister is only seven, but she always tells me whether my pictures are good or not. 我的妹妹只有7岁，但她总能说出我的画是好还是不好。
  • While John Gilbert was in hospital, he asked his doctor to tell him whether his operation had been successful, but the doctor refused to do so. 当约翰吉尔伯特住院的时候，他问医生告诉他，他的手术是否成功，但医生拒绝这样做。
  • In despair, I asked her whether she was enjoying her dinner. 在绝望中，我问她是否很享受她的晚餐。

SEE> might 也许, why 为什么, ques·tion 问题

ODE> Expressing a doubt or choice between alternatives. – whether, whether or not.

2064. which 哪一个 ## 230

[wɪtʃ]adj.哪一个；哪一些pron.哪一个；哪些

  • Which book does the man want? 哪本书的人想要什么？
  • Which book? 哪本书？
  • Which glasses does the man want? 哪几只？男人想要？

SEE> that 那, al·so 也, it 它

ODE> Asking for information specifying one or more people or things from a definite set. – which, a fact which, something which.

2065. while 当的时候 ## 45

[waɪl]conj.当 … 的时候；虽然；尽管；然而n.一段时间；一会儿v.消磨

  • While we were having breakfast, our little boy, Tommy, found two small coins on the floor. 虽然我们吃早饭时，我们的小男孩汤米在地上找到两枚小硬币。
  • While my friend, George, was reading in bed, two thieves climbed into his kitchen. 当我的朋友乔治在床上正在读，两个小偷爬进了他的厨房。
  • When the plane arrived, some of the detectives were waiting inside the main building while others were waiting on the airfield. 当飞机到达时，一些侦探在主楼内等待而其他人则守候在停机坪上。

SEE> both 两者, in·stead 代替, though 虽然

ODE> A period of time. – time, spell, stretch, stint, span, season, interval, period, period of time, length of time, duration, run, phase, stage, term.

2066. white 白色 ## 11

[waɪt]adj.白色的；纯洁的；白种的；加牛奶的n.白色；白种人

  • Whose shirt is white? 谁的衬衣是白色的？
  • Tim’s shirt’s white. 蒂姆的衬衫是白色的。
  • The refrigerator is white. 冰箱是白色的。

SEE> black 黑色, brown 棕色, red 红色

ODE> Of the colour of milk or fresh snow, due to the reflection of all visible rays of light; the opposite of black. – colourless, unpigmented, undyed, bleached, natural.

2067. who 谁 ## 176

[huː]pron.谁abbr.世界卫生组织(=World Health Organization)

  • Who is this young man? 谁是这个年轻人是谁？
  • Who’s climbing the tree? 谁在爬树？
  • Who is the tin of tobacco for? 谁是烟草中的锡？

SEE> whom 谁, al·so 也, once 一次

ODE> What or which person or people. –

2068. whole 整个的 ## 20

[hoʊl]adj.全部的；整体的；完整的n.全部；整体；完整adv.完全

  • I spent the whole day in my room, but I did not write a single card! 我花了整整一天在我的房间，但我没有写单卡！
  • After having spent whole mornings on the river, I always go home with an empty bag. 在河上呆上整整一上午，我总是空着袋子回家。
  • Then she swam to the shore after spending the whole night in the water. 然后，她游到岸边水中整整一夜之后。

SEE> en·tire 整个, eve·ry·thing 一切, rest 休息

ODE> All of; entire. – entire, complete, full, total.

2069. whom 谁 ## 4

[huːm]pron.[who的宾格]谁

  • In the torchlight, he caught sight of a figure whom he immediately recognized as Bill Wilkins, our local grocer. 借着电筒光，他看见一个人，马上认出比尔·威尔金斯，我们当地的杂货店主的。
  • Verrazano, an Italian about whom little is known, sailed into New York Harbour in 1524 and named it Angouleme. 韦拉札诺，一个意大利人很少有人知道，驶入纽约港于1524年，并把它命名为昂古莱姆。
  • She entered the station twenty minutes before the train was due, since her parents had impressed upon her that it would be unforgivable to miss it and cause the friends with whom she was going to stay to make two journeys to meet her. 她进了车站二十分钟车前是由于，因为她的父母对她印象深刻，这将是不可原谅错过它和谁在一起，她要留进行两次旅行，以满足她引起朋友。

SEE> who 谁, though 虽然, al·though 虽然

ODE> Used instead of ‘who’ as the object of a verb or preposition. –

2070. whose 谁的 ## 11

[huːz]pron.谁的adj.谁的

  • Whose handbag is it? 是谁的手袋？
  • Whose shirt is white? 谁的衬衣是白色的？
  • Whose shirt is that? 是谁的衬衫？

SEE> own 自己的, once 一次, fact 事实

ODE> Belonging to or associated with which person. –

2071. why 为什么 ## 88

[waɪ]adv.为什么conj…. 的理由；为什么int.咳；哎呀n.理由；谜

  • Why do the children thank their mother? 为什么孩子们向母亲致谢？
  • Why can’t Pamela type the letter? 帕梅拉为什么无法打信？
  • Why? 为什么？

SEE> know 知道, what 什么, rea·son 理由

ODE> For what reason or purpose. –

2072. wide 宽 ## 2

[waɪd]adj.广泛的；广阔的；睁得大的；渊博的；偏离目标的adv.张的很大地；广阔地；没有完全获胜把握

  • We informed him that the fissure extended for fifty yards and was two feet wide and four feet deep. 我们告诉他那个大裂缝长50码，2英尺宽和深4英尺。
  • Admittedly it was an unusual pie dish, for it was eighteen feet long and six feet wide. 诚然，这是一个不寻常的馅饼盘，因为它是长期18英尺和阔六脚。

SEE> broad 宽阔的, va·ri·e·ty 品种, long 长

ODE> Of great or more than average width. – broad, extensive, spacious, open, vast, spread out, outspread.

2073. wife 妻子 ## 41

[waɪf]n.妻子；夫人

  • Mr. Jones and his wife are looking at them. 琼斯先生和他的妻子正在寻找他们。
  • My wife and I are walking along the banks of the river. 我和妻子沿河岸上散步。
  • Mr. Sawyer usually reads his newspaper, but sometimes he and his wife watch television. 索耶先生总是读报纸，但有时和他的妻子一起看电视。

SEE> hus·band 丈夫, daugh·ter 女儿, moth·er 母亲

ODE> A married woman considered in relation to her spouse. – spouse, partner, mate, consort, woman, bride.

2074. wild 野生的 ## 8

[waɪld]adj.野生的；野蛮的；未开发的；狂热的adv.胡乱地；失去控制地n.荒野；荒地

  • When reports came into London Zoo that a wild puma had been spotted forty-five miles south of London, they were not taken seriously. 当报告来到伦敦动物园，一只野生的美洲狮已经发现伦敦的45英里南部，他们并没有受到重视。
  • It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside. 令人不安的是认为一个危险的野兽继续在宁静的乡村大。
  • Country people run wild when they go shopping in the city and stagger home loaded with as many of the exotic items as they can carry. 国家的人，当他们在城市和错开回家装载尽可能多的外来商品，他们可以携带逛街撒野。

SEE> an·i·mal 动物, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, in·deed 确实

ODE> (of an animal or plant) living or growing in the natural environment; not domesticated or cultivated. – untamed, undomesticated, feral.

2075. wild·ly 疯狂 ## 2

[’waɪldli]adv.狂热地；激动地；剧烈地；轻率地；鲁莽地

  • Gesticulating wildly, the man acted as if he found my offer outrageous, but he eventually reduced the price to ￡10. 激动地打着手势，该男子的举动就好像他发现我的报价离谱，但他终于把价钱降低到£10英镑。
  • In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences – most of them wildly improbable. 大部分是牵强附会，不可思议 - 在十九世纪时，小说家将通过一系列的巧合他的读者带来了他的故事的一个结论。

SEE> var·ied 多种, ad·mit·ted·ly , un·pre·dict·a·ble

ODE> In a way that lacks discipline or restraint. –

2076. will 将 ## 239

[wɪl]n.决心；意志；遗嘱；愿望aux.将；愿意；必须vt.决心；想要(某事发生)；将(财产)遗赠；规定vi.愿意

  • I’ll miss him. 我会想念他的。
  • We’ll all miss him. 我们都会想念他的。
  • When will the new people move into this house? 当将新人们搬进这所房子？

SEE> would 将, should 应该, expected 预期

ODE> Expressing the future tense. – have a tendency to, are bound to, have a habit of, do.

2077. will·ing 愿意 ## 5

[’wɪlɪŋ]adj.愿意的；心甘情愿的

  • Such is human nature, that a great many people are often willing to sacrifice higher pay for the privilege of becoming white-collar workers. 这就是人的本性，一个伟大的很多人往往愿意放弃高薪，以便成为白领的特权。
  • Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other, Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded. 每当意大利城邦在战争与对方，霍克沃德用于雇佣他的士兵诸侯谁愿意付出高昂的代价，他的要求。
  • I shook my head and held up five fingers indicating that I was willing to pay ￡5. 我摇摇头，伸出5根手指表示我愿意支付£5。

SEE> un·will·ing 不愿, re·luc·tant , ac·cept 接受

ODE> Ready, eager, or prepared to do something. – ready, prepared, disposed, inclined, nothing loath, of a mind, so minded, minded, in the mood.

2078. win 赢得 ## 20

[wɪn]v.赢；赢得；获胜；获得n.胜利

  • I’m sure we’ll win something this week. 我敢肯定，我们将在本周赢得一些东西。
  • You always say that, but we never win anything! 你总是这么说，但是我们从来没赢过！
  • What will you do if you win a lot of money? 你会怎么做，如果你赢了很多钱？

SEE> vic·to·ry 胜利, chance 机会, tri·umph

ODE> Be successful or victorious in (a contest or conflict) – come first in, finish first in, be victorious in, triumph in, take first prize in, achieve success in, be successful in, prevail in.

2079. wind 风 ## 11

[wɪnd]n.风；（随食物或饮料）吞下的气；呼吸；气息；管乐器；空谈v.使喘不过气来；（给婴儿轻轻拍抚后背）使打嗝；吹(号角等)；（路、河等）蜿蜒；缠绕；给…上发条；可上发条；倒（磁带、胶卷等）；转动（把手）n.弯曲；弯曲处；缠绕；转动；上发条

  • The stream wound its way across the field and then flowed right under their tent! 那小溪弯弯曲曲穿过田野，然后右键他们的帐篷底下流！
  • A gust of wind swept the bed off the roof and sent it crashing into the courtyard below. 一阵风席卷床从屋顶上，并把它摔碎在下面的院子里。
  • He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line. 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏的电源线的电线蛇的遗骸。

SEE> breeze , turn 转动, storm 风暴

ODE> The perceptible natural movement of the air, especially in the form of a current of air blowing from a particular direction. – breeze.

2080. win·dow 窗口 ## 25

[’wɪndoʊ]n.窗户；橱窗；视窗

  • The television is near the window. 电视机靠近窗子。
  • Open the window and air the room. 打开窗户，给房间通通风。
  • I’m going to put it here, in front of the window. 我打算把它放在这里，在窗口的前面。

SEE> door 门, room 房间, door·way

ODE> An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle, fitted with glass in a frame to admit light or air and allow people to see out. – casement, opening, aperture.

2081. wine 葡萄酒 ## 5

[waɪn]n.葡萄酒；酒；紫红色；使人沉醉的东西vi.喝酒vt.请 … 喝酒adj.深红色的

  • Have we got any beer and wine? 我们还有啤酒和葡萄酒吗？
  • Cooked in wine, snails are a great luxury in various parts of the world. 用酒烹调蜗牛，在世界各地有很大的奢侈品。
  • After her departure, Aunt Harriet discovered that there were piles of empty wine bottles of all shapes and sizes neatly stacked in what had once been Bessie’s wardrobe. 她走之后，哈丽特终于发现，有整齐堆放在什么贝西以前用过的衣柜各种形状和大小的空酒瓶成堆。

SEE> grape , beer 啤酒, cham·pagne

ODE> An alcoholic drink made from fermented grape juice. – vin de table, vin ordinaire, vin du pays.

2082. wing 翅膀 ## 3

[wɪŋ]n.翅膀；翼v.飞过；空运；临时发挥

  • Any ship that crosses the Pacific is accompanied for many days by the smaller albatross, which may keep company with the vessel for an hour without visible or more than occasional movement of wing. 跨越太平洋的船只是由较小的信天翁，这样可以保持公司与容器一小时不可见或超过翼的运动偶尔伴随着许多天。
  • The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards, as well as in the line of its course, are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings sufficient sustenance and progress. 空气船舶的墙壁直接向上，以及在其过程中的线路中的电流，足以给其巨大的翅膀足够的支撑力和前进的巨大鸟。
  • Duck, and like them the pigeons, are endowed with steel-like muscles, that are a good part of the weight of the bird, and these will ply the short wings with such irresistible power that they can bore for long distances through an opposing gale before exhaustion follows. 野鸭以及与它们相似的鸽子，都长着钢铁般般的肌肉，那是鸟的体重的很大一部分，而这些将扇动短小的翅膀与以巨大的力量，他们可以通过顶着大风很长的距离之前耗尽如下。

SEE> right 对, front 前面, left 左边

ODE> (in a bird) a modified forelimb that bears large feathers and is used for flying. – pinion, van.

2083. win·ner 优胜者 ## 2

[’wɪnər]n.获胜者；【网球】制胜球

  • Which car was the winner in 1995? 哪辆车在1995年的赢家？
  • The winner was Billy Stewart. 获胜者是比利。

SEE> win 赢得, run·ner 跑步者, cham·pi·on

ODE> A person or thing that wins something. – victor, champion, conqueror, vanquisher, defeater, conquering hero, hero.

2084. win·ter 冬季 ## 13

[’wɪntər]n.冬季；冬天adj.冬天的；冬季生长的vi.过冬vt.对 … 进行过冬保护

  • Is it very cold in winter? 它是在冬天很冷吗？
  • I don’t like autumn and winter. 我不喜欢秋季和冬季。
  • Winter was coming on and the hills threatened the surrounding villages with destruction, for heavy rain would not only wash away the soil but would cause serious floods as well. 冬季即将来临，这些山丘威胁周围村庄具有毁灭性的，因为大雨不仅会冲走土壤，而且还会引起严重的水灾。

SEE> sum·mer 夏天, spring 春天, rain·y

ODE> The coldest season of the year, in the northern hemisphere from December to February and in the southern hemisphere from June to August. –

2085. wire 电线 ## 5

[’waɪər]n.金属丝；电线；电报vt.发电报；装电线；(通过电线)接通；用金属丝把…连一起；电汇

  • He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line. 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏的电源线的电线蛇的遗骸。
  • A bird had snatched up the snake from the ground and then dropped it on to the wires. 鸟抢走了从地上爬起来的蛇，然后把它扔到了电线上。
  • The snake then wound itself round the wires. 蛇然后缠绕在电线。

SEE> fence 篱笆, ra·zor , at·tached 附

ODE> Metal drawn out into the form of a thin flexible thread or rod. – cable, lead, flex.

2086. wish 希望 ## 8

[wɪʃ]v.希望；想要n.愿望；命令；渴望；祝颂（表达这个意思时，常用复数）

  • Two men who recently spent five days on a coral island wished they had stayed there longer. 两个人谁最近呆了五天在一座珊瑚岛上，他们真希望在那里呆更长的时间。
  • I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service. 我反映，必须有自己之外了许多人谁希望借此优良的服务优势。
  • At night, when you really wish to go to sleep, you rarely manage to do so. 到了晚上，当你真的想要去睡觉，你很少能做到这样。

SEE> want 想要, sure 当然, sure·ly 一定

ODE> Feel or express a strong desire or hope for something that cannot or probably will not happen. – desire, want, hope for, long for, yearn for, crave, hunger for, thirst for, lust after, covet, sigh for, pine for, dream of.

2087. with 和一起 ## 306

[wɪð]prep.用；随着；包括；和 … 一起

  • Is there a problem with the Customs officer? 是否存在与海关官员有问题吗？
  • Mr. Jones is with his family. 琼斯先生同他的家人。
  • What are you going to do with that vase, Penny? 你打算用那花瓶呢？

SEE> both 两者, and 和, well 好

ODE> Accompanied by (another person or thing) – accompanied by, in the company of, escorted by.

2088. with·in 中 ## 11

[wɪ’ðɪn]prep.在(某段时间、距离或范围)内；在…里面adv.在…里面n.内部

  • As soon as I tap on the window, you must stop within five feet.’ 只要我一敲车窗，你必须在五英尺内停止“。
  • He described it as ‘a very agreeable situation located within two small hills in the midst of which flowed a great river.’ 他将其形容为“一家位于其中的流入一条大河中间的两个小山头一个非常愉快的局面。”
  • Latham made another attempt a week later and got within half a mile of Dover, but he was unlucky again. 莱瑟姆作了一次尝试一个星期后和多佛不到半英里之内得到的，但是他又是不幸的。

SEE> on·ly 只有, which 哪一个, al·though 虽然

ODE> Inside (something) – inside, in, within the bounds of, within the confines of, enclosed by, surrounded by.

2089. with·out 没有 ## 34

[wɪ’ðaʊt]prep.没有；无；在外面adv.在缺乏的情况下；在外面conj.除非

  • You will be very lucky if he lets you go without a ticket. 如果他让你去无票，你会很幸运。
  • I often fish for hours without catching anything. 我经常一钓数小时却一无所获。
  • Then the woman simply took the parcel and walked out of the shop without paying. 然后，那妇女拿过包就从商店出来，无需支付。

SEE> e·ven 甚至, no 不, not 不

ODE> In the absence of. – unaccompanied by, unescorted by.

2090. wom·an 女人 ## 36

[’wʊmən]n.妇女；女人adj.女人的

  • Those women are very hard-working. 这些妇女非常勤劳。
  • But women always wear uncomfortable shoes! 可是女人们总是穿不舒服的鞋！
  • Women always have the last word. 女人总是最后一个字。

SEE> girl 女孩, man 男人, moth·er 母亲

ODE> An adult human female. – lady, girl, member of the fair sex, member of the gentle sex, female.

2091. won·der 想知道 ## 12

[’wʌndər]n.惊奇；惊愕；奇迹；奇观v.惊奇；想知道；怀疑adj.奇妙的；非凡的

  • I wonder why! 我想知道为什么！
  • I wonder. 我想知道。
  • Dan wondered why he was wanted by the police, but he went to the station yesterday and now he is not worried anymore. 丹不知道为什么他被警方通缉，但他昨天去了车站，现在他不再担心了。

SEE> im·ag·ine 想像, why 为什么, in·deed 确实

ODE> A feeling of amazement and admiration, caused by something beautiful, remarkable, or unfamiliar. – awe, admiration, wonderment, fascination.

2092. won·der·ful 精彩的 ## 6

[’wʌndərfl]adj.精彩的；极好的

  • After a wonderful meal, they told stories and sang songs by the campfire. 美餐之后，他们讲起了故事，篝火，唱起了歌。
  • This wonderful plane can carry seven passengers. 这个奇妙的飞机可以载7名乘客。
  • By the time you read this, the Hubble’s eagle eye will have sent us thousands and thousands of wonderful pictures. 当你读到这篇文章时，哈勃的鹰之眼已经为我们送来了成千上万张精彩的照片。

SEE> ter·rif·ic , mar·vel·ous , a·maz·ing 惊人

ODE> Inspiring delight, pleasure, or admiration; extremely good; marvellous. – marvellous, magnificent, superb, glorious, sublime, lovely, delightful, first-class, first-rate.

2093. wood 树木 ## 10

[wʊd]n.木材；木头；树林

  • Can the mechanics repair Mr. Wood’s car? 修理工能否修复伍德先生的汽车？
  • I live in a very old town which is surrounded by beautiful woods. 我住在一个古老的小镇上被美丽的树林环绕。
  • On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods. 周日，数百人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林散步。

SEE> stone 石头, wood·en 木制的, fur·ni·ture 家具

ODE> The hard fibrous material that forms the main substance of the trunk or branches of a tree or shrub, used for fuel or timber. – timber, planks, planking.

2094. wood·en 木制的 ## 4

[’wʊdn]adj.木制的；生硬笨拙的

  • He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool. 他提出了整洁的小路，并在池塘上架起木桥。
  • When a plane from London arrived at Sydney airport, workers began to unload a number of wooden boxes which contained clothing. 当一架飞机从伦敦抵达悉尼机场时，工人们开始卸下大批装有衣服的木箱。
  • He had had a long and uncomfortable trip, for he had been confined to the wooden box for over eighteen hours. 他经历了一次漫长而又难受的旅程，因为他已经被限制在木箱了18个多小时。

SEE> wood 树木, stone 石头, frame 画框

ODE> Made of wood. – made of wood, wood, timber, woody.

2095. wool 羊毛 ## 4

[wʊl]n.羊毛；毛线；毛织品

  • I tried to say something, but my mouth was full of cotton wool. 我想说点什么，但我嘴里塞满了药棉。
  • When the dentist at last removed the cotton wool from my mouth, I was able to tell him that he had pulled out the wrong tooth. 最后，当牙医移除从我嘴中药棉，我可以告诉他，他拔错了牙。
  • Its wool, which had been dyed black, had been washed clean by the rain! 它的毛，这已经染成黑色，已经被雨水冲掉了！

SEE> cloth 布料, lin·en , cot·ton 棉花

ODE> The fine, soft curly or wavy hair forming the coat of a sheep, goat, or similar animal, especially when shorn and prepared for use in making cloth or yarn. – fleece, hair, coat.

2096. word 单词 ## 22

[wɜːrd]n.单词；消息；话语；诺言v.用词语表达

  • Women always have the last word. 女人总是最后一个字。
  • He didn’t write a word! 他没有写一个字！
  • What was so funny about the words on the sign? 什么好笑的牌子上的字？

SEE> phrase 短语, mean·ing 含义, means 手段

ODE> A single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used with others (or sometimes alone) to form a sentence and typically shown with a space on either side when written or printed. – term, name, expression, designation, locution.

2097. work 工作 ## 86

[wɜːrk]n.工作；职业；工作内容；职责；活计；工作所需的材料；工作地点；努力；工作成果；行为结果；作品v.工作；做事；使工作；争取；管理；运行；操作；奏效；产生…影响；造成；抽搐；逐渐移动[复]works：工厂；修建；机器部件；全套物品

  • You’re working hard, George. 你干得真辛苦，乔治。
  • In the morning, Mr. Sawyer goes to work and the children go to school. 早上，索耶先生去上班，孩子们去上学。
  • Mr. Sawyer comes home from work. 索耶先生下班回家。

SEE> work·ing 工作, well 好, so 所以

ODE> Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result. – labour, toil, exertion, effort, slog, drudgery, the sweat of one’s brow.

2098. work·er 工人 ## 13

[’wɜːrkər]n.工人；工作者

  • Tomorrow evening they will be singing at the Workers’ Club. 明晚他们将在工人俱乐部唱歌。
  • Workers will have completed the new roads by the end of this year. 工人们将在今年年底前把新的道路。
  • When a plane from London arrived at Sydney airport, workers began to unload a number of wooden boxes which contained clothing. 当一架飞机从伦敦抵达悉尼机场时，工人们开始卸下大批装有衣服的木箱。

SEE> em·ploy·ee 雇员, work·ing 工作, em·ploy·er 雇主

ODE> A person who does a specified type of work or who works in a specified way. – employee, member of staff, working man, working woman, workman, labourer, hand, operative, operator.

2099. work·ing 工作 ## 2

[’wɜːrkɪŋ]adj.做工作的；劳动的；工作上的；初步的；暂定的；基本够用的；起作用的n.矿；作业区（复）workings：运作；工作方法.

  • The busmen have stated that the strike will continue until general agreement is reached about pay and working conditions. 司机们声称罢工将持续到就工资和工作条件达成全面协议。
  • The administrative overheads of a business are low to the extent that everyone working in the business can be trusted to behave in a way that best promotes the interests of the firm. 一个企业的管理费用低的程度，每个人都在企业工作的可以信任的最促进公司利益的方式行事。

SEE> work 工作, well 好, time 时间

ODE> Having paid employment. – employed, in work, in a job, waged, in gainful employment.

2100. world 世界 ## 53

[wɜːrld]n.世界；地球；世人；世间；领域adj.世界的

  • He’s only forty-one years old, and he has already been to nearly every country in the world. 他只有41岁，他已是几乎每一个国家在世界上。
  • I want to see the world. 我想看到的世界。
  • If we win a lot of money we’ll travel round the world and we’ll stay at the best hotels. 如果我们赢了很多钱，我们周游世界，我们将留在最好的酒店。

SEE> time 时间, ev·er 曾经, first 第一

ODE> The earth, together with all of its countries and peoples. – earth, globe, planet, sphere.

2101. wor·ried 担心的 ## 5

[’wɜːrid]adj.担心的；烦恼的动词worry的过去式和过去分词.

  • Dan wondered why he was wanted by the police, but he went to the station yesterday and now he is not worried anymore. 丹不知道为什么他被警方通缉，但他昨天去了车站，现在他不再担心了。
  • I suddenly felt very worried, but could not say anything. 我突然觉得很担心，但什么都不能说。
  • Everybody on board was worried and we were curious to find out what had happened. 飞机上的人都很着急，大家都急于想知道出了什么事。

SEE> con·cerned 关心的, wor·ry 担心, anx·ious 着急的

ODE> Anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems. – anxious, disturbed, perturbed, troubled, bothered, distressed, concerned, upset, distraught, worried sick, disquieted, uneasy, ill at ease, fretful, fretting, agitated, in a state of agitation, nervous, edgy, on edge, like a cat on a hot tin roof, tense, overwrought, worked up, keyed up, strung out, jumpy, with one’s stomach in knots, stressed, under stress.

2102. wor·ry 担心 ## 10

[’wɜːri]vt.撕咬；使烦恼；使焦虑vi.担心；发愁n.担心；烦恼；忧虑

  • My wife always worries too much. 我妻子总是担心太多。
  • But this does not worry me. 但是，这并不让我担心。
  • Dan Robinson has been worried all week. 鲁宾逊整个星期都在担心。

SEE> wor·ried 担心的, fear 恐惧, rea·son 理由

ODE> Feel or cause to feel anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems. – alarming, concerning, worrisome, daunting, perturbing, trying, taxing, vexatious, niggling, bothersome, troublesome, unsettling, harassing, harrying, harrowing, nerve-racking.

2103. worse 更差 ## 4

[wɜːrs]adj.更坏的；更差的；更严重的adv.更坏；更差n.更坏的事物

  • To make matters worse, the room is rather small, so I have temporarily put my books on the floor. 更糟的是，房间非常小，所以我暂时把书放在了地板上。
  • This was worse than ‘a terrible secret’; this was a real skeleton! 这是比“骇人听闻的秘密”更加这是一个真正的骷髅！
  • But there was worse to come. 但更糟糕的事情。

SEE> e·ven 甚至, un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, ac·tu·al·ly 其实

ODE> Of poorer quality or lower standard; less good or desirable. –

2104. wor·ship 崇拜 ## 2

[’wɜːrʃɪp]n.崇拜；爱慕；做礼拜vi.做礼拜vt.崇拜；爱慕

  • The temple which the archaeologists explored was used as a place of worship from the fifteenth century B.C. 考古工作者考察的这座庙宇从第十五世纪公元前一个礼拜的地方
  • The contemporary phenomenon of car worship is to be explained not least by the sense of independence and freedom that ownership entails. 崇拜汽车现象可以通过独立和自由与所有权相伴的意义来解释并非最不重要的。

SEE> like·wise , faith 信仰, fur·ther·more

ODE> The feeling or expression of reverence and adoration for a deity. – reverence, revering, worshipping, veneration, venerating, adoration, adoring, -olatry, devotion, praise, thanksgiving, praising, praying to, glorification, glorifying, glory, exaltation, exalting, extolment, extolling, homage, respect, honour, honouring, esteem.

2105. worst 最差 ## 3

[wɜːrst]adj.最坏的；最差的；最不利的n.最坏的事物adv.最坏；最差形容词bad或ill的最高级.

  • Every year I enter for the garden competition too, and I always win a little prize for the worst garden in the town! 我每年的花园竞赛进入过了，我总是得全镇最差花园的小奖！
  • The worst thing about the do-it-yourself game is that sometimes even men live under the delusion that they can do anything, even when they have repeatedly been proved wrong. 关于做它自己的游戏最糟糕的是，有时甚至是男士生活的幻想，他们可以做任何事情，即使他们曾多次被证明是错误的下面。
  • Men were found to be the worst offenders. 男子被认为是最严重的罪犯。

SEE> worse 更差, ev·er 曾经, ter·ri·ble 可怕

ODE> Of the poorest quality or the lowest standard; least good or desirable. – defeat, beat, best, get the better of, gain the advantage over, prevail over, triumph over, gain a victory over, trounce, rout, thrash, drub, vanquish, conquer, master, overcome, overwhelm, overpower, overthrow, crush, subdue, subjugate.

2106. worth 值得 ## 14

[wɜːrθ]n.价值；财富adj.值得的；值钱的

  • It’s worth every penny of it. 这是值得这么多钱。
  • The other model’s more expensive, but it’s worth the money. 另一种模式是更昂贵，但它是值得的钱。
  • By this time, a Lancaster bomber in reasonable condition was rare and worth rescuing. 到了这个时候，状况良好的兰开斯特轰炸机实属罕见，值得抢救。

SEE> mil·lion 百万, be·sides , a·lone 单独地

ODE> Equivalent in value to the sum or item specified. – value, financial value, monetary value, price, asking price, selling price, cost.

2107. would 将 ## 191

[wʊd]aux.将；可能；大概；总会；愿意；will的过去式

  • Would you like to try it? 你想试试吗？
  • Would you like some more? 你想多一些？
  • I’d like a cigarette, too. 我想香烟了。

SEE> could 可以, might 也许, should 应该

ODE> (expressing the conditional mood) indicating the consequence of an imagined event or situation. –

2108. wound 伤口 ## 3

[wuːnd]n.创伤；伤害；伤口v.伤；伤害；缠绕（动词wind的过去式和过去分词）

  • After having been wounded towards the end of the war, he had been sent to hospital and was separated from his unit. 已经受伤对战争结束后，他被送进医院，并从他的单位分离。
  • Everything around him was full of her presence, continually reopening the wound. 他身边的一切都是母亲的影子不断勾起他的伤口。
  • Most animals we commonly observe do in fact age as we do, if given the chance to live long enough; and mechanical systems like a wound watch, or the sun, do in fact run out of energy in accordance with the second law of thermodynamics (whether the whole universe does so is a moot point at present). 大多数动物，我们通常看到的其实年龄，因为我们做，如果有机会到现场足够长;和机械系统像上了发条的手表，或者太阳，也实际上能根据热力学第二定律用完（整个宇宙是否如此，目前尚有争论）。

SEE> stab , af·ter·ward , pre·sum·a·bly 想必

ODE> An injury to living tissue caused by a cut, blow, or other impact, typically one in which the skin is cut or broken. – injury, lesion, cut, gash, laceration, tear, rent, puncture, slash.

2109. wrap 包裹 ## 3

[ræp]v.包；裹；覆盖；隐藏n.围巾；披肩；包装材料

  • After a little time, she chose one of the most expensive dresses in the shop and handed it to an assistant who wrapped it up for her as quickly as possible. 过了一会儿，她又选了商场里最昂贵的一件衣服，把它递给了助手谁尽快包好了她越好。
  • It had been wrapped up in newspaper and it contained half the money he had lost, together with a note which said: ‘A thief, yes, but only 50 per cent a thief!’ 它是用报纸包着的，一个纸条，上面写着含有一半，他已经失去了钱，一起：“一个小偷，是的，但只有50％的小偷！”
  • It was upon this principle that the first instruments were made, but the paper was wrapped round a drum which rotated slowly. 正是根据这一原理，第一个仪器进行了改造，但纸是包圆其缓慢旋转的鼓。

SEE> put 放, hold 拿着, pull 拉

ODE> Cover or enclose in paper or soft material. – swathe, bundle up, swaddle, sheathe, muffle, cloak, enfold, envelop, encase, enclose, cover, fold, wind.

2110. write 写 ## 31

[raɪt]v.写；书写；填写；作曲

  • Do you have any writing paper? 你有信纸吗？
  • ’I’ll write a letter soon. “我很快会写信的。
  • He says he’ll write a letter soon. 他说他很快会写信的。

SEE> writ·ing 写作, read 读, in·stance 例子

ODE> Mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement. – put in writing, write down, put down, put in black and white, commit to paper, jot down, note, note down, make a note of, set down, take down, mark down, record, register, log, list, make a list of, inscribe, sign, scribble, scrawl, pencil.

2111. writ·er 作家 ## 39

[’raɪtər]n.作者；作家

  • Why did the writer complain to the people behind him? 为什么笔者抱怨他身后的人吗？
  • Why was the writer’s aunt surprised? 为什么作家的阿姨感到惊讶吗？
  • How many cards did the writer send? 笔者没有多少卡送？

SEE> au·thor 作者, nov·el·ist , jour·nal·ist 记者

ODE> A person who has written something or who writes in a particular way. – author, wordsmith, man of letters, woman of letters, penman, creative writer.

2112. wrong 错误 ## 21

[rɔːŋ]adj.错误的；有毛病的；不适当的；不道德的adv.错误地n.不义行为；坏事；犯罪；欺骗；错误；不公正v.冤枉；不公正地对待

  • What’s wrong with the fashionable shoes? 有什么不对这些时髦的鞋？
  • You’ve given me the wrong case! 你给了我错了！
  • What does ‘No wrong numbers’ mean? 什么是“无错号”是什么意思？

SEE> un·for·tu·nate·ly 不幸的是, an·y·way 无论如何, think 想

ODE> Not correct or true; incorrect. – incorrect, mistaken, in error, erroneous, inaccurate, not accurate, inexact, not exact, imprecise, invalid, untrue, false, fallacious, wide of the mark, off target.

2113. yard 码 ## 3

[jɑːrd]n.院子；庭院n.码(长度单位)

  • Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air. 同时，他们鼓励我们中的那些他们正在大口喘气前谁也游不了5码。
  • The hunt for the puma began in a small village where a woman picking blackberries saw ‘a large cat’ only five yards away from her. 美洲狮狩猎开始在一个小村庄，一位妇女在采摘黑莓时的看见“一只大猫”，离她仅5码远。
  • We informed him that the fissure extended for fifty yards and was two feet wide and four feet deep. 我们告诉他那个大裂缝长50码，2英尺宽和深4英尺。

SEE> cor·ner 角落, ga·rage 车库, put 放

ODE> A unit of linear measure equal to 3 feet (0.9144 metre) – backyard, garden.

2114. year 年 ## 137

[jɪr]n.年；年度；年龄；学年

  • Jill’s eighteen years old, Tom. 吉尔的十八岁了，汤姆。
  • There is a car race near our town every year. 有每年都有一场汽车比赛我们镇子附近。
  • They were in fashion last year and the year before last. 他们在时装去年和前年。

SEE> last 最后的, month 月, a·go 前

ODE> The time taken by the earth to make one revolution around the sun. – twelve-month period, twelve-month session.

2115. yes 是 ## 61

[jes]adv.是；是的n.是（表示肯定）v.对…说是

  • Yes? 是？
  • Yes, it is. 是的。
  • Yes, it is. 是的。

SEE> in·deed 确实, an·y·way 无论如何, may·be 也许

ODE> Used to give an affirmative response. – all right, alright, very well, of course, by all means, sure, certainly, absolutely, indeed, affirmative, in the affirmative, agreed, roger.

2116. yes·ter·day 昨天 ## 18

[’jestərdeɪ]n.昨天；近来adv.昨天；近来

  • He telephoned me four times yesterday and three times the day before yesterday. 他四次，昨天和前天三次打电话给我。
  • He telephoned the office yesterday morning and yesterday afternoon. 他打电话给办公室昨天上午和下午。
  • Then I arrived home at six o’clock yesterday evening. 然后，我回到家里昨晚6点钟。

SEE> to·day 今天, af·ter·noon 下午, week 周

ODE> On the day before today. – out of fashion, out of date, outdated, old-fashioned, outmoded, out of style, dated, behind the times, last year’s, yesterday’s, unpopular, unstylish, superseded, archaic, obsolete, antiquated.

2117. yet 还 ## 34

[jet]adv.还；已经；仍然conj.然而；但是

  • You are better now, but you mustn’t get up yet. 你现在好些了，但你不能起床。
  • The boy mustn’t go to school yet, Mrs. Williams. 这孩子还不能去上学，威廉斯夫人。
  • Is my car ready yet? 我的车好了吗？

SEE> but 但是, though 虽然, in·deed 确实

ODE> Up until the present or a specified or implied time; by now or then. – so far, thus far, as yet, still, even now, up till now, up to now, until now, up to the present time.

2118. you 你 ## 507

[jə]pron.你；你们；(泛指)任何人

  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？
  • Is this your handbag? 这是你的手提包？
  • Thank you very much. 非常感谢你。

SEE> know 知道, want 想要, re·al·ly 真的

ODE> Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing. –

2119. young 年轻 ## 40

[jʌŋ]adj.年轻的；初期的；没有经验的n.青年人；幼崽

  • Who is this young man? 谁是这个年轻人是谁？
  • A young man and a young woman were sitting behind me. 一青年男子与一青年女子坐在我的后面。
  • ‘It’s none of your business,’ the young man said rudely. “这不关你的事，”那男的毫不客气地说。

SEE> whom 谁, who 谁, tal·ent·ed

ODE> Having lived or existed for only a short time. – youthful, juvenile.

2120. yours 你的 ## 2

[jərz]pron.你的；你们的

  • Is this case yours? 这箱子是你的吗？
  • After I had given her some money, she looked into a crystal ball and said: ’A relation of yours is coming to see you. 我给了她一些钱后，她看着一个水晶球说道：“您的一个亲戚就要看你。

SEE> ours 我们的, theirs 他们的, hers 她的

ODE> Used to refer to a thing or things belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing. –

2121. your·self 你自己 ## 6

[jɔːr’self]pron.你(们)自己；你(们)亲自

  • Enjoy yourself! 玩的开心！
  • Have you hurt yourself? 你有没有伤到自己？
  • The following example of ‘sick humour’ will enable you to judge for yourself. “病态幽默”的下面的例子将让你自己判断。

SEE> my·self 我自己, our·selves 我们自己, you 你

ODE> Used to refer to the person being addressed as the object of a verb or preposition when they are also the subject of the clause. –

2122. youth 青年 ## 7

[juːθ]n.青年时期；青春；青年

  • ‘I have just arrived in Scotland and I’m staying at a Youth Hostel.’ “我刚到苏格兰，我住在一家青年招待所。”
  • He says he’s staying at a Youth Hostel. 他说他住在一家青年旅馆。
  • The Youth Hostels Association. 青年招待所协会。

SEE> young 年轻, young·ster , teen·age

ODE> The period between childhood and adult age. – early years, early life, young days, teens, teenage years, adolescence, preadolescence, young adulthood, boyhood, girlhood, childhood.

2123. ze·ro 零 ## 2

[’zɪroʊ]n.零；零度；最低点；完全没有；无足轻重的人或物adj.零的；无价值的；零视度的v.把 … 调零；瞄准；集中注意；迫近

  • Little by little the eleven minutes fell to zero. 慢慢地从11分钟减到了零。
  • Mars is too dry and poor in oxygen, Venus far too hot, and so is Mercury, and the outer planets have temperatures near absolute zero and hydrogen-dominated atmospheres. 火星太干燥和在贫氧，金星太热，所以是汞，和外行星具有接近绝对零度和氢为主的气氛温度。

SEE> in·stance 例子, more·o·ver 此外, hence 因此

ODE> No quantity or number; nought; the figure 0. – nought, nothing, cipher, nil, 0.
